title: Halter Ranch 2015 Libelle Picpoul Blanc Sparkling (Adelaida District)
description: One of the first sparkling Picpoul Blancs in the area, this is a compelling argument for making more. Floral aromas of honeysuckle and jasmine meet with wet river stone, lime peel and nectarine on the nose. The palate is loaded with lemon zest and hints of passion fruit and mango, proving unique and delicious.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Orcio Cassata Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Brawny in black cherry, leather and black pepper, this is a well-made wine that's chewy and thick—a robust celebration of the variety from this site. Blended with 25% Petite Sirah, the addition is inky and adds further concentration and ongoing power. The wine was fermented and aged in terra-cotta amphora.

title: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Lot No. 87 Tempranillo (Lodi)
description: This beautifully composed wine tastes complex, flavorful but elegant at the same time. Enticing black-cherry and black-currant aromas are followed by warm and layered fruit and baking-spice flavors that fill the palate and linger nicely on the finish. It shows a fine balance between exuberant fruit and subtle oak spices, all nicely framed by soft tannins.

title: Maritana 2017 La Riviere Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From three separate sites, Winemaker Donald Patz has crafted a wine with an effusive nose of caramel, oak, pear and honey. The full-bodied palate is balanced by firm tannins and heightened acidity. Overall, it's fresh and fleshy in equal measure.

title: Nelle 2016 Wills Hills Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Candied Bing cherry, rose petals, potpourri and spice-rack flavors show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. There is a compelling grip to the palate, where candied rose and berry flavors meet with turned earth, gravelly sandstone and light clove flavors.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Mourvèdre (Red Hills)
description: True to type and admirably wild in flavors, this wine emphasizes meaty, savory, forest-floor aromas and rich but not overtly fruity flavors. It is full bodied, mouthfilling and complex. Woodsy, grilled-herb and smoked meat flavors expand on the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Starfield 2016 Tempranillo (El Dorado)
description: Excellent fruit concentration and a deft touch of spicy oak make this full-bodied well-balanced wine tempting and delicious. It's the first vintage from Starfield's estate vineyard, and was aged in 50% new French and American barrels. The stand-out wine marries layers of black cherry and black currants with mild cinnamon and nutmeg nuances on a velvety-smooth texture.

title: The Paring 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling by Matt Dees of Jonata and The Hilt fame is a great way to see what he's up to for a very affordable price. Aromas of dark red cherry and cranberry meet with dried tarragon on the nose. The palate's clean lines of black raspberry and wild cherry pick up soil-driven flavors of crushed gravel and a hint of sandalwood.

title: Trombetta 2017 Indindoli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salt and oak tones are met by crunchy, creamy flavors of apple and pear in this well-structured, balanced and complex white. The oak and tannin are integrated and supportive, allowing the fruit and floral tones to shine.

title: Trujillo 2015 Henry Brothers Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Blended with Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec, this is a brawny, substantial wine from grapes grown at 1,900-feet in elevation. It has richness to spare, a combination of dark cherry and cassis that is hugely structured and seasoned in cigar box, cocoa and sage.

title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Structured aromas of blackberry sorbet, dark hibiscus and crushed granite show on the nose of this very compelling take on Grenache. There is a very strong tension to the palate, carrying dynamic flavors of black raspberry, tarragon, mint and candied rosewater.

title: Boheme 2015 Occidental Hills Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from a cool pocket of the producer's English Hill Vineyard, an ocean-facing site in the hills of Occidental, this wine is exotic in mint, meat and baked strawberry. Thick, with supportive acidity, it shows garrigue and lavender and an irresistible shock of white pepper.

title: Challen 2016 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This wine has bones to last at least a decade, and needs a bit more time to come together. Aromas of rich black cherry, hickory, chiseled slate and loamy soil are more mineral than fruit-driven. The palate is also powered by slate and gravel, with polished but firm structure and a steadily rising acidity that cuts through the dark fruits. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Concannon 2016 Reserve Malbec (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine is subtly layered, rich and appealing from the complex aromas of spiced cherry and vanilla to the ripe and concentrated fruit flavors and on to a lingering finish. While full bodied, it is warmly wrapped in soft tannins for a velvety mouthfeel.

title: Foxen 2017 Block UU Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A warm butter aroma meets with lemon spray, citrus pith, wet gravel and crushed limestone on the nose of this bottling from a coveted single block in a historic vineyard. There is lots of tension on the palate, where restrained flavors of lime peel and Asian pear make for a tasty experience.

title: Jaffurs 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a compellingly earthy minerality that grabs hold right away on the nose of this bottling, with loam and wet gravel running into marjoram, tea leaf and boysenberry sorbet aromas. The sip shows dark and snappy fruits, with acid washing into the midpalate and then loads of thyme and bay leaf leading into the finish.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Cooper Jaxon Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This fun and whimsical label from Brian Loring delivers his rich style of Pinot Noir at an affordable price, offering aromas of black cherry, forest herbs, damp sage and crushed slate. The palate is earthy, offering flavors of dark berry, fennel frond, roasted meat and clove.

title: Lucia 2017 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: An expertly reserved streak of hazelnut and thinly sliced lemon rinds meet with a waft of butter on the delicately delicious nose of this bottling by the Pisoni family. The palate is wrapped in a chalky tension, allowing flavors of clay, Meyer lemon and light buttercream to take hold.

title: Opolo 2016 Rhapsody Reserve Collection Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and rich aromas of cocoa, caramel, vanilla, violet and black cherry show on the nose of this Bordeaux-style red blend. The palate is expressive and ripe in flavors of black cherry, coffee cream and caramel that are wrapped in stiff, chalky tannins.

title: Paradise Springs 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Buoyant aromas of lime blossom, grapefruit peel, honeydew and green-apple rinds make for a clean and crisp entry to the wine, which comes from a vineyard planted in 1971. The palate is vibrant and fresh, with racy flavors of lime pith and lemon soda.

title: Angeleno 2018 Super Bloom Clay Station Vineyard Borden Ranch Verdejo (Lodi)
description: This is a very light and bright wine from the new Los Angeles-based winery, starting with aromas of sour lemon, light melon and dried apple flesh. The palate is brisk and refreshing if simple, showing subtle pome fruit and citrus flavors—a nice complement to warm evenings.
designation: Super Bloom Clay Station Vineyard Borden Ranch

title: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 10% Merlot and sourced from both the producer's estate and other sites, this is an approachable, appealing wine, etched in smoked meat, oak and black pepper. With a fleshiness to the mouthfeel, it has lasting flavors of blackberry and clove.

title: Chappellet 2017 Mountain Cuvée Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is an earthy proprietor's blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Merlot, 8% Malbec, 6% Petit Verdot and 3% Cabernet Franc. Offering value, it features fruit from hillside vineyards and shows deft dense layering of blackberry and black tea, with dried herb in abundance.

title: Derby 2016 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Aromas of Ruby Red grapefruit pith, citrus spray, lily and a hint of riverstone show on the nose of this bottling from an extremely coastal, oceanview vineyard. The palate is ripe with nectarine, pear flesh and lychee flavors.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Ezio Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: Dried blackberry, incense, turned earth and mushroom aromas show on the nose of this reserve bottling. Similarly dried fruits show on the palate, including plums and berries, and the forest-floor kick of mushroom and damp herbs also persists.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Mellow on the nose, this bottling offers layered dried cherry, red flowers, damp wood and a hint of soy aromas. The palate is quite dry, combining marjoram and cedar with tea leaf and light-red-fruit flavors.

title: Dubost 2016 Homestead Red (Paso Robles)
description: Rusty red-cherry aromas meet with vanilla and cola spice on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Sangiovese. More stewed cherry and cola meet with tarragon and fennel bulb on the sip.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Mineral-laced aromas of flint, gravel and slate play loudly on the nose of this bottling. There is intense tension on the sip, which is also stony but layered with grapefruit pith and lemon spray. Slight effervescence remains in bottle.

title: Folie à Deux 2018 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)
description: Guava, pineapple and lemon-lime flavors make for a fleshy, brightly layered expression of this white variety, rare in these parts, which is bustling in acidity and low in oak.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a solid choice for midweek enjoyment. Generous aromas of ripe fresh red fruits meet with crushed slate, gravel and a kiss of sweet oak on the nose. It's lively on the palate, where juicy red cherry and oak framed by a spicy acidity.

title: Patel 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and earthy, this white tastes of pea shoots, peach and flowers. It's textured and showing just a hint of oak. Rounded in richness, it finishes lush and tropical.

title: Samuel Charles 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Dusty clove, sage and vanilla ride along a soft, simple palate of medium-bodied ripeness and concentration in this wine, which finishes thick in oak and tannin.

title: Vermeil 2015 Frediani Vineyard Rosedale Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Currant, cassis and crushed rock accent a soft, richly layered and concentrated body of firm intensity and tannin in this block-designate from the warm site. Tasting of cocoa powder, blueberry jam and toasted oak, the wine finishes quietly and with a touch of pepper.

title: Altvs 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy with a strong, metallic-like minerality, this is a soft, approachable white, with floral lemon, apple and oak notes. Sourced entirely from the Kuleto Estate Vineyard, it shows lasting flavors of vanilla and crème brûlée.

title: Anglim 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Dense and dark aromas of black-plum paste and blackberry gum show on the nose of this bottling. It's fairly rich and dark in flavors, with espresso bean and dark-purple fruits most apparent.

title: Derby 2014 Sparkling Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: There's a powerful effervescence on the nose of this bottling, starting with aromas of pink lemon, red plum and rose petal. The palate is tangy, with tight nectarine, tart red plum and a searing acidity.

title: Duckhorn 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tightly tannic and robustly concentrated, this is a powerhouse red wine, dotted in black cherry, vanilla and toasted oak. Accents of dried herb and sage provide complementary spice and earth to the richness.

title: Dueling Pistols 2016 Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Equal parts Zinfandel and Syrah, this is a hearty, smooth and approachable wine that will find wide appeal. High-toned red fruit, cinnamon and a meaty element of garrigue and black pepper give it definition around full-bodied weight.

title: Francis Coppola NV Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: This canned wine would be a great choice for the beach or picnic. It begins with fruitpunch-like aromas of cherry, pomegranate and cola and then leads into a fresh red-fruit palate that's spiced with clove and nutmeg.

title: Monochrome 2018 Analog in a Digital Age White (California)
description: Aromas of fresh pears and white-fleshed fruit show on the nose of this mostly Santa Barbara County blend of 74% Marsanne, 17% Grenache Blanc and 9% Viognier. There is compelling tension to the palate, where ripe apple and pear aromas meet with green melon.

title: Rockpile Winery 2016 Buck Pasture Red (Rockpile)
description: Combining 69% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Cabernet Franc and 8% Malbec, this is a tannic, oaky and concentrated wine that will do well in the cellar. Savory red fruit and dark chocolate are accented in cigar, crushed rock and an explosion of dried herb. Enjoy best from 2020–2026.

title: Bella Grace 2016 Mourvèdre (Amador County)
description: Fascinating and savory herb and dried-meat aromas and flavors give this wine plenty of authentic varietal character. It is medium to full bodied, lightly tannic, and brings forward mulled cherry and grilled plum flavors on the palate that linger on the finish.

title: Windchaser 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: This eye-opening wine is flavorful, concentrated and full bodied, clearly standing out in a varietal field full of blandness. Layers of ripe pear, fig, cream and almond give it plenty of complexity, while a mouthfilling texture and long finish complete the picture.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Terraces Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)
description: Boysenberry, lavender and violet aromas swirl on the nose of this bottling from a newly restored but deeply historic vineyard south of Hollister. Richer flavors of dark berry, purple flowers and fennel bulb arise on the sip, one of the denser bottlings for the winery.

title: Rideau 2017 Garey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Tangy red plum, cracked peppercorns and pine needle show on the nose of this bottling, which explores the lighter, savory side of Pinot Noir. The palate intrigues with an array of greener flavors, including thyme, charred pasilla chile and cracked pepper, set against a tart raspberry base.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2016 Sky High Ranch Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: This robust but polished wine offers concentrated blackberry and black-cherry flavors, full body and a firm texture laced with fine-grained tannins. Nervy acidity and persistent fruit on the finish keep the wine interesting sip afer sip. Best from 2022.

title: Charles Woodson's Intercept 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Soon-to-be NFL Hall of Famer Charles Woodson is not messing around with this Pinot Noir. Crisp aromas of fresh raspberry and hibiscus meet with a hint of gamy meat on the nose, while the palate delivers pleasantly rustic flavors of dried wild cherry, oregano and peppercorn.

title: Kempe 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: This is a complex and balanced take on this often overly unctuous grape, starting with aromas of dense cassis, charred meat, packed violets and charcoal. Very layered on the palate, it begins with acai before veering into coffee, caramel and fennel-pollen flavors.

title: Wolff 2017 Petite Sirah (Edna Valley)
description: This cool-climate expression of Petite Sirah offers aomas of lavender, violet and peppercorn on the nose. The palate is tightly wound in flavors of seedy blackberry, fresh white pepper and crumbled purple-flower petals.

title: Eden Rift 2018 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Very light aromas of yellow rose, wet gravel, honeysuckle and tart green apple show on the nose of this bottling. The sip is tense and zippy, combining rounded nectarine and chilled apple flavors with intriguing touches of lemongrass and chive.

title: Tantara 2017 La Encantada Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Damp earth, black plum and dank forest herbs show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate offers cranberry and raspberry as well as savory soy and dried beef flavors, all with earthy herbs in the background.

title: Davies 2017 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Ripe, delicious and layered, this spicy and rich wine is full bodied, generous and mouthfilling. It offers aromas of cinnamon, cherries and rhubarb, followed by flavors of red and black cherry, black tea and baking spices.

title: Siduri 2017 Pratt Vineyard Sexton Road Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Bright, crunchy red fruit, orange peel and pomegranate play around a core of nicely integrated, well-mannered texture and acidity. Fleshy and fresh, it sparks accents of black tea, cardamom and forest floor as it opens in the glass.

title: Tantara 2016 Lolita Red (Los Olivos District)
description: Roasted black-cherry, smoky blackberry, fudge and damp earth aromas converge on the nose of this rich bottling, which is quite dense in the glass. The tannins are both firm and lush on the palate, framing dense but not overly thick flavors of black cherry and baking spice.

title: Foxen 2017 Block 8 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Cherry sauce, clove, star anise and hickory-roasted game aromas show on the nose of this block-designated bottling from a historic vineyard. The palate is smooth and intriguing, with flavors of red plum, red currant, thyme and spicy cardamom touches.

title: Marietta Cellars 2016 Armé Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Saturated with opulent black-fruit flavors and moderately tannic, this wine is big but polished and complex. It shows little obvious oakiness, but rather feels shaped by oak aging until it was velvety and firm. Enjoyable now with something roasted or braised, this wine will drink best after 2022.

title: Mauritson 2016 Clough Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: From eroded riverbed soils that present as gravelly, layered in quartz and chert, this single-soil, single-varietal wine is thick, viscous and brawny in wood, earth and herbal elements. A soft texture takes root on the midpalate allowing for black and blue fruit to enter the picture and show verve on the high-toned finish.

title: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: Given time in both neutral French oak and stainless steel, with 23% Sauvignon Musque clone in the mix, this white is creamy in peach, pear and apple skin flavors. Complex, layered and textured, it weaves jolts of acidity and spicy pepper along the way.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2017 Either Side of the Hill Glenrose Vineyard Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Boysenberrry, dried violet, crumpled rose and hints of tar and fruitcake show on the nose of this bottling by Ryan Pease. Roasted flavors of coffee, cola and meat converge with black cherry on the palate.
designation: Either Side of the Hill Glenrose Vineyard

title: Domaine Carneros 2016 The Famous Gate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Estate-grown, this varietal wine is rich in red and black cherry, with an earthiness of tea and fig. Sassafras tugs at the edges of its medium-bodied midpalate, textured in silky tannin and brightly lifted by measured acidity.

title: Big Basin 2016 Old Corral Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from atop the Santa Cruz Mountains offers cherry, pomegranate and strawberry aromas on the nose with a pinch of nutmeg. The palate combines ripe cherry with sarsaparilla spice.

title: Black Ridge 2014 San Andreas Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Black currant, lilac and dried herbs combine for a delicious aromatic entry to this bottling. There is a hearty richness to the palate, with flavors of smoked blackberries framed by firm but forgiving tannins.

title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: This wine is tannic and tightly wound in its youth, exotic and feral with its grasp of earthy forest and dried herb. Blue fruit pokes through, trying to make its way against a wall of structure and grippy balance. Enjoy 2023–2026.

title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Whale Rock Vineyard Falanghina (Paso Robles)
description: Candied honeydew, lime cream, white peach and chalk show on the inviting nose of this organically grown Falanghina, an uncommon grape for California. There's a sizzle of fresh acid on the palate, which is full of balanced flavors of peach and guava.

title: Cinnabar 2015 Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed black currant, elderberry, mint and damp forest aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a taut texture to the palate, where robust tannins uphold blackberry and purple-flower flavors, all leveled by decent acidity.

title: Clif Family 2015 Croquet Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Initially reduced and oaky, this estate wine is intense in tar, black plum and gunpowder tones. The palate is big and ripe, with a generous feel and firm, chalky tannins. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Margerum 2016 Uber Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Bright aromas of candied blackberry meet with dewy herbs on the nose of this multiple vineyard blend by Doug Margerum. The palate combines black-currant juice with licorice, cracked black pepper and fresh acidity.

title: Robert Hall 2017 Cavern Select Vermentino (Paso Robles)
description: Finding zesty white wines in Paso Robles is a noble quest, and this bottling works well. Broad aromas of pear, grass clippings and pomelo skins lead into a tangy palate of lime peels, lemongrass and kaffir lime leaf. Then it rounds out into green-apple flesh, all framed by a chalky edge.

title: Wrath 2016 Ex Dolio Falanghina (Monterey)
description: Paying homage to how the Romans would have fermented their Falanghina in a ceramic vessel, this skin-contact wine is slightly orange and cloudy in the glass, offering aromas of wet stone, orange rind and crushed nuts. Tangy tangerine rind, lemon and apple flavors meet with a touch of rust on the palate.

title: Fess Parker 2016 The Big Easy Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dark and brooding aromas of peppercorn-crusted beef steak, teriyaki, blueberry and wood smoke make for a savory entry to this bottling. Intense blueberry, charred meat and cherry-wood flavors show on the palate, which is framed by firm mouthcoating tannins. It's a great barbecue wine.

title: Heitz 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A matchstick aroma leads to a package of great flavor and texture in this white from a historic producer. Flavors of apple, lemon and peach accentuate the creamy mouthfeel, with a honed balance of acidity, tannins and oak.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is exuberant in juicy tones of Meyer lemon, peach and wet stone. The medium-bodied palate has a fleshy mouthfeel that will appeal to a wide array of wine lovers.

title: Jaffurs 2015 High Tide Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose is tightly wound yet showing hints of roasted plum, root beer and sandalwood on this blend of 50% Mourvèdre, 33% Grenache and 17% Syrah. There sip is wrapped in tannic tension and offers flavors of pine wood, nutmeg and black plum.

title: Jax 2015 55 Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Broadly structured and succulent, this wine offers brawny, well-integrated tannins and juicy undertones of baked plum and black cherry. With 5% Cabernet Franc, it's floral and brimming in dried herb, black pepper and tobacco.

title: Kathryn Kennedy 2016 Small Lot Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Strawberry sorbet, light licorice and dried earth show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite mellow at first but becomes incredibly enjoyable with time. Fresh and accessible red-fruit flavors combine with hints of tobacco and tea leaf on the palate, which is delicate but with juicy depth.

title: Kynsi 2015 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Rustic aromas of pomegranate, sagebrush, forest floor and charred wood show on the nose of this appellation blend. Pine tree and eucalyptus aromas decorate the soft strawberry and red-plum flavors of the lightly bodied palate.

title: La Follette 2016 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy notions of tree bark and forest floor mark this lovely wine, a light bright expression of the variety that's focused and tense in acidity. Baked orange and plum flavors add to the mix, contributing to the spicy, lengthy palate of flavor and understated intensity.

title: MacRostie 2016 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Silky in delicate layers of strawberry and light spice, this wine builds power and concentration as it opens in the glass, becoming darker and more brooding in fruit. Baking-spice and black-tea components give it a savory edge that works well in the larger context.

title: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Malibu Coast)
description: This is a solid bottling from the upper reaches of the Malibu Coast appellation, showing oak smoke, black cherry and a hint of dried mint on the nose. The palate, which is bolstered with 6% Petite Sirah, 4% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc offers flavors of savory meat and roasted cherries, all wrapped in taut tannins that stand firm in the finish.

title: McClain Cellars 2016 Family Values Petite Sirah (Los Olivos District)
description: Intense black-plum and cassis aromas show on the sharp nose of this bottling. There is solid tannic tension to the palate, where black fruit and dark spice flavors are lifted by strong acidity.

title: Ramona Ranch 2016 Aglianico (Ramona Valley)
description: Extremely extracted and tangy aromas of strawberry and gamy meat show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers similarly funky elements, as well as underripe red-plum skins.

title: Axios 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Chocolate and brown sugar make for a thick and overtly rich and oaky experience in this small-production wine. Its tannins are overtly pronounced.

title: Campos 2017 Estate Big Red (Contra Costa County)
description: This simple and light-bodied wine shows a maple aroma and soft, almost sweet, candied-fruit flavors.

title: Villa San Juliette 2015 Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Extremely extracted aromas of tangy black-plum syrup show on the nose of this bottling. That black-plum flavors mixes with maple syrup and lavender on the palate.

title: Kirkland Signature 2017 Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Mint, eucalyptus and cranberry combine for an intensely herbal experience on the palate of this simple, approachable and low-priced wine.

title: St. Francis 2015 Lagomarsino Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Russian River Valley)
description: Tangy and somewhat astringent in tannin, this wine is thick in black fruit, brown sugar and toasted oak.

title: Mill Creek 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is quite tannic and somewhat astringent, the blend consisting of 25% Merlot. Aged 18 months in French oak, half of it new, the oak accentuates and underlines the strong tannin.

title: Cupcake NV Red Velvet Red (California)
description: Heavy aromas and flavors of cedar and charred pine seem to smother the fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, one-note wine.

title: Iter 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A noticeably deep-gold color and very strong smoky oaky aromas signal that this is an extremely styled wine. The flavors are raw and woody and somewhat bitter.

title: Benovia 2016 Tilton Hill Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This comes from the producer's coolest estate near the town of Freestone. White pepper jumps from the glass alongside accents of lavender, rose and spice. Compelling in every way, it offers juicy raspberry fruit that's focused, pure and undeniably delicious.

title: Schramsberg 2010 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)
description: This dry and beautifully aged bubbly is made from 84% Chardonnay and 16% Pinot Noir. Rich gold in color, it opens with fascinating and well-developed aromas of toasted baguette, toasted walnuts and marzipan, followed by a warm, buttery flavor that's backed by baked apple and cinnamon. The fine-beaded texture is luxurious and the finish is long and lingering. Best through 2024.

title: Chappellet 2016 Hideaway Vineyard Mountain Estates Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The grapes for this wine are sourced from the steep slopes of the producer's own Pritchard Hill spot at 1,425 feet. Juicy black cherry and wild berry yield to rich vanilla and oak, with ample grip and tension that lend structure. It's simply delicious, voluptuous and lush yet complex.

title: Massican 2018 Annia White (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 48% Tocai Friulano, 41% Ribolla Gialla and 11% Chardonnay, this is fresh and floral in tones of lemon rind, white flower and green apple. Fermented in both French oak and stainless steel, it is structured yet vibrant, gorgeously aromatic and remarkably long-lasting on the palate.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2017 459 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Enticing aromas of ripe red cherry and alpine strawberry are fruity but elegant on the nose, lifted by touches of rose petal and hibiscus. The palate offers pure flavors of boysenberry and black plum alongside touches of fennel, nutmeg, mace and a pinch of curry. It is very complex and vividly fresh.

title: Calera 2017 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)
description: Hailing from Josh Jensen's iconic vineyard at 2,200 feet above the Salinas Valley, this is an epic Chardonnay, loaded with clean, lively aromas of cherimoya, honeysuckle, sweet cream, crisp peach, struck flint and chive. The palate is tightly wound, with flavors of lemon spray, seared nectarine, sea salt and toasted oak.

title: Sanford 2016 La Rinconada Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from a vineyard planted in 1997 shows pristine aromas of lime, guava peel, lemon juice and wet chalk. The palate is austere at first, focused on the chalky grip, and then come waves of mellow cherimoya, white peach and other creamy white fruits. A salty element arises on the finish.

title: Joseph Phelps 2016 Pastorale Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the producer's estate property in Freestone, this is so, so good—an impressive wine that lingers in rose, cherry and vanilla. It has strong underlayers of forest and baking spice along with a shock of white pepper, lavender and buzzy, fresh acidity. Moderate in ripeness, it offers complex structure and makes a lasting impression.

title: Massican 2018 Gemina White (California)
description: Gemina is 69% Pinot Grigio and 31% Greco, from two vineyards, one in St. Helena and the other in Santa Rosa. With the goal of showcasing both northern and southern Italian inspiration, it deals in fresh lemon peel, white flower and gravelly texture, while being well structured and enduringly fresh. This is a truly lovely, revelatory wine.

title: Benovia 2016 Bella Una Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is sourced from a mix of several sites, including Martaella Estate, Tilton Hill Estate and the Martinelli family's Zio Tony Ranch. Together, they weave gorgeously integrated flavors of white pepper, garrigue, flint and never-ending baking spice. Firm tannins add to the intensity that resides within a core of balanced acidity and sumptuous black cherry.

title: Iron Horse 2014 Brut X Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: This extra-dry sparkler offers tones of green apple, lemon, wet stone and hazelnut, with bright acidity and a tightly focused structure. Despite nearly no sugar added, it doesn't lack flavor or richness, but instead offers a beautiful expression of pure fruit.

title: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This big, rich wine offers an array of plump fruit flavors that are woven through subtle oak spices. It has plenty of tannins, but they're so well integrated that the texture still feels creamy, carrying flavors of blueberry, black cherry and dark chocolate. Best through 2025.

title: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Seared citrus, lemon candies and toasty oak aromas converge on the nose of this appellation blend—a more affordable way to taste the handiwork of one of California's best Chardonnay brands. Fresh lemon paste and apple-custard flavors meet with oak and sea salt on the palate.

title: Barbieri 2016 Dromeus Grenache (Central Coast)
description: Aromas of caramelized cherry, cola, sarsaparilla and turned earth show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is full of licorice and rich red-fruit flavors, enveloped in polished tannins and a bright acidity.

title: Davies 2017 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This effusive, cheery and luxurious wine leads with fresh cherry aromas, coats the palate with strawberry and red-cherry flavors and finishes with even more fruit. It is tasty, soft and full bodied.

title: Decroux 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated rose-petal aromas meet with plum, earth and sumac on the nose of this appellation blend. Lavish tannins encapsulate the sip, where woody berry flavors lead into a vanilla-kissed finish.

title: Roederer Estate NV Estate Bottled Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)
description: An aroma like prosciutto and dried figs and lively flavors of raspberry and tangy apricot bring a big personality to this crisp, well-balanced and complex wine.

title: Voluptuary 2017 V. 01 Book of Life Brut Nature Sparkling (Lodi)
description: This striking new Picpoul Blanc has a deep gold color, warm aromas of baked apple and marzipan that lead to rich baking-spice and toasted nut flavors. It's unusually full and ripe-tasting for a sparkling wine, and very enjoyable.
designation: V. 01 Book of Life Brut Nature

title: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Strong aromas of coffee, cocoa, toffee and black cherry show on the very rich nose of this blend of Syrah, Mourvèdre, Petite Sirah, Touriga Nacional, Cabernet Sauvignon and Souzao. There's a tang of cherry peel to the sip, where caramelized flavors are lush and expressive.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Strata Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This mineral-driven white has a steely frame, punctuated by inviting aromas of white flower and apple blossom. Creamy on the palate, it stays bright and fresh in the glass, with appealing flavors of lemon zest, Gravenstein apple and wet stone.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Cinsault (Red Hills)
description: Very ripe, almost roasted black-fruit flavors and full body are the primary impressions of this bold, saturated wine. Black plums and dried plums are subtly spiced with cinnamon and tamarind for interesting complexity on the palate and finish.

title: Abbot's Passage 2018 Sightline White (Clarksburg)
description: This full-bodied wine shows a more serious side of Chenin Blanc, wrapping a rich texture around baked apple, vanilla and mineral flavors. It is nice and dry, mouthfilling and adds a touch of grippy tannin to cleanse the palate. An addition of 20% Verdejo was blended in.

title: Markus Wine Co 2018 Nimmo White (Lodi)
description: This attractive, spicy and complex blend balances ripe fruit with crisp acidity on a smooth and expansive texture. The wine is full bodied and rich enough for a lingering finish.

title: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: From one of the oldest vineyards in Paso Robles, this bottling starts with subtle hints of oak and toast as well as zesty flashes of lemon and lime. It's fairly broad and creamy on the palate, with full flavors of Meyer lemon and caramel.

title: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: A polished texture and a complex, complete flavor profile give this full-bodied wine a wonderful presence. It offers a bit of restraint to the opulent black-cherry and blueberry flavors while subtle oak accents frame rather than coat the fruit.

title: Cedarville 2016 Estate Bottled Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Fascinating aromas and intricate flavors make this full-bodied wine interesting and delicious. The aroma holds a blend of red cherry, rhubarb and cedar, while the flavors show handsome oak spices over concentrated cherry, sage and earth notes.

title: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Crushed sea shells, lemon spray, apple flesh and spun-sugar aromas draw the nose into this twist-top bottling. There's a compelling zip of acidity on the palate, where mellow flavors of toast and lemon jelly ride that sizzle into the finish.

title: Talbott 2017 Kali Hart Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: This bottling begins with aromas of cherry and berry along with wild mint and dried tarragon. Strong hits of licorice and star anise play well with the berry backdrop on the palate.

title: Wiens Cellars 2018 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: The most impressive Chardonnay to come from the region in recent memory, this bottling begins with white-peach, daffodil and underripe banana aromas that are cut by a strong line of crushed chalk. The palate's creamy white-fruit and tropical guava flavors are cut by white-rock minerality and bright acidity.

title: Bridlewood 2017 G-S-M (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a pleasing freshness to the nose of this blend, where smashed berries meet with struck flint and shattered stone. Lively flavors of raspberry and pomegranate find wood and light herbs on the palate.

title: Leoness 2016 Grande Mélange Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Relatively light in the glass, this blend offers lots of strawberry fruit and leather on the nose along with strong aromas of toasted oak. There is crispy red fruit on the sip, overlaid with powerful oak tones that prove toasty and inviting.

title: Alara 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (San Benito)
description: There are very prominent barrel aromas and flavors present in this powerful expression of Pinot Noir, starting with sandalwood and cedar scents that coat the blackberry jelly and minty cocoa on the nose. Mulling spices inhibit the palate, giving extreme spice to the cranberry and orange-rind flavors.

title: Blue Victorian Winery 2018 Rosé (Suisun Valley)
description: This charming and light-bodied wine smells like raspberries and roses and tastes a bit like watermelon and fresh herbs. It's a very nice choice in the modern mode of rosé.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: High-toned in citrus and green olive, this white takes on a richer concentration on the midpalate, with a barrel imprint of baking spice and vanilla.

title: Davis Family 2014 Soul Patch Estate Grown Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark and brooding in color and style, this wine is substantial in tannin weight and smoky oak, with a thickness of blackberry and grilled meat. Licorice and tobacco elements add a savory emphasis.

title: Decoy 2018 Rosé (California)
description: Light and appetizing, this crisp-tasting wine shows subtle raspberry and watermelon flavors, light body and good acidity to keep it lively.

title: Domaine de la Rivière 2017 Next Door Neighbor Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Stone-fruit driven, this white is rich and round, with a noticeable oak imprint of toasted brioche and vanilla. It balances on the finish, showing secondary flavors of apple, pear and baking spice.

title: Dusty Nabor 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Extremely light on the nose, this bottling shows light lemon, nectarine and sour orange aromas. There are tangerine rind and grapefruit rind touches to the palate, which offers very light red-plum flavors as well.

title: Eberle 2018 Mill Road Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Broad aromas of yellow pear, mango and hints of banana show on the ripe and aggressive nose of this bottling. There is compelling tension to the palate, where flavors of banana and mango are cut by a lemony acidity.

title: Galante 2018 Viognier (Carmel Valley)
description: Tonic-like aromas of lime peels, grapefruit pith and other botanicals meet with a light touch of smoke on the nose of this bottling. There is a good sizzle to the sip, which cuts into the midpalate sweetness of apples and pears before leading into a chalky finish.

title: Gravelpit Wines 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Juicy black cherry, cola and caramel show a pronounced barrel imprint of toasted oak and vanilla in this boldly constructed, small-production wine.

title: Kalaris 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dusty and herbal, this wine has a lightness to it, a fresh offering of tart red fruit, black tea and a lasting thread of earthiness.

title: Longhouse 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine goes for smoothness and richness rather than the typical varietal character, yet it has snappy underlying acidity. It feels and tastes ripe and generous, has mostly pear and apple flavors and good balance.

title: MCV 2018 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Mellow aromas of wet slate, lime and Meyer lemon make for a pleasant entry on the nose of this wine. The palate is also delicate, with a unique hint of herb and truffle adding to the light lemon backdrop.

title: Orsi Family 2018 Fiano (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This white has a concentrated richness of Meyer lemon and melon, the palate rounded and lush. From an estate site at some elevation, it is a rarity to find this variety in California; this is a good place to start.

title: Pride Mountain 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Juicy up front, this is a seriously structured and robust wine, brimming in bold flavors of tar, tobacco and cedar. With 7% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot, it offers concentrated intensity and lush texture.

title: Pulchella 2016 Wide Awake 50 Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Violet, blueberry-foam and cassis aromas show strongly on the nose of this blend of 51% Syrah, 39% Tannat, 5% Grenache and 5% Mourvèdre. It's very rich and quite extracted on the palate, where very tangy black-plum and blackberry flavors are lifted by bay leaf.

title: Rancho Victoria 2016 Barbera (Amador County)
description: This wine is full bodied and rather tart in flavor, showing red cherry, sour cherry and raspberry that make it tangy on the palate. Subtle oak shadings emerge on the finish as the wine reveals good depth and complexity.

title: Talbott 2017 Sarah Case Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: White peach, sea salt, honeysuckle and lemon peel all converge in a classic, oak-driven manner on the nose of this bottling. It's clean on the palate and full of familiar flavors of peach and butterscotch.

title: A. Torano 2017 Kick Ranch Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Lemony and fleshy, this is a steely white wine, with ample body weight and moderate acidity.

title: Bolt To Wines 2017 Grenache Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: Very golden in color in the glass, this appears to be a skin-contact wine, with aromas of dried lemon skins, funky pear flesh, sour orange rinds and a slight nuttiness. The palate is loaded with mouthfilling flavors of sour orange, roasted almonds and cashews.

title: If You See Kay 2016 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Perhaps the biggest labeling trick on government minders in awhile (get it?), this stylishly packaged bottling offers aromas of smashed strawberries, cherry Jolly Ranchers and mint chocolate chip. The palate is quite sweet with boysenberry pie flavors, and will probably excel in the broad market.

title: Seven Angels 2014 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Petite Sirah isn't known for aging well, and this one is already starting to show a little why, with lots of prune, raisin and coffee-liqueur elements on the nose. The acid pops and tannins firm up on the palate, which is lavish with cooked blackberry fruit.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rounded aromas of yellow apple and lemon wedge show on the nose of this bottling by the country music star. It's very zippy on the palate, carrying flavors of honeydew, ripe pear and peach, that are seeming a touch sweet.

title: Dark Horse 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a good, well-balanced and modestly fruity wine that shows low-key blackberry and cherry flavors, medium body and a light, dry mouthfeel. It's a good standard pour at a great price.

title: Gen5 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Well structured and filled with straightforward fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine is nicely dry, concentrated and appealing without overt oak influence. Ripe cherry and blackberry notes fill the aroma while equally vivid fruit flavors coat the palate.

title: J. Wilkes 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe strawberry, red-plum skins, carnation and turned earth make for an engaging nose on this bottling. The palate is taut but also a tad sour, with dried berry and more plum-skin flavors. It is still quite young, so the tartness may broaden and mellow with time.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 French Twist Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Rich aromas of black cherry, candied violets and charred cigar box show on the nose of this blend of Petit Verdot, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. The mouthfeel is quite full and rich, and the flavors trend toward caramelized berry fruits and balsamic tones, framed by squeaky tannins.

title: Theopolis 2017 Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This full-bodied but light-in-concentration wine has very lean fruit flavors and a dominant spicy, oaky, vanillin tone in both the aromas and the flavors.

title: Toad Hollow 2017 Francine's Selection Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: An earthy aroma blows off and this medium-bodied wine reveals appealing fresh apple and light spice flavors, buttery accents and good balance.

title: Delaney Blue Vineyards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Grassy and herbal, this white is made in an austere style, with little to no perceptible oak. Light and bright, it has a vegetal element offset well by a linger of lemon.

title: Spicy Vines 2016 Peter's Delight Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a tannic, minty wine full of earthy strawberry flavor and a medium-bodied approach to ripeness. The oak is well-integrated and supportive.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Warm, spice and vanilla aromas and flavors wrap around the ripe fruit and brown-sugar flavors in this obviously oaky and full-bodied wine. It has a rich texture and almost-sweet balance.

title: Aviary 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Green-olive and marshmallow flavors mesh in a fleshy, fruity mix of yin-yang flavor in this lightly ripe white.

title: Chuparosa 2016 North Block Red (Ramona Valley)
description: This blend of Sangiovese, Malbec and Cabernet Franc from San Diego County is a bit light in the glass and shows aromas of candied red cherry as well as leather and Old World-like funk. The palate is a tad sour.

title: emBRAZEN 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a relatively light, smooth and honest version of a typically tannic varietal. It offers vivid black-cherry and blackberry flavors, no assertive oakiness, a slightly gripping mouthfeel and medium body.

title: Red Car 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Steely and measured in ripeness, this wine is acid driven and crisp in style—a layered expression of green apple and lemon.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Brown Eyed Girl Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Extracted aromas of blackberries are both tangy and ripe on the nose of this bottling. There is a balsamic edge to the palate, where tart red fruits dominate.

title: Saddleback 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Oakville)
description: Exotic in fig and guava flavors, this is a ripe full-bodied white that's fleshy and concentrated in richness.

title: Sebastiani 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Dry and full-bodied, this wine has extra-ripe fruit aromas that verge on balsamic, concentrated cherry and cranberry flavors and firm tannins that tighten the texture.

title: Decoy 2016 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This affordable red is soft and round, offering full flavors of dark chocolate, vanilla and plum. The backbone is built on a foundation of fresh acidity and dried herb.

title: Talley 2016 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Candied Bing cherry, lavender, rose petal and tea leaf are extremely approachable and delicious smelling on the nose of this bottling. There is firm tension to the palate, where dark berry and plum flavors are lifted by juniper, allspice and a pinch of lavender.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Fresh and almost effervescent on the nose with lilacs and cracked rainbow peppercorns, this bottling also offers aromas of ripe alpine strawberry. That zesty red-fruit component shines on the palate as well alongside white pepper, dried purple flower and a hint of elderflower flavors.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 West Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Gritty in texture and supremely complex, this estate red is powerful in concentration and acidity. Floral rose and earth ride along its midpalate of forest floor, black tea and tangy pomegranate, finishing with an emphasis on the persistent Asian spice.

title: Foxen 2016 Cuvée Jeanne Marie Williamson-Dore Vineyard Red (Los Olivos District)
description: Intense aromas of candied boysenberry, black raspberry and a brisk purple flower and rose-petal florailty show on the nose of this blend of 69% Grenache, 23% Mourvèdre and 8% Syrah. The palate is redolent with tea-leaf and cherry-cola flavors that tighten focus as the chalky tannins steadily emerge.

title: Ken Brown 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This appellation blend of Rita's Crown and Huber vineyards offers the classic California Chardonnay experience but with expert balance. Aromas of white peach, blanched almonds and crisp lime peel lead into a oak-kissed palate, where Gravenstein apple and yellow-pear richness are deftly cut by lemon wedge sizzle and a chalky taut frame.

title: Longoria 2016 Lovely Rita Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rick Longoria has been making age-worthy Pinot Noir since the 1980s, and this bottling fits right into that legacy. Aromas of black plum, damp forest floor and pine wood lead into a structurally sound, very dry palate of boysenberry, tarragon, dill and smoke. Drink now–2036.

title: MacPhail 2016 Wightman House Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This very focused, medium-bodied wine is substantive and delicious. It starts with a quite fruity aroma full of black cherries and sour cherries, then on the palate it shows vivid, cherry-like flavors, nicely balanced by nervy acidity and moderate tannins and weaving in hints of black tea and rhubarb.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Burt Williams' Morning Dew Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine offers ripe fruit flavors and has a bold, moderately tannic texture that fills the mouth. To its credit, the wine shows some restraint in the firm acidity and almost tangy finish, so it keeps one coming back for another sip. Drink through 2026.

title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Inceptive Estate Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A blend of Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre aged in concrete and neutral oak, this bottling offers concentrated aromas of black plum, strawberry paste, wild thyme and black pepper. That pepper carries deep in the palate, spicing up the black plum, tangy berry and caramelized pork flavors. It finishes on a lingering violet note.

title: De Loach 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Middle Reach Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This white opens with a bright honeysuckle note on the nose, leading to a palate of moderate structure and grip. Lightly textured and demure, it finish is memorable in flavors of apple and nutmeg.

title: Black Kite 2016 River Turn Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Long on flavor and complexity, this full-bodied wine bursts with black-cherry, black-tea and redwood-forest aromas, before flooding the palate with delicious, just-ripe fruit flavors that come with a nicely gripping texture due to fine-grained tannins and medium to full body.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Calegari Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an Eastside Road hillside site that contributes balanced weight and smooth, seductive texture to this wine. With flavors of red cherry and raspberry, it has texture and complexity, with touches of Asian spice and black tea.

title: Niner 2016 JR Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Bright aromas of lemon skin and grapefruit pith are enveloped in strong chalky scents on the nose of this wine. There is tremendous tension to the palate, where fresh flavors of golden apple meet with honey, butter and toast that lead to a chalky finish.

title: Red Car 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Delicate layers of raspberry and strawberry define this coastal wine, which is deliciously layered and lightly complex. Pomegranate and blood orange flavors give it an additional lift of freshness and focus within its restrained style.

title: Talley 2016 Rosemary's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Intense and ripe aromas of boysenberry jam, violets and dark earth show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Powerful, juicy flavors of blackberry and cracked pepper appear on the palate, which is elegantly wrapped in a clay-like minerality and bolstered by strong acid.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A deep color, gorgeous fruit aromas and mouthfilling richness make this full-bodied wine memorable. The aromas show everything from strawberry syrup to sour cherries to cinnamon, while the flavors are fully ripe without seeming fat or sweet.

title: Daou 2016 Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)
description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling shows tightly wound blackberry fruit, pepper and dark chocolate on the nose. It's a very rich expression of Cabernet Franc, with lush dark fruit, although there is cracked pepper and a hint of herbs on the taut palate that adhere to the variety's roots.

title: Dragonette 2014 MJM Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very savory on the nose, this bottling offers charred meat, burned soy and tangy black plums on the umami-driven nose. The palate shows a more floral side, with violets, lilacs and jasmine before leading back toward roasted beef aromas. It is a very complex wine.

title: Epiphany 2016 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Roasted figs, grilled pork, bacon fat and coffee liqueur provide a deliciously savory profile on the nose of this bottling. Blackberry juice meets with smoke on the palate, where strong tannins uphold the wine's medium weight.

title: Friedeman 2016 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a beautiful floral entry of rose and lavender, building slowly on the palate in delicate layers of complexity. The lengthy broadway of fruit is defined in cassis and crunchy pomegranate, the finish a mix of white pepper and black tea.

title: Roth 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Blended with 13% Syrah, this is substantial red wine, perfumed in violet, with deep, dark flavors of dark cherry, vanilla and toasted oak. Supple and soft, it finishes in a savory tease of cedar and turned earth.

title: The Blending Lab 2016 GTePS Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep, dark and purple aromas of açai, cassis and acia teeter between delicate and syrupy on the nose of this blend of 65% Grenache, 25% Tempranillo and 10% Petite Sirah. The palate starts with a hint of savory peppercorn and herb spice then becomes more juicy when cassis and acid rise into the finish.

title: ZO Wines 2017 Winemaker's Select Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This new producer is devoted to small-production wines from its home in the appellation, blending this one with 15% Petite Sirah. Peppery and floral, it has a soft, delicate and elegant core characterized by delicate flavors of black cherry and strawberry.

title: Bushong 2018 Pretty in Pink Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: A darker shade of red in the glass, this rosé starts with mellow aromas of cherry juice, baking spice and warm pastry. There is solid vibrancy to the sip, where the broad cherry flavors meet with red pear and red apple.

title: Castoro Cellars 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh and accessible aromas of passion fruit, ripe melon, sweetgrass and wet cement make for a very complete nose on this bottling. The palate is classically crisp, with flavors of gooseberry, lime peels and cut grass, as well as a slightly metallic minerality.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Winemaker Series Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Cherry, star anise, clove and chai spice show on the nose of this bottling from a winery owned by Gallo. The palate is light with flavors of red plum and earthy herbs.

title: Fallbrook 2017 Special Selection Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Toasty aromas of oak, butter and lemon spritz make for a familiar nose on this bottling of Central Coast fruit by a South Coast winery. It's fairly rich and oak-driven on the palate, with marzipan and nutty flavors cut by lime zest and lively acid.

title: Foley Johnson 2016 Estate Merlot (Rutherford)
description: This is an intensely powerful, ripe and robust wine, richly layered in black-cherry and chocolate flavors. Secondary characteristics of clove, tobacco and dried herb nip at the full-bodied middle as toasted oak takes the final bow.

title: Folktale 2018 Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
description: Lime peels, sour kumquat and a nearly petrol aroma show on the nose of this bottling from the flatter parts of the Salinas Valley. Granny Smith apple flavors are sour but flavorful on the palate, lifted by lemon-blossom and wet stone touches.

title: Orfila 2016 Full Fathom Five Red
description: Strong aromas of dried earth, leather and red berries show on the nose of this blend of 40% Montepulciano, 40% Sangiovese, 12% Syrah, 4% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate is framed in chalky tannins and shows very dry flavors of berry and vanilla.

title: Parrish Family 2016 Malbec (Adelaida District)
description: Very dark and dense in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of cassis and lilacs, proving quite dense and somewhat shy. For such a dark wine, the palate is a little tepid, offering charred purple fruit and flowers.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Heroe Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Peppercorns, roasted pasilla chile and asphalt aromas meet with bright red fruit on the nose of this bottling, which is a great Cab for a summer day. The pyrazine-laden palate is fresh with more chile flavors that give depth to the underlying strawberry character.

title: Tiny House Vineyard 2018 Rosé of Pinotage (Sonoma Coast)
description: Structured with underlying tannins, this is a rare breed of Pinotage-based wine—dry and refreshing in layers of candied orange, cherry and peach. It has a flinty note of matchstick that opens the nose to its interesting fruit and herb.

title: Vincent 2016 Family Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Roasted blackberries, black-pepper, tar and violet-extract aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers blackberry, black-plum and Concord grape flavors, along with coffee and lilac elements.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2015 Terzetto Red (Chiles Valley)
description: From the producer's organic estate, this wine is equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, cofermented together. Dusty plum and dark chocolate combine around a moderate structure of firm tannin, toasted oak and coffee.

title: Cupcake 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Prominently earthy aromas of dust, baked soil and dried cranberries show on the nose of this widely available bottling. The flavors are also earthy, with wet gravel and hints of lanolin that mask the simple but pleasant berry flavors in the background.

title: B.R. Cohn 2018 Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: This is made from 80% Grenache and 20% Zinfandel and is substantive and grippy in texture, and is made in a meaty, robust style. Grapefruit pith, strawberry and blackberry highlight the fruity midpalate.

title: Buena Vista 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Earthy black tea and toasted oak accent a delicate opening bouquet in this widely appealing wine that is light and bright in wild strawberry and spice.

title: Etude 2018 Grace Benoist Ranch Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This has gritty tart acidity that pushes the palate in freshness and bright fruit. Wild strawberry, cherry and peach flavors combine to complement the acid, finding companionship in mint and dried herb.

title: Folktale 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Ripe pear and lemon-skin flavors show on the simple nose of this bottling. Clean flavors of crisp apple and pear flesh meet with wet stone on the palate, which is pleasant and familiar.

title: Massican 2018 Hyde Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: From the famous site in Carneros, the block sourced by the producer consists of Musque clone Chardonnay, planted in the early 1990s and a portion of it also goes into his Annia white blend. Opening in a whiff of confection, it offers steely acidity and a textured taste of lemon rind, grapefruit and white peach, layered and balanced in every sense of the word.

title: Sanford 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fairly light and delicate aromas of lemon peel, lemongrass and the slightest hint of warm buttercream show on the nose of this bottling from the region's most historic vineyard. There is a great sizzle to the palate, with fresh flavors of white flower and lemon zest that lead to an amazingly long and smooth finish.

title: Three Sticks 2017 Price Family Estates Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This youthful wine is from several properties owned by the producer, including the Walala, Gap's Crown, Durell and One Sky Vineyards. Earth, clove and tree bark tones provide a savory edge of complexity, followed by focused elements of baking spice, orange, pomegranate and strawberry. Structured yet bright, it is cohesive and delicious.

title: Benovia 2016 Martaella Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Warm, supple fruit is the star of this estate-vineyard wine, planted to heirloom clones. Flavors of baking spice, earth and rose petal ride beneath a core of lengthy cherry, pomegranate and plum, with good weight on the palate. Powerful and concentrated, it has balance and structure for days.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2016 Priorato Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Edgar Torres takes a stab at Priorat with this blend of 60% Carignan, 15% Garnacha, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah from the new Paper Street Vineyard, and succeeds with a deeply concentrated mix of strawberry, black cherry and purple flowers on the nose. The palate is pure purple, with lilac, wisteria and boysenberry flavors, framed by chalky tannins. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2015 Piocho Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Aromas of black plum, olive and bittersweet chocolate show on the nose of this Merlot-led blend, but it is the underlying minerality of crushed rocks and turned earth that's most compelling. The palate is smooth, with everything from oak and cocoa to rose buds, violets and black currants. The tannins are expertly polished and the density is ideal.

title: Moraga 2017 Bel Air Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is a rich style of Sauvignon Blanc from a property owned by Rupert Murdoch in the hills of Bel Air. Golden in the glass, it begins with lush aromas of white peach, mango, toasted almond, white flowers and toasted marshmallow. The palate opens with a flash of acidity followed by smooth waves of honey-dusted nectarine and seared stone fruit, finishing with hazelnut cream.

title: Tablas Creek 2017 Cotes de Tablas Red (Adelaida District)
description: This is just a lovely wine that showcases the delicate but true-to-style hand of vintner Jason Haas and his team. The blend of 53% Grenache, 25% Syrah, 12% Counoise and 10% Mourvèdre starts with bright aromas of red plum, strawberry and sumac. The palate snaps with acidity and chalky texture while delivering bright red fruit and underlying herb flavors.

title: Chappellet 2017 Grower Collection Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This vineyard-designate wine offers an inviting array of white pepper, cardamom and rose petal. Layered in complex, interwoven tannins and oak, it has tension and freshness in abundance, with deft flavors of stone, plum and dark cherry.

title: Antica 2016 Mountain Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine shows its mountain provenance in meaty, grippy and gritty tannins and a broad expansive weight on the palate. But beneath its brawn is beauty and a rounded lushness of delicious drinkability, a mix of brambly blackberry, cherry, cassis and crushed rock. Let it sit in the glass over time or consider cellaring. Enjoy 2026–2031.

title: Benovia 2016 La Pommeraie Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This tremendously impressive wine is made from grapes grown at the Martinelli family's Zio Tony Vineyard. It tastes of apple up front, juicy, layered and complex in lush texture and buoyant acidity. Edges of crème brûlée and caramel accent papaya and pineapple, with underlying mineral components that add to the intriguing richness.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2016 Mi Montsant Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: There is extreme aromatic depth to the nose of this blend of 50% Garnacha, 33% Carignan and 17% Tempranillo, from kirsch and lilac to licorice and roasted meat. The palate combines black-raspberry, açai and black-plum flavors, with underlying hints of loamy soil and dried lavender.

title: Chappellet 2017 Bateman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a vineyard in the Green Valley area, this is a thick, complex and seriously structured wine, layered in tension and breadth. The fruit is crunchy in pomegranate, cherry and citrus peel, the aromas steeped in rose. Richness develops along the way, weaving in a distinct taste of dark chocolate.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Clove, tea and stemmy earth permeate the core of this wine, which is lively, savory and tensely structured. Around the edges are brilliant layers of freshly picked raspberry and strawberry complemented by orange.

title: Goldeneye 2016 Gowan Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This full-bodied and firmly textured wine from perennial standout Goldeneye seems designed for aging, as its firm tannins and fresh acidity buoy abundant flavors of black cherry, clove and cedar. A slight tightness on the palate will help it age and improve through 2025.

title: Hendry 2015 Blocks 7 & 22 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is a spicy, sublime and expansive wine, full bodied no doubt, yet brimming in freshness and complexity. It is red-fruit driven and dazzles in white and black pepper, accented by dashes of cinnamon and nutmeg. It has a long-lasting texture and richness.

title: Inman Family 2018 Endless Crush Pratt Sexton Road Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from a site atop the Sebastopol Hills area near Freestone, known for its cooler climate, this is a quenchingly tart and textured wine, with structure and complexity. Fresh in lime, lemon and an endless taste of wild strawberry, it's a sublime expression of great fruit with lasting substance.
designation: Endless Crush Pratt Sexton Road Rosé of

title: Lester 2017 Lester Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This is a new project run by the owners of the celebrated vineyard in the Corralitos area, and it's a stunning start. Aromas of Asian pear, lime pith, lime blossom and wet clay lead into a zesty and vibrant palate of more lime, chalk and guava peels. The freshness is phenomenal.

title: Rudd 2016 Crossroads Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Made entirely from estate-grown organically farmed grapes, including 14% Cabernet Franc and 10% Petit Verdot, this is a dense expression of brambly blackberry, strawberry and darker notions of tobacco and toasted oak. It has a beautiful bouquet of earthy tobacco and iron, powerful yet structured and dazzling in spice and dried herb. Enjoy 2026–2030.

title: Seabold Cellars 2017 Olson Prunetucky Sands Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Clean, delicate and yet full aromas of lemon cream, toast, peach blossom and chalk show on the lovely nose of this bottling from a vineyard that sits above Highway 101 in Prunedale. The chalky texture takes hold immediately on the palate, with flavors of white peach and seared nectarine that are chiseled by acidity and finish on an intriguing chive note.

title: Vinum Cellars 2016 Pets Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: From one of the coolest spots in the Central Valley, this huge but supple wine tames the varietal's bold tannins with plenty of lush flavors of black cherry and blackberry. It is full in weight, with thick but smooth tannins and a compelling jammy richness that makes it easy to appreciate. Best through 2025.

title: Anarchist Wine Co. 2013 Conspiracy Theory Red (California)
description: An especially deep color and bold aromas of cedar and tobacco mark this as a serious, oak-aged wine. The fruit and spice flavors are well concentrated and easily up to the task of filling the wine's big frame and full body. It was blended from Petite Sirah, Syrah, Merlot, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon in that order of importance and aged in 70% new oak.

title: Bevela 2015 Old Fashioned Superstition Tierra Alta Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Coming in a squat bottle, this single-vineyard Syrah starts with aromas of caramelized black fruits, burned caramel, coffee, brown sugar and lilac on the nose. Aromas of tightly grained oak and roasted blackberry sauce show on the palate.
designation: Old Fashioned Superstition Tierra Alta Vineyard

title: Bushong 2016 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo)
description: This is a good wine for those seeking extreme cool-climate character, but may offend those seeking riper fruit flavors. Aromas of juniper, pine needle, peppercorn and tobacco decorate dark-red-currant fruit on the nose. The palate is all about herbs and spices, from tea leaves and more juniper, all sprinkled atop a mulberry backdrop.

title: Calla Lily 2013 Audax Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Black and inky, this wine blends in 13% Merlot and a smidgen of Cabernet Franc. Sandalwood, oak and cigar orbit around a soft, rich and round midpalate that is deftly structured and well integrated in oak and tannin.

title: Écluse 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated and thick aromas of chocolate fudge and candied Concord grape make for a very rich expression on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also rich and powerful with thick flavors of black cherry, cassis, roasted fennel and a hint of cocoa.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Dried lemons, poached apple, buttered toast and sandalwood converge for a classic yet expertly restrained nose on this bottling from a historic vineyard. The palate is crisp, fresh, ripe and savory all at once, presenting flavors of Asian pear, nectarine and Rainier cherry.

title: Foxen 7200 2016 Los Porteros Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Cedar aromas meet with dark red fruit and anise on the nose of this bottling from the eastern edge of the Santa Ynez Valley. Chalky tannins make for a compelling structure on the sip, where mouthfilling flavors of dark berries prove full but not fruity, finishing on a hint of vanilla.

title: Frank Family 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: A robustly styled wine with a depth of jammy plum and cherry, this is also bursting in earthy mushroom and forest tones, along with a distinct hit of cigar box. Refined tannins surround the soft rich midpalate followed by prominent oak.

title: Graziano 2015 Old Vine Carignane (Mendocino County)
description: Excellent concentration helps this medium-bodied, uncomplicated and gorgeously ripe wine stand out. It blends red and black fruits for a sense of focus and pure enjoyment in the flavors, while light tannins and good acidity balance it out nicely.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 High 9 Goodchild Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Light in the glass and bright on the nose, this bottling offers loads of fresh strawberry, red plum and sagebrush. It's light bodied on the palate, but energetic in flavors of fresh pomegranate and cranberry that are lifted by sage and wild thyme.

title: Roots Run Deep Winery 2014 The Graduate Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Blended with 3% Merlot, this mountain-grown wine offers tight-grained tannins and substantial power and weight. Flavors of blackberry, plum and cocoa powder dance around a core of toasted oak and graphite, unfurling to yield a pleasing wine.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Soft clove and fennel-frond spices meet with lighter cherry, dried strawberry and a touch of cedar on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows tangy red plum and strawberry with ample hints of thyme and sagebrush, proving pleasantly light but flavorful throughout the sip.

title: Square Peg 2017 Proprietor's Cuvée Rosé (Sonoma County)
description: Copper-pink in color and spicy on the palate, this wine offers a sublime texture that's ultimately crisp and delicious in style. Meyer lemon, strawberry and lime flavors refresh and delight within a balanced, light-bodied framework of elegance and restraint.

title: Vie Winery 2014 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Asphalt, dried black plum paste, packed purple flowers and black-currant jellies show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Dry and dark-purple-flower flavors meet with savory black-pepper spice, tense tannins and clean acidity on the palate. This wine should age well.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Christopher Crest Vineyard Family Reserve Estate Grown Mourvèdre (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of baked plum, bread, dried ginger, fennel and smoke show on the nose. There is good grip to the palate, where spicy flavors of plum skin and star anise lead into a vanilla-kissed finish.
designation: Christopher Crest Vineyard Family Reserve Estate Grown

title: Chalone Vineyard 2017 Chenin Blanc (Chalone)
description: Tangy lemon peels and rich Asian pear flesh meet with intriguing earthy aromas of hot sand in this bottling from one of California's most challenging and fascinating appellations. There is clean and pure acidity that powers that sip, offering flavors of grapefruit and nectarine against a chalky structure.

title: Sol Rouge 2016 White (Lake County)
description: Never mind the slightly hazy appearance, this presumably unfiltered wine is big on body and flavors, bursting with apricot, orange blossom and honey, while a rich, almost thick texture and honeyed finish complete the experience.

title: Spann Vineyards 2016 Lake Family Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: You won't have to wait years to enjoy this full-bodied wine. It finds good balance on a high plane of jammy fruit, fine tannins and moderate oak spices. The famously astringent texture of the varietal is soothed by plump blackberry and boysenberry flavors that coat the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Arcadia Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: From a Coombsville-area vineyard, this is an elegant, firmly textured and structured white, floral in apple blossom and pear. The flavors follow suit, showing an integrated full-bodied approach that is both balanced and substantial.

title: Thomas Fogarty 2016 Henry Ayrton's Block Rapley Trail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Hailing from a very specific block that was planted in 1983, this bottling is complex on the nose with juniper, wet sage, gravel and blistered black plum. The palate is intriguingly unique, showing mulberry, sour cherry, rose petal, carnation and wild mint flavors, wrapped in chiseled tannins that will last a good while. Drink 2021–2036.
designation: Henry Ayrton's Block Rapley Trail Vineyard

title: Wallis Family Estate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine made by sought-after winemaking consultant Thomas Rivers Brown. It delivers a powerful package of plum and dark chocolate. Earthy tobacco and sage meld with grippy, youthful tannins to showcase a well-structured offering. Enjoy 2024–2029.

title: Whitcraft 2017 Pence Ranch Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Drake Whitcraft is making wines like his father, Chris, whose bottlings lasted for decades, so this one will be fun to watch evolve. Very light in the glass, the wine shows aromas of raspberry, wet sage and green peppercorns, while the vibrant palate offers light cherry, pine needle, bay leaf and tea leaves. It's tightly woven, so enjoy now to at least 2037.

title: Trombetta 2017 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)
description: A note of reduction settles into an opening of salt, oak and sea spray in this well-made wine from the famous, windswept site. Crushed rock and white flower present an earthy, mineral component that's nicely balanced against a midpalate of luscious pear and fig.

title: Cobb 2016 Coastlands Vineyard Old Firs Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: As its name suggests, this most definitely effuses in forest floor and grippy, supportive walls of firm tannin and oak.
