From a strong opening, it evolves slowly and with nuance around a light-bodied core of white pepper, effusive red fruit and blood orange, the latter helping to highlight the innate backbone of acidity.

title: De Loach 2015 Rue Vineyard Olivet Bench Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy in strawberry and cherry, both thickly concentrated in flavor and richness, this is a bright, complex and tasty wine from the great site, which confounds with secondary characteristics of barbecue meat, char and vanilla bean.

title: Écluse 2016 Insider Red (Paso Robles)
description: Chiseled stone and wet earth aromas lean into dark blackberry and purple flowers on the nose of this unique blend of 57% Carignan, 29% Petite Sirah and 14% Zinfandel. Bright and ripe flavors of purple fruit kick off the sip before oregano-led herbs and more stony minerality provide complexity.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2015 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Intriguing aromas of sour cherry, mulberry and red-plum skin meet with compelling spice notes of cardamom pod on the nose of this bottling by Norm Yost. There's a spice-rack of flavors on the palate, from more cardamom to curry to clove, set against a tangy red-plum and strawberry-balsamic backdrop.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Kessler-Haak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rugged mulberry and wild plum aromas meet with dried sage and dusty soils on the nose of this bottling. The palate is savory with white pepper, Chinese seasoning salts and crushed sesame, which give savory depth to the cooked plum flavors.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Rancho La Vina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tangy and appealingly rustic aromas of Morello cherry, dark hibiscus and dried sagebrush show on the inviting nose of this single-vineyard expression. There's a welcome herbaceous quality to the palate, which gives depth to the rich cherry flavors, all wrapped in tangy acidity and tense tannins.

title: Riverbench 2016 Méthode Champenoise Cork Jumper Pinot Meunier Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Few California producers produce a straight Pinot Meunier bubbly, but this winery's inaugural effort makes one wonder why. Aromas of yellow hay, Meyer lemon peel, wet chalk, yellow pear and a touch of ash lead into a palate that's tangy in tones of grapefruit peel and pome fruit.
designation: Méthode Champenoise Cork Jumper Pinot Meunier

title: The Feminist Party 2017 G-S-M (Santa Barbara County)
description: Crisp, fresh and fruity on the nose, this blend offers delicious aromas of wild berries, purple flowers and wet asphalt on the expertly designed nose. Snappy boysenberry and black-raspberry flavors pop on the palate, which is lifted by cracked pepper, lavender and lilac touches.

title: Amici 2015 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Reductive with burly bold flavors of diesel and tar, this vineyard-designate from the southern end of the appellation is oaky, broad and grippy. Black fruit takes on a juicy undertone midway on the palate as tobacco, pencil and turned earth challenge in savory power. Enjoy 2025–2035.

title: Anaba 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a vibrant, energetic and fresh wine made from several vineyards, including cool-climate Clary Ranch and Wildcat Mountain Vineyard. Crisp, integrated flavors of orange and rhubarb mingle within a context of forest floor, cedar and tea—the tannins powerful and well-integrated.

title: Brophy Clark 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Roasted strawberry, hoisin, wet slate and grilled pork aromas make for an appealing nose. There is a strong zip to the palate in an energizing current that carries flavors of raspberry, white pepper and sagebrush.

title: Carlisle 2016 Mancini Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This historic vineyard was planted in 1922 to a mélange of mixed black and white varieties that are interplanted within the Zin. Earthy pepper jam and black and white pepper top an intensely structured and full-bodied wine dotted in plum, violet and ginger. The power is met by equal measures of acidity and freshness.

title: Cattleya 2017 Cuvée Number One Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Very dark and full aromas of deep-red-cherry fruit combine with loamy soil, crushed slate and scarlet rose petals on the intense nose of this bottling. A grippy structure frames the elegant yet strong sip, where flavors of dark pomegranate and cherry are spiced by cocoa dust.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Ashley's Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tangy lime and grapefruit aromas cut through the prominent sense of oak on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely crisp, framed by laser-sharp acidity and tense tannins, offering flavors of lemon peel, kumquat and more citrus.

title: Foxen 2017 Tinaquaic Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Honeysuckle and jasmine combine with fresh Asian pear and a squeeze of grapefruit on the fresh, clean and tight nose of this bottling from a low-yielding, dry-farmed vineyard. It's bright and zesty on the palate with loads of acid and chalky grip, showing flavors of freshly squeezed citrus and riper melon.

title: Mauritson 2015 Buck Pasture Red (Rockpile)
description: This blends together 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 11% Malbec and 9% Cabernet Franc from one site up high in the appellation. Perfumed in smoky cherry, graham cracker and cocoa dust, it's floral, bright and fresh, with soft structured tannins and a quenching succulence.

title: Fazeli Cellars 2017 Norooz White (Temecula)
description: B.J. Fazeli gives a nod to his Persian roots with the semisweet but extremely fresh and vibrant bottling of 67% Muscat Canelli and 33% Viognier. Clean aromas of lemon peel, pear and orange blossom lead into a crisp palate that's tense and refreshing with ripe citrus and white-flower flavors.

title: McNab Ridge 2016 Merlot (Mendocino County)
description: Smooth and easy to sip, this full-bodied wine has a silky mouthfeel that coddles bright raspberry and plump blackberry flavors in soft and supple tannins and resolved acidity. It's big but well mannered.

title: Michael David 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Smooth and buttery all the way through, this full-bodied wine starts with a butterscotch aroma. Additions of caramel and baked apple flavors contribute to the soft, creamy texture.

title: Passaggio 2017 Heringer Estates Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine has substantial fruit flavors accented by baking spices and a touch of butter, all laced with good acidity and wrapped in a mouthfilling texture.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Wet gravel and clay aromas meet with strawberry and tangy red-plum skins on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate's strawberry core is lifted by white sage and tarragon and sits atop flavors of a clay-like minerality.

title: Spann Vineyards 2016 Lake Family Cabernet Sauvignon (Clarksburg)
description: Extra bold flavors of dried fruit and a lush velvety texture give this full-bodied wine an opulent character. Black fig and dried plum in the aroma lead to spicy, mulled-wine flavors lightly accented by sandalwood and turned-earth notes.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Reserve Verbitksy Vineyard Tempranillo (Fair Play)
description: Full in body and wonderfully plummy in flavor, this medium- to full-bodied wine feels warm and broad and has uncomplicated, persistent fruit flavors that are easy to appreciate. A light wrapping of fine-grained tannins adds to the texture.

title: Meikle 2016 Estate Grown Barbera (Amador County)
description: The benefits of 33% new French barrels are evident in this keenly balanced and medium-bodied wine. An enticing, floral cedary aroma precedes bright and concentrated black-cherry and red-cherry flavors that bring good focus and freshness and a lively fruity finish.

title: Nelle 2016 Coastview Vineyard Syrah (Monterey County)
description: Black-currant syrup, crushed lilacs and dried violets show on the powerful nose of this bottling from a vineyard high above the eastern Salinas Valley. It's extremely ripe on the palate, where flavors of blackberry paste and boysenberry syrup are cut by powerful acidity.

title: San Simeon 2018 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh aromas of pear, rainy cement and the slightest hint of grass are evident on the nose of this bottling. There is a compellingly tangy grip to the crisp sip, which also shows ripe red apple and other pome fruits, making for a complex, pleasing sip.

title: Brick Barn 2016 Estate Blend Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light red-currant and red-plum aromas meet with minty garden herbs and a hint of cocoa on the nose of this bottling from a new estate just east of the Sta. Rita Hills. The sip is fresh with tangy cranberry and orange-peel flavors, wrapped in clean tension.

title: Ivory and Burt 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This generous and full-flavored wine layers pear syrup and vanilla over spiced apple notes. A soft mouthfeel makes the fruit seem even riper, and extends the finish. While not overtly oaky, the wine teases out both nutmeg and vanilla notes that add complexity.

title: Luna 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With 5% Petite Sirah, this shows as dark, inky and concentrated in style, with an opening of soft rich black fruit and plenty of heat. Cedar, clove and sage offer a contrast to the toasted oak and fruit-forward character of the wine.

title: Maggio 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Bright citrus and green-apple notes liven up this fresh, crisply textured wine. It has vibrant acidity, light and fruity flavors and a great sense of vitality.

title: Parducci 2017 Small Lot Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: Lively lemon and green-apple aromas make this light-bodied wine attractive from the first whiff. It brings more crisp fruit to the flavors, and maintains a tangy balance that's quite appetizing.

title: Peloton 2017 Spanish Springs Vineyard Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Flint, ash and Brie rind show on the intriguing nose of this bottling, which is a touch reductive right away and washed in dried herbs. There is a grassy tone to the palate, with crushed oyster shell and squeezed lime flavors.

title: Vie Winery 2013 White Hawk Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Tangy balsamic-tinged aromas of wild berry and sour black fruits meet with a touch of tar and cracked pepper on the nose of this bottling. Black-plum-skin flavors meet with Concord grape and purple flowers on the palate, which is still fresh despite being more than five years old.

title: Armitage 2018 Alaya Vineyard Stainless Steel Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Almost a tad pink in the glass, this stainless steel expression is very exuberant on the nose, showing bubblegum, wet slate, mango and pineapple aromas. The palate is also ripe and refreshing, with tropical flavors of coconut and papaya.

title: Carlisle 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From two sites (and with the addition of 15% Petite Sirah), this is an austere peppery red, spicy and high in acid, with highlights of cigar and raspberry. A touch of bitterness lingers on the finish.

title: Ess-eff 2017 Gianquinto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Steely mineral character makes for an easy approachable entry into this crisp refreshing white, which is light in style with a lush middle. Pear and apricot flavors complement the mouthfeel.

title: Rincon Mountain 2016 Pinot Noir (Ventura County)
description: Made from vines that grow above one of California's most famous surf spots, this bottling, which only amounted to a quarter-barrel of wine, predicts much potential for this coastal site. Aromas of red plum, rose petals and oak lead into a tense, tannin-loaded palate, with dried hibiscus and brick flavors.

title: Rubus 2017 Old Vines Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Seriously flavorful and appealing, this full-bodied wine virtually overflows with luscious blackberry, strawberry and maple flavors on a broad mouthcoating texture. It has good concentration, breadth and a lingering finish.

title: Saintsbury 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Plummy and brooding in dark cherry, this wine offers substantial up-front tannin and oak that mellows in the glass while presenting rich concentration. High-toned background acidity and jolts of baking spice counter the richer aspects well.

title: Saintsbury 2017 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Tangy in dark woody fruit, oak and tannin, this medium-bodied wine shows a wealth of herbal sage and earth. Interwoven flavors of orange, strawberry and rhubarb round out the palate in a complementary fashion.

title: Section Wines 2018 Vermentino (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Packaged with an appealingly playful polka-dot label, this bottling begins with aromas of sour lime paste and chalk. There's a solid grip to the palate, where lime blossom and crushed sea-shell flavors combine.

title: Seghesio 2018 Vermentino (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is waxy in apple and lemon flavors, with an underlying floral accent. The texture takes on a slight creaminess that melds with its foundation of lively acidity.

title: Wild Thing 2018 Rendezvous Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: This appealing and very flavorful wine made from Carignane and Zinfandel grapes has as much color as some red wines along with vivid red-cherry and raspberry aromas, good acidity and enough fruit concentration for a lingering finish.

title: Alara 2017 Pinot Noir (San Benito)
description: This project by former TV meteorologist Janu Goelz continues to turn heads and show promise. Aromas of strawberry, sumac, vanilla and licorice show on the nose, while cooked cherry and cranberry fruits are joined by damp tarragon on the powerful and fruity palate.

title: Aperture 2016 Right Bank Red (Alexander Valley)
description: This combines 52% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 11% Malbec and 7% Cabernet Franc. Together, they offer high-toned cherry, plum and cassis—the wine richly made and integrated in oak, tannin and heat.

title: Balletto 2017 Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright layers of dark plum, cherry and orange peel lead this juicy wine. Savory notions of black tea and cardamom complement the fruit and give pleasing earthy undertones.
designation: Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Clay Shannon 2018 Betsy Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)
description: This vivid wine feels light in weight but is substantial in terms of flavor concentration. It shows crisp apple and lemon aromas on the nose, with layers of citrus, melon and apple on the palate. There's a pleasing balance between fresh acidity and ripeness.

title: Clos LaChance 2017 Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Dense and concentrated aromas of blackberry, purple flowers and cola spice show on the nose of this bottling. Roasted black plum, rose petals, wild thyme and dark chocolate combine on the complex palate.

title: Comartin 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Stewed cherries in vanilla and caramel sauce rise to the fore on the nose of this bottling, which is quite broad. The palate offers accessible flavors of plum, roasted strawberry, pinched herbs and a hint of charred meat, lifted by persistent acidity.

title: Côte West 2017 Mounts Vineyard Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Light bodied, reduced and firm in tannin, this is a refreshing take on the variety, juicy and brimming in strong, layered flavors of blueberry and strawberry.

title: Davis Family 2018 Cote Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: With sizable structure and meat on its bones, this is still a lifted, high-toned wine that's light and bright in ripeness, with strongly layered flavors of lemon, grapefruit, strawberry and dried herb. It's refreshingly complex.

title: Eberle 2017 Côtes-du-Rôbles Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 64% Grenache, 24% Syrah, 8% Mourvèdre and 4% Durif offers aromas of gravel, baked soil, red plum and hibiscus. The palate is fun-loving and light bodied, with cranberry, hibiscus and orange-rind flavors, finishing with a hint of roasted meat.

title: Eberle 2018 Eberle Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Asian and Anjou pear aromas meet with Key lime, citrus and gardenia on the vibrant nose of this bottling. The palate is both tart and lush, with flavors of green guava and white flowers driving it along.

title: En Garde 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Big tangy red fruit meets integrated tannin and oak in this expansively concentrated, rich and exotic red wine. Sizzling acidity keeps it fresh in the glass—a complement to the oak and forest-floor elements that give it a savory, earthy edge.

title: Folded Hills 2017 August White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Aromas of melon, lime peel, white peach and a pinch of sea salt make for a very delicate nose on this bottling. The wine grabs hold of the palate immediately with a citrusy zeal, then widens toward nectarine and pear flesh flavors.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Aromas of roasted red cherry and kirsch show on the nose of this bottling from the Gilroy area. The oaky tannins are prevalent on the palate, where vanilla, gingerbread and roasted berries make for a heavy style of Syrah.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This is an extreme expression of cool-climate Syrah—perhaps more than the average consumer would enjoy. Aromas of rosemary, raw lamb chops, bloody beef, pepper dust and coffee grinds lead into an earthy, gamy palate of similar components.

title: Peachy Canyon 2017 The Odd One Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 54% Grenache, 25% Syrah and 21% Mourvèdre from the Zinfandel experts starts with a fairly meaty nose of smoke, black plum and dried purple flowers. The palate combines dark strawberry and mulberry with loads of white pepper and savory roasted meat flavors, all wrapped in persistent acidity.

title: Private Property 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very light in the glass, this wine begins a bit shy on the nose but soon shows precise aromas of nectarine, chalk, honeysuckle and melon rind. The palate grips with texture, carrying flavors of lemon, white peach and lychee.

title: DRNK 2018 Catie's Corner Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Aged in both amphora and stainless-steel barrels, this is an impressive white, crisp and varietal with structure and complexity in droves. Brightly stony in mineral and white flowers, it finishes in a beautiful kiss of lemon zest.

title: Gallo Signature Series 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a bold, hedonistic and appealling take on Pinot Noir, starting with smoky and rich aromas of earth, sagebrush, black raspberry and eucalyptus. The palate explodes with flavor, from ripe berries and earthy herbs to cedar-laced smoke.

title: Priest Ranch 2015 Coach Gun Red (Napa Valley)
description: Combining 50% Cabernet Sauvignon with 30% Petit Verdot and 20% Malbec, all estate-grown, this has an inviting nose of toasted oak, cedar and pencil shavings. Dense, firm tannins wrap around a juicy midpalate of huge texture and complex flavor, a mix of clove, black currant and cocoa powder. This will do well with more time in the bottle; enjoy best 2020–2025.

title: Clos de la Tech 2014 Santa Cruz Mountains Estates Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Despite already being five years old, this estate blend remains quite young and will live long. Aromas of black plum, nutmeg and star anise lead into a palate framed by sandy tannins, where black-fruit and dried ginger flavors arise. Drink 2021–2031.

title: La Marea 2018 Alternative Cut Kristy Vineyard Albariño (Monterey County)
description: This experimental twist by Ian Brand shows only slight differences from his original bottling, yet they're intriguingly fresh accents. Aromas of peach blossom, honeydew rinds and wax lead into a laser-sharp, high-toned palate that focuses on lime and the slightest touch of nectarine on the finish.

title: Testarossa 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Toasty and flinty on the nose, this bottling pairs aromas of daffodil, paraffin and lemon cream. Hints of seared oak carry through the palate, where a zippy citrus-zest acidity cuts through the warmer apricot tones.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 White Label Bassi Vineyard Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: From a vineyard that overlooks the Pacific Ocean, this cool-climate Syrah intrigues with seared boar flesh, dried violet and crisp boysenberry flavors. The palate plays with a lighter fresher style, offering snappy elderberry flavors alongside more purple flowers and a hint of tar.

title: Gary Farrell 2017 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a wonderfully tart, textured and mineral-driven white from multiple sites across the appellation. Crisp apple and pear wrap around a core of lemon, nutmeg and lemongrass, finishing on a bite of wet stone.

title: Thacher 2018 Shell Creek Vineyard Own-Rooted Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles Highlands District)
description: Very tight aromas of wet stone, light white flowers and Asian pear flesh show on the always appealing nose of this bottling by Sherman Thacher, one of the white-wine highlights from Paso Robles each vintage. The grippy wine grabs hold of the palate with a chalky texture and very dry white-fruit flavors, proving tense throughout the sip.

title: Baldassari Family Wines 2016 Nolan Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: Tar, grilled meat and mushroom highlight a thickly built midpalate of weight and complexity in this varietally satisfying red. Smoke, blueberry and white pepper continue the theme of savory exoticism and intrigue.

title: Etude 2016 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Minty herbs of tarragon and green sage give tremendous depth to the baked boysenberry aromas on the nose of this bottling. Wild sagebrush and chaparral herbs also overload the palate in pleasing ways, enhancing the brisk elderberry and mulberry flavors.

title: Testarossa 2016 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dense black-cherry aromas meet with minty soils on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate combines tangy boysenberry with star anise and clove, lifted by hints of lavender into the finish.

title: I. Brand & Family 2018 Eden Rift Vineyard Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)
description: With dynamic and complex expressions like this, it's a wonder why people started stripping the naturally pink hue that Pinot Gris provides. The pinkish orange wine delivers aromas of strawberry sorbet and rosebuds and then opens onto a palate of light raspberry and watermelon. There is ample tannic tension as well.

title: Kukkula 2016 Sisu Red (Adelaida District)
description: This blend of 50% Syrah, 25% Grenache and 25% Mourvèdre starts with aromas of smoked strawberry, raspberry and even peach on the nose, which combines fresh fruit with savory spice. The cherry-wood smoke shows on the palate too, yet is cut by snappy raspberry and red currant, reminiscent of roasted pork in a cranberry compote sauce.

title: Testarossa 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rich red-cherry and black-raspberry aromas meet with rose petals and crushed slate on the nose of this bottling. A tangy boysenberry flavor kicks off the palate, where bright acid also delivers lavender and rosewater elements.

title: Anglim 2017 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Roussanne (Adelaida District)
description: Rich on the nose with perfumed accents of white flowers, yellow melon and pear brioche, this is a balanced take on an often difficult grape. The palate is laden with lemon peel and lemon pastry, framed in a waxy texture and set atop a light butter backdrop.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This bottling starts with juicy aromas of red fruit, but then grows more complex, with darker cherry, tarragon, fennel and danky earth elements. The palate also starts bright with rose petals and blistered boysenberry flavors before returning to an earthy, gamy, shiitake mushroom-laced core.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Azaya Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: Firm, solidly built and slightly restrained at first sip, this medium-bodied wine has a deep color, concentrated fruit aromas and focused black-fruit flavors on the palate. Firm tannins and acidity give it a grippy mouthfeel while just-ripe black cherry and black tea dominate the flavors.

title: Furthermore 2015 Nevina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a site two ridges in from the ocean, at 1,300-feet in elevation, this is extreme winemaking at its best—a stemmy, earthy expression of wild strawberry that's lively on the palate and firmly structured. It dances in Asian spice and forest, tasting almost of the sea.

title: Pelletiere 2016 Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Winemaker Amy Butler coaxes cool-climate qualities from this Syrah, which starts with aromas of charred elderberry, black pepper and freshly paved street on the nose. Tangy black-plum extract and pomegranate-reduction flavors meet with green peppercorns, charred lamb and rosemary on the savory spicy palate.

title: Von Holt 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light and delicately colored, this wine is fresh and vibrant in acidity, with a savory, edgy element of forest floor and black tea. The tannins give it texture and structure without distraction, finishing in a balanced, elegant lingering of flavor.

title: Brassfield 2017 Chardonnay (High Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows good restraint and balance, as subtle baking-spice aromas meet Bosc pear and lemon meringue flavors. It has great balance and is a good candidate to hold for further development. Best after 2022.

title: Dancing Crow 2017 Volcano Ridge Cuvée Red (Lake County)
description: This wine is impressive and delicious, offering abundant aromas of black plums, black pepper and licorice and rich ripe saturated flavors of blackberry and black cherry. It is full bodied, rounded in texture but supported by underlying soft tannins and it leaves luscious fruit accents clinging to the sides of the mouth.

title: Furthermore 2015 Graton Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the vineyard around the winery property near the town of Graton, this is a tart and tangy red, spiced and exuberantly layered in pomegranate, blood orange and cranberry. With a twist of black licorice, it has tons of complex earthiness and a velvety smooth finish.

title: Heath Vineyards 2015 Absolution Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Candied blackberry, crushed oregano and a slight bell pepper aroma kick off the dynamic nose of this bottling, made from Paso Robles grapes by a Texas producer. There is a strong chalky structure to the palate, presenting flavors of black currant, white pepper and an array of dried herbs.

title: Poundstone 2017 Sangiacomo Catarina Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This heady, fleshy white from a well-farmed site is creamy and lush in mouthfeel, with a supportive backbone of acidity. The fruit is a mix of crisp green apple and more robust fig, with touches of vanilla and brioche emanating from the integrated oak.

title: Robert Renzoni 2014 Fiore di Fano Red (Temecula Valley)
description: This blend offers aromas of tangy raspberry, cranberry skin and baking spices, leading to a palate that's wrapped in chalky tension and persistent acidity. Flavors of tangy red fruit and hints of mace complete the experience.

title: Sanguis 2015 Nocturne Petit Verdot (Central Coast)
description: Deep, dark and concentrated black-fruit aromas on the nose of this bottling are lifted by rounded cola spice and violet extract. There are strong black-plum and elderberry flavors on the palate of this study of darkness, lifted by light black-licorice spice toward the finish.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2017 Integrato Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A barrel-select cuvée from seven vineyards, this bottling by John Benedetti shows aromas of cherry syrup, clove, lavender and ripe plum on the nose. A taut structure envelops the sip, offering flavors of candied raspberry and red-cherry bubblegum against fairly searing acidity.

title: Sextant 2015 Passage Red (Paso Robles)
description: A bit shy on the nose at first, this blend of 73% Syrah, 15% Grenache and 12% Mourvèdre slowly opens to reveal aromas of dark plum, caramel and coffee candies. It lands on the palate with rich caramel-kissed flavors of blackberry jam, mocha and espresso, wrapped in smooth, polished tannins.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Zinfandel (Red Hills)
description: This wine is bold, powerful and ripe-tasting, showing blackberry and raspberry aromas, light oak and cedar accents and an underlying savory, mineral character. It is full bodied and appropriately firm in texture.

title: Turnbull 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Woody cedar, tobacco and peppercorn line the road to a brawny and substantial experience of full-bodied concentration in this reserve-worthy red that offers value for the price. Firm, expansive tannins wrap around black currant and black cherry as a thick finish awaits. Enjoy from 2026–2031.

title: Thacher 2017 Shell Creek Vineyards Valdiguié (Paso Robles)
description: This wine goes down super easy, like a darker, fresh Gamay. Snappy aromas of black-raspberry sorbet, fresh tarragon and white pepper lead into an extremely fresh palate that bounces with red fruits and fennel flavors. It's light in body but flavorful and delicious.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Maestro Red (Napa Valley)
description: A well-made, incredibly affordable wine, this opens with inviting baking-spice notes of nutmeg and clove, accompanied by a dried herb undercurrent that speaks to the Cabernet Sauvignon within. Raspberry and currant highlight a beautifully structured and complex experience on the palate.

title: Sojourn 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Big oak and leathery tannins are hugely present in this thick, richly concentrated wine, that offers fans of a more robust style the jammy blueberry, blackberry and graham cracker layers worth sinking one's teeth into.

title: Écluse 2016 Prelude White (Paso Robles)
description: Plump peach, exotic citrus and creamy mango aromas strike the nose on this blend of 67% Grenache Blanc and 33% Viognier. There is great depth to the sip, ranging from citrus and pineapple to savory sea salt. The acid and texture are laser sharp.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Misc Stuff G-S-M (Sonoma County)
description: This is a robust, full-flavored blend of 55% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre, a majority of the wine aged in concrete. Rose-petal and lavender aromas lead to big layers of black licorice, grilled meat, mushroom and strawberry puree, as underlying acidity saves the day.

title: Navarro 2017 Premier Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: All polished and elegant, this medium-bodied barrel-fermented wine offers vanilla and butter aromas, subtle apple and baked apple flavors and a smooth texture. It has an abundance of the baking-spice character that a lot of people love in their Chardonnay.

title: Olema 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Brawny in cherry, cola and baking spice, this has a soft, approachable midpalate of balanced weight and ripeness. Integrated acidity boosts layers of strawberry, mint and citrus that complement one another well. This is a great value for the quality.

title: Paradise Springs 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Crisp aromas of lemon wedge, chilled green apples, river stones and white flowers make for an alluring start to this bottling. There is a strong sizzle to the sip, which presents flavors of honeysuckle, grapefruit and crisp apple slices.

title: Pellegrini 2015 Olivet Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an intensely earthy, bold and brawny red wine from the producer's great estate vineyard—a study in medium-bodied fruit and spice. Red currant, strawberry and citrus figure prominently into the mix, as oak and tannin make themselves known.

title: Peloton 2016 Squire Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Tangy aromas of Morello cherry, juniper and damp herbs make for a cool-climate entry to this bottling from a vineyard near the coast of Shell Beach. Tart black-plum flavors meet with oregano, marjoram and peppercorns on the palate.

title: Riley's Rows 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: The vision of college student and second-generation proprietor Riley Flanagan, this shows a light, candied touch of earthy strawberry and candied cherry. It is a balanced, elegant take on the variety that's balanced and full of grace.

title: Square Peg 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a dry-farmed site in a well-mannered vintage, this is earthy and savory in black tea, cardamom and forest floor. Light bodied and restrained in style, it offers a tartness of Bing cherry and tangerine that impress and linger on the long finish.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2015 FAY Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: An herbal imprint permeates across this wine—a bright expression of the grape that's earthy and lingering in tobacco, cigar box and pencil shavings. Clove, currant and sage play prominent roles across a landscape of full-bodied balance and complexity.

title: Velvet Bee 2017 Queen Bee Blanc White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: It's always exciting to see what winemakers do with Sémillon, which remains uncommon in this part of the world. This bottling blends it 50-50 with its traditional partner, Sauvignon Blanc to produce aromas of lemon skins, apple rinds and earthy, hot sandstone. There is a slight oily and waxy character to the palate, where flavors of light almond and lemon skin arise.

title: Foppiano 2015 Gianna's Block Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a strong aroma and subsequent flavor of espresso bean, contrasted well against softer elements of lavender. Burly black fruit meets oak and chalky substantial tannin weight, finishing in a swirl of grilled meat and black pepper.

title: Barnett 2015 Rattlesnake Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is the producer's 100% estate bottling meant to reflect the best of the best. Brawny and substantial oak accentuates the wine's savory, earthy intensity in forest, cedar and tar. Full bodied and richly concentrated, it finishes in a fistful of black pepper.

title: Bella Grace 2016 Montagñaro Red (Amador County)
description: This 50-50 blend of Zinfandel and Barbera wraps mellow spiced-fruit flavors in a warm soothing blanket of soft tannins for an alluring velvety mouthfeel. The wine is smooth, delicious, light on acidity and rich enough for a lingering spicy finish.

title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Tempranillo (Yolo County)
description: This wine is beautifully balanced: fresh and spicy, showing lots of blackberry and black-cherry flavors, a lively mouthfeel and medium body. It will be easy to drink and a snap to pair with food from Korean barbecue to fried chicken.

title: Bevela 2015 Unforeseen Alchemy Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Intense aromas of blackberry paste, ripe plum, turned earth and crushed cocoa show on the nose of this red blend. It's very smooth upon entry to the palate, with dark fruit and espresso-bean flavors that are cut by decent acidity.

title: Draxton 2018 Rosé of Pinot Meunier (Napa Valley)
description: Dark pink-orange in color, this fresh lighthearted wine is aromatic in strawberry and peach, with lively acidity providing a backbone of structure. Lasting flavors of grapefruit and tangerine linger and refresh.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Vogensen Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine that is soft and sinewy in style. Full bodied, it has pronounced oak, cedar and dried herb with fruity components of blueberry, cassis and red currant, the finish awash in clove and coffee.

title: Furthermore 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a dry, crisp and medium-bodied wine from the Pinot specialist, textured and complex with well-defined flavors of peach and strawberry. It has a lushness that remains fresh and focused, not to mention delicious.

title: Hawley 2016 Reserve Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A hit of turned earth opens the proceedings of this well-made wine, which is velvety on the palate with a back note of grit and tannin. Cherry, plum and a floral underbelly of violet give it a lasting brightness that contrasts well against the powerful ripeness of the fruit.

title: JCB 2016 No 81 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: The heady perfume of oak dominates in the nose of this wine, made in a voluptuous, rich and full-bodied style. Apple, pear and melon dance around a core of well-integrated body and texture, which finds balance within the density and concentration.

title: Louis M. Martini 2016 Thomann Station Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This is a boldly rich, ripe and robust rendition of the variety, thick and concentrated in graham cracker and blueberry cobbler. Still, it appeals in its voluptuousness, finishing in a lasting note of coffee and violet.

title: Paratus 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the cool mountain appellation, this wine is lightly spiced in clove and nutmeg and has a smooth soft elegance on the palate. Red currant, plum and blackberry give it a fruity underbelly that complements the feral aspects and viscosity.

title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Clone 113 Westside 3 Block Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Clean and bright Bing cherry aromas meet with red flowers on the intense nose of this bottling from high above the Salinas Valley. The palate combines rooibos tea with hibiscus flavors, but the compelling aspect is the grippy texture on an otherwise light frame.

title: Sculpterra 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted red and black cherries meet with hickory and nutmeg on the rich nose of this bottling, which is given color and depth thank to 10% Petite Sirah. A chalky mouthfeel carries flavors of rich red cherry, framed by tense tannins and decent acidity.

title: Via Romano 2014 Tuscan Style Papa Romano Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine has the grip and good acidity of a Sangiovese along with ample red- and black-cherry flavors that fill out the palate very well. It has a medium-dark color, light salt and pepper aromas that accent the cherries, and then a satisfying richness on the palate that is well supported by fine-grained tannins.

title: Bargetto 2014 La Vita Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Dusty blackberries and roasted fennel aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Dolcetto, 29% Refosco and 21% Nebbiolo that nods toward the owners' Italian heritage. The grapes do well in the cool Regan Vineyards, pairing a lighter weight mouthfeel with grippy tannins, wrapped in slightly tart red fruit and baking spice. Drink now–2034.

title: Big Basin 2015 Sixty-Two Terraces Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There is a strong sense of minerality to the nose of this bottling, with aromas of wet stone, turned loam and moist clay covering up the background fruits. The structure is very tannic on the palate, where elderberry and purple-flower flavors emerge from the soil-like core.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Estate Grown Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted aromas of coffee, charred black currant and pepper show on the rather lavish nose of this bottling. It's rich in style on the palate, where hearty dark-fruit flavors couple with an espresso note and are framed by solid acidity.
designation: Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Estate Grown

title: Davies 2015 Winfield Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: From a valley floor vineyard in the warmer northern climes of the valley, this 100% varietal red is broad and generous in black brambly fruit that veers into a rich rounded taste of vanilla. Soft texture makes it approachable and enjoyable in its youth.

title: Ektimo Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Sizzling acidity greets the palate immediately in this medium-bodied white that makes a good first impression and supports it with well-defined flavors of lemon, lime and green apple. The finish teases further in white peach.

title: Jigar 2015 Tollini Vineyard Syrah (Redwood Valley)
description: Very pure and deep black-cherry flavors highlight this inky-colored and full-bodied wine. It's packed with layers of very ripe cherry, plum and blackberry and wrapped in thick velvety tannins for a full mouthfeel.

title: La Follette 2016 Los Primeros Chardonnay (Sonoma County-Monterey County)
description: The grapes for this wine come 83% from Sonoma County, the remainder mostly from Monterey, with just 2% from Mendocino. It's made in a quenching style of succulent acidity and nuanced flavors of fig, quince and Meyer lemon, the backbone nicely rich in graham cracker.

title: Maddalena 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A deep red-berry aroma meets with mocha and toasty oak on the richly layered nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. There is solid complexity to the palate, with chalky tannins sitting beside more cocoa, red fruit and light caramel. This is an affordable wine to lay down. Drink now–2029.

title: Metz Road 2016 Riverview Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: A bright raspberry aroma meets accents of hibiscus tea, turned soil and wet rock on the nose. The palate brings broad flavors of sour cherry and thyme that are enhanced by peppery spice and a grippy texture.

title: Mount Veeder 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Brawny layers of blueberry and blackberry show in this broad and textured wine. Supple yet powerful tannins frame flavors of cedar, sage and cinnamon, which it an attractive, appealing vibe.

title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Napa County)
description: A smaller offering from the producer, this impresses in its blending of 60% Pinot Noir with 40% Chardonnay, combining them into a reserve-level expression of nutty almond and baked lemon. A crisp midpalate helps offset the lush broad expansion of creaminess that develops along the way.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Boysenberry and slate are lifted by baking spice on the nose of this bottling, which is being released later than the 2016 vintage. Tart plum-skin and floral flavors play on the palate, which is not as dense as usual but is still a strong wine.

title: Pennyroyal Farm 2016 Hammer Olsen Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: Great balance and freshness make this medium-bodied wine very appealing. It has lively acidity, just-ripe citrus and green-apple flavors and a mouthfeel that's both full and a bit tangy at the same time. It comes from the family that founded Navarro.

title: Perfusion 2016 Pinot Noir (San Francisco Bay)
description: From a small vineyard in the East Bay, this bottling offers snappy black-raspberry, rose-petal and peppercorn aromas on a light but expressive nose. There is a herbal tinge on the palate, with thyme and sagebrush flavors, as well as more berry. The structure and acidity are in balance.

title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Seven Leagues Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Housed in a classic green-glass bottle, this appellation blend offers aromas of lime blossom, sharp citrus rind, burnt almond and chalk. The palate is very racy and sharp with mouthwateringly sour citrus and wound-up pome fruit flavors.

title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Petite Sirah (Amador County)
description: An exotic earthy character dominates this dark-colored, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine, giving it a rustic feral appeal that gets progressively more enjoyable on the palate and finish. Blackberry and blueberry flavors underneath add to its appeal. Best after 2023.

title: Walt 2017 Clos Pepe Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Powerful aromas of black cherry, tobacco, clove, chocolate and oak are heavy but pleasing on this bold style of Pinot Noir. The lush, delicious and potent palate delivers more of the same, with black-cherry and tobacco flavors sprinkled with crushed nutmeg and vanilla.

title: Walt 2017 Sierra Mar Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Vanilla, caramel, roasted cherry and baked plum aromas make for a rich and lush entry to the nose of this wine. Framed by buoyant acidity, the palate delivers pure and ripe yet clean and complex flavors of strawberry sorbet drizzled with caramel and cocoa.

title: Calera 2016 Reed Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)
description: Juniper berry, bay leaf and mossy forest-floor elements join with dense cranberry fruit on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard 2,200 feet above the Salinas Valley. The palate pops with more of those herbal elements, including tarragon and eucalyptus, as well as cranberry and sandalwood.

title: Davis Family 2016 Campbell Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This has all the savory, exotic elements of the variety that the coast can offer, from clove and forest floor to black tea. The fruit is equally inviting, a mix of rhubarb and orange peel built around a core of tension, structure and crisp acidity that is balanced and endlessly complex.

title: Liquid Farm 2017 White Hills Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tight aromas of light pineapple, Meyer lemon and waxy paraffin get the slightest hint of smoke on the nose of this blend from four renowned vineyards. The palate is framed by strong acidity and chalky tension that underlies the grapefruit and lemon flavors, which are brushed with a delicate stroke of butter.

title: Comartin 2015 Camp Four Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Darker in the glass than many contemporary Grenaches, this bottling shows rich aromas of black cherry, vanilla, nutmeg and gingerbread on the nose. There's a compelling elegance to the sip, where kirsch, dark-chocolate and coffee flavors ride tannins that are just starting to smooth out.

title: Eighty Four 2018 Albariño (Carneros)
description: This rare find in the Napa Valley is bright and floral, with bristling acidity. From an estate-grown site planted in 2012, this white saw no oak, preserving its fruity core of melon, peach and jasmine.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2015 Petit Verdot (Howell Mountain)
description: Robust, leathery and textured, this has strong, layered flavors of dark plum, coffee and dusty cocoa powder. The tannins are structured and full of grip, in full support of the concentrated fruit and inky color.

title: Liquid Farm 2016 Four Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blend of Clos Pepe, Bentrock, La Rinconada and Kessler-Haak vineyards begins with aromas of brioche, nectarine-mango jam and toasty oak on the nose. The palate offers an intriguing mix of honeydew, oak, toast and buttered peach flavors, making for a clean and compelling sip.

title: Matchbook 2017 The Arsonist Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This indulgent, full-bodied wine goes all out on richness. Aromas of malted milk, vanilla and cream lead to layered hazelnut, crème brûlée and poached pear flavors, while the viscous texture carries through for a lingering finish.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Roasted red plums, minty tarragon, roasted herbs and a hint of game show on the complex nose of this bottling from a mountainside legend. Those layers emerge on the palate too, floating from raspberry to thyme and anise to peppered meats, with loads of savory depth.

title: Samsara 2014 Lotus Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This reserve style of Pinot Noir from Samsara is darker, earthier and denser than the usual style, but the hallmark forest-floor aroma still reigns, along with dried red cherries. Strong cranberry, red-cherry and mulberry flavors show on the sip, but the spice rack is loaded, offering nutmeg, vanilla and star anise in recurring layers.

title: Center of Effort 2015 Rosso Corsa Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Aromas of boysenberry, loamy earth, mint and a pinch of anise show on the nose. The palate plays up the loamy earth as well, which gives a mineral depth to the black cherry, black plum and cocoa flavors.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Ashley's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of black plum, sage, violet and a hint of tar combine for a dynamic and intriguing nose in this single-vineyard expression. Violets and lavender are prominent on the deftly balanced palate, with a pleasing plum flavor and a salt-and-pepper finish.

title: Gary Farrell 2018 Russian River Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Quince, lime and fig jump from the glass in this floral and earthy white wine, fermented and aged both in stainless steel and neutral oak. Stony mineral aspects complement the fruit amidst a textured palate.

title: Law 2017 Soph White (Adelaida District)
description: Fresh and sprightly on the nose, this blend of 57% Roussanne, 22% Marsanne and 21% Clairette Blanche offers lime blossom, lemon-lime soda and ashy chalky minerality on the nose. The palate grips with a tremendous texture and sizzles with bright acidity, offering apple flesh and squeezed grapefruit flavors.

title: Liquid Farm 2015 Golden Slope Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A blend from six vineyards located across the appellation, this bottling offers aromas of dried pears, mango and damp oak on the nose. There's a racy line of acidity on the palate, where dollops of creamy oak and baked apple are splashed by tangerine-powered acidity.

title: Lone Madrone 2017 Oveja White (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This bottling deftly combines the lushness of 46% Grenache Blanc with the tightness and acidity of the 54% Picpoul Blanc, starting with aromas of white-peach custard, Meyer lemon rind and sea salt. There's tension on the sip, where lemon-cream and crushed gravel flavors meet with light nectarine.

title: Samsara 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated aromas of blackberry syrup are lifted by pepper, gamy meats and a touch of oak on the nose of this bottling. Rich black-plum and black-currant flavors meet with charred meats, white pepper, rosemary and violet on the palate.

title: Seabold Cellars 2017 Brousseau The Swale Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: From one of the most age-worthy appellations in California comes this bottling, loaded on the nose with red-cherry and elegant violet aromas. The palate is very tight right now, yet slowly reveals black-plum, rose-petal and violet flavors that will only grow more compelling with time. Drink 2021–2037.

title: Bargetto 2016 Regan Vineyards Reserve Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Black cherry, wet loam, damp cedar and a pinch of cocoa show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very tense with tannins and searing acid, though intense boysenberry flavors do peek through.

title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Durif (Yolo County)
description: This wine is big, bold and densely textured. Ripe blackberry and violet aromas lead to rich saturated fruit flavors, very little oakiness and a very full mouthfeel boosted by layered tannins.

title: Black Ridge 2014 Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Crushed sandstone and flinty mineral aromas meet with a slightly reductive nose on this bottling. The palate is very tightly wound with grassy lime-skin flavors.

title: Brotherhood 2014 1839 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: From an New York operation located in the Hudson Valley that bills itself as the oldest continuously operating winery in the country, this bottling shows baked cherries, blackberries, molasses and anise on the nose. It's rounded and rich on the palate, where charred red fruits meet with cocoa atop a decently structured texture.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Estate Primitivo (El Dorado)
description: This wine is very fruity and also well-structured, offering generous raspberry and blackberry flavors backed by moderate tannins and good acidity. It's well balanced and appetizing to taste.

title: Cinnabar 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Rich aromas of dark plum, sagebrush, cola and black cherry make for a rather thick and ripe aromatic entry to this appellation blend. It is also thick on the palate, where dark-cherry flavors make for a ripe and structured experience.

title: Decoy 2015 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a value-driven blend that delivers plenty of quality flavor for the price, including an explosion of juicy dark cherry, cassis and rich round nicely integrated oak and tannin. It's enjoyable now and sure to please a crowd.

title: Domenica Amato 2017 Ceja Farms Grenache Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: Oily and oaky, this white is light bodied and viscous, featuring layered flavors of green apple, lemon and wet stone.

title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Zinfandel (Yolo County)
description: Ripe and lush, this full-bodied wine practically oozes raspberry and sweet cherry flavors. The texture is very smooth and polished too.

title: Bishop's Peak 2016 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Dried sage, bay leaf and thyme play against red cherry, raspberry and white pepper on the nose of this affordably priced twist-top bottling from the Talleys. Crushed carnations and tart cranberry flavors meet with orange rind on the palate.

title: Black Ridge 2013 San Andreas Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Violets, lilacs, black fruits and star anise make for a very showy nose on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Very floral flavors arise on the sip, where grainy tannins carry ripe black-plum-paste flavors.

title: Breathless NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)
description: With a copper-orange hue, this is made from a majority of Pinot Noir though it offers flavors indicative of the Chardonnay content as well. Driven by citrus tones of tangerine, it has a dry gritty texture, mid-level structure and lasting acidity.

title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Dos Vinas Vineyard Reserve Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Light aromas of honeydew and honey show on the restrained nose of this bottling. The palate is all about a tight texture, with springtime flavors of white flowers and lime pith showing through.

title: Clos La Chance 2014 Reserve Malbec (Central Coast)
description: Sweet and dark aromas of blackberry, dark chocolate, mint and charcoal show on the nose of this bottling. It's quite thick on the palate with strong tannins that cut the extracted black-currant and cigar-box flavors.

title: Ferguson Crest 2017 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: Clean honeydew, lime balm and peach-orange aromas meet with vanilla and white-rock aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a flash of sweetness to the palate, where ripe apple and pear flavors combine with lemon syrup.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2015 Solo Barrique Syrah (South Coast)
description: Boysenberry, mocha, tar, roasted meat and mint show on the nose of this bottling from southern California. Rocky tarry flavors arise on the palate, with a slightly primary boysenberry-juice backbone.

title: Kalaris 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: High-toned acidity lifts a delicate offering of cinnamon, plum and blueberry in this soft, round and approachable red.

title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This wine delivers substantial bang for the buck, blending a majority of Merlot with sizable amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, and small drops of Petit Verdot and Malbec. Firm tannins grip flavors of sage, cedar and graphite, with smoky blackberry playing on the full-bodied palate.

title: Lava Cap 2015 Reserve Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: This is a monster wine that goes for broke in terms of big bold flavors, full body and massive tannins. The color is black almost to the rim, the aromas are peppery and espresso-like, while the flavors are full of black fruit but also tightly strapped in by tannins. The wine could open up with extended aging, so it's best to drink after 2025.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Concentrated blackberry syrup, lilac, caramel and cedar show on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong cigar-box element to the palate, but it works with the rich black-currant flavors, all framed by tense tannins.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: Herbal with chalky tannins, this is blended with 8% Malbec from the elusive appellation. Red currant, baked plum and jammy blackberry highlight a powerful core of ripeness and grip.

title: Saddleback Cellars 2017 Frediani Vineyard Old Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: Reduced and intensely tannic, this youthful red offers robust oak and structure around notes of dried herb, sage and cinnamon. Thick, robust and ripe, its fruit character is elusive and marred by oak.

title: Sevtap 2016 Sunday Kind of Love Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very extracted aromas of elderberry syrup show on the nose of this blend of 50% Merlot, 25% Petit Verdot, 12.5% Cabernet Franc and 12.5% Malbec. Tangy black-plum and blackberry flavors meet with peppery spice on the palate.

title: Terra d'Oro 2018 Moscato (California)
description: This is an intensely sweet and sugary dessert-style wine that offers indulgent enjoyment. Its generous honeydew melon, lychee and honey flavors coat the palate.

title: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Fruity and fresh, this light, cheery wine gushes strawberry-jam and cherry-candy flavors. It's soft in texture and semisweet in balance.

title: Trentadue 2016 Old Patch Red (North Coast)
description: This is a pleasant, fruity, medium-bodied wine that should be a crowd pleaser. Plenty of cherry and berry flavors accompany very light tannins and a smooth texture.

title: Apothic 2016 Red (California)
description: Semisweet and very fruity, this is a rich and mouthcoating wine, with a very soft texture. It offers ripe cherry, prune and raisin flavors and a lingering syrupy finish.

title: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This fruity and very affordable wine has an appealing, smooth texture and attractive, light peach and apple flavors. Medium body and a touch of crispness make it appetizing.

title: California Roots 2017 Red (California)
description: This exceptionally smooth wine is light to medium bodied, and offers plenty of fresh fruit flavors and light accents of earth and spices.

title: Imagery 2016 Pallas Estate Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: Mild in structure and approach, this is a straightforward offering of the variety, herbal and earthy with a full-bodied ripeness at its core. Spicy clove and leather highlight a robust finish.

title: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Juicy, broadly defined and generous in black fruit, this full-bodied wine has dustings of dried herb and cigar. It delivers approachable smoothness and lasting ripeness.

title: Meeker 2018 Evina Vineyard Verdelho (Contra Costa County)
description: Grassy, weedy aromas and tangy, underripe flavors dominate this light-bodied and refreshing wine. It shows light citrus notes and a crisp texture.

title: Simple Life 2018 Chardonnay (California)
description: Vivid, ripe melon and apple flavors carry a touch of sweetness in this medium-bodied wine. It feels soft and round on the palate and has a syrupy finish.

title: Spann Vineyards 2017 Primavera Marsanne-Viognier (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is made from 60% Marsanne and 40% Viogner. Together they form a pungent offering of melon, lemon and lightheaded complexity.

title: Whiplash 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Toasted oak aromas and slightly sweet apple juice and pear nectar flavors make this full-bodied wine a palate drencher. It's a popular style, soft and ripe.

title: William Harrison 2016 Cabernet Franc (Rutherford)
description: Reductive oak greets the nose of this wine, which features sizably chunky, chalky tannin and plenty of dried herb. Full bodied and thickly ripe, it has enduring viscosity.

title: Oak Grove 2018 Family Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is a light, lean wine that emphasizes simple refreshment and will be easy to sip. Delicate green-apple aromas and a touch of butter in the flavor give it just enough substance to savor.

title: Alara 2018 Viognier (San Benito County)
description: This is an extremely ripe version of Viognier, starting with powerful aromas of mango sorbet, candied honeysuckle and poached pear. The palate is also fruit-heavy with apple, pear, mango and more tropical tones.

title: Director's Cut 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Made from a majority of the variety with additions of Petit Verdot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this is a thick, richly concentrated wine simple in dark cherry, vanilla and oak.

title: Heritance 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in jasmine, this is a richly woven white tasting boldly of fig and kiwi that finishes in a touch of metal.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2016 Estate Reserve Jewel Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Ruby Hill consistently makes one of the top Livermore Valley Chardonnays and this wine is a great example. This plush, luxurious and concentrated wine has absolutely no hard edges and plenty of generous pear, honey and marzipan flavors. It shows little obvious oak flavors, but starts with a noticeably deep gold color, offers slightly nutty, vanillin aromas and then a mouthfilling body, and a good lingering finish.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Sanguine, peppery and meaty, this is a bold, brawny wine from a long-standing vineyard designate, showing a great complement of elegance within an overall frame of power and girth. Firm tannins grip clove, black-tea and black-currant flavors, challenging them to speak. This will do well with more time in the bottle; enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Cotiere 2015 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Few winemakers beyond the Talleys get access to this vineyard, and winemaker Kevin Law treats the historic property with delicious respect. Tightly wound aromas of lime balm and wet rock lead into hints of buttercream on the dynamic nose. The palate combines Meyer lemon with buttered brioche on the midpalate before settling back toward lime on the finish.

title: Cotiere 2016 La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Plump aromas of lemon cream, toasty oak, daffodil and singed citrus peel arise on the nose of this bottling from the south side of the Sta. Rita Hills. There is a strong chalky grip to the sip, where bright lemony flavors are fresh, zesty and make the mouth tingle into the finish.

title: Hess Collection 2015 The Lion Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is an impressive, bold Cabernet that's blended with 10% Malbec and 8% Petit Verdot, all from the producer's mountain estate. A big, expansive palate makes for a full-bodied, grippy entry that shows flavors of vanilla and dark cherry. Lifted acidity frames it all. This has years to go; best from 2025–2030.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Sultry red fruit is seasoned in cardamom and baking spice with a lovely lilt of orange peel that accentuates the underlying acidity. Thick and concentrated on entry, the wine settles into a velvety smooth and floral expression of coastal crunchy fruit.

title: Sanford 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Deep and rich aromas of berry paste, turned earth and damp wood show on the nose of this bottling from the region's most historic vineyard. Bright red-raspberry flavors decorate an otherwise very earthy palate of dried herbs, potpourri, crushed stone and mossy forest floor.

title: Saxon Brown 2015 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium to full-bodied wine finds a great marriage of spicy oak and fascinating fruit flavors. Red and black cherries meet cinnamon and cedar in the aroma, before lightly smoky, meaty flavors join with bright cherry and rhubarb on the palate.

title: Tolosa 2017 1772 Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Frederic Delivert recently took the reins at this winery, and is bringing a freshness back to the wines that better reflects the region's cool climate. This bottling is a good example, with bright and fresh aromas of sour cherry, raspberry sorbet, white pepper and juniper. The palate falls in line with tart red fruit set against pine needle, moss and rosemary flavors.

title: Ultima Tulie 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Charred blackberry, cassis, black cherry and appealing smoke aromas emerge with power from the nose of this bottling. The palate is full of savory, meaty charcoal flavors, showing roasted black cherry along with a rich creamy mouthfeel.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 San Andreas Fault Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Strawberry puree, raspberry, mint and sage adorn up-front acidity in this focused, fresh and delicately framed wine named for the infamous earthquake fault. Crisp and light as cucumber, it sizzles in earthy energy.

title: Battle Family 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: From a small site where the appellation overlaps with Chalk Hill, Winemaker Patrick Sullivan has crafted an elegant expression of the variety. It displays complex layers of soy, currant, cedar and clove. Earthy and delicate in texture, it finishes with firm tannins and hints of sage and forest.

title: Hess Collection 2016 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With 10% Malbec in the blend, this bold red is brawny and powerful in concentrated flavors of toasted oak, clove, currant and black cherry. It benefits from bright acidity on the palate that prolongs the fruit flavors well into a lingering finish.

title: Longoria 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Block N Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's an intriguing mix of opulence and earthy funk to the nose of this bottling, which offers aromas of forest floor and dark-red fruit on the nose. The palate's richer berry fruits are layered across flavors of turned loam and shiitake mushroom.

title: Maiden Stoen 2017 Lafond Vineyard Riesling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright and zesty aromas of lemon blossom, Key lime zest, crushed chalk and the slightest hint of petrol show on the nose of this lively and tense bottling. The palate's chalky grip presents rounded flavors of Pink Lady apple and Asian pear, which cling to a persistent citrus energy.

title: Morgan 2017 G 17 Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This extremely bright Syrah shows the influence of newish winemaker Samuel Smith, who brings a crystallized focus to the variety, starting with aromas of black raspberry, boysenberry, asphalt and rosemary blossom. The palate is very floral, with candied lavender, lilacs and violets, and the red fruit is snappy and fresh. White pepper adds spice.

title: Ojai 2016 Rich Vineyard Barbera (Ventura County)
description: Ojai's Adam Tolmach is leading the charge for a return to grape-growing here, and this bottling is an epic show of potential. Freshly smashed boysenberry and black raspberry meet with white pepper on the fresh nose. The palate is tightly wound with boysenberry, wild thyme and fennel-pollen flavors.

title: Rombauer 2017 Home Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Round and rich, this wine has integrated, hearty helpings of oak and bold flavorings of baked pear, vanilla and nutmeg. A thread of tropical pineapple figures into the creamy mouthfeel as underlying acidity keeps the palate vibrant.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Soft white peach, tangy grapefruit peel and a hint of buttercream show on the classic and well-balanced nose of this reserve bottling. An exuberant acidity shines at the tip of the sip, then leads into lemon spray and yellow-grapefruit flavors that round out toward nectarine and ripe pear on the finish.

title: Sextant 2016 Kamal Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (El Pomar District)
description: Aromas of espresso, graphite, smoked wood, black currant and violet show on the nose of this bottling. The palate booms with violet and boysenberry flavors that settle into wood spice and crushed slate, all wrapped in tense tannins.

title: Giornata 2016 Luna Matta Vineyard Nebbiolo (Paso Robles)
description: Freshly smashed cherry and strawberry aromas meet with damp mint, tea and a hint of sesame on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The tannins are still firm on the palate, upholding the exotic spice and strawberry flavors while the acid penetrates deep into the finish. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Inman Family 2016 Sexton Road Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an edgy, complex and concentrated wine from a revered site in the heart of the Sebastopol Hills near Freestone. Racy and floral, it brims in stemmy earth, black tea, clove and leather, with a lingering note of ash and crushed violet. It has balance and subtle fruitiness.

title: Jordan 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine represents the first time the winery has aged its red in entirely French oak, switching slowly over from American. Notions of clove and vanilla accent sanguine red fruit and savory elements.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2017 Been Away Too Long Denner Vineyard Mourvèdre (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Mourvèdre specialist Ryan Pease explores the floral, delicate side of the tricky grape in this bottling, offering aromas of violet, lilac, boysenberry, peppercorn and cola on the nose. That cola element meets with sarsaparilla and dark plum on the palate, which is still quite young.
designation: Been Away Too Long Denner Vineyard

title: Testarossa 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Black raspberry, crushed slate and a light touch of mace make for a focused and deep nose on this bottling from vines planted in 1971. Crisp boysenberry fruit is fresh and lively on the palate, where the site's flinty minerality also comes through.

title: Kitá 2018 Camp 4 Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Tight and fresh aromas of Key lime and grass make for a subtle entry to this zesty bottling. There is great tension on the very stony sip, where rainy cement, lime skin and white-fruit flavors make for a satisfyingly complete package.

title: Beringer 2016 Lampyridae Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Earthy in saddle and tobacco, this wine is thickly concentrated and richly full bodied. From the exotic mountain appellation, it shares flavors of clove, black pepper and black currant in a sea of sage and blackberry, the fruitiness balanced in spice and dried herb.

title: Testarossa 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Pomegranate, smoked wood, sarsaparilla and tarragon aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is laced with higher toned fruit flavors of red cherry that are cut by dried herbs and cracked pepper spice.

title: Cedarville 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)
description: This wine shows a beautiful blend of oak spices with pure Cabernet fruit flavors for a minty, cinnamony, spiced cherry effect that's delicious. It's medium to full bodied, has an elegant, lightly tannic mouthfeel and lingering finish.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This wine offers sultry spice and brown sugar notes. Structured tannins wrap around integrated acidity, tangy red fruit, dark chocolate and coffee. Blended with 21% Petite Sirah and 2% Carignan, it has a lasting richness to the finish.

title: Earthquake 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: Wow, this inky-colored and full-bodied wine complements huge, ripe fruit flavors with generous oak spices. It's delicious, and well balanced on a big scale as firm tannins and good acidity nicely support all the fruit and oak.

title: Schramsberg 2016 Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Complexity and layering make this wine especially interesting as it goes from aromas of apple, butter and vanilla to deeper toast and baked apple on the palate. It's medium in body, has tantalizing acidity and a lingering finish. Best through 2026.
designation: Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Blanc de Blancs

title: Sangiacomo 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This combines grapes from Roberts Road, Amaral and Fedrick vineyards, the whole brought together by winemaker James MacPhail. Earthy forest, clove and black tea meet a fleshy, full-bodied midpalate of juicy blood orange, strawberry and mushroom that delight through a long finish.

title: Niner 2017 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Brisk aromas of Asian pear, Meyer lemon pith and Key lime make for a zesty entry to the nose of this bottling from the winery's Jespersen Ranch property. There is a steely tension to the palate, where a stiff structure frames flavors of pear and pineapple that are broad but not too ripe.

title: Niner 2018 Pinot Noir Rosé (Edna Valley)
description: Clean lines of strawberry, watermelon and rose race across the nose of this bottling. There is a chalky texture on the palate, where bubblegum and strawberry flavors are judiciously balanced.

title: Bee Hunter 2013 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: This full-bodied and well-balanced wine shows the classic cherry, black-cherry and tea notes of Pinot on a trim and lightly tannic texture. Made from a noted vineyard near Anderson Valley, the wine has benefited from extra time in the bottle.

title: Beringer 2016 Marston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This wine shines in bright red fruit, dusty herb and sage. Grippy and full bodied, it evolves to reveal layers of sweet tobacco and cinnamon founded along a sizable structure of tannin and oak. Enjoy best from 2026–2031.

title: Gehricke 2016 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Blended with 5% Petite Sirah, this is a soft, supple and fruit-forward wine, brilliant in plum and blackberry. Its balanced richness allows room for the power and grip to flow beneath complex characteristics of white pepper and lavender that complement dark chocolate and cinnamon on the finish.

title: Guarachi Family 2017 Sun Chase Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a big, full-bodied and fleshy white wine from the Petaluma Gap mountain vineyard, with an intense imprint of vanilla and nutmeg-laced oak. Stone fruit and pineapple are prominently on display, richly dappled in secondary notes of Gravenstein apple and fig.

title: Louis M. Martini 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a thick, concentrated and strongly tannic red wine from the famous site, sizzling in spicy black pepper and clove. Intense and full bodied, it has flavors of black currant, leather and cocoa powder dusted in oak. Hold it back and enjoy from 2026–2031.

title: Josh Cellars 2017 Legacy Red (California)
description: Very fruity and jammy in aroma and flavor, this medium-bodied wine is on the sweet side, showing grapy, berry-like flavors and a rather soft smooth texture.

title: Ravel & Stitch 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Very ripe aromas of blackberry jam and sweet cedar show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is candied with black-cherry juice and maple-syrup flavors.

title: Skyside 2017 Red (North Coast)
description: Dry, dark and full bodied, this big red wine supports blackberry and black-cherry flavors on a firm structure of moderate tannins. The grippy mouthfeel needs a juicy protein dish to pair with.

title: St. Francis 2018 Dry Stack Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)
description: Freshly cut grass, pea shoots and gooseberry etch themselves along a thick, concentrated palate of weight and richness in this vineyard-designated white.

title: Testarossa 2016 Cuvée Los Gatos Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Extracted aromas of black plum, dried rose petal, violet and rocky earth show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is thick, with black-plum pudding, baking spice and cracked pepper flavors.

title: Three Pears 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This wine is light, fruity and soft in texture, offering honeydew melon aromas and golden apple flavors. It's mild in terms of acidity and short on the finish.

title: Mirassou Sun 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Slightly sweet aromas of apple flesh, peach and pineapple dominate the nose of this bottling. The flavors are also quite ripe, with more pineapple and tropical elements arising.

title: Frey NV Organic Red (California)
description: Easygoing and nicely fruity, this medium-bodied wine will be great for casual occasions and people with varied tastes. It uses organic grapes and no added sulfites. The aroma exudes raspberry and strawberry while the flavors are cherry-like and verge on sweet.

title: Benessere 2018 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy in pea shoots and freshly cut grass, this is a thick, viscous and lemony white wine, restrained in ripeness and a lasting flavor of peach.

title: Bianchi 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Big and jammy fruit aromas of blackberry jelly and licorice are quite extracted on the nose of this bottling. That richness carries to the palate, where sweet-leaning flavors of black cherry syrup, gingerbread cookies and black licorice dominate.

title: Duckhorn 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 15% Sémillon, this is a large-production white that is earthy and sharply high-toned in grapefruit, guava and flint. Plenty of acidity boosts the midpalate of concentration and richness, finding balance in the end.

title: Imagery 2016 Pallas Estate Grown Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: This combines 43% Malbec with 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot. Smoky vanilla dominates on the nose before powerfully dense layers of black cherry, currant and dried herb figure in, finishing densely in tannin.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
