description: Extremely extracted aromas of black plum, milk chocolate and fudge are very rich on on the nose of this bottling. The palate is dense with black plums, roasted berries and strong licorice spice.

title: Oakstone 2017 Obscurity Cellars Field Blend Red (Amador County)
description: Very ripe, jammy fruit flavors and full body make this blend of Zinfandel and Carignane big but friendly. It offers blackberry and sweet plum, and a mild texture with just a touch of tannin.

title: V. Sattui 2017 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay (Yountville)
description: Oaky vanilla, crème brûlée and baked fig flavors make for a rich, unctuous expression of the grape in this vineyard-designate from a warm vintage. The wine is intensely flavored and fleshy on the palate.

title: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Easy to sip and rather light in body, this wine tastes fruity, pleasant and straightforward. It offers a soft texture and a touch of jam on the finish.

title: 3rd Generation 2011 Red (Amador County)
description: This is a good-quality medium- to full-bodied wine without a lot of personality, but it has a decent amount of fruit flavor and a smooth soft texture.

title: Bel Vino 2016 Long Valley Red (California)
description: Middle-of-the-road fruit flavors and a soft texture make this wine easy to sip. It has mild acidity, a light touch of tannin and reserved berry flavors.

title: Fighting Chance 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dried mulberry, baked cherries and strong nutmeg show on the nose of this thicker wine. The palate is noticeably sweet, with loads of gingerbread and extracted fruit flavors that slide from sugary to sour by the finish.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 1850° Red (Lodi)
description: An overabundance of spicy floral cedar aromas and flavors from oak make this full-bodied wine showy and rather one-dimensional. It is full bodied and lightly tannic.

title: Lost Blues 2014 High Horse Grenache (Central Coast)
description: Rich, voluptuous and luxurious on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of Luxardo cherry and star anise. The palate is bound together with ripe flavors of kirsch, gingerbread and roasted pork in a caramelized marinade.

title: Lucienne 2016 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Fresh sagebrush and tarragon create an herbal sensation on the nose of this bottling, with smoke, mulberry and tea leaves rounding out the experience. The palate is a combination of fruit and earth, with thyme, rosemary, bay leaf and tarragon coating the core flavors of cranberry, raspberry and orange peel. It's all wrapped in oaky warmth.

title: Lucienne 2016 Lone Oak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A stunner on the nose, this lavish and supple wine shows complex aromas of red and purple flowers, mulberry, fig and gingerbread. Firm tannins and just enough acidity frame the palate, which is loaded with full flavors of red plum, coffee, clove and cola.

title: Piro 2016 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Elegantly subtle yet extremely expressive on the nose, this single-vineyard bottling by Marc Piro shows Luxardo cherry, rhubarb and baking-spice aromas. There is strong spice to the sip, with mace, nutmeg, vanilla and cinnamon, as well as red-plum and smoked cherry flavors.

title: Sanguis 2015 Misfit Syrah (Central Coast)
description: This is a very savory Syrah, enhanced by bits of Grenache, Cabernet Franc, Petite Sirah and Viognier. Aromas of charred pork rind, smashed black raspberry and rosemary blossom leda into a palate that is tart with black plum and elderberry yet full of roasted lamb and cracked pepper flavors.

title: Rochioli 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from three sections of the famous vineyard, the majority from a share of River Block and the Mid 40, this white is remarkably good, complex and memorable. Matchstick notes give way to barrel oak, vanilla and spicy caramel apple, the palate textured and layered in additional elements of lemon peel, Key lime and pear. Full bodied, it holds its weight and breadth in balance, producing enduring beauty.

title: Stewart 2016 Nomad Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tart, tangy and tense red from the legendary vineyard, soft and velvety lush on the midpalate. Caramelized oak cradles baked cherry and cranberry, the layers complex and lengthy with seasonings of clove and nutmeg. Enjoy 2021–2030.

title: Stewart 2016 Nomad Beckstoffer Las Piedras Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Velvety thick and layered in coconut and black licorice, this wine expands on the palate in complex, full-bodied and fleshy waves, remaining fresh and herbal in the glass. Blackberry fruit takes on a baked quality that's sumptuous and grand. Enjoy 2021–2030.

title: Carlisle 2016 The Derivative White (Sonoma County)
description: A perennial favorite at a screaming good price, this combines 40% Muscadelle, 38% Colombard, 21% Sémillon and 1% Palomino from various sites across the county. The Sémillon is newly from Rossi Ranch. Floral and candied in honey and lemon peel, it's exotic, grippy and focused in a tension of acidity.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Angel Camp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This beautifully aromatic wine starts with an intricately spiced floral bouquet, followed by a gorgeous assemblage of strawberry, black cherry and black currant flavors that seem to melt in the mouth. It has a warm, mouthfilling texture, indulgent oak spiciness and gentle, well-integrated tannins and acidity.

title: Holdredge 2016 The True Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a coastal site in Annapolis, this wine imparts all that is implied about such a place—a lengthy and complex expression of myriad flavors and textures. Orange peel, mint tea, strawberry and pomegranate all puncture the wine's tangy acidity and powerful intensity.

title: Hubba 2016 The Eskimo Syrah (Central Coast)
description: From the very coastal Bassetti Vineyard, this cool-climate Syrah starts with aromas of black plum, violet, cola and espresso extract. Tannic structure and high acid show themselves immediately on the sip, which leads into flavors of cassis, smoked meats, cracked pepper and light-purple flowers. There is great tension between freshness and savoriness. Drink now through 2031.

title: Piro 2016 Runway Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Tangy and tart red-fruit aromas of cherry and pomegranate are lifted by wild mint, cinnamon and mulling spices on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from a newer vineyard near the historic Bien Nacido. The sip is taut and freshed with smashed berry and lively red-spice flavors, finishing with a touch of vanilla paste.

title: Sanguis 2015 See Through White (Central Coast)
description: A fascinatingly cofermented white wine, this blend of Chardonnay, Roussanne and Viognier by Matthias Pippig shows exuberant aromas of white peach essence, daffodil, lemon verbena and spring herbs on the nose. The palate is both oily and racy, with dried-peach and lemon-juice flavors that lead into a butterscotch touch on the finish.

title: Talley 2016 Rincon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Winemaker Eric Johnson really provides a wide range of Pinot Noir styles in this vintage, which makes for a complete portfolio. This bottling shows the fresh side of the grape, starting with snappy pomegranate and star anise on the nose. The palate offers tongue-tingling flavors of raspberry and more pomegranate, with subtle spice in the background.

title: Thomas Fogarty 2016 Langley Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Crisp but also warm aromas of roasted apple, lemon peel and flint arise on the nose of this bottling of the Clone 4 Chardonnay. There is compelling grip to the sip immediately, revealing bright Meyer lemon, tangerine flesh, almond and oak flavors. Both full bodied and racy, sure to please a wide swath of Chardonnay lovers.

title: Tolosa 2017 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There is a rugged core of cranberry, pomegranate and rhubarb on the nose of this bottling from an epic vineyard, along with aromas of applewood smoke, dried fennel and pepper spice. Fresh strawberry and raspberry flavors pop on the sip, with sandalwood and tea leaf in the background.

title: FEL 2016 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This bold wine is complex and concentrated without being overly big in body. It shows gorgeous black-cherry and wood-smoke aromas, deep and delicious cherry, spice and clove flavors, and fine balance. There's enough acidity and tannin to give it grip without holding back the fruit nuances.

title: Daou 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Exotic and elegant aromas of black plum, black-currant jellies and licorice arise on the darkly spiced nose of this bottling by the Daou brothers. The palate combines cassis and blackberry paste with tarragon, soft sage and mint flavors, making for a dynamic, lush and lovely sip.

title: Guarachi Family 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This gorgeous wine is earthy in minty sage and wild strawberry, the secondary flavors a twist of black tea and cherry compote. Thick with an acid backbone, it finds balance within its substantial power, leading to a juicy lengthy finish of Asian spice.

title: Liquid Farm 2016 Spear Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rounded and fresh aromas of red cherry show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression as do hints of nutmeg and clove. Red-currant and strawberry flavors arise on the bright, zesty palate, which is sprinkled with vanilla and dried sage to make a wine that's both hedonistic and intellectual.

title: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: Wine doesn't get much deeper in color or more concentrated in fruit flavor than this. The black color goes to smoky red on the rim, while the aroma is rife with blackberry, licorice, sweet oak and black pepper. The palate boasts plump blackberry, soft blueberry and dark chocolate flavors. Fans of bold, full-bodied and saturated reds are going to love this. Best through 2030.

title: Lombardi 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This small-production white made by Cabell Coursey comes from Orsi Vineyards grapes and is barrel fermented in French oak, 40% of it new. It impresses in its grasp of green olive, pear and salty brine, a lilt of lemon verbena in the background. The oak is unabashed but doesn't get in the way of the overall complexity and appeal.

title: Zotovich 2017 Z Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean layers of blackberry tartine, dried rose petals, blistered black plum and slate show on the nose of this top-level bottling by the Zotovich family. It's full flavored on the palate, with grilled black plum, alpine strawberry and violet that decorate the strong soil aspects in the backdrop. It's full of firm structure and bright acidity.

title: Auteur Wines 2017 Labyrinth Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a brawny, tannic and youthful wine ready to rest in the cellar, made entirely from Pommard clone vines. Peppery black fruit accents a full-bodied density that offers robust structure and complexity, the acidity supportive and in tune. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Baldassari Family Wines 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This impressive red is quiet and floral on the nose, exuding subtle aromas of rose petal and earth. Spicy, savory and full of white pepper, it offers lifted red fruit and integrated acidity, the tannins are firm and well mannered.

title: Clos de la Tech 2014 Domaine du Docteur Rodgers Pinot Noir (San Francisco Bay)
description: These wines are always incredibly unique and perfect conversation pieces for Pinot Noir lovers. This bottling begins with aromas of muddled mulberry, red plum, clay and mint chocolate chip. The palate's chalky texture delivers flavors of dark tarragon, dried cherry and more mulberry, with waves of loamy earth.

title: Clos de la Tech 2014 Domaine Lois Louise Cote Sud Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: As these mountaintop vines mature, the fruit gains more prominent character, yet the telltale structure remains. Aromas of dark tarragon and damp soil lead into the hearty black-cherry compote core of the nose. The palate is framed by polished yet firm tannins, carrying flavors of boysenberry, wild mint and black plum.

title: Evidence 2016 Of The Matter Bruadair Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: From a high-elevation site, this impressively structured wine is cofermented with 8% Malbec and explodes in tones of black pepper, nutmeg and sweet tobacco. It is smooth and tingling in acidity, yet also shows length and breadth. Enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Furthermore 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Bing cherry aromas are made complex by soil, crushed gravel and a minty streak on the nose of this bottling. There is a great snap to the fruit of the palate and then it slides into earthy flavors of pine needle and bay leaf, making for a very layered and intriguing experience.

title: Jarvis 2015 Will Jarvis' Science Project Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of Cabernet Franc with 5% Merlot is an impressive wine, aromatic in violet and wild game. A juicy midpalate of rich red fruit remains in balance against a fine tannic structure and integrated French oak, with touches of dried herb, graphite and pencil shavings coming to the fore.

title: Rowen 2014 2040 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This new wine is from the highest-elevation point on Cooley Ranch, a wild site north of Rockpile that reaches 2,040 feet. Blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec, it shows rocky minerality and deft tannic structure, with toasty oak and a lushness of vanilla, tobacco and dark plum.

title: Liquid Farm 2016 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lovely aromas of rose petals, hibiscus, dewy herbs and a gamy hint of roasted squab show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is great intensity to the sip, where black raspberry sizzles then becomes rounded by star anise and baking-spice flavors. The tannic tension is compelling.

title: Anaba 2016 Bismark Vineyard Syrah (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From a high-elevation site in the Mayacamas Mountains, this bold full-bodied red is defined in black and white pepper, garrigue and blueberry, with a subtle underlying hint of vanilla. Seamless, strong and sensual, it is lush on the palate with an enviable and lasting bite of grip and structure.

title: Clos de la Tech 2014 Domaine Valeta Sunny Slope Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Sharp aromas of stewed black plum, cocoa dust, wild mint and baked soil show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard 2,350 feet above the ocean. The tannins are firm and tight, carrying the black-cherry, earth and mint-chocolate flavors into the finish. Drink 2022–2039.

title: Villa Creek 2017 Willow Creek Cuvée Red (Paso Robles)
description: Well-integrated aromas of black plum, mushroom, forest floor and lilac make for a stunning nose on this blend of 70% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre from Cris Cherry. The flavors are also cohesive and unique, tossing roasted strawberry with savory touches of pepper dust and soy sauce.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Silky smooth and sculptured in crisp apple, pear and integrated oak, this showcases the famous site in all its complex glory, with accents of baking spice and brine. Medium bodied, it displays richness within a context of balance and grace.

title: Patz & Hall 2013 Hyde Vineyard Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Made entirely from the famous site's famous Chardonnay grapes, this is a lovely, high-toned and classically styled sparkling wine made by James Hall. Pear galette, crushed rock, honeysuckle and lemon peel combine effortlessly across the nose and palate to offer a seamless, effusive wine of great appeal.

title: Hall 2015 Kathryn Hall Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy, thick and densely packed in tannin, baked plum and nutmeg, this is an enormously fleshy, full-bodied wine with pronounced oak and heat. Forest floor, clove and tobacco figure into the flavor profile in savory, complex ways, accenting the bold power. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy best 2020–2025.

title: Baca 2017 I Spy Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: This big, bold wine offers a tremendously aromatic nose of white pepper and clove before unleashing a complex mouthful of structured linearity and lasting red fruit. Sage, dried herb and earthy forest accent the rich roundness of the midpalate as a lengthy finish builds.

title: Stateland 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Poached pear, strong lily and tangerine peel aromas show on the nose of this bottling, a new project for longtime winemaker Adam LaZarre. The palate offers fat flavors of pineapple, mango and cooked apple, yet with a lemony acidity that cuts through.

title: Villa San Juliette 2016 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: A rusty shade of red in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of dried cherry, vanilla bean, star anise and sandalwood on the complex nose. The palate is showing signs of oxidation, so enjoy the flavors of strawberry, dried sage and rusty earth soon.

title: Bridlewood 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Baked red-cherry-pie aromas meet with a touch of soil and wet rocks on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent grip to the palate, where blackberry and oak flavors lead into a palate of vanilla pastry.

title: Fess Parker 2018 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: Lemon and lime peels, crisp Asian pear and a sweet hint of orange blossom show on the nose of this slightly sweet bottling. The palate is sweet but immensely fresh and vibrant, with freshly cut tangerine, Pink Lady apple and ripe pear flavors.

title: Galante 2014 Blackjack Pasture Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)
description: There's a wild, rustic and hardscrabble quality to this bottling, like many from this hot, hilly region, starting with aromas of blackberries, tar and forest floor. The palate is reductive with hints of tar and turned earth, but there are also more accessible flavors of blackberry paste and sour cherry. Sticky tannins frame the sip.

title: Nola Grace 2018 Dry Rosé (California)
description: Refreshing and light bodied, this charming wine was made from Sangiovese, Pinot Noir and Zinfandel grapes. It offers delicate floral and fruity aromas, crisp raspberry and watermelon flavors and a crisp texture.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Alder Springs Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: The Alder Springs vineyard is known for making wines that are unyielding when young, so this full-bodied Chardonnay is not showing its stuff yet. A muted, slightly spicy and slightly earthy flavor is supported by a big mouthfilling texture. With time in the glass, it shows more baking spices and butter but little fruit focus. Odds are good that it will improve through at least 2024.

title: Portola Vineyards 2014 Los Trancos Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This wine is very earthy on the nose with aromas of crushed river stones, wet gravel and rust that also show hints of beet juice and red currant. The palate carries forth, with wet earth and rust flavors dominating the red-currant and fruit-punch tones.

title: Skinner 2017 Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: Packing in plenty of ripe fruit, this medium- to full-bodied wine also offers accents of subtle oak spices for a measure of complexity and interest. Black-plum and raisin flavors coat the palate for a soft and soothing effect.

title: Sosie 2016 Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Broad shouldered and substantial on the palate, this small production is fruity in style, a mix of ripe cherry and strawberry, with a richness of vanilla. The acidity is balanced and lively.

title: Stateland 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Simple but pleasant aromas of roasted red cherry, wood and slate show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is well structured and offers bright and ripe raspberry with rose petal, peppery spice and a hint of mace.

title: Wild Thing 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is very fruity, mild-mannered and easy to enjoy. It's full bodied but not too big, and packed with plump strawberry and blackberry flavors that seem almost sweet on the finish.

title: Artevino 2016 Largo Ridge Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Very flavorful and spicy, this full-bodied wine smells like poached plums and brown sugar, tastes broad and oaky and feels plush, almost soft, on the palate.

title: Balderdash 2016 Invincible Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Candied red-currant aromas are given a strongly minty touch on the nose of this bottling. The minty character works better on the palate, where it combines with strawberry and red plum, leading into a pine-needle finish.

title: Bellante 2018 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Cantaloupe, baked orange, white peach and a hint of smoke show on the tropical-leaning nose of this single-vineyard bottling. Baked lemon, plumeria, guava and smoke combine for the palate.

title: Cline 2018 Estate Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)
description: High-toned tangerine and grapefruit are refreshingly thirst-quenching in acidity in this bright, approachable white wine. A meaty midpalate gives it substance without oak aging or additional ripeness.

title: Clos du Val 2018 State Lane Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This estate white is fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel and shows a bright crisp personality as a result. Lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors are boldly formed, building to a vanilla richness on the finish.

title: Consensio 2017 Allegro White Hawk Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rich aromas of boysenberry, black plum, wet clay and damp forest floor show on the nose of this bottling, made at a facility in Camarillo. Tangy black-plum and pine-needle flavors meet with dark earth and cocoa on the palate.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV 9 Estate Petit Verdot (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Thick and robust in tannin, this is blended with 9% Cabernet Sauvignon. Dark in color, it shows a wealth of clove, cedar and dried herb on the palate, with a plush richness of blackberry and licorice.

title: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Carneros)
description: Soft, velvety and lush, this full-bodied wine offers high-toned red fruit, dusty spice and robust oak. Sourced from both the Hudson and Hyde vineyards, it has vibrancy through the finish.

title: Stewart 2016 Tartan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 43% Merlot, 29% Malbec, 17% Cabernet Sauvignon and 11% Petit Verdot from several vineyards, including Stagecoach and Brokenrock on Atlas Peak. It's a richly concentrated, rocky wine with bold flavors of dried cherry and plum, black pepper and leather, the grip of tannin is no joke.

title: Toccata 2015 Riserva Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dark-red cherry, dried tarragon and crushed brick aromas show on the nose of this blend of 53% Cabernet Sauvignon, 26% Sangiovese, 7% Merlot, 7% Freisa and 7% Petit Verdot from two vineyards. The palate offers a clean expression of roasted berry, loam and mocha.

title: Ironstone 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: Intense and focused fruit flavors seem to light up this full-bodied, densely packed wine. It also shows generous and well-integrated oak shadings of cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla that sit on mouthcoating berry flavors and are framed by fine-grained tannins.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site known as famously for Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this red is big in flavor and power, with a robust body of baked cherry, rhubarb compote and clove. Rounded oak supports without distraction as jolts of acidity add tension and vibrancy.

title: Theopolis 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This full-bodied wine adds smoky oaky peppery flavors to the grape variety's natural black-fruit and tannin combo for a rowdy, beefy personality that rivals a savory Syrah. The tannins feel tight, however, and the wine needs time to mellow. Best after 2024.

title: Trefethen 2016 Dragon's Tooth Red (Napa Valley)
description: The Oak Knoll producer's blend of 47% Malbec, 27% Petit Verdot, 23% Cabernet Sauvignon and 3% Merlot is elegant and structured. Red currant, cassis and cedar give personality to firm tannins—the grapes grown on the winery's rockiest blocks.

title: Blue Rock 2016 Best Barrels Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Lush and expansive on the palate, this is a lovely version of the variety, full bodied yet classic in style. Coffee, plum and baking spice combine for a complex and layered experience of seamless acidity and tension on the palate.

title: Brassfield 2016 Grenache (High Valley)
description: This wine offers abundant plum, berry and new-oak aromas. Mouthfilling fruit flavors develop on the palate, with a smooth texture to carry them along. It is rich, lightly tannic, full bodied and satisfying.

title: Byron Blatty 2016 Agenda Syrah (Los Angeles County)
description: This newer winery is one of the most promising Los Angeles County wine projects. This bottling, which includes 15% Tannat, shows cassis, black cherry and crushed purple flowers on the nose, while the palate is loaded with Morello cherry, rounded brown sugar and maple and a pleasantly chalky tannic structure.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Rossi Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aged in neutral French oak, this is a sanguine, smoky and spicy red, thickly concentrated in black olive, black currant, leather and lavender. It is made in a robust full-bodied style that nonetheless is equipped with complementary freshness and lift on the finish.

title: Lexington 2014 Apex Gist Ranch Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This bottling, which includes 1% Cabernet Franc, offers bright and snappy aromas of red currant and black plum along with a bit of mocha cream. There is bright acidity and strong crushed rock minerality on the palate, which surrounds tart red fruit.

title: Sbragia 2016 Italo's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a thick, rich red blended with 5% Petite Sirah that delivers strong flavors of blackberry cobbler, graham cracker and vanilla. Boldly layered and lush on the palate, it has complex touches of structure and integrated oak.

title: Scratch 2015 Janaca Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Very strong, fruit-forward aromas of black cherry, blackberry jam, baking spice and toasty oak show on the nose of this bottling by Sabrine Rodems from a vineyard near Mount Madonna. The palate combines rich fruit, wood spice and a butterscotch finish with chalky tannins and strong acidity, a combination that will please many palates.

title: Shooting Star 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: Never mind the screw cap, this velvet-textured wine is generous, fruity and deep without overdoing the oak. Its rich and saturated blackberry, black-cherry and fig flavors are warm and mouthfilling while soft tannins bolster the texture and give it a slight sense of restraint on the palate and finish.

title: The Withers Winery 2016 Mr. Burgess Syrah (El Dorado)
description: Concentrated and tightly wrapped, this wine has tempting flavors and good balance for aging. Focused black-cherry and cranberry aromas are followed by tangy but rich cherry and berry flavors wrapped in firm tannins and lifted by good acidity. Best after 2021.

title: Timbre 2015 Opening Act Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Clean aromas of Gravenstein apple, dried lime peel and a kiss of oak show on the nose of this blend of the Bien Nacido and Sierra Madre vineyards. There is a great tension to the sip, where strong citrus-peel and green-apple flavors make for a zingy experience.

title: Hahn 2017 SLH Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tart and candied berry aromas meet with tangy pomegranate and hibiscus on the nose. The palate combines more cranberry and pomegranate flavors with dried herbs, all framed by energetic acidity and firm tannins.

title: Riboli 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a site in Rutherford and blended with 6% Petit Verdot, this is a woody, herbal red wine, moderate in structure and robustly ripe in style. Cedar, pencil, char and dried herb contrast against a richness of milk chocolate as firm tannins take hold and grip the long finish.

title: Brassfield 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (High Valley)
description: Full bodied and firmly tannic, this powerful estate-grown wine wraps flavors of ripe black cherry and blackberry in a velvety, mouthcoating texture. The fruit flavors are concentrated and lingering, while significant and tasty oak accents are woven throughout.

title: Cordant 2016 Escolle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rich and extracted aromas of licorice and strawberry reduction are leveled by juniper and other forest spices on the nose of this bottling. The palate is full of black-cherry and boysenberry flavors, with tangy touches of balsamic and pine needle.

title: Chandon NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: Dry and refreshing, this light-bodied and crisp wine shows bright citrus and crisp apple flavors on a lively texture of bubbles and good acidity.

title: Easton 2018 Zinster Lot 1852 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Lots of fresh berries and a dash of perceived sweetness keep this wine fruity, soft and easy to drink. Made with whole cluster fermentation, it seems low in acidity and tannins and high in jammy syrupy fruit flavors.

title: Etude 2017 Grace Benoist Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From estate-grown fruit, planted to a variety of clones, this is thick, savory wine that's rich and round on the palate in layers of blackberry and cherry. Toasted oak wraps around firm, persistent tannins that underscore its ultimate power and full-bodied approach.

title: Matchbook 2017 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This wine has a unique cassis and blueberry aroma, plenty of concentrated cherry and berry flavors and an almost syrupy finish since it's so saturated with ripe fruit.

title: Rombauer 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Brawny in dark plum, chocolate and soft layers of richness, this is blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot and aged in French oak, a minority of it new. It finishes quietly in woody tannin.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Landmark Collection Barbera (Livermore Valley)
description: Heavily oaked and full bodied, this wine is covered in woody cedary baking-spice aromas followed by tart blackberry and raspberry flavors and a firm streak of acidity.

title: Saddleback Cellars 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Oakville)
description: Steely and intensely high toned, this white is floral in jasmine and a hint of jalapeño. The core of its midpalate is rich in stone fruit.

title: Stephen Vincent 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Bold fruit flavors vie with attention-getting oak notes like vanilla and waffle in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It is packed with bright cherry and raspberry flavors and feels slightly sweet on the finish.

title: Boeger 2017 Pinot Grande Pinot Noir (El Dorado)
description: A firm texture and lean fruit flavors make this medium-bodied wine taste tight and restrained. Cranberry and dried cherry notes rest on tangy acidity and moderate tannins. It's a good, appetizing wine to pair with extra-rich proteins.

title: Chandon NV Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: A vivid pink color and ample fruit aromas are followed by fairly ripe, full cherry and strawberry flavors that hint at sweetness. The texture is soft and generously bubbly.

title: E18hteen 2018 Catie's Corner Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Wet stone, white flowers, lime and high-toned acidity mark this lightweight well-integrated wine from the famous site in the heart of the appellation. Simple in its approach, it finishes crisp and clean.

title: Frey 2016 Organic Carignane (Mendocino)
description: This medium-bodied wine is packed with ripe cherry and dried plum flavors, and balanced on zingy acidity and moderate tannins. Despite the purple haze inside the bottle, it's a lively fruity nicely concentrated wine. No sulfites were added.

title: Girasole 2018 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Fresh floral aromas start this wine off on a light note but it gains weight via full body and moderate apple and white-peach flavors. Made from organic grapes, the wine is appealing and easy to sip.

title: Holly's Hill 2018 Estate Roussanne (El Dorado)
description: Full body and a firm texture accompany very subtle flavors that hint at vanilla and mineral. The wine is enjoyable for its good, hefty mouthfeel, and may need time for more complexity to build.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Signature Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a tarry aspect to the nose of this bottling, which also offers aromas of smashed slate, dark berry and singed herbs. The palate is overloaded with tobacco leaf and cigar wrapper flavors, which dominate the dried cherry fruit.

title: Peirano 2016 Heritage Collection Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows the black olive and herb character of the varietal along with ripe black-cherry flavors. A smooth texture and modest tannins carry along the mouthfeel.

title: Tamber Bey 2017 Deux Chevaux Vineyard Dijon Chardonnay (Yountville)
description: This is a hearty, floral and tropical white from the one clone that builds richness as it opens, a richness that presents as lush and creamy while maintaining underlying acidity.

title: Tank Garage 2018 Skin Flick White (Sierra Foothills)
description: A gold-orange color and potent plum and watermelon aromas lead to a brisk, dry and moderately tannic texture and tight apricot and peach-skin flavors in this light-bodied wine. Fermented with the skins like a red wine, this “orange” wine is dry but appetizing.

title: Terra Robles 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry and very smoky charred oak aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is bright acidity to the sip, where flavors of dried cherry and cedar converge.

title: Whiplash 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a smooth supple full-bodied wine, with pleasant, subdued but ripe fruit flavors and not too much oak influence.

title: Divergent Vine 2017 Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: Whiffs of barnyard and black figs in the aroma give way to vivid and earthy plum and blackberry in this medium-bodied, well-balanced wine. It has moderate tannins, a fresh texture and fruity finish.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 The Brick Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Heavy char and smoke in the aromas and flavors almost take over this full-bodied wine in spite of some pretty concentrated blackberry and black-plum notes underneath. It's moderately tannic and feels very firm in texture.

title: Saintsbury 2017 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Thick and brooding in black fruit, black tea and forest floor, this earthy wine is full bodied, fleshy and robust in oak.

title: Sierra Starr 2017 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Amador County)
description: This tasty and medium-bodied wine is quite fruity, well balanced and showing just enough ripeness to feel rounded in the mouth. It has crisp acidity to buoy the ripe plums and berries.

title: Bellante 2018 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)
description: Gardenia, honeysuckle and lime peel aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which veers toward earth and animal flesh at times. It tightens on the palate, offering green-apple flesh and more lime flavors.

title: Midnight 2015 Titan Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry, purple flowers and toast show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers dried plum skins and more violet flavors.

title: The Mistral 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This plush medium-bodied wine smells like pear syrup and baking spices, tastes fruity and rich, and feels broad in texture. It shows just enough light acidity to keep it fresh.

title: Wilson Creek 2018 Cassidy Vineyard Moscato (Temecula Valley)
description: Powerful aromas of orange blossoms, ripe apples and pears promise sweetness on the palate of this bottling. It is indeed quite sweet and viscous on the sip, but there is an underlying acidity that pops through the clean and ripe peach flavors.

title: Clos du Val 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Tropical fruit and vanilla characterize this wine—an estate crafting that's soft and fleshy on the palate. The ripeness is in check and balanced, as a touch of richness rounds out on the finish, with a tease of marshmallow oak.

title: Napa Cellars 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy and lush on the palate, this white has a rounded richness sure to please, with lasting flavors of lemon verbena and peach.

title: Noceto 2015 Linsteadt Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This full-bodied and oak-accented wine displays vivid red- and black-cherry flavors, bright acidity and a touch of tannin for grip.

title: Oak Farm 2018 Silvaspoons Vineyard Rosé (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine made from Grenache grapes has more of a straw color than a pink one, and offers rather rich pear and peach aromas and flavors. It's soft and mouthfilling in texture.

title: Stateland 2017 Margarita Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Cherries, cedar and damp forest wood show on the nose of this bottling. It's both fruity and tangy on the sip with more cherry and wood spice, proving quite fruity and oaky.

title: Wilson Creek 2018 Chloe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Temecula Valley)
description: Light on the nose at first, this wine opens toward aromas of honey, nectarine, Asian pear and scratched grapefruit skin. The palate is quite clean but lands with a surprisingly sweet touch, offering ripe pear-syrup flavors.

title: Minus Tide 2018 Feliz Creek Vineyard Rosé of Carignan (Mendocino)
description: A very pale color and light subtle flavors give this light-bodied wine a delicate, quiet but refreshing profile. It has good acidity for balance, and feels fresh and clean on the palate.

title: Blue Victorian Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Suisun Valley)
description: This wine has extremely aromatic gooseberry and pine needle aromas along with crisp and fruity flavors that are fresh and straightforward. It's light in body and simply refreshing.

title: Cupcake NV Black Forest Red (California)
description: Plenty of berry and cherry flavors and a hint of mint make this medium-bodied wine very appealing and a bit complex. Gorgeous ripe fruit notes carry the sensation of sweetness.

title: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A pretty strong streak of toasted oak influences the flavors of this medium-bodied wine. Buttery smoky nuances overlay ripe, almost fat, apple and pear flavors on a very soft texture.

title: Layer Cake 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Smoky oaky aromas and flavors take center stage in this full-bodied, moderately tannic and fairly concentrated wine. Good but subdued blackberry and black-cherry notes come out with time.

title: Lyle Thomas 2016 Lot 707 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An unapologetic oakiness shapes the aromas and flavors of this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. Grilled bread, sweet pickles and cedar in the aroma lead to juicy cherry flavors that are held firmly in check by oak notes and a touch of astringency.

title: Aerena 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Oak-forward and wearing the wood with abandon, this white has baked tropical flavors and a lingering harshness to its tannins. The grapes originate from both Sonoma Mountain and the Russian River Valley.

title: Ramspeck 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and brimming in cedar, this is a light-bodied, lightly textured wine with 5% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in. Simple red fruit and coffee combine to offer flavor.

title: Sand Dollar 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: With an aroma like cinnamon rolls and similar, pastry-like flavors, this medium-bodied wine is tempting, but not what most people expect to drink with lunch or dinner.

title: Scaredy Cat Ranch 2015 Meritage (Ramona Valley)
description: Very tarry, reductive aromas coat the nose of this blend of 82% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Petit Verdot and 12% Malbec, which also shows some black plum. The palate offers black currant and a strong sense of Old World funk.

title: Sera Fina 2017 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)
description: An unmistakable aroma of buttered toast marks this full-bodied wine, even before the flavors bring on more toast, light char and a slight astringency in the texture. It makes for a rather severe character overall.

title: Blue Fox Cellars 2013 Seebass Vineyard Syrah (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is rustic in flavor and sturdy in texture, showing cedar and dried cherry notes framed by very firm tannins, full body and a dry mouthfeel.

title: Hamilton Creek 2017 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a harsh and somewhat bitter red, simple in approach and body, with pronounced herbal characteristics and missing fruit.

title: Prima Materia NV Arcanum No. III Red (Lake County)
description: Many of Prima Materia's offerings have gotten very good reviews, but this rough-edged wine is extremely tannic, and doesn't have enough fruit and richness to balance its drying astringency. Recommended only for people who like an intense texture and some bitterness.

title: Roederer Estate 2012 L'Ermitage Estate Bottled Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)
description: Luxurious and layered, this nicely mature wine has a broad range of complex aromas and flavors, from fig to mushroom to butter and baking spices that ride a supple texture and linger for a long finish. The very fine bead, plush texture and a creamy richness that verges on sweetness are practically irresistible. Best through 2025.

title: Desparada 2015 Death & Resurrection Sangiovese (California)
description: This is a lush and hearty take on Sangiovese, beginning with aromas of black currant, caramel, dried purple flowers, salted meats and coffee cream. The palate is tense right away, which gives structure to the liquid violet and black-cherry-laced coffee-cream flavors. The tannins are firm but polished, and acidity drives deep into the finish.

title: Sanguis 2015 Bossman Red (Central Coast)
description: Strong, intense and rich aromas of blackberry, caramel and violet make for a delicious entry on the nose of this blend of Syrah, Petite Sirah, Grenache and Viognier. Expressive flavors of black cherry and butterscotch are luxurious, yet the firm tannins and buoyant acidity click every box for an epic wine.

title: Herman Story 2016 Milk & Honey Red (Paso Robles)
description: Russell From masterfully captures the unctuous ripeness of Paso Robles while retaining enough structure to keep the resulting wine balanced. This heavy duty blend of 32% Tempranillo, 26% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Petit Verdot and 19% Syrah is thick and inky in the glass, with transcendent aromas of blueberry syrup, cappuccino and smoked meat that drill deep into the cortex. A firm structure and steady acidity present flavors of black currant and charcoal.

title: Thomas Fogarty 2016 James Thomas's Block Rapley Trail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A mere 50 cases were made of this bottling from the Martini clone, and the care given to the wine shows. Aromas of lavender, potpourri, rosemary blossoms, tea leaves and juniper lead into a palate full of similar herbal and floral elements. But the sip also offers bright red fruit, tarragon and fennel flavors, leaving the mouth and soul refreshed.
designation: James Thomas's Block Rapley Trail Vineyard

title: Epoch 2015 Ingenuity Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Rich and yet focused aromas of black cherry and cassis are leveled by wet gravel and crushed slate on the intense nose of this blend of 51% Syrah, 28% Mourvèdre, 14% Petite Sirah and 7% Grenache. The palate is very structural at first with stand-up tannins, but they open the doors to lush floral and fruit flavors, from lilac and lavender to elegant plums and berries.

title: Ojai 2016 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tart cherry, crushed red and purple flowers and hints of soil and moss make for an extremely impressive nose on this bottling by Adam Tolmach. There is great structure and heft to the palate, where dark-plum, mulberry, pine-forest and tea-leaf flavors converge into a clean taut finish.

title: Daou 2016 Eye of the Falcon Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Focused aromas of black currant jam, cocoa nib, espresso bean and German chocolate cake show on the nose of this blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Petite Verdot. Polished tannins support luxurious flavors of cocoa powder, hoisin, baking spice and black currant paste. Drink 2020–2036.

title: Herman Story 2016 Nuts & Bolts Syrah (California)
description: Lavish aromas of stewed black plum, hickory smoke, cracked pepper, liquefied violets and peppery teriyaki make for a very umami-forward nose on this bottling. The palate is lush and creamy with blackberry, fudge and cappuccino flavors, wrapped in buoyant acid and decent tannins that ensure some longevity.

title: FEL 2016 Savoy Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This concentrated and fruit-packed wine from a storied vineyard walks the line between ripeness and restraint. Flavors of black cherry and blackberry fill the palate, bolstered by a mildly firm feel. It offers plenty to appreciate now and is worth cellaring through 2024.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Devil's Gulch Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: This grand, lavish and concentrated wine is medium to full in weight, with rich, ripe fruit flavors. A spice rack full of cinnamon, clove and nutmeg fill the aroma, while flavors of mulled black cherry and spiced plum fill out the palate. Best through 2025.

title: Sextant 2016 Octant Estate Grown Red (El Pomar District)
description: Fresh and juicy aromas of boysenberry and black plum meet with a wet slate minerality on the nose of this blend of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Merlot, 9% Malbec and 8% Cabernet Franc. The palate is framed by a firm structure and delivers flavors of black plum jam, toasted oak and coffee that drive into the lingering finish.

title: Holly's Hill 2017 Patriarche Red (El Dorado)
description: This is a rich but also complex and earthy wine in the Rhône style, offering light smoke, pepper and turned earth aromas, tasty but not overripe plum and fig flavors and a smooth texture. It is full bodied, well-balanced for its size and an excellent example of the type.

title: Four Lanterns 2018 Apricity Picpoul Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Very crisp aromas of pear, apple and lime pith are framed by immense chunks of chalk on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely fresh and mineral-driven, offering flavors of crushed sea shell as well as yellow-pear flesh toward the crisp finish.

title: Thacher 2018 Rosé of Cinsault (Central Coast)
description: Bright bubblegum, wet stone and chalk aromas are crisp and lovely on the nose of this bottling of Cinsaut, which is rarely used in American rosé. It's intensely taut on the extremely crisp and light sip, where grippy lemon flavors meet with pluot and plum.

title: Testarossa 2016 Rincon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Black-plum, violet and concentrated red-currant aromas meet with a touch of roasted meat on the nose of this bottling. It's a very cohesive wine on the palate, where dark-cherry, licorice and star anise flavors decorate the meaty texture.

title: Wrath 2017 115/667 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: A wild sagebrush aroma kicks off the nose of this clonal blend, followed by waves of baked cranberry, mace and pine needle. A bright Bing cherry flavor arises on the palate alongside thyme, eucalyptus and baking spice tones that add more complexity.

title: Markus Wine Co 2017 Nero Red (Lodi)
description: This is a big, dry red with Rhône-like attributes of earthiness, smokiness and meatiness to complement the concentrated berry flavors. Starting with 72% Petite Sirah, it's firm in texture, a bit chewy due to good tannins, and shows good breadth on the palate as well as impressive length on the finish. Best through 2027.

title: Sanguis 2014 Loner Whale Song Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Snappy black raspberry aromas meet with dark-black plum and sage oil on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very well integrated, with boysenberry pie and black-plum-pudding flavors meshed with thyme and more sagebrush.

title: Mauritson 2016 Positas Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: The name for this wine refers to a gravelly loam soil formed in alluvial beds and often found on bench lands and side slopes. It shows tangy currant and black cherry, with herbal sage and anise around the edges. The tannins are still young and gripping. Enjoy 2021–2026.

title: El Lugar 2016 Spanish Springs Vineyard Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: From a very cool climate site just miles from the Pismo Beach, this bottling shows the expected aroma set of cracked pepper, iodine, black plum, lilac and tar. The palate is high in acid and quite fresh, with lively violet and pepper spicing up the game and slight fish-oil flavors.

title: Tantara 2017 Zotovich Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite wound up on the nose, this single-vineyard bottling shyly shows nectarine and white-flower aromas. The palate is flinty and mineral-driven, with touches of oak scattered amidst the Meyer lemon peel and smoke flavors.

title: Sol Rouge 2014 Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)
description: A flavorful core of dried cherry and roasted plum supports accents of wood smoke, singed herbs and balsamic in this full-bodied, mouthfilling and very rich wine from the tiny hillside vineyard of Sol Rouge. Firm tannins give it grip on the palate.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Veteran Mike Sinor continues to experiment with his brand, and this whole-cluster bottling gets twiggy with it, offering aromas of blackberry that are cut by gamy, Syrah-like notes of singed rosemary and roasted lamb chop. That meaty, gamy and herby component also coats the palate, where boysenberry and purple-flower flavors are doused in herb juice.

title: Lumen 2016 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling starts with aromas of cherry, cranberry and a touch of pine needle on the nose. There's a compelling earthy streak through the palate, where pomegranate and rose petals flirt with tarragon and minty licorice, leading into a spicy finish.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Extremely pure and crisp on the nose, this bottling starts with aromas of pure apple and crushed chalk. There is great zip to the sip and sharp flavors of white peach and lime custard that are vibrant and alive. Drink now–2032.

title: 50 Harvests 2017 Blanc Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: This impressive white combines 52% Sémillon and 48% Sauvignon Blanc into a sleek package of fresh, fruity kiwi and fig. With a sublime texture, moderate weight and length, it has balance and considerable grace.

title: Landmark 2016 Escolle Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rustic aromas of roasted game and wet rock give depth to the light strawberry tone on the nose of this bottling. Dried cranberry and pomegranate arise on the aromatic palate, lifted by pinches of thyme and crushed sagebrush.

title: Iron + Sand 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The black fruit aroma is reserved on the nose of this bottling, allowing violet, stone, loam and a hint of herbs to come to the forefront. The dry palate is cohesive in flavors of black cherry, purple flowers and soil, with a hint of black olive. The subtleties will benefit from cellaring. Drink 2021–2032.

title: Sanguis 2016 The Highlands Red (Central Coast)
description: This blend of Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot begins with subdued aromas of dried berry, red currants and a rainy blacktop minerality. Crushed rocks show strongly on the palate, where elegant dark-berry flavors merge with a light dusting of herbs, wrapped in an intense structure.

title: Cutruzzola 2015 Gloria Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Elegant and sultry aromas of rose petal, hibiscus and purple flowers decorate the black raspberry fruit on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the hills behind Cambria. It's very expressive on the palate, with raspberry jam, fennel bulb and anise flavors.

title: Four Lanterns 2016 Third Blue Hour Cabernet Sauvignon (Templeton Gap District)
description: There are immensely dense fruit aromas on the nose of this bottling, where cassis and lilac prove elegant and deep once they emerge from the structured backdrop. A crunchy blackberry flavor meets with violet on the palate, which is firm with tannins that start to relent by the finish. Drink 2021–2031.

title: Red Car 2016 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Juicy and light in style, this wine offers a length of crisp, directed acidity and undeniable spice, a mix of cardamom and white pepper. Wrapped in firm tannins that present as silky and restrained, the fruit is a mix of orange and wild strawberry, just barely ripe.

title: Rockpile Winery 2017 Rockpile Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: This is a tightly wound, structured and boldly tannic wine from a high-elevation site. It is layered in flavors of black fruit, toffee, oak and black licorice. The powerful, full-bodied palate finds its balance amidst a compelling thread of acidity that gives it freshness without taking away any of its lush charm.

title: Aleksander 2012 Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: There is plenty of bottle age on this release, made by the family of former NBA pro Sasha Vujacic, but it's quite delicious now. Aromas of caramelized blackberry and liquified oak lead into a palate full of cedar, cassis and a hint of black olive. The tannins remain firm.

title: Kempe 2017 Red (Central Coast)
description: Plenty of thyme, oregano, marjoram and cracked pepper give depth to the woody blackberries and wild raspberries apparent on the nose of this blend. The palate is richer with blackberry, but fresh acidity keeps the garden herb and peppercorn spice in play.

title: Sandhi 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Intriguing and exotic lime and green-plum aromas meet with white flowers and wet stone on the nose of this countywide blend. There's a bright sizzle of acidity to the sip, where sharp and fresh flavors of citrus pith and river stone converge.

title: Calcareous 2017 Moose Syrah-Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 80% Syrah and 20% Petit Verdot begins with aromas of cola, root beer, boysenberry juice and caramel on the nose. On the palate, the penetrating acidity drives into the finish, carrying flavors of violet, wild berry, cola and clove.

title: Chateau Molyneaux 2016 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: This concentrated and aromatic wine captures the classic character of this French varietal with precision. It shows black fruit and roasted herbs in the aroma, and potent cranberry, blueberry and wood smoke on the palate. The structure is firm and moderately tannic, so there's no great hurry to enjoy it. Best through 2025.

title: McNab Ridge 2017 Pinotage (Mendocino County)
description: This rich and chocolaty wine is very concentrated, deep and ripe, so much so that its opulent black-cherry and blueberry flavors keep building on the finish. While very lush, the wine still has a good underpinning of fine-grained tannins that are well matched to the power of the flavors. Best through 2025.

title: Windchaser 2017 Grenache Noir (El Dorado)
description: Complex and enticing aromas of tea, maraschino cherries and plums lead to vibrant fruit, cedar and spice flavors that ride a lightly tannic texture. The wine is layered, harmonious, medium-bodied and different. It's worth a search.

title: DRNK 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick black fruit and a shock of clove combine in this medium-bodied, brooding red wine. Bright acidity supports a rich candied-cherry flavor on the midpalate that deepens into a complex finish of spice and oak.

title: Level 3 2016 Choice & Chance Red (Paso Robles)
description: Intense and lavish aromas of purple fruits meet with coffee candies and caramel on the nose of this blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Syrah and 15% Petite Sirah, which is quite dark in the glass. The earthy palate is loaded with violet and more purple-fruit flavors, framed by strong acidity and sticky tannins.

title: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Thick in tannin and spicy in nutmeg, this is a savory, structured and rambunctious red, bold in full-bodied ripeness and concentration. Clove, cigar and cedar give it seasoning and complexity around a length of black currant and brambly blackberry dusted in cocoa powder.

title: Waxwing 2017 Lester Family Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This is an incredibly unique take on cool-climate Syrah, starting with aromas of tobacco ash and lively black currant. The palate is also intriguing, with strong flavors of wet campfire and tobacco ash alongside more familiar elements of black plum and charred vanilla. Sticky tannins carry throughout the sip.

title: Margerum 2018 M5 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Doug Margerum's flagship blend of 47% Grenache, 40% Syrah, 9% Mourvèdre, 2% Counoise and 2% Cinsaut is bright, delicious and easy to guzzle. Fresh lively aromas of wild strawberry, simmering pomegranate sauce, mint and peppercorns lead into a palate of berries, plum, thyme and marjoram. It is crisp while complex.

title: Balletto 2016 Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This balanced, bright wine is inviting in aromas of jasmine and apple blossom. Spicy oak complements a core of lemony flavor on the palate that leads to bold apple and accents of ginger and nutmeg.
designation: Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Decroux 2016 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Stewed mulberry and plum aromas meet with hints of cocoa, clove and gingerbread on the nose of this bottling. Those wild dark-red-fruit flavors arise on the palate as well, where strong star anise and licorice touches complete the rich experience.

title: El Lugar 2017 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark-cherry and dark earth aromas kick off the nose of this bottling, which warms up toward concentrated boysenberry with patience. The palate is awash in ripe berries along with turned earth and crumbled sagebrush flavors.

title: Hungry Hawk 2017 Grenache (San Diego County)
description: Very light in the glass, this is a very refreshing and easy-to-enjoy Grenache, starting with aromas of red fruit, minty herbs, white pepper and rose water. It's tight and bright on the sip, with snappy red currant and more white pepper, and would work well chilled.

title: Siduri 2017 Parsons' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy, textured and thickly rich, this is a well-made full-bodied wine, with grip and power to spare. Dark-cherry cola mixes with cardamom and orange peel, the oak and tannin behaved but undoubtedly present.

title: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: Perfumed in exotic ginger and white flower, this is a creamy and full-bodied white wine from the mountain appellation that is well integrated in oak and tannin. Fig, pear and nutmeg highlight a broad spectrum of appeal and weight across the lengthy palate.

title: Longoria 2016 Block M Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very earthy and leathery on the nose, this single-block bottling shows deep and hearty aromas of plum and mulberry as well as roasted game. The palate surrounds an earthy core, where black plum and cardamom cling to a tightly wound structure.

title: Longoria 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There is a strong mushroomy, wet-earth element to the nose of this bottling, with subtle raspberry fruit emerging in the background. The palate combines that brighter red fruit with savory flashes of sesame and char, with plenty of turned loam throughout.

title: Opolo 2016 Summit Creek Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Candied black cherry, hickory smoke, vanilla and dried herbs show on the complex nose of this bottling. It's very plush, rounded and likable on the palate, where flavors of red cherry and caramel prove quite lengthy and medium weight.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Goldrock Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a big, thick and velvety wine, steeped in concentrated flavors of baked cherry and pomegranate. Rose-petal aromas soften the power of the firm tannins as does tart acidity and a length of earthy mineral.

title: Pelletiere 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Rounded and plump aromas of lime blossom, sweet apple, oak and nuts are cut by a wet stone minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is much tighter than expected, with a zingy lemon quality that keeps the warmer apple, peach and sea salt flavors in check.

title: Rütz 2016 Maison Grand Cru Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light layers of Bing cherry and rose petal mingle around delicate sprinklings of orange peel and Asian spice in this elegant wine. Balanced and moderate in ripeness and oak, it lingers on tones of black tea and tobacco.

title: Saarloos & Sons 2015 Broer El Camino Real Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This bottling from a vineyard that sits next to Highways 101 and 154 is extremely light in the glass, and shows intriguing aromas of grenadine, red melon, gingerbread spice, leather and cola. There's a dried ginger bite to the palate, where clove and sandalwood flavors mix with fleshy red fruit until the vanilla-kissed finish.

title: Sanguis 2014 Loner Favonious Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Dried apples, flint, sour lime and a hint of oak show on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. The palate is extremely racy, offering tight flavors of green melon and Gravenstein apple. It gains complexity as it sits open, so will age well.

title: Sanguis 2015 Verve Red (Central Coast)
description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah, Petite Sirah and Viognier is one of the more subtle offerings in the Sanguis lineup, showing dark cherry and rosewater on the nose. The palate combines black-cherry, coffee syrup and caramelized flavors, framed in a taut structure.

title: Say When 2017 When They Woke Up They Had Plans to Meet Later That Day Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Adorned with one of the longest names ever put on an American wine bottle, this clean wine shows soft aromas of pink cherries, red apple and a sharp tang. It's light and taut on the palate with crisp cranberry, clove and an acidity that persists into the finish.
designation: When They Woke Up They Had Plans to Meet Later That Day Spanish Springs Vineyard

title: Scratch 2017 San Saba Vineyard Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Monterey)
description: This wine features a label design by artist Eddie Colla. It shows strong aromas of pear, pineapple and tropical fruit on the nose. The palate displays flavors of lime, lemongrass and green apple, enveloped in an aggressive mousse.
designation: San Saba Vineyard Blanc de Blanc

title: Thomas George 2016 Baker Ridge Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fruity and textured, this is a nicely made wine that shows well-integrated oak and approachability. Bright layers of flavor traffic in apple, pear and nutmeg as focused acidity keeps it lively and vibrant in the glass.

title: Binz 2016 Sleeper-Crain Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This lavishly fruity and well-oaked wine tames the tart nature of the varietal quite well, bringing richness and warmth to the palate along with delicious red-cherry, black-plum and baking-spice nuances. Light tannins give the texture just enough grip for pairing with big proteins.

title: Bonterra 2014 The McNab Biodynamic Red (Mendocino County)
description: This square-jawed wine is big, powerful and just a bit rough around the edges. An aromatic blast of oak, tobacco and cedar on the nose is followed by ripe focused black-cherry flavors and integrated oak along with firm chunky tannins on the palate. It should make a great match with a steak or roast.

title: Corley 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This big bold red is given additional power and grace from the addition of 8% Cabernet Franc and 8% Merlot. Leather, licorice and lavender all play a part within a context of sizable grip and weight, the lingering flavors a mix of grilled meat and blackberry.

title: Counter Punch 2016 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a big, bold but well-mannered wine that coats the tongue with rich flavors of plums and berries. Dark chocolate marks the midpalate, while more dark fruit echos on the finish. It is full bodied, layered and deep, benefitting from moderate tannins to balance out its richness.

title: Aquinas 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a big, hearty wine, with dark-fruit flavors, well-integrated oak accents, a full body and firm tannins. Elements of graphite, blackberry and espresso mingle on the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Sterling 2015 Iridium Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Named for a rare element as this wine is only made in certain vintages, this is a 100% varietal wine in an impressively silver-adorned bottle. Grippy and with a baked fruit quality, it tastes of plum, dried cherry and currant, with a soft rounded midpalate of leather, coffee and cedar. The finish continues to grip.

title: Cuvaison 2016 Diablo Estate Grown Syrah (Los Carneros)
description: Named for the soils in which the grapes are grown, 100% varietal in this case, this is a beautifully spicy, leathery red, fruity in blueberry and blackberry. There's brightness beneath the brawn as secondary components of black pepper, grilled meat and cola play against the fruit and velvety tannins.

title: Fort Ross Winery 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This opens in a thick concentration of dark cherry, plum and undeniable cola spice, the midpalate built around firm integrated tannins and oak. Complementary aspects of forest, black tea and coastal sea spray add to the complexity and overall appeal.

title: Williams & Heim 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very floral aromas of honeysuckle and gardenia meet with flint, sweet wood and butter on the nose of this bottling. Ripe flavors of white flower, applesauce and cinnamon show on the rich palate, which finishes ever so sweetly.

title: Boeger 2016 Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine tastes like a mouthful of freshly crushed grapes—ripe and juicy—lightly accented by oak spices and with a smooth soft texture.

title: Brutocao 2017 Estate Bottled Hopland Ranches Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Generously oaked but up to the challenge, this substantive and full-bodied wine matches lavish butter, toast and vanilla flavors with concentrated and ripe peach, pear and honey flavors. It has a rich, nicely viscous texture but good acidity underneath it for balance.

title: Joullian 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Fresh aromas of citrus spray, orange cream, lime peel and buttered toast converge on the nose of this bottling. It's fairly plump on the palate with ripe apples and poached pear, but the salty caramelized lemon-peel edge enhances the sip.

title: Lasorda Family WInes 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Lightly sweet apple tones meet with tangerine pith and lemon balm on the clean, easy and familiar nose of this bottling by the family of former Los Angeles Dodgers manager Tommy Lasorda. There is decent tension to the palate, which is bright, fresh and crisp with pome fruit and citrus flavors.

title: Neyers 2017 Sage Canyon Red (California)
description: This is a bright, well-balanced wine that smells like blackberries and cherries, tastes fresh and nicely fruity and feels tangy and grippy on the palate. It's a medium-bodied versatile red wine that could dress up almost any meal.

title: Noble Vines 2016 337 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This concentrated and full-bodied wine blends smoky, earthy tones with black fig on the nose and palate. It has a lush, broad, mouthcoating texture and moderate tannins for structure.

title: Puma Road 2014 Pedregal Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paicines)
description: Extracted aromas of blackberry reduction, elderberry jam, grape seed, roasted beef and hoisin show on the nose of this bottling. There is ample peppery spice on the sip, alongside cooked berries, with an acid wash on the finish.

title: Writer's Block 2016 Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Generous, smooth and full bodied, this wine offers ripe black-plum and blackberry aromas, mouthfilling flavors and an appealing, lightly gripping texture. While high in alcohol, it tastes nice and balanced.

title: Les Belles Collines 2016 Pinot Gris (California)
description: Copious aromas and flavors of ripe melons, pineapples and pears give this full-bodied wine a lot to like. It is effusive and fruity, not quite sweet but very ripe. The mouthfeel is rich, filling and broad.

title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Aglianico (Amador County)
description: This is a bold, well-structured wine that combines fruity and savory notes like blackberries, mushrooms and beef juices for a concentrated, complex and rather tannic impression. It has a deep color with a brownish rim, cranberry aromas and a full, dry mouthfeel.

title: Crooked Path 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This vintage shows plenty of ripe strawberry on the nose, as well as a hint of spearmint. It dries up considerably on the palate, with flavors of strawberry-sorbet and mint that ride over a loamy, earthy backbone.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Estate Reserve Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: An oaky aroma and heavy, sweet-seeming oak flavors take the forefront in this rich, full-bodied and extremely spicy wine. It shows chocolate, vanilla, nutmeg and cinnamon notes.

title: Hungry Hawk 2017 Chardorino White (San Diego County)
description: This is an atypical but bold and ultimately successful blend of 90% Chardonnay and 10% Albarino from San Diego. It's light in the glass and shows aromas of lemon peel, lime balm and butterscotch on the nose. The palate's rich, nearly sweet pome-fruit flavors are cut by key-lime-peel tension and a tense chalkiness.

title: Passaggio 2016 Heringer Estates Mourvèdre (Clarksburg)
description: This wine is smooth, mellow and supple, making it easy to enjoy its soft plum and Bing cherry aromas and flavors. The mouthfeel is broad and rich, showing light tannins and a full body.

title: Timbre 2015 Lead Vocals Bien Nacido Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's an intriguing combination of hazelnut, pecan and tangerine on the nose of this racy bottling, which offers tangy and pithy aromas. The palate is very taut and zesty with yellow-grapefruit and sour acid flavors.

title: Toca Madera 2016 Estate Bottled Marsanne (Madera)
description: This wine is fairly rich in texture and savory in flavors, bringing a subdued mix of mineral, lanolin and nut nuances to the nose and the palate. It has a medium to full body and a good balance between viscosity and acidity.

title: Treana 2015 Blanc White (Central Coast)
description: A slightly darker shade of yellow in the glass, this blend of 45% Viognier, 45% Marsanne and 10% Roussanne shows honey, baked pear, buttered toast and sweet wood on the nose. There is a tangy sense of lemon to the palate as well as toasted nuts, making for a complex combination of fresh and savory.

title: Treana 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Broad and clean aromas of honeysuckle and squeezed citrus show on the crisp and lively nose of this bottling. It lands with richer buttercream and pan-seared apple flavors, which are cleaned up by decent acidity.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2016 Manchego's Fate Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: A focused nose of dried purple flowers, fresh boysenberry and singed sagebrush show on the nose of this blend of 60% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Zinfandel. The palate tastes of pure purple, from violets to black currant, with a pleasantly lingering acid.

title: Goat Bubbles 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sierra Madre Vineyard Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Very yeasty on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of corn bread, Meyer lemon pith and a damp dough ball. Lemon peels and crab-apple flavors arise on the texturally compelling palate, where sourdough elements also linger.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Sierra Madre Vineyard

title: J. Lohr 2016 Hilltop Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling shows accessible aromas of black cherry, toasty oak, grilled teriyaki meat and a hint of purple flowers. The palate brings blackberry and smoked meat flavors framed by tannins that rise up toward the finish.

title: Jackson Estate 2017 Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: Tight, juicy and youthfully tannic, this comes from the Cloud Landing Vineyard in the new appellation, planted to a multiplicity of clones. Textured and richly full bodied, it offers complementary elements of forest floor, tea, blueberry and orange peel.

title: Kenwood 2016 The Barn Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This opens in a robust, inviting nose of cherry, cinnamon, orange and rose, a nicely made, balanced and integrated mix of spice and fruit. With a delicate midpalate, it hides its underlying ripeness and richness well, with enough acidity to keep the palate fresh.

title: Kori 2018 Highlands Vineyard Rosé (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A deeper plum color, this rosé also shows aromas of red plum as well as cherry, bubblegum and the slightest hint of nutmeg. There is zesty acidity on the tightly woven palate as well as more than the usual spice, which kicks the plum flavors up a notch.

title: Lava Cap NV American River Red Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A big structure and powerful oak and black-fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine a lot of presence. Aromas of cedar, tobacco and black cherry are followed by punchy berry and cassis flavors wrapped in firm tannins. Best after 2022.

title: Luna 2016 Winemaker's Reserve Sangiovese (Napa Valley)
description: The producer sources from across the valley to make this 100% varietal wine, rare in these parts. It opens in smoky oak, leather and cola as flavors of blackberry and tobacco come to the fore. With moderate structure, it has a soft roundness and appealing drinkability.

title: Matthes Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Grenache Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This grower-producer offers this lightly styled white that is juicy in fresh peach and apricot, the texture lovely and layered, with a balanced bite of ripeness and acidity.

title: Morgan 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Arroyo Seco)
description: Very pale pink in the glass, this bottling shows light aromas of bubblegum, chalk and cherry-laced cotton candy on the nose. There is a great grip to the palate, where lime, strawberry and bubblegum flavors arise atop a streak of bright acidity, finishing with watermelon candy.

title: Prima Materia 2017 Bianco Sangiovese
description: This medium-bodied rosé has a pale-salmon color, aromas of prosciutto and canteloupe, and mouthfilling meaty, spicy, apricot flavors. It's nicely dry and serious, and could easily pair with birds or beasts as well as appetizers.

title: Roots Run Deep Winery 2014 The Scholar Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: With 5% Merlot, this hearty ripe wine spent two years in French oak and another year aging in bottle. Soft, rich and round, it has a dense core of blueberry pie and chocolate flavor that's supremely decadent.

title: Sandler 2017 Cortada Alta Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Baked red cherry, chaparral herbs and rusty earth aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The rusty quality extends to the sip, where dried cherry, pomegranate and cranberry flavors are framed by decent structure and acidity.

title: Sean W. McBride 2017 Kim Giles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: This is a minty, eucalyptus-filled red from a vineyard overlooking San Pablo Bay southeast of Carneros. Tight and savory, it is youthfully robust in cranberry and orange peel.

title: Silenus 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: From several sites within the appellation, the wine includes 6% Cabernet Sauvignon from the producer's Oak Knoll District estate. This is a well-made red, soft in plum and integrated in oak. It expands on the midpalate to add a richness of black cherry and vanilla that's lush and lengthy.

title: Stringer 2017 John Sebastiano Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tangy lime-peel, lemongrass and lime-leaf aromas make for a very sharp entry to this bottling. The palate is also very tangy and acid-driven, showing flavors of grapefruit peel, Meyer lemon pith and lime zest.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Ramazzotti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Spice and herb combine memorably in this well-composed, bright and powerful red wine. Brambly and brooding in black cherry, it remains intriguing and richly concentrated in the glass.

title: Waxwing 2017 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Aromas of black plum, red licorice, star anise and light strawberry show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the Corralitos area. The palate is fresh with flavors of plum and mulberry, which are framed by bright acidity.

title: Calcareous 2017 Lily Blanc White (Paso Robles)
