description: Very mellow on the nose at first, this blend of 51% Viognier, 27% Grenache Blanc and 22% Roussanne shows lemon cream, custard, toasted nuts and a slight smoke on the nose. The palate's flavors are broad and welcoming, with white peach, sea salt and then a tinge of lemon rind that makes for a slightly sour finish.

title: Castle Rock 2018 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: A snappy black-raspberry aroma meets with wild mint, crushed rose petals and hibiscus on the nose of this reliable bottling. The palate is fresh in flavors of dark-red fruit and boysenberry, but made more complex by earthy herbs, and finishes on the riper end of the spectrum.

title: Guenoc 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine combines zesty, grassy aromas with rich fruit flavors for a well-balanced and appetizing character. It shows plenty of citrus, green apple and gooseberry tones.

title: J Vineyards & Winery NV California Cuveé Sparkling (California)
description: Flavorful and polished, this supple wine blends subtle apple and pear notes with buttery, creamy accents. It is rich in character and softly framed by fine bubbles and elegant acidity, with a hint of sweetness on the finish.

title: La Voix 2016 Here and Heaven Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very tense aromas of pomelo pith and tangerine rinds meet with a baked yogurt hint of dairy on the nose of this bottling. The palate follows a tight line of crushed almond, roasted apple and white ash, framed by tons of acid and a grippy texture.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Flax Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Rose and lavender accent a thick round midpalate of concentration and full body in this Westside Road red. Savory, salty and tightly wound in firm tannins, it opens in the glass to reveal tart black cherry, orange peel and jolts of cardamom.

title: Pull 2016 BDX Estate Grown Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon shows aromas of red berries, peppercorns and a hint of green herbs on the nose. It's tightly woven on the palate, where a tangy red-plum flavor leads into a caramel-kissed finish.

title: Reynoso 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is intense in concentration and style, with a vanilla touch to the oak and layers of dense, candied pear. Full bodied, it finishes in nutmeg and white peach, holding its richness well.

title: Rombauer 2017 Buchli Station Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: From the producer's estate vineyard comes this darkly colored, creamy and voluptuous white. Moderate acidity lies beneath a core of likable richness and interwoven tastes of honey pear and peach that finishes in a lasting swirl of vanilla.

title: Say When 2017 Sona Vino Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Oak-smoke and lemon-blossom aromas are both rustic and precise on the nose of this bottling by young, Los Angeles-based winemaker Rachel Silkowski DeAscentiis. Decent tension frames the sip, which presents flavors of graham cracker, sesame, sea salt and smoked white peach.

title: Scratch 2014 KW Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rather ripe and thick aromas of dried cherry are lifted by dried mint on the nose of this bottling by Sabrine Rodems. There are strong flavors on the sip, where boysenberry meets with tarragon and strong acidity.

title: Thomas George 2016 Cresta Ridge Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a broad and expansive white wine, complex and robust in style. Candied-peach flavors are complemented by lifted acidity and a taste of banana. Flinty in a quiet waft of matchstick, the weight and texture are impressive and hold up well.

title: ZO Wines 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a new producer in the appellation, this is a refreshing, light-bodied wine that displays flavors of peach and Meyer lemon. The bright acidity quenches from start to finish.

title: Cobden Wini 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Herbal in mountain sage and lavender, this robust red lingers in dusty crushed rock elements and a meaty core of red fruit. Robust and full bodied, it softens on the finish, allowing the oak to show but not distract.

title: Cosentino 2016 Cigar Bourbon Barrel-Aged Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Impressively concentrated black-fruit and dark-chocolate flavors fill out the relatively big frame of this full-bodied wine. It smells and tastes generous, ripe, deep and brooding, while well-integrated tannins and a lingering finish add to its appeal.

title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Barbera (Yolo County)
description: This is a focused, balanced and full-bodied wine. It shows nicely concentrated cherry and berry flavors, and soft accents of black pepper and cedar that add complexity. Light tannins and a supple texture complete the package.

title: Cannonball 2017 Eleven Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This satisfying white opens with a distinct green-olive aroma. Tart acidity evolves to support a profile of candied apple and peach on the palate, building to a bright, fresh finish.

title: Charles B. Mitchell NV Monsieur Omo Red (Fair Play)
description: For a nonvintage wine, this is exciting. It is full bodied, inky in color, concentrated and potent in aroma and ripe and firmly tannic in the mouth. Notes of blackberry jam and cocoa nibs in the aroma are followed by black cherry and molasses on the palate, while a densely tannic texture keeps the wine wrapped tightly. Best after 2023.

title: Frank Family 2015 Winston Hill Red (Rutherford)
description: This blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with handfuls of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Together, they offer a plummy core of fruit that's thick and robust on the palate in full-bodied ripeness and approach. The tannins pop on the finish, accompanied by strong flavors of tobacco and coffee.

title: Groth 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Blended with 15% Merlot, this has a classic character of Old World savoriness, opening in a burst of cassis before becoming more well defined in cedar, clove and crayon wax. The firm tannins never distract, instead supporting a core of full-bodied roundness and plush texture.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Merlot (California)
description: This wine brings out the wonderful natural herb, olive and tobacco side of Merlot, along with plenty of deep black fruits, too. It has a mouthfilling texture supported by moderate tannins, a touch of new oak that's not overwhelming and a lingering fruit and spice finish.

title: Rutherford Hill 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: A wine held back in barrel and bottle for some time before release, this beauty still has time to go before relaxing its thick, tannic intensity of Old World leather and cedar elements. A caramel mocha component of opulence is up front and present. Enjoy 2024–2029.

title: Saddleback 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a leathery medium-bodied red of restrained ripeness that offers strong flavors of baking spice, cigar box and tobacco. The fruit leans into black currant and cassis.

title: Cuvaison 2018 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Los Carneros)
description: Grassy and herbal, this is also a lively, fresh and floral white wine. The fruit component is a delightful mélange of pineapple, lime and melon.

title: F2 Wines 2018 Europeo Rosé of Syrah (Los Olivos District)
description: Candied strawberry aromas meet with a slightly sour kick of lime on the nose of this bottling from the Great Oaks Vineyard. There's a fresh flash to the sip, where pink fruits meet with earthy flavors.

title: Falkner 2018 Viognier (Temecula Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling is exuberant on the nose with freshly smashed papaya, mango and pineapple aromas, proving tropical yet clean. There is a taut tension to the palate, which balances the ripe jasmine and tuberose flavors.

title: Marco Lucchesi 2016 Estelle Vineyards Nebbiolo (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light on the nose, this bottling offers hints of rose petal, strawberry puree, plum and earth on the nose. Concentrated cherry-paste flavors meet with earthy clay and dried red- and purple-flower flavors on the palate, which is still a bit stiff.

title: Pine Mountain Vineyards 2018 High Elevation Rosé (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)
description: Made from 88% Cabernet Sauvignon and 12% Merlot, this is a musky, meaty and metallic wine, light in style, that offers flavors of honey, cranberry and currant. Small production, it finishes in a tease of anise.

title: Section Wines 2016 Il Buttero Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Deep and dark aromas of black plum and dried fig show on the nose of this blend of 60% Sangiovese, 20% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah. It's quite dense on the palate, blending that dark-plum fruit with purple flowers, loamy earth and a hint of caramel.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Cammi Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Lighter in color than most Syrahs, this wine begins with aromas of snappy red fruit and pepper, with hints of licorice and new leather. The palate is not very Syrah-like, but pleasant with cranberry and strawberry flavors that are lifted by fennel pollen and vanilla.

title: Chateau Souverain 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a tasty, easy-drinking wine. It shows ripe plum and peach flavors, a deceptively full body and a mouthfilling texture.

title: Aerena 2018 Rosé (San Francisco Bay)
description: Full flavored and mouthfilling, this wine is richer and broader than most rosés. While technically light bodied, it bursts with watermelon and raspberries that saturate the palate.

title: Balletto 2018 Teresa's Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fresh, lively acidity is up front and persistent in this light steely white unfettered by oak. Fermented and aged instead in stainless steel, it shows bright flavors of mango, peach and green apple.

title: Cobden Wini 2018 O'Sullivan Family Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Raspberry and strawberry highlight a dry, herbal experience of hearty fruit lifted by an oomph of acidity in this delightfully balanced, refreshing wine.

title: Davis Family 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy and delicately textured, this is made from sustainably farmed grapes and native fermented. Fig, tea and dark cherry shine along a thoroughfare of medium-bodied weight and breadth, the tannins softly integrated.

title: Dubost 2013 Blood of Jove Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: This boozy dessert wine will hold up to any cigar imaginable, starting with potent aromas of black-plum sauce, kirsch and dank pine needle. There is decent acidity on the sip, where flavors of black plum, cedar and scotch reign.

title: Hawley 2018 Viognier (Sonoma County)
description: Supremely floral, crisp and steely, this wine shines in bold flavors of apple, lemon and honey, with an unsuspecting viscosity. It shows a hit of ripeness and heat on the finish.

title: Kokomo 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Tangy red fruit rides atop substantial tannin in this concentrated, richly built wine. Baking spice, vanilla and black pepper all play a supporting part as the wine builds to an earthy end.

title: Mountain Tides 2018 Rosé of Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)
description: This light-salmon-colored wine has a smooth, rich texture that drapes ripe peach and mango flavors across the taste buds. Unusual for a rosé, it was whole-cluster pressed and matured in neutral barrels.

title: Raeburn 2018 Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from Pinot Noir, Grenache and other red grapes, this wine offers up-front fruity flavors of mango, guava and dark cherry. Richly round, it spent no time in oak, soaking in a moderate level of fresh acidity to keep it lively in the glass.

title: Upshot 2017 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This flavorful, full-bodied blend is appealing in flavors of lush, jammy plum and toasted oak, with a lifted backbone of acidity. It is a blend of Merlot, Zinfandel, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Riesling.

title: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Petite Sirah (California)
description: This is an easy-to-drink example of the varietal, showing plenty of dark fruit, spicy oak and black pepper but not so tannic as many others. Rich blackberry, blueberry and milk chocolate on the palate make it satisfying.

title: Akash 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Broad aromas of poached pear, wet stone, grass and guava make for a well-rounded nose on this bottling. There is compellingly chalky grip to the sip, and then the flavors show riper tones of guava cream and tropical fruit.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Grenache (Amador County)
description: Ripe juicy cherry and prune flavors give this full-bodied wine a lot of flavor impact. The mouthfeel is smooth and polished, and the balance leans toward the soft side. It's a big, but easy-drinking wine.

title: Hawley 2017 Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: With 15% Petite Sirah, this is no shy wine—a hearty representation of the warm vintage and substantial appellation. A juicy core of black and red berry leads the way to a soft hearty core of toasted oak and cinnamon.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2018 Silver Spur Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Exuberant aromatically, this is a richly layered, high-toned white, with flavors of pea shoot, peach skin and lime. It refreshes and impresses with an easygoing approachability.

title: Joseph Jewell 2016 Shiloh Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a confectionary underbelly of marshmallow and vanilla, a sweet nose that hints of baked pineapple and baked apple. Ultimately light in tone, it starts rich and finds its way to a satisfactory balance.

title: Leoness 2015 Compilation Red (California)
description: Smoked raspberry aromas meet with dusty thyme on the nose of this kitchen-sink blend of Syrah, Petite Sirah, Zinfandel, Mourvèdre and Petit Verdot. Sandy rustic tannins frame the sip, where flavors of roasted red plum meet with fennel pollen and strong oaky tannins.

title: Maley 2017 Lodi Native Wegat Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a tasty, dry and well-structured wine, with appetizing raspberry and plum flavors, firm tannins and good fruit acidity for balance. It was fermented with native yeast and aged with no new oak.

title: Ovis 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy, earthy and richly woven with firm tannins, this is a nicely made wine with a full-bodied ripeness to its black fruit. The oak is toasted and in sync.

title: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Merlot (Mendocino)
description: This full-bodied wine is fruity, well balanced and smooth, showing ripe cherry flavors and hints of baking spices.

title: Tantara 2017 Tondre H Block Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Cola, extracted black cherry, grape seed and dank herbs show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is aggressive, with tangy flavors of boysenberry and green peppercorns, framed by searing acidity.

title: William Harrison 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Firm compressed tannin and oak underscore this wine's robust nature—a ripe expression of hearty red and black berry, vanilla and sage. A dusty texture adds savory complexity.

title: William Hill Estate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Sweet oak and plump ripe berry flavors make a flashy combo in this extroverted, full-bodied and mouthfilling wine. Baking spices, toast and light wood smoke complement a core of boysenberry, blackberry and blueberry.

title: McManis 2018 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Chardonnay (River Junction)
description: This is a well-balanced, medium-bodied wine that stays to the middle of the road, offering equal parts ripe fruit and buttery oak. It's a straightforward pour that should please a diverse crowd of drinkers.

title: Angeleno 2018 Super Bloom Zinfandel (Clements Hills)
description: Red-cherry and strawberry aromas meet with tangy red-plum skin and dried herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tangy with red plum as well as cola flavors.

title: Apriori 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This white has a steely frame of structure and moderate ripeness, highlighting brisk acidity and balanced oak over quiet flavors of apple and cinnamon.

title: Briar Hill 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Wet stone, light mint and lemon-balm aromas show on the nose of this bottling by Adam LaZarre. It lands on the palate with ripe apple and yellow-peach flavors as well as a river stone minerality.

title: Cinema 2016 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Zinfandel, 17% Syrah and 8% Petite Sirah into a sweetly oaked, fruity expression of cherry and vanilla. Rounded, with firm dusty tannin, it presents a juicy backbone seasoned in baking spice and mocha.

title: Collier Falls 2014 Hillside Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dusty and soft in mocha, this 100% varietal estate wine is approachable and well priced, offering a rounded, lengthy expression of black currant and blackberry.

title: David Clinton 2014 Forté Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Rustic in an intensity of sweet berry and vanilla, this is a viscous syrupy dessert wine that's powerful in its sweetness and concentration.

title: MacRostie 2017 Donnelly Creek Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is tighter and lighter than most California Pinots, but has an attractive, appetizing bite in the texture and offers prominent oak, smoke and spice accents.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Estate Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This is hearty, powerful white wine from the heart of the region—a meaty expression of apricot and quince. Meaty and exotic on the palate, it shows a touch of oak and plenty of tropical richness that will please fans of a bigger style.

title: Saint Gregory 2016 Pinot Gris (Mendocino County)
description: This is an extra spicy, barrel-fermented and lees-aged wine that adds hints of ginger, butter and vanilla to the naturally fruity flavors of the grapes. Medium to full body and a rich creamy texture give it a mouthfilling presence.

title: Mirror 2017 Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)
description: Integrated in oak with a mineral stoniness to the back of the palate, this wine is made in a rich, layered style, showing bold flavors of lemon zest, green apple, pineapple and toasted oak. It packs a punch of ripeness and weight.

title: Pine Ridge 2018 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine tastes vivid and tangy but also boasts rich, ripe and round characteristics that broaden the flavors and lead to a lingering finish. It shows an abundance of ripe pear, apple and citrus flavors that really wake up the taste buds.

title: Vermeil 2015 Frediani Vineyard Pickett Road Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Spicy black fruit dipped in nutmeg and cocoa powder rules the palate of this structured, silky wine, with integrated oak and measured tannin providing a foundation of intensity and concentration on the palate.

title: DRNK 2017 Wildwood Vineyards Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: From head-trained, dry-farmed vines, this wine offers bright, high-toned acidity and concentrated, rounded edges of classic blackberry, black-cherry and cinnamon notes. Big tannin structure adds to the weight and complexity and sense of power.

title: Fallon Place 2016 Landa Vineyard Zinfandel (Chalk Hill)
description: Rustic red cherry, vanilla and lavender accent a rich and rewarding palate of balanced flavor and texture in this vineyard-designated wine. Oaky toasted notes add complexity and a savory complexion.

title: Michael David 2016 Freakshow Red (Lodi)
description: This superripe, jammy wine offers a spicy white pepper aroma and then overflows on the palate with flavors of blackberry, strawberry and milk chocolate. The mouthfeel is broad and generous, supported by light tannins and a full body.

title: Angeleno 2018 Alonso Family Vineyard Albariño (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: Golden yellow in the glass, this bottling from Los Angeles County offers in intriguing perfume of orange rind, preserved lemon and yellow apples. There are clean lines of tangerine peel and dried peach on the palate, which is coated in a waxy texture that goes deep into the finish.

title: Kunde 2015 Red (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This blend of 67% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Cabernet Franc and 9% Petit Verdot opens in bright aromas of cherry and vanilla. Sage and pencil notes take over on the palate, with a density of tannin and powerful weight building on the leathery finish.

title: Oakstone 2016 Estate de Cascabel Cabernet Sauvignon (Fair Play)
description: Fruity, nervy and tautly balanced, this full-bodied wine is laser-focused on black-cherry flavors that are pure, concentrated and deep. It has a sense of natural, unmanipulated fruitiness that is well shaped by fine-grained tannins. Best through 2026.

title: Makana 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Dusty oak, sage and leather give this mountain-appellation wine a savory, herbal and earthy personality that is appealing and well integrated with the dense, concentrated black fruit. The oak and tannin are beginning to meld well together into a seamless whole.

title: Peachy Canyon 2017 Classic Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Tight violet and lilac aromas meet with blackberry fruit chews and acai on the nose of this bottling. Black cherry and lavender converge on the palate, which is dense with stiff tannins but manages to float across the tongue.

title: Kelleher 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark in color and substantial in ripeness and breadth, this 100% varietal wine is fermented and aged in both stainless steel and neutral oak. Flavors of lemon zest and dark cherry are surrounded by a light, firm frame of fresh acidity and medium-bodied weight.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Roberitage Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied blend of half Cabernet Sauvignon and half Syrah is bold in flavor and hefty in texture. It offers smoky black-peppery aromas, good black-fruit flavors and a generous dash of spicy oak from aging in 80% new French barrels for 28 months. Best through 2024.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 White Label Bassi Ranch Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Sharply tangy aromas of boysenberry meet with turned earth and wild herbs on the nose of this bottling. It's thicker than expected on the palate, with flavors of black cherry and dark pomegranate, as well as a freshly cracked pepper element adding spice.

title: MacLaren 2018 Aida Gregori Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral, light and bright with a tension of exotic citrus, wet stone and flowers, this small-production white adheres to varietal correctness and a restrained approach to ripeness, opting instead for clarity and focus.

title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Rich aromas of concentrated berry jam and white pepper make for a pleasant entry to this bottling. It's also hearty on the palate with black-cherry, leather, tobacco-leaf and roasted meat flavors, proving mouthfilling but not overly heavy. Stiffer tannins hold everything in check.

title: Site 2016 Stolpman Vineyards Roussanne (Ballard Canyon)
description: This is a unique take Roussanne, starting with a mix of riper cantaloupe and toasted banana aromas that are cut by more sour orange and citrus spray. The palate also mixes the rich with the tart, combining tropical hints of mango with more sour orange tones.

title: Priest Ranch 2016 Snake Oil Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick, weighty wine made 100% from one variety, with bombastic, brawny black fruit. Tar, leather, garrigue and earthy herb give it contrast and complexity, its fleshy ripeness never distracting from its well-made core. This could do with some cellaring; enjoy best 2026–2031.

title: Angeleno 2017 Alonso Family Vineyard Syrah (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: Lighter in the glass than most Syrahs, this bottling shows red fruit and hibiscus flowers on the nose along with rusty hints of wild herbs. The palate packs roasted red plums and cranberries with a cracked pepper spice and exotic tarragon touches.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is a perfumed and seductive wine made from a range of sites across the county. Fresh acidity is seamlessly integrated between textured layers of black cherry, forest floor and cardamom. The overall experience is balanced and undeniably beautiful.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Terra De Promissio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Sultry aromas of rose and lavender carry the nose of this earthy, coastal wine. Flavors of wild raspberry, strawberry, blood orange and rhubarb weave around crisp, seamless acidity. Light in style, it is complex and beautiful.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a fresh, bubbly personality that's complemented by complex, earthy undertones of rose and forest floor. The tannins offer grip to the palate, adding texture and weight within a framework of balanced acidity.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Westside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A perennial knockout, this wine combines vineyard sites from its namesake Westside Road. Flavors of smoke, strawberry, forest floor and black tea accent a velvety, lush palate, ending with a fresh, savory edge.

title: Shafer 2014 Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: The famous wine lives up to its mighty reputation in this vintage. Densely packed in tones of red currant, cassis and cocoa powder, the palate offers a sublime texture that lingers despite an overall powerful punch of structure and tannin. Elements of crushed rock and black licorice unfold on the finish. Enjoy from 2024–2034.

title: Turnbull 2016 Black Label Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This is a head-turning wine, especially at the price—an impressive study in cohesive elements of black currant, lavender and licorice melded with meaty, lengthy tannin. The black currant gives way to more sumptuous flavors of blueberry and cocoa powder, offering balanced body weight and complexity.

title: Clarice 2017 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There is beautiful concentration on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, combining aromas of candied black raspberry and ripe cherry with hints of cinnamon and warm coffee cake. It's explosive on the palate, with a bursting boysenberry flavor that's rounded out by star anise, vanilla and rose petals, yet the structure remains lithe and tight.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Dr. Crane delivers rewarding complexity and contour within a framework of firm, substantial tannins and stark structure. Leather, grilled meat and gunpowder complement tangy layers of acid-driven cassis and red currant, combining effortlessly in a seamless array of evolving flavors and aromas. The minerality takes form in a sensation of crushed rock. Enjoy from 2025–2035.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2016 Morrito Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: This bottling from a hillside block is powerful, attention-grabbing and deliciously balanced. Aromas of candied plum and exotic black cherry meet with piles of red and purple flowers on the nose. The palate shows both impact and depth, offering acid-powered flavors of hearty red fruit and dark star-anise spice.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Pungently floral and inviting, this vineyard site is in the heart of the Olivet Lane District, a historic part of the larger appellation. Orange and rhubarb flavors contribute a fleshy texture and a biting, high-toned lilt of acidity. Persistent notes of Asian spice and black tea give it complexity and length.

title: Epoch 2015 Estate Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Concentrated black cherry, elderberry and blackberry meet with crushed dark chocolate, mint and pencil shavings on the nose of this blend of 53% Syrah, 26% Mourvèdre, 13% Grenache, 5% Tempranillo and 3% Zinfandel. The hefty palate combines flavors of dark fruits with nutmeg and clove elements, framed by chalky tannins and subtle but persistent acidity.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Sweetwater Springs Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Fruity, floral and spicy in nose and flavor, this had time to age in both new French oak and concrete. Robust, powerful layers of powerful black fruit benefit from complex characteristics of white pepper and lavender with an unforgettable perfume tenacious in its intensity.

title: Shafer 2016 TD-9 Red (Napa Valley)
description: The winery's proprietary blend of 58% Merlot, 26% Cabernet Sauvignon and 16% Malbec is hugely impressive and memorable, with a smoky, toasted oak character. Plush flavors of blackberry and cherry jam meld with spice on the rich, round midpalate. It offers plenty of grip and concentration, finishing on a handful of dried herb.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From a historic site in the heart of the appellation, this hearty red is beautifully laced in flavors of dried plum, earth and spiced cake. There's an underlying raciness to the acidity that keeps it fresh and focused.

title: Peake Ranch 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a delicious showcase of Syrah that exhibits both the spicy cool-climate aspects, as well as richer and savory touches of ripe fruit and roasted meats. Aromas of black raspberry, smoky flint and tar lead into a palate of rounded red cherry, charred beef, lavender and rosemary blossom. It's extremely complex.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2017 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Aromas of cherry and boysenberry meet with roasted pork, smoke and flowers in this bottling from a coveted vineyard in the Corralitos area. There is great freshness and snap to the palate, which offers flavors of black raspberry, red currant, bay leaf, dried mint and crushed purple flowers.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Drew Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is a chewy, substantially weighted and full-bodied red from the always impressive and nuanced appellation, a study in meat, garrigue and leather. Dark and brooding in savory fruit and herbal earthiness, it has a density that unfurls on the palate in slow waves of subtle blackberry and blueberry pie.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Fruity in blueberry and black cherry, with a citrus-tinged undertow, this blockbuster beauty is a mix of sleek tannins and complex structure, offering undeniable deliciousness as well as something to think about. Gunpowder and tobacco give it a savory edginess and lingering finish of black pepper. Enjoy from 2025–2035.

title: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This divine and complex white delivers tones of almond paste, sea salt, lime and tangerine that are balanced by fresh, vibrant acidity. This is a well-balanced, food-friendly wine that impresses from start to long finish.

title: Sanguis 2015 1/1 Syrah (Central Coast)
description: This wine only grows more compelling the longer it sits open. It begins with aromas of blackberry, thyme stems and singed tobacco on the nose, leading into a woody palate of dried sage, cracked pepper and fresh blackberry. All of the elements converge into savory excellence with patience. Drink 2021–2035.

title: Sandler 2017 Boer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Black-cherry, black-plum and dark floral aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a single vineyard in the rugged Chalone appellation. The palate is framed by sandy tannins, revealing dark flavors of mulberry, rose petal and rich black plum.

title: Sandler 2017 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Quite delicate on the nose, this bottling shows mellow aromas of strawberry and raspberry alongside freshly cracked pepper and plucked herbs. The palate is coated in peppery spices and dried herbs that add depth to the dried red-currant flavors.

title: Stephen Ross 2017 Spanish Springs Vineyard Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Meyer lemon and cantaloupe converge on the dynamic nose of this bottling along with white flowers, yellow pears and chalk. That white-rock minerality consumes the grippy palate, where Asian pear, light guava and jasmine flavors emerge.

title: Tercero 2018 Aberration Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Winemaker Larry Schaffer recommends this blend of 40% Cinsault, 40% Grenache and 20% Carignane be served with a chill, which better presents the fresh, gluggable flavors of watermelon, beet juice and damp earth. The palate carries the ball forward with red apple and jujube flavors, wrapped in bright acidity.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Herbal and sanguine, this is a thick, rich and rounded wine with hints of iron, currant and stone. It holds its weighty ripeness well.

title: V. Sattui 2016 Crow Ridge Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Sanguine, meaty and moderate in oak, this is a generously ripe rich red. It offers substantial weighty waves of jammy black fruit and a depth of dark chocolate.

title: Waxwing 2017 Deerheart Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Bright and fresh raspberry aromas meet with violet and dark hibiscus on the extremely floral nose of this bottling. The palate is more fruity and primary with black raspberry aromas alongside wild forest herbs and thyme.

title: Wente 2016 Riva Ranch Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Candied red cherry, clove and oak smoke converge for a very accessible and inviting nose on this bottling from the historic family's estate. Pomegranate flavors meet with oak and vanilla bean on the palate, which is framed by chalky and sticky tannins.

title: Wilson Family 2014 Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Black-currant, açai and Concord grape aromas prove very purple on the nose of this bottling, and there is also a touch of cracked pepper and dried lilac. The black-currant core of the palate is lifted by rosemary blossoms, rainbow peppercorns, chocolate and roasted wood flavors, all framed by sticky tannins.

title: Ancien 2016 Jouissance Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a full-bodied style of wine, reduced slightly and youthfully tight, with a smooth velvety texture of integrated tannin and bold background oak. Dark cherry, cola and baking spice combine for a lovely experience of lushness on the palate.

title: August West 2017 Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark cherry, black raspberry and hints of hibiscus and rose buds arise on the nose of this bottling from Sonoma. The flavors are nicely rounded on the palate with fruit punch, orange rind and clove, yet there is an underlying sharpness that penetrates into the finish.

title: Bjorn 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Candied red fruit defines the core of this 100% varietal wine, with accents of cedar, sage and dried herb. Buzzy acidity keeps it fresh against a wall of robust ripeness and chalky tannins.

title: Chappellet 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: There is 10% Malbec, 8% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot in this wine, which represents a refined and complex expression of the grape from a mountain site. Smoky oak meets black cherry, leather, dark chocolate and a touch of dried herb—flavors that accent a balance of tannin and structure.

title: DNA VIneyards 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This light-bodied wine offers an opening note of candied citrus as it develops a juicy core of texture and flavor. Strong in baking spice, it has secondary characteristics of forest floor and flint, with firm integrated tannin.

title: Domaine de la Rivière 2017 Middle Reach Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This has a concentrated opening of rich red strawberry and cherry, with a hint of cola and savory edges of forest floor and dried herb. The midpalate is succulent and softly layered, integrated and impressively structured.

title: Grand Napa 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: With 5% Cabernet Franc, this red is dotted in dried herb and sage, the tannins pillowy on the palate. A dusty rocky mineral component leads the way along a robust core of integrated concentration and dark flavors of blackberry and black currant.

title: Iron Horse 2014 Russian Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: Rich and thick in mousse, this sparkling wine is made in creamy, lush style and it succeeds in delivering plenty of soft supple layers of flavor. Peach and cherry cordial come to mind around flecks of brioche and crème brûlée. It finishes dry.

title: Judge Palmer 2015 Vinegrove Terrace Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a soft, supple and spicy wine, brimming in black pepper and smoked meat. Expansive and broadly textured, it has underlying grip and youthful tannin, with lasting flavors of black cherry and lavender.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Valley View Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The 20% new French oak used in this bottling shows strongly on the nose, with roasted wood aromas overcoming the dark-red-cherry and light pepper scents. The palate is wrapped in firm oaky tannins, so more time will be needed to allow the smashed cherry and berry flavors to integrate with the vanilla elements.

title: Marimar 2015 La Masia Don Miguel Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Powerfully concentrated and intensely aromatic, this is a balanced, ultimately elegant expression of cinnamon, clove and black tea, with a hint of rose and lavender on the nose. The tannins are firm and well behaved, providing structure for the brambly blueberry and cherry.

title: Foot of the Bed 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Strong aromas of baked strawberry and eucalyptus oil show on the tangy nose of this bottling. The palate is also tangy, with balsamic boysenberry flavors alongside a hint of herb oil.

title: Rain Cloud 2017 Red (California)
description: This thick, bold wine smells and tastes very woody. It has charred aromas, roasted fruit flavors and a rather drying, astringent texture.

title: AuburnJames 2015 Artist Series Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending nearly half Cabernet Sauvignon with lesser amounts of Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this is a green, tannic and intensely herbal wine with a thick concentration of oak.

title: Merriam 2014 Gloeckner Turner Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rockpile)
description: Dusty oak and rock form around a harshness of tannin in this savory wine that has just a touch of rich red fruit.

title: Dark Horse NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Very basic in flavor, this canned wine is acceptable as a generic accompaniment to food. It's light bodied and soft in texture.

title: The Dirty Pure Project 2017 The Bomb Red (California)
description: A strong artificial-tasting oak component makes this wine seem like a concoction rather than a normal grape wine. Flavors like Concord juice and chocolate are heavily shaded by flavors like cedar shavings, clove and menthol.

title: Schug 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: With a soft entry into rounded flavors of bay leaf and oak, this is a simple wine, with mild red fruit on offer.

title: Benessere 2016 Estate Black Glass Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: This red is light, simple and a touch bland, struggling to reveal spicy black fruit and a hint of toasted oak.

title: Paraduxx 2016 Rector Creek Vineyard Block 4 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 55% Petit Verdot and 45% Zinfandel, this wine is built by astringent tannins and puckering acidity. The fruit is mild and doesn't hold up to the structure.

title: Tin Barn 2016 Pickberry Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is tart, green and astringent. It is driven by racy red fruit and carries a bitter finish.

title: Technique 2018 Technique Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: This wine opens in floral, Gewürztraminer-like lychee and mango before becoming quite harsh and astringent on the palate.

title: Fleury Estate 2014 The F in Red Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: A 50-50 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this is an earthy wine with puckering, harsh oak and tannin.

title: Joseph Phelps 2016 Insignia Estate Grown Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a lengthy, powerful blend of 84% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Petit Verdot and 3% each of Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Together they coalesce as one seamless, complex experience of black currant, brambly berry and black pepper, with accents of graphite, pencil and cedar. Robust in tannin and youthful energy, it will benefit from aging. Enjoy 2026–2031.

title: Larkmead 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This stellar, powerhouse wine is perfumed in aromas of pencil, leather and sage that season a core of mineral and crushed rock. The fruit is equally savory in currant and plum, with a dusting of dark chocolate. Enjoy now–2029.

title: Drew 2016 Estate Mid-Slope Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: This fascinating wine shows a deep, brooding set of earth, forest floor and stewed cherry aromas, followed by concentrated flavors of plum, hawthorn and basil on the palate. Medium to full in weight, these tones mesh with moderate tannins for a texture that's both full and a little grippy. Best through 2026.

title: Larkmead 2016 The Lark Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made entierly from Cabernet Sauvignon, this top tier wine offers dark, brooding flavors of coffee, toffee, sage and earth. It is robust in feel, showing up-front power and structure that's balanced by nuanced oak. This deserves more time in the cellar; enjoy 2026–2031.

title: Auteur Wines 2017 Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is an acid-driven, well-integrated and composed white from a well-farmed site, structured, gritty and complex in nature. Meyer lemon, lime and tangerine provide a crisp fresh backdrop of inviting flavor that meets floral companionship in apple blossom aromas and a hint of lemongrass on the lengthy finish.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Susanna's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine opens with ample expressions of pretzel, lemon candy and stone. It offers complexity and structure in its nuanced use of oak and full-barrel fermentation, finishing on a spritz of sea spray.

title: Villa Creek 2016 Avenger Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry, vanilla and caramel aromas make for a rich, lush and inviting nose on this blend of 70% Syrah, 20% Mourvèdre and 10% Grenache, one of Paso Robles' premiere bottlings each vintage. Hearty flavors of black-cherry cream, butterscotch, wild herbs and roasted meat show on the palate, which is framed by chalky tannins.

title: Drew 2016 Valenti Syrah (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Serious underlying fruit concentration and an intense mineral and black-pepper aroma give this full-bodied wine an imposing approach. It shows deep and dark fruit flavors, a fascinating burnt sage and burnt orange aspect, very firm tannins and bone-dry balance. It's impressive now and will be delicious after 2025.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Made in an approachable style, this wine shows rounded and ripe red cherry on the nose with hints of clove and baking spice. There are prominent strawberry and fennel-bulb flavors on the palate with a pinch of herbs, proving quite rich for the price point.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is made from two vineyard sites, Starscape and Shiloh Hill, both vineyard designates for the producer. Together, they offer a light approach of understated ripeness and sharp citrus tones with an expansive fleshy midpalate of oak.

title: Markus Wine Co 2016 Blue Red (Lodi)
description: This is a smooth, medium-bodied wine that smells a bit earthy and meaty, tastes mild and berrylike, and has light tannins. It's a Bordeaux-style blend that has 70% Petit Verdot.

title: Napa Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Pear and melon flavors punctuate a touch of spritzy acidity that gives freshness to an otherwise moderate framework of ripeness. Vanilla oak highlights the finish.

title: Sebastopol Oaks 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Sunny well-ripened fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine aromatic and flavorful as it spreads black cherry, plum and clove nuances across the palate. It has good acidity, moderate tannins and a lingering hint of ripeness on the finish.

title: Bookshelf 2017 Dichotomy White Pinot Noir (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a white wine made from red-wine grapes and indeed it shows the body and rich mouthfeel of a red, but substitutes melon, butterscotch and honey flavors. The color is a touch deeper than most whites, too.

title: Cosentino 2017 Cigar Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This red wine has the classic wild berry and briar character of the varietal, along with a veneer of baking spices and cream that sweetens its flavors. It is full bodied, light in tannins and soft in terms of acidity.

title: Dubbed In Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This aromatic wine shows a floral and cedar perfume followed by rather dense, concentrated cranberry and tart cherry flavors. It is full bodied, has a gripping texture and decent sense of depth.

title: Halcyon 2017 Alder Springs Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendocino County)
description: Smoky, meaty aromas and good, hearty fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine substantive and mouth filling. Firm tannins add grip to the texture, reining in the tart blackberry and cranberry flavors just enough for good balance.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2015 Spring Hill Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Golden dark color shows the influence of 20 months in all French oak, more than half of the oak new. Apple, Meyer lemon and bright acidity complement the density of the oak and body.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Reserve Barbera (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine is deep in color, powerful in oak and fruit aromas and very focused in flavors. A vivid bright black-cherry core is shaded by cedar, nutmeg and wood-smoke nuances while good acidity and light tannins boost the texture.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 Viva Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This sturdy wine is dry and flavorful without overt oak but with a good structure of fine-grained tannin and acidity. Black-cherry and blackberry flavors fill it out nicely.

title: Broadside 2017 Wild Ferment Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Clean and broad aromas of poached pear, apple and mango candy are ripe and very approachable on the nose of this twist-top bottling. More poached pome fruit and pineapple flavors arise on the sip, but there is a lemony edge that keeps it in check.

title: Hahn 2017 Pinot Gris (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of Key lime pie, candied tangerine and bubblegum are quite joyous on the nose of this wine, which is very light in the glass. It's crisp on the palate and subtle at first until waves of peach and pear flesh slide into the finish.

title: Lasorda Family WInes 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A very dry and somewhat dusty take on the grape, this bottling from the family of famed Los Angeles Dodger manager Tommy Lasorda offers aromas of bay leaf, tobacco and blackberry on the nose. The palate combines herb, soy and tea leaf with tart dark fruit.

title: Noble Tree 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Chalk Hill-Russian River Valley)
description: This is an unusual and aromatic white, blended with nearly 22% Grenache Blanc and fermented predominantly in stainless steel and concrete egg. Moderate in style, it offers rich rounded edges of texture and floral apple blossom.

title: Priest Ranch 2017 Estate Grown Grenache Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Waxy apple accents a sumptuous midpalate of lemon verbena and white flower in this steely white ample in up-front acidity.

title: Sextant 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dark blackberry, grape seed, singed caramel and gingerbread-cake aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a compelling spice profile on the palate, which lifts up the richer black-plum-paste backdrop.

title: Andis 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a good, approachable, weekday wine that offers plenty of fresh raspberry and blackberry flavors, a full body but a rather soft tannic texture.

title: Carlisle 2016 Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 8% Syrah, the grapes primarily from Rossi Ranch in Sonoma Valley, this is a thick, leathery and tannic red, well made and mannered but undeniably varietal. The tastes lean into biscuit and blackberry cobbler.

title: Paradise Springs 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Candied boysenberry and black-raspberry aromas cut through the earthy funk that often comes from this old vineyard, the region's pioneering property. There is ample structure on the palate, where darker purple fruits and dried flowers meet with dust and slightly sour plums.

title: Shooting Star 2016 Merlot (Lake County)
description: This wine has impressive black-cherry, cocoa-powder and leather aromas, a concentrated palate of blackberries and charcuterie steeped in supple tannins for a grippy but yielding texture. It's well balanced, food friendly and offers great value.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Red-plum and pomegranate aromas meet with black-tea leaf on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers lightly stewed plum flavors that are enhanced by Indian spice and a gravelly tension.

title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Malbec (Yolo County)
description: Well balanced, firm in texture and complex in flavor, this wine shows light wood-smoke and black-pepper aromas, meaty, plummy flavors and a lightly tannic mouthfeel. While slightly on the lean side in terms of fruit, it's appetizing and complex.

title: Boeger 2016 Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)
description: Gorgeous, uncomplicated fruit flavors give this wine loads of appeal. It shows fresh red cherry and black cherry on the nose, delicious cherry and blackberry on the palate and a lightly firm texture for good balance.

title: Boeger 2017 Pinot Noir (El Dorado)
description: This medium-bodied white wine made from dark Pinot Noir grapes is rich in buttery spicy notes from the first whiff to the lingering finish. Butterscotch and melted butter fill the aroma while toasted almond, vanilla and pear flavors coat the palate. It is very well done in this showy style.

title: Freeman 2017 Hawk Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This tightly wound wine is reasonably ripe and smooth, light bodied, and gives an uncomplicated serving of apple and lemon flavors on a crisp nervy texture. It shows little oak influence, but subtle fruit, mineral and savory accents should develop nicely with time. Best after 2023.

title: Meiomi NV Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Light lemon-lime aromas and flavors give a charming, refreshing aspect to this fine-beaded, light-bodied wine. It has just enough richness from additional flavors of spiced apple and lemon meringue to balance the lively acidity.

title: Murphy-Goode 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a straight-up, well-structured and moderately tannic wine with medium to full body, firm acidity and an almost tangy texture. It dusts black-cherry and cranberry flavors with hints of spicy oak and dark chocolate that continue to develop on the palate and finish.

title: Myka 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Made in a richer style than most, this wine has its share of attractive baking-spice aromas, ripe apple and peach flavors and full body. It's unoaked but offers nice complexity and maturity anyway.

title: Toca Madera 2015 Reserve Estate Bottled Tempranillo (Madera)
description: Aromas like grilled beef and black pepper lead to gutsy fruit flavors and a firmly tannic texture in this full-bodied, flavorful but not overripe wine. Smoky spicy notes prevail and the wine's balance favors a bit of restraint.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2016 Garcia Ridge Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Damp soil, black currant, Concord grape, plump lilacs and a gravelly minerality show on the nose of this blend of 50% Zinfandel, 40% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate is full of purple flavors, from acai to Concord grape, with a touch of poppy cola spice.

title: Bravium 2017 Wiley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a solid, well-structured wine that frames its red- and black-cherry flavors in good light tannins and fresh acidity. It tastes brisk and refreshing, offering light to medium cherry, oak-spice and clove notes and a food friendly balance.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Mourvèdre (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a plush, generous and well-rounded wine that shows touches of the varietal's meaty, funky character but well backed up by tasty raspberry, dried cherry, oak spice and milk-chocolate nuances. It has a very smooth, lightly tannic texture and mouthfilling viscosity.

title: Holly's Hill 2017 Patriarche Blanc White (El Dorado)
description: Floral aromas and vibrant ripe fruit components give this wine a lot of flavor impact. It is nicely rounded in texture but light in terms of alcohol while also balanced by good acidity.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dark in color, this is a full-bodied, firm and deeply flavored white that makes good use of oak, offering a touch of butter and brioche. Apple and peach richness add to the whole.

title: Blazon 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Full bodied, moderately spicy and full of ripe, almost jammy fruit flavors, this bold and mouthfilling wine tastes rich and generous. Blackberry and sweet black-plum notes seem to coat the tongue, and add to an almost thick texture that extends the finish nicely.

title: Boeger 2016 Reserve Meritage (El Dorado)
description: This is a good, concentrated, well-balanced wine with fairly bold blackberry flavors accented by red cherry and baking spices. Medium body and a touch of tannin give the texture some grip and will make it a very good palate-cleansing dinner-time wine.

title: Byron Blatty 2016 Pragmatic Red (Los Angeles County)
description: This blend of 90% Malbec, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot is very dark in the glass and quite expressive on the nose, offering black currant, candied violet, plum jelly and Dr Pepper aromas. It's very juicy on the palate, with more black currant and licorice and a very strong acidic backbone.

title: Cordant 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Very plump and tangy fruit aromas of cranberry and pomegranate meet with toasted sage and carnation on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit explosive with red-fruit tartness yet also rich with a thicker body, presenting a somewhat jumbled experience.

title: Montagne Russe 2017 Old Lakeville Road Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine opens with an intensity of wood and oak intensifying on the palate to share classic elements of smoked meat, garrigue, iron and black raspberry. With a shock of bright acidity midway through, it has texture and gravitas within a cool-climate ethos.

title: Paper Street 2016 Cornflower Blue Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Appealing aromas of smoked red plums, roasted strawberries, lilacs and baking spice show on the dynamic nose of this bottling from a young vineyard. There is a strong savory kick to the plate, where peppery spices are sprinkled atop mulberry pie and gingerbread flavors.

title: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Petite Sirah (Lake County)
description: This full-bodied, full-flavored wine practically bursts with flavors of cocoa powder, blackberry and blueberry. It is dark, rich and concentrated, supported by a massive layer of fine-grained tannins but not so heavy that one couldn't drink it now with a nice, juicy cut of meat. Best after 2027.

title: Cardella 2016 Francesco's Vineyard Petite Sirah (California)
description: Concentrated, layered and deep, this pure and unaffected wine boasts vivid graphite and black-pepper aromas, tempting blackberry, blueberry and dark chocolate flavors on a firmly tannic texture. It's solid in structure but also well balanced and polished.

title: High Valley Vineyard 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (High Valley)
description: Delicious, fruit-soaked flavors and a smooth texture make this full-bodied wine almost irresistible. It is drenched in ripe blackberry, blueberry and cocoa flavors, and feels shaped by new oak without becoming overtly oaky in flavor. Best through 2023.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Casa de Viñas Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a massive, inky-colored, full-bodied wine that needs several years to mature before optimal drinking. Still, it's tempting now due to enticing dark chocolate and blueberry aromas, and flavors saturated with blackberry and oak spices. Best after 2026.

title: The Lost Chapters 2014 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: High-toned red fruit meets dark chocolate and sage in this hearty red wine, blended with 7% Merlot and 7% Sangiovese. Cassis, currant and blueberry play around structured tannin and a softness of texture, finishing in varietal dried herb notes, cedar and graphite.

title: Tyros 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers a bright nose of sweet oak, which leads to succulent waves of cherry, plum and currant on the palate. Flourishes of cedar and dried herb meld with a wealth of soft, silky tannins.

title: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending 38% Cabernet Sauvignon with 36% Merlot and 26% Cabernet Franc, this wine is brawny and brooding in tar, leather and black currant. Offering a substantial mouthfeel of powerful tannin, it settles into a savory layer of black licorice and sage. Enjoy best 2020–2025.

title: J. Cage Cellars 2017 El Coro Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: With 20% whole cluster in the fermentation, this vineyard-designate is lightly oaked and stemmy, with exotic elements of tree bark, tea and Asian spice. Complex and high toned, it has nicely integrated acidity and a lasting freshness of tangy red fruit.

title: B Cellars 2018 Jewell Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Tropical with secondary notes of peach, green apple and Meyer lemon, this is a robust, concentrated and fleshy white wine, bright in underlying acidity and thus ultimately well balanced.

title: Clay Shannon 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Lake County)
description: This big but balanced wine carries aromas of black cherry and mint. The palate offers a firm texture, with fresh flavors of ripe black cherry, cranberry and black plum.

title: Miner 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Light in color this is an effervescent expression of peach, apricot and pear, delicate flavors that are balanced and lovely on the palate. A finishing touch of lime keeps it bright.

title: Cline 2017 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: Full bodied and quite mouthfilling, this flavorful wine piles on the fruit and accents it with light, spicy oak notes. Blackberry, Bing cherry and blueberry vie for attention while subtle baking spice and black pepper add complexity.

title: Whipsmart Wine Company 2017 Near to the Wild Heart Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral in violet and lavender, this is an appealing red wine, concentrated in tannin and burly black fruit, with underlying notes of iron and garrigue. Full bodied, it finds balance in the glass with a hint of grace and fully integrated oak.

title: Beringer 2016 Regional Estates Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with smaller amounts of Merlot, Petit Verdot, Zinfandel and other varieties, this wine is lightly spiced and in balance, despite its powerful approach to ripeness. Tobacco, clove and black pepper enliven the darker, denser aspects of blackberry jam and dark chocolate, finishing unabashedly rich.

title: Landmark 2017 Overlook Pinot Noir (California)
description: This blend of Pinot Noir from Monterey County (65%), Santa Barbara County (18%) and Sonoma County (17%) begins with aromas of boysenberry, dried lilac and turned earth on the nose. There is a focused intensity on the palate, with more berry flavors as well as pie crust, loamy earth and a pinch of mint.

title: Baileyana 2017 Firepeak Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Rounded white-peach aromas meet with smoky touches of flint and oak on the nose of this bottling. The toasty flavors continue to the palate, where seared lemon and rounded peach are framed by a bright acidity.

title: Toretti 2016 Valentino Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Black plum, elderberry, dark soil and purple flowers converge on the nose of this elegantly layered, dark but dry bottling. Lilac and lavender meet with black plum on the palate, and oak is apparent on the finish.

title: Fess Parker 2017 The Big Easy Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Smoked black cherries, roasted meats, lilac and oak make for an intriguingly floral while meaty nose on this popular, New Orleans-inspired red blend. It's smooth and suave entering the palate, where well-integrated oak flavors and tannins frame the black-cherry fruit. It will be great for barbecues.

title: Replica 2016 Sempre e Per Sempre Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has an intensity of heat and bold flavor, a mix of baked apple and honey that's both rich and complementary.

title: Riaza 2014 Outsider 2.0 Tempranillo (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells mellow and mature, tastes leathery and spicy and has a smooth lightly textured mouthfeel. It will be good for everyday occasions. Best to drink it soon.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Pink Label Leras Martini Clone Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Jammy, thick and sweetly viscous, this wine is smoothly layered in dense black cherry with secondary elements of smoky oak and black tea.

title: Rombauer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Thickly built, spritzy in acidity and brightly citrus-driven in lemon zest, grapefruit and apricot, this is the fourth vintage of this wine from the longtime Napa Valley producer. It delivers flavor and texture within integrated oak, within which just a portion is fermented.

title: Sera Fina 2017 Viognier (Amador County)
description: Nicely crisp and dry, this medium-bodied wine smells floral and tastes a bit leesy like it just came out of a barrel. It has tangy lemon and green-apple flavors.

title: The Federalist 2016 Bourbon Barrel Aged Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Full bodied and jammy tasting, this wine also has a layer of astringency—possibly from the bourbon barrels—so it comes off more dry and puckery than many others. Raspberry and red cherry combine with floral and mineral accents.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Bourbon Barrel Aged Zinfandel (California)
description: The bourbon barrel-aged trend is a weird twist in fine wine circles, and this boozy bottling won't convince many connoisseurs otherwise. Sour black-plum and burned caramel aromas lead into a slightly sweet palate with ripe red fruit and vanilla spice throughout.

title: Bookshelf 2016 Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This is a good middle-of-the-road wine, with fairly rich fruit flavors and a pleasant broad texture. Mild plum and strawberry notes and soft tannins add to the wine's mellow appeal.

title: Carpe Diem 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine is smooth in texture and plummy in flavor, offering wet earth and farmyard aromas to start off with, followed by baked black-cherry flavors. The funky earthy character persists through the finish.

title: Allan Hancock 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black raspberry, fresh thyme and white pepper make for an interesting aromatic approach to this bottling. Pencil shavings and bright red fruit prove a tad weak on the palate.

title: Block Nine 2017 Caiden's Vineyards Pinot Noir (California)
description: Touches of wet earth and farmyard in the aroma don't keep this medium-bodied wine from being enjoyable, but they do add a funky accent to the ripe red-berry character. A smooth and mouthfilling texture makes it very easy to sip.

title: Castle Rock 2017 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This oaky wine starts with spicy, earthy and wood-smoke aromas followed by decent plummy flavors that are also accented by spicy oak notes. It has a full body and a mouthfilling texture.

title: Crush 8 2017 Zinfandel (California)
description: This jammy-tasting wine is very ripe, very smooth, full bodied and almost syrupy in texture. It tastes pruney and raisiny and leaves a sweet impression on the finish.

title: Figge 2016 Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Sour lemon rinds and strong papaya aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a sharp, citrus-driven acidity to the palate, with slightly harsh lemon-rind and melon-scrap flavors.

title: Figge 2016 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Black-plum paste and concentrated lilacs show on the nose of the bottling. The palate is quite sour and tangy with plum-skin flavors.

title: MacRostie 2016 Cummings Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine starts delicately in a light-bodied fashion, bearing blue and red berry fruit that presents as bright. There's a hint of vanilla that sparks on the finish.

title: Peju 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A broad, concentrated and 100% varietal wine, this is smoky in meat and blackberry jam, its tannic weight substantial and grippy.

title: Reata 2017 Aurelius White (California)
description: This is a soft, lightly sweet wine with delicate peach and honeysuckle flavors. It's very smooth and creamy in mouthfeel.

title: Sweet Heart 2015 Tempranillo (Yolo County)
description: With a closed-in aroma and being almost monolithic on the palate, this wine is full-bodied, moderately tannic and subtle in flavor. Touches of wood char and black pepper in the aroma meet mild blackberry on the palate.

title: Twisted Cedar 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine from a native American-owned winery has a sweet maple aroma, and flavors that are very fruity as well as quite oaky. It is well-saturated in terms of color and has smooth tannins for a pleasant mouthfeel.

title: Parker Station 2018 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Clean lines of pear flesh, honeysuckle, lime blossom and mango are rounded and delicate on the nose of this blend from Edna Valley, Monterey and Santa Barbara. There is decent tension to the sip, where white rock and riper pear flesh flavors lead into Gravenstein apple and peach toward the finish.

title: Three Stars 2016 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This canned red blend is dark in color and thick in plummy blackberry and toasted oak. Rich and full bodied, it has an appealing fruitiness and seasonings of baking spice.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2016 Cassie Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)
description: Smoky oak and black pepper take the lead in the aroma of this full-bodied, firmly tannic wine, but nuances of sour cherry, black cherry and grilled herbs make the palate lively and complex. It's medium bodied, not heavy or too saturated.

title: Akash 2016 Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)
description: Dense aromas of cassis, black-cherry candy, smoke and a hint of cola show on the nose of this bottling from a newer property in Temecula. Candied yet tangy black-plum flavors arise on the sip alongside floral touches of jasmine and lilac, while the acidity sears into the finish.

title: Amici 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County)
description: Oily and viscous in mouthfeel, this complex white offers a touch of oak and floral, herbal components. It is complemented by rich rewarding flavors of vanilla and fig.

title: Bee Hunter 2016 Mariah Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Tangy and well balanced, this light and refreshing wine offers lemon-lime aromas, grapefruit flavors and a lean appetizing texture.

title: Beringer 2016 Home Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a stewy, thick and concentrated wine with broad woody tannins. Expansive on the palate, it has an intensity of earth and herb met by blackberry jam, cocoa powder and sweet tobacco.

title: Bootleg 2015 Red (Napa County)
description: This is an opulent, richly layered wine, a combination of Merlot, Petite Sirah and Syrah, with smaller amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Juicy, it offers smoky cherry and grippy tannin around likable layers of weight and body.

title: Bridlewood 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Red-cherry compote with pepper dust, thyme and wood spice make for a pleasant if simple nose on this bottling. Roasted cherry, cranberry and red-plum flavors are lifted by oregano and baking spice on the palate.

title: Côte West 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)
description: This wine is pleasantly and lightly fruity, offers a touch of mineral complexity and has good balance and medium body. It shows a bit of restraint that's appealing in a varietal category crammed with extroverted wines.

title: Dubost 2017 Auguste Red (Adelaida District)
description: Black-plum aromas meet with strong wood tones of hickory and oak on the nose of this blend of 40% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 30% Mourvèdre, which also offers gingerbread and lilac touches. The palate is very thick and extracted, offering roasted strawberry, black-plum pudding and potent boozy power.

title: Etude 2018 Pinot Gris (Carneros)
description: Creamy and textured, this has strong fruity flavors of lemon peel, lime and stone, the midpalate viscous and broad in its appeal. The finish offers a twist of hazelnut.

title: Midnight 2016 Solstice Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Packed rose petals, dark berries, cocoa and earth show on the mellow nose of this bottling. It's pleasant and easy on the palate, with dusty berries, tangy black-plum skin and roasted wood flavors.

title: Newton 2016 Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: This bold white has a reductive note to the nose, and a meaty intensity throughout. It opens with aromas of jasmine and apple blossom before becoming richer on the palate in pineapple and pear, the oak prominent and complementary.

title: Sevtap 2016 Make Me Sexy Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Blackberry and candied rose aromas show on the tangy nose of this blend of 46% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 14% Cabernet Franc, 14% Petit Verdot and 6% Malbec. There is a peppery spice to the palate, which enhances the black-plum tang, and earthy flavors of pencil shavings mesh into the blackberry-juice core.

title: Three Stars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: With an earthy nose, this canned white tastes slightly reduced at first, but opens slowly to reveal nutty undertones beneath a fruity core of melon and fig. The mouthfeel is crisp and steely with a lasting lushness of richness.

title: Twisted Cedar 2017 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine is very concentrated, fruity and ripe in flavor, practically overflowing with blackberry and prune impressions. It is broad and mouthfilling in texture, rather soft on tannins and may have a hint of sweetness.

title: Dark Horse 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This medium-weight wine puts forward light spicy oak aromas followed by tasty black-cherry and raspberry flavors. It shows good balance and a welcome touch of tannins.

title: Chateau Souverain 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a tasty, easy-drinking wine. It shows ripe plum and peach flavors, a deceptively full body and a mouthfilling texture.

title: Au Contraire 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Made in a fruity, voluptuous style accented in a heartiness of oak, this is a widely appealing wine at a fair price point, creamy in texture and robust in tropical pineapple, mango and guava.

title: McClain Cellars 2016 Painted Dreams Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Wet stone and black-plum aromas show on the fairly reserved nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly wound and very dry, with only touches of dark fruit and violets coming through the veil at this point.

title: Plummy 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Medium to full bodied, broad and rich in mouthfeel, this wine doesn't taste exactly like its name, but shows plenty of other fruits like ripe cherry and berry aromas, pleasant, mouth-coating cherry and strawberry flavors and a rather soft texture.

title: Amici 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an amazing price point for a wine of quality and great vineyard sourcing. Steely high-toned acidity girds a midpalate that's low in oak and subdued in crisp apple fruit, with just a touch of tannin on the finish.

title: Broken Earth 2016 Limited Release Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a deep and dark take on Merlot, with aromas of fudge, black cherry, wet gravel and cigar box. The palate offers roasted wood and dark prune-like fruits, but impresses mostly with its weight and structure.

title: Crū 2016 Paraiso Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very light in color in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows light chalky aromas on the nose alongside lemon peel and candied honeysuckle. Green-apple-flesh flavors pop on the palate with bright citrus flashes.

title: Eponymous 2016 Proprietary White (Carneros)
description: This blends 84% Pinot Blanc and 16% Riesling into a waxy, viscous and floral expression of green apple, peach and jasmine. High in acidity, it offers a touch of weight within a light-bodied ripeness.

title: Fernwood 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This bottling, aged in 100% American oak, offers earthy aromas of forest floor, concentrated cassis and a balsamic berry sauce on the nose. Chunky sticky tannins deliver flavors of dark chocolate and dried berries, which turn tangy toward the finish.

title: Jeremy Wine Co 2017 Shinn Vineyard Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Hints of butterscotch and caramel in the aroma of this full-bodied wine are followed by baked apple and brown-sugar flavors and a rich soft texture. It has an appealing creaminess both in the flavors and the mouthfeel.

title: Karah Estate 2018 Tendance Passante Sparkling (California)
description: This is a fun, pop-top wine, orange-pink in color, a blend of Pinot Noir and Chenin Blanc. An inviting, floral-candied note of watermelon Jolly Rancher leads to interesting flavors of hazelnut and lemon, with plenty of acidity to buoy the light body.

title: Kokomo 2016 Mukaida Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This medium-bodied white has soft rounded corners of structure and flavor, a mix of tangy lemon and crunchy Gravenstein apple. The oak is helpful and well incorporated.

title: Precision Wine 2017 Fly By Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a fruit-forward and balanced white, crisp and fleshy in bold layers of pear and apple. The acidity is nicely integrated.

title: Riaza 2017 Sparkling Verdejo (Clarksburg)
description: This unusual sparkling wine made from Verdejo grapes goes for a doughy complexity that starts with an earthy, yeasty aroma and follows through with flavors like freshly baked bread and mineral water. It's on the light side in terms of fruit character, and is light to medium bodied.

title: Robert Mondavi 2017 Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 15% Sémillon, this white is bright in lemon, stone and anise, yet full-bodied in weight and breadth. It has a grip on the palate that emphasizes its ultimate power and concentration of fruit.

title: Black Ridge 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Candied black cherry makes for a very expressive, almost sweet nose on this bottling. The palate blossoms with purple flowers of lilac and jasmine, yet it is somewhat thin in body.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Pasofusion Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Full on the nose with ripe red fruits, this blend offers sweet wood and snapped sagebrush aromas as well. The palate shows tangy boysenberry and herbal flavors, framed by very tight drying tannins.

title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 Espionage Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dried black plums, purple flowers, toasted wood and a touch of funk show on the nose of this blend of 68% Malbec, 19% Cabernet Franc and 13% Petit Verdot. There's a strong, almost skunky herbal kick to the palate, which gives depth to the tart berry and black-plum-skin flavors.

title: Clos LaChance 2017 Erwin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Bright and ripe berry aromas kick of the nose on this bottling, which then offers a hint of crushed clove. The palate is very full and framed by chalky tannins, loaded with ripe berry, baking-spice and dried tarragon flavors.

title: Crū 2016 Vineyard Montage Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Red-cherry and baking-spice aromas make for a likable and easy nose on this bottling. The palate offers richer but tart Montmorency cherry flavors along with hints of thyme and dried garden herbs.

title: Iron Hub 2016 Small Lot Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied, ripe and rich wine swells with melon and pineapple flavors and feels soft and lazy in texture. It has low acidity and a buttery thread running through it.

title: Pianetta 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)
description: Earthy, somewhat rustic aromas of dried herbs and black cherry make for nicely layered nose. The palate offers gravelly, earthy, loamy flavors that complement the roasted strawberry core.

title: Tessier Winery 2017 Goldbud Vineyard Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: This bone-dry and tangy-tasting wine is medium bodied and rather lean in texture, while intriguing pepper, sage and charred beef flavors keep the palate activated. Moderate tannins give it a nice grip.

title: Collier Falls 2014 Hillside Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
