description: This is entirely varietal and estate-grown, a complex study in bacon fat, grilled meat and leather. The aromas are intensely powerful and lead to a sinewy midpalate of softly layered richness ending in black tar and olive.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2017 Jose S. Ferrer Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Jasmine and geranium combine for a forceful, floral entry into this white, which is full bodied and fleshy on the palate. Its dense display of pear and apple flavors are succulent and richly lush.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2016 Primitivo Clone Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: Thick, leathery and brawny in tannin, this substantive wine shows a wealth of toasted oak and full-bodied fruitiness, its flavors a twist of caramel, coffee and blackberry jam. Black pepper adds to the mix to emphasize an earthy, savory underbelly.

title: Trujillo 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a bright nose of cherry and currant, its tannins silky and seamless across the palate. It blends in smaller percentages of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec, with a chalky, herbal character that lingers in moderate structure and tannin weight.

title: Goldbelly Cellars 2016 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied but polished wine offers black-raisin and dark chocolate aromas and ripe blackberry and blueberry flavors on a smooth texture framed by abundant but fine-grained tannins. It's straightforward and delicious, showing off all those great fruit flavors.

title: Beringer 2016 Chabot Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Densely packed in tobacco and leather, this powerfully ripe, full-bodied wine is integrated in sturdy tannins with a lengthy palate. Black fruit dominates within this context, as the wine builds up steam and heat.

title: Foppiano 2016 Nonno's Block Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Bold, brawny and powerful in intensity, this ripe full-bodied wine offers dark chocolate, marshmallow and blueberry, with just the slightest hint of dried plum. Dusty tannin and oak are well integrated.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: Full bodied and heavily spiced with oak, this wine offers aromas of charcoal and wood smoke, flavors of blackberry and black pepper and a huge structure of alcohol and tannin. It's a dramatic, in-your-face wine that will be fun to drink with ribs or pulled pork.

title: Landmark 2016 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Golden in color, this is a soft, supple wine that's robustly flavored in pear, mango and vanilla. An earthiness also pervades around a rich grip of oak.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Petite Sirah (Amador County)
description: Fruity and full bodied, this huge wine offers ripe, juicy blackberry and black-cherry flavors. Firm tannins add structure to the rich mouthfeel.

title: Dubost 2016 Calleri Vineyard Negrette (San Benito County)
description: Extremely dark in the glass, this rarely seen variety offers unctuous aromas of black cherry and strong cassis on the massive nose. The sip lands with power and some grace, loaded with rich flavors of cassis cream and espresso that are suspended by thick tannins and decent acidity. This is a potent wine that grabs attention.

title: Red Car 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: An oaky nose of caramel and brioche gives way to a lighter, brighter midpalate of high-toned acidity and fresh flavors of lemon and tangerine. The ripeness is balanced and well integrated with the tannin and oak.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This delicious bottle starts off with robust aromas of cherry, sweet oak and mint. Polished but firm tannins uphold dark fruit, baking spice and a pinch of peppery herbs on the well-rounded, satisfying palate.

title: Kitá 2017 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very light in the glass, this is a delicate and floral spin on Chardonnay, starting with aromas of apple blossom, pear flesh and honeysuckle. It's light in body and quite mellow on the palate, offering clean apple pastry and Asian pear flavors.

title: Mooney Family 2018 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very ripe aromas of mango, papaya and candied Key lime show on the fresh and powerful nose of this bottling. The palate is also quite tropical and lush, with more mango, pineapple and tuberose flavors that are cut by a zesty acidity.

title: Testarossa 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light brushes of butter, golden pear, almond and lemon balm make for a very inviting nose on this appellation blend. The palate is a tad sweeter than expected, with flavors of apple syrup, pear galette and sea salt.

title: Dark Horse NV Brut Bubbles Sparkling (California)
description: This can of bubbles offers a lot of Chardonnay character in the apple and pear aromas and a lightly toasty vanilla accent. The flavors are layered but light and the acidity is fresh.

title: Ram's Gate 2018 Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dark in color, this is a biting, crisply tart wine that's lithe and lemony. Herbal and delightfully refreshing, it shows a complex core of rhubarb and strawberry that's undeniably appealing.

title: E16 2015 Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This beguiling wine has a carbonic intensity of earthy freshness alongside textured layers of orange and cherry. The finish is leathery and savory in tea and spice.

title: Epiphany 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The savory oak tones are prominent on the nose of this bottling, which also shows cassis and peppercorn on the lavish nose. Ripe flavors of blackberry jam are cut by smoke, bacon fat and more cracked pepper on the palate.

title: Flora Springs 2015 Rennie Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: A 100% varietal wine from a three-acre block on the producer's estate, this is an herbal, woody and earthy red wine. Generous helpings of oak and concentration grasp bold flavors of black cherry, currant as well as richer hits of dark chocolate and coffee.

title: Foxen 2016 Tinaquaic Vineyard Old Vines Dry Farmed Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Intriguing things happen on dry-farmed, old vine vineyards, and this bottling shows a wide-ranging nose of aromas, from boysenberry and sour violets to smoke, roasted game and singed rosemary. The palate offers sour berry and cedar flavors, proving rather tight at this stage of life.
designation: Tinaquaic Vineyard Old Vines Dry Farmed

title: Paraduxx 2015 Cork Tree Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 50% Malbec blended with 36% Cabernet Sauvignon and 14% Merlot, this red is broad in tannin and spicy oak, with plenty of structure and concentration. The fruit leans into bold flavors of strawberry and blueberry, the finish bright and lengthy.

title: Sojourn 2016 Riddle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This site is near the cool, fog-influenced town of Occidental and it shows plenty of cool-climate character. Robustly fruity on entry, it settles into a delicate midpalate of spicy orange, rhubarb and black tea, finishing with a lasting grace.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Drake Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: An elegantly structured medium-bodied white, this shows crisp green-apple and steel flavors, with subtle oak tones. Elements of Meyer lemon and melon add context and complementary flavor to a lengthy, succulent finish.

title: Jax 2017 Y3 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is a concentrated and layered concrete-fermented white. Apple, pear and mango figure into the flavor profile, with a dusting of nutmeg and clove tones.

title: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is a floral, concentrated white wine. The entry of lush crème brûlée and fig flavors are met by persistent honeysuckle and toasted oak tones.

title: Kokomo 2016 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Fruity and robust, this big-boned, ripe varietal wine is softly layered in baked strawberry, vanilla and cola. The oak is supportive and smoky.

title: Merry Edwards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: A perennially popular and well-made wine, this vintage is no exception, shining in concentrated, layers of rich, bold flavor. A sweetness of peach and vanilla complement a more exotic element of rose petal and black licorice.

title: Noble Tree 2016 Noble Blanc White (Chalk Hill)
description: This blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier does justice to both varieties, showing characteristics of honeysuckle, wet stone and lemon peel in a light, crisp package of elegant ripeness. Peach and apple round out the fresh flavors.

title: B Cellars 2016 Blend 26 Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a substantial blend of 68% Cabernet Sauvignon and 32% Cabernet Franc. Peppery, leathery and meaty, it has plenty of weight on offer and grippy tannins, the fruit leaning into savory black currant and a side helping of tobacco. Let this one sit a bit; enjoy best from 2021–2026.

title: Bennett Lane 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A juicy midpalate of raspberry and black cherry is met by polished tannin and integrated oak in this well-made wine from a soft, approachable vintage.

title: Bennett Lane 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Meaty, big-boned and steeped in both woody oak and tannin, this is a brawny full-bodied wine with ample concentration. The midpalate takes on a succulence of juicy black currant and black cherry, finishing with a leathery accent.

title: Concannon 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a successful, small-production white that's bright, textured and memorable in swathes of well-heeled grapefruit and Meyer lemon. A grassy undertone of pea shoots plays well against the crisp fruit.

title: Crū 2017 Wine Club Reserve Sarmento Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Cranberry, Bing cherry and sagebrush aromas make for a delicate nose in this small-lot bottling. There is a compelling crispness to the palate, where pomegranate and rose petal flavors align.

title: Darioush 2014 Signature Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from estate-grown Mount Veeder grapes, as well as Oak Knoll fruit. Sanguine in black olive, it has flavors of black currant, eucalyptus and bold, brawny oak. Grippy and gritty in texture, it offers integrated tannin and substantial ripeness.

title: Epiphany 2016 Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Blackberry jelly is lifted by wood spice and strong toasted cedar aromas on the nose of this blend of 56% Syrah and 44% Cabernet Sauvignon. Roasted aromas of coffee and charred meat give savory depth to the rounder berry fruit on the palate.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2017 Sparkling Rosé (Amador County)
description: Dry and crisp, this surprising wine made from Zinfandel grapes has a sophisticated and complex lees-aged character that gives a toasty note to the aroma, and light earthy oaky ginger and cherry flavors on the palate. While medium bodied, it is well concentrated and interesting to taste.

title: Flora Springs 2015 Wild Boar Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This comes from a site in Pope Valley on the eastern edge of the appellation, where the grapes are grown at 1,200-feet in elevation. Red currant, clove and turned earth top a layer of grippy reduction and sizable oak, with secondary elements of tar and leather.

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dried cranberries, peppercorns, sagebrush and turned earth aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is layered with bay leaf, eucalyptus and menthol tones, set against a dried dark-cherry backdrop.

title: Opaque 2014 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Dark boysenberry aromas are quite boisterous on the nose of this bottling, and pair well with the smoky oak tones. The palate is full of clean dark fruit and flowers as well as vanilla, riding a strong acidity deep into the finish.

title: Orsi Family 2014 Sagrantino (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is savory in nature while also rich and concentrated in dark fruit. A plush midpalate of plum and black currant takes on black olive and licorice notes as the wine opens.

title: Preston 2016 Estate Carignane (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, rare in these parts, this is made from organic and biodynamically farmed grapes. Floral wafts of violet and lavender open the palate to softly integrated layers of balanced earthiness, blueberry and dark cherry.

title: Rancho Victoria 2015 Reserve Syrah (Amador County)
description: Flavorful, polished and well structured, this inviting wine lures with its very ripe black-fruit aromas and delivers rich black-cherry, anise and cedar flavors. Soft interlaced tannins fill the mouth and carry its concentration through the finish.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2016 Tuscano Famiglia Collection Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Sophisticated, perfumed oak aromas and a great combo of opulent fruit flavors laced with baking spices and cedar make this Tuscan-style blend an interesting and complex wine. As full bodied and well structured as it is, it could stand in for a Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Westerhold 2016 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Herbal, stemmy and unusual, this is a tangy, layered and thickly robust wine with sizable tannin structure and weight. It holds up in the glass, allowing just enough acidity to freshen and intrigue.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This full-bodied wine is polished and well balanced, but quite concentrated too. It delivers black cherry and black-currant flavors on an almost creamy texture. Plenty of fine-grained tannins add good structure and the finish is lingering.

title: Pacific Redwood 2018 Organic Syrah (California)
description: This full-bodied and immensely fruity wine, with no added sulfites, has such intense and concentrated fruit that the black fig, dried cherry and blackberry seem to tumble over each other in the aromas and then spread rapidly over the palate. The wine is all about generosity, ripeness and mouthfeel, which build up to a lingering finish.

title: Doffo 2016 Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of purple flowers and grape syrup meet with dark mint, nutmeg and mace on the nose of this bottling. There's an intriguing hint of green peppercorn on the palate followed by blackberry, thyme and rosemary flavors.

title: August Briggs 2015 Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: Perfumed on the nose and thick on the palate, this wine is also high-toned in currant, red cherry and a spicy thread of nutmeg and pepper. The texture is leathery and lengthy, with a rich concentration of fruit that remains in balance.

title: B.R. Cohn 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Fresh and fruity, this is a light-bodied white that displays a lasting sense of crisp acidity. Flavors of ripe fig, pear and melon meld with a lasting tease of freshly squeezed lemon.

title: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Cloudy's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a hugely concentrated and powerfully built wine, chewy in tannin and oak. The fruit is overtaken by dark-chocolate and tobacco notes, richly voluptuous in texture and lasting ripeness.

title: Blair 2016 The Matriarch Delfina's Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Lemon peel, ripe nectarine, peach and pear flesh show on the nose of this bottling from cattle rancher-turned-vintner Jeffrey Blair. There is a taut texture to the palate, where sea salt, lemon and smoke qualities are mouthwatering.

title: Brick & Mortar 2018 Blanc White (California)
description: This is a steely, floral canned blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay, the grapes from both Clarksburg and the Napa Valley. It refreshes and shows varietal complexity within a refreshingly bright, well-put-together package of green apple and grapefruit.

title: Brick & Mortar 2018 Bubbles Rosé (California)
description: The winery sources whole cluster-pressed Syrah from Clarksburg and Sonoma Coast to make this lively, enjoyable can of sparkling, which has good acidity and tension. Effervescent, it offers textured, fresh flavors of strawberry patch, watermelon and lime.

title: Buena Vista 2016 Ida's Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy with a persistence of cola and clove, this wine has a delicate structure that's soft and rounded within a context of ripe power. Strawberry and orange compote give it a fruity underbelly beneath the savory ripeness.

title: Effort 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: One of the most pale pinks of the year, this rosé shows plump nectarine, pluot, lime and rose-bud aromas on the floral nose. There is a taut texture to the palate, which is clean, crisp and citrus-driven, with lime and hints of pink fruit.

title: Folie à Deux 2016 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: With a soft, moderate structure and light style, this is a well-integrated red that has balanced oak and tannin. Clove, cedar and forest notes season a core of plum and dark cherry, finished by a pleasing jolt of vanilla.

title: Isolde's Rapture 2016 Red (California)
description: Deep and delicious, this very concentrated and high-octane wine boasts rich chocolate and boysenberry aromas, saturated blackberry-jam flavors and a hefty but smooth texture. It has a bonanza of bold fruit notes and sufficient melted tannins to wrap up that fruit nicely.

title: Three Sticks 2016 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Juicy red fruit dominates in this powerhouse red from an estate site. A confectionery note of vanilla softens the toasted oak and substantial tannin as rocky mineral components give the fruit a savory edge of complexity and lingering texture.

title: Beckon 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This widely available, well-priced bottling is worth stocking up on. Creamy aromas of yellow peach, oak, butter and lemon are classic Chardonnay markers. The palate offers ripe peach, pear and apple flavors, cut by lime peel and decent tension. It's rich yet clean and balanced.

title: Brutocao 2015 Coro Red (Mendocino)
description: Starting with tempting, toasted oak and wood-smoke aromas, this full-bodied Zinfandel-based blend adds plenty of black-cherry flavors and a good grippy texture of moderate tannins. Brutocao is one of less than 10 Mendocino wineries that make the unique Coro series.

title: Campovida 2017 Tavolo Bianco White (Mendocino County)
description: This is a vibrant, dry wine that combines crisp green-apple, fennel bulb and citrus flavors on a lively structure of good acidity and medium body. Blended from Arneis and Friulano grapes, it holds back just a bit on ripeness, which makes it appetizing and easy to keep sipping.

title: Cass 2016 Rockin' One White (Paso Robles)
description: Broad aromas of white melon, creamy cherimoya, apple blossom and wet river stone make for a very showy nose on this blend of 45% Roussanne, 28% Marsanne and 27% Viognier. There is a flinty minerality to the palate, alongside flavors of lemon, apple and banana.

title: Cordant 2016 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very ripe aromas of boysenberry reduction sauce and dark nutmeg spice show on the nose of this bottling from a coveted vineyard at the southwest edge of the appellation. It explodes on the palate with rich, tangy flavors of red cherry compote, wild mint, clove and balsamic reduction.

title: Cuvaison 2015 Estate Grown Brut Rosé (Los Carneros)
description: This is the winery's first vintage of sparkling, made from 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Noir grown on the estate property. Cranberry red and orange in color, it delights in a moderate structure and tamed acidity that lifts the mélange of cherry, strawberry and raspberry on the palate. A twinge of grapefruit tartness hits nicely on the finish.

title: Furthermore 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy and in full embrace of forest floor and clove, this is a medium-built appellation red that offers dark, brooding flavors of strawberry and blackberry.

title: Heritance 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Thick in chocolate-covered plum, this is a soft, approachable and fairly priced wine that's broad in appeal and full-bodied style. It has a touch of reduction and oak as it finishes.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Broken Compass Saitone Vineyard Old Vine Carignane (Russian River Valley)
description: From a well-known old-vine site for Zinfandel, this wine shows the prowess of other varieties within its ground. Thick, leathery and tart, it retains plenty of acidity within a core of full-powered earth and stems. The richness is complemented by seasonings of white and black pepper.
designation: Broken Compass Saitone Vineyard Old Vine

title: La Crema 2015 Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Elegantly layered aromas of black cherry, wet sage and tobacco make for a rich and nuanced entry to this single-vineyard bottling. The palate is loaded with juicy cherry and mint flavors, proving quite powerful but still very approachable.

title: Mt. Brave 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot, this is a full-bodied concentrated red that's thick in tannin and youthful structure. Black fruit, sage, clove and cinnamon figure into the rich, lushly crafted palate that's integrated in toasted oak.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a warm and ripe, but well-structured wine that overflows with black cherry and blackberry flavor and has a rich texture of soft tannins and light acidity. The ripeness and intensity of the fruit flavors is practically irresistible.

title: Opolo 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Rich black cherry, vanilla and dark loamy soil make for a very fruity but pleasant entry to the nose of this bottling. There is a streak of candied black cherry on the palate but lots of tannic stiffness as well, with baking spice, pie crust and acidity carrying into the finish.

title: Pey-Marin 2016 Trois Filles Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: Just-ripe and warmly spicy, this inviting and light-bodied wine shows fresh red-cherry and plum aromas, broad and mouthfilling fruit flavors and moderate baking-spice and toast nuances from oak aging.

title: Poundstone 2016 Sangiacomo Catarina Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Fleshy, focused and bright, this wine also offers plenty of full-bodied richness and full flavor—a meaty take on baked apple, pear and a savory twist of olive.

title: Sbragia 2016 Nonno's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This offers a wealth of juicy dark plum and blackberry seasoned in cinnamon and nutmeg. Dusty cloves and texture dot a landscape of robust ripeness and richness that pleases the palate. This is blended with 10% Carignan and 5% Petite Sirah.

title: Smith & Hook 2015 Proprietary Red (Central Coast)
description: Rich and smoky on the nose, this hedonistic wine shows aromas of black currant, blackberry and milk chocolate. The palate is thick in flavors of fudge and black cherry, framed by chalky tannins and decent acidity to provide some balance.

title: Troublemaker NV Red (Central Coast)
description: This is a widely available, nonvintage blend of 54% Syrah, 15% Petite Sirah, 14% Grenache, 10% Mourvèdre and 7% Zinfandel. Aromas of caramelized black fruit, oak and black pepper lead into an extremely rich palate that's loaded with vanilla, caramel, fudge and black cherry.

title: Encanto 2014 Usibelli Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is thick and rich in chocolate and vanilla notes, with complementary aspects of dark cherry jam. Broadly structured and concentrated, it'll please the palate and wallet in equal measure.

title: Hawk and Horse Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: Serious and full bodied, this complex wine is made from organic grapes. It wafts aromas of mint, toasted oak and baking spices and delivers layers of black and red fruits, cedar and vanilla on the palate. It has moderate tannins and a mouthfiling texture. Best after 2023.

title: Kori 2017 San Saba Vineyard Syrah (Monterey)
description: There's a compelling mix of density and cool-climate qualities on this bottling, starting with aromas of black raspberry, blackberry, lavender, lilacs and green peppercorns on the nose. The cohesive palate unites flavors of roasted coffee and charred meats with fresh black currant and minty herbs.

title: Parrish Family 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dark in the glass, this bottling offers deep black-cherry aromas along with chipped graphite, wet slate and espresso bean. The palate combines violet, coffee-bean and black-fruit flavors into a cohesive, elegant and deliciously lush experience.

title: Rodney Strong 2016 Blue Wing Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This displays heady aromas of apple, ginger and toasted brioche. Juicy and lengthy, the palate dazzles in underlying mineral aspects of stone and earth.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Gypsy Rouge Red (Red Hills)
description: An enticing blend of oak spices and ripe berries gives this Grenache-based, full-bodied and very flavorful wine a great start, before it floods the palate with plush black-cherry and blackberry flavors wrapped in a velvety, softly tannic texture.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2017 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This appellation blend carries that aromatic hallmark of this winery's Chardonnays, with a streak of walnut oil that decorates the marmalade and toast tones. The palate is bright in acidity, giving energy to the flavors of walnut paste, dried orange peel and sun-dried honeysuckle.

title: Folktale 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This bottling is evidence of the strides winemaker David Baird has made in recent years to uplift this new brand. This white is what classic California Chardonnays should taste like when made in a balanced way. Aromas of butter, lemon peels, gardenia and chalk lead into toast, mango, pineapple and peach on the palate that hide behind an earthy, crushed, white-rock structure.

title: Joseph Jewell 2016 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Aged in French oak, 25% of it new, this is a pretty, bright and impressive wine, brimming in beautiful waves of strawberry and blackberry. The inviting aromas and fresh acidity balance out an undeniable power at the wine's core, reined in by structured tannin.

title: Judge Palmer 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and grippy in tannin, this is a complex, thickly concentrated wine, not shy in oak or power. The full-bodied intensity opens into an expanse of cherry cordial and spicy vanilla. This should do well in the cellar, so enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Kings Carey 2017 Spear Vineyards Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Extremely light in the glass, this bottling from the small block of Grenache in this newer vineyard is very aromatic on the nose, with strawberry, earthy chaparral and rooibos tea aromas. It's light and tense in texture on the sip, but the flavors of dried thyme, red plum and white pepper are fresh, lively and delicious.

title: Long Meadow Ranch 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a great varietal wine, with excellent quality particularly for the price. The red is well integrated, with underlying power and overall grace. Smoky black cherry, cassis and currant are accented by orange peel and high-toned acidity, finishing soft and supple in tannin.

title: Bonterra 2014 The Butler Red (Mendocino County)
description: Made by Winemaker Jeff Cichocki from biodynamic grapes grown in the Butler Ranch Vineyard, this opens with concentrated aromas of ripe blueberry and spice that move the full-bodied palate with equally focused fruit flavors. A velvety, lightly gripping texture and good fruit concentration help bring on a lingering finish.

title: Corley 2015 Yewell Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Dusty sage and tobacco highlight a rich, balanced and complex expression of the variety, in this case 100% and from one property. Thick, rich and tightly wound, it has underlying brightness and minerality that complement its sizable posture.

title: Crosby Roamann 2015 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
description: Violet perfume opens this memorable wine that is sourced from the Jaeger Ranch. Soft, supple, fleshy and lush, it's a seamless and full-bodied offering. Flavors of leather, vanilla and black cherry complement each other, with a hint of toasted oak that lingers on the finish.

title: Domaine de la Rivière 2017 El Diablo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This new Russian River Valley producer is working with both estate fruit and grapes from mighty sites like El Diablo. Here, winemaker Kale Anderson coaxes tremendous power and flavor from the site, not sacrificing perfumed aromatics of rose and lavender along a midpalate of strawberry and smoky cherry. Full bodied, it has lovely tension and freshness.

title: Ex Post Facto 2017 Syrah (Santa Barbara)
description: Greg Brewer explores the savory side of Syrah in this bottling, which delivers aromas of thyme, green peppercorn, charred beef and elderberry on the nose. The palate packs in herbs and peppercorns but also thicker black-currant flavors, providing both flavorful depth and textural richness.

title: Goldeneye 2016 The Narrows Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This full-bodied full-flavored wine marries luscious ripe fruit flavors with a generous helping of well-integrated oak spices like cinnamon, clove and nutmeg. The mouthfeel is broad and rich, the tannins are supple and the finish lingers nicely.

title: Joseph Phelps 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This lovely wine shows exceptional quality and complexity within a bold, expansive package of thick, grippy tannin and layered flavors of blackberry, tobacco and smoked meat. It is blended with 7% Merlot, 3% Petit Verdot and 2% each of Malbec and Petit Verdot.

title: Sanford 2015 Founders Vines Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From the original own-rooted vines planted by Richard Sanford and Michael Benedict in the early 1970s, this bottling offers earthy aromas of dried oyster mushrooms in paper bags, lanolin, smoke and smashed raspberry. The damp earth elements wrap the palate as well, where dried berries and leather make for a very Old World expression that grows more fascinating with each sip.

title: Seabold Cellars 2018 Rodnick Farm Old Vines Pinot Blanc (Chalone)
description: It's always a joy to taste the old vines of Chalone, and this bottling captures their unique qualities, starting with aromas of apple syrup, hazelnut and toasted pecan. The palate offers almond, Meyer lemon and a creamy oak flavor that lingers on the tongue for a long time—all very unique elements.

title: August West 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Cranberry and mulberry aromas meet with green herbs and very tangy balsamic raspberry notes on the nose of this bottling. That tang is overpowering on the palate, where sharp balsamic tones cut through the underlying red fruits.

title: AVA Grace Vineyards 2017 Citrus Floral Refined Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This flavorful wine exudes bright peach aromas, and turns riper and softer on the palate, where peach and apricot flavors and low acidity make it soothing and mouthfilling.

title: Beaucanon 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine in spirit, this is a thick rich wine blended with 10% Petit Verdot and a half percent of Malbec. Blueberry and currant highlight a palate of chalky tannin and toasted oak.

title: Böen 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Sonoma County-Santa Barbara County)
description: An extra-deep color and obvious oaky cedary aromas are followed by flavors of chocolate and blackberry jam in this full-bodied, almost over-the-top wine.

title: Briceland 2016 Dark Horse Vineyard Syrah (Mendocino County)
description: Made from organic grapes, this wine is sturdy, well-structured and medium to full bodied. Moderate fruit flavors, a light spiciness and supportive crisp tannins give it a restrained but satisfying style.

title: Delectus 2014 French Wedding Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: Meaty and brimming in smoky oak, this is a boldly ripe and richly crafted red wine, with just 1% Cabernet Franc in the mix. The tannin grip is significant and substantial.

title: Delta 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Brick and Mortar winemaker Matthew Iaconis turns his attention to making this affordable red sourcing from multiple cool-climate sites. Burly in black strawberry, it has supportive acidity and a simplicity to the texture, finishing in a waft of rose and lavender. The proceeds from the wine go to environmental causes.

title: Emmi Cellars 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This has a candied nose of sweet peach that gets wrapped up in grassy, herbal notes and a chunkiness on the palate of concentrated acidity.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2018 Dry Rosé of Sangiovese (Sonoma County)
description: This has bright red-fruit notes met by stone-fruit elements of peach and apricot. Robust in body and flavor, it has lush texture and lasting hints of sage and smoked meat.

title: Highway 12 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Perfumed and thick in tannin, this is an intensely aromatic and layered wine, showing highlights of clove, tobacco and clove. The fruit is nuanced and quiet, a mix of currant and cranberry.

title: Merriam 2014 Windacre Estate Merlot (Russian River Valley)
description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc, this is an earthy red. Tart acidity and thick tannins provide the frame for full-bodied flavors of baked cherry and plum.

title: Mesa Del Sol 2014 Prima Rossa Red (Arroyo Seco)
description: Light and crisp aromas of pomegranate, strawberry and rose buds show on the nose of this blend of Zinfandel, Syrah, Sangiovese and Grenache. The palate's red-fruit tones are lifted by dried herb flavors and the sour tinge of black-plum skins.

title: Muscardini 2014 Vadasz Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Chewy tannins form around big bold flavors of tobacco, turned earth, blueberry and mocha in this substantially concentrated wine. A leathery backbone gives it softness against the richness.

title: Rippey 2015 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: This bold and smoky wine has a heavy oak influence that shows up in the wood-smoke aromas and charred black-pepper flavors. It is full bodied, quite tannic and dominated by woodiness more than fruitiness.

title: Smokescreen 2016 The Chemist Red (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry aromas are dusted by prominent oregano, charred wood and sweet tobacco-leaf tones on the nose of this blend. Sour black-plum flavors meet with herbs and gamy meats on the palate.

title: Taft Street 2015 Garagistes Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tightly wound in tannin and oak, this is a textured full-bodied wine highlighted in savory earth tones and a contrast of tart high-toned fruit.

title: The Blending Lab 2016 PS Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Sour blackberry, violet and a hint of pepper show on the nose of this bottling. The purple-flower flavors shine through on the palate, as do blackberry-jam and teriyaki meat flavors, and the finish is very tangy.

title: August West 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very tangy aromas of grenadine, red plum and raspberry vinegar kick off the nose on this appellation blend. The palate is also extremely tangy with black-plum skin and more balsamic notes.

title: Crux 2017 Grenache Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This white is light in style, blended with 15% Viognier, which is creamier and more viscous. Apple, honey and fig define its delicate nature.

title: Fallbrook 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Sweet-leaning aromas of apple, pear, orange skin and concentrated honeysuckle show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers light apple and green-pear-skin flavors.

title: New Clairvaux 2018 St. James Block Assyrtiko (Tehama County)
description: This light-bodied wine smells a bit floral and minerally, tastes delicate, mildly fruity and floral, and has a crisp and refreshing profile. It's made at a Cistercian monastery in the northern interior of California.

title: Peju 2016 Fifty/Fifty Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: An equal partnership between Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is thick and richly layered in red fruit, smoothened tannin and creamy, weighted texture. It has a touch of dried herb and cedar, but leads with density and power.

title: Rideau 2017 Peake Ranch Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated aromas of boysenberry paste and crushed grapeseeds show on the nose of this small-batch bottling of just two barrels. The palate is strong, with flavors of tangy black plum and other dark fruits.

title: Roblar 2018 Fumé Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crisp green-apple and Asian pear aromas meet with a touch of apple blossom on the nose of this bottling. The palate is dry and slightly sour with Granny Smith apple and lemon-peel flavors.

title: Rock Wall 2017 Heringer Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Clarksburg)
description: This wine exudes distinct fruit and savory flavors that make a nice change of pace. It's well balanced, full bodied but not extreme, lifting red and black currant above black plum and showing accents of roasted herbs and black olive.

title: Saint Gregory 2015 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This is a substantial wine, firm in structure and offering good black-fruit flavors and modest but spicy forest-floor accents. It feels tight and restrained, but should open with time. It will be best after 2021.

title: Tantara 2017 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Bright strawberry aromas on the nose of this bottling meet with slightly funky shiitakes cooked in a cran-raspberry sauce. The palate is very tangy, with red-plum skin flavors, enhanced with a touch of herbs.

title: Uvaggio 2018 Vermentino (Lodi)
description: This bright and concentrated wine combines ripe apple and peach in equal proportions, with lively herb and mineral notes. It has a refreshing balance and vivid flavors.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Double Dog Red Five Paws Vineyard Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Rustic aromas of brick, red cherry and blistered red plum show on the nose of this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah. It's a little light on the palate, where pleasant flavors of roasted red plum and strawberry meet with sagebrush and wild herbs.
designation: Double Dog Red Five Paws Vineyard

title: Twisted Cedar 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine offers ripe fruit aromas, a rich smooth texture and a good touch of crisp acidity for balance. The addition of 2% Gewürztraminer and 2% Viognier help elevate the fruitiness.

title: Thomas Allen 2017 Selections Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This solid and well-made wine is one of the best deals in California Cab. It does not go for overt oak or over-ripeness, but offers honest black-cherry and black-currant flavors, subtle vanilla and spice notes, a good structure of moderate tannins and a nice heft on the palate. It can fill in at almost any meal.

title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Chardonnay (California)
description: This crowd-pleasing, medium-bodied wine is flavorful, well balanced and fruity enough, showing spicy oak accents in a supporting role.

title: Amador Cellars 2016 Estate Grenache Noir (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This agreeable and balanced wine is fruit-forward, plummy and smooth, supported by subtle acidity and light tannins. It's not competing for attention, but quietly delivers pleasure.

title: Amador Cellars 2016 Family Reserve Miscela Italiana Red (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This blend of Primitivo, Aglianico and Barbera is very smooth, very concentrated and very fruity, offering focused black-cherry and raspberry-jam flavors that are quite ripe but still nicely dry.

title: Danza del Sol 2015 Super Tuscan Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Tangy boysenberry and black-plum aromas show on the nose of this blend of 61% Sangiovese, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Cabernet Franc and 2% Merlot. Rustic flavors of dusty berries and dried herbs ride chalky tannins and toasted wood flavors into the finish.

title: Josh Cellars 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This flavorful well-balanced wine feels firm from fine-grained tannins and offers vivid black-cherry and red-cherry flavors. It has the kind of taut mouthfeel that will pair well with rich proteins.

title: Rideau 2016 The Brassman Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Violet candies, turned earth, tobacco leaf and grape-seed aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the McGinley Vineyard. There are strong tobacco-leaf flavors on the palate alongside dank herbs and tangy black plum.

title: Tribute 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Ripe bright fruit flavors are wrapped in seductive spicy oak in this medium-bodied, smooth-textured wine. Aromas like toasted bread, baking spices and pencil shavings almost overwhelm the black-plum flavors, and they're hard to resist.

title: McManis 2018 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Chardonnay (River Junction)
description: This is a well-balanced, medium-bodied wine that stays to the middle of the road, offering equal parts ripe fruit and buttery oak. It's a straightforward pour that should please a diverse crowd of drinkers.

title: Bella Grace 2018 Viognier (Amador County)
description: Attractive floral aromas and melon-like flavors make this medium-bodied wine a crowd-pleaser. It shows decent concentration, good balance and a fairly lively texture.

title: Calcareous 2016 Signature Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows prominent fruit-forward aromas of blackberry jam and oak, proving quite familiar and rich. Once sipped, the wine fills the mouth with texture and flavor, combining the dark fruit tones with baking-spice and woody notes, and finishing on vanilla.

title: Di Bruno 2018 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very pale in the glass, this is a sprightly, zesty spin on the often tepid grape, offering loads of lily, lemon-lime soda and peach aromas on the nose. The sip is very zippy with acidity and near effervescence, showing peach and fresh lime-juice flavors.

title: Domaine Della 2017 Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Full bodied and robustly velvety in style, this offers a richness of vanilla and baking spice around core elements of rhubarb, strawberry and orange peel. The flavors come together around supple integrated tannin and oak, with a deft thread of acidity throughout.

title: Domaine Della 2017 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This Ritchie white shows robust, fleshy structure and earthy, floral and complex components of fresh tropical fruit and strong tannin. Full bodied and expressive in pineapple, lanolin and mango, it has plenty of backbone and power.

title: Domaine Della 2017 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rich and earthy, this is a robust, full-bodied and memorable wine from the great site. Soft supple tannins support a core of baked plum, cardamom and dusty crushed rock, with stemmy black tea and clove playing supporting roles.

title: Goldeneye 2016 Confluence Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A smoky toasted oak aroma leads to spicy oaky flavors and full body in this assertively styled wine. A doughy scent is followed by very ripe cherry and blackberry flavors shaded by cinnamon, vanilla and tobacco. The oakiness dominates and will be an added attraction for people who like this style.

title: Hall 2016 The North End Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a powerful, richly woven wine, substantially earthy and savory in spirit. Elements of cedar, pencil shavings, sage and tobacco characterize an expansive and weighty mouthfeel of explosive tannin and robust oak.

title: Herencia 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Chiles Valley)
description: Intensely flavored in blackberry and cherry, this is a grippy full-bodied wine, with underlying acidity that freshens its bolder tendencies impressively. Lavender, black licorice and dried herb add to the complexity and layering of character.

title: Kokomo 2018 Pauline's Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Light, delicate flavors of mint, watermelon and strawberry give this delightful wine a burst of intensity on the midpalate, evolving into a creamy middle of lush richness. It finishes high-toned in stone and mineral.

title: Lava Cap 2016 Reserve Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: This is a pure and focused wine that's uncomplicated by too much oak or overripeness. It offers the dark, dense concentrated black-fruit flavors of the variety on a firm, tannic texture. It's built for aging and should be best from 2023–2030.

title: Le Casque 2016 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is huge but well balanced and well polished, so it's fun to drink now or can be saved until more of the tannins are resolved. Lightly spicy aromas are followed by delicious blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors on a mouthfilling texture of fine-grained tannins and full body. It is best from 2022–2030.

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2017 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Full and pleasantly rustic aromas of cherry, cranberry, sagebrush, roasted game and crushed gravel show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The palate is also savory and full of intriguing flavors, showing roasted pork in mulberry and cranberry sauce with a pinch of oregano.

title: Opaque 2016 Darkness Red (Paso Robles)
description: Smoked black cherry, cola and charred oak show on the nose of this red blend. There is compelling density to the palate, where strong but polished tannins frame flavors of root beer, baking spice and black currant.

title: Orfila 2016 Estate Roussanne
description: Creamy nectarine, sea salt, cherimoya and a hint of caramel strike a compelling balance between savory tones and fresh fruit on the nose. The palate also walks a fine line between fresh citrus and underlying creaminess, with hints of honey, peach and more salt. Tingling acidity ensures long aging potential. Drink now–2026.

title: Proulx 2016 Jack Barrett Red (Paso Robles)
description: This detailed blend of 32% Syrah, 21% Grenache and then 11 other grapes hits the mark, with aromas of black plum, wet gravel, wild mint and sage on the nose. The palate proves elegant in presentation, with wild black raspberry, elderberry, Concord grape and a decent display of herbal flavors.

title: Vincent 2016 Family Reserve Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very oaky and rich on the nose, the wine begins with dense aromas of black cherry and vanilla. The palate is silky in texture, offering flavors of roasted black cherry, loamy soil and vanilla cola, making for a dense, lush experience.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2015 V Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is made with organically farmed grapes from the property's steepest terrain, a tribute to the winery's founder, Volker. Powerfully built, it's thick, herbal and oaky, layered in juicy red fruit, sage, cocoa dust and crushed rock. The mineral aspects are profound. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Adroît 2017 Volage Petillant-Naturel Rosé Sparkling (Monterey County)
description: Cloudy and a creamy pink color in the glass, this pét-nat shows strawberry bubblegum and red-berry sorbet on the nose. The palate is loaded with full flavors of Ruby Red grapefruit and guava, making for a very refreshing and fun-loving sparkler.

title: Blair 2014 The Reserve Delfina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Light in the glass, this reserve bottling offers dried red cherries, dried thyme and rusty minerality on the nose. The palate shows bright cherry and rosebud, with wet gravel and a slate-driven minerality, proving mellow but pleasant and complex.

title: Croma Vera 2018 Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Brisk aromas of Pink Lady apple and freshly cut grapefruit make for an enveloping but not overbearing nose. Flavors of Key lime and tangerine are judiciously mellow on the palate, making for a flavorful yet still crisp wine.

title: Gainey 2016 Patrick's Vineyard Selection Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: For a hearty blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Merlot and 8% Petit Verdot, this bottling is fresh and snappy, with aromas of black raspberry and blackberry, yet there are also richer tones of charred oak, graphite and brown sugar. The palate is cohesive with flavors of black plum and black currant, layered with cocoa and peppercorn toward a pie crust finish.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Cask 23 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This gorgeous wine combines the best of two historic vineyards—Fay and S.L.V.—into one cohesive, refined whole. A soft entry of woody spice and toasted oak leads the way to an expansive midpalate of currant, crushed rock, dried herb and elegant tannins begging for further time in the bottle. Enjoy 2026–2036.

title: Chappellet 2015 Pritchard Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a powerfully concentrated and constructed wine, with 14% Petit Verdot and 8% Malbec. Dark, inky and reductive, it offers waves of tar, leather and toasted oak within sinewy tannins. Chewy black fruit is structured around wild elements of cedar, dried herb and sage, with lingering notes of clove. This is one to let settle; enjoy best from 2025–2030.

title: Obsidian Ridge 2016 Half-Mile Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This layered, complex and polished wine is compelling from the first scent of clove, black plum and black cherry to the rich, saturated flavors and the lingering spiced-plum finish. A warm layer of soft tannins envelops the palate as subtle blackberry and dark-chocolate notes emerge with repeated sipping and linger on the finish. Aged for 18 months in all new Hungarian Kadar barrels, it will mature through 2030.

title: Diamond Creek 2016 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: From a five-acre section of the vineyard, this classic red is blended with 8% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc. Crushed rock, red fruit and warm baking spices combine around a grippy midpalate of leather, clove and tobacco—the power gracefully persistent. The finish is brambly and bright. Allow this youthful wine to age; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

title: Longoria 2017 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Floral tones of rose petal and lavender kick off the nose on this bottling from Rick Longoria's estate vineyard, followed by waves of concentrated black plum and mace. The palate pairs boysenberry with black plum, lavender with lilac and licorice with nutmeg in a complex display.

title: Côtière 2017 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright aromas of Bing cherry are leveled by white sage and tea leaf on the complex and cohesive nose of this bottling. It's clean on the palate with tart cranberry and pomegranate flavors that lead into wild thyme and chaparral scrub, framed by expertly balanced acidity and mouthfeel.

title: Benovia 2016 Cohn Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: From a low-yielding vineyard planted in 1970, this is aromatic in tones of rose, geranium and carnation. Tight, youthful tannins wrap around flavors of earth, red cherry, rhubarb and leather on the palate. This should do well in the cellar; best 2021–2026.

title: Cenyth 2018 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Sonoma County)
description: Made entirely from the one variety, this is light in color and beautifully composed, a study in structure and graceful texture. Red cherry and pomegranate play around complementary characteristics of rose, dried herb and cedar, finishing with plenty of fresh acidity.

title: LaRue 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Juicy in fresh cherry, strawberry and rhubarb, this delightful wine sourced from two of owner and winemaker Katy Wilson's single-vineyard designates (Rice-Spivak and Thorn Ridge) intrigues in unexpected nuances of nutmeg and white pepper. Fresh, lively and earthy, it is incredibly good.

title: LaRue 2017 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Owner and winemaker Katy Wilson makes very little of this wine sadly, so stock up if you can. Stony mineral and brine figure prominently on entry as a buildup of Meyer lemon, fig and quince define the juicy midpalate of restrained oak and ripeness. Lingering acidity keeps it fresh through a long, spicy finish.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Old Vines Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tangy, forested, brawny and brooding in exotic floral earthiness, this is a delicious wine made in a full-bodied, robustly ripe style that appeals. Asian spice, cola and jammy black cherry are featured within the rich layering of complex texture, finishing softly satisfying.

title: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: From the great vineyard site in Carneros, this 100% varietal wine from the site's oldest vines is earthy, rugged and generous in flavor, oak and heat, with a persistence of structure and tannin. It unfurls itself slowly to show succulent cassis, nutmeg, graphite and blueberry compote, layers of complexity that lead to a soft, graceful finish.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Terraces Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Crushed white rocks, Asian pear, a touch of butter and a hint of pineapple converge on the nose of this deliciously complex bottling. There is extreme tension on the palate, where lively lemongrass and taut white-fleshed fruit flavors are expertly subtle and will only improve for decades. Drink now through 2037.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 AMDG Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is brimming in tones of earth, stems, black cherry and blood orange. It shows impressive breadth and structure, yet finishes graceful in a lively balance of acidity.

title: Larkmead 2016 LMV Salon Red (Napa Valley)
description: With 53% Cabernet Franc taking the lead in concert with 47% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is an herbal, earthy wine from the producer's estate, showing sage, cedar and pencil shavings. Old school and classic in approach, it has weight and breadth, with moderate underlying acidity, grippy tannin and a show of oak. This should be cellared; enjoy best 2026–2031.

title: Smith-Madrone 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)
description: This gorgeous, acid-driven Chardonnay is made from the producer's dry-farmed estate. Stone, apricot, apple, pear and fig ride along a focused, linear palate. Barrel fermentation has lent texture and nuance without distraction. It finishes succulent, soft and inviting.

title: Côtière 2017 La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean aromas of yellow peach, roasted pome fruit, light caramel, toast and delicious oak show on the nose of this bottling by Kevin Law. The palate is quite exotic and unique, combining roasted wood, dried peach and mango with hints of saffron, olive oil and aged cheese.

title: Benovia 2017 Three Sisters Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This gorgeous wine offers aromas of peach, pear and fluffy brioche on the nose, with a rounded, rich and fleshy palate boasting similar flavors. Elegantly structured, it delves deeper into mineral aspects of flint and stone as it opens in the glass, finishing undeniably crisp in tones of apple and Meyer lemon.

title: Arietta 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sourced predominantly from the Coombsville appellation, this is a stunning, beautifully aromatic wine made with 3% Petit Verdot. Winemaker Andy Erickson coaxes clove, red currant and a bite of acidity from soft, seamlessly rounded layers of classic structure and grace. Earthy tones of gravel and dried herb provide contrast to the powerful fruit. Enjoy best from 2026–2030.

title: McKinney 2018 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Clean aromas of rainy cement, sharp cut grass and lime blossom show on the refreshing nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp and lively, with grapefruit juice, grass and passion fruit flavors leading toward a taut finish.

title: Opolo 2018 Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Grassy aromas of Granny Smith apples, struck stone and guava peel show on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The palate is zesty and refreshing, offering flavors of green fruits and herbs, as well as riper fruits in the delicious midpalate.

title: Rincon Mountain 2016 Dusty Vinyl Red (Paso Robles)
description: Wet slate, baked boysenberry and a hint of pie crust show on the nose of this blend of 44% Syrah, 33% Mourvèdre and 23% Grenache. The palate combines berries with slate and soil flavors, all framed by sandy tannins.

title: Terra Valentine 2015 Wurtele Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is a spicy, herbal and thickly concentrated wine, grippy in tannin and brawny black fruit. The big flavor is complemented by complex elements of cedar, clove and cigar box—lasting notions on the finish that would benefit from more time in bottle. Enjoy best from 2025–2030.

title: Three Thieves 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This exuberant wine is packed with expressive fruit aromas and irresistible flavors that range from cherry to black plum and blackberry. No noticeable oak gets in the way of the wine's fruit flavors. Medium body, good balance and gentle tannins make it easy to sip.

title: Dawn's Dream 2018 Clone 236 Pinot Noir Rosé (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Hints of strawberry and nectarine meet with river stones on the nose of this very pleasing Pinot Noir-based rosé. It's high toned on the palate, with fresh acidity and broad flavors of peach and red plum, with a long-lasting zip.

title: Doffo 2016 Motodoffo Gran Tinto Red (California)
description: In a frosted glass bottle with a stylish sketch of a vintage motorcycle, which the winery's father-son owners regularly race, this blend of 85% Zinfandel and 15% Petite Sirah blends oregano and fennel frond with black currant and caramel on the nose. Soft blueberry and pepper spice show on the palate, along with a touch of licorice.

title: Eberle 2018 Côtes-du-Rôbles Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 55% Grenache Blanc, 30% Roussanne and 15% Viognier starts with aromas of peach, mango and tuberose. The palate sizzles on citrus at first, then comes a richer nectarine flavor, with a finish full of savory salt.

title: Grimm's Bluff 2015 Estate Petit Verdot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Dense aromas of black plum, dried herbs and loamy soil show on the nose of this bottling by proprietor Rick Grimm. There is compelling tension to the palate, where stiffer tannins allow elderberry, purple-flower and char flavors to shine through.

title: Grimm's Bluff 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: From a stunning estate that was planted biodynamically, this bottling, which is the first for this project by newly hired winemaker Ernst Storm, offers aromas of cut grass, dried grapefruit rinds and lime zest on the nose. Stony flavors of wet cement make for a fresh and compelling palate, with flavors of green-pear skin, lime rind and dried hay all apparent.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2015 Beatty Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: With a sizable tannin structure and powerful concentration, this is a mountain wine, no doubt, with dusty sage and dried herb secondary to dense dark chocolate, blackberry and currant. The palate grips and demands more time to mellow. Enjoy best from 2025–2030.

title: Koehler 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a fresh and tropical approach, with sharp mango and tuberose aromas showing strongly on the nose. The palate moves toward a more elegant display, combining that mango with clean and light guava jelly on toast flavors.

title: Mathew Gibson 2014 Estate Primitivo (Sierra Foothills)
description: This serious and complex wine shows bold flavors, big structure and a good dash of spicy oak. It is full bodied, peppery and berry-like in flavor, has firm tannins for grip on the palate and a lingering finish.

title: McKinney 2017 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Strong floral aromas of violet and rose met with dense boysenberry-jam aromas on the nose of this bottling from a coveted vineyard west of the Sta. Rita Hills. Earthier tones take over once sipped, with wild herbs and crushed gravel flavors getting lift from pomegranate and star anise.

title: McKinney 2017 Spear Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The cool-climate aspects of this newer vineyard come through on this bottling, which starts with aromas of freshly trampled hibiscus, blackberry, roasted beef and bloody rust. The palate's initial impression of boysenberry pie picks up cracked pepper and game as it opens.

title: Meadow View 2016 Isabelle's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Lamorinda)
description: The ripe and rich fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine are shaded by light oak spices and shaped by soft tannins. It is mouthfilling in texture, coating the palate with opulent black-cherry and dried cherry flavors.

title: Midnight 2018 Aurora White (Paso Robles)
description: Shy on the nose at first, this mostly equal blend of Viognier, Picpoul Blanc, Grenache Blanc and Roussanne emerges with aromas of Key lime and magnolia blossom. The palate is also delicately subtle, offering refreshing and crisp flavors of chilled white peach and mango.

title: OVR 2018 Old Vine Rosé (California)
description: Balanced and beautiful, this light- to medium-bodied wine made from Rhône varieties offers everything in appealing proportions. Jazzy raspberry aromas are followed by subtle cherry and rhubarb flavors on a crisp texture.

title: Tiny House Vineyard 2017 W.E. Bottoms Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Velvety, sumptuous and high toned, this wine has sizzling acidity as its foundation, which provides a lift to deft flavors of orange, rhubarb and pomegranate. Spicy clove and cardamom nip at its edges alongside a lovely hint of lavender.

title: Walt 2017 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Matchstick and flinty aromas rise from the glass of this rounded, rich and highly appealing wine. Melon, vanilla bean, hazelnut and a light spice of nutmeg characterize the flavors that highlight a medium-bodied frame of tense structure and grace.

title: Parker Station 2018 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: There's a bit of apparent fizz to the poured wine in this twist-top bottling, which starts with aromas of rusty cranberry. Roasted cherry and pomegranate-syrup flavors show on the palate.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Herbaceouus and varietal, this is a light-bodied, soft and approachable red wine made to appeal broadly and it does. Lush on the palate, it offers dark cherry, plum and a lasting flavor of vanilla-tinged oak.

title: Thomas Allen NV Muscat (Lodi)
description: Semisweet on the palate and rich in texture, this fruity and floral-scented wine could work well with aged cheeses or even a salty main course, as well as for dessert.

title: Wilson Creek 2018 Harmony Vineyard Family Reserve Roussanne (Temecula Valley)
description: Lemons, iron, peach-extract and olive-oil aromas make for an interesting entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is viscous and somewhat sweet, with flavors of cantaloupe and seared lemon.

title: Wolff 2017 Red Wolff Red (Central Coast)
description: A bit extracted on the nose, this kitchen-sink blend of 34% Merlot, 29% Cabernet Sauvignon, 17% Grenache, 11% Barbera and 9% Syrah offers aromas of blackberry, dried tarragon, lavender and grape seed. It's sour on the palate, with black-plum skin and light licorice flavors, framed by itchy tannins.

title: Bota Box 2018 Rosé (California)
description: This light-bodied wine tastes mildly fruity and straightforward, offering watermelon and raspberry flavors on a reasonably crisp texture.

title: Kirkland Signature 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A deep color and concentrated black-cherry flavor gives this full-bodied wine some classic Cabernet character. Dense fruit and lightly spiced oak tones meld with a light snap of tannin to firm up the texture.

title: Bogle 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine is smooth and mellow, easygoing in texture and nicely ripe in flavor. It has a rather soft mouthfeel and light tannins.

title: Bogle 2018 Rosé (California)
description: Pleasant and light bodied, this wine is pale pink and offers delicate peach flavors. Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Zinfandel grapes.

title: Entropy Cellars 2016 S Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine lays on the chocolate and baking spices in a thick layer over very ripe, jammy berry flavors underneath. Think of it as a showy red blend with a touch of sweetness.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2017 Tre Terre Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned, floral and earthy, with a substantial imprint of oak, this is a medium-bodied white that dances around full flavors of lemon meringue, apple pie and brioche. The finish is heavy in butter and nutmeg.

title: Jeff Runquist 2017 Barbera (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine is an oak bomb from the smoky charred cedary aromas to the flavors of toasted baguette and baking spices to the rather tart and moderately tannic texture.

title: Noble Vines 2017 181 Merlot (California)
description: This meaty wine offers aromas of cured ham and wood smoke followed by roasted plum flavors, moderate tannins and medium body.

title: William Hill Estate 2017 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Fat aromas of black cherry, vanilla, caramel and oak all arise on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with oak alongside ripe cherries and berries. It's pleasant although simple.

title: Oak Grove 2018 Family Reserve Chardonnay (California)
description: Balancing fruity and oaky flavors, this medium-bodied Chardonnay shows good crisp apple and ripe pear notes that are coated with butter and vanilla. The texture is on the soft side.

title: Chateau Souverain 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas of candied fruit and maple dominate the aromas of this medium-bodied, oaky and spicy wine. A firm texture is appealing and the seemingly sweet spiciness is front and center.

title: California Roots 2017 Moscato (California)
description: This sweet wine shows wonderful fruit aromas, concentrated, ripe and spicy fruit flavors and a mouthcoating sugary texture.

title: Wine Cube 2017 Red (California)
description: This wine is dark in color, very ripe and spicy in flavor and has an almost thick, mouthcoating texture. The blackberry, dark-chocolate and black-pepper notes are intense.

title: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine offers plenty of varietal character in the grassy snap-pea aromas and tangy fruit flavors that come with a crisp texture.

title: Barefoot NV Malbec (California)
description: A grape jam aroma and flavor gives this wine an easy, approachable style. It feels soft in texture and ends ripe and fruity.

title: La Crema 2015 Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This full-bodied red is smooth and silky on the palate, swirled in tangy, tart acidity that buoys the concentration of power. Crisp red fruit and subtle undertones of earthiness and rose make for a succulent core built around firm tannin and integrated oak.

title: Ojai 2016 Kick On Ranch Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of wet clay, grapefruit zest, white flowers and apple flesh show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard close to Los Alamos. It's very grippy and chalky on the palate, where nectarine and ripe apple flavors play out.

title: Starr 2014 Phil's Selection Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: Big and brawny but well balanced, this full-bodied wine is a blend of selected lots. It combines roasted, meaty aromas with ripe blueberry, chocolate and black-pepper flavors. A firm structure gives it good heft on the palate, too.

title: The Withers Winery 2017 Claire's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Creamy toffee and vanilla meet a structured midpalate of concentrated fruit and supportive oak in this white made from a vineyard in Occidental. Back-end acidity gives it persistent freshness and lift in the glass, with a spicy nutmeg finish.

title: Thomas Fogarty 2016 Mindego Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The nose on this single-vineyard expression is quite reserved at first, but shows darker red fruits and baking spice with patience. The palate is also shy to release its flavors of black pepper, black plum and black cherry, yet the firm tannins and buoyant acidity ensure a long life.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Rich Vineyard Picpoul (Ventura County)
description: This is a good showing for fruit from Ventura County, where vineyards are slowing starting to emerge after Pierce's disease decimated the region years ago. Aromas of petrol, citrus pith and orange blossom lead into a tightly wound palate with flavors of mandarin sorbet, margarita lime and crushed white rocks.

title: Ultima Tulie 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Light and tight on the nose, this bottling by Cameron Stoffel shows dried lemon peels, scratched grapefruit, nectarine and minty herbs on the flinty nose. There is a strong grip to the palate, with flavors of squeezed lime, red apple and a saline touch.

title: Sebastiani 2016 Merlot (North Coast)
description: Well-balanced and nicely concentrated, this full-bodied wine fills its firm frame with a core of rich black cherry and shades of roast beef and pepper. It shows firm tannins and good acidity to counter the deep fruit notes.

title: Andis 2015 Original Grandpére Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Big and balanced, this full-bodied wine from possibly the oldest Zinfandel vineyard in California blends tasty berry aromas with rich and spicy fruit flavors, moderate tannins and a good mouthfilling texture. It was fermented in a concrete egg-shaped container and aged in 10% new French oak.

title: Dragonette 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Straightforward Sauvignon Blanc aromas of apple skins, pear rinds, grass and wet stone show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate starts tart with lime and then evolves into a creamier midpalate, offering flavors of lemon wedge and guava skin.

title: Holdredge 2016 Rolling Thunder Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a robust coastal wine that displays bright acidity and strong elements of compost and turned earth. The expansive palate is lifted by a persistence of lively, peppery spiciness and lingering grip.

title: Hunnicutt 2015 Brinkman Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This wine has grippy, youthful tannins that wrap around a core of hefty toasted oak. The midpalate is laced in a mix of complementary grilled meat, black pepper and black currant, the texture dense and concentrated. This could stand more time in the bottle; enjoy best from 2025 through 2030.

title: Kukkula 2015 Lagniappe Red (Adelaida District)
description: This unique blend of 57% Zinfandel, 30% Grenache, 10% Petite Sirah and 3% Syrah offers plum, rhubarb, tea leaf, cracked pepper and fennel on the nose. The palate combines that licorice touch with tangy cranberry, fig and dill flavors.

title: Longoria 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a strong sense of Old World earth on the nose of this bottling, which shows aromas of blackberry, new leather and forest floor on the nose. The palate is loaded with dark-plum and turned-earth flavors, rounded by a smokier finish.

title: MCV 2016 1105 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and dark in the glass, this blend of 63% Petite Sirah, 11% Syrah, 10% Grenache, 9% Petit Verdot, 6% Tannat and 1% Viognier shows very elegant aromas of purple fruits and violets on the nose. On the well-structured palate, whose tannins rise into the finish, there are flavors of cassis, espresso and cola spice.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Figurine Red (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh strawberry aromas meet with the strong sense of charred oak on the nose of this atypical blend of 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37% Primitivo and 18% Merlot. It's lighter weight in body, with savory flavors of thyme, sage and sandalwood, set against alpine strawberry and raspberry compote.

title: Starfield 2016 Viognier (El Dorado)
description: Delicate floral and mineral aromas in this medium-bodied wine turn to rich white-peach flavors on the palate. It has very good balance, and tastes clean and refreshing while also revealing depth and a lingering finish. Barrel fermented, it offers subtlety and satisfaction at the same time.

title: Tenshen 2017 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black cherry, cola, root beer and roasted plums make for a very approachable and yet complex nose on this well-priced blend. The palate is also easy to like and not overly complicated, but carries quite a bit of intrigue with flavors of black cherry and smoked sagebrush.

title: Fleur 2017 Carneros Select Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a nicely made wine at an attractive price, offering balanced acidity and a good moderate use of oak. Lime, melon and apple provide a tart fruitiness that satisfies as a salty finish builds steam and contributes a savory tease on the finish.

title: Foursight 2016 Charles Vineyard Semillon (Anderson Valley)
description: Too bad there aren't more lush and tasty Sémillons like this in California. The wine is soothing and subtle, revealing buttery toasted-almond aromas, rich-feeling but restrained-tasting fruit, a full body and a lingering finish.

title: JCB 2016 No 11 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy cola, cherry and strawberry give this lush fruit-forward wine an undeniable richness and concentration, within a thick structure of integrated tannin and big oak. It delivers on varietal character within a big style.

title: JCB 2016 No 3 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Juicy, expansive and generous in cherry cola, orange peel and pomegranate, this is a profoundly rich, round and rewarding wine—a showcase of the varietal that's hearty in tannin and oak but ultimately balanced in profile.

title: Judge Palmer 2015 Vintage Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This is earthy in truffle and turned earth aromas, with an expansive layering on the palate of rich red fruit. Bright acidity and integrated tannins meld with the robust ripeness and rounded edges.

title: Kaena 2016 JWB Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Mikael Sigouin takes a break from Grenache to deliver this blend of 66% Cabernet Sauvignon and 34% Syrah, which is rich on the nose with black-cherry, violet, cocoa and caramel aromas. The palate is thick, with dark fruit and lilac flavors, leading into a baking-spice finish.

title: Kivelstadt Cellars 2014 The Inheritance Estate Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: With 2% Viognier, this is feral and sauvage varietal wine, earthy and peppery with a fresh focused intensity of dark brooding flavor. It stays balanced in the glass, bright and lifted in acidity, with integrated tannin and oak.

title: Martin Ray 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Bright red fruit finds tension in a bold layering of tannin and full-bodied concentration within this dark, brooding wine. Blackberry, cocoa dust and flint wrap around herbal components of turned earth, flint and sage, finishing in a punch of toasted oak.

title: McKahn 2017 Syrah (Spring Mountain District)
description: Made in tiny amounts, this is a thick, substantially concentrated red that's powerfully flavored and textured. Licorice, lavender, gun smoke and flint accent its core of blackberry jam and cocoa powder, the tannins structured and held in check.

title: Orsi Family 2015 Negroamaro (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A rustic leathery nose leads to a middle marked by firm, chalky tannins in this bold, juicy wine. The flavors dance around dense dark cherry and sage, complementing each other well in a fine marriage of savory and fruity.

title: Parrish Family 2016 Petite Sirah (El Pomar District)
description: Blueberry-cream, smoky sea-salt caramel and rich fudge aromas make for a very lush and luxurious nose on this bottling. Those elements spread into the palate where they join black-cherry jam, toffee and coffee-cream flavors as well.

title: Pulchella 2016 Decorus Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and dark aromas of black currant, purple flowers and a touch of smoke show on the nose of this Syrah-driven blend (with 18% Grenache) from four vineyards. The palate is tense with sour blackberry and soft tannins, leading into a mouthfilling vanilla and marzipan finish.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Brothers Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This single-vineyard wine is 100% varietal and hails from a 141-acre hillside site. It's lush and smooth with a velvety texture defined in blueberry toast, baked plum and dark chocolate. It offers plenty of robust body weight and powerful tannin.

title: Roots Run Deep Winery 2014 The PhD Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is ripe and powerfully concentrated, with grippy intensity. Perfumed notes of clove, nutmeg and tobacco follow through on the thick palate to highlight leather and smoked meat.

title: Sandler 2017 BD10 Anniversary Cuvée Pinot Noir (California)
description: Concentrated aromas of blackberry and black raspberry are lifted by peppercorns, rose buds and vanilla on the nose of this anniversary bottling. The palate's peppery spices and forest-floor tones balance the tangy black-raspberry and cranberry-fruit flavors.

title: Sbragia 2014 Monte Rosso Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Plummy and brimming in dark cherry, this wine from the famous mountain site also broods in dark chocolate, a richness that persists and pleases the palate. Rounded, soft and rich, it has a spicy, earthy undercurrent that complements.

title: Sojourn 2016 Proprietary Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
