description: This is 100% varietal, sourced from a mix of hillside and valley-floor sites. Chocolate mocha, sweet cherry and dusty rock accent a lush decadent expression of robust full-bodied ripeness and concentration.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2017 Grenache Blanc (Edna Valley)
description: Sour apple and sour pear aromas meet with a touch of lime peels and lanolin on the nose of this bottling. It explodes on the palate, with bright acidity, lemon, lime and Asian pear flavors, framed by a chalky backbone.

title: Waxwing 2018 Tondre Grapefield Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Orange- and limesorbet aromas dominate the nose of this single-vineyard expression—one of the few Rieslings in the appellation. There is tremendous verve to the sip, with fresh and lively flavors of tangy citrus, ripe orange and a chalky grip on the finish.

title: Wild Coyote 2017 Tannat (Adelaida District)
description: Pleasing aromas of caramel, roasted black currant and black plum show on the nose of this bottling from a winery that proudly only makes red wines. The tannins are a bit chunky on the palate, but flavors of cassis and cappuccino make for an enjoyable sip.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Proprietary Red (California)
description: Tones of charcoal and smoked meat are backed up by ripe, rich blackberry in this dark-colored, moderately tannic and thick-textured wine. Black cherry and clove nuances develop on the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine in style, this is earthy and tart in red currant, blueberry and a richness of graham cracker, the minerality a mix of iron and earth. The tannins are substantial yet pillowy, making the palate soft and rich.

title: Saddleback 2015 Merlot (Oakville)
description: Salty briny oak meets big concentrated flavors of black currant, black cherry and leather in this bold brawny red. It is blended with 9% Cabernet Sauvignon, which adds to its tannic power and spicy length.

title: Freelander 2017 District One Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a well-made wine that's generous in aromas and flavors. It is a little taut and appetizing in texture and balanced by good acidity. Cinnamon and red-cherry aromas are followed by snappy cherry and raspberry flavors. The wine is medium bodied and lightly tannic.

title: Outward 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Black-raspberry sorbet, exotic cardamom and green peppercorns make an intriguing entry into this bottling from a new label run by outdoor-loving climbers. The palate is pretty mellow and airy, offering hints of violet, lilac, white pepper and blackberry.

title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 The Conspirator Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling smells of concentrated black plum, black currant and violet on the nose. The palate shows Concord grape sauce on roasted beef flavors, along with licorice and tarragon, and grows very tangy by the finish.

title: Clos LaChance 2015 Whitestone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Deep fruity aromas of blackberry and black-plum jam meet with wood spice, roasted meat and sarsaparilla on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, which is still young and may grow more interesting with patience. The tannins rise up right away on the palate, offered roasted wood and berry flavors with a coffee, tea and tobacco finish.

title: Leitmotif 2017 Cuvée Amiliana White (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 50% Viognier and 50% Grenache Blanc offers edgy and sharp aromas of lime pith and lemon skin but also rounded touches of white peach and singed guava. There is a linear line of energy to the palate, which is tight and bright although a touch sour, with cooked lemon flavors.

title: Lion Ranch 2016 Lion's Share White (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Smoke, peach rinds, sour lemon and struck matchstick show on the nose of this blend of 37% Roussanne, 36% Viognier, 22% Marsanne and 5% Picpoul Blanc. A very zesty mouthfeel is full of zippy acidity, delivering smoked lemon and dried peach flavors.

title: Lobo 2015 Wulff Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: This wine is effusively aromatic in violet and wild raspberry, following through on the palate with similar flavors. Compact in medium-bodied ripeness and tannin, it finishes with secondary characteristics of black pepper and leather.

title: Europa Village 2014 Vienza Barbera (Temecula Valley)
description: Italian grapes seem to excel in the Temecula Valley's warm climate, and this is no exception. Light in the glass, the Barbera offers mace and nutmeg aromas against a raspberry-liqueur background. The palate blends cola spice with smooth dried red cherry and a long fennel-laced finish.

title: McClain Cellars 2016 Sacred Love Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Fairly powerful aromas of black cherry and raisin meet with fudge and caramel on the nose of this ripe bottling. It's thick and lavish with chalky tannins on the palate, with rich blackberry jam and black-pepper flavors.

title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 The Assassin Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Candied boysenberry and jammy red-plum aromas show on the nose of this blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Syrah. The palate is very drinkable and fresh with bright and snappy black raspberry flavors, a twinge of herbs and a decent tannic edge.

title: Crū 2017 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Broad peach and ripe melon aromas lead into pear flesh, banana chip and brioche on the dynamic nose of this bottling. There is a toasty flavor to the sip, with apple butter on pastry tones riding a chalky tension. It is a very lively wine though quite ripe.

title: De Loach 2015 Les Parcelles Cachées Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens in floral and spicy aromas before unleashing a succulent midpalate that's as substantial in red and blue fruit as it is tannin. A lengthy streak of earthy forest floor complements the concentrated fruit.

title: Dragonette 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a very Sauvignon Blanc-like take on Chardonnay, starting with aromas of lemongrass, lime leaf, lemon balm and a steely edge. The palate is tense with melon and pear-rind flavors as well as more grassy tones.

title: Outward 2016 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dark and tangy blackberry and black-plum-fruit aromas meet with a touch of charred meat on the nose of this bottling. The palate is well structured, carrying flavors of elderberry, violet and roasted cocoa on the edges.

title: Pianetta 2016 Tuscan Nights Red (Central Coast)
description: This ripe blend of 72% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Sangiovese and 3% Petite Sirah starts with rich black cherry, sweet cedar and candied raspberry on the nose. There are grippy tannins on the sip and decent acidity, delivering flavors of exotic red cherry and mace.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Black-cherry and blackberry aromas are framed by oak tones and lifted by crushed flowers on the nose of this bottling, which evolves quite quickly as it sits in the glass. Tangy black-plum-skin flavors are tart and tightly wound on the palate, graced with a pinch of pepper on the finish.

title: Char Char 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: With a steely core of apple, pear and lemon, this wine takes on a considerable concentration of richness midpalate, with subtle oak playing a supporting role. The texture is creamy and voluptuously lush.

title: Blackbird Vineyards 2016 Arise Red (Napa Valley)
description: This proprietary blend is dominant in Merlot and Cabernet Franc, its tannins burly and cradled in sizable helpings of toasted oak. Juicy red fruit is seasoned in dried herb, clove and pencil shavings.

title: Decoy 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Light and bright in well-defined flavors of white peach and apricot, this is a fulsome, balanced white, quiet and subtle in flavor with crisp, focused acidity.

title: Midnight 2015 Full Moon Red (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry and wood aromas converge on the nose of this simple but pleasant bottling. Woody flavors of leather meet with brighter berries and purple flowers on the palate, where the tannins are a bit sticky.

title: Muscardini 2015 Los Chamizal Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Syrupy blueberry flavor underlines a rich and round palate of bold ripeness in this vineyard-designate, which finishes in a flourish of cinnamon and mocha.

title: Portalupi 2016 Dolinsek Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This quite ripe wine is raisiny sweet in baked flavors of plum and gingerbread, with an interesting complement of peppery spice. Big, bold and thickly rich, it's odd and appealing at the same time.

title: Sojourn 2017 Riddle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is substantial in weight and style, with an earthiness that persists around tight-grained tannin and pronounced oak. The fruit flavor is marked in black cherry and a spritz of cola, with finishing touches of tea.

title: Tri-Tip 2017 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted plum and strawberry aromas meet with hints of tomato on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very tangy with boysenberry and grape seed flavors, which would indeed work just fine for a tri-tip barbecue.

title: AJA Vineyards 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Deeply concentrated aromas of blackberry sauce are hit with a minty streak and strong cedar tones on the nose of this wine from a Malibu-based producer. The palate is very ripe and extracted with tangy black-currant flavors and strong acidity.

title: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Merlot (California)
description: This wine is soft, fruity and easy to sip. Grapey aromas and ripe straightforward blackberry flavors fill in the middle, and there is little noticeable tannin or acidity.

title: One Hope 2017 Vintner Collection Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a lively light-bodied wine with very fresh and straightforward fruit flavors, and a texture that balances crisp acidity with a touch of perceived sweetness.

title: Pedroncelli 2017 Signature Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Simple in red, rounded fruit, this is an approachable, value-minded red wine that spent eight months in French oak. Moderate structure keeps it fresh in the glass.

title: Slow Press 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Strong buttercream, apple custard and oak smoke aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The smoky oak tones carry into the sip, where pear and green-apple-skin flavors are slightly bitter and a honey-butter character goes into the finish.

title: Sola 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is good in quality and serviceable for casual occasions. It shows earthy herbal aromas and sour cherry and rhubarb flavors.

title: St. Anne's Crossing 2015 Tripi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy black plum and dark chocolate melt into developed flavors of thick, syrupy brown sugar, with plenty of body weight and heat. This is a brawny rich wine.

title: Summit Lake 2014 Estate Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: Fruity and thick in waves of coffee and chocolate, this is a rich, round and approachable wine that should appeal widely to fans of a bigger bolder style.

title: Timark 2014 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very extracted aromas of boysenberry balsamic dressing and baking spice show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with tangy touches of orange juice and more sour boysenberry.

title: Vincent 2017 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a slightly sour and tangy note on the nose of this wine, which offers aromas of lemon oil, cooked green apples and a slight nuttiness. There's a hint of wood on the palate, where dried lemon-peel flavors are tangy yet the overall impression is rich.

title: Butler & Thief 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine offers straightforward fruitiness and accents of dried herbs on a rather light texture with soft tannins.

title: Ca' Momi NV Heartcraft Sparkling Rosé (California)
description: This soft, plush and soothing wine shows a bright salmon color, light red-cherry and raspberry aromas and fresh fruity flavors. It has a touch of sweetness and the body is light.

title: Dog & Pony 2016 La Vaquera Red (California)
description: This blend of 60% Tempranillo, 20% Carignane and 20% Grenache is very gamy, earthy and leathery on the nose, with damp campfire aromas. It is slightly sour on the sip, with flavors of incense stick, black plum, pine needle and smoke.

title: Ektimo Vineyards 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Pruney with jammy, nutty black fruit, this wine is well integrated and high toned in nature, with an impressive underlying foundation of structure that helps support the rich fruit.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2016 Siena Red (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 72% Sangiovese with 14% Malbec, 8% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petite Sirah. The whole is robust in thick leathery black fruit, smoky oak and a jammy quality that's rounded in structure.

title: Gen5 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine matches buttery, toasty overtones with plenty of juicy ripe pear and apple flavors. Aged on the lees for 10 months, the texture is smooth and layered, and there's a good hint of acidity to balance the wine's richness.

title: Imagery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Refreshing and crisp, this light-bodied, elegant wine offers very clean appley aromas and good lean Bosc pear and mineral flavors backed by appetizing acidity.

title: Indigené 2015 Ambiente Red (Paso Robles)
description: Bright and fruity red-currant and baked berry aromas blend with turned earth and mint-chocolate-chip aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate's silky tannins and plush texture carry bright ripe fruit flavors with a hint of anise.

title: La Honda Winery 2016 Exponent Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Rich aromas of plum and incense show on the herbaceous nose of this blend. It's taut in texture on the palate, where flavors of pine needle and dark red fruits ride a decent wave of acidity.

title: Left Bend 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Black-cherry and mace aromas come through on a very ripe and extracted nose for this appellation blend. It's thick on the palate, with concentrated strawberry and raspberry flavors that are cut by dried herbs and framed by chalky tannins and penetrating acidity.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: Very concentrated and very tannic, this wine is young and tightly wound, so it will need plenty of time to reach peak enjoyment. The black-pepper, cranberry and espresso flavors are enticing but difficult to get to now. Best after 2025.

title: Binz 2015 Fox Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This wine is delicious in terms of late-harvested fruit flavors like boysenberry jam and raspberry syrup. It has full body, mild tannins and a mouthcoating texture.

title: Joullian 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)
description: Boysenberry sorbet, cocoa and sweet dried herbs show on the nose of this complex and layered Cab from the warm reaches of Carmel Valley. The structure is tannic, chalky and firm, though the mouthfeel is lighter than expected, offering flavors of tobacco, berry and light vanilla on the finish.

title: Left Bend 2015 Gali Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz County)
description: Blackberry and raspberry flavors fight for attention against the tarry asphalt-laced nose of this bottling, which also shows off sage and anise aromas. Roasted wood and thyme flavors arise on the palate against elderberry and black-plum flavors.

title: Marimar Estate 2015 Metodo Antiguo Dona Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This estate-grown wine is made with whole-cluster fermentation, intended to be slower and cooler in order to produce less bitter tannin. It succeeds though does offer a stemmy carbonic expression that tastes of fresh strawberry and ash, the earthiness intense and persistent.

title: Shannon 2015 Home Ranch Reserve Tempranillo (Lake County)
description: This wine is exotic and extroverted thanks to the aroma of wood char and singed rosemary, the bold black-fruit, the roasted coffee and the cocoa nib flavors. It's not overly full in body, and has good acidity and firm tannins for structure, which helps power the bold flavors on the palate and finish.

title: Andretti 2016 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)
description: Thick, rich and robust in peach, apricot and stone, this is made in a big viscous style with present ripeness.

title: Austerity 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Black-cherry, vanilla and cola-syrup aromas show on the nose of this widely available wine. That richness dries up a bit on the sip thanks to upright, slightly sticky tannins, allowing flavors of strawberry and tart black-plum skin to shine through.

title: Chronic Cellars 2017 Stone Fox White (Paso Robles)
description: Light in the glass, this blend of 61% Grenache Blanc, 32% Viognier and 7% Picpoul offers approachable aromas of ripe apples, poached pear and light smoke. The palate is broad with very ripe flavors of roasted apple and pear, cut by a lime-pith edge.

title: Decoy 2016 Red (Sonoma County)
description: Robust tannin and oak wraparound a full expression of red cherry and vanilla in this soft, approachable blend.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Family Reserve Malbec (Paicines)
description: Somewhat shy on the nose, this bottling offers berry, dried herb and wet slate aromas. The palate is very dry and tightly woven with chalky tannins that only allow berry, roast beef and charcoal flavors to barely arise. It will likely become more expressive with time.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Winemaker Series Meritage (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed slate, oregano and blackberry-syrup aromas show on the nose of this blend. Ripe cherries and strawberries provide an approachable, nearly sweet core to the palate, which benefits from a pinch of herbs.

title: Europa Village 2015 Bolero Cellars Garnacha (Temecula Valley)
description: Light aromas of pomegranate and cherry meet with licorice on the nose of this bottling. Cola-spice and strawberry-juice flavors make for a pleasant fruit-punch-like sipping experience.

title: Grassini 2017 Afiora Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Warm aromas of cherry and chalk start off this pink wine from Happy Canyon. It's easy on the palate with light red-fruit flavors and a soft quaffable texture.

title: Jigar 2014 Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Mild-mannered fruit is dominated by substantial tannin weight and concentration, with savory elements of clove and black tea playing around the edges.

title: Pennyroyal Farm 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: Very fresh and very vibrant, this light-bodied and well-balanced wine is aromatic, crisp and refreshing. It promises green apples, garden herbs and citrus in the aroma and delivers juicy tangy apple and grapefruit on the palate.

title: Roblar 2016 Estate Mourvèdre (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Relatively light in the glass, this bottling offers red berry, tart strawberry, tea leaf and exotic floral touches on the nose. The red-plum flavors are hit by star anise, red licorice and red apple on the palate, proving to be a well rounded sip.

title: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Dos Ranchos Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Lots of rocky earth and chaparral scrub aromas meet with mellow black-plum and strawberry fruit on the rustic yet refined nose of this blend of two vineyards. The palate combines peppercorn, elderberry and more dried earth.

title: Sculpterra 2015 Estate Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Boysenberry, dried lavender and dark-soil aromas show compellingly in this bottling, which is darkened by 15% Petite Sirah. The acid-driven sip offers tart and dark berries, proving very fresh and poppy on the palate.

title: Sedition 2014 Chenoweth Vineyards Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Tart cranberry and pomegranate flavors present as juicy on the palate, the spiciness tenacious and accented in citrus. The energy and freshness is complemented well by a soft velvety texture.

title: Sojourn 2016 Wohler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Lush and brightly layered in exotic citrus, this features crunchy pomegranate and cherry tones as well. The fruitiness is marked by acidity and balanced ripeness. It has a lasting impact of spice and cola.

title: Theorize 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Golden honey and apple are met by a richness of coconut in this well-integrated, substantive wine. A balance of oak adds weight and breadth around a medium-bodied ripeness and lasting bit of ginger.

title: Works and Days 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy in ash, dusty rock and forest, this coastal wine is succulent and tightly wound. It offers density on the palate, with succulent flavors  of strawberry and rhubarb laced with cola.

title: Works and Days 2016 Hill Justice Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Lavender aromatics accent a delicately built body that develops intensity as it opens. Asian spice, white pepper and toasted oak burnish on the palate before settling into a soft rounded finish of dark cherry.

title: Animo 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This offers classic flavors of crisp, red currant and cassis, with background notes of dried herb and floral rose. The tannins are sturdy and supportive of the fruit. Toasted oak components are emphasized on the lengthy peppery finish.

title: Works & Days 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker/owner Cabell Coursey ages this white entirely in terracotta amphorae, and the result is robustly perfumed in apple blossom, with a hint of citrus. Light in texture and balanced power, it finishes in a lovely mix of lemon verbena and pear.

title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a savory red, adorned in cedar, dried herb and black pepper. The aromatics are nicely defined in violet. Burly grippy tannins complement a wealth of ripe plum and graphite.

title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick, rich and rounded red, structured in complex notions of dark cherry and cassis. Billowy tannins give it a lift of texture and lightness despite its overall weight and heft. Let this sit a bit; best 2026–2031.

title: B Cellars 2016 Manzana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: With a touch of reduction in its tightly wound youth, this red shows plenty of juicy black cherry to appeal from the get-go—a concentrated effort that's rich and equally generous in tannin. Lavender, black licorice and smoky oak complement the proceedings.

title: Bishop's Peak 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Snappy blackberry and boysenberry aromas combine with lilac, herbs and olive on a very inviting nose in this second-label bottling by the Talley family. It's a fully flavored experience on the sip, with black plum, savory charred meat and dried herbs, showing great complexity for under $25.

title: Cuvaison 2016 ATS Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: Spicy and acid-driven, with a lushness that develops on the back of the palate, this is a highly aromatic white, floral in jasmine and honeysuckle. The fruit is crisply lemon and green apple, with a touch of white peach.

title: La Honda Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Very delicate on the nose, this appellation blend offers aromas of Asian pear, lychee and spring flowers. It's tightly wound yet expressive on the palate with honeysuckle and nectarine flavors.

title: MacRostie 2015 The Loch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Savory spice components of cardamom meet black tea and forest floor in this powerful rich wine. A blend of the best blocks and barrels from several vineyards gives it a complex set of flavors and textures, from delicate and elegant to structured and age-worthy. Best 2020–2025.

title: Mt. Brave 2015 Merlot (Mount Veeder)
description: Rich, tannic and woody, this wine is robust in big black fruit, espresso and toasted oak. It is youthful in dense concentration and structure, a worthy showcase of the variety grown in a wild cool-climate appellation that appears to love it with abandon. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Naggiar 2015 La Bete Noire Estate Reserve Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This massively built Rhône-style wine is chock full of equal parts color, flavor and tannin. It smells like blackberries, black cherries and black pepper, tastes ripe and rich, and feels very firm and tannic in texture.

title: Campos 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (Contra Costa County)
description: This wine is mellow, mature and smooth, showing nicely developed oak, spice and leather characteristics and a palate-pleasing, mouthfilling texture.

title: Cass 2015 Estate Grown G-S-M (Paso Robles)
description: Lighter in the glass, this blend starts with aromas of stewed strawberries along with pinches of oregano and thyme. There is a strongly rustic sagebrush quality to the sip, which also offers cooked red-plum and herb flavors. This is a reliable midweek dinner option.

title: Complicated 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This shows dense flavors of blackberry and cherry. Dark and brooding, it unfurls waves of soft, seamless fruit across the silky palate, finishing in an earthy twist of mushroom and oak.

title: Fazeli Cellars 2015 Shiraz (Temecula Valley)
description: Smashed black currant, black plum and violet meet with the slightest hint of balsamic reduction on the nose of this bottling. Cracked pepper and tangy Indian spices are greeted by flavors of blackberry and black lime on the tangy palate.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2016 Versada Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is a thick rich showing of cherry and vanilla that's intensely earthy in contrast—a mix of turned earth and violet. Integrated, bright and powerful, it holds its tannins in check and allows only a supportive role for the oak.

title: Kokomo 2016 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a syrupy thick expression of the variety, ripe as they come, with big, bold and tannic flavors of graham cracker and blueberry jam. The rich fruit-forward nature of the wine delivers a hit of espresso as it finishes.

title: Paradise Springs 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean aromas of lime and lemon meet with chalk, dried apple and pear on the nose of this bottling. The palate is pleasant is slightly simple, showing cooked apple and tangy lime-zest flavors.

title: Pellegrini 2018 Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a beautiful pink color and is moderately structured and balanced acidity, with a fleshy palate of cherry and lime. A touch of spice enlivens the fruit.

title: Skyline Wines 2016 Artisan White (Central Coast)
description: There's a combination of orange rind, orange blossom and a touch of petrol on the nose of this blend. There is decent tension to the sip, where fairly rich and tropical leaning flavors of papaya and chilled melon soup are cut by lime pith.

title: Holly's Hill 2017 Estate Carignane (El Dorado)
description: This exuberant wine is fruity, fresh and full bodied, exuding red- and black-cherry aromas, gushing raspberry and blackberry flavors and feeling smooth and silky on the palate. It has vibrant acidity and very mild tannins so it's easy to sip.

title: Langman Estate 2016 Estate Reserve William's Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Big in flavor but smooth in texture, this hearty wine accents blackberry and black-cherry flavors with light smoky spicy notes. It is light in tannin, has a mouthfilling presence and touches of vanilla on the finish.

title: Saxon Brown 2014 Stonewall Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Dusty and briary, this block-designate tastes of root beer and Christmas cake—the spiciness leading to a seeming-sweetness of chocolate and licorice.

title: Solitary Cellars 2016 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This broad-textured and full-bodied Barbera from the heart of Zinfandel country in Amador County wraps mulled cherries and ripe raspberries in supple tannins and soft acidity for a soothing palate and finish.

title: Spann Vineyards 2015 Mo Zin Red (California)
description: Spicy mulled-fruit aromas and rich warm flavors make this blend of Zinfandel, Mourvèdre and Syrah accessible and tasty. It combines a good baking-spice element of oakiness with nicely ripe black cherry and blackberry on a full body with moderate tannins for a bit of grip in the texture.

title: St. Francis 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Moderate in apple, peach and oak, this is a medium-bodied well-made wine at a fair price point that delivers approachable flavors, texture and balanced acidity.

title: Temecula Hills 2015 Mourvèdre (California)
description: Bright plum, sultry rosebuds, turned loam and gravel aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Temecula vines. There's a compelling minerality to the palate, which gives depth to the cooked plum and smoke flavors.

title: Toca Madera 2016 Estate Bottled Tempranillo (Madera)
description: Black pepper and cedar aromas and fresh grapey plummy flavors make this light-bodied wine likeable and a bit distinctive. It has mild tannins to keep the texture smooth and velvety.

title: Vie Winery 2014 L'Imagnaire Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Strongly extracted cherry and mulberry aromas meet with sandalwood and pine-forest aromas on the nose of this bottling. The ripe berry and licorice flavors of the palate are very powerful.

title: Bushong 2016 Spanish Castle Magic Tempranillo (Monterey)
description: Rich aromas of black currant, kirsch, cold-brewed coffee and loamy soil show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is thick with tannins that are both chunky and polished, carrying very dark-black-fruit flavors.

title: Écluse 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling is very concentrated on the nose with extracted aromas of blackberry and black plum, leaning toward prune. There's a flash of acid and hint of violet at the tip of the sip, and then the flavors move into potpourri and light blackberry.

title: Ektimo Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Perfumed in clove and tobacco, this is a soft, smoothly crafted wine with some age on it that's rich in clove, toasted oak and black cherry.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2015 Rio Vista Vineyard 2A Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A richer, more extracted style of Pinot Noir, this bottling offers tangy aromas of sour cherry, light clove, green olive and balsamic boysenberry sauce. The palate is also very tangy and intense with acetic tones.

title: Ledson 2015 Reserve Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Brawny, concentrated and tannic, this is an expansive, firmly structured red wine that imparts big flavors of black currant, clove and earth.

title: Oblivion 2014 Zinfandel (Central Coast)
description: Candied Bing cherry, hickory-smoked meats and cherry-syrup aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is decent acid on the sip, where flavors of freshly smashed black currants reign.

title: One Leaf 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a medium-bodied, nicely balanced wine that has everything in the proper proportions. Fresh cherry and light herb aromas are followed by ripe black cherry, black olive and a touch of oak spice on the palate. Light tannins and good acidity complete the experience.

title: Puma Road 2013 The Predator Pedregal Vineyard Meritage (Paicines)
description: This bottling offers aromas of charred boysenberry, black plum syrup and baked soil. The cooked black-plum character extends to the sip, where it's dusted by oregano, marjoram and dill.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 Karia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This has inviting wafts of spicy ginger, nutmeg and clove from the beginning, and then notes of oak that follow through with flavors of Asian pear and lemon. The acidity is moderate and the body full and concentrated, with a lasting note of butter.

title: Vie Winery 2014 L'Etranger Red (North Coast)
description: A superripe saturated aspect to this full-bodied wine makes it attention-getting from a bouquet of dried cherries and sun-dried tomatoes to a bold black-cherry blast on the palate. It feels firm, tannic and a bit drying on the finish.

title: Foppiano 2015 Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)
description: Dusty dark chocolate and blueberry jam form the center of this rich full-bodied wine, that is thick and gritty in approach. Raisiny leather and meaty black pepper follow the concentrated fruit into a whirlwind of bold ripeness.

title: Conclusion 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is a light-bodied, crisply styled wine, earthy and stemmy, with subdued flavors of cranberry, strawberry and red currant. The tannins are youthful and tightly wound.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Méthode Traditionelle Iris Brut Rosé (California)
description: This light-bodied wine made from red Rhône grape varieties shows a hot-pink color as deep as a still rosé wine, flavors of baking spices and cotton candy and a tutti–frutti finish.

title: Old Soul 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Sturdy and well balanced, this medium-bodied wine has moderate cherry and smoke aromas, straightforward fruit flavors and a good texture of light tannins and palate-cleansing acidity. It should be food friendly, too.

title: Vie Winery 2014 L'Intruse Mourvèdre (Santa Barbara County)
description: Extracted aromas of cooked plums, stewed berries and smoke fennel bulbs show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tangy with plum skins and also shows wet gravel flavors.

title: Brophy Clark 2015 Whale Rock Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Boysenberry and violet aromas meet with jammy fruit aromas on the rich nose of this bottling. There is a curious zing of acidity to the sip, which lifts the juicy boysenberry-jam and fennel-frond flavors.

title: Coast 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This medium-bodied, value-priced wine from a Sierra Foothills winery offers an interesting mix of melon, herb and pistachio aromas and flavors along with a smooth and rather rich texture.

title: DeLorimier 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: Citrus-driven with strong floral aromatics and high-toned acidity, this is a full-bodied and fleshy white that is ample in ripeness. Green apple shines and provides a lasting note of tartness on the finish.

title: Girard 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: There's bright, underlying acidity beneath this otherwise bold and flavorful wine, a mix of dried cherry, pepper and coffee that's soft and satisfying on the palate.

title: Longwood 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Textured and approachable in style, this is medium bodied and holds its oak well, showing a melding together of strong green-apple flavor twisted in lemon.

title: Naggiar 2016 Zio Luciano Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is well-made and straightforward, balancing ripe raspberry and strawberry flavors against good acidity and light tannins. It feels medium bodied, tastes fresh and almost jammy in character.

title: Solitary Cellars 2016 Code Three Red (California)
description: Very fruity and very big in structure, too, this wine was blended from Zinfandel, Syrah and Petite Sirah. It is packed with black cherries and blackberries and framed by firm tannins.

title: Heath Vineyards 2017 Captivating Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Tightly wound aromas of lime blossom and chalk lead into ripe pear flesh on the nose of this bottling by a winery based in Texas. There is good zip to the sip and a compelling texture, delivering flavors of Gravenstein apple and pear

title: Sculpterra 2016 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of dark-red currants and sandalwood show on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 11% Merlot. It's fresh and tart on the palate with sour cherries, dried herbs, tobacco and black-pepper spice.

title: Steele 2017 Pinot Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows very clean aromas of lime blossom, lemon skins and white flowers. It's fresh on the sip, with ripe apple flavors that are edged out by lime.

title: Tolosa 2017 Poletti Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Broad but also sharp aromas of pear, citrus, honeydew melon and underlying chalk show on the nose of this bottling. There is decent texture on the sip, where ripe flavors of melon and kiwi trend toward sweet.

title: Foursight 2015 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This smooth and slightly underripe wine smells of black cherries and sour cherries, tastes of black tea and bitters, while hints of warm plums come through on the finish. The mouthfeel is gentle but backed by mild tannins and acidity.

title: Heron 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: It's not flashy or superfruity, but this light-bodied wine has good, clean citrus flavors, crisp balance and a nicely brisk texture. It is nicely dry, appetizing and straightforward.

title: McManis 2017 Estate Grown Merlot (Lodi)
description: Strong juniper and cedar aromas start off this full-bodied wine, with vivid flavors of cola, cherry juice and mint on the smooth palate. It's an unorthodox style, but lots of fun to taste and drink.

title: Bee Hunter 2015 Riesling (Anderson Valley)
description: Vivid apple and peach aromas start this medium-bodied wine off with a bang, and equally fruity fresh flavors follow. A touch of spritz livens up the mouthfeel while an impression of sweetness is balanced by good acidity.

title: Concannon 2016 Reserve Assemblage Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Good, ripe fruit and spice aromas and rich meaty flavors fill out a firm dry texture in this serious and somewhat complex wine. It is full bodied, firmly tannic and will pair beautifully with big proteins.

title: ZD 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: With an opening aroma of green olive martini, this white is oily and viscous in texture, with a considerable backbone of oak. Intensely layered in baked apple and pear, it retains its richness and concentration through a lengthy finish.

title: Andis 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied, ripe and spicy wine shows plenty of blackberry and black pepper in the aromas and flavors, while filling the mouth with a broad, soft texture.

title: Chronic Cellars 2017 Purple Paradise Red (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of smashed boysenberry and thyme meet with lively peppercorn on the nose of this blend of 78% Zinfandel, 9% Petite Sirah, 7% Syrah and 6% Grenache. It's ripe but energetic on the palate, with flavors of blackberry jam, white pepper and eucalyptus.

title: Clif Family 2016 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Tar and oak accent this thick, tannic and intense red, 100% varietal and well made to showcase the fruit. Blackberry and jammy blackberry flavors are densely packed, with the wine finishing soft and round.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Jackson Estate Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Key lime, poached apple, roasted nut, flint and meringue aromas show on the nose of this bottling by the large yet still family-owned operation. It lands fat on the palate with ripe, roasted apple and clean Meyer lemon flavors, a very classic Chardonnay in the Kendall-Jackson style.

title: Korbel NV Brut Rosé Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (California)
description: This delicate wine is light salmon in color, reminiscent of white raspberries in aroma and tastes subtly like raspberries and strawberries. Bright acidity and tiny bubbles give it a smooth and refreshing texture.

title: Longoria 2016 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Wet wood, oregano and dried herb flavors spice up the cranberry fruit on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers flavors of strawberry, wood spice and pencil shavings, proving compelling and easy to quaff.

title: Opolo 2017 Summit Creek Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Fire-roasted strawberries, hickory, soft clove and baking-spice aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The smoky aspects carry to the juicy and ripe palate, where roasted cherries and berries are spiced by vanilla and framed with noticeable tannins.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Stolpman Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There is a compelling gravelly minerality on the nose of this bottling along with aromas of black cherry and black plum. The palate is rich yet tart with sour cherry flavors as well as oregano and fennel bulb.

title: Scotto Family Cellars NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: This rambunctious wine has a brilliant pale-salmon color, potent aromas of apple and peach skin and lichees, followed by strong floral, cinnamon and raspberry flavors that are rich and deep. It's a bold assertive bottle of bubbles.

title: Scratch 2017 Kristy's Vineyard Riesling (Monterey)
description: Yellow-peach and poached-pear aromas meet with lemon peel on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The dry palate combines lime peels with Golden Delicious apples and a hint of honey.

title: XYZin 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)
description: This is a firm-textured and nicely balanced wine that keeps the grape variety's exuberant fruit flavors slightly in check. Moderately ripe raspberry flavors mingle with light tannins and good acidity for a palate-pleasing, easy-food-pairing profile.

title: Acumen 2015 Peak Attelas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec, all estate-grown, this is made in a sublime, understated style, with turned earth, soy and stone on the opening nose and palate. Oak and leather mark the midpalate, with a continued emphasis of dried herb.

title: Crooked Path 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh blackberry, herbs and a bit of wet slate show on the nose of this bottling. It's very dry on the palate, with savory flavors of roasted beef, cola and berries, framed by ample tannins and decent acid.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a well made, tempting, commercial style of Cabernet that has abundant ripe fruit, generous oaky, spicy accents, a rich, almost-sweet mouthfeel and lingering finish.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2014 Hidden Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: This is brawny in red and black cherry with a soft midpalate of juicy approachability, moderate oak and tannin. Full bodied, it shows an ease of enjoyability now.

title: Passaggio 2016 Heringer Estates G-S-M (Clarksburg)
description: This Rhône-style red blend offers rich aromas and flavors, a broad texture and good sense of depth. It has a full body, smooth texture and light tannins to add a bit of grip.

title: Poundstone 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Earthy eucalyptus and bay leaf rise on the nose of this wine, made in a full-bodied, rich and dense style. Brown sugar, cola and dark cherry contribute to its robust, lush flavor.

title: Puma Road 2012 Pedregal Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: Though almost seven years old, this bottling still is vivacious with Bing cherry, cola and hickory aromas on the boisterous nose. The palate is also very fruity, with ripe cherries and strawberries that are bolstered by hickory flavors, and the dried herbs slowly show as the wine aerates.

title: Starfield 2016 The Miner's Inch Red (El Dorado)
description: Ripe and mouthfilling fruit flavors are lightly shaded with oak spices in this full-bodied, firm-textured and well-structured wine. Made from an usual bend of Tempranillo, Fiano and Aglianico grapes, it's a hearty drink to pair with big proteins.

title: Josh Cellars 2017 Rosé (California)
description: This wine has the feel of a dinner beverage, showing a rich texture despite rather low alcohol. A bright copper color, peach and pear aromas, and generous fruit flavors give it good heft and mouthfeel.

title: Brutocao 2017 Estate Bottled Feliz Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)
description: Fresh, fruity and tangy, this wine is a good thirst quencher and will be versatile in food pairings. It has a sunny, ripe flavor profile and enough crisp acidity for good balance.

title: Campovida 2015 Dark Horse Ranch Grenache (Mendocino County)
description: This is a full-bodied wine that's pleasant and soothing to drink, and rather light in terms of flavor and tannin. It has a light-garnet color, fresh plum and raspberry aromas and mild, tasty, spiced-plum flavors.

title: Hungry Hawk 2016 Super Tuscan Red (San Diego County)
description: Fresh aromas of crushed stone, bright strawberry and a hint of asphalt show on the nose of this blend of 57% Sangiovese, 23% Merlot, 18% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Cabernet Franc that is fairly light in the glass. It's light in body on the palate but shows strong flavors of red berry, wild herbs and rocky minerality, framed by squeaky tannins.

title: Hungry Hawk 2017 Hill Springs Reserve Chardonnay (San Diego County)
description: Tightly wound aromas of key lime spray and lychee make for a fresh entry on the nose of this bottling, which was aged in Slovakian oak. Lemon and tangerine flavors arise on the palate as does a spun-sugar element, proving quite pleasant if the slightest bit sweet.

title: Iron Hub 2015 Grenache (Amador County)
description: This wine is appealing for its forward-fruit aromas, good balance despite full body, and well-concentrated flavors of red cherry, sour cherry and cedar. Moderate tannins keep the texture lively and gripping.

title: Langman Estate 2016 Joy! Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This a full-bodied but nicely balanced and dry wine. It combines ripe fruit flavors with accents of black pepper and wood smoke carried on a moderately tannic texture, and should be a good choice with a wide variety of hoofed and winged proteins.

title: Sierra Starr 2017 Cosmic Reserve Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Butter, butterscotch, vanilla and pear-nectar flavors give a big luxurious personality to this soft full-bodied wine. The texture is equally rich, almost sweet, coating the sides of the mouth and propelling the buttery nuances through a lingering finish.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Harmony Vineyard Roussanne (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of wet cement and sharp plumeria make for a compelling entry to this bottling. The palate offers ripe nectarine, pineapple and exotic fruits, finishing with a touch of coconut extract.

title: ZO Wines 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Black pepper and ash open this light-bodied red that is highlighted in fresh, vibrant acidity and a light approach. Cherry and vanilla flavors ride over firm tannins and sweet American oak.

title: Brassfield 2016 Pinot Noir (High Valley)
description: Warm ripe plummy aromas and flavors are shaded by light oak spices like vanilla and nutmeg in this medium-bodied, round and soft-textured wine. It tastes smooth, rather rich and easy to sip.

title: Buena Vista 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Big tropical-fruit flavors meet salty oak in this voluptuous, lush wine, that displays a full-bodied style of optimum ripeness. An earthy underbelly of white flowers and apple blossom provide contrast.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Barbera (Tracy Hills)
description: this full-bodied and assertive wine has vivid oaky aromas of smoked meats and charred wood that meet equally spicy, smoky beefy flavors wrapped in moderate tannins.

title: Folie à Deux 2017 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)
description: With a steely nose, this wine becomes lush and voluptuous on the palate, with a medium-bodied take on lemon rind, melon and fleshy guava.

title: Maggio 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Heavily spiced and oaky, this wine gives an almost sweet impression of baking spices in the aroma, and berry jam in the flavor. Medium body and light tannins add good structure beneath all the oaky perfume.

title: Parducci 2017 Small Lot Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is fresh, fruity and uncomplicated, showing apple-skin aromas, ripe pear and apple flavors and touches of brown sugar on the finish. It is generous in flavor and soft in balance.

title: Swanson 2018 Pinot Grigio (San Benito County)
description: Nearly clear in the glass, this bottling smells of bright pear, key lime and a bit of jasmine on the nose. The palate is clean, easy and refreshing, offering simple apple and pear flavors.

title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Straightforward black-cherry and black-olive flavors give this medium-bodied wine a solid footing, while a smooth, low-tannin texture makes it easy on the palate. It's fruity enough without overdoing it, and has good balance.

title: 1850 2016 Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)
description: Aromas like butterscotch and salted peanuts join candied-fruit and apple-juice flavors in this full-bodied, fat and sassy wine. It has an apparent touch of sweetness to accompany all those rich and indulgent characteristics.

title: LangeTwins 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine has a slightly funky, oaky aroma and plenty of easygoing ripe and cooked fruit flavors accented by savory herb and earth tones. It is full bodied, broad and almost soft in texture.

title: Murphy-Goode 2015 Merlot (California)
description: Wood smoke and cooked berry aromas yield to bold charred blackberry flavors encased in nicely grippy tannins and lifted by acidity. The wine is medium to full bodied, and quite bold in style.

title: Alyris 2016 The Audition Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Brioche, baked fig and crème brûlée mark this bold full-figured wine, which traffics in additional rich tones of marshmallow and vanilla. It's made in a hearty style and will appeal to fans of voluptuousness.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2017 Rava Blackjack Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Monterey)
description: The nose begins with candied lemon, ripe apple flesh, spring flowers and citrus pith, then the palate offers melon-syrup and orange-blossom flavors.

title: Geyser Peak 2017 River Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Blended with 5% Gewürztraminer, this is a light herbaceous offering of bright stone fruit that's fresh, viscous and well made. Vibrant acidity permeates a fruit-forward style tinged in contrasting notes of freshly cut grass and lemon meringue.

title: HammerSky NV Heritage Red (Paso Robles)
description: Juicy red currant, tangy sumac and a touch of clove and licorice show on the nose of this 50-50 blend of Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's tangy with black-plum skin and balsamic strawberry sauce on the palate, lifted by a pinch of white pepper.

title: Holly's Hill 2017 Petit Patriarche Red (El Dorado)
description: Earthy peppery flavors come to the fore in this medium- to full-bodied wine blended from Carnigane, Cinsault and other Rhône varieties, giving it a savory profile. Prune, soy and black plum merge on the palate where subtle tannins add a bit of grip.

title: Kokomo 2016 Peters Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an intensely rich and dense red, prominent in tannin and oak, that takes on a baked, jammy dark-fruit persona. Around its syrupy midpalate of dark cherry and cola are earthy elements of black tea and cola.

title: Korbel NV Méthode Champenoise Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: This is a frothy, light and pleasant wine that offers peach and pistachio flavors, lively bubbles and a touch of cotton candy on the finish.

title: Mabera 2015 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is true to type, packed with dark-fruit flavors and girded with massive fine-grained tannins that keep most of that fruit in check. The wine is full bodied but tight and restrained, probably needing several years to reach its peak. Best after 2023.

title: Navarro 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This fresh-tasting wine from one of Mendocino's most reliable wineries has vivid apple and pear aromas, ripe and fruity flavors and very little oakiness to get in the way. A bit on the soft side in texture, it's easy to sip.

title: Rabble 2018 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A pale pink in color, this bottling, which features an awesome augmented-reality-enhanced label of a mermaid and a shipwreck, shows pink grapefruit, chalk, bubblegum and cold steel on the nose. The palate offers dried raspberry and damp earth.

title: Scheid 2016 Escolle Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: From a vineyard that's one of this appellation's closest to the Monterey Bay, this bottling is tightly woven on the nose with lime pith, chalk, Meyer lemon, lily and a hint of apple flesh aromas. It's very taut on the palate, with honeysuckle, apple blossom and Key lime pie flavors.

title: Tavolo 2016 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Made for a Rhode Island wine bar of the same name, run by Leonard and Sherri Mello, this cross-country collaboration is quite fresh and spicy on the nose, showing aromas of strawberry, dried rose petals and a dusting of thyme and sage. It's bright and taut on the palate, with pomegranate and raspberry flavors, as well as touches of white pepper and curry.

title: Terre Rouge 2014 Garrigue Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This blend of two-thirds Syrah and one-third Cabernet Sauvignon is earthy, smoky and black peppery in a very good way, as it reveals funky nuances from the potent aromas through flavors that are also ripe and full of black-fruit notes, to the lingering spicy finish. There aren't many pure Syrahs from the Foothills as good as this blend.

title: Three 2016 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: Bold and spicy, this high-octane wine starts with salt and pepper aromas, and delivers intense black-pepper and black-cherry flavors on a firm palate bolstered by fine-grained tannins. Winemaker Matt Cline included 11% Petite Sirah, 9% Carignan and 2% Black Malvoisie in the blend.

title: Whitehall Lane 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Tones of creamy citrus and vanilla wafer dominate the palate of this layered, complex white. Additional flavors of green apple and tangerine emphasize the underlying acidity that's both juicy and crisp.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Earthy in forest floor, this mountain wine is grippy and oaky, powerful in its grasp of a drought-affected vintage that offered density and concentration in spades. Stony dusty mineral components override the blue and black fruit that simmers beneath a full-bodied ripeness.

title: Alta Colina 2016 Model Citizen Roussanne (Adelaida District)
description: There is great restraint shown on this bottling of the often oily and dense variety, starting with subtle yellow apple, Meyer lemon peel and melon aromas on the nose. Baked nectarine and yellow-peach flesh show on the sip, yet there is a salty, savory aspect with orange rind and almond touches toward the finish.

title: Big Basin 2016 Coastview Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Lime skins, grapefruit, ash, lily, chives and dairy aromas make for a unique and dynamic entry to the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high in the mountains near Chalone. There's a grainy tightness to the palate, where Meyer lemon pith, almond oil and herbal elements battle for attention.

title: Calluna 2015 The Colonel's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)
description: Leathery, sinewy tobacco adorns firm tannin in this structured, layered and integrated wine, made from a tiny acre block of the producer's hillside property. Elegant in style, it's lovely and light, a perfect companion for the table.

title: Eden Rift 2016 Terraces Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: The 25% new French oak shows in luxurious ways on this bottling, with aromas of butterscotch, scorched hazelnuts, pecans and a backdrop of seashell minerality on the nose. Warm nutty flavors consume the palate, yet there's a grapefruit-rind edge as well.

title: Grassini 2017 Block 14 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very lively aromas of lemongrass, kaffir lime, rainy cement and a hint of greenish orange show on the nose of this block-designated bottling. The texture is very crunchy and grippy with lime skins, springtime herbs and a touch of passion fruit. It is fresh yet complex.

title: Jaffurs 2015 Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Snappy black-raspberry and green-peppercorn aromas meet with black-plum paste and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling. It's a lively wine, fresh, floral and medium bodied on the palate, where thyme, rosemary and fennel flavors decorate the dark fruit.

title: Pahlmeyer 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 79% Cabernet Sauvignon with 16% Merlot, 3% Malbec and 1% each of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The brawny nose opens in black currant and licorice, paving the way for the bold, rich flavors of lavender, blueberry and graham cracker to come.

title: Point & Line 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dried red flowers and sagebrush combine for an elegant aromatic entry to this bottling by two business partners who have worked in Santa Barbara's restaurant scene for many years. Tarragon and intriguing peppercorn flavors decorate the tangy cranberry palate, which is lightly bodied but very well structured.

title: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Extraordinarily deep and resonant in a black fruit flavor, this is a full-bodied wine that has great focus and a moderate layer of tannins to offer grip. Black berry, plum and cherry flavors all contribute to the palate and keep reverberating on the finish.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: Relatively light in the glass, this true Mourvèdre bottling shows black raspberry and a strong rocky minerality on the nose. The palate is crisp with more bright raspberry flavors, but is made complex thanks to earthy herbal tones.

title: Tablas Creek 2017 Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Rounded aromas of ripe melon and nearly tropical fruit show on the nose of this single-varietal expression, but it's the edgy chalky aromas that are most compelling. That grippy minerality peaks on the palate, grabbing attention with citrus and more melon flavors before settling into a smooth finish.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Winemaker's Select Cinsault (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of dark red-cherry paste, star anise, mace, tar and rose show on the nose of this bottling. There's a rocky, loamy kick to the palate, followed by rounded plum, jasmine tea and strawberry flavors.

title: Y Rousseau 2014 Tannat (Mendocino County)
description: This monster of a wine is made from a very unusual grape variety for California. It shows a deep dark color, potent, smoky black-pepper aromas and bone-dry black-fruit flavors carried by unflinchingly firm tannins. It's fascinating to taste and imagine how long the wine should age to lose at least some of its impressive grip. Best after 2030.

title: B Cellars 2016 Kick Ranch Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: This is a meaty, thick version of the variety from a well-farmed site. It shows a density of tannic structure that wraps around elements of leather, tar, oak and brawny black pepper. The fruit broods appropriately in blackberry and blueberry richness.

title: Testarossa 2017 Cuvée Los Gatos Pinot Noir Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A darker, rusty shade of pink, this bottling starts with aromas of tangy plum skin and dank herbs on the nose. There's a light red-bell-pepper touch to the palate, where tangy red-plum and cranberry flavors meet with a pinch of thyme.

title: Europa Village 2016 C'est La Vie Private Reserve Merlot (Temecula Valley)
description: Very extracted and rich on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of cherry syrup and mint. The palate is also somewhat syrup-like with dusty red-cherry, fennel-bulb and tarragon flavors.

title: Fallbrook 2016 33 Degrees North Cabernet Sauvignon (South Coast)
description: Blackberry jam, oaky wood and a hint of balsamic vinegar show on the nose of this bottling. Similar flavors arise on the palate, namely blackberry balsamic sauce and a touch of oak.

title: Flora Springs 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: High-toned in tart waves of red currant and cassis, this 100% varietal wine is concentrated and herbal, with strong tannin structure and approachable complexity.

title: Rock & Vine 2016 Three Ranches Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Cherry, blackberry, crushed rocks and oak decorate the nose of this bottling. The flavors begin brightly, with blackberry and a rocky minerality, then grow more toward sour black plum and dank herbs. The tannins are sticky by the finish.

title: Stateland 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Crumbled rose petals, grilled beef, oak smoke and pinched herbs show on the nose of this bottling, which also offers a graphite minerality. The palate is concentrated with tangy black-cherry, smoked meat and oregano flavors.

title: The Lost Chapters 2014 Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a soft rounded wine, with modest fruit and robust tannin. It has dark color and brooding full-bodied concentration, finishing mildly.

title: The Snitch 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 3% Viognier, the Snitch is within the Prisoner Wine Company portfolio of illustrative, creative label design. Intensely full-bodied, it tastes of caramel, brioche and baked apple, sure to please fans of a rich, concentrated style.

title: Uphill Vineyards 2017 Estate Grown Rosato di Primitivo (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine is unusually mature in aromas and flavors and has a very smooth, rich texture. It doesn't fit the current mold for rosé but is easy and pleasant to drink.

title: Vibe 2017 All the Way Rosé of Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: A rusty shade of red in the glass, this is a very sweet-smelling rosé, with strong strawberry and some cola aromas. The palate dives into sour plums while remaining ripe with red fruit and spiced with a touch of vanilla. It's more like a light red wine.

title: Dobson Family 2015 Taurid Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a field blend of 77% Petite Sirah, 20% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon. Hearty, full bodied and grippy, it's intensely flavored in blackberry and blueberry, with shocks of dark chocolate and vanilla. The oak is pronounced.

title: The Grenachista 2016 Alder Springs Grenache Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is full bodied and quite tannic, showing peppery underbrush aromas and rather earthy iron-like flavors. It's interesting but rough around the edges.

title: Bodewell 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: A beautiful copper color leads to earthy smoky aromas and then metallic mineral flavors. The wine has medium body and a very muted fruit character.

title: Maher 2017 Sumptuous Red (California)
description: This jammy, full-bodied and somewhat sweet wine blends concentrated blackberry and black-cherry flavors with a generous addition of baking spices from oak. Made in Wisconsin from California grapes.

title: Maher 2017 Super Tuscan Red (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine offers vivid cedar and sweet-pickle aromas, oaky flavors backed by a bit of cherry, and a lightly tannic texture.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick, rich and full bodied, this white is brimming in hazelnut, brioche and caramelized apple flavor. The midpalate is decadently lush.

title: Caricature 2017 Red (California)
description: This is a light, very fruity, fresh wine that exudes cherry-candy and raspberry flavors and has a soft, totally non-tannic texture.

title: Carson Ridge 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Light red-cherry, baked pastry and oregano aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's lively on the palate with nearly effervescent acidity, offering blackberry, mint and forest-floor flavors, framed by clingy tannins.

title: Concannon 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Plummy in up-front fruit, this wine has a thickness of tannin and oak that gives it an expansive, weighty quality on the medium-bodied palate.

title: Decoy 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is sourced from both Carneros and Russian River Valley vineyards. It's light in color, perfumed in oak and strong in tannin weight, with bold flavors of black cherry, cola, forest and tea, delivering value within a varietally correct package.

title: Martin Ray 2017 Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Tight aromas of lime pith, lemongrass, lime leaf and wet chalk show on the nose of this bottling. A line of fresh Key lime flavors meet with green pear on the tightly woven palate.

title: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Embracing the variety completely, this wine is fermented in stainless steel and aged in French oak. Thick, brawny red fruit is lush in tannin and texture, with accents of baking spice and dark chocolate rounding out the palate.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Thick and herbal, this wine has an earthy entry of tight-grained tannin and black olive. Blended with tiny amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, it was barrel-aged for nearly two years in French and Hungarian oak and is robustly ripe and concentrated in lush red fruit.

title: Flora Springs 2016 Holy Smoke Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Juicy red and black fruit mark this full-bodied wine from the heart of the appellation—a study in sweet cherry, vanilla and a tinge of marshmallow. Firm heavy tannins wrap around the succulent core, providing structure.

title: Peju 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is brawny in juicy black fruit, toasted oak and a lasting note of sweet tobacco. It packs power and heat into a tannic structure and underlying herbaceousness that works against the bolder elements.

title: Balletto 2016 Twin Ridges Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is a blend of grapes from Sexton Hill and Cider Ridge Vineyards, both estate-farmed and occupying the same hill southwest of Sebastopol, 10 miles from the Pacific Ocean. Apple, lime and a touch of wet stone give it cool-climate appeal while persistent acidity lifts it up.
designation: Twin Ridges Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Jammy blueberry, cherry and chocolate flavors make for a densely packed bullet of richness and rounded tannins in this valley-floor wine. Well made and complex in structure, it delivers a lasting punch of clove, tobacco and dried herb.

title: Vigilance 2017 Chardonnay (Red Hills)
description: Delicious floral and fruity aromas lead to mouthcoating fruit and honey flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine. There is little oakiness to intrude on the gushing, generous apple, pear and peach nuances.

title: Enotria 2013 Nebbiolo (Mendocino County)
description: It's a well-balanced, flavorful and varietally true wine full of zesty raspberry and cranberry on the palate and supported by an impressive structure of fine-grained tannins. The wine is appetizing and nervy—perfect for a rich mushroom risotto or the like.

title: Drew 2016 Valenti Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)
description: This medium-bodied wine catches the eye with a deeper than usual gold color before aromas like crisp fruits and flavors like savory herbs and earth unfold. It feels firm and lean on the palate, slowly releasing mineral and toasted almond accents on the finish. From a great Pinot Noir vineyard, this wine should open with time. Best after 2022.

title: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of dried berries, dark leather and crushed lava rock show on the nose of this blend of 51% Sangiovese, 23% Merlot, 19% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Cabernet Franc. The palate is a pleasant blend of earth, herbs and berries, with steady acidity and a light vanilla finish.
designation: Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style

title: Hess Collection 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This well-made white offers a balanced mélange of apple, pear and cinnamon. Bright acidity lifts it all and works well with the French oak.

title: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Textured, round and yet steely, this wine offers a straightforward approach and subdued ripeness. A touch of peach sparks the midpalate with lovely flavor.

title: Prager NV Noble Companion 10-Year-Old Tawny Port (Napa Valley)
description: Aged a little over 10 years in neutral oak, this wine is a blend of six grape varieties. Bottled in 2018, it tastes of salted caramel, cherry syrup and dark chocolate—a soft, rich and round treat for the senses.

title: Raeburn 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Lightly carbonic and fresh on entry, this is a textured, varietal wine that develops richness and power in the glass. Orange peel, rhubarb and a sprinkling of baking spice gives it nuanced flavor and complexity without undue fuss.

title: Benessere 2017 Estate Moscato (St. Helena)
description: Viscous as honey, with rich layers of peach skin, this dessert wine is appealingly rich and floral, with 110 g/L residual sugar. It tastes of baked apple and cinnamon.

title: Pianetta 2017 Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)
description: Loads of vanilla and prominent oak meet with black cherry on the nose of this bottling. There is refreshing tang to the sip, where caramelized oak flavors arise again, but in a more integrated and appealing manner. This is a Sangiovese with heft.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: With a tiny amount of Sémillon and Muscat, this is stony, floral and herbal, with a flinty hint of oak. Full bodied, it has hearty flavors of lemon candy and meringue that underline its essential richness.

title: Toccata 2016 Riserva Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This Super Tuscan-style wine begins with aromas of roasted berry, tar, charred beef and a tinge of violet. It lands on the palate with full tannins and a rich mouthfeel, offering flavors of tangy berry, roasted cherry and oak.

title: Frei Brothers 2016 Sonoma Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Structured and tightly wound in youthful tannin, this full-bodied expression of the grape is abundant in black licorice, toasted oak and cedar. These accents ride along a pathway of juicy black fruit and toffee that should appeal to many.

title: Blue Fox Cellars 2015 Nube Bianco Vineyard Tocai Friulano (Potter Valley)
description: Strong aromas of fresh earth, buttered popcorn and sauteed veggies vie for attention in this full-bodied and quite mature-tasting wine.

title: Lampyridae 2013 Communication Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is 100% varietal—thick and peppery, with a huge presence of oak that makes it hard for the fruit to speak.

title: RouteStock 2016 Route 29 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is soft and simple in approach, fairly priced and tasting of tobacco, cedar and stewed plum. The ripeness is moderate.

title: VinRoc 2014 Coyotes Howl Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a long-aged wine in both barrel and bottle: two years each. Mushroom, tobacco and black-olive flavors work well against a burnt, green background that provokes the palate.

title: La Folia Winery 2014 Primitivo (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is quite mature and woody, showing berry pie and warm earth aromas at first, then raisiny fruit that's heavily accented with leather, sandalwood and caramel flavors.

title: Pedroncelli 2016 Friends Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a value-minded blend of 60% Merlot, 26% Zinfandel and 14% Syrah that is gritty and simple in approach, with an abundance of baked plum, dried herb, chalky tannin and oak.

title: Toca Madera 2015 Estate Bottled Red (Madera)
description: This medium-bodied wine is tightly wound, not showing much of an aroma and feeling tannic and lean on the palate. It has light meat and pepper flavors and a touch of sour cherry.

title: Wise Villa 2016 Estate Petit Verdot (Sierra Foothills)
description: A heavy dose of sweet-seeming oak flavor almost overpowers this otherwise light-bodied wine. But it may find fans among those who like cedar, sandalwood and maple layered on a soft base of fruit.

title: Markham 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Burly in oak and tannin, this is an approachable white with highlights of anise, lavender and baked pear that finishes with a touch of metal.

title: Tamber Bey 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This rich full-bodied wine has a jammy syrupy nature to its fruit that presents as sweet and cloying.

title: V. Sattui 2017 Reserve Stock Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This offers aromas of barrel fermentation, rich and oak-laden in vanilla and spice. In flavor it has elements of graham cracker, honey and crème brûlée but alas, also a harshness to the finish.

title: Vellum 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal in clove and thick in tannin, this is a simply structured and medium-bodied wine that is beginning to show its age.

title: Gehricke 2015 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: This wine has a funkiness to it that detracts from a tight tart acidity and understated flavors of cherry and vanilla.

title: Kunde 2017 Wildwood Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: This estate-grown wine has a sharp nose of oak and petrol. Its palate is a bit harsh and sour.

title: Eponymous 2012 MacAllister Red (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 62% Cabernet Sauvignon with 23% Cabernet Franc and 15% Merlot from a vineyard atop Moon Mountain. The fruit is baked in ripeness and the structure soft and simple, finishing a touch flat.

title: Fork in the Road Vineyard 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This wine has a sweet confectionery nose and harsh astringent acidity. Marshmallow and baked pineapple flavors become slightly herbal and green.

title: Karah Estate 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: There's a combination of intriguing white pepper and black cherry at first in this wine, before it becomes flat on the palate and without fruit.

title: Clos Agnes 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A floral opening of anise and lavender evolves to a buttery middle before the wine becomes disjointed, rough and harsh on the palate.

title: Smith & Sons Wine Co. 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This affordable wine is smoky in oak with oddly flavored elements of dried herb and cedar that become green on the palate.

title: Europa Village 2013 Vienza Aleatico (Temecula Valley)
description: Minty aromas of sagebrush, tarragon and spearmint make for an intriguing nose on this bottling. It's sweet, thick and medicinal on the palate, with raisin, mint and cough syrup flavors.

title: Paulownia 2016 Glass Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This wine is robust in tannin and ripe fruit, with a savory core steeped in earth, tobacco and cedar. Rich notions of cherry and vanilla arise on the palate, with a lurking creaminess to the texture. This structured powerhouse should do well in the cellar; enjoy 2022–2026.

title: Riley's Rows 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Nutty and mineral, this is a full-bodied white, with grip and ripeness that isn't overoaked. Citrus and apple flavors give it lift and accentuate underlying acidity.

title: River Road 2016 Boschetti Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral and pretty in its bouquet of wild strawberry, this bold full-flavored wine is appealingly spicy in black pepper and a dash of dried herb. Raspberry and plum flavors last and linger, unfettered by tannin, which is well integrated and soft.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Smoky oak and firm, grippy tannins rise to the front of the palate in this reserve-tier wine. It is 100% varietal and sourced from multiple vineyards. Thick black fruit is complemented by cedar and dried herb atop a velvety smooth texture.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Aromas of rusty earth, baked red cherry, strawberry and dried herbs show on the nose of this bottling from the Gilroy area. Rounded red-cherry flavors meet with wild chaparral herbs on the tangy palate.

title: Textbook 2016 Mise en Place Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Thick in oak and tannin, this wine has grip and tension that underlie a foundation of savory cedar, currant, clove and tobacco. This will do well over time; enjoy 2022–2026.

title: Thirty-Seven 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Peppery spice and orange peel meet a touch of clove, tree bark and black tea in this tightly woven, integrated and medium-bodied red wine. A lingering note of cherry and cola give it an understated richness that works within the high-toned structure.

title: Uptick Vineyards 2013 Late Harvest Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: This works as a sweet, syrupy expression of blackberry and cherry, the fruit decadently layered and intense. Secondary flavors of raisin, cinnamon and chocolate underscore the inherent and intended richness.

title: Vincent 2015 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Down-the-middle aromas of blackberry pie, sweet cedar and fresh rose buds show on the nose of this bottling from a newer brand. The palate combines those same fruit and wood flavors with more complex hints of green herbs and tobacco, finishing with a wash of acidity.

title: Vineyard 511 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
