description: Expansive and weighty, this powerful wine has a soft and supple tannin structure and full-bodied ripeness, with highlights of blueberry, currant and dark cherry. Secondary notes of vanilla and dark chocolate emphasize its enduring richness.

title: Waxwing 2017 Star Lane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: An elegant nose of thick black cherry, blueberry, smashed violets and grape seed show on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are very polished on the palate at first but grow denser as the flavors of cocoa, caramel and black cherry arise. Drink 2020–2032.

title: Benovia 2016 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: From the producer's Cohn Estate Vineyard, planted in 1970, this is Zin from a Pinot Noir perspective, given gentle treatment and cooperage in French oak (34% new). Juicy, thick and robust in tannin, it settles into a softness of floral aromas and high-toned red and black cherry and berry laced in nutmeg.

title: Black Stallion 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Steely and floral on the nose, this wine opens into a lush, textured palate driven by fruit. Lemon and peach flavors are complemented by flecks of wet stone and flint, finishing dry and delicious.

title: Brick & Mortar 2018 Vin Rubis Pinot-Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 52% Pinot Noir and 48% Chardonnay the way the producer would ordinarily make a 100% Pinot Noir, this has a dark Gamay-like color, with tight carbonic structure and freshness. Cranberry, red apple and cherry mingle lightly across the palate without intrusion from oak or much tannin. Enjoy cold.

title: Calcareous 2017 Kate's Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of black raspberry, dark strawberry, fresh black currant and dried herbs are lush but elegant on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The sip is fresh with black-plum and boysenberry flavors, with minty herbs giving extra intrigue.

title: Corley 2015 State Lane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: This 100% single-vineyard varietal wine is powerfully concentrated, with a huge mouthfeel from the beginning. It evolves to show elements of leather, dry tannin and dark currant, with a tenacity to its structure. Enjoy best from 2022–2025.

title: Crux 2014 Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Blended with 8% Mourvèdre and 5% Petite Sirah, this offers varietally earthy intensity in the form of turned earth, white pepper and a feral note of grilled meat and mushroom. Sizzling back notes of acidity give it a lift of freshness and life that adds to the overall balance.

title: Crux 2015 Grenache (Russian River Valley)
description: Blended with 5% each of Syrah and Mourvèdre, this bold red is bright in strawberry, violet and white pepper, complex with depth and weight. Supple tannins allow the fruit to speak, seasoned in baking spice and a tease of vanilla.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Old Vines Merlot (San Francisco Bay)
description: Subtle wood spices and ripe luscious fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine a stand out. It's packed with opulent black-cherry notes that follow baking-spice aromas, and feels smooth in texture, wrapping soft tannins around all the generous flavors.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Rava Blackjack Vineyard Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: This Pinot Noir is very light in the glass and on the body, but full of interesting flavors. Aromas of cooked pomegranate, red plums and earthy eucalyptus on the nose lead into soft strawberry and bay leaf on the palate.

title: Coursey Graves 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This lovely, well-made white is spicy, grippy and textured, with robust underlying richness. Light in style, the mouthfeel is balanced in juicy, lingering acidity and quiet flavors of green apple and lime.

title: Jax 2016 Y3 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Ripeness is paramount in this full-bodied, dark-fruit-forward wine crafted by Winemaker Kirk Venge. It smells and tastes soaked in late-picked grape and berry flavors, has a broad, almost thick texture and full mouthfeel. The oak influence is not obvious, but adds complexity and grip to the midpalate and finish.

title: Kynsi 2015 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Tightly woven aromas of cranberry, soft leather and gravelly minerality show on the nose of this bottling from the vineyard that surrounds this winery. There's good grip to the palate, where flavors of turned soil, sagebrush and tart cherry make for an intriguingly rustic sip.

title: La Follette 2016 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Exotic and floral, this has a substantial midpalate of powerful concentration, exhibited as big flavors of apple, pear and lemon. Lightly ripe, it has texture and nuance that are impressively lengthy and delicious.

title: Migration 2016 Drum Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a vineyard in the heart of the Sta. Rita Hills, this bottling shows vanilla and star anise on the nose along with black plum fruit. The palate is very cohesive and well integrated, offering alpine strawberry, boysenberry and rounded lilac flavors.

title: Pennyroyal Farm 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Vibrant and firm in texture but intense in flavor, this wine has a pale-salmon color, subtle aromas of white flowers and white raspberries followed by tangy, almost chewy raspberry and white-peach flavors. It practically vibrates with tantalizing acidity and has a clean, snappy finish.

title: Pianetta 2016 Sangiovese (Paso Robles Estrella District)
description: Bright and joyous Bing cherry aromas meet with nutmeg and gingerbread on the extremely accessible nose of this bottling. It's really juicy and lovable on the palate, where playful cherry and strawberry flavors are framed by slate-driven minerality, tense tannins and strong acidity.

title: Scheid 2016 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Smooth aromas of mace, strawberry and red plum paste show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is a bit angular in texture, with sharp acidity and a raspberry sorbet flavor. A flash of vanilla unfolds on the finish.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Esprit de Tablas Red (Adelaida District)
description: Exotic cherry aromas mix with mace and other rum-barrel spices on the nose of this blend of 46% Mourvèdre, 31% Syrah, 18% Grenache and 5% Counoise. There's a burst of red cherry and tart strawberry on the palate, which then settles into a smooth suave texture.

title: The Calling 2015 Sullivan Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Layered in crunchy apple and cinnamon, with an underlying richness of pie dough, this is a well-integrated and highly likable white. Oak does its job quietly and with purpose, as a mineral component of crushed rock provides an exotic edge to the finish.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Esprit Blanc De Tablas White (Adelaida District)
description: Loads of white flower, guava peel and orange blossom aromas show on the nose of this blend of 75% Roussanne, 18% Grenache Blanc and 7% Picpoul Blanc. Light pear, peach and guava flavors make for a mellow expression that will age for years but is drinking great now. Drink until 2030.

title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2014 Tapestry Reserve Red (Napa Valley)
description: With all five major Bordeaux red varieties represented, this blend is a majority Cabernet Sauvignon. An herbal, broadly defined entry of black cherry, plum and moderate structure define it, as a moderate structure of juicy tannin gives it grip.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Old Telegram Mataro (Contra Costa County)
description: Very fresh on the nose, this twist-top bottling from the East Bay shows tart black-raspberry and dried violet aromas. It's both bright and very slate-driven on the palate, where boysenberry and black-plum-skin flavors meet with white pepper and lavender. It's very expressive.

title: Chimney Rock 2015 Ganymede Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This wine has significant tannin power that presents as grippy and powerful on the palate. Soft underlying aspects of violet, dark cherry and plum are complemented by graphite and toasted oak, all within a full-bodied ripe rich persona. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Encanto 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: High in acidity and crisp red fruit, this wine contrasts with a bold tannic backbone of powerful concentration and richness. Juicy red cherry and cola persist along a through line of focused flavor.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine is unusually on-point for the varietal and tastes terrific. The cherry and blackberry flavors are nicely focused and the wine has great structure from moderate tannins and good fruit acidity.
designation: Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards

title: J. Davies 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This blends the main variety with 16% Malbec and smaller pinches of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The resulting wine is robust and well built, softly structured and punctuated in flavors of bold red cherry and plum. Rich, it shows some restraint and ultimately balance, the fruit integrated with oak and tannin.

title: Ken Brown 2014 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of framboise, with lavender, potpourri and sage sticks, show on the nose of this bottling from one of the steepest vineyards in the region. Earthy flavors of sagebrush and minty tarragon meet with boysenberry and elderberry fruits, and an aromatic lift goes deep into the finish.

title: Margerum 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: This Grenache is elegant and light, starting with aromas of rose hips, hibiscus extract and rooibos tea. The palate is energized, tense and quite quaffable, with plummy fruit-punch flavors that are lifted by star anise and other baking spices.

title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Casa Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Smashed berries, charred meat and peppercorn-crusted game show on the nose of this expression of a single vineyard that's dry farmed at 2,100 feet in the mountains. It's very dry on the sip, with flavors of elderberry, crushed pepper and garden herbs.

title: BOLD 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Aromas of oak, vanilla, lemon jam on brioche and roasted apples show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers flavors of Golden Russet apple, sandalwood and a hint of citrus.

title: Clos du Val 2018 Estate Gran Val Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Made entirely from stainless-steel fermented Pinot Noir, this has a lovely bouquet of floral aromatics and dry sensibility of balanced ripeness. Watermelon, strawberry, orange and freshly cut grass highlight a refreshing palate of light flavor.
designation: Estate Gran Val Vineyard Rosé of

title: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a flavorful, enjoyable and drinkable wine. Abundant black-cherry and blackberry-jam aromas lead to ripe black-fruit flavors and a fairly broad texture that has just a touch of tannin.

title: Dusty Nabor 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A yellowish shade of pink in the glass, this rosé sports a mellow nose that's more earth than fruit, with river stone and underrripe orange aromas. The acidity and texture on the sip are compelling, with light flavors of lemon juice and nectarine skins.

title: Enkidu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This wine offers a good value, opening in bay leaf and eucalyptus that is brightly interwoven with burly oak and textured tannin. Cherry and cassis flavors give it a fruity lift before the finish's powerful heat.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2016 Summit Select Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: Mint and eucalyptus appear on the nose of this full-bodied wine, which is otherwise bright and compelling in red fruit, earth and baking spice. Lifted, it's thick in tannin and weight on the finish.

title: Folktale 2018 Estate Grown Rosé (Monterey County)
description: Peach and Ruby Red grapefruit aromas make for a juicy entry to this rosé. There is plenty of citrus energy on the palate, alongside rounded red-plum and red-pear flavors, framed by a chalky, almost filmy texture.

title: Heir Apparent 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Blended with 6% Cabernet Franc, this is a soft seamless wine that is creamy in texture and tannin. Pencil shavings and dried herb complement a richness of black cherry and dark chocolate.

title: Iskaranu 2017 Mimma Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This tiny-production wine has a delicate nose of black tea and wild strawberry that leads to a concentrated midpalate of forest and hearty tannin. Orange-peel and rhubarb flavors round out the lengthy finish.

title: JCB 2016 No 7 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Powerfully built, this has a rose petal bouquet and nicely layered midpalate of cherry cola and forest floor. The tannin and oak are pronounced and persistent.

title: Kenwood 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: A bouquet of red fruit leads the way to a juicy midpalate of structured richness and oak, the latter well integrated and supportive. Balanced ripeness allows the cherry, cassis and cocoa powder to impress in brightness.

title: Kenwood 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: With a spicy entry of clove and cinnamon, this wine is soft and supple on the palate—a light-bodied burst of cherry and blueberry that overdelivers on its price point.

title: Kenwood 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Blackberry syrup and a richness of chocolate combine effectively in this broadly appealing wine, tart in the midpalate, with acidity that helps balance the overall juiciness and heat.

title: Lion Ranch 2017 Marsanne (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Sandalwood, dried lemon peel, dried apple and a hint of sandstone-like minerality show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 13% Roussanne. There is a good sizzle to the sip where flavors of dried lemon and apple meet with toasted wood.

title: Montemar 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dried cherry sauce and cola spice show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is also centered on dried red fruits and spiced by earthy sagbrush.

title: Newman's Own 2017 Common Good Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The new releases from Newman's Own have stepped up in quality. Flavors of black cherry, maple and chocolate come with a hint of sweetness in this very polished, fruity, and approachable wine.

title: Rock Wall 2015 Papa's Syrah (Solano County)
description: Amazingly lush and melting on the first sip, this wine is very concentrated and full bodied and builds heat on the palate. It smells like maple syrup and tastes rich and indulgent like dried fruits and brandy.

title: Sebastiani 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Buttery croissant aromas and indulgent vanilla and butter-laden flavors make this wine virtually rich enough for dessert. It shows plenty of oak baking spices, a fat texture and lingering buttery finish.

title: The Grenachista 2016 Mathis Vineyard Grenache Noir (Sonoma Valley)
description: This varietally focused producer does a nice job here, offering a small-production vineyard designate that is bright in strawberry, plum and vanilla. Light and crisp on the palate, it remains fresh and focused within a powerful middle palate of rich concentration.

title: V. Sattui 2016 Quaglia Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: This is a field blend with undetermined amounts of Petite Sirah and Carignane within. Sweet jammy cherry is accentuated by a thread of vanilla, the rich texture is creamy and lush.

title: Gallo Signature Series 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 3% Petite Sirah and a small percentage of the fruit from Monte Rosso Vineyard, this is hearty, ripe and relentless, and made for fans of a not-shy wine. Tight-grained tannin anchor a core of powerful black cherry, blackberry and cinnamon, ending in vanilla oak.

title: Gehricke 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Opening in a whiff of matchstick and toasted oak, this is an intensely powerful and lush white wine with a touch of heat that exudes tropical flavors of pineapple and mango. The finish is dipped in marshmallow cream.

title: Oakstone 2017 Naylor Vineyard Barbera (Fair Play)
description: This fruity and straightforward wine shows dried herb aromas, good raspberry and plum flavors, a smooth texture and very little oak spice. It is uncomplicated and easy to drink.

title: Rodrigue Molyneaux 2016 Sangiovese (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a good substantial wine that offers robust fruit and oak-spice aromas, a pretty big mouthfeel and full body. Sunbaked, cedary flavors fill the midpalate and continue on the finish.

title: Sunseeker 2018 Rosé (California)
description: This medium-bodied rosé wine based on Grenache is nicely packed with fruit. Vivid raspberry and floral aromas lead to similar flavors, and the smooth texture reveals a touch of sweetness on the finish.

title: Charles Krug 2018 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: A stainless-steel white with steely texture, this is an approachable expression of floral jasmine and lemony lightheartedness that should widely appeal.

title: Frey 2018 Organic Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This wine is bold and full bodied, showing delicious blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a welcomed, dry palate. Firm tannins help to frame the fruit nicely. It's a fully organic wine with no added sulfites.

title: MooBuzz 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Gamy on the nose with old leather aromas, this bottling also shows struck flint and dried red-fruit aromas. Rounded cherry and charred wood flavors arise on the sip, where the gamy kick also comes through.

title: Tamber Bey 2018 Sans Chêne Chardonnay (Yountville)
description: Made without oak, this steely white is earthy, grassy and spritzy in fresh acidity—a lively and fresh expression of light-bodied apple and pear.

title: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This charming wine is so fruity that it seems sweet, gushing red-cherry, black-cherry and strawberry flavors on medium body.

title: Cline 2018 Viognier (North Coast)
description: This is a medium-weight wine, with moderately fruity aromas and flavors and a soft light texture. It's something pleasant and undemanding to sip.

title: Maddalena 2016 Riesling (Monterey)
description: A strong petrol character shows on the nose of this bottling alongside green orange rind and sweet apple blossom. It lands on the palate quite sweetly, with orange-blossom extract and spun-sugar flavors.

title: Peirano 2016 Six-Clones Heritage Collection Estate Grown Merlot (Lodi)
description: This wine is simple, fresh and fruity, offering lots of bright cherry and plum flavors and a fairly crisp texture.

title: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This flavorful, approachable and full-bodied wine is drenched in plum and black-cherry aromas, rich and soft fruit flavors and laced with very mild tannins.

title: Bella Grace 2018 Estate Bella Rosé (Amador County)
description: Very pale in color and also very light in flavor, this delicate and light-bodied wine doesn't make much of an impression, but it tastes clean and fresh.

title: Bodkin NV The Fearless Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Suisun Valley)
description: Green-apple aromas and lemony flavors make this light-bodied wine steely, refreshing and austere.

title: Cherry Pie 2017 Pinot Noir
description: A flinty, reduced aroma gets this wine off to a slow start, but it brings on good, tart cherry and berry flavors and an earthy finish.

title: Diamond Hitch 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Rustic aromas of smoke, dust, herbs and roasted cherries show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with ripe, nearly sweet flavors of strawberry and cherry with lots of hickory smoke in the finish.

title: Josh Cellars 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Jammy aromas and fresh fruity flavors dominate this medium-bodied, exuberant wine. It is rich in oak, light in tannin, and gushing with strawberry, blackberry and cherry notes.

title: Oak Ridge 2016 Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Very ripe and full bodied, this opulent wine oozes blackberry-jam and blueberry-syrup flavors on a soft smooth texture.

title: Corley 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a big, juicy and expansive wine, blended with 12% Merlot. Concentrated flavors of dark cherry and black currant fill the glass in weighty structure and integrated tannin, leading to a cohesive, lengthy finish.

title: Cuvaison 2018 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Whole-cluster pressed and fermented in stainless steel, this wine is effusive in lemon, strawberry and earthy spice. A brawny midpalate builds tension and structure as it opens in the glass, finishing crisp and refreshing.

title: Lumen 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light in the glass, this fresh bottling by Lane Tanner packs in aromas of cranberry juice, red apple, gravel and flint on the nose. The palate blends snappy red cherry with rocky minerality, pine needle and touches of mushroom.

title: Lawer 2017 Betsy's Vineyard Viognier (Knights Valley)
description: Viscous in honeycomb and green-apple flavor, this is a well-made version of the variety, elegant with a hearty midpalate of richness and concentration.

title: Benziger 2017 de Coelo Terra Neuma Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is from a biodynamic vineyard site overlooking the Pacific Ocean near Freestone and it shows a lightness of texture and touch. High-toned acidity boosts fresh lively flavors of pomegranate and cranberry as underlying grip provides structure.

title: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: This wine is definitely oaky, but in a good way, with baking spice aromas leading to mulled raspberry and cherry flavors that meld with a cocoa accent on the palate. A medium body and smooth tannins give just enough grip to the mouthfeel.

title: Cline 2018 Ancient Vines Mourvèdre Rosé (Contra Costa County)
description: Light floral and baking-spice aromas lead to rather rich, mouthcoating yellow-plum and cinnamon flavors. The wine is medium bodied and has a rip round texture.

title: Covenant 2018 Red C Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This light, refreshing and herbaceous wine has a streak of lemon that supports mineral, white pepper and sliced fennel bulb flavors. It is definitely crisp and tangy, refreshing on the palate.

title: Dubost 2018 Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Apple and golden-pear aromas are cut by lemon peel on the nose of this bottling. There is a fresh zip on the sip, with yellow-peach and melon flavors making for a bright flavorful wine.

title: F2 Wines 2018 Ghibellini Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)
description: Meyer lemon peel and spring blossom aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There's a sizzle of white pepper to the bright palate, where a solid texture upholds the green-fruit flavors.

title: Midnight 2016 Nocturne Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Black plum and blackberry aromas meet with dried lilacs and roasted coffee on the nose of this twist-top bottling. Seared blackberry and more purple-flower flavors meet with decent acidity and a chalky texture on the palate.

title: Mountain Tides 2017 Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)
description: Big but well-balanced, this deeply colored and robustly fruity wine shows the classic black-pepper accents, full body and plenty of fine-grained tannins for a grippy texture. It has a lightly oaky, spicy complexity and a richness that lingers on the finish.

title: Thomas Allen 2016 Cuvée Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Clements Hills)
description: Smooth and mouthfilling without being heavy, this light-bodied wine is also nicely dry. It shows tangy green apple and a touch of baking spice and cream to top it off.

title: Prospector 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Very ripe in flavor and soft in texture, this luxurious wine is full bodied, somewhat jammy and smooth on the palate.

title: Covenant 2017 Mensch Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Milk chocolate, cocoa and raspberry flavors offer a lot to like in this full-bodied, engaging and not quite sweet wine. It has a broad, almost soft texture, a low level of tannin and a lot of yummy fruit and spice notes that linger on the finish.

title: Peachy Canyon 2018 Classic Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Plush aromas of strawberry are clean, crisp and enhanced by a flinty minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate follows a line of strawberry and Mandarin orange peel, bolstered by proper acidity.

title: The Gentleman's Match Wine Co 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Very smooth and subtly spicy, this full-bodied wine drips with fruit so ripe it would drop from the tree or vine. Plums, black cherries and blackberries come to mind. The wine has soft tannins, a broad texture and a lingering ripe finish.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2018 Uncaged Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This full-bodied wine is reserved in style, offering mineral, chalk and light milky aromas, followed by dry and tangy mineral and white-pepper flavors. These add up to an interesting, complex and different wine.

title: Côte West 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Clarksburg)
description: A very subdued color and bright, citrus flavors mark this refreshing, light- to medium-bodied wine. Great acidity and energizing grapefruit and crisp apple animate the palate.

title: Falkner 2016 Meritage (Temecula Valley)
description: This blend of 43% Merlot, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon and 22% Cabernet Franc is light on the nose, with plenty of earthy oregano and sage alongside the wild blackberry fruit. Roasted blackberry flavors show on the sip, enhanced by dried marjoram and leather and framed by decent acidity and structure.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Summit Block Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an outstanding wine that is fresh and alive. Baked plum, orange and cherry flavors are just the beginning of a complex, concentrated array of flavors, with never-ending depth woven within a framework of graceful power and elegance.

title: Denner 2016 Mother Of Exiles Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Extremely dense and dark in color, this blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 17% Merlot, 10% Petit Verdot and 3% Cabernet Franc shows crisp black currant, cocoa and cola on the pure and delicious nose. Polished yet firm tannins meet with snappy acidity on the palate, where flavors of black currant and stone converge in long-lasting harmony. Drink through 2041.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Monastery Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This bold wine is firm yet lifted, with structured tannins that elongate the palate. Smooth layers of blueberry, orange and cranberry flavors give it a lasting tanginess around bright streaks of acidity and spice.

title: Sanguis 2016 Bossman Red (Central Coast)
description: This proprietary blend of Syrah, Petite Sirah, Grenache and Viognier by Matthias Pippig is a lesson in cohesion. The nose blends boysenberry, vanilla and baking spice, but it's the palate that's most compelling, presenting flavors of cocoa, black plum, elderberry and coffee dust, all delivered with creamy mouthfeel.

title: Chanin 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Extremely delicate and pure aromas of lemon, nectarine, gardenia and lily are soft and inviting on the nose of this bottling. The palate sizzles with acidity, offering focused but austere flavors of lemon zest and crushed gravel that surround an immensely chalky core. It will mature well through 2042.

title: Chanin 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very delicate on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of nectarine, white-melon flesh, a hint of melon rind and light lemon spray. The palate is extremely textural, offering subtle flavors of lemon cream, chalk, lemongrass, ash and Brie rind that will live forever. Drink now through 2042.

title: Daou 2017 Unbound Red (Paso Robles)
description: One of the darkest wines anywhere, this blend of 69% Petite Sirah, 25% Tannat and 6% Tempranillo shows dense aromas of cassis, blackberry, roasted coffee, milk chocolate and forest floor in a powerful yet balanced manner. The tannins are tense but polished, carrying dark-fruit flavors that are rich but not overly ripe, and wrapped in smoke and leather.

title: Daou 2016 Soul of a Lion Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Aromas of coffee bean, charred meat, blackberry and toast show on the nose of this blend of 86% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot. There is compelling density to the palate, which offers flavors of espresso, cocoa, charred toast and blackberry.

title: Longoria 2017 A Noir Supreme Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This ode to John Coltrane by Rick Longoria is a big and booming but balanced Pinot Noir, starting with aromas of boysenberry juice, clove and hickory smoke. The flavors are full and wrapped in a compelling texture of chalk and acid, offering strong black-raspberry and delicious baking-spice notes.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Kanzler Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This nicely made, complex and balanced wine opens in an inviting nose of rose and following flavors of rhubarb compote, grapefruit and orange. Bright, fresh and silky in tannin, it has an intriguing underlying earthiness that presents as peppery and exotically spicy.

title: Merry Edwards 2017 Olivet Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Generous and delicious, this is a tannic, boldly structured and beautifully brawny wine, rich in wild cherry and brambly blackberry. Toasted oak, orange and spicy nutmeg accent a luxurious mouthfeel on the midpalate before an unctuous wave of cocoa powder takes hold on the long finish.

title: Benovia 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine shows the power of blending across multiple sites, all vineyard-designates of their own (Martaela Estate, Cohn Estate, Tilton Hill Estate and Zio Tony Ranch). Reductive initially, it is demure in earthy forest, nutmeg and sage as more forceful flavors of rose petal, blackberry and blood orange highlight a lightning rod of fresh acidity.

title: Sanguis 2015 Loner Le Dauphine Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Clean lines of wet cement, chalk, lime blossom, citrus peel and sandalwood veer into exotic aromatic combinations on the nose of this bottling. There is tremendous tension on the palate, where fine-grained oak tannins uphold the Asian pear, lemon spray and white-rock flavors.
designation: Loner Le Dauphine Bien Nacido Vineyard

title: Sanguis 2016 The Ten Wings White (Central Coast)
description: Matthias Pippig makes a strong argument for why Chardonnay, Roussanne, Viognier and Marsanne can coexist in the same bottle, despite centuries of tradition telling otherwise. Clean, delicate aromas of white peach and honeysuckle lead into an intricately layered palate of jasmine, Meyer lemon and toast that is obscure, delicious and compelling.

title: Smith-Madrone 2016 Estate Bottled Riesling (Spring Mountain District)
description: Opening with a lovely mix of apricot, green apple and petrol, this wine offers enviable structure, complexity and balance. Lush on the midpalate, it never loses focus, retaining mineral-like stoniness and linear, fresh acidity.

title: Rusack 2017 Santa Catalina Island Vineyard Chardonnay (California)
description: Despite the struggles of growing grapes on mountaintops in the middle of an island, this Chardonnay impresses with aromas of tight lemon peel, nectarine, pineapple and lime leaf. There is a blast of acid on the sip, where seared white-peach and lemon flavors prove fresh and lovely.

title: Kenzo Estate 2018 Asatsuyu Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From consulting winemaker Heidi Barrett, this is a beautiful wine, which was given time in both stainless steel and French oak. Sublime elements of peach, lemon zest and stone highlight a voluptuously grippy and lush structure.

title: Continuum 2016 Sage Mountain Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a very young, concentrated and tannin-laced wine with great potential for aging, from Tim and Marcia Mondavi's Pritchard Hill winery estate. An almost black color is the first impression, then an aroma of blueberries, blackberries and black currants leads to very ripe black-fruit flavors and oak spices that are thoroughly held in check by the tight texture. Best from 2028–2038.

title: Austin Hope 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling remains as impressive and delicious as it did upon debut two vintages ago. Aromas of black cherry, hickory smoke and vanilla cookie lead into a palate of brown sugar, sea salt, caramel and black-cherry foam, all framed by polished tannins and just enough acidity.

title: Arietta 2016 H Block Hudson Vineyards Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tremendously memorable and well-made cofermentation of 70% Cabernet Franc and 30% Merlot from one specific block of the mighty Hudson Vineyard in Carneros. Reduced slightly, it brims in graphite, earth and dried herb, with classically stylized secondary layers of cassis, lavender, anise and oak. The texture is sublime. Lovely now, this will do well over time; enjoy best from 2026–2036.

title: Maggio 2018 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a smooth, agreeable, full-bodied wine that coats the mouth with rich pear and ripe apple flavors while an almost viscous texture gives nice length on the finish.

title: SeaGlass 2018 Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: An aroma of freshly cut pear is clean and crisp on the nose. There is decent tension to the palate, where broad apple and pear flavors are wound rather tight.

title: Au Contraire 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light, crisp and refreshing, this is a nicely approachable wine brightly layered in flavors of cherry and lime. It finishes with plenty of acidity to remain lively in the glass as the finish veers metallic.

title: Frank Family 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: With an oaky, buttery intensity, this wine is tropical in nature and richly lush on the palate—a full-figured expression of the grape sourced from both Beckstoffer and Hudson vineyards, as well as the producer's own Lewis Vineyard within the appellation.

title: Laetitia 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very gamy aromas of raw lamb and dried meat show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very closed and inward, its tart berry flavors cut by sour and slightly astringent lanolin flavors.

title: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Sharp in flinty, stainless-steel appeal, this is a bright, light-bodied white, with forceful layers of apricot, green apple and lime.

title: Tortoise Creek 2018 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a light, ripe, almost-sweet tasting wine that smells like fresh cherries and raspberries and shows gentle fruit flavors with little oak imprint.

title: SeaGlass 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of sliced green apple, lime and citrus blossom show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines lime, grass and apple, with a hint of honeysuckle.

title: Akash 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Toasty aromas of strawberry, dried red plum and incense show on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong cedar and pine kick to the nose, where dark red-currant and tart plum-skin flavors are framed by angular tannins.

title: Conduit 2017 Marsanne-Roussanne (Contra Costa County)
description: This light-bodied wine smells nutty, honeyed and savory all at the same time, while the palate offers dry tangy tart apple, toasted nut and white pepper. Diverse flavors and a nervy, thin texture make it unusual but appealing as a change of pace.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: A bit shy on the nose at first, this bottling eventually offers aromas of pencil shavings, tart red plums and slightly richer black cherry. The palate shows dark berry and plum flavors, wrapped in soft yet somewhat chunky tannins.

title: Esser 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Dried beef, lamb flesh and leathery tobacco aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a grippy texture to the sip, where dried cherry and raspberry flavors meet with more leather and game.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Chewy tannin and oak with a smoky toasty component lead the way to a robust and softly rich wine that includes 21% Syrah, the whole aged in French, Eastern European and American oak. Straightforward and savory, it finishes in earthy black currant.

title: Gnarly Head 2017 Authentic Black Red (Lodi)
description: Good breadth, warm and generous fruit flavors and a velvety texture make this medium-bodied wine easy to sip. A touch of sweetness and spicy oak accent the palate and finish.

title: Masia de la Vinya 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Seared lemon, toast and nutty qualities show on the nose of this Temecula-based bottling, which is already hinting at its age. Lemon peels, crushed almonds and paraffin flavors play on the palate.

title: Dark Horse 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine leads with spicy smoky oak in the aromas and pours more oak over the ripe cherry and black-plum flavors. It's not a bad choice for those with a taste for wood, and has a smooth, lightly tannic texture.

title: Dark Horse NV Big Red (California)
description: This wine is showy, oaky and ripe tasting, wrapping baking spice, wood smoke, raisin and black plum in a softly tannic texture.

title: Dark Horse NV Double Down Red (California)
description: This dramatic wine has an extra-deep color and intense fruit aromas, followed by palate-drenching, ripe and overripe prune and blackberry flavors. It is full bodied and mouthfilling, without so much tannin that it tightens the fat texture.

title: 6.6.44 NV Red (California)
description: This is a very unusual wine, blended from a combination of French-grown and California-grown base wines and bottled in California to commemorate the 75th anniversary of D-Day. It is flavorful and firm in texture, showing ripe black-cherry and mint notes carried by moderate tannins and full body.

title: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry and black-cherry jam meet with rocky soils and savory aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is more primary, with raspberry syrup and light herb flavors most prominent.

title: Yorba 2012 Shake Ridge Vineyards Syrah (Amador County)
description: Ripe and overripe fruit flavors take the fore in this full-bodied, concentrated and jammy-tasting wine from Ann Kraemer. The blackberry, boysenberry and dried plum notes are delicious as they mingle on a smooth but moderately tannic texture.

title: El Lugar 2017 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: A lighter yet beautiful shade in the glass, this bottling starts with aromas of Bing cherry and pomegranate that are cut by freshly chopped game and smoke. There are earthy tones to the palate, but the focus is crisp and tart cranberry fruit.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Robust in dried herb and graphite, this is a weighty, structured and tannic red blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec. Classic elements of currant and clove add to the overall mix of vintage-appropriate density and power.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers juicy peach, apple and fig, with measured richness and highlights of vanilla and oak. The lush, creamy style is sure to appeal to many.

title: Trentadue La Storia 2018 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Steely and seemingly low in oak, this is a softly layered, mineral-driven white, with lithe flavors of apple and pear that mingle well against a fluid texture. The wine appeals in its approachability and quality.

title: Husch 2017 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Generous fruit flavors and a broad, smooth texture give this full-bodied wine a rich profile. Good ripe plum and mulled cherry flavors fill the palate and are concentrated enough to linger on the finish.

title: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: From a clonal selection on the producer's estate vineyard, this pure expression of the grape exudes black licorice, lavender and oak. Sturdy, grippy tannins wrap around an expansive midpalate that's accented by dried herb, cedar and cigar.

title: Kunde 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This juicy, smooth wine includes 3% Petit Verdot in the blend. Firm in tannin and oak, it shows dense layers of red and black cherry alongside dustings of cocoa powder and sweet tobacco.

title: Siduri 2017 Edmeades Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a delicate, medium-bodied wine that offers lively red cherry and raspberry flavors and shows restraint through light tannins and vivid acidity.

title: Siduri 2017 Lingenfelder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Robustly rich, layered and rounded in red cherry, tea and toasted oak, this is a full-bodied and concentrated wine, with plenty of power and ripeness. A touch of orange peel gives it a pleasing sweetness on the finish.

title: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Pinot Noir (California)
description: Delicious cherry flavors fill this wine from the first whiff to the lingering fruity finish. It has good concentration, great focus and a wonderful freshness that keeps it lively on the palate.

title: Barbieri 2015 Seppia Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Boysenberry, grape-seed, white-pepper and earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Grippy grainy tannins frame the sip, where tangy black-raspberry flavors are cut by strong herbal tones of tarragon, fennel and thyme.

title: Bella Grace 2018 Estate Grenache Blanc (Amador County)
description: Fragrant, flavorful and nicely balanced, this medium-bodied wine offers tropical-fruit aromas, lively fruit and floral flavors and a just-right texture that's crisp but smooth.

title: Cardella 2014 L'aquedotto Vineyard Barbera (California)
description: Prominent oak spices and generous fruit flavors combine nicely in this full-bodied and firm-textured wine. Hints of baking spices and butter mingle with nicely ripe blackberry notes that are mouthfilling.

title: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Tightly wound and youthful, this is a cellar-worthy wine, perfumed in black fruit, dried herb and oak, with a thick concentration of richness and structure. Enjoy 2020–2026.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Dickinson Block Zinfandel (Cienega Valley)
description: For a vineyard planted in 1906, this fruit is still banging with intensity, starting with billowing aromas of exotic strawberry and blossoming red flowers. The flavors are also generous and bold, full of ripe strawberry and cranberry, all framed by almost searing acidity.

title: Martin Ranch 2016 Therese Vineyards Viognier (Arroyo Seco)
description: Peach and melon aromas are prominent but properly reserved on the nose of this bottling, which also offers hints of apple butter. There is a pleasant plushness to the palate, where dried nectarine and ash flavors arise, with a light caramel tone on the finish.

title: Newton 2016 Puzzle Red (Spring Mountain District)
description: This red is thick, weighty and tannic, an earthy commingling of several Bordeaux reds as one. Cedar, oak and tobacco wrap around dark-black fruit and grippy texture.

title: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This full-bodied wine shows minimal oak flavor, and instead is driven by tasty nervy fruity notes like Bosc pear and Pippin apple. It tastes clean, fresh and tangy for a very appetizing effect that the average California Chardonnay doesn't offer.

title: Wente 2016 Sandstone Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: This nicely concentrated wine offers plenty of blackberry and black cherry interlaced with oak spices that add vanilla and cinnamon nuances. It's rich and velvety in texture.

title: Saintsbury 2017 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Floral, earthy and beautifully textured, this vineyard-designated white is structured and balanced. The components are lovingly etched in wet stone, white flower and lemon verbena, lasting and lengthy with spicy texture and impressive weight.

title: Seabold Cellars 2017 Pelio Upper Block Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Pristine aromas of honeysuckle, white peach, sea salt caramel and sharp citrus make for a delicious entry on the nose of this bottling by Chris Miller. The sip zips with acid and surrounds a chalky texture, delivering flavors of Meyer lemon, grapefruit, pan-seared apple and a touch of mango. Vividly complex and delicious.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2017 Machado Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Buoyant aromas of Bing cherry and raspberry sorbet are layered with lavender and rose buds on the elegant, approachable nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The palate is crisp in an underripe cherry flavor, with a taut texture and accents of mace and star anise on the finish.

title: Benovia 2016 La Pommeraie Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site along the edge of the Green Valley appellation, this starts with a beautiful bouquet of fresh cherry and raspberry that opens the door to a seamless, supple palate. Integrated acidity supports the smooth, rich flavors of baking spice and black tea.

title: Goldeneye 2016 Ten Degrees Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is big and bold, blending powerful structure with warm red- and black-fruit flavors that fill it out. Raspberries and black cherries are shaded by strawberry and cinnamon in both the aromas and flavors, while moderate tannins and supple acidity balance everything out beautifully. Best through 2026.

title: Samsara 2014 Om Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This five-year-old wine is showing very well right now, indicative of how the cool climate style evolves into even more interesting flavors with time. Aromas of black-pepper sauce, charred lamb gristle, roasted chile peppers and black raspberry lead into a palate that's spicy with pepper, herbal with pine needles and eucalyptus and framed by underripe wild berries.

title: Samsara 2015 Melville Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The epitome of cool-climate Syrah from this region, this bottling flashes on the nose with crushed peppercorns, fresh dill, fennel and green sage, asphalt and underripe raspberry. The palate is lively, with plucked sage, coriander and obscure Mexican spices that give tremendous depth to the black-raspberry flavors

title: The Setting 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This is a high-toned, well-integrated and likable wine that's broadly expressive and expansive on the palate. It offers layered flavors of sweet tobacco, black raspberry and cherry, with supple tannins that add length and breadth.

title: Corison 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: In spite of a lightness to the palate weight, this is no doubt a serious wine. It's complex and integrated, with intriguing aspects of leather, earth and truffle. Soft and supple, it shows flavors of clove, tart red raspberry and cassis, and is deliciously memorable in every way. Enjoy 2026–2036.

title: Domaine Della 2017 Earl Stephens Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy and thick in rich, rewarding flavors of baked rhubarb and strawberry spiced by nutmeg, this bold red is also floral in rose petal. Velvety smooth and full bodied in style, it delivers concentrated complexity and undeniable appeal.

title: Massican 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: For his own label, Larkmead winemaker Dan Petroski looks to northern Italy for inspiration, sourcing from Napa Valley vineyards he admires (ones with the warmest days and coolest nights) to produce this 100% varietal beauty. Robustly fruity and flinty, it shows apricot, lemongrass, wet stone and wraparound acidity that buzzes in freshness.

title: Ancien 2016 Mink Vineyard Pinot Noir (Coombsville)
description: This wine is heady in spicy nutmeg on the nose. The palate brings bold flavors of black cherry, strawberry and orange peel. Delicately built and nuanced, it shows a wealth of integrated, supple tannins that lend support.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2017 Hapgood Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Greg Brewer's hallmark on these wines are a purity of fruit, which, in this case, arises as strawberry sorbet on the nose, with hints of thyme and tarragon. That red-fruit focus spreads into the palate, where hints of cherry tomatoes and pepper dust lead into complex herbs and spearmint toward the finish.

title: Shafer 2016 One Point Five Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This wine is sourced from the producer's Hillside Estate and Borderline Vineyards two miles south of the winery. It offers toasted oak, leather, clove and cinnamon—a savory profile that's deceptively fresh in underlying acidity. Dark plum and black cherry flavors are lushly textured and spicy on the palate.

title: Ancien 2016 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pure aromas of candied boysenberry, violet and lavender have been kissed gently by oak on the nose of this intense yet elegant bottling. That intensity grips the palate with more purple fruit and nutmeg spice, wrapped in a firm structure. Drink now–2031.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2017 Machado Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of chamomile, lemon blossom and sweet lime peel meet with an underlying hint of walnut oil and sour cream on the nose of this bottling by Greg Brewer. The palate's compelling texture is simultaneously oily and chalky, with expertly integrated acidity carrying flavors of peach extract and labneh.

title: Center of Effort 2015 Giallo Solare Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This is a rich yet balanced expression of Chardonnay, starting with aromas of butterscotch, lemon preserves, citrus cream and minty herbs. Ripe and roasted apple flavors show on the palate, as does sea-salt caramel toward the finish, but the lemony acidity drives from start to finish.

title: Cresta Velia Wines 2016 Eagle Summit Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Entirely varietal, this is a boldly flavored, structured and complex mountain-grown wine, tense and brimming in tannin. The juicy core of cherry, cassis and currant complements the darker, more brooding elements of tobacco, clove and herb. This should do well over time; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 McDonald Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This intriguing, complex and evolving wine bursts with white pepper and clove, the fruit character vibrantly fresh in pomegranate. It is worth spending time and getting to know this study in stemmy herbal tea.

title: Goldeneye 2016 Split Rail Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A sophisticated, toasty aroma and absolutely ripe and mouthfilling fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine impossible to ignore. Wonderful oak spices meet delicious black-cherry and blackberry flavors on a moderately tannic and mouthfilling structure. Best through 2024.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Goldrock Ridge Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: With up-front oak and weight, this wine has a juicy midpalate of peach, pear and apple that give the texture a welcome fleshiness and appeal. Full bodied, it retains enough underlying acidity to provide freshness beneath the richer elements.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2018 Lester Family Vineyard Partners' Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Bright aromas of apple blossom and pear meet with ripe touches of cantaloupe on the nose of this bottling. There is a great sizzle of acidity on the palate, cutting through the clean, broad flavors of apple butter on toast.

title: Lion Ranch 2018 Lioness Rosé (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of lemon pith, pluot flesh and crushed chalk show on the tightly wound nose of this blend of 57% Grenachee, 36% Cinsault and 7% Syrah. The palate grabs hold with a tense mouthfeel, delivering slight flavors of sour cherry, grapefruit pith and crushed white rocks.

title: Napa Cellars 2017 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is an explosive offering of succulent black cherry and cola that finds balance and backbone on the structured midpalate. It finishes with hints of clove, cedar and toasted oak that linger.

title: Level 3 2016 Milestone Red (Paso Robles)
description: There's a strong smoky core to the nose of this blend of 65% Syrah, 25% Grenache and 10% Mourvèdre by the founders of Dark Star Cellars, alongside aromas of roasted boysenberry, pie crust and cassis. The palate is focused on purple fruit and flowers, delivering acia, black-currant and violet flavors into an acid-washed finish.

title: Lion Ranch 2017 Cuvée Blanc White (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The nose on this blend of 64% Grenache Blanc, 28% Picpoul Blanc and 8% Roussanne sizzles with the promise of acid and tension, offering crushed sea shell, key lime sorbet and Asian pear aromas. It's almost effervescent in the glass, with zippy flabors of green papaya and lime skin.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)
description: Soft, sultry and spicy, this 100% varietal wine is from a low-yielding vintage and appellation, with blockbuster characteristics of blackberry, black cherry and black pepper. Clove, cigar box and earthy tannin add additional savory flavor around a grippy texture.

title: Mirror 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Bright in lemon and wet stone, this white offers an impressive breadth of flavor and texture. The oak is well integrated, yielding a wine that is open to lasting refreshment.

title: Lumen 2016 Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Pithy aromas of grapefruit rind, lime leaves and dried grass start a tad reductive on this bottling by Lane Tanner before opening up toward white flowers. The palate is tense, offering flavors of honeydew and pomelo flesh.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2018 Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Seared lime, melon rind and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling. There is refreshing crispness to the acid-driven palate, where limey flavors are wrapped in a chalky tension and finish with a hint of flint.

title: Graveyard 2017 Mortal Zin Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: There's a compelling mineral kick to the nose of this bottling, starting with aromas a crushed gravel aroma that gives depth to the dark strawberry, cherry pie and smoke tones. The palate is big and booming in ripe blackberry and strawberry flavors, but there are layers of tannins and baking spice that hold it all in check.

title: Bonny Doon 2018 Le Cigare Blanc Cuvée Oumuamua White (Central Coast)
description: Bright and clean aromas of honeydew and cantaloupe mesh with fresh gardenia, peach and mango on the nose of this blend of 54% Grenache Blanc and 46% Vermentino from three vineyards in Arroyo Seco and the Edna Valley. It tightens up on the sip, where Meyer lemon pith and lime skin lead into more lush guava tones.

title: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a meaty, concentrated expression of 66% Cabernet Sauvignon, 29% Merlot and smaller percentages of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Intensely powerful, it shows oak, dried herb and currant. The finish is rich and round in dark chocolate and vanilla.

title: Sanguis 2016 Two-Part Invention White (Central Coast)
description: This proprietary blend of Marsanne and Chardonnay, is a bit reductive at first on the nose, opening toward flint, petrol and pear rinds. The sip is tense and steely, with warmer yellow-apple and roast flavors slowly emerging.

title: Foxen 2017 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Tart pomegranate and cranberry aromas meet with gamy aromas of dried beef and dusty earth on the nose of this bottling. The palate is elegant while wild and rustic, offering sour plum and tangy pomegranate as well as touches of herb and game flavors.

title: Kukkula 2018 Vaalea White (Adelaida District)
description: A very crisp and zesty blend of 36% Roussanne, 35% Grenache Blanc and 29% Viognier, this antidote to rich red wines starts with aromas of Asian pear, chilled grapes and jasmine on the nose. The palate is tightly wound and rather delicate, offering peach-blossom, pear and jicama flavors.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Ripe, polished and well balanced, this wine checks all the boxes. Opulent black-cherry, black-currant and oak-spice aromas lead to rich but not overripe fruit flavors, while a soft layer of fine-grained tannins forms a smooth mouthfeel.

title: Wild Thing 2017 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)
description: This full-bodied wine smells and tastes effusively ripe and rich, offering vanilla, pear nectar and honey aromas followed by mouthfilling cream, peach and almond flavors. Nice to pair with cheese before or after a meal, or by itself as a dessert wine.

title: Zotovich 2017 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Smoky aromas wrap around the rich expression of black plums and baked berries on the nose of this estate bottling. The palate is also dense with black-currant and smoked meat qualities, with fresh violets flavors and firm tannins that pop up on the finish.

title: Andis 2018 Bill Dillian Vineyard Semillon (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is pleasantly rich in texture and ripe in flavor, showing a range of citrus, fresh herb, honey and fennel bulb nuances accompanied by a tangy but mouthfilling presence. It's a good opportunity to enjoy a class varietal that's rare in California.

title: HammerSky 2015 Against All Odds Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot starts with very tart aromas of red plum and strawberry vinegar on the nose. The palate is full of tangy red fruit as well as a pinch of dill.

title: La Fleur's 2017 At Altitude Sangiovese (South Coast)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows tangy cherry, peppercorns and a flash of light balsamic vinegar on the nose. The palate is tangy, with red-plum skins, and makes for a pleasant, easy-drinking sip.

title: River Road 2016 Red (California)
description: Vanilla and milk-chocolate accents join ripe fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, oaky and smooth-textured wine.

title: Seven Deadly Zins 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This wine is in the super fruity, jammy mode, bursting with blackberry, boysenberry and strawberry flavors. Accents of sweet oak and a fat, soft texture give it a sense of indulgence if not overindulgence.

title: Bogle 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has an appealing combo of good, ripe fruity aromas and flavors, a mouthfilling texture and soft tannins that make it smooth to sip.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Estate Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: Overt smoky, woody aromas and flavors dominate this full-bodied, bold and oaky wine. After the wood-smoke aromas come notes of black pepper and beef juice on the palate along with moderate tannins.

title: Hungry Hawk 2016 Petite Sirah (San Diego County)
description: Quite light for a Petite Sirah, this bottling shows aromas of baked strawberry and black plum with hints of toasted wood and tar. Sour black-plum-skin and purple-flower flavors arise on the thinner palate.

title: Hungry Hawk 2016 Syrah (San Diego County)
description: Black-plum jellies, sweet cola and soda pop aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's very fruity on the palate with juicy blackberry and bubblegum flavors.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Woody in cedar, pencil shavings and toasted oak, this is a straightforward, full-bodied red, big in tannin weight and breadth that delivers big bold flavor and integrated oak.

title: Loveland Vineyards 2016 Dark Knight Red (California)
description: A superdeep color and extremely concentrated Port-like aromas help this full-bodied and firmly built wine stand out from the pack. A hint of sweetness in the dark chocolate and dried plum flavors makes it mouthcoating.

title: Poundstone 2017 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Rough, sinewy tannins protrude from a big-boned style of ripeness and intent in this robust, youthful red. The dark cherry fruit takes on a baked component seasoned in Asian spice and leather.

title: Sbragia 2016 La Promessa Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a moderately structured, fully ripe red (blended with 5% Petite Sirah) that packs a considerable punch to the palate. Red licorice, cinnamon and plum contrast well against a wall of toasted oak, vanilla and cola.

title: Bella Grace 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Exuberant grapey jammy flavors make this wine tempting while full body and a touch of oaky sweetness add some fat to the mouthfeel. It will satisfy the ripeness requirements of practically anyone.

title: Langman Estate 2016 Grace's Grenache (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is rich and soothing, showing distinctive floral, grapey aromas, a broad mouthfeel and ripe concentrated plum and prune flavors. It feels quite full bodied but not very tannic, and leaves a lingering finish.

title: Murphy-Goode 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Concentrated, dry and rather full bodied, this substantive wine offers green-apple and floral aromas, ripe apple and kiwi flavors and a soothing mouthfilling texture.

title: Clos La Chance 2017 Colibri Dry Rosé (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine tastes very fresh, even candied, as peach and vanilla aromas are followed by hints of melted butter and almond on the palate.

title: HammerSky NV Straight de Barrel Lot #29 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Intriguing aromas of pencil shavings, olive, violet and dark strawberry are both lushly caramelized and a bit tangy on the nose of this bottling, which gets some Bourbon barrel treatment. The palate's black-plum-skin tang is dusted by a hint of herbs, finishing on candied caramel notes.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Bow Tie Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark black fruit dominates in this full-bodied, robust red, which offers up-front intensity of flavor. Black tea and forest give nuance within a context of moderate acidity and structure.

title: Redwood Hill 2015 Redwood Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Fountaingrove District)
description: Blended with Cabernet Franc and Merlot, then given nearly two years in oak, both French and American, this is a moderately ripe red, simple in structure and buoyant in high-strung red fruit and dried herb.

title: Sbragia 2015 Gino's Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Smoky oak and leather profoundly mark this wine, a dark fruited, herbal mingling of big flavor and body weight. Blended with 10% Carignan and 5% Petite Sirah, it lingers in sage and meaty pepper.

title: Boekenoogen 2017 Garrett's Vineyard Dry Land Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This pet project of Garrett Boekenoogen is exploring dry farming high in the foothills and this vintage is most impressive. Rocky mineral-laden aromas mix with strawberry, hibiscus and cinnamon on the nose, while the palate combines ripe berry and candied-raspberry flavors with tarragon and licorice. It's very complex and layered.

title: Foxen 2017 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A complex array of red plum, mulberry, wet slate, turned earth and lanolin show on the nose of this appellation blend, one of the winery's better bottlings of the vintage. There is a hearty weight to the sip, where perfectly ripe berries, cherries and plums meet with tarragon and other minty, earthy herb flavors.

title: Friedeman 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This commingles grapes from Lancel Creek, Terra de Promissio and Estines vineyards, all single-vineyard designates in their own right. Together, they offer floral notes of rose and lavender within exotic forested wood, dried herb, cardamom and blood orange. The whole is balanced and silky smooth.

title: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This big wine has a velvety texture and generous flavors of black cherry, blueberry and dark chocolate. Wisps of baking spices coat the palate while ample fine-grained tannins firm up the mouthfeel. It spent 18 months in all-new French oak barrels.

title: El Lugar 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Candied raspberry, wild mint and tarragon converge for an aggressive but compelling nose on this bottling from old vine blocks. The palate is full, with flavors of pomegranate, red plum, oregano and cracked pepper, making for a deep and layered sip.

title: Level 3 2016 Driven Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black currant and blackberry-pie aromas make for a joyous entry to this blend of 43% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Syrah and 15% Petite Sirah, which also shows new leather on the nose. It's generous on the palate, with rich boysenberry, snappy pink-peppercorn spice and a dusting of wild thyme, framed by balanced acidity and tannins.

title: Sanguis 2016 Misfit Red (Central Coast)
description: Juicy aromas of cherry cola, charred wood and roasted meat show on the nose of this proprietary blend of Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Grenache, Petit Verdot and Viognier. Cocoa, cola and black-plum flavors are lifted by white pepper and savory soy on the palate.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Five Sisters Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earth, spice and herb rise to the fore of this wine, complemented by its core of tart rhubarb, sage and black tea. Firm tannin and oak provide structure and balanced weight, with fresh acidity bubbling beneath the richness and power.

title: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Thick, herbal and earthy, this is a fantastic expression of the appellation. Firm tannins show structure and measured richness around thickets of black cherry, dark chocolate and earthy sage, finishing on a hint of black pepper.

title: Martinelli 2017 Vigneto di Evo Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From estate-grown fruit, this is a hearty, robust expression of the variety that explodes on the palate in restless waves of ripe red cherry, black and white pepper and exotic black licorice. Powerfully concentrated, it shows a hint of lavender on the nose that invites one back again and again.

title: Red Car 2016 Hagan Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a light, crisp and ultimately compelling wine, with an understated approach to elegance over power. At its heart is an irresistible thread of white pepper that dots a midpalate of raspberry, pomegranate and orange. This is earthy and delicious.

title: Square Peg 2017 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This brawny, concentrated wine offers tones of blue fruit, orange, rhubarb and black tea supported by a strong foundation of structured tannins. A length of earth and spice linger on the long drawn-out finish.

title: Lava Cap 2017 Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This bold wine is big but balanced, stuffed with ripe and tempting plum and blackberry flavors that are supported by moderate tannins. Hints of white pepper and concentrated fruit keep unfolding on the finish.

title: Phinch 2018 Chêne Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Though still quite young, this is an impressive debut wine, starting with rich yet balanced aromas of black cherry, star anise, crushed rocks and light licorice. The sip hits with a sizzle of acidity and then opens toward mulberry, elderberry and other wild tree fruits, with hints of fennel bulb, all wrapped in leathery tannins. Drink now through 2033.

title: Beckmen 2017 Purisima Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: This is a classic expression of Ballard Canyon's Goldilocks appeal, blending the rich potential of warmer-weather Syrah with cooler-climate freshness. Aromas of black cherry, fudge and even butterscotch lead to a palate were oaky caramel and cappuccino flavors are cut by crisp pepper spice.

title: Bee Hunter 2014 Docker Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Warm fruit tones and abundant baking spices give this full-bodied and late-released wine plenty of allure. Touches of rhubarb and tamarind come out on the palate, supported by moderate fine-grained tannins.

title: Sandhi 2017 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a fascinating wine. It's both hearty and loaded with savory greener flavors—an unusual combination. Aromas of dark plum, tobacco and green sage lead into a palate that is both dense and zesty, showing more plum offset by Earl Grey tea, green peppercorn and pine needle.

title: Talbott 2017 Sarah Case Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Strong aromas of lemon and yellow grapefruit meet with richer touches of toasted Marcona almond, sea salt and toast on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh and savory, mixing lemon cream with almond and buttered croissant.
designation: Sarah Case Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Estate Grown

title: Tantara 2017 Evelyn Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Intense aromas of boysenberry are ripe and pure, with hints of sagebrush and cracked pepper on the nose. The palate is hearty and delicious, with flavors of boysenberry pie, lifted by pinches of clove and cardamom.

title: Holus Bolus 2017 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a great introductory bottle for cool-climate Syrah, offering a fruit-driven freshness that's appealing to many palates while providing the savory tones of the style. Aromas of cracked pepper, green peppercorn, blistered red plum and woody raspberries lead into a palate of underripe berry and more pepper.

title: Bianchi 2017 Loma Verde Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling offers subtle and pleasant aromas of rust and red fruit on the nose. The palate is more concentrated, with sour cherry and rose-petal flavors, dusted with a hint of dried thyme.

title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling offers dried black-plum and baked soil aromas on the tightly wound nose. More plum flavors meet with rosemary flowers on the palate, which is clean yet simple.

title: Conduit 2018 Viognier (El Dorado)
description: This light to medium-bodied wine shows a greenish tint in the light-gold color, vanilla and butter aromas, and a rich but not overripe flavor of lemon and butter.

title: Covenant 2017 Landsman Field Blend Red (Sonoma County)
description: A blend of 65% Zinfandel with 18% Petite Sirah and 17% Grenache, this is a meaty, peppery expression of bold flavor and texture, that's richly rounded and layered. Blueberry jam and vanilla give it a lasting succulence.

title: Granite Lion 2017 Melody Lane White (South Coast)
description: A fairly dark shade of yellow in the glass, this blend from Jamul, California looks a little funky but shows familiar aromas of dried peach and lemon spray on the nose. It's waxy on the palate before light acid washes through, offering shy flavors of citrus and nuts toward the finish.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Hearty, reduced and big in oak and tannin, this wine offers jammy black fruit, with light hints of leather and sage. Robustly ripe, soft and rich, it overdelivers on its price points to fans of a robust concentrated style.

title: Raymond 2016 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tight, tannic and leathery in texture, this full-bodied wine is thick and broadly defined, with powerfully dense, dark berry fruit. Hints of sage give it an nice earthiness that lingers.

title: Smith Devereux 2017 Red (California)
description: Packed with plummy, pruney fruit flavors and generous oak spices, this full-bodied wine blasts the palate with a bold, almost roasted effect. It's moderately tannic and softens with a touch of sweetness on the finish.

title: Vigilance 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: A smoky, peppery tone dominates this full-bodied and flavorful wine, but it has enough black-cherry and sour cherry fruitiness on the palate to balance it out. Moderate tannins add some grip and the smoky-fruity blend lingers on the finish.

title: Buehler 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a dark and intensely brooding wine, 100% varietal, from fruit grown near Howell Mountain. Smoke, char, bark and densely packed tannin wrap around baked plum, graphite and earthy dried herb.

title: Buehler 2016 Papa's Knoll Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's oldest block of Cabernet Sauvignon, this delivers soft, layered herbaceousness and grip, the tannins firm and tenacious. Baked plum, nutmeg and oaky concentration complement each other well.

title: Esser 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Gamy aromas meet with dark berry on the slightly sour nose of this bottling. Tangy black fruits and dark strawberry show on the sip, where the gamy, dried meat flavors also show.

title: Parker Station 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Light and bright aromas of red fruit, tobacco and dank herbs show on the nose of this bottling. Tangy herbs and zippy acidity carry tart berry flavors through the sip.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Herbal and briary, this wine shows strong flavors of clove, cigar and leather saddle, with a soft, easygoing midpalate of full-bodied weight and flavor. Black currant and dark chocolate mark the finish.

title: Barefoot NV Moscato (California)
description: Very fruity, flavorful and semisweet, this light-bodied and low-alcohol wine gushes floral and lychee fruit aromas, sweet honey and honeydew melon flavors and soft texture.

title: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This fruity and very affordable wine has an appealing, smooth texture and attractive, light peach and apple flavors. Medium body and a touch of crispness make it appetizing.

title: Apothic 2016 Red (California)
description: Semisweet and very fruity, this is a rich and mouthcoating wine, with a very soft texture. It offers ripe cherry, prune and raisin flavors and a lingering syrupy finish.

title: Beringer 2017 Founder's Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine is light for a Cabernet, and shows lots of fresh, almost-sweet fruit flavors from strawberry to marascino cherry. Medium body and a lack of noticeable tannins keep the texture soft and easy.

title: Black Ink 2017 Red (California)
description: Fruity, light and easy, in contrast to the look of the bottle, this medium-bodied wine shows fresh cherry and raspberry aromas, lively fruit flavors and a smooth light texture.

title: Drive 2017 Puccioni Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This thick, viscous wine features syrupy red fruit complemented in black pepper, leather and robust oak.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2015 Left Tusque Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Thick and herbaceous, with a trail of bright red currant, cherry and cassis, this is a broadly expansive and well-made wine, elegantly balanced and restrained in style. It delivers plenty of fruit within a context of structure and seamless texture.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Coast Grade Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: Very pretty on the nose, this bottling starts with aromas of light raspberry, rose petals and tarragon on the nose. It's clean, fresh, delicate and yet expressive on the palate with dried sagebrush and more crisp raspberry flavors.

title: Stasis 2016 Murmur Vineyard Gamay Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The potential for Gamay Noir to become an important Central Coast grape is made apparent with almost every bottling. In this case, aromas of strawberry, cherry jam, gravel and singed oak lead into a broad, immensely drinkable palate of red plum, white pepper and salted meats. Glug up!

title: The Paring 2015 Red (California)
description: Candied blackberry aromas meet with cola spice, licorice and wet earth on the nose of this red blend from the same team behind the Jonata and The Hilt wineries. There is a strong structure to the full-bodied palate, where black fruit plays with cocoa and pepper spices.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Grand Reserve Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: K-J's Grand Reserve is well worth the upcharge from the Vintner's Reserve. This seductive and delicious wine is practically irresistible for its combination of abundant ripe-fruit and baking-spice flavors. It offers an indulgent, luxurious texture of melted tannins and mellow acidity.

title: Brick Barn 2017 Rose of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A beautiful pale pink in color, this rosé, which includes 10% Grenache Blanc, shows lovely aromas of bubblegum, strawberry and wet cement on the nose. There is a great sizzle to the palate, where citrusy energy delivers rounded flavors of plum and strawberry.

title: Caraccioli 2018 Escolle Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is an exciting pink wine from the bubbly-focused Caraccioli family. It shows boisterous aromas of bubble gum, peach and lime on the nose. The palate is racy and tense, offering a delicious smashed-strawberry flavor.

title: De Loach 2015 Forgotten Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Juicy, broad and thick, this red is nonetheless brightened by nervy acidity and tart tangled flavors of cherry and blackberry. Integrated and soft in texture, it delights in its earthy, savory elements of black pepper, mint and leather that contrast well against the fruit.

title: De Loach 2015 Saitone Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This comes from a well-known, historic old-vine site in the heart of the appellation's Olivet Bench. Brawny in black fruit, leather and earthy grit, it shows a juicy midpalate of bright acidity that tempers its robustly ripe and rich tendencies.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
