description: Tart, tangy and intensely earthy, this is a concentrated, youthful and full-throttled flavored wine, with plenty of balanced acidity to keep it fresh and structured. Cardamom and black tea provide a savory complement to the vibrant energy.

title: Goat Bubbles 2015 Solomon Hills Vineyard Rosé Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A yellowy shade of pink in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of strawberry jam, raspberry, corn tortilla and yeast on the nose. It hits the palate with a broad entry, presenting flavors of strawberry foam and sourdough that combine both fruit with yeasty funk.

title: Las Positas 2015 Coccineous Estate Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Supremely concentrated and deep, this full-bodied wine shows an inky color, dense aromas of black fruits, leather and spices, and tongue-coating blackberry and blueberry flavors. It is mouthfilling, generously tannic and well suited for big dishes like mushroom risotto or osso buco. It's blended from Tempranillo, Syrah and Petite Sirah with a dash of Graciano.

title: Steele 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)
description: A generous helping of spicy, smoky oak blends with a rich and saturated black fruit flavor in this full-bodied, moderately tannic and seductive wine. Aged in 30% new American and French barrels, it offers layers of flavor, a good sense of depth and plenty of structure for pairing with big proteins.

title: Whitcraft 2017 Stolpman Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Drake Whitcraft is pushing the earlier-pick, low-alcohol styles like few others, and this almost rosé-like Grenache is an extreme example. Transparent in the glass, the wine shows aromas of fresh strawberries, cinnamon, rose and tarragon. It's bright on the sip with cran-raspberry flavors and a simple touch of minty herbs. It's a great red wine for the beach.

title: Anaba 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Snappy black-raspberry aromas meet with concentrated rose-water and damp sage on the nose of this single vineyard expression. Lovely flavors of sour cherry, thyme and white pepper ride a fresh line of acidity into a sagebrush-filled finish.

title: Aperture 2017 Chenin Blanc (North Coast)
description: Mineral, stone fruit and earth are interwoven within a framework of sizzling acidity in this roundly textured, lightly ripe and impressive white wine. The palate is dry and crisp, with exotic tones of honey and almond.

title: Boheme 2015 English Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: South-facing toward the ocean and the coast of Marin, this white tastes of the sea, a mix of stone and salt with in a viscous complexion of tightly wound structure and grace. The fruit is subdued and well integrated, with a touch of white peach and lemon lingering on the palate.

title: Boheme 2015 Stuller Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Plummy and deeply defined in wild cherry and strawberry, this wine has a surprising density and underlying richness beneath its more savory, earthy characteristics of forest, black tea and sandalwood. Balanced in ripeness, it is well integrated and still developing in complexity.

title: Boheme 2015 Taylor Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Honeysuckle and jasmine aromas invite one into this cool coastal wine, light bodied and tightly wound in tannin and well-integrated oak. The flavors assemble into shards of wet stone and oyster shell, with tart chasers of apricot and Meyer lemon.

title: Boheme 2015 Taylor Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A cold site in a concentrated, challenging vintage known for being both intense and compact, this wine delivers a subtle package of oak, cedar, clove and earth before unfurling quiet waves of plum, currant and cassis.

title: Boatique 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: Both concentrated and deep, this full-bodied wine has plenty to offer. It starts with a deep dark color, displays rich and focused fruit aromas and brings ripe blackberry and black cherry to the palate. A touch of fine-grained tannins adds a velvety touch to the texture.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Califa Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: This bottling from a cool-climate zone is tight and bright on the nose with aromas of blackberry, lilac and elderflower. The palate is very firm in tannic structure right now, so the flavors of elderberry, black plum, lavender and aromatic herbs need more time to evolve. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Herman Story 2015 On the Road Grenache (California)
description: Roasted blackberry and charred meat aromas show on the nose of this Grenache, which is superripe and extracted in the winery's style, but retains a compelling degree of balance. The palate shows rather elegant touches of star anise and clove against a backdrop of roasted cherries, plums, sagebrush and cola.

title: Holdredge 2016 Judgment Tree Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a block in the Rochioli Vineyard, this wine astounds in beautiful tones of earth, spice and tea. Cardamom complements the robust body of juicy black cherry, oak and tannin. The wine's power is held in check by a subtle floral tone that lingers on the finish.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Domaine des Chirats Rockpile Vineyard Syrah (Rockpile)
description: In collaboration with French winemaker Yves Cuilleron, this is a substantial wine of great complexity and bold flavor. A juicy entry of black cherry and blackberry dig up underlying earthiness and aspects of lavender and lilac. It has big power within a soft frame.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Silver Eagle Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny grippy tannins take hold of a full-bodied output of earthy compost and thick walls of dense, concentrated black cherry and blackberry in this robust well-made wine from a great vineyard site. The earthiness persists in leading to garrigue and grilled meat on the lingering finish.

title: Kathryn Kennedy 2005 Cuvée Twenty-Seven Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: It's fascinating to see California wineries release older sparkling wines. This 13-year-old beauty is dark yellow in the glass and offers aromas of Meyer lemon peel, corn, nuts and orchard fruit. The palate is rich with flavors of corn tortilla dough, dried lemon peels and creamy wheat meal, seeming both nuanced and powerful.

title: Phillips Hill 2017 Boontling Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is full bodied, ripe and inviting, showing warm plum, cherry and spice from the first whiff to the lingering finish. Luckily it stops short of overripeness and has a wrapping of light tannins and good acidity to freshen its texture.

title: Sanguis 2015 Wildflower White (Central Coast)
description: This cofermented blend of Marsanne, Viognier and Roussanne shows toasted oak, dried Meyer lemon skin and a sherry-like nutty pecan quality on the nose. The palate is strong with mango flavors that are cut by a lime-laced edge that drives into the finish.

title: Flanagan 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This is an impressive, grippy and full-bodied red, firm in tannin and well-integrated in oak. Caramel toffee flavors complement offerings of lavender and grilled meat, with a dusty, crushed rock flair to the minerality. This has time to go in the bottle. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Halcón 2016 Elevacion Syrah (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This expressive, smoky, wine has a bright firm texture of moderate tannins and good acidity along with medium body. The aromas suggest black pepper, red cherry and black tea, while the flavors bring out more red and black cherries for a good sense of depth. This used 100% whole clusters that were fermented with native yeast.

title: Jigar 2015 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from grapes grown on a former Gravenstein apple orchard, this white offers perfumed and earthy elements of apple blossom and geranium with a bright lifted midpalate of lemony citrus and pear. Integrated oak gives it oomph without distraction making for a complete experience that's soft and crisp.

title: Knights Bridge 2016 Pont De Chevalier Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: This has a heady perfume of apple blossom and toasted oak that invites from the beginning. Salty and briny, it wraps full-bodied complexity and acidity with dense robust flavors of green apple and tart plum.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Estate Reserve Jewel Collection Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a powerful, eminently flavorful wine that's dry, full bodied and well structured. It has resounding black-cherry and blackberry flavors, good acidity, firm tannins and a mouthcoating texture.

title: Chronic Cellars 2017 Suite Petite Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: The Beckett brothers deliver a wine that starts with aromas of concentrated blackberry jam, toasted wood, plum and violet. The palate is floral and fresh, with penetrating flavors of blueberry sorbet that rest against a strong tannic structure.

title: Fort Ross Winery 2015 Top of Land Fort Ross Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: A robust nose of forest and smoky leather give way to a grippy midpalate of tension and tannic structure in this coastal estate wine. Strawberry compote and blueberry flavors are sumptuous and sultry on the palate, becoming velvety smooth within twists of black tea and cardamom.
designation: Top of Land Fort Ross Vineyard

title: Glenwood Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: With a persistence of lively acidity, this crisp white is fresh and floral, with textured waves of integrated flavor. The fruit consists of green apple, grapefruit and lime, a memorable medley of refreshment.

title: Guarachi Family 2016 Sun Chase Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This estate wine has a thick floral entry and oaky imprint that is complemented by strong, robustly layered flavors of melon, lemon and crushed rock. Full bodied and richly concentrated, it has a lushness to the palate that remains well structured throughout.

title: Hubba 2016 Dreamland Red (Paso Robles)
description: A fascinating look at cofermented grapes that don't usually hang out, this blend of 69% Grenache and 31% Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas of candied strawberry, potpourri, smoked cranberry and sagebrush on the nose. It's soft and plush on the palate, where cran-raspberry flavors meet with wild thyme.

title: Kukkula 2016 Kaamos Red (Adelaida District)
description: This deep and hearty, but not too heavy, blend of 52% Petite Sirah, 17% Grenache, 15% Mourvèdre, 10% Zinfandel and 6% Syrah shows smashed black currant and blueberry on the nose. There is strong, sticky structure to the palate, where dark-purple fruits meet with smoke and thyme flavors.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Older Barrels Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling offers heavily layered aromas of red cherry, wild thyme and sage. It hits the palate with heft, delivering boysenberry, bay leaf and peppercorn flavors to make for a full expression of the grape.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2015 Barrack Brand Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Fresh cranberries, a hint of blackberry and crushed river stone make for an accessible yet elegant nose on this blend of 80% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Cabernet Franc, 5% Malbec and 5% Petite Verdot. The palate is subtle, smooth and balanced, with polished hints of blackberry, gravel and herbs. These qualities will intensify with time, so drink from 2020 through 2035.

title: Lone Madrone 2015 Oveja Negra Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This head-pruned, dry-farmed blend of 49% Mourvèdre, 22% Grenache, 21% Syrah and 8% Counoise from Old Oak Vineyard begins with blackberry, dried purple-flower and gamy meat aromas. The palate is full, with strong but smooth tannins that present flavors of roasted berry and more wild meats.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2017 Songs of Its Own Red (Adelaida District)
description: Snappy pomegranate, hibiscus and rose-petal aromas are sprinkled with sarsaparilla spice on the nose of this blend of 52% Grenache, 45% Mourvèdre and 3% Cinsault. It's light bodied on the palate, where refreshing flavors of cranberry, pomegranate and orange rind make for a lively sip.

title: Davies 2016 JD Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This elegant, classically styled wine is earthy in tobacco, mushroom and fig, a lovely wine from the mountain appellation. A soft understated richness of plum and black cherry wrap around a texture of grippy dust and dark chocolate, finishing as gracefully as it starts.

title: Bold 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Warm aromas of red cherry and oak meet with juniper and sage on the nose of this appellation blend. The wine zips with acidity when it his the palate, delivering fresh flavors of red currant and rose, proving refreshing into the finish.

title: Dawn's Dream 2017 Bel Sogno Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Sharp aromas of black plum and mulberry meet with an underlying earthy aspect on the nose of this bottling. There is a similarly buoyant fruit character to the palate, where those plummy flavors are framed with acidity and decorated with dried oregano.

title: Dusty Nabor 2017 NSO Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Quite lush and rich on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of red cherry cream with caramel and vanilla, proving quite inviting. The palate takes those rich cherry flavors and backs them up with earthy and herbal elements, including tobacco leaf.

title: En Garde 2015 Touché Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This includes 12% Mount Veeder Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. Juicy blackberry and brown-sugar richness evolves in the glass to find balance in high-toned cherry and currant. It has good tension and texture within a full-bodied concentrated framework.

title: Fallbrook 2016 33 Degrees North Gracie Hill Vineyard Cabernet Franc (South Coast)
description: This is a very fresh wine from an appellation that's often much heavier and extracted. Aromas of roasted strawberries, oak, tarragon and peppercorn confirm the grape variety, while the palate shows hibiscus, roasted red cherries and more cracked pepper.

title: Flora Springs 2016 Rennie Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Pencil shavings and plum give this sumptuous full-bodied wine a well-earned structure, with high-toned, fresh undertones of acidity and complexity. The oak and tannin weight are in balance and in support of the savory fruit.

title: Giornata 2018 Vermentino (Paso Robles)
description: Broad and appealing aromas of white peach, cherimoya, daffodil and gardenia show on the nose of this bottling. The wine hits the palate with supple flavors of creamy white peach, honeysuckle and banana flowers, dashed with a savory pinch of sea salt.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Twist of Fate Alta Colina Vineyard Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Earthy blackberry aromas meet with violet and lavender on the elegantly layered nose of this bottling. The palate is far more complex, blending game, turned earth and black-plum flavors. But the structure is most impressive, with thick textural tannins that will last long. Drink 2020–2031.
designation: Twist of Fate Alta Colina Vineyard

title: Koehler 2016 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this intriguing bottling combines dried hibiscus and red-fruit aromas with tinges of wild thyme and singed rosemary on the nose. The palate is also complex and intellectual, offering pomegranate and wild tarragon flavors.

title: Koehler 2016 Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rich aromas of caramel-glazed boysenberry and toasty oak smell much thicker than the medium-bodied frame that's evident in the glass on this wine. The palate balances roasted coffee, blackberry-paste, star anise and nutmeg flavors into a delicious sip.

title: Riley's Rows 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Lychee, peach and inviting opening aromatics make for a heady entry into this light, bright and crisply high-toned white. Lemon peel and a bite of orange add to the texture and overall complexity.

title: Samsara 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very fresh and snappy aromas of black raspberry are lifted by elegant touches of red flowers, mace and a loamy minerality on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate shows focused red-fruit flavors of cranberry and pomegranate, yet with an earthy, dusty core.

title: Sol Rouge 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This wine is a full-bore full-bodied effort that shows intensely concentrated black-fruit, black-pepper and wood-smoke aromas, followed by a wave of superripe flavors. An attractive charcoal and iron-like quality comes out with time in the glass. Firm tannins keep it well wrapped up, but this is not necessarily an ager; enjoy through 2021.

title: Parvaneh 2016 Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Lavish aromas of cassis, lavender and cocoa make for a deep and thorough nose in this estate bottling. Cohesive flavors of roasted beef, boysenberry jam, peppercorn and flower petals make for a complex and smooth experience.

title: Armida 2016 Castelli Knight Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Cranberry and plum meet a contrasting richness of vanilla and cola in this ultimately balanced, expressive wine. Supple on the midpalate, it has high-toned acidity and a lightness of a lasting finish featuring baking spice and forest.

title: Ironstone 2016 Estate Grown Reserve Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is powerful, full bodied and tastes as if lavishly oaked to lend an aroma of toasted almonds and browned butter, flavors like baked apple and toasted baguette and a mouthfilling texture backed by good acidity.

title: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Naci Ocevi Black Label Nasi Ocevi Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This full-throttle wine has a deep dark color, heady oak, smoke and cedar aromas, extra-ripe fruit flavors and a full body. It has just enough tannin for a little grip and to focus the generous black-fruit flavors.
designation: Naci Ocevi Black Label Nasi Ocevi Vineyard

title: Longevity 2013 Vintner Select Petit Verdot (Lodi)
description: This is a tasty, oaky and extremely spicy wine that smells like cedar and balsamic, tastes rich and spicy like molasses, and has lots of body and velvety tannins for structure. It's a kick to taste and enjoy.

title: Tom of Finland 2016 Out Standing Red (California)
description: Bold in flavor and moderately tannic, this is a robust wine that pours rich blackberry and black cherry onto the palate. Firm tannins and a good creamy mouthfeel wrap nicely around the rich fruit and spicy oak notes.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 G-S-M (Livermore Valley)
description: Broad and rich, this full-bodied wine has bass notes of black cherry, lots of baking spice accents from oak barrel aging, and a mouthfilling, almost soft texture.

title: Redwood Hill 2017 Hopkins River Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a compact texture of firm acidity and tone. Subtle aromatics lead the way to defined flavors of melon and peach that have a density that persists on the long finish.

title: Gen5 2016 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine tastes ultrafresh and fruity, feels rich and lightly tannic and has enough underlying concentration to add depth. Perfect for casual occasions.

title: Dark Horse 2016 Merlot (California)
description: This full-bodied Merlot is blended with 7% Petit Verdot and 6% Teroldego. It tastes ripe and generous, but also grippy on the palate. Moderate tannins and good acidity give it some heft, while a deep black-cherry flavor and mild oak spice add interest.

title: Ironstone 2016 Chenin Blanc (California)
description: This light, fruity, dry wine smells like apple skins and tastes like crisp Pippin apples. It has good balance, a tangy palate and clean finish. It's easy to imagine pairing it with smoked trout or goat cheese in a first course.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Black Beast Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: A deep dark color and heavy tannins make this wine full bodied and rather formidable to sip, but it is nicely packed with fresh and delicious blackberry, dried cherry and pomegranate flavors. It is made mostly from Petite Sirah and Syrah with dashes of Mourvèdre and Zinfandel.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Pure, focused fruit flavors give this wine plenty of appeal and there is little oak flavor to distract from them. It is full bodied and moderately tannic to put a good frame around the generous raspberry and blackberry flavors that taste vibrant and concentrated.

title: Precision Wine 2016 Fly By Merlot (North Coast)
description: This easygoing honest-tasting dry wine has simple straightforward fruit flavors, a good restrained texture and relatively light body so it's tempting to pour another glass. Expect ripe but not sweet plum and grape flavors.

title: Renwood 2016 Special Reserve Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Fruity, ripe and soft, this wine is chock-full of expressive, jammy, berry and plum flavors, has mild tannins and low acidity. It feels easy and soothing on the palate.

title: Shannon Ridge 2016 High Elevation Collection Wrangler Red (Lake County)
description: Full bodied and saturated with black-fruit flavors, this wine matches its firm structure with opulent fruit notes to achieve a delicious, generous character and smooth texture.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Califa Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: Intense aromas of cherry cola and rosewater meet with crumbled sage and vanilla cookie on the nose of this bottling. It's quite light and even a tad thin on the palate, yet the flavors are bursting with cherry and roasted strawberry.

title: Lexington 2014 Gist Ranch Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Candied rosewater, minty tarragon, tangy black-plum and black raspberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers similar black-plum tang along with warmer flavors of lilac and pencil shavings.

title: Monochrome 2017 Altered Images White (California)
description: This blend of 52% Chardonnay and 48% Chenin Blanc comes from two vineyards in Santa Barbara County, and shows aromas of yellow pear, lemon blossom and gardenia. There is a nice taut quality to the palate, where ripe peach flavors and a hint of oak arise.

title: Opolo 2017 Mountain Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This is a big and well-made Zinfandel, good for those who love the unabashedly ripe yet not cloying style. Aromas of smoked strawberry, red currant and cranberry syrup lead into a palate that is plush with strawberry sorbet and chalky tannins.

title: Primative 2016 Hunter Gatherer Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Full aromas of black cherry, smoked wood and cola spice show on the nose of this bottling. Polished tannins wrap the palate, which offers juicy flavors of black currant with a finish of vanilla and caramel.

title: Sextant 2016 Wheelhouse Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this bottling is quite focused on the loamy soil aspects, but there is also a fruity touch of black cherry. The tannins are well polished on the palate, allowing the black-plum, nutmeg and clove flavors to take center stage.

title: De Loach 2016 Stubbs Vineyard Petaluma Gap Chardonnay (Marin County)
description: This full-bodied barrel-fermented wine is bold in flavor, rich in texture and showing a plethora of complex and delicious oak and spice flavors. Nutmeg, toasted almond, baked pears and vanilla coat the palate and linger on the finish, while the luxurious texture is nicely balanced by moderate acidity.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Spencer's Hill Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a spot within the producer's estate Endeavour Vineyard, named for a member of the winery's third-generation, this is a thick, concentrated wine bursting in blackberry, cherry and plum. Robust in tannin and oak, it shows lush balance as it evolves, finishing in dusty clove, nutmeg and vanilla cake.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a nicely made wine, its oak barrel-influence up front yet subdued. Caramel, lemon curd and graham cracker are complemented by mineral components of stone and sea air in addition to an impressive lift of tangerine. The quenching acidity doesn't prevent the texture from feeling lush but all is ultimately balanced and bright.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 The Imposter Red (California)
description: Drenched with luxuriously ripe black-fruit flavors, this generous, ripe and full-bodied wine is a standout. Largely blended from Zinfandel and Petite Sirah, it shows black-plum and black-cherry notes that have an almost-sweet character on the palate, and linger nicely on the finish.

title: Las Positas 2015 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a full-bore full-bodied wine that is not at all shy about its oak spiciness and potent ripe fruit core. Cedar, vanilla and cinnamon nuances in the aroma lead to vibrant black-cherry and dark-chocolate flavors while, a velvety coat of tannins forms a big but smooth texture.

title: Lucia 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Pleasantly strong aromas of chalk meet with lemon blossom on the impressively delicate nose of this appellation blend from the Pisoni family. There is great tension to the sip, where a chalky grip surrounds flavors of white peach, pineapple and light oak.

title: Maritana 2017 Dutton Ranch Shop Block 1967 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Anise, earth, white flower and honey combine on the nose and palate of this tightly structured white from a cooler section of the appellation. Gravenstein apple flavors present as lush and plush, cradled in toasted oak, yet there's an acid backbone that's undeniably fresh.

title: Paradise Springs 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: From McGinley Vineyard, this bottling is extremely fresh and vibrant, starting with aromas of spring flowers, alpine water, white lily and delicate pear peels. There is extreme tension to the palate, where rounded apple, pear and nectarine flavors are wrapped in fresh acidity.

title: Peloton 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: There's a compelling aroma of slate-driven minerality on the nose of this bottling alongside violet, lilac and candied black currant. The palate is also floral in character, with lavender decorating the black-plum core, which is also spiced by peppercorns and framed in sticky tannins.

title: Stolo 2017 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Seared nectarine, sea salt and white melon make for a broad, clean and welcoming aromatic entry to this bottling. The sip is very cohesive, showing toast with white-peach jam, lemon rinds and more sea salt, which makes sense given the vineyard's proximity to the coastline.

title: Thomas Allen 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: This big bad wine attacks from all points of the compass, starting with an inky color and smoky peppery singed herb aromas and followed by bold blackberry, unsweetened cocoa and espresso flavors that are up to the task of balancing the formidable fine-grained tannins. Expressive, complex oak influences like cedar, tobacco and cumin continue across the palate, lingering on the finish. Best after 2025.

title: Toca Madera 2016 Conmigo Viognier-Marsanne (Madera)
description: Wines like this excellent Rhône-style white blend show that Madera County can do more than sweet wines and bulk wines. Nicely rich and savory, this wine complements subtle pear and peach flavors with waxy stony nutty nuances that give it attractive complexity. A full body and a mouthcoating texture help extend the finish.

title: Carlisle 2016 The Integral Red (Sonoma County)
description: Winemaker Mike Officer combines 53% Syrah and 47% Mourvèdre into a greater whole in this brawny concentrated beauty, which is highly aromatic in tobacco, coffee bean and black-olive tapenade. Baked fruit flavor is contrasted in grilled meat, mushroom and white pepper, with refined tannins never getting in the way.

title: De Loach 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a well-made, well-integrated showcase of the appellation, with crisp flavors of apple, ginger and Asian pear. Hearty in texture and style, it has a lasting bite of anise on the full-bodied finish.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Rodney's Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Strong aromas of black plum and blackberry are hit with savory salt and pepper spices on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate's richness is cut by snappy boysenberry, a hint of anise and a finish of vanilla.

title: Foxen 2017 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Crisp aromas of lemon peel and pomelo wedge meet with gravelly, grassy undertones on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is richness to the palate, and the faint hint of oak, with flavors of baked apple that are cut by grass and squeezed lime.

title: Graziano 2015 Vincenzo Vineyard 100th Anniversary Red (Mendocino County)
description: This wine, made from 70-year-old Carignan and Valdiguié vines, has a bold cedary floral spicy aroma, vivid black-fruit and cinnamon flavors and a grippy, moderately tannic texture. It's big in structure and lip-smacking in mouthfeel, so it should age well. Best after 2024.

title: Nelle 2016 Syrah (California)
description: Brooding aromas of black currant and black plum meet with damp soil, charred meat and a pinch of black pepper on the nose of this Syrah. Ripe fruit flavors rule the palate, from singed black plums to strong purple flowers, along with savory tones of hoisin and miso. Chalky tannins frame the sip.

title: Sanguis 2016 Souplesse No. 6 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Those seeking depth and complexity in the form of rosé will be satisfied by this bottling, which begins with richer aromas of cherry, dried herbs and tangerine peel. There is a grippy orange pith start to the sip, followed by flavors of baked red fruit and compressed rose petals.

title: Trentadue 2016 La Storia Petite Sirah (Alexander Valley)
description: This well-made wine tastes of blueberry pie and lavender—its style big in tannin and ripe oak, yet bright in acidity. Integrated and softly textured, it has a freshness to the finish that invites and impresses.

title: Zotovich 2017 Zoto Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Asian pear, lime blossom, light pineapple, wet slate and grapefruit aromas make for a complex nose on this entry-level bottling for the estate winery. Candied pear and ripe apple show on the clean, poppy palate.

title: Gloria Ferrer NV Méthode Champenoise Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Carneros)
description: This sparkling wine is a blend of 92% Pinot Noir and 8% Chardonnay. Pale peachy-pink in color, it is balanced and fruity, displaying tones of strawberry, lemon and wet stone.

title: Marimar 2017 Blanc de Noirs Dona Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from 100% Pommard-clone grown on an estate vineyard, this is a focused, lightly fruity wine that tastes of sea spray, wet stone and a touch of cherry cola. While dry, it develops a pleasing richness on the midpalate that carries it through the lifted finish.
designation: Blanc de Noirs Dona Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir

title: Geyser Peak 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 5% Petite Sirah, this is a substantially concentrated wine that works in its delivery of sinewy, richly layered marshmallow and blackberry. Expansive on the palate, it's soft and velvety lush, with pillowy tannins that stretch across the palate.

title: Peju 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This sanguine, herbal wine has an explosive midpalate of oaky cherry and dusty tannin, delivering on its varietal promise. Hearty and full bodied, it balances its savory personality well against a backdrop of red fruit.

title: Pellegrini 2018 Olivet Lane Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Candied strawberry and tangerine mark this creamy, lush and likable wine, which refreshes in its persistence of acidity. It has a tease of red licorice the adds richness that works within the brighter tones.

title: Upshot 2018 White (Sonoma County)
description: This blend of Chardonnay, Grenache Blanc, Gewürztraminer, Pinot Noir, Viognier and Sauvignon Blanc is bright and crisp in feel. Bursting in persistent acidity, it lingers in tones of honeysuckle and green apple.

title: Bouchaine 2018 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir Rosé (Carneros)
description: This is an estate wine made from Pinot Noir grapes, the majority whole-cluster pressed. Crisp and fruity, it tastes of wild strawberry, peach and melon. Lightly ripe, it remains dry and vibrant and perfectly quaffable.

title: Côte West 2018 Del Barba Vineyard Rosé of Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: This vivid and tangy wine has a hot-pink color and is crammed with raspberry and watermelon flavors. The fruit flavors are fresh and inviting, and combined with the good acidity they make a lasting impression.

title: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This is a fruity, vibrant and well-balanced wine that will please a lot of people. It gushes with blackberry and black cherry aromas. The palate is full of concentrated ripe-berry flavors and offers just a hint of tannins for an appetizing texture.

title: McKinney 2016 Tuscan Nights Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rose petals, wet slate and alpine strawberry aromas show on the nose of this blend of 62% Sangiovese, 23% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Petit Verdot. Fairly tight tannins surround the sip, which is loaded with black plum and minty herbs.

title: Yorba 2018 Shake Ridge Vineyards Rosado (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied, luxuriously textured wine is blended from Primitivo, Tempranillo and Barbera. It offers a pale color, watermelon and white-raspberry flavors, and a generous texture that's lifted by good acidity to balance it out.

title: Davies 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Overdelivering on its price point, this is a well-made, impressively structured red wine, blended with 9% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. Soft in texture and moderate in acidity, it has high-toned red fruit that presents as tart and tangy beneath firm, integrated tannin and vanilla oak.

title: Dubost 2017 Alexandrine White (Adelaida District)
description: Clean lines of melon, yellow peach, lemon juice and daffodil show on the nose of this blend of 60% Viognier, 30% Grenache Blanc and 10% Roussanne. The fatter white-peach flavors are leveled by citrus pith and savory sea salt touches on the palate.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Estate Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This entry-level Pinot Noir is a blend of estate vineyards in the Santa Maria Valley and Los Alamos. Aromas of red cherry and turned earth lead into a palate that's grippy in texture while delivering flavors of cherry, smoke and vanilla cookie. Sweet spice tones extend into a long finish.

title: Rusack 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Light lemon, wet chalk and smoked white-peach aromas show on the nose of this county-wide bottling, which is all from Clone 4 grapes. It lands on the palate cleanly, with flavors of white peach, lemongrass and a touch of butterscotch toward the finish.

title: Blackbird Vineyards 2016 Illustration Red (Napa Valley)
description: Letting Merlot lead the way at 78%, this red also includes 21% Cabernet Franc and 1% Cabernet Sauvignon. Chocolate and plum define a core of tension and structure, the fruit expansive on the palate and seasoned in savory spice.

title: Pali 2018 Pali Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light aromas of watermelon, nectarine and pale-pink rose petals are subtle and fresh on the nose of this bottling, which is a single-vineyard rosé. The palate is tense and crisp, offering flavors of pluot and nectarine.

title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Carneros)
description: With a nose of stone fruit and follow-through flavors of nectarine, peach, pear and apple, this wine is richly constructed with ample body and creamy mousse on the palate, enjoyable in its hint of brioche. The finish brightens in tangerine.

title: Matthew Gibson 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: Heavy oak character, a distinctive tobacco and olive flavor and plenty of tannin set this full-bodied, unapologetic wine apart from the crowd. It has a thick, almost stiff mouthfeel, bold herb and fruit flavors and a lingering, oak-spice finish.

title: Trombetta 2011 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a great older vintage to revisit which shows the benefits of maturity. Earthy strawberry and tea alight from an exotic core of woody forest and high-toned acidity, a worthwhile exploration of a cooler vintage that is aging well.

title: Chalone Vineyard 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Clean and crisp aromas of pomegranate and raspberry are brushed with a hint of cola spice on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh and tangy with red-plum and hibiscus flavors that are lifted with a pinch of white pepper.

title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Renegade Red (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: This blend of 32% Syrah, 25% Zinfandel, 20% Malbec, 19% Petit Verdot and 4% Petite Sirah offers aromas of iodine, tar, black pepper and cassis. There is a tarry texture to the palate, where a ripe black-currant backdrop is spiced by savory sea salt and pepper dust.

title: Boatique 2016 Malbec (Red Hills)
description: This concentrated and exuberant wine has a reduced aroma on first whiff, but quickly turns rich and generous, showing black-fig, blackberry and turned earth aromas followed by ripe black fruits, plenty of spicy complexity, full body and firm tannins.

title: Dunstan 2016 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy, floral and steely in style, this offers plenty of lithe, buoyant acidity and citrus-driven fruit to keep it fresh and nervy in the glass. Smoothly textured and high toned in nature, it shows the diversity of the great vineyard site.

title: Écluse 2016 Rendition Red (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of roasted berries, crushed slate, chocolate and black currant syrup arise from this blend of 27% Grenache, 20% Syrah, 20% Counoise, 20% Petite Sirah, 7% Tannat and 6% Mourvèdre. There is a strong tension to the sip, where flavors of raisin and prune are backed up by fresh acidity and spices such as clove and star anise.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Parker West Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dried lemon peels, white peach and crushed hazelnuts make for a pretty ripe nose on this bottling. There is a compelling grip to the sip, which clings to the palate with flavors of ripe lemon, tart apple and a light marzipan touch on the finish.

title: Foxen 2017 Ernesto Wickenden Vineyard Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Always one of the more distinctive white wines from the region, this vintage starts with aromas of lemon skin, forest herbs and chive. The palate is redolent of yellow grapefruit and rides a tense, tangy structure into the long finish.

title: Les Belles Collines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Woody pencil shavings and dried herb combine on the nose and palate in this Cabernet that's blended with 8% Merlot, 6% Cabernet Franc and 2% Malbec. Succulent red currant and cassis come to life on the midpalate, with a tannic backbone that emphasizes final touches of black pepper and clove.

title: McNab Ridge 2016 Family Reserve Open Hand Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)
description: This full-bodied wine has a dark brooding color and a profusion of plump, dense blueberry and blackberry aromas that complement cocoa and boysenberry on the palate. Encased in thick, luxurious tannins, the flavors persist nicely on the finish. Best after 2024.

title: Michael David 2015 Inkblot Petit Verdot (Lodi)
description: Intense and lavishly fruity, this wine is ripe and concentrated in flavor, with a rich—almost thick—feel. Tons of blackberry, black cherry and dark chocolate flavors are layered between soft tannins for a luxurious texture and lingering finish.

title: Nelle 2016 Maniacal Red (Paso Robles)
description: Thick aromas of black-plum jelly and black currant meet with clove and gingerbread on the nose of this blend of 50% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre. The palate is very rich with flavors of cooked plum yet leveled by chalky tannins and strong baking spice.

title: Peloton 2017 Squire Canyon Vineyard Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
description: There's a great interplay between tangy lime-laced chopped chive flavors and riper hints of red apple on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate starts with mellow flavors, crisp acidity and textural depth before riper apple and fresh pineapple flavors arise.

title: Seghesio 2016 Bevill/Wolcott Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the producer's Heritage Grower Series, this highlights the site's perfumed leather and brambly blackberry. Intense on the midpalate, it features highlights of earth and black licorice, with a robust ripeness at its core.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 Aveta Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This has 10% Sauvignon Musqué, 3% Sémillon and 1% Muscat Canelli. Together, the grapes provide an experience of floral melon, stone fruit and white flower, a pungent nuttiness contributing additional complexity. The midpalate is steely and high toned in citrus.

title: Trinchero 2016 Mario's Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Notes of violet and lavender mark the nose of this 100% varietal wine. Blueberry, blackberry and dark chocolate swirl around weighty tannins and oak, striking a balance on the long finish of black pepper and tobacco. Still youthful, this will do well in the cellar. Enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2014 Cassie Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)
description: Deep in color and potent in aromas, this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine shows complex cedar, tobacco and violet aromas, has a good core of blackberries and black plums and a mouthcoating texture. With more complexity and layering than most, it's a good candidate for the cellar. Enjoy best after 2024.

title: Whitcraft 2017 My Friend Matts Vineyard Syrah (Los Olivos District)
description: This is another zippy, fun and refreshing wine by Drake Whitcraft, although his low-ripeness style may be outstripping the grape's varietal character in this particular bottling. Aromas of fresh red currant, lavender and thyme lead into a Pinot Noir-like expression of smashed red fruit and rosebuds on the palate.

title: Chalone Vineyard 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Wines from this rugged appellation east of the Salinas Valley always need extra time to evolve, and that's the case with this bottling, which begins with aromas of wet clay, red currant and strong soil scents. The palate is dense with earthy tones, yet bright red-currant flavors pop through clay-like flavors and will integrate more fully with time. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Anaba 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a fine example of how well this variety does when made into a lighthearted light-bodied quaff of a wine, with an inviting a bouquet of peach and strawberry. Dry, tangy and refreshing in acidity, it sizzles on the palate with verve and energy.

title: Monticello Vineyards 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
description: Blended with 12% Cabernet Franc, this is a nicely made wine, soft and silky with a lasting thread of spicy clove and cinnamon. Forest-floor earthiness complements dark fruit and supple tannins, with a supportive embrace of moderate oak.

title: Orsi Family 2014 Montepulciano (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Rich, juicy and rustic in style, this wine delights with good acidity and structure, showing flavors of current, dried cherry and leather. The finish is a burst of Italian herb and deli meat.

title: Orsi Family 2015 Nebbiolo (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made in a light, quaffable style, this small-production estate wine is dusty in tannin and rustic in grilled meat and black pepper, its palate old school in integrated oak and high-tones of red fruit.

title: Pezzi King 2015 Midnight Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Plum cake and spice ride a thickly concentrated middle of red fruit and tension, making for a complex experience in the glass. Robust and ripe, it's soft and layered, too, with a pleasant complexity of integrated oak and tannin.

title: Saintsbury 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Tropical, nutty and robust in initial oak, this wine settles into a nice balanced place, slightly reductive and youthful. Apple and pear compote give it a fruity flavor nuanced in lushness.

title: Sbragia 2014 Godspeed Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This substantial wine of considerable weight and tension has a thick entry from a grippy savory personality. Earthy dried herb, sage and currant define it, a nod to its mountain provenance. There is 4% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot in the wine.

title: Sosie 2016 Vivio Vineyard Roussanne (Bennett Valley)
description: This wine is from a single site, planted in volcanic soils at 750-feet in elevation. Aged in neutral oak, it is floral and earthy, with a rocky mineral edge joined by apricot and ginger flavors within the silky texture.

title: Stephen Ross 2017 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Intriguing aromas of dried lemon peels, wet wool, crushed rocks and lime pith show on the dynamic nose of this bottling from a very coastal vineyard behind Pismo Beach. There is compelling grip to the sip with flavors of citrus, apple blossom and a pinch of salt.

title: V. Sattui 2016 Gilsson Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy in blackberry and plum, this generously ripe rich wine is soft and well-integrated and has aromas of rose and cinnamon. Teases of dried herb give it additional complexity and unexpected nuance.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo)
description: Very stony aromas of wet gravel meet with rose buds, dried berries and a hint of leather on the nose of this restrained Zinfandel. The palate is also more about minerality than fruit, with flavors of river stone blending into cassis and purple flowers.

title: Andis 2016 Painted Fields Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: A deft touch of oak gives a baking-spice vibe to this concentrated, black-fruit focused and medium-bodied wine. It feels well rounded and mouthfilling, has light tannins and good balance. It is a blend of 54% Barbera, 25% Primitivo, 10% Malbec, 6% Petite Sirah and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Briceland 2015 Ishi Pishi Ranch Syrah (Humboldt County)
description: This exciting medium-bodied wine takes the path less traveled in California, showing the nervy peppery herbaceous side of Syrah. Smoke and black-pepper scents give way to blackberry, fresh sage and grilled rosemary flavors, while light tannins and good acidity give it an appetizing balance.

title: Brick & Mortar 2018 Vin Clair Pinot-Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A light refreshing white wine, this is made by picking 52% Pinot Noir and 48% Chardonnay on the same day and then pressing and cofermenting them together. Structured and lightweight, it dazzles in tart high-toned acidity, adorned in flavors of fresh lemon, apple and melon with a flinty stony finish.

title: Carson Ridge 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: There's an impressive complexity to this affordably priced bottling, starting with aromas of light lemon glaze, nectarine, Asian pear and wet stone on the nose. The palate is taut, bright and fresh with honeysuckle, Meyer lemon pith and wet chalk flavors.

title: Clos du Val 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is blended with 14% Cabernet Franc, 7% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot, the whole given 20 months in a combination of French and Hungarian oak. It shows bright floral aromatics and bold flavors of blueberry, cinnamon and clove. The texture is soft and well integrated, with a light finish.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2016 Firepit Red (San Francisco Bay)
description: Medium bodied and nicely aromatic, this wine is scented with cedar and cinnamon over a black cherry flavor. It's well balanced, not heavy, and has an appealing complexity.

title: Delta 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine offers major bang for the buck, a soft nuanced layering of smooth juicy cassis and plum wrapped in leather and oak. Expansive and structured, it has freshness without fuss.

title: Domaine Della 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy in black cherry and strawberry, this is an exuberant full-bodied red, with layers of refreshing acidity that complement its velvety midpalate well. Soft and textured, the tannins and oak are well integrated and add to the overall power.

title: Flanagan 2014 Serenity Way Red (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Merlot that has power and structure in spades. A layering of mocha and coffee bean rides along a leathery earth center that's creamy and lush on the palate. The tannins are firm and chalky, leading to a peppery finish.

title: Ghost Block 2016 Ghost Block Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: Soft, plush tannins surround a creamy texture of baked plum, cinnamon and cedar, the wine Old World in dried herb and sage components. Full bodied, it showcases the variety from the producer's long-owned estate.

title: Allan Hancock 2016 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Allan Hancock College's vineyard is in the city of Santa Maria, and much closer to the coast than most of the Santa Maria Valley appellation. That gives this Syrah extreme cool-climate character, from tar, peppercorn, roasted lamb and black-currant paste on the nose to a tense palate loaded with cracked pepper, rosemary and game. Fresh acidity provides a juicy quality too.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Estate Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: This dark and brooding wine has everything in spades. The color is reddish-black, the aromas are full of new leather, oak dust and black cherry, while the flavors are ripe, generous black cherry, blueberry and dark chocolate. The 40% new American barrels adds spicinesss. There is no lack of the grape variety's famous tannins, but they are fine grained and contribute to a velvety saturated mouthfeel.

title: Au Bon Climat 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of Meyer lemon cream and crushed hazelnuts are deliciously inviting on the nose of this bottling from the winery's historic vineyard series. White peach, walnut, smoke and tangy grapefruit converge on the dynamic palate.

title: Bella 2016 Lily Hill Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Fascinating briary, peppery aromas and flavors give this full-bodied wine extra personality, while a core of superconcentrated black fruits is wrapped in firm tannins. It's very tasty now and has the structure to age and improve. Best through 2027.

title: Big Basin 2015 Gabilan Mountains G-S-M (Monterey County)
description: From the Antle and Brosseau vineyards in the Chalone AVA, this 53% Mourvèdre, 30% Grenache and 17% Syrah blend offers rich caramel, chocolate, black-cherry and bay leaf aromas on the nose. There's a great display of herbs across the palate, giving depth to the rich black-plum backdrop, framed by rounded acidity and tannic tension.

title: Binz 2015 Oleta Vineyard Petite Sirah (Fiddletown)
description: This immensely concentrated and densely layered wine is impressive for its deep dark color, intense blackberry and dark-chocolate aromas, saturated blueberry flavors and a thick wrapping of fine-grained tannins. Fans of big rich wines will love it now, with a roasted or grilled chunk of meat, and it will age well. Best after 2023.

title: Chimney Rock 2015 Clone 4 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This wine is made from some of the smallest, densest berries on the property's northern end, a warm, intense place for grapes. Floral on the nose, it presents chalky tannin, ash and crushed rock-like minerality around a core of red and black cherry as well as plum. It offers substantial concentration and robust richness.

title: Faust 2015 The Pact Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From the exciting appellation that is Coombsville, this wine starts with beautiful aromas of violet and clove before opening up on the palate to a generous array of blackberry, plum and black pepper. Full bodied, it shows elegance and a sense of balance that holds up through a lengthy finish.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Rochioli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: The historic vineyard shows well in this impressive wine, which opens in an earthy mix of black peppercorn and black tea. Soft and seductive on the palate, it lingers in citrus-laden acidity that lifts up flavors of cranberry, strawberry and nutmeg.

title: Jaffurs 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black-raspberry, forest floor, wet tobacco and peppercorn aromas show on the layered and minty nose of this bottling. The fresh palate is taut and tart with bright red fruits that benefit from complex touches of thyme, bay leaf and green peppercorn.

title: Sanford 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of dried cranberry, hibiscus, rooibos tea, mace and grated ginger combine on the nose of this appellation blend. Intense flavors of elderflower and violet make for an elegantly vibrant palate, which is framed by intense black-raspberry fruit.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this impresses mightily in its offering of blueberry-cobbler flavor and graham cracker. Dark chocolate and white pepper contrast easily within bright polished tannins and a lingering finish of leather and graphite.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Karmere Vineyards Petite Sirah (Amador County)
description: Lavish oak spices soften and complement the concentrated fruit flavors of this full-bodied, thickly textured wine. It shows hints of wood smoke and baking spices in the aroma and cinnamon and cardamom notes on the palate as a rich layer of fine-grained tannins coats the tongue. It's delicious and stylish.

title: Barden 2017 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This wine is still quite young, which makes it very energetic if not yet fully evolved. Aromas of crushed hibiscus, elderberry and smoked meat lead into a palate of plum, berry, game and dried sage. It's both rich and zesty at once.

title: Bee Hunter 2015 Semillon (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Too bad California doesn't make more Semillons like this. While technically light-bodied, this wine tastes nutty and feels smooth, bringing a lot of richness to the palate along with buttery earthy almond-like flavors. It has a touch of astringency and acidity to counterpoint its weight and support the complex and evolved character of the flavors.

title: Big Basin 2015 Altitude 2292 Red (Monterey County)
description: Coming from a mountain vineyard nearly 2,300 feet above the eastern Salinas Valley, this blend of 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, 38% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc, 6% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot offers a taste of a unique terroir. Aromas of red cherry, oregano and cigar box lead into a complex palate of tangy black-plum skin and dried herbs, all framed by strong acid and a light but taut structure.

title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an exceptionally well-made wine at the price point: floral and appealing in quiet waves of citrus, baked pear and nutmeg. Integrated oak gives it power and strength within an edge of mineral-laden acidity.

title: Left Bend 2015 Gali Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz County)
description: This bottling, which originates from the Corralitos area, is quite showy on the nose, with black-cherry, raspberry sorbet, vanilla and caramel aromas all prominent. It dries up a bit on the sip, where a chalky texture is wrapped around blackberry, star anise and nutmeg flavors.

title: Pennyroyal Farm 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A-pure black-cherry character practically leaps out of the glass as this medium-bodied wine offers enticing aromas, satisfying fruit flavors and a firm lip-smacking texture. Nuances of forest floor and black tea join with abundant cherries to give complexity and interest.

title: Westerly 2013 Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Five years in, and this wine is still very much alive. Concentrated red-currant and black-cherry aromas meet with vanilla, gingerbread and crushed violet on the lavish nose. The palate is also lush, proving soft in structure with full-bodied flavors of black cherry, milk chocolate, red flowers and baking spice.

title: Keller Estate 2017 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)
description: With a steely nose of crisp acidity and floral honeysuckle, this wine is earthy and robust in caramel apple and pear. Rich and robust, it offers moderate structure and texture from 100% estate-grown fruit.

title: Navarro 2018 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Ripe and lively apple and pear flavors seem to light up this medium-bodied, fresh and well-balanced wine. It has a citrus tang supporting peach and crisp apple notes, and will be a perfect aperitif or pairing with seafood.

title: Alara 2018 Grenache Blanc (San Benito County)
description: Aromas of struck stone and lime pith show on the reserved nose of this bottling, which starts a tad reductive but quickly opens up. Nectarine and lemon flavors play on the subtle palate, finishing on hints of butter and toast.

title: Friedeman 2017 El Diablo Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Inviting aromas of lemon custard, vanilla bean and pear meet a robustly lithe concentration on the palate, the power fleshy and richly round. Toasted oak and a tropical bounty of fruit await as the wine builds concentration and flavor seasoned in baking spice.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2018 Cunat Family Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: Grassy in gooseberry, lychee and fig, this is an appealingly herbal wine that shows great structure and complexity. The fruit is abundant in peach fuzz, melon and apricot laced in buzzy acidity.

title: Terra Valentine 2018 Kick Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Fountaingrove District)
description: Floral, flinty and well balanced, with nice structure, this is a well-made white brimming in apricot and lime whose label states stainless-steel fermentation was used. It shows classic flavor and fleshy texture with length and decent depth.

title: Bridlewood 2016 Zinfandel (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a hedonistic, drink-now bottling loaded with unctuous aromas of black currant, vanilla and cocoa on the rich nose. The mouthfeel is thick and framed by soft tannins, with strawberry sorbet, licorice and milk chocolate flavors.

title: David Clinton 2016 Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Sanguine in currant and cranberry, this is a grippy, robust wine that's leathery in texture and shows good integration and structure. Savory tones of black pepper, cinnamon and dried herb help temper the underlying vanilla oak.

title: Albatross Ridge 2017 First Flight Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Meyer lemon skins, oak and toast aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high atop the Carmel Valley. Tangy yellow-apple-skin flavors meet with preserved lemon on the palate.

title: Hungry Hawk 2018 Estate Viognier (San Diego County)
description: The grape does very well in the warmer environs near Escondido, starting with austere aromas of lime pith, wet stone and the lightest hint of pear flesh. It's restrained on the palate, touching on tropical fruit cocktail, poached pear and citrus spray, proving crisp and refreshing throughout.

title: Leoness 2016 Alessandro Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Roasted meat, charred plums and a hint of violet show on the nose of this bottling, which is a little lighter in color than most Syrahs. The palate offers more meaty and grilled fruit flavors, with hints of thyme and rose petal.

title: Tantara 2017 Dierberg Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of white peach and oak are cut by Meyer lemon pastry on the nose of this bottling from vines planted in 1997. Strong oak and buttercream flavors play on the rich palate, with lemon zest touches providing acidic relief.

title: Brecon Estate 2016 Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)
description: Strong aromas of red fruits and hibiscus concentrate mix with milk chocolate on the nose of this bottling. Tart red fruits, black plum and cracked pepper spice come through on the palate, which combines riper flavors with a fairly firm structure.

title: Miner 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This has a sizable addition of 13% Cabernet Franc, which works nicely to provide an herbal earthiness that appeals. Juicy and broad on the palate in generous black fruit that doesn't hold back in ripeness of density, it shows complexity and structure, with chalky tannin and oak.

title: Hungry Hawk 2018 Estate Albariño (San Diego County)
description: This is one of the most compelling wines out of San Diego County, starting with aromas of clean pear, Tuscan lemon and bright citrus. The delicate palate offers fresh and tightly wound flavors of lemon blossom and nectarine.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2018 Hoot Owl Creek Viognier (Alexander Valley)
description: Floral honeysuckle and gardenia dominate on the nose of this lovely white, briny in wet stone and a persistence of lemon zest. Crisp acidity provides a lightness of body around burly ripeness and weighty viscosity.

title: Anglim 2015 Grenache (Adelaida District)
description: Roasted red plum, rose petals, hibiscus and a hint of cocoa show on the nose of this bottling. It's dry and grippy on the palate, where raspberry and pomegranate flavors meet with rose water.

title: Trentadue La Storia 2017 Block 303 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: Sinewy in leather, black currant and black tea, this wine is structured in tannin and oak, complex and appealing in moderate richness and ripeness. The finish is soft and lingering in baking spice.

title: Gondak Cellars 2018 Campbell McKinney Vineyard Grenache (Russian River Valley)
description: This tiny production offers translucently light color and nicely structured flavors of strawberry and raspberry within a light-bodied ripeness. Peppery and herbal, it comes from the northern reaches of the appellation and displays the cool climate well.

title: Sanguis 2017 Superleggera No. 7 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Part of an increasingly diverse rosé category, this darker, slightly aged version shows more robust and complex flavors than most pink wines. Orange-pink in the glass, it shows aromas of rust, plums, tangerine and light smoke. The palate is tense yet rich, with strawberry, orange-juice, chalk and baking-spice flavors.

title: Cline 2018 Cashmere Rosé (California)
description: What tastes like oak spice puts a pretty heavy lid on this medium-bodied wine, tamping down the crisp refreshment that many drinkers look for.

title: Spann Vineyards 2015 Primitivo (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with 20% Syrah, this wine has muted flavors of chocolate and a lightness of red fruit within herbal, sizable tannins.

title: Pinstack 2018 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Bread aromas are followed by browned apple flavors and medium body. The wine is sparse on fruit and falls a bit flat.

title: Stephen Vincent 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows an off-beat blend of savory, buttery aromas and buttery but also herbal flavors.

title: Wilson Creek 2018 Variant Series Red (California)
description: Very jammy fruits of strawberry and dark berry meet with a sour meat aromas on the nose of this wine. There is a soft sweetness to the sip at first and then come waves of black-plum skin, tobacco leaf and oddly strong acidity.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Extremely extracted blackberry and black-plum-sauce flavors meet with caramelized notes on the nose. The palate is very sweet and Port-like with prune flavors.

title: Josh Cellars 2018 Rosé (California)
description: While the brand has become very popular, this wine is pale in color and almost heavy in texture, and also lean and simple in flavor.

title: Big Churn 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This full-bodied and thick-textured wine comes off as cloying. It has an unusually deep, brassy color. A flood of caramel, vanilla and toast clog the aromas and practically smother the slim fruit flavors underneath.

title: Pedroncelli 2016 Courage Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the Faloni Vineyard, and aged 16 months in American Oak, this wine imparts a charred quality on the nose as overt ripeness hits the palate in a simple, viscous display of berry jam and brown sugar.

title: Ramey 2016 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: The second vintage of this vineyard-designate is a standout: beautifully crafted to reflect its meticulously farmed fruit and master winemaking. Brioche, honeyed apple, anise and pear wrap around crisp acidity and integrated oak, the wine's innate power balanced within an elegant framework of structure and graceful texture.

title: Ramey 2016 Woolsey Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site in the heart of the appellation farmed by the Martinelli family, this wine is sparkling in acidity and crisp well-defined flavors of lemon rind and green apple. It explodes in apple blossom and jasmine aromas, with lovely balanced richness and body weight, the oak lending a layering of baking spice.

title: Lester 2016 Mercurio Lester Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Aromas of game, crushed slate, pomegranate, raspberry and pine kick off the nose. The palate is loaded with flavors of forest floor, eucalyptus and tarragon, framed by touches of plum and lavender and finishing on nutmeg.

title: Ramey 2016 Westside Farms Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From the producer's estate property for the third vintage release, this wine possesses a beautiful layering of minerality and expressive fruit characteristics of lemon verbena and pear. Complex and elegant, it is powerfully built and silky smooth, with quietly integrated oak and a ginger-like spiciness to the finish.

title: Storm 2016 Donnachadh Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's an extreme purity of black-raspberry fruit on the nose of this bottling by South African Ernst Storm, yet also earthy mineral-laden layers of slate and soil. The sip is taut, elegant and acid-driven, offering just enough raspberry fruit to balance the bay leaf, thyme and earthy soil flavors. It's refreshing and goes down all too easily.

title: Wayfarer 2017 Wayfarer Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This stunning wine impresses vintage to vintage and 2017 is no exception. Golden apple, pear and honey fig highlight a fleshy, sumptuous and lush texture of nuanced acidity and oak, the fruit estate grown above ocean fog. Spicy nutmeg, cardamon and a hint of ginger round out the complex fruit and structure.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2017 3D Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The brand's telltale aromas of pure red fruit and earth recall a wild strawberry plucked from a field of minty sagebrush. Rounded red-currant, pine-needle and redwood-frond flavors power the fresh palate, which is delightful and delicious.

title: Law 2016 Sagacious Red (Adelaida District)
description: Smooth and lavish aromas of cassis and lilac are rich and beautiful on the nose of this blend of 36% Grenache, 34% Syrah and 30% Mourvèdre. Polished but long-lingering tannins present luxuriously soft flavors of violet and dark-purple fruits, extending into a finish that doesn't quit.

title: Samsara 2015 Turner Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The nose on this single-vineyard expression of cool-climate Syrah is extremely pungent and savory, offering bay leaf, thyme, charred beef, lavender and nose-tickling cracked pepper aromas. The palate is peppery as can be, lifting the dark boysenberry-jam flavors that slide toward eucalyptus and a touch of caramel on the finish: a journey of a wine.

title: Storm Wines 2016 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Raspberry-compote, bay leaf, juniper and blood-orange-rind aromas make for a richly layered yet light and bright expression from this vineyard on the western edge of the appellation. The palate is loaded with sagebrush and crisp raspberry, riding a gravelly texture into a rocky-flavored finish.

title: Spottswoode 2016 Lyndenhurst Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine continues to overdeliver on its price point, offering elegant yet powerful aromas of fig, forest floor and earth. Firm tannins offer grip around flavors of black currant, sage, cedar and flint, with spicy clove lingering on the finish.

title: Kings Carey 2018 Sémillon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A rare single-varietal display of Sémillon, this bottling from the Vogelzang Vineyard offers aromas of pear rinds, lime peels, roasted apples and a hint of funky yeast. The yellow-apple flavors extend to the palate, where there is also a hint of petrol and a cider-like acidity.

title: Oak Mountain 2016 Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: Light and fresh aromas of strawberry, cracked pepper, seared chiles and crushed slate make for a classic nose on this bottling. The palate snaps with freshness, delivering full flavors of pencil shavings, seared red pepper and smoky red fruits.

title: Buena Vista 2016 Bela's Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy and fruit-forward in jammy plum and cherry flavors, this is a rounded and supple wine with length and a persistence of earthiness. Black tea and cola play around the bold full-bodied edges.

title: Deovlet 2016 Zotovich Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Riper aromas of cooked cherries and stewed berries meet with cola on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There's a snap of acid to the sip and then the darker, extracted berry flavors return, with a spicy kick of root beer and fennel toward the finish.

title: Frey 2017 Biodynamic Field Blend Red (Mendocino)
description: A touch of wood smoke and a hint of barbecue spices add interest to this ripe, fruity and smooth wine. It is medium bodied, scented with blackberries and laced with dark-chocolate and blueberry flavors.

title: Gnarly Head 2017 1924 Double Black Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Ripe in flavor and big but soothing in mouthfeel, this full-bodied wine coats the palate with jammy blackberry, wood smoke and cocoa flavors. A rich texture, mild tannins and concentrated fruit components come together nicely.

title: Marimar 2017 Acero Unoaked Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Given no time in oak, this is a surprisingly creamy and lush wine, generous in body weight and lush tropical fruit. Rich and spicy, it finishes in peach and Meyer lemon.

title: Martin Ray 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Thick, textured and richly dense, this well-priced red is broad in its appeal, with a length of cassis, red currant and toasted oak. The approach is moderate and in balance, with light teases of baking spice.

title: Morgan 2018 Albariño (Monterey)
description: Broad pear-flesh aromas are cut by lime pith and a muddy clay minerality on the nose of this fresh bottling. The sip hits with a strong citrus tang that blossoms into Pink Lady apple flesh and cherimoya flavors.

title: Oak Farm 2018 Albariño (Lodi)
description: Apple skin and apricot flavors light up this nicely crisp and medium-bodied unoaked wine that was matured in stainless-steel tanks. It's ripe enough to be easily appealing and it's well-balanced by fresh-tasting acidity.

title: Orsi Family 2015 Schioppettino (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an unusual Italian variety to find in California and yet here it succeeds in its fresh bright nose of cherry, rose petal and earth, grown on the producer's home ranch. Tight tannins support a lively palate of pomegranate and white pepper.

title: Sofia 2018 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Monterey County)
description: A pale shade of pink, this sparkling rosé is vivacious on the nose with aromas of strawberry, watermelon, bubblegum and Ruby Red grapefruit. The palate is also very accessible, with grapefruit rind flavors riding the soft mousse.

title: Bridlewood 2015 Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Boysenberry, dried violets, light caramel and a hint of tar show on the mellow nose of this bottling. The palate is quite tense with stiff thick tannins that carry flavors of bright blackberry fruit.

title: Chalk Hill 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy blue and red fruit highlight a thick tannin structure of powerful intensity and hearty oak in this ripe ribald wine from the producer's Trenton Road vineyard, situated in cooler climes.

title: Chloe 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Lucas)
description: Fresh aromas of blackberry meet with toasty oak, peppercorn and a hint of green herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate's core of black currant and black-plum fruit are lifted by woody spice and framed by medium acidity and tannins.

title: Daou 2017 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Very golden in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of ripe apple, white peach and sea salt on the nose. The palate is fat, with apples, pears, buttercream and toasted nuts, plus just enough acid to keep it afloat.

title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Signature Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Bright fruit flavors of cassis and cherry dominate in this full-bodied wine. Its tannins are on the silky, velvety end of the spectrum, with underlying grip and structure for balance.

title: Mesa Del Sol 2013 Prima Rossa Red (Arroyo Seco)
description: This blend of Zinfandel, Syrah, Sangiovese and Grenache shows baked cherry, hibiscus, purple flowers, tarragon and root beer aromas on the nose. The palate is pleasant if simple and light, with flavors of pomegranate, wild strawberry, plum and dried ginger.

title: Parvaneh 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Dried blackberry, roasted beef, smoke and a whiff of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows slightly sour tones of black currant and blueberry with hints of baking spice that cut through the dense texture.

title: Porch Pounder 2018 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: This is a very reliable and appropriately named canned wine. It's very pretty in pink color, and shows aromas of strawberry and tart berries. It sizzles across the palate with simple but pleasing flavors of cherry, red plum and chalk.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Winemaker's Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Stewed red cherries, dried cranberries and a hint of cola show on the nose of this bottling. Sour cherry, star anise and vanilla flavors appear on the rounded palate, which is framed by just enough tannin.

title: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a medium-bodied wine from the Mondavi family of Charles Krug Winery. It balances red and black fruit flavors with supportive acidity and solid tannins. A bit of oak rises up but doesn't detract from the fruity core.

title: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This full-bodied wine has everything in good proportions, from ripe fruit aromas to equally bold, ripe and almost-sweet flavors that are judiciously spiced with oak and braced by moderate tannins.

title: Anaya 2016 Nebbiolo (Clements Hills)
description: Unusually ripe and fruity for a Nebbiolo, this full-bodied oak-aged wine shows generous black plum and black cherry and a fairly soft texture.

title: Bee Hunter 2014 Eagle Point Ranch Grenache (Mendocino)
description: This full-bodied wine is showy and oaky. An aroma of cedar shavings and roses leads to rich strawberry and ripe plum notes that are coated in spicy oak nuances like cinnamon and cedar.

title: Bridlewood 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of potpourri, dried pomegranate and a bit of forest dust show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with clean and crisp pomegranate flavors before showing a sweeter cherry streak, with herbal spices to round it out.

title: Chateau St. Jean NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: This luxurious and smooth sparkler spreads an inviting buttery layer over apple cider and raspberry flavors for an almost sweet impression.

title: Denier-Handal 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a tangy, soft and approachable red wine, earthy in baking spice and rich rounded flavors of blackberry, dark chocolate and oak.

title: Granite Lion 2017 Estate Reserve Zinfandel (South Coast)
description: Very strong aromas of potpourri and crumbled violets kick off the nose on this bottling. Those floral tones carry to the palate, which also shows dark tobacco and kirsch flavors.

title: Head High 2018 Pinot Noir (California)
description: An attractive single-serving can lushly crafted to go down easy, this is rich and varietal in cherry cola and a lasting hit of vanilla. A touch of smoky oak completes the experience.

title: Husch 2018 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)
description: Medium bodied and just a touch sweet, this wine overflows with ripe apple and melon aromas, and broad rich appley and floral flavors.

title: New Clairvaux 2018 St James Block Moschofilero (Tehama County)
description: Light to medium bodied, this wine is made on a Cistercian monastery property from a Greek grape variety that's extremely rare in California. It tastes dry and refreshing, and has mild melon and green-apple flavors.

title: Pali 2017 Charm Acres Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Aromatically floral and inviting, this is a thick, fleshy and rounded white with minimal oak influence that offers balanced tropical flavor and baking spice.

title: McManis 2018 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Viognier (River Junction)
description: This light-bodied wine offers soft, pleasant tones of flowers and honeydew. It is straightforward yet well balanced.

title: Farmhouse 2018 White (California)
description: Serious, dry and full bodied, this wine is more about subtle earthy and savory nuances than overt fruitiness.

title: Cline 2018 Cashmere White (California)
