description: This medium-bodied wine is attractive in a savory, spicy way as it offers white-pepper and fennel-bulb flavors, a crisp texture and very good balance.

title: Director's 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Combining 84% Cab with Malbec, Merlot and Syrah, this is a savory, thick and robust wine, ripe in black cherry and plum. Generous oak and tannin add weight and length, with a lurking hint of dried herb and cedar on the finish.

title: Francis Coppola 2017 Black Label Claret Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Fresh, fruity but full bodied, this easy-drinking wine offers focused cherry and strawberry flavors, light tannins and a fruity, almost-sweet finish.

title: Frey 2015 Biodynamic Syrah (Mendocino)
description: This wild and earthy wine is big on savory elements rather than simply fruity ones. It pours out gamy tarry peppery aromas, follows with earthy stony sagey flavors and a good underpinning of roasted plum. It has no added sulfites.

title: Frey 2018 Organic Malbec (Mendocino)
description: This full-bodied deep-colored wine offers earth and dried herb aromas, good blackberry and wood-smoke flavors and a touch of tannin to build the texture. No sulfites added.

title: The Atom 2017 Half-Life Chardonnay (California)
description: A rich texture carries buttery, spicy oak flavors almost to the extreme in this full-bodied, soft and pillowy wine.

title: Bend 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Strong oaky aromas meet spicy ginger, vanilla and pineapple flavors in this full-bodied wine. The oak really dominates and the acidity is soft.

title: Suvali 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has tons of heavy spicy cedar and oak aromas that continue on the palate, coating over the mild apple flavors underneath. It's one for oak lovers only.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Broadly fruity, earthy aromas and reasonably ripe fruit flavors make this medium-bodied wine a respectable choice.

title: Joel Gott 2016 815 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An obvious and dramatic oak aroma and flavor make this full-bodied wine a kind of one-note song. It is moderately tannic and has some ripe black cherry under the char, cedar and menthol notes.

title: One Hope NV Vintner Collection Sparkling Rosé (California)
description: This semisweet wine shows pleasant plum and vanilla flavors on a soft, soothing texture. A light body and a sugary finish give it a cotton-candy appeal.

title: Stephen Vincent 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Unusually spicy, this medium-bodied wine offers clove, cedar and black-pepper aromas, heavily spiced fruit flavors and a smooth oaky finish.

title: Voss 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Grassy and flinty in stone and gunpowder, this is a bright, lemony and very light white wine made from organically farmed grapes.

title: Iter 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This extremely oaky, heavily spiced wine is full-bodied and laced with fine-grained tannin. It layers cedar, clove, and toasted wood over vague berry flavors.

title: Testarossa 2016 Cuvée Los Gatos Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Dried pineapple and pear aromas meet with apple juice on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit flat with dried mango and more apple-juice flavors.

title: Scotto Family Cellars NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: Bubblegum aromas and watermelon flavors give this light-bodied wine a popular profile. It is soft in texture and finishes with a touch of sweetness.

title: The Audition 2015 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This burly, ripe wine tastes of chocolate-covered raisin, baked plum, cinnamon and a tease of prune, its body weight substantial and soft. Dusty, earthy elements and toasted oak round out the picture.

title: Sevtap 2016 Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Fruity aromas of red currant meet with tangy blackberry balsamic and cracked pepper aromas on the nose of this bottling. It's a bit sour and tangy on the palate, where black-plum and balsamic flavors linger into the finish.

title: Summers 2016 Two-Acre Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: This wine is richly flavored like marshmallow cream, with secondary notions of vanilla and dark cherry. Elements of smoked meat tease the palate surrounded by robust tannin and oak.

title: Kuleto Estate 2015 Frog Prince Red (Napa County)
description: This has hearty tannins and oak, making for a substantial expression of dark fruit, tar and leather on the palate. The blend is driven by 56% Merlot and includes 18% Malbec, 14% Petit Verdot and 12% Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Scotto Family Cellars NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: This light bodied wine smells appley, tastes like pineapple and apple cider, and has a soft foamy texture.

title: Wine Guerrilla 2017 Hemar Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a ripe rich wine, brooding in raisin cake and brown sugar that threads a dose of high-toned acidity throughout.

title: Purple Dragon 2018 Jurassic Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This bottling is very reductive on the nose, with lemon rinds barely able to get past the closed-in nose. There is tension to the palate, but the flavors reflect the nose, offering just a bit of citrus.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 Marisa Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A strong smell of cedar, charred wood and asphalt dominates this very full-bodied wine. The palate shows lots of wood tannins, heavy spices and smoky flavors.

title: Apriori 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Reductive and earthy, this is a big wine brimming in tannin and red fruit that dulls on the finish.

title: Crū 2017 Clone 113 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Light in the glass, this clonal expression from a fantastic vineyard offers aromas of sour cherry and dried thyme on the nose. It's light and acid-driven on the palate, where mouthwatering flavors of sage and strawberry lead into a tense finish.

title: B Cellars 2016 Blend 25 Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Made from 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Syrah, the fruit grown predominantly in Napa County, this wine is burly in cedar, herb, black currant and cassis. The tannin structure impresses in its weight and breadth, able to support the full-bodied concentration and ripeness. It finishes with grace.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Rued Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is floral in jasmine and steely on the midpalate—a beautiful white wine that's balanced and elegant in approach. With a good grip of tannin and oak, it shines in sharp flavors of green apple, Meyer lemon and crème brûlée., while the richness is seasoned in nutmeg.

title: Friedeman 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This combines grapes from several single-vineyard sites, including Terra de Promissio and Campbell Ranch. It excels in its opening notes of rose petal and lavender, with an underbelly of turned earth. Bold black fruit presents as sizably rich on the palate, a richness that turns velvety smooth and indelible.

title: Leitmotif 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows pressed rose petals, dewy thyme, wet forest floor, wild tarragon and a touch of funk on the nose. The palate's light pomegranate flavors gain complexity from earthy elements of moss, damp mint and turned loam. It's an intriguing, refreshing sip.

title: Martellotto 2016 Il Capoccia Riserva Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Deep blackberry aromas meet with new leather and elegant rose-petal scents on the nose of this blend from one of the warmer regions in Santa Barbara. Rich and ripe flavors of candied cherries and berries are wrapped in a woody caramel-laced coating.

title: Lampyridae 2017 Grenache (Mount Veeder)
description: Tightly wound in its youth, this wine is rich and full bodied, with a baked quality to the wild strawberry and black cherry. Meaty and syrupy in thickness, it is layered and voluptuous, with finishing touches of meat and white pepper.

title: Aquinas 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: This wine is full of unmistakable varietal character, bursting with black-cherry and pine-forest aromas, filling the palate with a ripe-tart tension between black and red fruits, and staying nimble and balanced in terms of texture.

title: Bonterra 2016 The Roost Blue Heron Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Plump and buttery, this medium-bodied wine pours on the vanilla, butter and baking spice flavors, with a rich, layered texture that's soothing on the palate. Made from biodynamic grapes, it is well concentrated but not too heavy.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Falcon's Perch Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of baked red cherry, rose and fennel lead into a palate loaded with strawberry, sagebrush, thyme and loamy soil. The mouthfeel is full yet cut by strong acidity.

title: Paraduxx 2017 Proprietary White (Napa Valley)
description: This blends a majority of Viognier with 27% Chardonnay and 5% each of Roussanne and Marsanne. Inviting floral aromas of apple blossom are followed by textured tangy flavors of grapefruit, green apple and apricot in an integrated, complex package of vibrant elegance.

title: Pianetta 2016 Syrah (Monterey)
description: Blackberry paste, licorice, lavender dust and roasted meat aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the warm reaches of southern Monterey County. Stewed black-fruit flavors meet with hints of wild thyme and white pepper on the palate, which is framed by stiff tannins.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a throwback to a more savory style of Cabernet Sauvignon that was once the norm in California. Aromas of crushed oregano, peppercorn and pencil shavings lead into a palate that is full in rocky minerality and dried herbs, but there's also dark cranberry fruit to round it out.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Ripe blackberry and black-cherry aromas meet with tar on the rich nose of this bottling. The palate begins with a tangy grip that leads into elderflower and elderberry flavors, along with lavender on the finish.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Eastside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned and floral, this blend of several Eastside Road vineyards is soft and approachable. Moderately structured, it allows the delicate layers of dried herb, cola and dark cherry to shine, lifted by lemony acidity.

title: Zeka 2015 Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)
description: This wine has high-toned fruit and underlying brightness, melding the two complementary sides within a context of integrated oak and thick tannin. Citrus, rhubarb and pomegranate provide a tartness of lingering fruit dipped in light Asian spice. This is the producer's first vintage.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 Hirsch Estate Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This is an acid-driven, sharply focused white, tense and fresh with exotic waves of green apple and Meyer lemon. The oak is subdued and secondary to the briny, stony taste of the forest and sea.

title: Captûre 2017 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a complex, impressive white with a creamy, lush entry that evolves on the palate to offer crisp, fleshy elements of white peach and lime. The midpalate is balanced in richness, leading the way to a bold herbal and grassy finish.

title: Corley 2014 Yewell Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Cinnamon and clove season sanguine elements of smoked meat and blue fruit in this broadly structured, well-made wine. Big in flavor, it finishes in a length of toasty oak.

title: Crū 2017 French Camp Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Guava and bubblegum aromas are very clean and cut by a steely edge on the nose. The palate tightens up considerably, offering tense lemon skin and chalky tones against rounded white-peach and guava flavors.

title: Heron 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: A fruity, plummy aroma and fresh cherry flavors make this medium-bodied wine straightforward and easy to appreciate. It's rather light and lean but pleasant to sip.

title: Tamber Bey 2016 Deux Chevaux Vineyard Dijon Chardonnay (Yountville)
description: Big, soft and fruity with a touch of confectionery richness, this wine offers intense ripeness and moderate structure.

title: Days of Youth NV The Diver Brut Sparkling (California)
description: This plush and frothy wine offers attractive, low-key apple and butter aromas and flavors, and a smooth soft mouth-filling effervescence.

title: Lion Ranch NV VP Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)
description: An uncommon offering of sweet Viognier, this bottling shows honeydew, crushed stone and orange peel on the nose. It's a tad oily on the palate with petrol-laced flavors of sour lime peel.

title: Martellotto 2017 My Way Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Coffee grinds, wet soils and dark fruits show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is slightly sour with berry and forest-floor moss flavors.

title: Parker Station 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey-San Luis Obispo-Santa Barbara)
description: Smashed cranberry, dried herbs and meat, and a touch of rubbery funk show on the nose of this bottling, which combines fruit from Monterey, San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara counties. Cranberry, dried cherry and flower petals decorate the palate.

title: Byington 2014 Euphoria Late Harvest Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Light in the glass for a dessert wine, this unique bottling of late harvest Pinot Noir offers raisin, sandalwood and cedar on the nose. The palate is ripe and pruney with flavors of sour raisin and smoked cedar.

title: Precision Wine 2015 Spotlight Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed oak is smoky and a tad rough around the edges, the wine offering a fruity and lush midpalate that takes on a harsh green component as it finishes soft and simple.

title: Josh Cellars 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a decent commercial wine that's medium bodied, lightly tart at first and plenty fruity. It turns richer, almost sweet, on the palate as vanilla and butter notes come forward.

title: Olelo 2017 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Underripe berries, red-plum skins and wood spice show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tart and framed by squeaky tannins.

title: Samuel Charles 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This medium-bodied wine is very fruity in flavor and soft and easy in texture. It has low acidity, very little noticeable tannin and a rather thick, syrupy mouthfeel.

title: The Seeker 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This soft-textured wine combines light citrus aromas and heavier poached pear and vanilla flavors. It tastes fat and full, low in acidity and a touch sweet.

title: Houdini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Sharp acidity girds a steely, austere expression of the variety, stony in lemon peel, grapefruit and jasmine.

title: Kalaris 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This has a dull nose and disjointed acidity, offering leathery brawn and a strong waft of lavender without complexity.

title: Grayson 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: A smoky, earthy character dominates this medium-bodied wine, while low-intensity blackberry flavors and a tangy texture provide a foundation.

title: Kenwood 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is a funky, earthy wine that's sizable in tannin weight and robust oak. The fruit struggles to exist within this context, offering a mix of baked strawberry and cherry.

title: Longwood 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and grassy, this offers aromas of pea shoots and lemon rind, with a thickness on the palate that persists in a mix of stone fruit and lemongrass.

title: Educated Guess 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Soft and oaky, this wine has a fruit-forward tropical edge that finds companionship in sweet notions of vanilla and nougat.

title: Leaping Horse 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This lightly sweet and syrupy wine smells like waffles and tastes like blueberries. It is medium bodied, soft in texture and very low in tannin.

title: Lucky Rock Wine Co. 2017 County Cuvée Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a utilitarian, light-bodied wine. It has earthy, lightly spicy aromas followed by flavors like red cherry with a touch of raspberry vinegar.

title: Fesstivity 2016 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sour orange aromas team up with warm and yeasty scents of egg bread on the nose of this delightful sparkler. The mousse on the palate is quite lush in texture, and carries flavors of tart green apple and the slightest show of toasty oak.

title: Folktale 2018 Le Mistral Rosé of Grenache Blanc (Monterey County)
description: David Baird crafts one of the more interesting rosés on the market by letting Grenache Blanc sit with Grenache Noir skins for 16 hours to pick up color and flavor. That results in aromas of light lemon skin, pluot and chilled river water and flavors of nectarine, red plum and raspberry, with unique hints of white pepper and herbs.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2016 Late Disgorged Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Lasting and expansive in rich, high-toned waves of strawberry and cherry, this is a delightful sparkling wine, structured and offering plenty of mineral-tinged acidity. A note of cranberry piques on the finish.

title: Kokomo 2015 Peters Vineyard Méthode Champenoise Blanc de Blanc Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)
description: Well crafted in a classic sparkling style, this wine offers tight, focused acidity and sublime texture, a deft commingling of peach and apple flavor. The mineral aspect takes form in a bite of wet stone and sea spray.
designation: Peters Vineyard Méthode Champenoise Blanc de Blanc

title: Le Vigne 2015 Riservato Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Cohesive aromas of blackberry and black currant are jammy but well restrained on the nose of this reserve wine. The wine is well balanced on the palate with firm chalky tannins and refreshing acidity, allowing the black-fruit flavors to ride deep into the finish.

title: Pech Merle 2015 Cuccio Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Berry, cherry and black pepper delight around a substantial body of lengthy weighty ripeness and complexity in this well-made wine. It has an intriguing backbone of smoked meat that meets its match in black licorice and a finishing touch of vanilla oak.

title: Rock Wall 2017 Red (High Valley)
description: Big and bold but also polished around the edges, this wine is an unusual 50-50 blend of Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. It's full bodied and offers delicious, grapey, jammy and handsomely oaky aromas, saturated black-fruit flavors that verge on sweet, and gobs of soft tannins that add heft without harshness.

title: Rotta 2016 Time Capsule Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep, dark and brooding in the glass, this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Petit Verdot and 25% Malbec is loaded with aromas of red cherry compote, cedar, licorice and mint. The palate's tannins are thick, with acidity that pokes out toward the finish, bookending flavors of blackberry paste, anise and dried mint.

title: Tamber Bey 2018 Lizzy's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Oakville)
description: Fresh and clear in focused acidity, this vineyard-designated white is a bouquet of lovely fruit and flowers, from peach and squeezed Meyer lemon to jasmine. Stony texture adds a mineral component that's irresistible in appeal.

title: Yao Family Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Softly layered and richly round, this is an appealing wine blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Concentrated and complex, it winds together the sweetness of vanilla and cherry with spicy elements of clove, tobacco and sage.

title: OneHope 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: This charitable project is funding the search for an Alzheimer's cure, and this tasty bottling will help with the cause. Aromas of oak, caramel, baked cherry and crushed slate lead into a lush palate of ripe red cherry, wet stone, French toast and oaky vanilla flavors.

title: AJA Vineyards 2012 Pamela's Selection Syrah (California)
description: This heavier style of Syrah comes from the Malibu area, showing aromas of cassis, roasted meat, coffee and liquefied violets on the thick nose. Roasted berries and caramel show on the palate, which should be enjoyed soon.

title: Baily 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: There's a unique fennel-like spice that pervades many Temecula Valley wines, and veteran Phil Baily uses it to his advantage in this bottling. Aromas of roasted strawberry, anise, bay leaf, roasted plum and soy lead into a palate full of blackberry paste, marjoram and peppercorns. There are hints of the Indian spice ajwain as well.

title: Blair 2016 Pinot Gris (Arroyo Seco)
description: The nose on this white wine is quite complex, showing lime peel, peach flesh, nectarine jam on toast, gardenia and even chalky minerality. The palate provides toasty flavors against tangy citrus peels, with hints of hazelnut and preserved lemon.

title: Deovlet 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of baked black cherry, cola, charred oak and savory smoke make for a very approachable nose on this appellation blend. The palate is full of prominent black cherry, loamy earth and dried sagebrush flavors.

title: Diatom 2018 Katherine's Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Extremely jubilant aromas of Fruit Stripe gum, guava, pineapple and mango make for a fresh and lively nose on this bottling. The palate zips with acidity that cuts through the ripe peach, pear and pineapple-guava flavors, which are powerful yet framed in a tense texture.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This opens in heady, inviting aromas of rose and dried herb, the fruit sourced from Green Valley sites the producer likes for their high acidity. Candied apple, peach and strawberry flavors are high-toned and wrapped in silky texture, with good lasting grip.

title: Gainey 2017 Limited Selection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Roasted apple, butterscotch and strong oak aromas show on the nose of this rich bottling, which offers a balanced style of classic California Chardonnay. The palate is creamy in texture with flavors of white peach, grilled lemons and more toasty oak.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2018 Piocho Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Crisp aromas of lime skin and chilled green-apple flesh are quite sharp on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Sémillon. There is great snap to the sip, where fresh acidity and a compelling texture deliver flavors of apple peel, lime juice and white pepper.

title: Kaena 2016 Clone 513 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Black cherry, baked licorice and a pinch of peppercorns show on the nose of this clonal study of Grenache. The palate offers warm flavors of cherry compote with star anise and caramel, framed by compelling texture and fresh acidity.

title: The Larsen Projekt 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Lovely in lemon peel, red apple and grapefruit, this delightfully drinkable is immensely appealing, with high-toned acidity and complex structure. It's built to love.

title: Bushong 2018 Cold Roses White (Central Coast)
description: Floral aromas of tuberose and plumeria are crisp and not overbearing on the nose of this white blend, with additional hints of orange cream and lemongrass. The palate shows a prominent candied-honeydew flavor as well as lime peel and guava, all leveled by lively acid.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2016 Demayo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Very buttery in aroma and flavor, this full-bodied wine lavishes almond, cream and vanilla nuances on the palate, supported by a silky and smooth texture leading to a lingering finish.

title: Deovlet 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated black cherry and dark berries meet with a floral lift, earthy soil and charred wood aromas on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is taut with grippy red-cherry and sagebrush flavors, washed in grippy texture and fresh acidity.

title: Edge 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is blended with 10% Cabernet Franc and 3% Malbec. Spicy leather and sweet tobacco combine around bright red fruit and supple tannin. It offers a balanced approach to richness and concentration.

title: Flanagan 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This appellation wine does justice to the area and vintage, showing a wealth of medium-bodied flavors defined in citrus, cherry and strawberry. Soft and supple in texture, it should appeal widely and over time, finishing in a savory edge of black tea.

title: Fossil Point 2017 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Aromas of boysenberry, dried mint and lavender show on the nose of this bottling, which is crafted by the Center of Effort team. The palate is fresh in floral and dark fruit flavors that ride the steadily rising acidity into the finish.

title: Le Casque 2016 Calotte G-S-M (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is full bodied, has great balance and pleasing, subtle spice and fruit flavors that are nicely interwoven on the palate and finish. Appetizing grippy elements of mild tannins and good acidity give it a lively texture that rewards continued sipping. It's a GSM blend with emphasis on the Grenache.

title: Martin Ray 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Grippy and earthy in savory black fruit, this appellation wine is strong and powerful in tannin and structure, with a smooth, underlying velvety texture that rounds out its full-bodied edges.

title: Muscardini 2014 Unti Vineyards Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an expressive, meaty red wine, richly layered in dense flavors of baked plum, nougat and marzipan. With a lasting thread of spice throughout, from cinnamon to white pepper, it finds its balance between a savory and sweet character that works and tastes great.

title: Prima Materia 2017 Tocai Friulano (Potter Valley)
description: Hints of rosemary and thyme meet tempting, ripe melon and pear flavors in this aromatic, full-bodied and richly textured wine from winemaker and former chef Pietro Buttita. It's an unusual—but at the same time very appealing—flavor profile.

title: Sandoval Mergenov 2018 Serenity Farm & Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Rich aromas of baked red cherry, hot pastry and a touch of cola show on the nose of this bottling by a military veteran-turned-winemaker. It tightens up dramatically on the sip, carrying those interesting riper flavors but in a more toned down style, with a pinch of herbs as well.

title: Sculpterra 2015 Bentley Ironworks Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This wine, which spent 16 months in 57% new oak, shows deep aromas of black plum, cassis and prominent oak seasoning. The mouthfeel is fairly thick and full of black cherry, black currant and coffee foam, with acid that washes through on the finish.

title: Stolo 2018 Gewürztraminer (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Very light in the glass, this is an extremely aromatic wine featuring apple blossoms, Asian pear, honeydew and ripe white fruits all strong on the nose. The palate zings with acidity, offering rounded flavors of ripe pear and freshly cut apple.

title: Vincent 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Aromas of smoked black plums, dried earth and purple flowers make for a roasted nose on this reserve bottling. There is a pleasing snap of blackberry fruit on the palate, where toasty oak and caramel tones drive through the delicately bodied wine.

title: Brick & Mortar 2018 Rosé (California)
description: This is a lovely drinking can of wine, made from whole cluster-pressed Syrah grown in Clarksburg and the Sonoma Coast. Dark red in color, it's meaty and flavorful in fruit leather and plum. Refreshing and light in style, it has enough body weight to take notice and leave a lasting impression.

title: Corley 2015 Tietjen Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This wine has an inviting floral nose that leads to an expressive generosity of blueberry and cinnamon spice. Lengthy and robustly built, it has mineral earthiness along the lines of the region's famous dust, a stony quality that remains memorable on the palate.

title: Crosby Roamann 2014 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
description: From the Jaeger Ranch in the heart of the appellation, this is a spicy, lengthy and complex red, entirely varietal and made in small amounts. Coconut, vanilla and clove accent soft plum and blackberry, with the tannins well integrated and the wine full of tension and structure.

title: Fallbrook 2016 Syrah (California)
description: Concentrated blackberry aromas meet with savory smoke, peppercorns and teriyaki roast beef on the nose of this bottling from Southern California. There is a compelling tannic tension to the sip, where rich blackberry flavors are layered across peppery spices, oak and a caramel-laced finish.

title: Fesstivity 2016 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sour orange aromas team up with warm and yeasty scents of egg bread on the nose of this delightful sparkler. The mousse on the palate is quite lush in texture, and carries flavors of tart green apple and the slightest show of toasty oak.

title: Côtière 2017 Murmur Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Tight aromas of lemon peel, lemon pith and a touch of seared almond show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard along Highway 101 just south of Santa Maria. A compelling texture that blends bright acid and grippy tannins present flavors of roasted lemon and hazelnut on the palate.

title: Bonterra 2016 The McNab Red (Mendocino County)
description: Drenched with blackberry and blueberry flavors, this full-bodied Bordeaux-style red blend adds baking spices and chocolate to the mix for an approach that's hard not to like. It's made from biodynamic grapes from a single vineyard.

title: Sculpterra 2017 Mega Focus Red (Central Coast)
description: Caramelized cherries and licorice converge for a generous and inviting nose on this gulpable blend of 60% Syrah, 20% Grenache and 20% Mourvèdre. The palate is flavorful and just complex enough, combining smoked cherry, cranberry and chaparral-like herbs that are reminiscent of sunbaked forests throughout the Central Coast.

title: Wrath 2017 Pommard 4/777 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Pleasantly rustic on the nose, this bottling by Sabrine Rodems begins with complex aromas of dried herbs, iron and red cherry. The palate is earthy in tones of tea leaves and cracked peppercorn, with accents of curry spice and cranberry adding to the elegant, complex mix.

title: DRNK 2018 Morning Sun Vineyard Pinot Gris (Bennett Valley)
description: Fermented in both amphora and neutral French oak, whole-cluster pressed, this is a light, balanced and floral white from the cool appellation, layered in medium-bodied flavors of green apple and apricot. It shines in lovely acidity and just enough weight.

title: Côtière 2017 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Boysenberry jam, crushed slate and candied violet aromas show on the nose of this bottling by Kevin Law. The palate is very floral in violet and lilac flavors, as well as spicy, thanks to cracked black pepper, which give depth to the underlying purple fruit.

title: Site 2017 Larner Vineyard Viognier (Ballard Canyon)
description: There are hints of peach custard and warm brioche on the nose of this bottling, yet it's wrapped in a steely, focused shell, with a hint of lime skin freshness. It's crisp and grippy on the palate, where Meyer lemon and pan-seared apple flavors are lifted by a pinch of sea salt.

title: Bee Hunter 2014 Greenwood Ridge Dry Riesling (Anderson Valley)
description: A vivid yellow color and heady aromas of diesel and peach warn that this full-bodied and mature wine is going to push the envelope. It's more fruity on the palate, as tangy apricot and peach-skin flavors compete with the classic smokiness of Riesling for a dramatic rendering of the grape variety.

title: Brecon Estate 2018 True Acacia Head Albariño (Central Coast)
description: Buoyant aromas of candied mango, lime blossom and chalk make for a slightly richer style of Albarino in this bottling, which amps up the acacia wood influence. It's ripe and expressive on the palate, with pear flesh and honeydew, but a zippy lemon acidity slices straight through the sip.

title: Keller Estate 2017 Precioso Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: A barrel selection from the producer's estate vineyards, this juicy red wine is soft and spicy, with nuanced oak and robust earthiness. Its bright tones of acidity evolve into supple dark cherry, dried herb and cedar, offering length and complexity.

title: Brecon Estate 2017 Reserve Petite Sirah (Monterey)
description: Opulent aromas of black currant, vanilla, gingerbread and violet show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is cohesive in flavors of cassis and violet that are integrated into the creamy, toasty tanninss and fine acidity.

title: Jalama 2016 La Presa Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crumpled violets, white pepper and cassis aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which offers a hint of the cool-climate elements that can enhance Petite Sirah. Lavender and violet meet with rich black currant on the palate.

title: Oceano 2017 Spanish Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Ripe pear and nectarine aromas meet with a touch of oak and hints of dairy on the nose of this bottling from an extremely coastal vineyard. There is compelling grip to the sip, where flashy flavors of Meyer lemon, baked apple and cinnamon ride a steely frame.

title: Patel 2015 Cabernet Franc (Coombsville)
description: Plummy flavor complements richer tones of dark chocolate in this thick, viscous and robustly structured wine. Firm tannins provide additional weight and breadth along a spectrum of toasted oak and softly spiced earthiness.

title: Paul Dolan 2017 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Rich and tempting aromas of vanilla, butter and baking spice lead to mouthcoating flavors of poached pear and butterscotch in this full-bodied wine. Made from organic grapes, it's indulgent, luxurious and concentrated enough to drink with steak.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2018 Lone Oak Vineyard Partners' Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Apple flesh, lime and toasty oak aromas introduce the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Clean flavors of citrus and pome fruit show on the sip, where acid zings and the structure retains a chalky feel.

title: Côtière 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Lemon brioche, butter cream, toast and a judicious amount of oak show on the nose of this county blend by Kevin Law. There is a toasty quality to the sip, where light oak, roasted nectarine and lime-peel flavors slide into a hazelnut finish.

title: Qupé 2016 Y Block Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: This wine is plush and rounded in creamy white peach, daffodil and chamomile on the nose. A seared-pear flavor evolves into a flinty, gravelly minerality on the palate, with plenty of sea salt and lemon-laced brightness that zip into the finish.

title: Ty Caton 2016 Upper Bench Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From the mountain appellation neighboring Mount Veeder, this is an impressive, hearty and earthy red wine. Sanguine with meaty elements of flavor accented by leather and black currant, it is soft, integrated and well structured, with length and grace.

title: Reata 2017 Pedregal Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Benito)
description: Rich and inviting on the hedonistic nose, this bottling combines black-cherry, caramel maple and smoky earth aromas. It is soft and somewhat fat on the palate, but its effect is easy to enjoy, with approachable flavors of Bing cherry, vanilla brioche, baking spice and oak.

title: Black Sheep Finds 2017 The Joy Fantastic Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From the winery's new estate vineyard named after the Prince album, this bottling shows plenty of green peppercorn, green olive and singed tobacco on the nose alongside cracked black pepper, lamb crust and muddy hole. The savory display on the palate is real, ranging from Kalamata olive to underripe blackberry. More vine age will boost texture.

title: Westwood 2016 Annadel Gap Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Valley)
description: This exuberant wine from the estate site offers rich tones of forest floor and black tea. The palate brings wild strawberry, boysenberry and dried herb tones that veer into an intriguing note of white pepper on the finish.

title: Caliza 2016 Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Inviting aromas of cassis, sharp purple flowers, espresso bean and charred wood float across the nose on this bottling. The palate is lively with mocha and cappuccino-foam flavors that are well integrated into the black-currant fruit, and the acid powers deeply into the finish. Drink now through 2031.

title: Land of Promise 2016 Deo Favente Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the producer's own Terra de Promissio vineyard, this is a light, elegant wine of refinement and subtlety, crisp in crunchy red fruit and a tenacious bite of acidity. Fresh and nuanced, it holds its tannins close to the chest, allowing plenty of room for earthy spice and forest to emerge.

title: Talley 2017 Stone Corral Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Pomegranate, exotic strawberries and wild spices, from cinnamon to clove to curry leaf, show on the nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is soft and comforting, delivering flavors of dried rose petal, wild cherry, mulberry and touches of vanilla and butterscotch toward the finish.

title: Bella Grace 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Very generous, juicy and complex fruit flavors drive this expansive, full-bodied and velvety textured wine. It is big on black plum and blackberry, accented with subtle oak spices and a touch of strawberry.

title: Brecon Estate 2017 Forty Two Red (Central Coast)
description: Aromas of plum pudding, caramel, strawberry and boysenberry are rich but fresh on the nose of this blend of 38% Syrah, 36% Mourvèdre, 24% Petite Sirah and 2% Grenache. The palate is loaded with black plum, mulberry, cocoa, peppercorn and fennel flavors, proving hearty and intriguing.

title: Chanin 2017 Los Alamos Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied cherry, mint leaves, thyme-flecked earth and a hint of toasted wood show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh and yet savory, showing roasted cranberry and raspberry alongside wild tarragon and sagebrush flavors.

title: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Adorned with an impressive metal label, this end-of-night, break-out-the-cigars dessert bottling is pungent on the nose, with rich black-currant and the slightest prune aroma. It lands on the palate with a waxy mouthfeel, combining weighty richness and power. Sweeter flavors of caramelized black cherry are cut by mouthcleansing acidity.

title: Sandhi 2017 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tightly wound on the nose, this appellation blend by Raj Parr and Sashi Moorman shows wet stone and lemon peel on the nose but also slightly fatter hints of seared apple, daffodil and light dairy. The sip is also tense and fresh, with lime-pith flavors and the slightest hint of nuts on the finish.

title: Talley 2017 Rincon Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Immediately appealing aromas of daffodil, honeysuckle, cherimoya and hazelnut paste show on the nose of this bottling. The wine lands smooth and creamy on the palate, mixing plumeria, almond and light caramel flavors.

title: Anaba 2018 Landa Vineyard Late Harvest Viognier (Sonoma Valley)
description: Golden honey in color, this is a thick, rich and balanced dessert wine made from 100% Viognier allowed to hang long into the season to develop botrytis. Textured, it tastes of apricot and brioche, with a complex structure.

title: Holly's Hill 2017 Classique Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: Wild, gamy, earthy aromas lead to complex and savory earth, beef, black-pepper and grilled sage flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine from one of the Sierra Foothills region's top performers with Rhône varietals. It's a great example of the untamed style that Mourvèdre can bring to the table.

title: Piedrasassi 2017 Rim Rock Vineyard Syrah (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Extremely floral aromas of lavender, lilac, potpourri and patchouli consume the nose of this fascinating bottling. The palate is more complex, with flavors of herb-crusted beef shank, rosemary pinches, cracked pepper and a touch of black-plum extract.

title: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: Dense aromas of black currant, crushed black rocks, scarlet rose and cappuccino show on the nose of this lavish blend of 53% Cabernet Sauvignon and 47% Syrah, which is aged in 85% new oak. Rich yet very dry on the palate, this wine offers flavors of rustic herb, lava rock, charred tobacco and Luxardo cherry.

title: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Fresh blackberry and black-currant aromas mix with toasted oak and sandalwood scents on the nose of this blend of 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Petit Verdot, 25% Cabernet Franc and 5% Merlot. It is medium bodied and lively on the palate, with red-fruit flavors and more wood spice.

title: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Concentrated crystallized blackberry aromas meet with charred wood and brighter red flowers on the nose of this blend of 54% Merlot, 32% Cabernet Franc and 14% Syrah. Grippy tannins frame the sip, where crisp and bright red fruits are kissed by oak and toast.

title: Black Sheep Finds 2017 The Joy Fantastic Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a vineyard planted in 2014, this bottling shows lively aromas of lemon balm, mint, earthy nuts and a hint of aged cheese on the nose. The palate is strong with flavors of sour lemon, tangerine peel and ash, riding a laser-edge of acidity while trending pleasantly funky.

title: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the producer's Hardie Ranch, this is a 100%-varietal white fermented and aged in both stainless steel and oak foudre. The creamy palate brings elements of peach, dried herb and freshly cut grass, with a lengthy finish of stone.

title: Barbieri 2015 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Inky purple in color, this wine begins with dense blackberry aromas alongside roasted game, singed tobacco and an umami-laced hint of tar. There's a strong sizzle of acidity on the tip of the sip, which descends into roasted black plum and black currant before the tannins take hold and deliver a roasted venison finish. It is a roller coaster of a wine.

title: Peachy Canyon 2017 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Winemaker Robert Henson is exploring the floral side of Zinfandel in his new bottlings. In this case, that means a load of potpourri on the nose alongside the singed tobacco, cigar-box and red-fruit aromas. Tart cranberry, fennel bulb and dried flowers show on the sip.

title: Lafond 2016 Martin Ray Clone Lafond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Though initially rich and concentrated on the nose, this bottling manages to offer plenty of lavender and lilac floral touches as well. The palate is cohesive with dark-berry flavors that meld into soil and are wrapped in a compellingly pure density.

title: Sanguis 2016 Since You Asked Kindly Red (Central Coast)
description: This proprietary blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Syrah is quite rich on the nose, with stewed plums and milk chocolate aromas. Roasted flavors of black cherry, strawberry and plum show on the sip, where sandy tannins uphold a dry sip.

title: Sosie 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Block K5 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine shines in dried herb, pencil shavings and sage, the earthiness undeniably present. Juicy and broadly expressive in thick, elongated tannins and prominent oak, the fruit is both dried and baked, a mix of black cherry and plum. This will do well with more time in bottle. Enjoy 2021–2025.

title: Mooney Family 2017 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Savory and sultry aromas of roasted red cherry, sandalwood and pecan wood show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is woody, with flavors of cedar and toasty oak, then revealing a core of cherry sauce with pinches of wild thyme and eucalyptus leaf.

title: Denner 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: A touch cloudy in the glass, this bottling is tightly wound on the nose, offering aromas of lemon peel, chalk, riverstone and peach blossom. There is great tension to the zippy palate, where vibrant acidity delivers both a citrus tang and more rounded flavors of lychee and apple cider.

title: Dunites 2017 Slo Coast Syrah-Grenache (San Luis Obispo County)
description: There's an extreme amount of cool-climate Syrah influence on this blend, which includes 21% Grenache. Aromas of tar, char, singed oil, cracked pepper and blackberry lead into a peppery palate, where nori wrap, ash and dark boysenberry thrive.

title: Foxen 2017 Block 43 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Sandalwood and caramel aromas meet with reduced cherry and gingerbread on the nose of this bottling. Dried cherry, dried strawberry and nutmeg show on the powerful, somewhat extracted palate.

title: Lumen 2016 Martian Ranch Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: A strawberry jam aroma meets with tangy herbs and green peppercorn on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tense and grippy with tannins, carrying a fresh raspberry-sorbet flavor and a unique touch of eucalyptus oil.

title: Anglim 2017 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)
description: Candied peach, honeydew, mint, brioche and a hint of steel show on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The palate offers a balanced weight and mouthfeel, carrying flavors of fresh lemon, yellow peach and a hint of mango.

title: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a bold, hearty Bordeaux blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 10% Malbec and 5% Cabernet Franc. Substantial in tannin and oak, it has softened edges of earthiness, forest and sage. Nuanced black fruit complements the graphite and savory spice.

title: Longoria 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The Labor Day 2017 heat spike likely played into this denser, higher alcohol bottling, which begins with dense aromas of boysenberry jam as well as lighter hints of forest floor. The palate is dense, with rich black-plum and elderberry flavors, lifted by hints of mint and flower petals. Best to drink this one now.

title: Brecon Estate 2017 Grenache (Adelaida District)
description: Crisp and ripe raspberry and strawberry aromas meet with a sprig of light mint on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very full of flavor, with strong cherry and strawberry as well as nutmeg. Loads of acid cut through the ripeness.

title: Fiftyrow 2016 Alice Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Spicy in blackberry and chocolate, this is a smooth, soft and moderately complex red, made in small quantities from the well-known appellation. A hint of expected dustiness wavers amidst the fruit and oak.

title: Kokomo 2017 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Rich and layered, this well-made wine is brimming in red and dark cherry and has bright and focused acidity that keeps it fresh amidst robust ripeness and weight. Fleshy texture gives it added appeal and complexity with impressive length.

title: William Hill Estate 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Freshly smashed Bing cherry aromas meet with sage on the fruity, immediately likable nose of this bottling. There is great snap to the sip, where richer strawberry and pomegranate flavors are cut by tangy red-plum skins.

title: Dunites 2018 Oliver's Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Shy on the nose at first, this bottling offers aromas of lemon preserves on toast, light wood and a touch of nuts against a steely backdrop. It's crisp, clean and easy on the palate, where a sizzle of lime juice cuts through the riper hints of nectarine, riding a taut acidity into the finish.

title: Paraduxx 2015 X2 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 92% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Zinfandel into a robustly built powerhouse of full flavor and smooth, rounded richness. Juicy black fruit, vanilla and toasted oak give it plenty of oomph and power.

title: Decoy 2017 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is soft, rounded and succulent in waves of plum and dark cherry. Moderate in weight and ripeness, it is solidly backed by integrated oak, baking spice and a lasting hint of dried herb.

title: MacLaren 2016 Atoosa's Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Black pepper, garrigue, tar and leather frame this old-school red, made in small amounts from a relatively cool-climate site. Bright threads of acidity give it lift and nervy freshness that appeals.

title: St. Anne's Crossing 2015 Ami Cheri Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, this big wine is jammy in red fruit with secondary aspects of dried herb and olive. Ultimately it leans concentrated and syrupy in sweet cherry and chocolate.

title: Wente 2018 Niki's Rosé of Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Bright strawberry aromas meet with lemon and tangerine peels on the nose of this bottling from Monterey County. The palate is easy to like if simple with hints of raspberry and lemon spray.

title: Cobble Creek 2017 Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of sandalwood, red cherry and light leather show on the nose of this bottling, which touts its organic, gluten-free, vegan-friendly ways. Red-currant flavors dominate the palate, which shows both a flash of acid and a thick texture.

title: Ballentine 2016 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick, concentrated and robustly tannic red wine, with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and Lagrein. It's juicy in black cherry and dark chocolate, with savory additions of cedar, pencil shavings and tobacco.

title: Carruth 2016 Manzoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Quite gamy on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of iodine, black cherry and tar. The palate offers tangy cranberry, dried mint and leathery Old World flavors.

title: Chloe 2017 No. 249 Red (North Coast)
description: Thick grapey aromas and rich jammy flavors give this medium-bodied wine an über-fruity character, while soft acidity and mild tannins keep it gentle on the palate.

title: Educated Guess 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Dark cranberry in color, this is an herbal, tart and fruity wine, with a juicy center of strawberry, grapefruit and lemon. The acidity is lifted and fresh.

title: Proulx 2016 Merveille Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Damp earth, new leather and red-plum aromas show on the nose of this blend of Grenache, Zinfandel, Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. There's a sour aspect to the palate, where gamy flavors overtake the red-plum fruit.

title: Rutherford Hill 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Substantial tannins and a powerful presence of toasted oak give this wine a heady full-bodied personality, complemented in red fruit, crayon and rich dark chocolate.

title: SIP 2017 Moscato (California)
description: Sweet in flavor and almost syrupy in texture, this wine offers attractive pistachio aromas followed by flavors of poached pears and lychee fruit. Medium body and a viscous texture leave a lingering floral finish.

title: Bridlewood 2016 G-S-M (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a strong gamy aroma on the nose of this bottling, along with dried plum skins, elderberry, tar and leather. The gamy aspect extends to the leathery sip, where dried meat flavors meet with tannic purple fruits.

title: Frey NV Organic Agriculturist Red (California)
description: Ripe bright fruits in the aroma and flavor make this wine very forward and a little tangy, showing red and black cherry along with raspberry accents. Made without added sulfites, it's full bodied and has moderate tannins and good acidity that add to the mouthfeel.

title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Meritage (Rutherford)
description: This blends 52% Merlot with 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% each of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc and 2% Malbec. Juicy strawberry-jam flavor dominates, wrapped in woody oak, dried herb and a touch of heat.

title: La Crema 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Strong aromas of vanilla and caramel meet with buttercream and lemon on the nose of this very classic style of California chardonnay. There is a lemony tension and freshness to the sip, where the oak flavors grow strong and nearly sweet in the finish.

title: McClain Cellars 2016 Rudderless Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Roasted red cherry, ripe berries and a hint of sweet cedar show on the nose of this red blend. Berry-juice and red-cherry-compote flavors meet with more cedar on the palate.

title: Murphy-Goode 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Perfumed and thick in structure, this is a widely appealing wine bursting in jammy blueberry and dark cherry that finishes robust in oak.

title: Rancho Victoria 2015 Horseplay Red (Amador County)
description: This is a firm tight wine, with evident tannins and acidity to balance its red-cherry and cranberry flavors. Attractive but subtle oak accents add to its appeal.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Simple but pleasant aromas of ripe berries, earthy mushrooms and plum skins show on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of ripe red fruit on the sip but then come more interesting waves of tea leaves, eucalyptus and a strong, slightly overbearing tobacco-leaf flavor.

title: Timark 2015 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Concentrated mulberry and dark-plum flavors are lifted by Christmas spices on the very rich and extracted nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is also very extracted with flavors of black-plum sauce, kirsch and dark clove.

title: V. Sattui 2016 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Part savory in soy, cedar and crayon wax and part robust in black plum and berry, this wine is substantial in tannins most of all, which taste burly and beyond generous in the glass.

title: Frei Brothers 2017 Sonoma Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Grassy, herbal and strongly full bodied, this white is textured and tannic, with an ongoing grittiness of wet stone. The fruit is a mix of peach and pineapple.

title: Kenwood 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tangy and high in acidity, this is a fresh and funky wine, earthy in dried herb, black tea and rhubarb. The style is light and bright.

title: Mer Soleil 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Cooked berry and cherry aromas meet with slate and turned loam on the nose of this bottling. Dark-berry flavors blend with campfire smoke and more rich earth on the palate.

title: Niner 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling, which also includes 9% Carmenère, 4% Petit Verdot and 3% Cabernet Franc, hews toward an older California style of Cab, with dried oregano and cedar overriding black-plum and blackberry aromas on the nose. The palate is also very herbal and rather light, with tight tannins framing flavors of oregano, peppercorn and blackberry.

title: Reata 2016 Pedregal Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Benito County)
description: Earthy aromas of red cherry and wild strawberry also show a gunmetal streak on the nose of this bottling. It's full and soft on the palate, with red-cherry and turned loam flavors that are quite extracted.

title: Villa San Juliette 2014 Alicante Bouschet (Paso Robles)
description: Cassis and caramelized strawberry aromas show on the fairly extracted nose of this bottling of a red-pulped grape that's rarely seen at all in California, much less all by itself. The palate is flush with soft red fruit and sprinkled with chai spice.

title: Ferguson Crest 2015 Private Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Quite tarry on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of sweet black cherry, charcoal and violets. There is a lot of crushed peppercorn and Indian spice on the palate, which gives depth to the very rich and extracted Concord grape flavors.

title: Ferguson Crest 2016 Fergalicious Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There is a strong herbal and peppercorn start to the nose of this wine, followed by leather and black fruit. The blend of 40% Syrah, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Petit Verdot and 20% Grenache shows gamy Old World flavors on the palate of dried leather, dried meat, black plum and graphite minerality.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Bow Tie Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a moderately structured, lushly layered and unabashedly ripe white wine, rich and full-bodied in every way. Tropical mango and pineapple veer into baked flavors of additional concentration and voluptuousness.

title: Martellotto 2017 Le Bon Temps Roule Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a lighter style of Pinot Noir, with earthy aromas of juniper, cola and pine needles on the nose. There are a lot of green aspects to the palate as well, such as menthol, which give nuance to the tart cranberry fruit.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: The nose of this estate bottling is quite showy, offering Bing cherry, pungent rose buds and a hint of vanilla. It's fairly light on the palate but with pleasing red-plum and cranberry flavors that are easy to quaff.

title: Sextant 2016 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Supple red fruit and candied berries meet with a touch of turned loam on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines cocoa, red cherry and a touch of earthy funk with a powerful acidity.

title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 Cryptology Red (Paso Robles)
description: Tart blackberry, cracked pepper, lilac and a touch of balsamic show on the nose of this blend. There are savory char and peppery notes to the palate, which surrounds dark-berry flavors.

title: Crū 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted wood, light red fruit and leather aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Leathery tannins frame the sip, where the dark red fruit meets with smoky flavors.

title: B Cellars 2016 Blend 27 Red (Napa Valley)
description: A full-bodied combination of 60% Merlot with 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Petit Verdot, this is a grippy plummy wine of serious earthiness. It offers turned earth, compost and forest elements that compel and combine well together.

title: Chuparosa 2016 Cabernet Franc (Ramona Valley)
description: Tart red fruits and tangy herbs make for a familiar and varietally correct lead into this bottling, which also shows a funky Old World touch as well. The red fruit and dried herbs also pop on the palate, yet so does that sour funk.

title: Crū 2015 Monarch Red (Paso Robles)
description: Smoked wood, light red currant and a stronger cassis element begins to emerge on the nose of this blend of 68% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Charbono and 6% Carignane. There is a clean line of elderberry fruit with hints of white pepper and cedar on the lighter-bodied palate.

title: J. Wilkes 2017 Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe apple, nectarine and lime-peel aromas make for a very accessible nose on this bottling. There is compelling tension to the palate, where bright citrusy and yellow-apple flavors get a white pepper lift and ride on fresh acidity. It's a great white wine for many occasions.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2017 Silver Spur Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Floral and herbal, this has high-toned acidity and a grassy element that's earthy and within the wine's style. Stony texture adds complexity to the stone fruit and lemon.

title: La Crema 2015 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Earthy with tart acidity, this wine is hearty and full bodied, with a depth of concentrated black cherry and pomegranate. It finishes in a dark swath of dark chocolate and coffee.

title: LangeTwins 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is an attractive, polished wine that matches bold fruit flavors with a generous dash of spice without the oak smothering the classic old-vine fruitiness. The full-bodied palate has a deft touch of tannins and a spicy finish.

title: LangeTwins 2018 Estate Grown Sangiovese Rosé (Lodi)
description: This bold and animated wine dazzles the eye with a hot-pink color, with a nose that's bright in citrus and raspberry aromas. It tastes lively, fresh and very fruity—exactly the things that are great about rosé.

title: Newton 2016 Unfiltered Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-made, well-priced wine, classic in elements of pencil shaving, dried herb, clove and cedar. Generous oak and tannin provide structure and weight within a balanced approach to ripeness, with lasting impressions of coffee and black currant on the finish.

title: Picayune 2018 Rusty Gate Farm Albariño (Russian River Valley)
description: Lemon, grapefruit and tangerine rule the day in this layered white wine that's refreshingly bright and light. Focused acidity gives it a sense of tension on the palate that resolves into a burst of beauty and elegance. The wine was aged in neutral oak.

title: Schug 2017 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Tangy citrus and pomegranate combine for a bright, fresh experience built around focused acidity in this appellation wine. Gravelly texture gives it a complexity that impresses and lengthens the finish.

title: Sosie 2016 Spring Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a small producer, this wine shows an undeniable earthiness, pronounced acidity and a plush texture. Notes of black cherry, strawberry and stemmy forest floor meld on the palate, which offers pronounced power and weight.

title: St. Francis 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Dense with a thread of underlying acidity, this reserve-tier wine offers bold flavors of blackberry, black cherry, dust and cocoa powder. Lush and concentrated in full-bodied intensity, it has aromatic complexity and a lasting hint of savory cedar and clove.

title: Stasis 2016 Murmur Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Soft and slightly sour lemon aromas meet with damp wood and forest floor on the nose of this bottling from the team behind Rabble wines in Paso Robles. The palate offers golden-pear, tart lemon and lemongrass flavors.

title: The Larsen Projekt 2017 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This tastes of strawberry patch and dried herb—basically a sunny summer day. With a light entry, it builds body and complexity on the midpalate, with a humble richness and earthy finish.

title: Villa San Juliette 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Appropriately herbaceous aromas meet with fresh red fruit on the nose of this bottling, which also shows rustic hints of tar. The palate offers black plum, peppercorns and more herbs, framed by sticky tannins.

title: Villa San Juliette 2018 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Smooth aromas of concentrated watermelon and soft Rainier cherry show on the nose of this bottling. The wine dried up on the sip, where a chalky tension carries more watermelon and strawberry flavors.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Promenance Vineyard Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)
description: Caramelized fruit, licorice and turned earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's dry on the palate, with black-plum jelly and savory pinches of thyme and peppercorn, proving to be a pleasant sip.

title: Amador Cellars 2016 Fields Family Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Bursting with strawberry, raspberry and red-cherry flavors, this aromatic and intensely fruity wine is a joy to taste. It feels bright and somewhat tart on the palate, tastes fresh, concentrated and well balanced.

title: Bolt To Wines 2016 Roussanne (Ballard Canyon)
description: Slightly cloudy in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of mango, crushed granite and apple cider, with a slightly metallic minerality. The palate takes the tropical mango, papaya and tuberose flavors to the next level, yet tucks them behind an intriguing veil of crushed river stone.

title: Chappellet 2017 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A steely floral nose contributes a vibrancy to this wine that persists on the palate, as richer notions of stone fruit, pineapple and vanilla weigh in. Creamy and integrated, the midpalate leads to a balanced finish of crisp acidity.

title: Clos du Val 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Reductive in tar, oak and thick concentrated flavor, this estate wine is spicy and darkly brooding in black cherry and plum. Sage and cedar nip around the edges of fruit and powerful ripeness.

title: Comartin 2018 Adelaide's Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Ripe aromas of baked red cherry and strawberry are cut by an edge of grapefruit pith on the nose of this Grenache-based rosé. The palate dries up considerably, delivering flavors of red plum and, toward the finish, a delicate pastry crust.

title: DRNK 2017 Mill Station Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: Dry, textured and full bodied, this white is weighty and structured. It offers rich tones of hazelnut, caramel apple and honey brightened by green apple and tangerine.

title: En Garde 2016 Starkey Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light color belies this wine's heartier nature, a velvety textured expression of bold, jammy cherry and strawberry. Good acidity lends freshness to the full-bodied weight and concentrated flavors rounded in toasted oak.

title: Gibbs 2018 Centa Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: High toned in grapefruit and lime, this 100% varietal white is textured on the midpalate and shows just a hint of oak. Persistent freshness keeps it lively and vibrant on the palate.

title: Kori 2018 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Dried hay, bags of lawn clippings, green mango, white pepper and green bell pepper show on the very complex nose of this bottling. The bell pepper flavors are prominent on the sip, where pasilla chile elements meet with warm peaches.

title: LangeTwins 2018 Estate Grown Musqué Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: A generous fruitiness is wound up tightly in this tangy, concentrated and well-balanced wine. It leads with vibrant citrus and gooseberry aromas, followed by tight fruit flavors that expand on the palate and linger nicely on the finish.

title: Luna 2016 Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is Old World in style, subdued and elegantly layered in dark cherry and plum. Structured and soft in its youth, it contains 5% Petit Verdot and finishes in a nuanced reminder of toasted oak and vanilla.

title: Orsi Family 2015 Barbera (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This tiny-production estate wine is bright and juicy, offering a soft rustic underpinning of layered tannin, rounded richness and high-toned acidity. It tastes of freshly picked strawberry and cherry, with a lasting tartness that appeals.

title: Prima Materia 2017 Estate Bottled Chardonnay
description: Winemaker Pietro Buttita has a sure hand with at least a dozen varietals, and this Chardonnay is no exception. Livened up by good, bracing acidity, this beautifully ripe and smooth wine has great balance and plenty of attractive pear, apple and peach flavors.

title: Rodney Strong 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Brimming in aromas of peach and vanilla, this wine is complex and layered. Bright acidity boosts the rich elements of fruit and oak on the palate.

title: Sandler 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A bit lighter in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of red cherry, sagebrush, wild mint and rusty earth on the nose. The light and bright candied raspberry and pomegranate flavors of the palate are lifted by star anise and dried sage qualities that emerge toward the finish.

title: Sandler 2017 Madzia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)
description: Subtle hints of smoke and oak play against a light red-cherry, pomegranate and cranberry backdrop in this bottling. The palate is cohesive, with flavors of red plum, dried herbs and bright acidity.

title: Silenus 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: This 100% varietal wine is made from grapes grown on two sites of the appellation, including the Silenus Estate. Opening in baked bread, brioche and cedar, it continues to develop expressions of dried herb, fig and cocoa powder in the glass between a good tension of acidity and integration.

title: Sojourn 2016 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Robust in dark cherry-cordial flavor and a taste of sage, this is a powerfully concentrated and boldly ripe wine, 100% varietal and from the famous site. Tannins are dusty and substantial, providing structure within the thick concentration.

title: Solminer 2018 Linus Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of red apple, light raspberry, rose petal and a hint of chalk make for an intriguing nose on this Grenache-based rosé. The palate is tense and acid driven, offering flavors of cherry and light cola spice.

title: Stringer 2018 Babbling Brook Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Clean aromas of watermelon and baseball card bubblegum show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh, lively and crisp, with more watermelon as well as lime-juice and rind flavors, giving a touch of complexity to the refreshing sip.

title: Sullivan 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This wine is tremendously structured and youthful in tannin and oak. The grapes come from the producer's 26-acre estate, which was first planted by Andre Tchelistcheff, a friend of the original founder. (Sullivan is currently owned by Juan Pablo Torres Padilla's private investment group VITE USA.) The wine is made by Jeff Cole and shows smoky black fruit and elements of crushed rock. Age and enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Roussanne (Adelaida District)
description: Light honey, Asian pear flesh and fresh citrus blossoms make for a very inviting nose on this bottling from the winery that introduced modern Roussanne to California. The palate balances subtle citrus and warm apple tones with the lightest brush of butterscotch toward the finish. Drink now through 2031.

title: The Grenachista 2016 Mounts Vineyard Grenache Noir (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine opens in an inviting contrast of white pepper and compost, the tannins meaty and quiet in their power. Supple texture forms a foundation beneath strawberry, currant and baked plum.

title: Trentadue 2016 La Storia Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is well made and satisfying, opening in a bright sanguine nose of iron and leather. The midpalate is lengthy and graceful, offering a succulence of cassis and black cherry.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2015 Alexander Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made from the oldest vines in the producer's vineyard estate, where concentrated berries result, this is an herbal, grippy and indeed intensely taut tension-filled wine. Chocolate, fig and cherry liqueur mingle on the complex palate of nuanced richness and lingering earthiness.

title: Ca' Momi 2016 Rosso Red (California)
description: Lush and plush, this spice box of a wine offers a velvety, mouthfilling texture and a nicely soft structure of melted tannins. It is scented with pencil shavings, cinnamon and tobacco and shows lingering flavors of cherry and crème de cassis.

title: Croma Vera 2017 Joven Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Rich aromas of black cherry, charcoal, olive and cola make for a compelling nose on this young Tempranillo. The palate combines deep and dark blackberry and black-plum flavors with charred beef, iodine and more black olive.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2017 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Quite yellow in the glass, this rare Pinot Gris from this historic vineyard offers mellow aromas of yellow pear, daffodil and honey on corn tortilla. There is a pear-rind grip to the tense palate, which leads into a waxy finish, with hints of roasted nuts. This is a very unique and interesting white wine.

title: Testarossa 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lightly seared citrus, lemon preserves, roasted peach slices and an ample amount of oak show on the nose of this bottling. The palate balances rich and ripe flavors with sea salty, lemony acidity and a sandstone-like minerality.

title: Oak Grove 2018 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Crisp and tangy, this light- to medium-bodied wine offers tones of citrus, green apple and a touch of tropical fruit. It is smooth and easy to enjoy.

title: Angeleno 2018 The Meadow Rosé (California)
description: Hints of tangerine rind meet with fresh berry and crushed stone on the nose of this bottling from a new winery in the heart of Los Angeles. The palate is grippy with chalky tension, showing flavors of lemon zest, tangerine and light nectarine, framed by solid acidity.

title: Bellante 2017 Jack McGinley Vineyard Syrah (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Rose petals and juicy red fruits meet with roasted plum on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is somewhat light in body, with touches of black plum, roasted game and a pinch of jasmine.

title: Bernardus 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)
description: There is a strong sense of earth to the nose of this twist-top bottling, with soil and rock aromas alongside black cherry and singed tobacco. The palate is lightly bodied yet stiff with tannins, offering flavors of blackberry juice along with peppery spices and pinches of oregano and marjoram.

title: Lumen 2018 Starry Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of bright raspberry, citrus peel and candied sour cherry emerge from this Grenache-based bottling, which is a beautiful shade of pink in the glass. The flavors are full on the palate, with Mandarin orange and raspberry elements most apparent.

title: Tooth and Nail 2016 The Possessor Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dense aromas of black cherry, black currant, roasted wood, dark mint and fennel show on the nose of this blend of 69% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Merlot, 10% Petite Sirah and 6% Syrah. The palate is thick in texture, with full and rounded flavors of black cherry, cassis and dried herbs.

title: Barefoot NV Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Fruit, spices, stone and vivid herbaceousness come together nicely in this well-balanced and satisfying wine. It shows wonderful varietal character in citrus and lemongrass notes.

title: Clos La Chance 2017 22 Pirates Red (Central Coast)
description: Concentrated aromas of lilac and black currant show on the nose of this buccaneer-themed red blend. The full-flavored palate packs a blackberry jam flavor alongside thyme, oregano and wild mint, with more purple flowers lingering on the finish.

title: Artevino 2017 Lost Creek Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Oak aromas and flavors take the lead in this light-bodied wine, but they're backed by good, tangy red-cherry and sour cherry flavors that complete the picture nicely. Moderate tannins add some bite to the texture.

title: Baca 2017 Marbles Pocai Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: This is muted, soft and powerful wine from the warm appellation, fully in grasp of its intensity and heat. Baking spice, mocha and blackberry jam complement up-front tannin and sturdy oak, finishing in lasting richness.

title: Opolo 2017 Montagna Mare Red (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh berries, vanilla and hickory aromas show on the nose of this blend of Barbera and Sangiovese. There is tannic tension to the palate, where roasted red-cherry, vanilla-dust and liquid-smoke flavors arise.

title: Dark Horse NV Rosé Bubbles Sparkling (California)
description: Ample flavors and a broad, rounded texture make this medium-bodied wine mouthfilling and attractive. Minty, cherry-like aromas and cream and raspberry flavors fill the palate.

title: Acacia 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Tropical in nature with up-front viscosity and richness, this white shows dense flavors of pineapple, mango and vanilla. The oak is integrated yet present, contributing a shock of honey as it finishes.

title: Blackbird Vineyards 2018 Arriviste Rosé (Napa County)
description: Blending 65% Cabernet Sauvignon with 25% Cabernet Franc and 10% Merlot, this meaty wine has a touch of garrigue, dried cherry and lavender, the core of the fruit rich in style and in full possession of tannin.

title: Broadside 2017 Margarita Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Easygoing and pleasant red-fruit aromas meet with a touch of damp herbs and bell pepper on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with ripe plums and strawberries yet it's the pyrazine-laden cherry-pepper notes that set it apart.

title: Chuparosa 2018 Albariño (Ramona Valley)
description: Freshly cut apples, a hint of honey and pineapple flesh aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The wine tightens up on the sip, where a line of acidity cuts through the dried apple flavors—a good show for an emergent region.

title: E18hteen 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Herbal and grassy, this is a nicely made wine that is tart in lemon, grapefruit and anise. It has a hearty mouthfeel of balanced body weight and finishes smoothly crisp.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2018 Rosé (California)
description: This light-copper colored wine brings red-wine character to rosé. It has plenty of raspberry and cherry aromas, a mouthfilling ripeness and medium to full body. It will pair well with light dishes and even beef or duck.

title: Niner 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)
