description: This is a fairly ripe style of Sauvignon Blanc coming from a coastal area, starting with big aromas of peach, nectarine, orange sorbet and lemon cream. The palate goes more sour with lime skins and bitter orange, and then come waves of dried mango.

title: Mountain Tides 2016 Petite Sirah (Clements Hills)
description: The natural chocolate and blueberry flavors of the grape variety come through beautifully in this full-bodied and unusually smooth-textured wine. Its color is very dark, the aromas are packed with ripe fruits and light spices, and the texture is nicely polished despite firm well-integrated tannins. Best through 2030. Only three barrels were produced.

title: Mountain Tides 2017 Petite Sirah (Clements Hills)
description: This full-bodied wine bursts with black fig, dried plum and wet earth aromas followed by ripe, juicy blackberry and black-pepper flavors that are well offset by good acidity and firm tannins. It is unusually concentrated and complex.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a tightly wound and intense wine that shows its youth, a study in concentrated Gravenstein apple, salt and stone. A floral underbelly of apple and orange blossom brightens the palate and grippy structure. Let this wine open slowly in the glass.

title: Guarachi Family 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This bold, flavorful wine has a baked quality to its rich notes of strawberry and cherry. Rich and smoky in oak, it showers the fruit in savory elements of clove and nutmeg, the whole layered and unabashedly full bodied.

title: Rusack 2017 Mt. Carmel Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean aromas of white peach, sea salt and judicious oak manage to be both bright and creamy on the nose of this bottling from an iconic vineyard in the center of the appellation. It's also clean and crisp on the palate, with flavors of pineapple, mango and lime zest running deep into the finish.

title: Sculpterra 2018 Winemaker Signature Red (Paso Robles)
description: Packaged in a custom-blown glass bottle signed by the winemaker, this luxury-level blend of 42% Cabernet Franc, 33% Syrah and 25% Petite Sirah does not disappoint. Aromas of vanilla, roasted red plums and baking spices lead into a palate of black cherry, turned earth and toasted oak and cedar. It's rich, layered and satisfying.

title: Testarossa 2016 La Rinconada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling is lightly styled, allowing the vineyard's strong herbal and game-like aromas to show through the redcherry fruit. The palate is similar, with red-cherry and hickory flavors giving way to dried thyme, sage and hints of roasted boar.

title: Villa Creek 2016 Luna Matta Vineyard Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: There's a powerful density of black currant on the nose as well as cracked peppercorns in this single-vineyard bottling, which is cohesive and elegant on the nose. There's a weighty presence on the palate, with lively black fruits and more pepper spice, yet it is still quite young in the life of this wine, which needs many hours or decanting to open up.

title: Anaba 2018 Snow Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: A rare variety, this 100% varietal wine has a steely frame of high-toned earthiness that appeals and impresses in unexpected complexity. Jasmine and honeysuckle aromas open the way to a bright palate of light citrus and peach that persists on the finish.

title: Cutruzzola 2016 Riven Rock Vineyard Riesling (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Zesty aromas of orange blossom and Key lime soda draw the nose into this coastally grown Riesling from the hills behind Cambria. The palate zips with acidic glee into flavors of lime balm and a touch of ripe white fruit, but it's the chalky structure and white-rock minerality that steal the show.

title: Joullian 2015 Hammler The Chief Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)
description: This luxury level bottling, which includes 14% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, begins with earthy aromas of loam and cigar wrapper as well as elegant touches of purple flowers, boysenberry fruit and beef. The palate combines dried berries with pine, wrapped in a polished tannic structure.

title: Opolo 2017 Summit Creek Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This affordably priced bottling delivers all that's desired in a Paso Robles red: rich aromas of black cherry foam, oak spice, vanilla cream and pie crust. That's followed by a lush and rounded palate of pillowy, chalky tannins that offer flavors of cherry, baking spice and dried herbs.

title: Chappellet 2017 Calesa Vineyard Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)
description: From the new appellation comes this well-made, impressive vineyard-designate, the entry crisp and focused in cool-climate acidity. Stone and white flower accents complement a midpalate of rounded lemon cookie, peach and pear, with just a touch of baking spice on the soft lengthy finish.

title: Keller Estate 2017 El Coro Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: Tones of ash, earth and rose adorn this medium-bodied wine, with an expansive, lively core of fleshy red fruit and bright acidity. It unfurls slowly in the glass, displaying crunchy cherry and currant flavors.

title: Bacio Divino 2016 Artful Red Wine Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This includes 5% Sangiovese, a worthy, more feral companion to the structured Cabernet. Toasted oak, tobacco and crayon wax play out along a brooding core of tart black fruit and serious tannin, finishing with a taste of graphite.

title: Peju 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: With 7% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a succulent, structured, reserve-worthy wine. Spicy clove and vanilla oak support a full-bodied core of layered cassis and blueberry, finishing with powerful concentration and richness on the palate.

title: Giornata 2017 French Camp Vineyard Aglianico (Paso Robles)
description: Strong aromas of dark plum, oregano and wild thyme show on the nose of this bottling of a warm-weather grape from one of the region's hotter vineyards. Grippy tannins and a bright acidity frame the palate, where flavors of plum, berry, pepper and savory meat elements arise.

title: Liquid Farm 2017 SBC Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of Spear, Peake, Sanford & Benedict and Radian vineyards is loaded with thyme, pine needle and green peppercorn on the nose, with pomegranate and light strawberry playing the fruit role. Underripe raspberries and more pine needle pop on the fresh palate.

title: Grey Stack 2018 Rosemary's Block Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)
description: A perennial, small-production wine to watch, this comes from cool-climate vines and offers a supple texture and mid-weight ripeness. Balanced in acidity, its flavors lean into delicious apricot and peach.

title: Thompson 31fifty Wine 2016 Cicero Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smoky cinnamon and baked cherry highlight a sumptuous, spicy and native-fermented wine that's earthy in intensity. Anise, clove, oak and tea season the dark, brooding fruit and fresh lively acidity.

title: Falkner 2015 Reserve Syrah (Temecula)
description: Strong blackberry and black-currant aromas are very extracted and ripe on the nose of this wine. The palate is more dynamic with mint-chocolate fudge, black-currant syrup, strong acid and a vanilla finish.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Vintner's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This is a juicy, simple red that overdelivers on its price point, offering expansive layers of soft rich red- and black-cherry fruit. Friendly and approachable, it's a fantastic value and balanced in style.

title: La Voix 2015 Rebel Rebel Quinta del Mar Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: The nose on this bottling is very pungent with cranberry, raspberry, sumac and a persistently tangy strawberry-balsamic aroma. The sip is tangy and vinegar-laced, lifted by earthy sage tones.

title: Mignanelli 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Light cranberry aromas meet with wet slate and turned soil on the nose of this bottling, which needs a little time to breathe. Tangy red-fruit flavors meet with gravelly tension on the taut and tart palate.

title: Murphy-Goode 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Dry and tangy in style, this light-bodied wine offers good refreshment qualities due to bright citrus and green-apple flavors. Good acidity keeps the texture lively so it will make a good lunch or apéritif wine.

title: Puma Road 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Cranberry, damp thyme and bay leaf show on the nose of this appellation blend, which is from a winery owned by longtime farmer Ray Franscioni. The palate shows extracted flavors of tart red cherry as well as sage, thyme and aromatic chaparral shrubs.

title: Brassfield 2017 High Serenity Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)
description: Generous fruity aromas and flavors give this medium-bodied wine a fresh straightforward appeal. It is packed with apple, banana, peach and melon notes carried on a relatively soft texture.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Fruity aromas of dark strawberry are enhanced by tobacco and crushed rocks on the nose of this bottling. It's easy on the palate with strawberry sorbet, marjoram, oregano and cracked pepper flavors.

title: Shooting Star 2017 Riesling (Lake County)
description: This is a generous and fruity, medium-bodied wine that's smooth in texture. Aromas of honeydew melon and honey smell almost sweet and the palate impression is soft and very fruity, too. It should be a crowd-pleaser.

title: Leaping Horse 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This light-bodied wine is restrained and subtle, starting with a virtually transparent color, then followed by tight apple and pine aromas and tangy, orange-peel and gooseberry flavors. Bolstered with 20% other varieties blended in, this is a refreshing, dry wine.

title: Meeker 2015 Pena Creek Vineyard The Paddle Syrah-Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A majority of 77% Petite Sirah is blended with 23% Syrah, both from a high-elevation site in the appellation. A tartness of cherry and cranberry dominate around an intensely dusty texture and leathery tar.

title: Jigar 2015 Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a thick, densely constructed red wine, syrupy and ripe in black cherry. A leathery texture emphasizes the concentration and firm tannin as hits of acidity weave through.

title: Sebastiani 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This lively, fresh, light-bodied wine offers citrus and mint aromas followed by richer apple and peach flavors on a smooth, rounded texture with just a hint of acidity underneath.

title: Bliss 2017 Estate Bottled Rosé (Mendocino)
description: This wine makes a big impression, from a bold and rather dark coral color to expansive fruity and spicy aromas to quite-ripe fruit flavors. Its texture is broad and a bit soft. It's a rare bird, being made of 59% Dolcetto grapes plus Merlot and Zinfandel.

title: Falkner 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Extracted aromas of red-cherry and blackberry syrups meet with toasted licorice on the nose of this bottling. It's very thick on the palate with roasted black currant, berry and more licorice spice.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Floral, earthy and intensely full bodied, this is a robust white brimming in apple, guava and fig flavors, in addition to oak.

title: Tussock Jumper 2016 Zinfandel (California)
description: This is a well-seasoned wine that peppers its raspberry flavors with meaty, salty accents. It is full bodied, lightly tannic and nicely mouthfilling, but does not feel heavy.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Winemaker's Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of cherry syrup and pomegranate soda pop make for a sweet smelling entry to this bottling. The palate is tangy with berry and lifted with hints of lavender, fennel and mint, but thin in body.

title: Beringer 2016 Beringer Bros. Bourbon Barrel Aged Red (California)
description: This full-bodied wine is drenched in late-harvest fruit flavors and dark chocolate. Black raisins, dried figs and prunes fill out the lush, non-tannic and sweet-seeming mouthfeel and then linger on the finish.

title: Decoy 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This is a widely appealing white with a crisp entry that veers into vibrant nervy energy and freshness. With a buoyant undercurrent to its defined flavors of golden apple and pear, it finishes with just a hint of lemony richness.

title: Fulcrum 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Mint, lavender and rose-petal aromas make for an exotic floral entry as substantial tannins and body weight build strength on the palate. Well made, the wine is robust in dark-cherry fruit and a lasting note of toasted oak.

title: J. Lohr 2016 Gesture Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Smoothed-out aromas of caramelized blackberry, vanilla and purple flowers make for a very full and inviting nose on this bottling. Black-cherry, baking-spice and mocha-cappuccino flavors show on the lush and hedonistic palate, which is hard not to like.

title: Jaffurs 2017 Thompson Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Crisp aromas of nectarine meet with riper melon and chalky tension on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very restrained at first but then allows smooth with flavors of melon, papaya and lime rind to take over.

title: Joseph Cellars 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tight in tannin structure and reductive qualities, this opens slowly to offer a robust ripeness and intensity of strawberry and cherry jam. Dark chocolate and black tea season the lengthy finish.

title: Klinker Brick 2015 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: A deep dark color leads to floral and cinnamon aromas, nicely concentrated blueberry and boysenberry flavors and a multi-layered texture due to fine-grained tannins. This wine has delicious richness and ripeness that outweigh the varietal's typical astringency.

title: Left Bend 2014 Fellom Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Smashed blackberry, roasted meats, asphalt and toasty oak aromas show strongly on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard off of Montebello Road. Very earthy flavors of tar and turned soil come through on the palate, framed by very dry tannins and a finishing with a hint of cocoa.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Catalyst Private Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Big fat berries meet with turned loam and crushed slate on the approachable nose of this blend of Zinfandel, Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Dried berry and potpourri flavors meet with popping acidity on the palate, which finishes on cocoa and mint spices.

title: MacRostie 2016 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky and reduced, this is a dense, tannic and boldly flavored wine, its flavors a mix of black tea, baked orange and red currant. Baking spice notes pierce the finish.

title: MacRostie 2016 Wildcat Mountain Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a soft, delicate and lightly styled red from the appellation, earthy and quietly rich in caramelized oak and baked cherry. It has a nice balance of nutmeg and cola on the finish.

title: Peter Paul Wines 2016 Live Free or Die Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a beautifully made wine, crispy in mineral elements and lovely layers of fig, Meyer lemon, tangerine and pear. Medium bodied, it holds its fruit and acidity well, with gritty layers of texture from start to finish.

title: Pianetta 2016 Bilancio Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)
description: Tar, forest floor and muddy earth aromas meet with wild berries on the nose of this blend of 52% Syrah and 48% Cabernet Sauvignon. Strong herb and mint flavors arise on the palate, giving complexity to the black-plum and cedar backdrop.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Apple Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smoky oak and caramel enriched the expansive palate of this intense, ripe and powerful red that's black in brooding fruit and root beer. Well made in a big style, it finishes in mocha chocolate.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2015 Cassie Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)
description: Rich boysenberry flavors and a hint of sweetness make this wine easy to sip in spite of its full body and rather thick tannins. It delivers blackberry-jam and mocha accents while the broad texture seems to coat the sides of the mouth.

title: William Hill Estate 2015 Bench Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend is rich in feel, with elongated tannins to support the full body. Elements of lavender and sage accent a core of black licorice and ripe plum on the palate.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2017 Para Mas Amigas Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: A hint of flowers in the aroma of this rich and full-bodied wine gives way to ripe fig, pear and honey flavors on the palate. It's so ripe that it verges on sweetness, and has an opulent, viscous texture that helps the honeyed character cling to the sides of the mouth for a lingering finish.

title: Wrath 2016 3 Clone Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Tightly wound on the nose, this clonal combo offers citrusy aromas of grapefruit rind and sharp apple flesh on the nose. The palate is wrapped in a chalky, tight texture, revealing flavors of Anjou pear and Pink Lady apple.

title: Duckhorn 2014 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: This hearty red wine is a blend of 57% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. The palate twists together flavors of cedar and sage with black cherry and blackberry, supported by a full-bodied, powerful structure.

title: Francis Coppola 2015 Reserve Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Quiet aromatically, this bold, reserve-tier wine includes 8% Petite Sirah. Thick and softly layered in blue fruit, it also offers meaty leather and black pepper amongst waves of rich concentration.

title: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced at first, this wine comes around to reveal soft layers of baked plum, graham cracker and coffee. Full bodied and ripe, it offers a balanced oak nuance and a soft texture that speaks to the varietal character.

title: La Follette 2016 Los Primeros Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County)
description: A blend of two worlds (62% of the fruit from Sonoma County and 38% from Monterey), this is an approachable red wine, with a juicy entry of savory forest floor, black tea and black cherry. It finishes in a tartness of acidity akin to rhubarb.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2015 Francville Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The mountainous terrain keeps this bottling on the lighter red-fruit side of the grape, offering aromas of tart cranberry, rose petals, wet gravel and a hint of oaky vanilla. The palate is fresh with pomegranate, raspberry jam and tart red plum, spiced by white pepper.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Morelli Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: With integrated acidity and a touch of white pepper, this is a well-made varietal wine that is elegant in style and approach. Plum and cherry flavors take on a rich dried component of concentration that works against the toasted oak and leather.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Sanford & Benedict Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light and bright aromas of lemon peel, Anjou pear and damp oak show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is a tangy grip to the sip, where soft wood flavors meet with citrus flavors and are framed by a taut structure.

title: Hanzell 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is the Pinot Noir and Chardonnay producer's second inaugural release of Cabernet Sauvignon, having made the variety from 1979 to 1992 before grafting over the Cab vines to Pinot Noir. In 2012 Hanzell replanted two acres of Pinot back to Cabernet and here's the welcome result. Blended with 12% Cabernet Franc, 11% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot, it offers a sweet cassis bouquet and substantial structure lined in flavors of red fruit, pencil shavings and tobacco.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Summation Red (California)
description: Wonderful Christmas-spice aromas lead to concentrated opulent fruit flavors in this full-bodied, complex and nicely oaky wine that's blended mostly from Syrah and Zinfandel. It's easy to pick out clove, cinnamon and cedar aromas before black currant and black cherry fill the palate.

title: Seghesio 2017 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This is an impressive appellation wine, blended with smaller percentages of Petite Sirah, Carignan, Syrah and mixed reds. Aged in both American and French oak, it is earthy, thick and brawny in leather, tobacco and coffee. Black baked fruit completes the picture, finishing in dust.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2015 S.L.V. Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an estate-grown, 100% varietal wine that showcases a soft, broad experience that's approachably rich and well-balanced. Perfumed in cherry, cassis and vanilla, it has a subtle, savory character on the midpalate of dense smoky oak and firm structure.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Karia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is the producer's cooler-climate offering of the variety—a steely, classically structured wine that has crisp well-defined apple, melon and pear.

title: Thacher 2017 Glenrose Vineyard Cinsault (Adelaida District)
description: Very light in the glass and slightly cloudy, this is a fascinating if somewhat simple wine that's hard to stop drinking. Aromas of raspberry and cherry meet with flinty crushed rock on the nose, while the palate is tangy with red plum, sagebrush and fruit-punch flavors. It is a perfect fit for lovers of fresh chillable reds.

title: Thomas Allen 2017 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)
description: Elegant and well balanced, this smooth and supple wine has just the right equilibrium between fresh appley flavors, brisk acidity and a good touch of viscosity for a smooth mouthfeel and finish.

title: Axr 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Dark in color with an intensity to its use of oak and up-front acidity, this shows a mix of caramel, vanilla and honeycomb, with a lasting note of butter and earth.

title: Boeger 2015 Reserve Meritage (El Dorado)
description: This is an interesting, complex and well-balanced wine that offers equal measures of ripe fruit, spices, moderate tannins and good acidity. Blackberry and black cherry blend in with light wood smoke and black pepper on a good firm structure.

title: Brick Barn 2017 Albariño (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of key lime flesh and peel, dried lemon rinds and a hint of freshly chopped celery show on the nose of this bottling. There's plenty of zip and grip to the sip, where flavors of dried Anjou pear peels and lime-like acidity meet with an earthy aspect.

title: Cattleya 2017 Cuvée Number Five Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is very sharp overall, starting with a tight nose of Gravenstein apple, grapefruit peel, citrus spray and slightly warmer hints of plumeria and toast. The palate rides the citrus-peel line from lemon to grapefruit, proving very racy with acidity.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (California)
description: Ripe fruit flavors and a generous helping of oak spices make this full-bodied wine flavorful and easy to sip. It brings cinnamon and red cherry to the nose, and black cherry, cranberry and baking spices to the palate.

title: De Loach 2015 O.F.S. Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Raisin, plum and cherry contrast against tart red currant in this “finest selection” from the producer. Juicy and broadly approachable, it has a likable thread of acidity that punctures through the hearty rich fruit and leathery texture.

title: Frank Family 2015 Patriarch Winston Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a thick, concentrated wine from the producer's estate site on the eastern benches of the appellation. Leather, earth and blue and red fruit meld together within firm sizable tannins and prominent oak. The wine is made in a big full-bodied style.

title: Guarachi Family 2017 Sun Chase Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: This is a bold, full-bodied and ripely styled red from the producer's own impressive vineyard site, high in the wilds of the new appellation. Smoky oak, wood and dark, concentrated cherry fruit combine around a core of substantial tannin and texture.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Martini Clone Old Girls Starscape Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy and tannic in plum, cherry and dust, this vineyard and clone-designate shows grippy structure and a mineral push of dust, crushed rock and turned earth. The fruit is brightened in citrus undertones.
designation: Martini Clone Old Girls Starscape Vineyard

title: Peter Franus 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is an easygoing, lovable and classically made white from one vineyard site in Carneros planted to the Musqué clone of the variety. It shares effusive layers of peach and vanilla within a viscous mouthfeel of elegant power and grace.

title: Sans Liege 2018 Cotes-du-Coast White (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 33% Viognier, 26% Roussanne, 22% Grenache Blanc, 11% Marsanne and 8% Clairette is an excellent display of everyday white Rhône potential along the Central Coast. Aromas of peach, buttered toast, pineapple and river stone lead into a palate that combines rich tones of roasted apple, yellow peach and lemon brioche with savory sea salts.

title: Treana 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of black cherry, caramel sauce, dried herbs and crushed rocks lead into a palate shaped by strong yet relenting tannins. Flavors of oak and more dark cherry ride a silky mouthfeel.

title: J. Lohr 2016 South Ridge Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: This widely available wine carries aromas of ripe berry, plum, violet and lavender that lead into a palate loaded with flavors of black currant and purple flowers. Polished tannins and just-right acidity frame it all.

title: La Marea 2018 Kristy Vineyard Albariño (Monterey County)
description: Apple-blossom, chilled pear and crisp peach-flesh aromas show on this sleek and fresh bottling. There is ample tension on the palate, where citrusy flavors of lemon, lime and yellow grapefruit prove refreshing.

title: Lumen 2017 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Aromas of peach, chamomile, lemongrass and wax make for a complex entry to this bottling. The palate combines lemon-spray and melon flavors, all wrapped in a sleek texture.

title: Testarossa 2016 Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers pomegranate, cherry pastry, cinnamon and mace aromas on the nose. It's loaded with baking spice on the palate, from dried ginger to star anise, which play against the cranberry core.

title: Keller Estate 2017 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: A soft sultry wine, with densely bright flavors of red and black cherry, cinnamon, nutmeg and licorice, this red is also robust in texture and layered acidity, with staying power on the palate.

title: Delgado 2016 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Sultry and soft, this white offers a juiciness of pear, anise and salty oak, made in a rich, layered style that nonetheless has complex structure and weight. It finishes with a touch of heat and undeniable power.

title: Grimm's Bluff 2015 Contango Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Dense blackberry and black-plum aromas are lifted by earthy wood and leather on the nose of this bottling from a biodynamic vineyard. There is a strong black-plum tang at the front of the palate, then the chalky tannins take hold, delivering touches of cocoa and coffee into the finish.

title: Storypoint 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This appealing and full-bodied wine is filled to the brim with plump, generous black-fruit and baking-spice flavors that are well-concentrated and wrapped in a blanket of fine-grained tannins. A new offering from E. & J. Gallo, it has very good depth and length without being heavy.

title: Alta Colina 2018 Lynn's Cuvée Sparkling Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Sparkling Grenache Blanc is a rare beast, but this bottling may change that. Aromas of tuberose, crisp papaya, light mango and pineapple lead into a crisp palate of Asian pear and honeydew that is clean and vibrant.

title: Peachy Canyon 2017 D Block Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling comes from a historic vineyard that includes cuttings from most of the old-growth Zinfandel blocks in California. The result is complex on the nose, with aromas of strawberry, mulberry jam and lavender. The palate combines violet and lilac flavors with rich black plum, licorice and tarragon.

title: Daou 2018 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Broad aromas of lime spray, tangerine, lemon peel, lychee and white flowers converge on the nose of this bottling. There's compelling cohesion of flavors on the palate, where poached apples and pears meet with a hint of savory sea salt.

title: Testarossa 2016 Rosemary's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling from a Talley family vineyard shows aromas of crushed slate, smoke, black plum paste and gravelly earth. It's very dry on the palate, where the texture steals the show, its grip revealing delicate flavors of blackberry and black plum.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Element 116 Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied Bordeaux-style blend is an excellent one. It shows tasty chocolate, black pepper, earth and grilled beef flavors and has a good, dry, moderately tannic mouthfeel. Best through 2026.

title: Justin 2016 Justification Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 57% Merlot and 43% Cabernet Franc begins quite subtly on the nose, with aromas of berry, mint and oak. Polished tannins frame the palate, where flavors of black cherry, espresso bean and dried mint arise.

title: Las Positas 2018 Estate Verdelho (Livermore Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine strikes a nice balance between a mild grassy, herbaceous aroma and more ripe and satisfying white-peach and tangy apple notes. It tastes very fresh, feels lively and has a mouthwatering finish.

title: Wrath 2017 Swan/828 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: There's a strong amount of dewy forest aromas going on in this bottling, including pine needle, eucalyptus oil and tart red fruits. An underlying smear of raspberry jam arises on the palate alongside wild mint and tea flavors.

title: Friedeman 2017 UV Lancel Creek Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Lovely and light with strong flavors of Gravenstein apple, pear and melon, this is a floral and well-made wine from the meticulously farmed site that shows a balanced approach to acidity and flavor. The oak is measured and supportive without ever getting in the way.

title: Fort Ross Vineyard 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Dark in color this wine offers tangy strawberry, tangerine and grapefruit in good measure, building to a meaty midpalate of weighty viscosity and substance. Building complexity as it goes, it weaves within its fruity edges nuanced hints of dried herb.

title: The Paring 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Nutty aromas of cashew meet with seared lemon peel and wet chalk on the nose of this bottling. There is good grip to the sip, where sharp flavors of grapefruit peel are set against warmer tones of almond.

title: The Winery SF 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: Full-bodied, concentrated and showing lots of new-oak flavors, this bold wine is ripe, firmly structured with tannins and acidity and offers a lot of spicy cedary accents. A good core of blackberry and black cherry is up to the task of filling out the textured and woody frame.

title: Writer's Block 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)
description: This wine is full-bodied, firmly tannic and saturated with cranberry and black-cherry flavors. It's a bold and structured wine that needs rich food as a pairing to really show its stuff, or a few more years of storage in a cool place. Best after 2022.

title: Michael David 2016 Freakshow Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This lavishly oaked wine blends ripe black-fruit flavors with abundant baking spice, wood smoke and maple tones. It is big but fairly soft in structure, with moderate tannins that give it a seductive, extravagant edge.

title: Acumen 2015 Peak Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Made from 86% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Malbec, 5% Petit Verdot, 3% Cabernet Franc and 1% Merlot, this is an herbal and smoky wine, earthy in sage and flint. Thick leathery tannins grip the palate with force as a touch of cherry and vanilla wind around a deep lasting finish.

title: Dancing Crow 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This is a nicely tart, palate-cleansing wine with plenty of fruit acidity, rather light body and vivid lemon, grapefruit and fresh herb flavors. It tastes bracing and crisp, making it a great choice with appetizers and on hot summer days.

title: Laetitia 2017 Estate Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Dried berries, baked soil and wet gravel show on the nose of this twist-top bottling. There is a strong core of cinnamon and cardamom pod on the palate, which is also rich in red cherry and savory animal hide flavors.

title: Las Positas 2015 Obscurus Estate Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Big in flavor but soothing and rich in texture, this full-bodied wine sports a spicy, slightly earthy aroma, concentrated blackberry and blueberry on the palate, and soft tannins that shape the mouthfeel without astringency.

title: Morgan 2017 Tempranillo (Arroyo Seco)
description: This is a fresh take on an often hearty and rustic grape, beginning with lively aromas of blackberry, wet gravel and roasted wood on the nose. The palate is bright yet tense, offering boysenberry and rose-petal flavors while remaining light on its feet.

title: Parducci 2016 True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: This staunch, tannic and concentrated wine is wound up tight and will need years to put its best foot forward. The color is inky dark, the aromas and flavors are closed in lightly smoky and peppery tones. There's rich dark fruit underneath, but it's almost unaccessible at this point. It will be best consumed after 2026.

title: Roth 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This bold white delivers a perfumed jasmine tone on the nose and palate. A mix of ginger, nutmeg and apple add to the flavors, lifted by steely, vibrant acidity.

title: T. Berkley Wines 2016 Leaning Oak Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Los Carneros)
description: Earthy tobacco and clove greet the entry of this balanced, light-bodied wine. Dark cherry, plum and dried herb round out the nuanced experience that is supported by firm, persistent tannins.

title: Amici 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A sinewy strong tannin structure wraps around earthy black tea, black cherry and forest, the medium-bodied wine showing a strong sense of savory character and complexity.

title: Chalk Hill 2017 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Chalk Hill)
description: A portion of this wine was fermented in French oak, while the other half in stainless-steel drums. It is grassy and herbal at first, settling into flavors of lemon rind, melon and pea shoot. The palate is rich and rounded, with buzzy acidity brightening the background.

title: Challen 2016 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of peach oil and honeysuckle extract make for a very sharp and pungent nose on this bottling. There are sandalwood and oak tones to the palate, with a fresh lemony citrus streak throughout.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2014 Endeavour Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is sourced from an estate vineyard along Lytton Springs that also grows Petit Verdot, of which there is 10% in this wine. A soft, juicy entry upholds flavors of dried herb, strawberry and red currant, with firm, sinewy tannins giving support. A thread of fresh acidity helps balance the fruit.

title: Falkner 2015 Meritage (California)
description: Intense aromas of smoke, blackberry, cassis and licorice show on the nose of this 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot and 7% Cabernet Franc blend. The tangy black-plum flavor is spiced by savory salt and pepper accents, and the structure is compellingly firm.

title: Foxen 7200 2016 Tinaquaic Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Dark fruits of elderberry and black plum meet with loamy soil, gravel and black pepper on the nose of this bottling from a mostly dry-farmed vineyard. The palate offers blackberry and toasted oak spice, leaning toward a richer expression of the variety.

title: Hawley 2018 Hopkins River Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Inviting in floral and peach aromatics, this well-made medium-bodied white has high-toned citrus flavors at its core. Grapefruit and lemon juice and zest mingle effortlessly buoyed by bright acidity and persistent freshness.

title: Las Positas 2016 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a bold and full-bodied wine from the toasted oak aromas to the ripe pear and almond flavors to a rich and mouthcoating texture. Barrel fermented and aged on the lees, it has good depth and concentration, solid structure of acidity and body and a lingering finish.

title: Lail 2017 Blueprint Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Always impressive, this is a fleshy, boldly structured white wine, offering a tremendous palate of exotic flavor. Lemon rind, wet stone, peach and a grittiness of background oak mingle effortlessly within a moderate richness of balanced complexity.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 The Reserve To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Perfumed in rose and violet, this reserve-worthy red displays deft notes of currant, dark cherry and plum along an exotic mineral-laden lineup of crushed rock and cocoa powder. Plush and broadly expansive in tannin, it persists in a classic, old-world finish of dried herb, sage and clove. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Saxon Brown 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rose petal and white pepper season the entry aromatics of this well-made wine, that's robust in weight and expansive tannin. Exotic fruit tones like rhubarb and pomegranate wrap around savory elements of black tea and forest floor.

title: Black Kite 2016 Stony Terrace Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine squeezes lots of bright fruit flavors into a tight frame of good acidity and moderate tannins. It's medium to full in body, has an appetizing dry texture and stops short of full ripeness.

title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 Deep State Red (Paso Robles)
description: Wild sagebrush herbs and forest wood meet with juicy cranberries and pencil shavings on the nose of this blend of 44% Cabernet Franc, 43% Merlot and 13% Petit Verdot. It's both juicy and tart with berry flavors on the well-structured palate, but the compelling complexity comes from dill, marjoram, licorice and tarragon spices.

title: Conclusion 2017 The Storyteller White (Sonoma County)
description: This proprietary white blends 95% Viognier with 5% Sauvignon Blanc. Together they're exotic in sea salt, wet stone and high-toned floral aromatics of jasmine. The palate is succulent and restrained, a study in white peach, green apple and lemon zest.

title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Made entirely from old Wente clone vines, this structured wine offers a steely core of lemon, green apple and honey. There's balanced acidity on the palate, with floral accents of apple and orange blossoms.
designation: Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard

title: Dusty Nabor 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A fresh cherry aroma is wrapped in loads of intriguing spice on the nose of this bottling, including clove, mint and cocoa. A chalky texture of grainy tannins frames the palate, where plum, blackberry, dried ginger and more baking-spice flavors ride a persistent acidity.

title: Flora Springs 2015 Out of Sight Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a hillside site between Oak Knoll and Coombsville, this is a sanguine, elegant red densely layered and plush in soft oak. Red currant, clove, cedar and cherry make appearances within savory complements of leather and tobacco.

title: Luna Hart 2016 Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)
description: This is Cabernet Franc done in a fresh and zesty style, starting with aromas of raspberry, cranberry, dewy herbs and green peppercorns. The palate is loaded with cracked pepper, juniper and mossy herbs, yet the ripe red apples and dried berry flavors complete the refreshing picture. Serve a bit chilled.

title: Pianetta 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles Estrella District)
description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling from a district in east Paso Robles shows espresso, tar, roast beef and pepper on the complex nose. There's an herbal quality to the sip as well as a violet note, set against elderberry fruit and held up by loads of acid and tannin.

title: Robert Hall 2016 Cavern Select Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Sourced from the region's most historic vineyard, this wine starts with aromas of racy boysenberry, exotic black plum and wood smoke. The palate combines flavors of smoke, snappy berries and red currants with a floral aspect.

title: Robert Hall 2016 Cavern Select G-S-M (Paso Robles)
description: The investment in quality promised by this winery's new owners, O'Neill Vintners & Distillers, seem to be paying off in the recent releases. This blend of 34% Grenache, 34% Syrah and 32% Mourvèdre shows aromas of black currant, violet and soil on the rich nose. The palate is intense in flavors of meat and black fruit, yet lifted by a hint of lavender and framed by balanced tannins and acidity.

title: Vina Robles 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling exhibits the richness that's made Paso Robles famous, yet at a price point that's great for frequent indulgence. Inky in the glass, the bottling's lush nose offers concentrated black cherry, caramel, cocoa and coffee. It's soft and smooth on the palate, where the black-cherry compote flavors are lifted by star anise and clove.

title: Dragonette 2016 Grassini Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Intense aromas of Sauvignon Blanc dominate this bottling, including sharp lawn cuttings, lemongrass, argan oil and even cut garden hose, yet there's a slight hint of peach as well. The dynamic experience continues on the sip, which is both lush in mouthfeel yet very grassy and herbal in flavor with green pepper, basil and lime leaf.

title: Epiphany 2016 Hampton Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very ripe blackberry and black-plum aromas are lifted by compacted violets on the nose of this bottling by the Fess Parker family. It lands on the palate with full flavors of blackberry reduction sauce, charred meat and pepper spice, with acidity that rolls into the finish.

title: Foxen 2016 Tinaquaic Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Freshly smashed violets combine with hints of tar, black pepper and elderberry on the nose of this bottling. There is strong acid on the palate delivering flavors of pepper, roasted meat and tangy dark fruits, proving quite fresh and still a tad young.

title: Foxen 2016 Williamson-Doré Vineyard Syrah (Los Olivos District)
description: Crystallized boysenberry and lilac aromas are boosted by black peppercorn on the clean nose. There is chalky grip and bright acidity on the full-bodied palate, where jasmine and violet flavors lead into a candied grape tone.

title: Friedeman 2016 UV Lancel Creek Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A robust entry of crisp acidity and lively pineapple fruit impresses immediately in this vineyard-designate that's well made and memorable. Rounded integrated oak gives it a pleasurable texture and length that's both complex and inviting.

title: Les Belles Collines 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Smooth and stony in mineral elements, this is a complex, medium-bodied and structured white. It is well defined in bold flavors of green apple, melon and Meyer lemon.

title: Smoking Loon 2017 The Original Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine has ample bright and fruity aromas that meet good, focused apple and pear flavors. Medium body and a light smooth texture make it easy to enjoy.

title: St. Francis 2014 Wild Oak Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with 10% Malbec and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon and then aged 20 months in entirely French oak, this wine has a heavy hand of blackberry and chocolate on the nose that continues on the palate. Moderate acidity competes with the concentration of oak and heat.

title: Thomas Allen 2016 Generations Red (Lodi)
description: Powerful toast and vanilla aromas and flavors make this full-bodied wine an obvious choice for oak enthusiasts. It is rich with blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors, very spicy and somewhat tannic.

title: Crooked Path 2016 The Wanderer Red (Paso Robles)
description: Cooked black plums, black cherries, fig and burnt gingerbread show on the nose of this GSM. Similarly cooked flavors show on the palate, where the acid and structure are shy.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Smoky oak and dull tannins support baked black fruit and tobacco in this soft, approachable and straightforward red wine.

title: Oak Mountain 2017 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: Very light and nearly effervescent in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of grapefruit peel, baking soda and damp campfire wood. Lemon pith and sour apple flavors arise on the sip.

title: Andretti 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This ripe wine traffics in butterscotch, brioche and baked pineapple, the texture viscous and overtly lush. It finishes with a lingering hint of sweetness.

title: Calculated Risk 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Fruity in dark cherry and plum within a simple structure, this wine is soft in texture with edges of clove. It finishes without fanfare.

title: 786 Wines 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is ripe to the point of sweetness, blending vanilla and milk-chocolate notes from oak with dried plum and raisin flavors.

title: Hamilton Creek 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: With a candied quality to its fruit, this tart, lemony wine is uneventful in terms of structure and complexity, offering a straightforward simple expression of the grape.

title: Rütz 2017 Maison Grand Cru Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is tart and cloudy, with strong flavors of baked pineapple and anise. The acidity takes on a persistent sour character that won't appeal to all.

title: Zeka 2016 Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)
description: From a single vineyard, this is a supremely earthy wine, brimming in compost and turned earth. It's tart and edgy in acidity, too, with a sour aspect to the finish.

title: Bandit NV Dry Rosé (California)
description: So fruity that it seems sweet, this effusive and medium-bodied wine tastes like strawberries and cotton candy. It is soft on the palate, and light in terms of concentration.

title: Decoy 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Herbal and effusive in green olive, this blends in 9% Merlot and 1% each of Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot. A thick midpalate of body weight and tannin evolves to a soft approachable finish.

title: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Sangiovese (Lodi)
description: An aroma of smoked bacon and flavors of cherry jam and melted butter make a sightly jarring combination in this full-bodied wine.

title: Puma Road 2012 Triumvirate Pedregal Vineyard Meritage (Paicines)
description: Extremely extracted aromas of blackberry jam, grape seed and dark chocolate show on the nose of this bottling. Tangy black-plum flavors meet with blackberry vinegar on the palate for a wine that is past its prime.

title: Barrelhouse 2017 Bourbon Barrel Aged Red (California)
description: An exceptionally sweet-smelling and sweet-feeling character marks this ripe, oaky, soft wine. Vanilla and butter aromas lead to raisin and barbecue-sauce flavors.

title: Rombauer 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This popular white is rich and concentrated in tropical fruit and sweet oak with a lasting taste of honey and vanilla.

title: Eagle Ridge 2017 Private Reserve Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (Livermore Valley)
description: This bold and candy-like wine smells toasty and buttery, tastes like butter and butterscotch and has an earthy edge too.

title: River Road 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This screw cap white is perfumed and floral, aged in both oak barrel and stainless steel. The midpalate and finish take on an astringent tinge before delving into vanilla and butter.

title: Shroud Mountain 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Generous, jammy aromas and fully ripe berry flavors give this full-bodied wine an easy-peasy charm. It's soft and mouthfilling in texture, light on tannins and not weighed down by too much oakiness.

title: Tortoise Creek 2017 Cuvée Jeane Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: Anjou pear, squeezed lime and riper guava aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate combines apple flesh with lime juice, proving pleasantly mellow and refreshing.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 El Loco Rojo Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Medium bodied and well balanced, this Cabernet Sauvignon-based wine shows good black-cherry aromas and a touch of tobacco in the dark-fruit flavors. Light tannins give it a nice grip on the palate.

title: Koehler 2017 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of grilled nectarine and light lemon pith on the nose. The palate is very tight, offering lemon peel and yellow-apple flavors with the slightest hint of smoke.

title: Lucky Rock Wine Co. 2018 County Cuvée Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County-Napa County)
description: Tangy and fresh, this nicely crisp wine offers plenty of lime and honeydew melon flavors on a light to medium body. It's smooth, well balanced and easy to enjoy.

title: Michael David 2017 Freakshow Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Rich, oaky and concentrated, this full-bodied, showy wine offers an abundance of baking spice, raspberry sauce and blackberry jam. It's chock full of fruit and maple flavors that are lifted by a good structure of moderate tannins.

title: Byron Blatty 2018 Rosé (Los Angeles County)
description: Broad aromas of peach, light strawberry and watermelon show on the nose of this Grenache-based rosé from Los Angeles County. Those fruits hit the palate first but then come compelling waves of chalky texture and lively acidity.

title: Koehler 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Pleasing aromas of bubblegum and grapefruit spray show on the nose of this bottling. The bubblegum flavor is also strong on the palate, alongside hints of peach and a lingering sandalwood influence.

title: McKinney 2017 Siren White (Santa Barbara County)
description: Warmer tones of honey-drizzled peach are cut by Key lime juice spritz on the nose of this blend of equal parts Viognier, Grenache Blanc, Albariño, and Roussanne. The well-balanced palate combines white peach, pineapple custard and lemon juice.

title: Opolo 2018 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Red cherry and vanilla meet with plumeria and orange rind on the unique nose of this rosé, which is a blend of 65% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 5% Viognier. The palate combines strawberry and red-plum flavors with a solid amount of acidity.

title: Saintsbury 2017 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Bold and effusively aromatic in rose petal and earth, this wine has an intensity of black cherry and tangy strawberry on the midpalate and an abundance of acidity.

title: Beringer 2016 The Waymaker Red (Paso Robles)
description: Hints of cappuccino meet with dark-plum fruit on the pleasant nose of this blend from the North Coast-based producer. Flavors of violet and black-plum jelly round out the easy-to-enjoy sip.

title: Doffo 2016 Salute Red (California)
description: This blend of 60% Petite Sirah and 40% Malbec offers aromas of cassis, blackberry and toasted herbs on the nose. It's quite ripe on the palate with plenty of rich berry-syrup flavors that are lifted by wild herbs and a touch of pepper.

title: High Valley Vineyard 2018 Rosé (High Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine has more color and slightly riper fruit flavors than usual for a rosé, but it's not at all heavy. Light red-cherry notes and a smooth silky texture make it easy to love.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Persing Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The nose of this single-vineyard expression combines wet stone and dusty oregano with fresh hints of red fruit and boysenberry on the nose. There is an herbal array on the palate of oregano and marjoram, which lift the red-currant fruit and ride light, easy tannins.

title: Koehler 2018 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a tropical, fruit-forward style of Chardonnay, with aromas of grapefruit, ripe pear, melon and mango. The latter fruit as well as papaya show on the refreshing palate alongside ripe pineapple.

title: La Crema 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: This widely available wine is a great midweek sipper. Light in the glass, it offers clean aromas of pomegranate, hibiscus and light touches of toasty oak. It's soft and mellow on the palate with cranberry, strawberry and tarragon flavors.

title: Marco Lucchesi 2016 Riserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Blackberry and cola aromas meet with gravel and turned soil on the minerally driven nose of this bottling. The palate is also full of intriguing earth, with stiffer tannins framing the soil and blackberry flavors.

title: MCV 2018 Pink Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Deep pink in color, this bottling offers soft aromas of red plum and cranberry, with tart touches of plum skin, earth and smoke on the nose. It's tight on the palate at first and then opens toward strawberry-sorbet flavors.

title: Trim 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This appealing wine is nicely balanced, fresh and has a flinty mineral character that enhances the crisp apple and white-peach flavors. Bright acidity gives it an appetizing mouthfeel and clean finish.

title: Hahn 2017 Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Earthy aromas of crushed slate and loam meet with dark-red cherry on the nose of this bottling. Roasted wild berries, crushed thyme, turned earth and a brisk acidity converge on the palate.

title: Laurel Glen 2016 Counterpoint Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Meant to be enjoyable earlier than the winery's signature mountain Cabernet, this is blended with 10% Merlot and 10% Malbec. It also includes fruit from off of the estate. Black-fruit forward, it has a balanced approach to oak and power, with a roundness to the palate.

title: Moniker 2017 La Ribera Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: An aroma of bread dough and subtle floral flavors backed by mineral and peach make this a pleasant and rather subtle wine. Little obvious oakiness comes through and it feels soft in texture.

title: Newman's Own 2014 Common Good Red (California)
description: This wine is slighly salty and savory in aroma, darkly fruity in flavor and velvety in texture. It coats the palate with ripe jammy blackberry and blueberry flavors underlain with fine-grained tannins. It's smooth and soft in texture.

title: Oak Farm 2018 Estate Grown Fiano (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine, made from a grape variety long grown in southern Italy, smells and tastes fruity and floral. It's fresh, clean and easy-going, with light acidity and a soft texture.

title: Oblivion 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Tart elderberry and red- and black-plum aromas show strongly on the juicy nose of this bottling, along with hints of lilac and lavender. The palate is very fruity, with smashed raspberry and red-currant flavors, while bright acid and light tannins prove pleasant if simple.

title: Orsi Family 2015 Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Big, brawny tannin and oak form a foundation beneath rustic red fruit, tobacco and beefsteak tomato in this estate wine, made from the Tuscan-native grape.

title: Pacific Redwood 2017 Organic Merlot (North Coast)
description: This medium-bodied and smooth-textured wine has a savory side to complement its good blackberry flavors. The aromas of black olive and bell pepper are typical for the grape variety when grown in cooler areas and they don't overwhelm the nice fruit impressions on the palate.

title: Paul Dolan 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Potter Valley)
description: Flinty figgy aromas and reserved fig and apple flavors give this full-bodied wine an appealing, rich quality. The wine's initial subtlety is a good thing as it develops slowly in the glass.

title: Pezzi King 2015 Row 26 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This ribald ripe wine opens in a sweet nose of blackberry jam and cinnamon, then delivers a follow-up of black pepper and palate of herbal intensity. Brazenly concentrated, it's soft, rich and round.

title: Rombauer 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy and lush, this is a rich, satisfying white for fans of a more voluptuous style. Flavors lean on peach cobbler, vanilla and brioche.

title: Roth 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a good value wine, made in a full-bodied style that will broadly appeal. Chalky tannins give it a gravelly texture that is peppered in forest floor, earth and cherry cola, the oak a mix of French and Hungarian.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)
description: There's a mix of freshness and savory qualities on the nose of this bottling, with aromas of lemon balm as well as hazelnuts. The palate's toasted almond qualities meet with creamier peach-custard flavors, all lifted by a citrusy tang.

title: Sbragia 2015 Home Ranch Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Blended with 5% Petite Sirah, this is a thick and meaty red wine, sanguine in iron and red currant. It has a robust ripeness and concentration with pleasing accents of dried herb and cedar.

title: Taft Street 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a fair deal: a wine of high quality that dances in cherry and strawberry, taking on a jammy sweetness on the nose. Expansive on the midpalate, its tannins are lengthy in savory hints of forest and tea.

title: Vincent 2016 Family Reserve Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Tangy boysenberry meets with packed purple flowers on the mellow nose of this bottling. The palate is very tangy with balsamic blackberry flavors as well as peppery spices and dried herbs on the finish.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2017 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Lime zest, cream and white flowers show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very crisp with aggressive citrus tones, from grapefruit skins to lime juice, and the tension is noticeable.

title: Wente 2017 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Fresh pear, nectarine, smoke and apple aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very ripe with pear and apple-butter flavors, which are cut by lemon spray and then finish toward marzipan and chalk.

title: Wild Coyote 2017 Tempranillo (Adelaida District)
description: Roasted strawberry aromas meet with oak smoke on the mellow nose of this bottling. The palate is tangy with roasted red-plum flavors that are enhanced with touches of leather and tobacco.

title: Black Stallion 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an attractively priced wine, well made and richly woven in strawberry and cassis. Smooth rounded edges of integrated tannin and oak punctuate a touch of grip on the powerful, full-bodied finish.

title: Rockpile Winery 2015 Rockpile Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rockpile)
description: This wine is broad and expansive in plush dark fruit and spice that is supported by soft, billowy tannins. Blended with 9% Malbec, 8% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Franc, is dazzles in tones of violet, blueberry, clove, pencil and pepper.

title: The Debate 2015 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the great site in the heart of St. Helena, this is a thick, rich red, brimming in delicious layers of cherry liqueur, graham cracker and black licorice. Complex, it is lushly crafted with robust body and structure, built to last and the tannins soften over time. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Trujillo 2015 Gary Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Cherry, berry and spice tones orbit around well-integrated oak and firm tannins, showing breadth and weight as this builds in the glass. Everything is in proportion—fruit, oak and tannin—offering a seamless experience that is defined by structure and complexity. It will cellar well; enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Anaba 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Floral and earthy, this head-turning white is textured, crisp and bright. Complex flavors of lemon pith, peach and anise combine with ease around a midpalate of graceful weight and harmony, while remaining balanced and fresh in the glass.

title: Carlisle 2016 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright boysenberry and spice highlight a boldly layered experience of full-bodied concentration in this estate red, from a vineyard planted nearly 100 years ago to mixed black and white varieties in addition to Zinfandel. Soft and rich, it is well integrated, structured and elegantly built, with lasting acidity.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Sweetwater Springs Vineyard Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine begins reduced with strong aromas of diesel and tar. It continues on the palate in an intensity of perfumed violet and lilac, followed by white pepper and grilled meat. Thick and concentrated in ripeness and power, it allows room for its acidity to speak, freshening the proceedings with ease.

title: Teachworth 2013 Estate Blend Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: A lean high-toned red wine, this shows deft layers of balanced ripeness and savory character, a mix of cigar box, black cherry and spicy leather. The mountain appellation contributes elements of the forest and graphite, with mineral-laden gems hidden within.

title: Waits-Mast 2015 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Cedar, red cherry and forest-floor nuances take the lead in this medium- to full-bodied wine that combines tantalizing aromas with just-ripe flavors and an appetizing, lightly tannic texture. The wine is complex, layered and sophisticated, bringing something new to each sip.

title: Anaba 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This opens with a rich nose of brioche and honeysuckle while remaining simultaneously crisp and fresh on the palate in lemon, grapefruit and apple flavors. Well integrated and balanced within a light-bodied elegance, it shows quiet, nuanced power.

title: Carlisle 2016 Papera Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From the great site planted in 1934, this wine has 4% Carignan in the mix. It's dark, brooding and yet bright, with a concentration of cranberry, blood orange and cassis. The acidity is focused and in balance, underlining the wine's winning succulence and energy.

title: Cuvaison 2017 Méthode Béton Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Los Carneros)
description: This white is the result of concrete egg experimentation and it succeeds wildly in its lovely capture of acid-driven stone fruit enveloped in a persistence of minerality. Peach and lemon flavors round out a medium-bodied texture of impressive lushness and enduring beauty. The wine was aged 12 months in concrete.

title: Maritana 2017 Dutton Ranch Hansen Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This powerfully concentrated white is engaging in floral and mineral tones, with a robust cradling of oak. There's tension on the palate, which is layered in flavors of tropical guava, mango and pineapple that are dusted with baking spice.

title: Schramsberg 2011 Méthode Traditionnelle Extra Brut Sparkling (North Coast)
description: A bold well-aged aroma and nutty smoky flavors make this full-bodied wine noteworthy and complex. The extra brut designation means it's drier than a typical brut, having only 4.5 g/L residual sugar, and making it the driest sparkling wine Schramsberg has ever released. Woody spicy peppery nuances mingle with dried-apple and toasted walnut flavors, leaving a lingering smoky finish.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Petite Sirah (Lake County)
description: For all of its imposing black color and silty tannins, this opulent wine is also luscious and enticing, drenched in superripe and luxurious blackberry and cassis flavors that absolutely coat the palate and linger long on the finish. While not oaky, it has the sur lie richness and viscosity and shows dashes of cocoa, cardamom and clove. Best after 2023.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Saveria Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Aromas of crushed black currant, strawberry sorbet and fennel bulb create a dynamic start to the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The fresh and bright character extends to the palate, where raspberry, mint and mushroom flavors are dominant.

title: Anaba 2016 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a high-toned, silky and seductive wine, that's floral and inviting in dried herb and lavender. With a touch of coconut, it melds together orange and cherry brightness into a warmth of baking spice and a firm tannin structure.

title: Holly's Hill 2015 Estate Classique Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: This masterful wine deftly combines great fruit concentration, ample savory, earthy accents and subtle oak spices for a deep, complex and satisfying character. It is full bodied, layered, so smooth that it's almost creamy in texture, and studded with subtle smoky, peppery accents from the first whiff to the lingering finish.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Strong floral aromas of hibiscus and lavender meet with black raspberry on the rather elegant nose of this bottling by Brian Loring. Those aspects continue to the palate, where they meet with darker violet and red-cherry flavors as well as hints of thyme and rosemary.

title: Paradise Springs 2017 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is an epic cool-climate expression, hailing from clone 470 grapes grown in the Donnachadh Vineyard. Freshly cracked pepper, savory lamb crust and smashed boysenberry aromas show on the nose. The palate pairs gamy meats with rosemary and rainbow peppercorns, wrapped around a dense black-plum and lilac core.

title: Stone The Crows 2015 Three Twins Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an estate-grown red that's thick, rich and concentrated in bold flavors of dark chocolate and blueberry cake. The midpalate is soft and seductive with full-bodied power as a finishing touch of dust and crushed rock builds and emboldens.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2015 Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Bringing together 38% Merlot with 34% Malbec and 28% Cabernet Sauvignon, this red is mild in mocha and blackberry flavors. Soft, integrated tannins provide a dusty underbelly of herbal sage and earth.

title: Walt 2016 Brown Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Stemmy and earthy, this tastes of black tea, bark and forest. Fruity in cherry cola, it explodes in cardamon and cinnamon, along a full-throttled road to a concentrated, ripe finish.

title: Coursey Graves 2017 West Slope Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a densely concentrated and powerfully 100% varietal wine, intensely full-bodied and robust in black fruit, iron, smoke and garrigue. Tannic and ripe, it is also complex and intriguing, with a boldness that never backs off.

title: Fulcrum 2017 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Salty and oaky, this wine was barrel fermented in 26% new French oak, allowing room for an intensity of caramel and baked apple. Lengthy and well made, it has length and breadth within moderate structure and acidity.

title: Gallo Signature Series 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Made in a bold, full-bodied style, this wine is complex and inviting in aromas of anise, fennel and apple blossom. The palate reveals velvety flavors of pear and peach.

title: Consensio 2017 Intrigue Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dark plum, violet, cola and a hint of game show on the nose of this bottling from a winery based in Camarillo. There is decent complexity to the palate, where roasted plum and strawberry flavors meet with thyme and tarragon.

title: Stasis 2016 Murmur Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Darker aromas of black plum and mulberry get hit with nutmeg and soft clove spice on this nose of this bottling from a vineyard that sits adjacent to Highway 101. Tart black plum, lilac and violet flavors are framed by sandalwood on the palate.

title: Lafond 2018 SRH Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This deeply pink colored bottling is extremely fresh and zippy on the nose, offering raspberry, alpine strawberry and cherry aromas with underlying herb and earth tones. The palate is slightly effervescent at first, yet that freshness works well, upholding the strawberry sorbet, cherry sauce and vanilla ice cream flavors.

title: Avid 2017 Avid Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: Structured, full bodied and rich, this is a fruity, earthy wine that is robust in flavors of cherry, vanilla and raspberry. It will appeal to fans of a bigger style of the variety.

title: Davis Family 2016 Rosé de Noir Dutton Ranch Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: Made by the Méthode Champenoise from Pinot Noir grapes grown at the Green Valley ranch, this tastes of watermelon, grapefruit and cherry. Meaty in texture with moderate weight, it is lively and fresh, with lasting acidity.

title: Sean Minor 2018 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Fresh aromas of grapefruit, lemon and a hint of pear carry the nose. There is a snappy freshness to the palate, where bright flavors of apple and pear meet with sea salt and sizzling acidity.

title: Jarvis 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky oak, sage and sanguine red fruit form the core of this classic, old-world styled red, 100% varietal and from the producer's mountain estate. Intensely structured and dense in tannin, it shows potential for aging, with high notes of herb and pencil shavings.

title: Whipsmart Wine Company 2017 Sit in the Sun Muscadelle (Sonoma Valley)
description: This unusual white tastes of honeydew and dried apricot, with a mighty floral characteristic that adds to its appeal. Viscous and waxy, it has an exotic and old-world flair of moderate acidity and balanced body weight.

title: Walt 2017 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fresh in cherry and pomegranate, this is a full-bodied, robustly ripe and tannic wine, that is also oaky and powerful. Bold fistfuls of Asian spice give it complexity and balance.

title: Testarossa 2016 Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Quite rich on the nose, this bottling offers concentrated aromas of cherry, turned soil and dill on the nose. Dried red-cherry and woody oak flavors show on the palate, where the texture is most compelling, with layers of lush tannins that will take time to fully resolve.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Parker West Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cranberry serves as the backdrop on the nose of this bottling, while the funky earth, game and sweetly seared oak play in the foreground. The palate is framed by wood-spice flavors of sandalwood and cedar, with tart cranberry and roasted pork elements arising as well.

title: Windchaser 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a highly recommended, robust and full-bodied wine. It's grippy in mouthfeel, containing the black-cherry and plum flavors within good acidity and moderate tannins. Look for it to improve and show more complexity with time. Best after 2022.

title: Jordan 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A touch of oak starts this off, with a palate built by tight-grained tannins and integrated fruit. Flavors of stone, white flowers and ripe apple combine to create a nuanced yet rich feel.

title: Yorba 2013 Shake Ridge Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine is well made, flavorful and nicely balanced. It leans toward the bold side of the spectrum and shows well-integrated tannins for grip on the palate, generous raspberry and blackberry flavors and light oak spices.

title: Blackbird Vineyards 2016 Contrarian Red (Napa Valley)
description: With a mild and soft entry, this blend of 64% Cabernet Sauvignon, 29% Cabernet Franc and 7% Merlot delights in its sharp tones of dark cherry and currant. The midpalate picks up complexity in its array of sage and clove seasoning.

title: Fazeli Cellars 2017 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of marzipan, white-peach cream and a hint of marshmallow are cut by a streak of sour citrus on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers sour lemon, toasted nuts and, in the midpalate, a fleshy nectarine flavor.

title: Foxen 7200 2016 Range 30 West Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Exotic berries and spices show on the nose of this blend of 62% Cabernet Franc and 38% Merlot, from fruity raspberries to star anise and licorice. The palate combines flavors of fennel frond and pasilla chile with green peppercorns and richer black-plum fruit.

title: Girasole 2017 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This rather light-bodied wine made from organic grapes tastes mild, smooth and nicely ripe so it's easy to sip and should please a crowd. The gentle texture, soft tannins and nice mix of fruit and mild spices are broadly appealing.

title: Rabble 2017 Mossfire Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Bright and snappy aromas of boysenberry jam on toast and dark red cherry show on the lively nose of this bottling, whose label features an amazing display of augmented reality viewable through a smart phone. The flavors are fresh in ripe plum and berry, lifted by hints of fennel and mint, and wrapped in enough structure to keep it serious.

title: Rabble 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Lime peels, red apple and hints of kelp show on the nose of this bottling. It's grippy on the palate with aggressive acidity, offering intense flavors of Granny Smith apple, lime and green herbs.

title: The Paring 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Sour limes and green-apple peels make for a tangy aromatic entry to this bottling. There are plenty of rainy cement flavors on the palate, which is lifted by lime peel.

title: Tooth and Nail 2016 The Stand Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling, which includes 11% Syrah and 1% Viognier, is a bit reductive at first, showing charred beef, tar and Concord grape aromas. The palate combines roasted meats with black-currant-jelly flavors that emerge through the asphalt character with patience.

title: Two Sisters 2016 Courtney's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Hazelnut and browned butter mesh with lemon cream on the nose of this full-flavored and bold Chardonnay from the Foley family. The flavors are rounded and rich, with butter-poached apples and creamy lemon, proving very powerful.

title: Coast 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a nicely balanced, well-modulated wine that combines ample fruit notes with a honey and almond overlay and a very smooth mouthcoating texture. It is medium bodied and subtle in its richness.

title: Coast 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Attractive flavor complexity ups the interest level in this medium-bodied, smooth and supple wine. Plum and blackberry blend with black olive and tobacco on the palate while melted tannins coat the tongue.

title: Flora Springs 2017 Soliloquy White (Napa Valley)
description: This proprietary white blends together 44% Sauvignon Blanc, 42% Chardonnay and 14% Malvasia. Pungent in floral jasmine and woody cedar, it's robustly lush and full bodied.

title: Grady Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: This wine is powerful, medium to full bodied and monolithic in character. It has an intensely deep color, restrained but ripe aromas and a blend of black-fruit and black-pepper flavors that hardly peak through a very grippy texture due to fine layers of tannins. Best after 2025.

title: High Dive 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Tenacious in tannin and thickly concentrated fruit, this has a juicy core of cassis and cherry cola that are well-accented in anise, sage, cedar and cigar.

title: Kalaris 2015 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Golden in color, this is a creamy, likable white with some age on it that shows bold layers of Gravenstein apple and pear. There's a steely backbone of acidity that complements well.

title: Longhouse 2017 Stainless Steel Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: While rather light in flavor, this medium-bodied wine is well balanced, dry and appetizing. Crisp apple and white peach notes round out the brisk texture.

title: Michael Pozzan 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Soft, rich and likable, this is made at an attractive price point and delivers seamless approachability that's both varietal and well made. Black fruit and black pepper highlight the experience most, with firm tannins and toasted oak never getting in the way.

title: Rusack 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: Sour limes and cut lawn clippings show on the nose of this bottling from the heart of Ballard Canyon. There is good grip to the sip, where sour Granny Smith apple flavors meet with damp gravel minerality.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Strong cedar aromas frame the dark red fruit and dried herbs on the nose of this bottling. The woody flavors are quite strong on the palate, where tobacco-leaf tones meet with pomegranate and red cherry.

title: Andretti 2014 Montona Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
