description: Rich and tannic, this is a boldly flavored and structured wine, dense in plum, dark cherry, clove and black pepper. It has soft approachable tannins and a hearty use of oak.

title: Brick Barn 2016 Vermentino (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Bright and fresh aromas of lime blossom, key lime pie, ripe nectarine, chalk and jasmin show on the expressive nose of this bottling. There is a great zing to the palate as well as a chalky grip, allowing ripe pear and peach-oil flavors to shine, though they do become sweeter as the wine breathes and warms.

title: Bailarin 2016 Black Knight Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Big in oak and brimming in rich red fruit, this wine is lightly spiced in cardamom and clove, with chalky tannins providing additional texture. Medium bodied in style, it builds flavor as it opens, showing rich layers of strawberry and dark-cherry cola.

title: Böen 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara-Monterey-Sonoma)
description: A smooth rich texture and ripe luxurious fruit flavors are framed by butter and baking spices in this satisfying full-bodied wine. It goes for ripeness and heft, feeling soft in acidity and long on the finish.

title: Briceland 2015 Ishi Pishi Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Humboldt County)
description: Concentrated black-cherry and black-currant flavors get great support from firm tannins and good acidity in this medium-bodied wine. It has good focus and concentration at relatively low ripeness, revealing layers of fruit and light oak nuances as it opens up.

title: Chappellet 2017 Cold Creek Vineyard Viognier (Carneros)
description: This wine opens with a sweet nose of candied fruit and flowers, the texture velvety and robust in viscous intensity. A taste of apple skin and lemon lingers for awhile on the palate, with a lasting note of wet stone.

title: Cobble Creek 2017 Red (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this organically grown wine is pristine, with blackberry juice, smoked meat, dried herbs and oak. The sip is layered with flavors of dark chocolate, berries, loamy soil and light caramel on the finish. It's surprisingly complex for the price.

title: Crux 2014 G-S-M (Russian River Valley)
description: Bay leaf and eucalyptus aromas open this wine, a blend of 58% Grenache, 22% Mourvèdre, 18% Syrah and 2% Petite Sirah. Juicy in black and red berry, it is well integrated, focused and complete, with full-bodied richness and supple texture, finished in nutmeg and black pepper.

title: Delta 2018 Chenin Blanc (California)
description: Soft and supple in peach and lemon, this lovely white is fleshy in texture with plenty of underlying acidity to keep it fresh in the glass. It saw time in stainless steel and neutral oak, and persists in aromas of jasmine.

title: Delta 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: With the goal of making wines for environmental change, owners Matthew and Alexis Iaconis donate $1 of every bottle of Delta sold to environmental groups that reduce carbon emissions and protect the ocean. This white is crisp and fresh—a delicious quaff of fig, peach and lemon rind, with a compelling, stony mineral edge, fermented entirely in stainless steel.

title: Domaine Della 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an earthy, powerfully grippy and ripe red wine, with nuanced layers of plum and cherry cola. Dry firm tannins provide a powerful backdrop of intensity and complexity.

title: Duckhorn 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Thick in dark chocolate and leather, this is a lengthy, dry and grippy red wine, sourced from two sites in the appellation. Herbal in clove and cedar, it is 100% varietal, its oak supportive but not distracting.

title: Duckhorn 2015 Three Palms Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the famous Merlot vineyard this is indeed inclusive of 6% Merlot (and 2% Petit Verdot), which adds a layer of softness and approachability. Thick robust black fruit and smoky oak highlight a lush supple texture and significant bite of concentration and power.

title: Flora Springs 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal and a good showcase for the grape. Thick rounded richness and dense flavors of cherry and vanilla are complemented by sage, cedar and dried herb.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2015 Rio Vista Vineyard Dijon Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tangy black-raspberry aromas meet with dark clove and Indian spices on the nose of this bottling. There's a lot of forest floor and Mediterranean spice flavors to the palate, which is framed by a sour cherry and tangy berry core.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2015 Late Disgorged Reserve Cuvée Demi Sec Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Half-dry in style, and having spent 20 months in oak, this is a hearty, richly lush wine that is softly layered in bright flavors of Key lime and blood orange. It makes the ideal pairing with spicy food or a salty box of popcorn.
designation: Late Disgorged Reserve Cuvée Demi Sec

title: Hall 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Spicy and earthy in plum, black currant and blackberry, this is a soft, supple and rounded wine, in balance despite a hearty ripeness and bold texture of underlying tannic grip. It sources across the appellation to showcase an approachable, robust memorable experience of powerful concentration.

title: Iskaranu 2017 Secret Clone Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tree bark and cinnamon complement fruitier aspects of blue and red berry in this well-made medium-bodied wine that's in balance while presenting overall elegance. Savory and earthy, it delivers nice flavors and texture, keeping the tannin and oak in check.

title: Krupp Brothers 2018 Stagecoach Vineyard Viognier (Napa Valley)
description: This is a hearty, expressive 100% varietal wine, floral in honeysuckle and gardenia, with a lovely entry of succulent citrus. Complex and elegant, it dazzles in minerality—a mix of stone and earth that works on every level.

title: Lion Ranch 2016 Two Lions Grenache-Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This blend of 85% Grenache and 15% Syrah starts with gamy aromas of spit-roasted boar, with a touch of wild berry and rust. There is bright acidity to the sip, where that gamy quality extends across flavors of red plum and pomegranate.

title: McKahn 2018 Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: Given six months in neutral barrel, this is an effervescent, lively white, with tension and focus on the palate. Sweet peach, apple and mineral-like stone add to inviting aromas of white flower as the wine finishes dry and with power.

title: Orfila 2016 Montepulciano
description: Dried berries, black plum, savory soy and a hint of iodine show on the nose of this bottling from San Diego County. The palate offers violet and açai flavors yet remains very earthy, elegant and dry.

title: Hanzell 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: This impressive white delivers a core of quince, lemon rind and apple that blends with accents of white flower and lemongrass. Crisp acidity drives the freshness on the textured palate, offering elegance and plenty of layers of intrigue. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Timbre 2015 The Headliner Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Joshua Klapper takes the extremely cool-climate vines of Presqu'ile Vineyard and works refreshing magic, presenting a wine with complex aromas of plum, roasted cherry, dried sage, pine needle and peppercorn. The palate is bright with raspberry yet lifted by frankincense and sandalwood, proving delicate but immensely expressive.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine shines in fresh flavors of tangerine and grapefruit. Bright acidity lends structure to the light-bodied palate, giving it an elegant and lasting impression.

title: Amici 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Tar, leather and coffee flavors ride along a velvety body of integrated and richly woven texture in this beautiful wine, blended to great floral and herbal effect, with 12% Cabernet Franc. Black licorice, black cherry and firm tannins make for a stellar and seamless experience dripping in lasting richness.

title: Cobb 2016 Mariani Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: High-toned floral aromas and flavors mark this memorable, elegant and delicately textured wine, buoyant in acidity and fresh hits of tangerine, lime and a tease of caramel. The structure is impressive, suggesting potential aging, and the wine has an undeniable hint of wet stone-like mineral that lingers.

title: Daou 2016 Micho Red (Paso Robles)
description: Like most Daou wines, this blend of 52% Merlot and 48% Cabernet Sauvignon only grows better as it breathes and opens over the course of days. Black rocks, blackberry and a loamy minerality kick off the nose while the palate presents strong black currant, black plum, crushed graphite, slight herb and coffee syrup flavors. Drink now through 2031.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2013 Late Disgorged Carneros Cuvée Sparkling Rosé (Carneros)
description: Orange in color, with a dry intense mousse of great intrigue, this aged sparkling offers limestone-like mineral flavor that continues in its texture of wet stone and oyster shell. The fruit is subtle and integrated, a mix of key lime and green apple that peaks midpalate and allows the acidity to speak resoundingly on the finish. This is made from 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay.

title: Hanzell 2017 Sebella Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: The winery's stainless-fermented white is so good and such a value for the quality that it cannot be recommended highly enough. Licorice, anise and green apple combine around a steely core of crisp acidity and lengthy balance that impresses from start to finish.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2017 Split Rail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From a vineyard 1,700 feet above sea level, this light and fresh bottling tantalizes on the nose. Aromas of wild strawberry and red currant are lifted by white pepper and marjoram, while the zesty palate combines pomegranate and dried herbs.

title: Three Sticks 2016 Cuvée Eva Marie Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Spicy black-cherry and boysenberry flavors ride along a velvety palate in this lush wine. Accents of vanilla and cola add to the sumptuous nature, giving it a seductive, plush feel.

title: Timbre 2015 The Hi-Hat Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Earthy tones dominate the nose of this bottling from John Sebastiano Vineyard, featuring aromas of forest floor, dewy thyme and pine needle. The palate pops with black-raspberry, damp sagebrush and tarragon flavors, proving very brilliant and bright.

title: Jarvis 2013 Lake William Estate Grown Cave Fermented Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Cabernet Franc, 26% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot offers grip and structure within a leathery midpalate of robust texture and weight. Black pepper, currant and plum provide a subtle helping of fruit that lengthens and brightens the finish.
designation: Lake William Estate Grown Cave Fermented

title: Clarice 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lush and inviting aromas of baked black cherry, cola, cream and strawbery greet the nose on this impressive appellation blend by Winemaker Adam Lee. There is a lot of grip to the palate, where a ripe boysenberry jam flavor is elevated by spearmint and framed by stiff tannins.

title: Jax 2016 72 Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is plush, lush and fruity, interwoven with tones of cardamom and clove. The palate is rich in feel, bolstered by layers of orange peel, cassis and toasted oak flavors.

title: Maryetta 2015 Valenti Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Savory, earthy and herbaceous aromas lead to a crisp and vital palate that carries bright flavors of red cherry, pine and rhubarb. It is medium in weight, energized with acidity and light in tannins, while also nicely concentrated and focused.

title: The Vineyard House 2014 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)
description: This blends 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from Oakville, combining bold integrated flavors of cinnamon toast, sage, licorice and blackberry. Reduced and showing its oak, it has sinewy quality to the texture, and finishes with an unexpected freshness.

title: Encanto 2013 Usibelli Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Juicy red fruit is lightly spiced in cinnamon, clove and a tangle of toasted oak in this well-made, 100% varietal wine. Red and black cherry show a succulence on the midpalate as complex, integrated structure supports a memorable experience on the spicy earthy finish.

title: Amici 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is impressively blended with 10% Cabernet Franc, showing a wealth of dusty plum, clove and cinnamon character up front and throughout. The fruit is predominantly from mountain vineyards. Soft, integrated texture shows its integration with the French oak, which supports instead of distracts.

title: Amici 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Youthful, this wine is blended with small amounts of Malbec, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Together, they form a core of earthy cedar, clove and pencil shavings, with a bite of thick tannin taking on a leathery texture. Dark cherry, black currant and dark chocolate melt on the palate into a velvety whole.

title: Furthermore 2015 Starbridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light and delicate in color and build, this is brimming in fresh acidity, with an exotic forest-floor complement and lingering hits of Asian spice and licorice. Made in tiny amounts, it speaks to the coast's ability to be vibrant and nervy within a context of savory intrigue.

title: Reata 2017 Three County Pinot Noir (San Benito County-Sonoma County-Monterey County)
description: Attractive and medium bodied, this smooth-textured wine offers pleasant and light red-cherry and black-plum flavors and a touch of spicy complexity. It feels soft on the palate and easy to drink.

title: Sean Minor 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Full bodied and mouthfilling, this generous, ripe, blueberry-scented and black-cherry-flavored wine has lots to like. It's exuberant in flavor, broad and smooth in texture, and has very light tannins so it seems to melt in the mouth.

title: Sean Minor 2018 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a good solid wine, well balanced and nicely packed with fruity and savory flavors. It is medium to full bodied, stuffed with cherries, cinnamon and green-tea notes.

title: The Gentleman's Match Wine Co 2015 Madame X Red (Napa Valley)
description: Tight-grained tannins underscore high tones of plum, cherry and coconut shavings in this full-bodied red which blends a majority of Merlot with Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. It has brawn and soft approachability.

title: Thomas Allen NV Ancient Carignane (Lodi)
description: Oak spices play a big role in this medium- to full-bodied wine made from vines as old as 127 years. It offers an aroma of cinnamon, vanilla and nutmeg, while ripe and delicious black-cherry flavors light up the palate.

title: Fetzer 2018 Shaly Loam Gewurztraminer (Monterey)
description: Sweet pear, tonic water and gin-like botanicals show on the nose of this bottling. There is a compelling sizzle to the palate, with guava, orange blossom and apple syrup flavors that are leveled by lively acidity and a crushed rock tone.

title: Simple Life 2018 Rosé (California)
description: Aromas of mint and peach lead to a crisp apple flavor on the medium-bodied palate. While straightforward in its appeal, it is well-balanced and easy to enjoy.

title: Beringer 2017 Whisper Sister Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Named to honor Bertha Beringer, who helped the winery survive Prohibition, this is a juicy, soft and easily lovable wine, brimming in exuberant red fruit, firm tannin and sweet oak. Rich and full bodied, it offers wide appeal.

title: Davis Bynum 2018 Jane's Vineyard Virginia's Block Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: From the one block of the Woolsey Road vineyard, this is a medium-bodied white that shines in bright acidity and sharp flavors of pear and Meyer lemon. Dried herb and spice play at its edges, adding complexity to the balanced richness.

title: Girard 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Green olive, crème brûlée and toasted oak mingle around a core of medium-bodied roundness, the wine showing a metallic, stony edge against the wood.

title: Jalama 2016 Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Black plum and crumpled purple flowers show on the somewhat tangy nose of this bottling. Ripe Concord grape flavors arise on the palate alongside baking spice and tangy black-plum skins.

title: Kalaris 2016 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: This has a floral, light entry of mango, pear and steely elements of crisp acidity. Tight and firm in texture, it stays crisp and approachable in the glass.

title: Lula 2018 Dry Ranch Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This light-bodied and crisp-textured wine bursts with ripe peach and apple aromas, then shows a lean, tangy palate with restrained, tangy but light fruit flavors.

title: Silver Palm 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a serious, dry, oak-aged wine, with full body, firm tannins and good concentration. It's well balanced and a bit reserved in flavor, as light smoke and beef accents mingle with tasty black cherry and cranberry.

title: Swanson 2017 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This red is thick and sinewy in leather, smoky oak and spice. Full bodied and robust in style, it weaves between black pepper and blackberry with ease, showing a wide appeal.

title: Tantara 2017 Zotovich Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Plush aromas of black plum, black cherry and light lavender show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very tangy, with black-plum-skin flavors, lifted by hints of purple flowers.

title: Wilson Creek NV The Venetian Red (California)
description: Funky and gamy but pleasant aromas of dried red fruit, chiseled granite and wild herbs show on the nose of this blend of Teroldego, Sangiovese, Zinfandel and Malbec. The palate offers a roasted pork in cranberry-plum-sauce flavor, with that earthy funk quite prominent.

title: Melt 2018 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine is smooth and easy to drink. It feels nicely layered and creamy in texture, shows attractive apple and baking-spice aromas and adds vanilla and cream flavors on the palate.

title: Abbeyville 2018 Tanner's Passage Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This is a good, enjoyable, flavorful wine that blends butter, baked apple and baking spices on a broad texture. Lightly toasted oak and vanilla add some welcome complexity.

title: Brutocao 2016 Torrent Hopland Ranches Estate Bottled Red (Mendocino)
description: This easygoing wine is medium bodied, moderately fruity and has a smooth, almost soft texture.

title: Beckmen 2017 Whole Cluster Purisima Mountain Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Clean aromas of ripe cherry, plum, licorice and cinnamon arise on the nose of this whole-cluster bottling by Steve Beckmen. The palate is full of tangy red fruits and more licorice spice, with a savory showing of herbal and tea spice as well.

title: Eden Rift 2018 Eden-a-Vent Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)
description: Made in a carbonic, Cru Beaujolais style, this fresh play on Pinot Noir starts with candied strawberry, dried cherry and pomegranate on the fruit-driven nose. Pungent cranberry and hibiscus flavors meet with fennel pollen on the sip, which is playful if not very complex.

title: El Lugar 2017 Rincon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Light in color, this bottling begins with bright and rusty aromas of red cherry, vanilla and slight caramel, proving quite inviting. The palate starts with ripe red fruit before pinches of thyme and white sage add a savory side.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Family Meritage (Temecula Valley)
description: This blend of 47% Cabernet Franc, 30% Malbec, 18% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot is an impressive showing, starting with aromas of cherry, cinnamon and oak that are fresh and fruity. Oak decorates the palate in a balanced way, lifting up the black cherry, caramel and cappuccino flavors.

title: Adelaida 2017 HMR Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Adelaida District)
description: Hailing from the oldest Pinot Noir vineyard on the Central Coast, planted in 1964, this bottling starts with aromas of carnation, cinnamon, red plum and a hint of red apple. An array of herbs, from tarragon to thyme, show on the sip, decorating the strawberry and red-plum flavors. Vanilla pops on the finish.

title: El Lugar 2018 Blanc Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Chiseled stone and crushed slate aromas meet with crisp pear and jasmine aromas on the nose of this bottling—a rare white wine made from Pinot Noir. There is compelling tension to the sip, where yellow-pear flavors dominate.

title: Monochrome 2018 Mix and Match White (California)
description: Grapefruit, green-apple and pear-flesh aromas arise on this atypical blend of 46% Grenache Blanc, 45% Chenin Blanc and 9% Roussanne from vineyards in Paso Robles and the Santa Ynez Valley. A chalky mouthfeel delivers intriguing flavors of sharp green citrus and plush white-fruit flesh.

title: Tantara 2016 Ingeborg Vineyard Syrah (Los Olivos District)
description: Black fruit, lilac and lavender play with smoke and bacon fat on the nose of this bottling. The palate is medium weight and wrapped in soft tannins, with the snap of blackberry fruit, the spice of peppercorns and a touch of tar.

title: Tower 15 2017 Petite Sirah (San Miguel District)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling starts with aromas of cassis, concentrated wisteria and a hint of fudge on the nose. The palate is big and bold with black-cherry, acai and caramel flavors, all cut by strong acidity.

title: Wolff 2018 RoséWolff Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A beautiful shade of pale pink in the glass, this Grenache-based rosé starts with aromas of strawberry sorbet, peach, grapefruit and stone on the nose. There is a grippy texture to the sip, where snappy flavors of light strawberry and cotton candy are dry and tightly woven.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Napa-Sonoma-Monterey)
description: This wine finds great balance between richness and vibrancy, delivering a broad mouthfeel lifted by brilliant fruit and baking-spice flavors. Lemon, butter and pear aromas lead to Fuji apple and tangy lemon on the palate.

title: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 22% Cabernet Sauvignon and tiny percentages of Malbec and Petit Verdot, this is a hearty take on the variety. Full-bodied flavors of black currant and dried herb meld with firm tannins and oak. Textured, richly layered and appealing, it finishes on acents of tobacco and clove.

title: Hess Collection 2017 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With 11% Petite Sirah and 8% Malbec in the blend, this is no shy undertaking. Robust, fleshy dark fruit flavors are enveloped by a voluptuous texture. Currant and toasted oak form the core of the midpalate as a hint of cigar comes into play on the finish.

title: Frey 2018 Sun & Rain Organic Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Oodles of enticing fruit flavors and deft oak spices give this full-bodied wine plenty to enjoy. It has a buttery, creamy richness both in flavor and texture, excellent concentration and a lingering finish.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Estate Pinot Meunier (Carneros)
description: This earthy wine offers a rich concentration of black cherry, blueberry and dark chocolate. Measured acidity hones in the rich palate, making for an intriguingly worthwhile experience.

title: Easton 2017 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine has the classic brambly, wild berry signature of Zinfandel framed by firm tannins and good acidity. It is nicely concentrated, fruity but not fat, and rich enough for a lingering, tasty finish.

title: Roederer Estate NV Estate Bottled Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)
description: This crisp, fruity and citrus-accented wine has plenty of green apple and lemon flavors, brisk bubbles and a clean, tangy finish. A flavor of fresh-baked bread and a softer texture develop with time in the glass.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This serious blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Barbera is delicious and substantial, offering a good mix of oak spices and rich dark-fruit flavors. Firm tannins and full body give it a big mouthfeel.

title: Beckmen 2017 Cuvee Le Bec Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 47% Syrah, 35% Grenache, 11% Mourvèdre and 7% Counoise is one of the best red wines for the price anywhere in California, offering impressive weight and complexity in the $20 range. Aromas of lilac and blackberry drop into a palate full of boysenberry, leather and beef, with a rose-petal freshness.

title: Minus Tide 2017 Mariah Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Ripe fruit aromas and enticing pastry-shop accents bring a lot of enjoyment to this medium-bodied, fresh and minimally oaky wine. Crisp apple and poached pear mingle with vanilla, nutmeg and ginger on the palate while crisp natural acidity keeps it in balance.

title: Europa Village 2016 Vienza Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of red berry and cinnamon on the nose. Roasted fennel and cranberry sauce flavors show on the palate, which is pleasant although not typical of Sangiovese.

title: One Hope 2016 Vintner Collection Red (California)
description: This is a very serviceable and slightly sweet wine. It has candied-fruit aromas and flavors, and pretty good balance due to subtle acidity and tannins.

title: Vacationer 2018 Rosé (California)
description: This smooth and soft wine offers floral spicy aromas and flavors on a medium body. It has a rich mouthfeel.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2016 Colmar 538 Selection Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Earthy and tannic, with a tangy tart midpalate of cherry and cranberry, this is an estate-grown wine that's full bodied and overtly robust.

title: Wilson Creek 2018 Harmony Vineyard Roussanne (Temecula Valley)
description: Sour grapefruit peels, toasted nuts and Rainier cherry aromas make for an interesting nose on this bottling. The palate is somewhat sweet with apple syrup, honeysuckle and peach touches.

title: Double Black 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Wet campfire, dried mints and black raspberry show on the nose of this earthy bottling. The palate is very ripe and fairly sweet with red fruits and cut with pinches of tarragon.

title: Balderdash 2016 Joyride Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Extremely ripe and extracted on the nose, this bottling shows black-cherry and caramel aromas. The palate is heavy with flavors of black plum, dark cranberry and more caramel.

title: Balius 2016 Merlot (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a sweet nose of chocolate and vanilla oak and this richness continues on the palate. Basically built and structured, it has a simple approachability.

title: Campos 2017 Gigi's Estate Red (Contra Costa County)
description: This is an easy-drinking, middle-of-the-road pour that won't make enemies. It's full bodied, with stewed cherry and plum flavors and very little tannin.

title: Concrete 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine has a rich caramel overtone in the aroma and flavor that suppresses the fruit flavors and gives it a sweet impression.

title: One Hope 2016 Vintner Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Very fruity and grapey in aroma, this medium-bodied wine adds strong vanilla, marshmallow and toast in the flavors. It comes off as a pop wine due to those obvious oak elements and a hint of sweetness.

title: Vibe 2016 Captivate Me Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black cherry, tar and funky game aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate recalls damp campfire wood, sour oregano and roasted cherries.

title: Annabella 2018 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: Earthy, somewhat funky aromas of grapefruit rind and dank plums show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are a mix of metallic tones and sour plums.

title: Fend & Foster 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Reduced and overtly earthy, this wine is thick in tannin and elusive in fruit, with a simple approach to acidity and integration.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2017 Spring Hills Vineyard Flora (Russian River Valley)
description: A cross between Gewürztraminer and Sémillon, this wine is dark gold in color and oaky and thick on the palate. Tangy in sour apple and baked lemon, it tastes quite ripe.

title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2017 ReZerve Barbera (Amador County)
description: Heavy oak aromas and flavors quash the fruity notes in this lopsided, full-bodied wine. It's something only oak lovers will appreciate.

title: SummitVine 2015 Diamant Red (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Blending 73% Merlot with 22% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, this has thick and jammy baked flavors that taste overripe and powerfully concentrated.

title: Gibbs 2016 Three Clones Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Mild in spice and quiet black fruit, this wine includes 7% Merlot and 7% Petit Verdot. Priced at a good value, it is made in a simple, approachable style.

title: Maher 2017 Black Widow Zinfandel (California)
description: A rather raw, green-wood aroma and sweet-seeming oak flavors dominate this medium-bodied wine. Those who like a sweet pickle and candied-fruit profile will enjoy it.

title: Maxville 2017 Big Max Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a grassy and intensely herbal white wine, with an imprint of reductive oak and quite ripe personality.

title: Poundstone 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Intensely steely, this wine offers a length and breadth of full-bodied ripeness that takes form in broad layers of honey, pear and lemon chiffon. Structured, it's richly concentrated with a lingering hit of toasted oak.

title: Sonoma-Cutrer 2014 Winemaker's Release Grand Cuvée Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from 60% Chardonnay from Vine Hill Ranch and 40% Pinot Noir from the producer's Owsley Estate, this is a voluptuous sparkling wine, flavored in cherry, strawberry and peach. It has quiet apple undertones and a hazelnut, brioche richness that presents as lush on the palate.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Family Meritage Meritage (Temecula Valley)
description: A bit lighter in the glass than comparable wines, this blend of 47% Cabernet Franc, 30% Malbec, 18% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot begins with approachable cherry-candy fruit on the nose. There is a core of dark strawberry on the palate with hints of sweet sage and licorice, making for a very quaffable wine.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2017 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Very pleasant and soft aromas of light honeysuckle, yellow melon and creamy peach show on the nose of this bottling from a clone imported by the Bonny Doon founder. Tangy and fresh apple-skin flavors meet with slightly sweet melon elements on the broad palate.

title: Liberty School 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This compelling wine starts with aromas of red cherry, crushed rock, cigar box and hickory on the nose. The palate combines flavors of smashed blackberry with sage, thyme, pepper, smoke and a loamy minerality.

title: Opolo 2016 Summit Creek Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Richly extracted aromas of black cherry cream, black-plum sauce and chai spice show on the nose of this bottling. It's very full of flavor on the palate, with caramel and coffee candies, more black cherry and soft lush tannins that are quite creamy.

title: Shooting Star 2016 Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: This will be a very good dinner time wine due to its firm structure and tempting, ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors. It's medium bodied, and has light tannins and acidity that balance it out nicely.

title: Renwood 2016 Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: This smoky, peppery wine is a great change of pace for Cabernet and Pinot Noir drinkers. Toasted oak and black pepper dominate the aromas, while meaty, dried plum flavors fill out the palate. A medium to full body and moderate tannins provide an appetizing texture.

title: Brutocao 2015 Estate Bottled Quadriga Hopland Ranches Red (Mendocino)
description: This blend of Italian grape varieties boasts well-concentrated and ripe fruit flavors that are nicely framed in a slightly oaky range of baking spices. It's generous, fruity and easy to sip.

title: Dracaena 2016 Plummer Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Broad red-cherry aromas meet with more tart plum skins and carnation buds on the nose of this bottling. The palate also shows red cherry as well as vanilla-cookie and pencil shaving flavors, framed by grippy tannins and bright acid.

title: F2 Wines 2015 Saracen Syrah (Los Olivos District)
description: Light and delicate aromas of sweet wood and purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling from a newer winery in the Santa Ynez Valley. It's a lighter, more delicate expression on the palate, where solid acidity and grippy tannins present dark-fruit flavors.

title: La Crema 2016 Saralee's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This white from the great vineyard site is intense in approach and full-bodied richness. Thick, concentrated layers of tropical and stone fruit effuse from the palate adorned in toasted oak and lasting lushness.

title: Langman Estate 2016 Raymond's Rows Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied wine is dark in color, peppery in aroma and ripe and jammy in flavor. It has plenty of the grape variety's famous tannins to make the texture grippy. While not fancy or ambitious, this is a solid, well-structured wine that will improve with time. Best after 2024.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Creamy aromas of black cherry, cardamom, cracked pepper and Indian spices show on the nose of this county blend. Luxardo cherry, coriander and even curry spices show up on the fascinating and tangy palate.

title: Matchbook 2016 Estate Bottled Petite Sirah (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This is a well-structured, ageworthy red wine that surrounds ripe lush blackberry and maple flavors with fine-grained tannins and full body. It is big and bold on the palate and will show its best stuff with a juicy chop or steak. Best after 2024.

title: Bevela 2017 Fractured Emergence Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Delicate on the nose, this bottling starts with light aromas of honey, tangerine, crushed chalk and the slightest bit of pineapple. The palate is very tangy, high-toned and a tad sour, showing green grapefruit and citrus pith flavors.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2015 Gravel Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a strong sense of wood, matchstick and smoky flint on the nose of this bottling. Those woody elements carry to the palate as well, where sandalwood and oak elements mesh into dried lemon peels and savory sea salt, bolstered by sizzling acidity.

title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Broad aromas of pear, lime skin, apple blossom and hazelnut show on the nose of this bottling. The nutty aspect extends to the palate and settles into tangy marmalade and buttered toast toward the finish.

title: Passaggio 2016 Heringer Estates Grenache (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine is light enough in color to pass as a rosé, and shows good, fresh red-fruit flavors along with good balance. Brisk acidity and light tannins give some grip on the palate, while raspberry flavors last through the tangy finish.

title: Starfield 2016 Aglianico (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine is intense in color and structure, feeling quite dry and firmly tannic, but countering that austerity with substantial blackberry flavors and a good sense of freshness. Enjoy it now with indulgent, rich foods or cellar to see how it mellows. Best after 2023.

title: Stolo 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Soft and subtle tones of green apple and passion fruit are enhanced by a hint of jalapeño spice on the nose of this bottling. There is a fascinating stony quality to the sip, where wet cement flavors combine with passion fruit and lime-laced tonic water.

title: Tondré 2015 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Bursting aromas of boysenberry meet with hints of caramel and freshly grated nutmeg on the lively inviting nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The vibrantly fresh palate snaps with black raspberry, vanilla and floral flavors, proving complex, refreshing and delicious.

title: B.R. Cohn 2017 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: This elegant, medium- to full-bodied wine offers flavors of raspberry, black cherry and black tea, while a firm and nicely tart texture provides great balance. Subtle oak spices add complexity from the aroma through the finish.

title: Blair 2015 Delfina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Hibiscus and light red fruits meet with hints of pork roast on the mellow but enveloping nose of this bottling. The palate's pomegranate and sour cherry flavors meet with wild herbs, more roasted game and plenty of interesting floral tones.

title: Brick & Mortar 2018 Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is made entirely from Syrah picked from a cool site near Petaluma. It impresses in its dry, thirst-quenching body and structure, offering complexity within a quaffable package of lovely flavor and texture. Grapefruit, Rainier cherry and apple add to the tart juiciness and stony sea spray.

title: Denali Estate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This new producer has the proper bona fides, employing sought-after consulting winemaker Thomas Rivers Brown to make the wine from a site on the eastern edge of the appellation. Juicy in dark cherry it offers a soft structure dotted in cocoa dust, baked plum, cedar and pencil—a rich, full-bodied style complemented by classic savory notes.

title: Diatom 2018 Bar-M Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: From a vineyard in the Los Alamos Valley, this bottling by Greg Brewer begins with fresh aromas of passion fruit, citron, lime leaf and wet cement. The palate is tightly wound with slightly sour tones of guava peel, presenting a very fresh, no-oak style that still has plenty of character.

title: Fesstivity 2016 Brut Rosé Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of crisp lemon peel, pluot and watermelon show on the inviting nose of this sparkling wine. The flavors are quite focused on the palate, with lemon peel and grapefruit rind pushing into the sharp, precise finish.

title: Flanagan 2017 Gap's View Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a new site for the producer, acquired in 2015, this is made in tiny amounts and shows savory character throughout. Floral and earthy, with a note of clove and flint, it's tightly wound in grippy tannin and tart cranberry, cassis and raspberry, with a lasting trace of black tea.

title: Hawk and Horse Vineyards 2014 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)
description: This full-bodied and impressive wine matches the intense tannins of the variety with equally intense fruit flavors for good balance on a very big frame. Bright blueberry and blackberry aromas lead to effusive black-fruit and dried fruit flavors, accented by dark chocolate. Best 2023–2030.

title: Miraflores 2016 Estate Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: Bold flavors and a massive structure make this outstanding full-bodied wine a good candidate for further aging. Concentrated blueberry and dark-chocolate notes fill the aroma, while cocoa, espresso and blackberry coat the palate. Layers of fine-grained tannnins will help it mature. Best from 2024–2030.

title: Pulchella 2016 Highs & Lows Red (Paso Robles)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this blend of 59% Grenache from Heaton Ranch Vineyard and 41% Syrah from two other vineyards makes for a complex experience, starting with aromas of concentrated black plum, nutmeg and clove. Those baking-spice elements carry into the palate, giving depth to the mulberry and floral flavors.

title: Round Pond 2018 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This is 100% stainless-steel fermented, which shows in the fresh, lively acidity that's front and center. Flinty wet-stone accents give it a bit of texture as bold flavors of lemon and mango linger on the medium-bodied palate.

title: Samsara 2015 LaBarge Vineyard Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The nose on this bottling is extremely floral, starting with rose petals and lavender before diving into raspberry and cola spice. The lavender and rose buds arise on the sip as well, along with tarragon, fresh red fruit and grippy, even slightly chunky tannins.

title: Seabold Cellars 2018 Mission Ranch Grenache Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: There's a fascinating twist to the finish of this wine, in which a pecan and hazelnut flavor arises. The nose starts with crisp and mellow aromas of green apple and nectarine, while the palate shows strong citrus before the nutty quality emerges. No wonder sommelier-turned-winemaker Chris Miller calls it trouvaille, or “lucky find.”

title: Sojourn 2016 Oakville Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This well-sourced red is sweetly rounded and rich in tobacco, cedar and sage, with secondary notes of dark cherry and dried herb. Robust and powerfully built, it has rounded tannins and nicely integrated oak.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Viva Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine is big but complex, showing earthy tobacco-like aromas, ripe but dense blackberry and black-cherry flavors and a velvety blanket of fine-grained tannins. It's balanced, not overripe and displays some of the classic black olive and pepper aspects of Cabernet that are compelling. Best from 2023.

title: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy and robust, this wine has intensity in spades. Full bodied, it is concentrated in Christmas spice and baked plum, with a sweetness to the oak. The tannins are big and structured, adding a chalky quality to the texture.

title: Beekeeper Cellars 2016 Secret Stones Madrone Spring Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Blended with 20% Petite Sirah, then aged in all French oak, 25% of it new, this is an outstanding wine from a burly mountainous appellation. A robust hearty nose of oak, tobacco and leather leads the way to a high-toned midpalate of cherry and berry dusted in crushed rock and black pepper.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2015 Gran Reserva Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Central Coast)
description: Smoked beef in a cherry-compote sauce, minty herbs, loamy soils and wet slate are all aromas that present themselves on the compelling nose of this bottling, which spent 36 months in barrel. The palate is smoky in flavor, with black-cherry and purple-flower touches and stiff tannins that carry into the savory finish. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Grassini 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This reserve bottling aims for richness, offering aromas of rounded apple, pear, smoked nuts and crushed chalk. The palate wraps a smoky touch around the dried grass and yellow-pear flavors.

title: Grounded Wine Co. 2016 Public Radio Red (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted pork, nutmeg, vanilla and mulberry aromas show on the nose of this blend of 64% Grenache, 27% Syrah and 9% Petite Sirah, part of Napa winemaker Josh Phelps' new venture. It's smooth on the palate with loads of star anise and gingerbread flavors that play against a roasted red- and black-plum backdrop.

title: La Follette 2016 Hawk's Roost Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a robustly structured, energetic wine, robust in oak and spicy components. Leather and game give it an edginess of rough-hewn intensity, as white pepper contrasts well against flavors of strawberry and orange.

title: La Follette 2016 Heintz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Lightly spiced and earthy, with a touch of tree bark and forest floor, this wine shines in tangy raspberry and strawberry flavors, with a backbone of sage and black tea. Light bodied and balanced, it has a persistence of acidity.

title: McClain Cellars 2016 Kiss of Life White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of yellow melon and orange cream make for a clean and plush nose in this blend of Grenache Blanc, Albariño, Loureiro and Viognier from the Estelle Vineyard. It's lush on the palate at first, and then tightens in structure, offering ripe but grippy flavors of creamy white peach and cherimoya.

title: Melmar Wines 2015 Signature Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Blending in tiny amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Malbec, this robustly concentrated red is given nearly two years in French oak, much of it new. It offers leathery sinew, bombastic tannins that should shake out in time, and classic elements of cedar, pencil shavings and currant. This is for fans of power.

title: Migration 2016 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A thick, layered and richly woven red from a well-farmed site, this speaks loudly to the vintage and the appellation, imparting lovely flavors of black cherry, black tea and cola. Fleshy and beguiling, it lingers in vanilla.

title: Pellet Estate 2016 Sun Chase Vineyard Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a broad-shouldered, richly unctuous white despite its un-oaked approach. Spicy ginger, ripe mango and pear are aligned with a lasting taste of caramel.

title: Rombauer 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine in red currant and cherry, this full-bodied wine is juicy, soft and round, with polished tannins and integrated oak. It impresses with its ability to offer varietal character and overall approachability.

title: The Calling 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a powerfully concentrated wine that's balanced by an underlying brightness. The juicy acidity supports flavors of red cherry and plum, while integrated tannins give it a plush feel that's widely appealing.

title: The Federalist 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: The fresh, snappy fruit flavors in this medium-bodied wine are almost irrestible. It shows the charming, light and quaffable aspects of the grape that make it a good lunch wine or pre-dinner glass.

title: Three 2016 Old Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: This full-bodied wine has a concentrated berry and cherry essence that makes it easy to sip and enjoy. A touch of raspberry in the aroma and a hint of baking spices on the palate make it all the more tasty.

title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Merlot (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Dried herbs, dark red cherry, crushed slate and smashed twigs show on the nose of this bottling from the southern Paso Robles region. The herbaceous character is deftly integrated into the palate's black-cherry fruits, all framed by tight tannins.

title: Bargetto 2017 Regan Vineyards Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a strong kick of hickory to the nose of this bottling by a winery founded in 1933, with subtle black-cherry fruit slow to emerge. The palate offers a tight structure that evolves with time, proving light in body and tense with mellow rosewater flavors.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Grenache (Monterey County)
description: This blend of three properties from up and down the Central Coast (64% Rancho Solo, 24% Alta Loma and 12% Shokrian vineyards) is a bit gamy at first, but the red fruit and flower aromas emerge from the reductive veil with time. The palate offers flavors of roasted pork in a red-plum sauce, with a touch of oak.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Red (Central Coast)
description: Elegant purple fruits meet with violet and lavender on the nose of this blend, which is led by Syrah, Tannat, Tempranillo and Grenache, with little bits of Viognier and Petite Sirah. Firm tannins uphold the medium-bodied palate, where tart berry and more purple-flower flavors arise.

title: Figge 2015 Foster's Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Intense and tarry in style, this bottling starts with deep aromas of boysenberry. There is a compelling density and intensity to the sip, where dark berries meet with damp tarragon flavors.

title: La Honda Winery 2016 Salinian Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The nose of this bottling is very twiggy with aromas of dried herbs, dark cocoa, peppercorn and elderberry. Damp wood and sage sticks show on the palate alongside very dark and dry berry flavors.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The cedar, sandalwood and pine-forest aromas work well on the Sangiovese in this bottling, which also shows red cherry on the nose. There is good tannic tightness to the palate, where red-fruit flavors meet with sawdust and vanilla on the finish.

title: Odisea 2015 Lewis Vineyard The Temp Tempranillo (Clements Hills)
description: This full-bodied and thick-textured wine wraps spicy smoky beefy flavors around a good core of blackberries and black cherries. The spicy oak character dominates but it's attractive and adds to the wine's boldness.

title: Bailarin 2016 Suacci Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed in clove and stems, this is an earthy wine with a light body that is shy in fruit, opting for more savory complexity. Cranberry, strawberry and forest notes define it best.

title: Benziger 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Light to medium bodied, this wine offers delicate fruit and herb aromas, followed by crisp and lightly fruity flavors that hit the target.

title: Bushong 2018 Spanish Castle Queen Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Fresh aromas of apples, pear and chalk meet with sour and sweet lime scents on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with a Key lime bubblegum flavor and grows more toward peach on the finish, making for a fruitful yet zesty experience.

title: Castle Rock 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of red plum and raspberry are lifted by the slightest hint of cinnamon on the nose of this bottling. Broad flavors of strawberry and red apple make for an approachable palate that begins to lean slightly ripe toward the finish.

title: Cline 2017 Estate Grown Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: Meat, lavender and toasted oak-barrel notes combine well in this value-driven wine, which overdelivers on its price point. With a soft moderate midpalate, it has good power and weight and lasting richness in the form of baked plum and cherry flavor.

title: Crū 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Ripe pear and chalk aromas meet with playful scents of bubblegum on the nose of this unoaked Chardonnay. The sip zips with acidity before the ripe flavors of pineapple, pear and Pink Lady apple take over.

title: Elizabeth Spencer 2016 Special Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft, round and jammy in raspberry, this wine also offers sage and compost—an underlying earthiness that complements its more decadent tones marked additionally in chocolate mocha.

title: Europa Village 2016 C'est La Vie Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this wine smells like strawberry extract and fennel, which are pleasant aromas yet not Syrah-like. The palate offers light red-plum and strawberry tones, finishing on French toast. It is likable, if not varietally familiar.

title: Layer Cake 2016 Bourbon Barrel Aged Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This attention-getting wine boasts very ripe, grapey, dried-fruit flavors and a broad full mouthfeel with very fine-grained tannins that are not at all harsh. The flavors are ample and the texture soft.

title: Maxville 2017 Big Max Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Rustic aromas of red fruit, smoke and dusty earth show on the nose. There are fresher fruit flavors of strawberry and even cranberry on the palate, where wood spices take over and lead into a graham cracker finish.

title: Montemar 2014 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The nose on this bottling is quite subtle at first, offering hints of fresh purple flowers as well as framboise and vanilla. The palate is dry with tart berries, bay leaf and minty herbs.

title: Pulchella 2015 Henchman Tannat (Adelaida District)
description: Black-currant, black-pepper and lilac aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the Bella Collina Vineyard. Blackberry and more black-currant flavors arise on the palate, where sage and thyme show up, making for a more complex sip.

title: Pulchella 2018 Drifter Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Restrained aromas of ripe pear flesh, apple blossom and guava show on the nose of this bottling from Terra Mia Vineyard. The palate is also reserved, just allowing enough of the guava and tuberose flavors to emerge.

title: Samsara 2018 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light aromas of wet stone and red berry show on the nose of this blend of 60% Mourvèdre and 40% Grenache. There is compelling texture to the sip, where the strawberry-flesh flavors meet with earthy tones of moss and mushroom.

title: Stokes' Ghost 2016 Petite Sirah (Monterey)
description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling, named after a famed Monterey spectre, shows dark blackberry, iodine and tarry elements on the nose. The tannins are very grippy and thick on the sip, and need some time to mellow, and the flavors of charred wood and boysenberry are a tad rustic.

title: The Blending Lab 2016 tZ Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted strawberry and smoky oak make for a simple but pleasant nose on this bottling, The palate is loaded with rich and concentrated blackberry flavors, lifted by fresh acidity and finishing on a vanilla kick.

title: Timark 2017 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Fresh yet concentrated aromas of black raspberry, star anise and nutmeg become quite tangy on the nose of this bottling. The palate is thick and full of joyous strawberry and raspberry flavors, all cut by green sage and an increasingly sour tang.

title: Uptick Vineyards NV Brut Sparkling (North Coast)
description: This wine is nicely dry, has some good, earthy complexity in flavors and a sense that it has aged long enough. There's a tinge of pink in the straw color. A scent of ginger cookies and flavors full of apple cider and baking spices give it something to savor.

title: Wente 2017 Riverbank Riesling (Arroyo Seco)
description: Key lime, wet stone and a steely minerality show on the crisp nose of this bottling. Rounded flavors of lemon and orange balm meet with orange blossom and jasmine on the palate, which shows the slightest hint of sweet.

title: Andretti 2016 Rosa Garcia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a thick, rich and syrupy red, brawny in red and blue fruit, cola and a lingering generosity of toasted oak. It has touches of dried herb and clove.

title: Angels & Cowboys 2018 Rosé (Sonoma County)
description: Light pink in color and delicately flavored, this is a bright, refreshing wine made primarily from Grenache. Dry, it features layers of citrus and cherry flavor that are nuanced in wet stone and herb.

title: Blue Fox Cellars 2015 Nube Bianco Vineyard Arneis (Potter Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells lightly earthy and meaty, and tastes chalky, tight and mineral driven. It's refreshing and austere in an interesting way.

title: Cobble Creek 2017 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Light plumeria and jasmine aromas meet with candied lime peel and brioche on the nose of this wine, which is billed on the label as gluten-free and vegan-friendly. The palate starts with a snappy taut texture and delivers flavors of candied lime, grapefruit and honeysuckle.

title: Muscardini 2014 Madrone Ridge Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Thick and concentrated, this wine is burly in black fruit and a lingering ripeness that takes on a generous lushness and mouthfeel.

title: Nola Grace 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Very fruity and rather rich in texture, this wine is one of the riper, softer versions of the varietal. It shows appealing apple, vanilla and honeydew melon flavors.

title: One Hope 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: There is an earthy core of turned loam on the nose of this bottling alongside fresh red cherries. The tannins are a bit hard on the palate, where roasted berry and damp herb flavors ride a lingering acidity.

title: Roth 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Smoky oak and meat contrast against jammy black fruit and chocolate in this reserve-tier wine, aged 19 months in French oak, the majority new. A small percentage of Syrah adds to the meaty backbone of overt flavor.

title: Sculpterra 2017 Heroe Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling shows crisp aromas of cranberry, fresh herbs and crushed graphite on the nose. The palate is a tad ripe, with candied cherry and pomegranate-syrup flavors, all lifted by mint and rising tannins on the finish.

title: Thomas Allen 2017 Selections Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This medium-boded wine shows a nice blend of ripe pear and apple aromas, with buttery baking-spice flavors. A rich texture and subdued acidity make it soft on the palate.

title: Timark 2016 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Baked red cherry, cocoa, tangy raspberry and a touch of earth show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very tangy with balsamic berry flavors that are framed by cedar-like wood tones.

title: Cobble Creek 2017 Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of sandalwood, red cherry and light leather show on the nose of this bottling, which touts its organic, gluten-free, vegan-friendly ways. Red-currant flavors dominate the palate, which shows both a flash of acid and a thick texture.

title: Ballentine 2018 Betty's Vineyard Chenin Blanc (St. Helena)
description: Entirely varietal from estate-grown fruit, Betty's shows fig, peach and apple flavors wrapped around a stony texture of midweight ripeness and style. Floral, it's youthfully vibrant.

title: Ca' Momi NV Heartcraft Sparkling (California)
description: Fresh apple-juice aromas and lively apple and citrus flavors highlight this rather soft-textured and mouthfilling wine. An off-dry balance and pillowy bubbles make it gentle on the palate.

title: Heir Apparent 2016 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of 40% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Petit Verdot that tastes of black licorice, currant and soy. A leathery texture tops a full-bodied concentrated thicket of tannin and oak.

title: Lester 2017 Lester Family Vineyards Rosé of Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a strong sense of earth on the nose of this rosé, with clay and mud aromas as well as sour red fruits. The palate is quite sour, with flavors of unripe plums and red apples.

title: One Leaf 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This is a well-behaved, extremely affordable, firm-textured wine that has moderate oak and fruit flavors in good balance and a nip of tannin to help give it some grip.

title: Paris Valley Road 2018 Chardonnay (California)
description: Flinty aromas of struck match meet with light lemon peel, pith and blossom on the nose of this bottling. The lemon-juice-laced palate is tangy, fresh and very sharp with nearly singeing acidity.

title: Pedroncelli 2018 Signature Selection Dry Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Cranberry in color, this tastes of peach fuzz and strawberry, the texture creamy and lushly rich. Light bodied, it has a subtle intensity on the finish.

title: Rotta 2016 Super Red (Paso Robles)
description: Very extracted aromas of blackberry, plum sauce, cola and earth show on the nose of this blend of 56% Zinfandel and 44% Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate is extremely dense with flavors of blackberry and anise, all a bit heavy.

title: Scholar and Mason 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is nicely priced, offering baking-spice and smoky oak around a simple core of structure and firm tannin. The flavors are in balance and the wine ultimately easy to enjoy, with an understated elegance that should appeal.

title: The Debate 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: An impressive showcase of the famous Oakville vineyard, this delivers weighty, complex notions of tobacco, cedar and pencil shavings, savory and robust elements that find companionship in complementary red cherry, currant and cassis. With lasting breadth and weight, it will do well with more time in the cellar. Enjoy 2025–2035.

title: Les Belles Collines 2014 Les Sommets Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a complex, beautiful red wine, blended with a handful of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Aged two years in all new French oak, it shows a full embrace of dark cherry, currant and cedar flavors. Classic, boldly textured and well integrated, it is structured and ready for the cellar. Best 2024–2031.

title: Little Giant 2015 Lamonica Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an impressively memorable wine, perfumed in violet and sage tones, with a persistence of blackberry and cocoa powder that feels seamless and perfectly integrated on the palate. Accents of bright acidity and graphite complement the richer, concentrated aspects, finding rhythm in the glass.

title: Waits-Mast 2015 Mariah Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Aromas of earth, new oak and new leather give this fascinating wine a great start, while rich, warm flavors of ripe black cherry, baking spice, cedar and rhubarb follow on the palate. It's oaky and spicy in a good way, and is fully balanced by nervy fruit and light tannins for a fresh texture and lingering finish.

title: Cobb 2017 Vonarburg Vineyard Riesling (Anderson Valley)
description: A dry, light and crisp style of white that will impress and delight, this delivers elegant flavors of waxy apple, peach and wet stone around bristling integrated acidity. Lovely and lithe, it unfurls slowly in the glass, opening up bouquets of white flowers and lychee as it goes.

title: Falcone NV Annate IX Red (Paso Robles)
description: This nonvintage solera-style blend of Petite Sirah, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is weighty, rich, complex and simply delicious, starting with aromas of espresso bean, toasted bread and black currant. The expressive palate is smooth in texture and booming with flavors of black cherry, smoked meat and anise-laced baking spices.

title: Schramsberg 2010 J. Schram Rosé (North Coast)
description: Mellow and luxurious, this complex and complete sparkling wine exudes aromas of ginger and cinnamon, while flavors of peach, apricot and persimmon fill the mouth and linger nicely on the finish. It has tiny, slow bubbles and matches a sense of energy from acidity with the richness from long aging in the winery's caves.

title: Cobb 2016 Emmaline Ann Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy and stemmy, this opens in an effusive bouquet of wild strawberry and lavender, with a forest of pine encircling the aromas. Delicately built, with a strong underlying foundation of firm tannin, it buzzes on the palate in white pepper, nutmeg and crisp tangerine.

title: Cobb 2016 Jack Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a cold, steep site, Jack Hill is fleshy, spicy and integrated, brimming promisingly with a wealth of dark cherry, strawberry and blood orange. A tease of cola and cardamom give it a powerful middle of nuanced richness around a body of firm integrated tannin.

title: Benovia 2015 Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: Dry and quietly fruity, this new offering from the producer combines half estate-grown Chardonnay and half estate-grown Pinot Noir into a rich, creamy whole that's brimming in red apple, tangerine and brioche. Velvety in texture, it offers plenty of robust body around a structure of balanced acidity and lasting mousse.

title: Lucia 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This appellation blend is a compelling show of the region, starting with fresh and lively aromas of black cherry, raspberry, loamy soil and crushed slate. The earthy quality is prominent on the palate, but backed up by deep accents of boysenberry and cardamom.

title: Terminim 2017 Cepages d'Or Alder Springs Vineyard Marsanne-Roussanne (Mendocino County)
description: A collaboration between Donald Patz and François Villard of the northern Rhône, this is built around spectacular fruit from the great Alder Springs, combining 66% Marsanne and 34% Roussanne. Up-front oak leads to lively floral aromatics and steely, integrated acidity—the flavors an impressive melding of peach and pineapple.

title: V. Vineyards 2015 Audace Ruby Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Winemaker Jean Hoefliger crafts a beautiful statement of refined structure and grace in this wine, highlighting pencil shavings, clove and firm, substantial tannin weight. Supportive acidity provides a contrasting brightness that refreshes the palate against tart red currant and cassis. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Axr 2015 Madrone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy in cherry and cassis, this provides moderate ripeness and resplendent acidity, with an exuberant expression of style and grace that makes it enjoyable in the glass. Firm tannin structure gives it complexity for days and a lightness of being that is hard to resist.

title: Calla Lily 2014 Audax Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with small amounts of Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this wine succeeds in its rich coming-together of plum, lavender and black-currant flavors, the palate densely packed in fruit and tight-grained tannin. Effusively perfumed in oak and cedar, it is nicely integrated and shows great complexity.

title: Carlisle 2016 Limerick Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Structured, integrated and succulent, this is a standout wine from a standout site. It is floral on the nose, with bright violet and cherry liqueur. The palate continues the theme in blueberry, cassis and dark chocolate—powerfully built with fresh bolts of acidity throughout.

title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy, herbal and delightfully seasoned in sweet and savory spice tones, this bold, seductive wine is structured in firm tannins and integrated acidity. Flavors of cranberry, rhubarb and tangerine give the palate a tart, bright and refreshing sensibility, with an ending bouquet of rose and cola.
designation: Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard

title: Holly's Hill 2016 Stem Inclusion Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: One of the most concentrated and pure expressions of the varietal available, this stunner from the Sierra Foothills region gushes black cherries and blackberries in the aroma and coats the taste buds with more ripe, gorgeous cherry and berry nuances. The wine is layered, concentrated, full bodied, deep and lingering.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 El Diablo Vineyard Grenache (Russian River Valley)
description: Fermented 40% whole cluster and then given time to age in neutral barrels, this is a brawny, exotic and boldly flavorful wine. Black licorice, grilled meat and baked strawberry and cherry give it a complex lift of intrigue and succulence. The tannins are firmly structured and supportive.

title: MacRostie 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This has pretty opening aromatics of cinnamon and nutmeg embroiled in rose and lavender, a bright, enticing and exotic beginning to a seamless experience. Salty oak, tea and Asian spice rub up against rhubarb and pomegranate freshness that helps support silky tannins.

title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Heritage Clones Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is made entirely from the Calera clone. Bold, beautiful and substantially structured, it delights in hefty layers of blue and red berry, salt, leather and oak. The palate is balanced, with plenty of grip. Enjoy 2026–2031.
designation: Year of the Monkey Heritage Clones Single Vineyard

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a seamless, Old World and classic white, integrated in salty oak with a beautiful opening nose of lemon rind. Lifted, persistent acidity gives it focus and freshness, as a taste of briny oyster shell, lemongrass and Asian spice mingle around well-integrated thoughtful oak. This is a beautiful wine.

title: The Vineyard House 2016 Chardonnay (Oakville)
description: This is a truly lovely and lush white wine, barrel-aged 10 months in new French oak and made in an elegant style. A creamy golden nose of nutmeg, vanilla and crème brûlée follows a voluptuous thread of hazelnut and anise, finishing gracefully with structure and textured acidity.

title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Ten Oaks Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a block planted entirely to the earthy, elegant Pommard clone, and surrounded by the oaks for which it's named, this is a powerhouse wine that is structured and complex. Cherry and cranberry notes are dipped in dried herb and nutmeg on the palate, with balanced acidity lending support. Enjoy 2026–2031.
designation: Year of the Monkey Ten Oaks Single Vineyard

title: Stewart 2016 Nomad Beckstoffer Bourn Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a rich, luxurious and rounded red, from a site in St. Helena. Sultry, seductive dark cherry, clove, pencil and tobacco complement each other around a velvety smooth texture and tension of tannin that supports an underlying voluptuousness of blueberry pie and chocolate.

title: Benom 2016 Origin Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling from a new label by the French-born Fabre brothers is very dark in the glass and shows thick, luscious aromas of black plum, concentrated violets, mocha, minty cola and leather. It's soft and supple on the palate, where chalky tannins presents intense black-currant, black-pepper and elegantly herbal flavors.

title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Angel Camp Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Warm, rich and generous, this beautifully ripe and well-oaked wine floods the senses with aromas of strawberry, red plum and red cherry, along with hints of cinnamon and clove. The palate is full bodied, flavorful and layered.
designation: Year of the Monkey Angel Camp Single Vineyard

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Docker Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This is a bold, concentrated yet tangy wine that still manages to carry a senese of elegance. Vivid, dramatic and focused fruit aromas and flavors give it a big presence, while firm acidity and moderate tannins provide an almost electric texture. Best after 2023.

title: Desparada 2016 Niobe White Hawk Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Freshly pressed blackberry and elderberry aromas are lifted by elderflower, white pepper and rosemary blossoms on the nose of this fresh single-vineyard expression. The palate is tightly woven yet allows flavors of roasted black plum, black currant, black cherry and fig to arise alongside savory smoke and pretty floral touches.

title: Desparada 2016 Suitor Red (California)
description: A blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 36% Sangiovese and 4% Cabernet Franc from six Central Coast vineyards, this bottling shows intense fruit and hearty spice on the nose, including black cherry, mace and mocha aromas. Juicy black-currant flavors are spiced by cocoa and tart black raspberry freshness on the high-acid palate.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Zio Tony Ranch Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: From a relatively cool-climate site, this wine is dark and inky with fistfuls of earthy forest floor, grilled meat and wild game. Sanguine, it tastes of iron and dried herb, grippy with undeniable underlying brightness and beautiful shocks of white pepper.

title: Stewart 2016 Nomad Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Densely textured and robust in black cherry compote and plum, this is a blockbuster, age-worthy red from the Oakville site, its tannins forceful and youthfully grippy. Nutmeg, cedar and clove season the rich fruit and toasted oak. Enjoy 2021–2030.

title: Herman Story 2016 Casual Encounters Red (California)
description: Russell From's wines showcase the rich style that's made Paso Robles famous, and this blend of 37% Syrah, 28% Grenache, 25% Mourvèdre and 10% Tannat is a great example. Smoky aromas of black plum, boysenberry, charred wood and tar lead into a chocolate-laced palate of roasted blackberry and plum jelly dusted with smoked beef, teriyaki and a butterscotch finish.

title: Longoria 2015 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of red currant and boysenberry meet with wet slate, forest moss and damp herbs on the nose of this bottling from Rick Longoria's estate vineyard. There are tons of sagebrush, potpourri and dried rose petals on the sip, with floral and tea leaf flavors playing against the fresh red-fruit core.

title: ONX 2016 Reckoning Red (Templeton Gap District)
description: This blend of 58% Syrah, 18% Malbec, 10% Grenache, 9% Mourvèdre, 4% Petite Sirah and 1% Viognier shows pungent aromas of charred black plum, mesquite, candied violet, roasted pork and cola spice. The palate is rich and thick yet intense and zippy in acid, offering flavors of dark fruit and slate-driven minerality.

title: Ramey 2015 Pedregal Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Cofermented with 11% Petit Verdot, this is a serious, classically made wine from the generous appellation, Old World in its grippy structure and full embrace of cedar, pencil shavings and dried herb. Clove and peppercorn provide additional spice around a length of firm, integrated tannin and oak, finishing in a sanguine element of meat. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Thomas Fogarty 2016 Damiana Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From a vineyard planted in 1978, this bottling starts off quite subtle, with white flowers, lemon rinds, nectarine and wet white-rock aromas. The palate is extremely tense and chalky, with white flower, Asian pear and a light brush of vanilla. Drink now through 2036.

title: Three Sticks 2016 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the producer's estate vineyard, this wine offers flavors of white flowers, Meyer lemon, melon and mineral that mingle effortlessly on the medium-bodied palate. Beautifully layered and balanced, it lingers in tones of nutmeg, crushed rock and lemongrass.

title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a delicious, rich and exotic wine that shows an earthy slant to its generous, complex fruit flavors. Black cherry, raspberry and fig aromas grace the nose, while just-ripe notes of red cherry and rhubarb touch the palate. It is full bodied, smooth and mouthfilling, but counterpointed nicely by moderate tannins and acidity.
designation: Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Canfield Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy mushroom, forest and crushed rock tones open this lovely wine, which features focused acidity and plenty of tension on the palate. A lengthy floral expression lingers beneath the surface.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Las Piedras Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Thick and richly built with bright red fruit, this has integrated tannin and oak. A touch of grip rides around the edges of the fruit and clove spice, which are nuanced in layers of black licorice, blueberry and cassis. Full bodied, the wine has a wealth of minerality at its core.

title: Clendenen Family 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: A blend of Jim Clendenen's vineyards at Rancho La Cuna and Le Bon Climat, this extra-bottle-aged beauty is a showstopper, starting with aromas of roast pork in a cranberry-mulberry sauce, hickory smoke, star anise, curry and crushed slate. Intense but not biting acid pops right away on the sip, delivering deep sour-cherry, licorice and chai-spice flavors.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Smooth and grippy, this wine offers a beautiful undercurrent of balanced bright acidity, which lifts the richness of the fruit to new levels. Blueberry, black cherry and graphite combine with ease around powerful dusty tannin and toasted oak.

title: Barden 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is the first time that Doug Margerum has parsed out a single-vineyard expression from his Sta. Rita Hills blend for this label, and it's easy to see why. On the nose, sagebrush and blackberry converge with gamy meats, while the extremely zippy palate offers black-raspberry, lavender, white-pepper and duck-fat flavors.

title: Chimney Rock 2015 Clone 7 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Plush, lengthy and well integrated, this is a complex exotic mix of black licorice, leather, meat and plum. Made from one of the warmest parts of the vineyard, it has robust tannin structure and tension, finishing in a burst of clove and pepper.

title: Margerum 2016 M5 Reserve Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 44% Grenache, 36% Syrah, 12% Mourvèdre, 5% Counoise and 3% Cinsaut marinates together in 2,000-liter French foudres, a process that delivers elegant aromas of black plum, star anise, gingerbread, peppercorn and wet slate. Those same flavors dominate the palate, where a compelling tannic tension and lingering acidity complete a beautiful picture.

title: Migration 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Concentrated black cherry and dark-hued rose petals meet with French toast and bacon aromas on the inviting and rich nose of this bottling by the Duckhorn family of wines. The palate is approachable with mulberry and alpine-strawberry flavors, dusted with pepper and strong violet character.

title: Gambal + Work 2016 Bentrock Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
