description: Clean and bright aromas of sharp lemon, crushed chalk and lightly toasted almond are very reminiscent of Alex Gambal's bottlings from Burgundy on the nose of this promising collaboration project with Peter Work of Ampelos Cellars. There is phenomenal tension to the palate, with tightly woven citrus, chalk and seared nectarine flavors.

title: Kenzo Estate 2015 Rindo Estate Bottled Red (Napa Valley)
description: A woody and herbal nose follows through to the structured, rich palate, along with sage and cedar. Black cherry and currant define the flavors, while toasted oak lends support. The blend is 47% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc, 6% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Lynmar 2016 Old Vines Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From vines planted in 1974, this vine-designate is spicy, savory and rocky in mineral content, with a broadly lush palate that's succulent in texture. Immensely pleasurable and appealing, it has an exuberance of fruit and spice.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Sunshine Valley Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: This Oak Knoll wine is bright, integrated, tamed in tannin and juicy. Gorgeous inviting aromatics make an immediate statement, opening the door for a stage of animated blueberry, blackberry and cassis. The texture is complex but supple and smooth.

title: Au Bon Climat 2015 Nuits-Blanches au Bouge Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rich aromas of sandalwood, cinnamon, brioche French toast, vanilla and nutmeg make for a lush and attention-grabbing entry to this bottling. There's great cohesion of those spices on the palate, alongside a bright lemony streak that cuts through the white peach and Marcona almond flavors.

title: Big Basin 2016 Alfaro Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Pungent amounts of cinnamon, raspberry, wet thyme and dill show on the brilliant nose of this cool-climate, 100% whole cluster bottling by Bradley Brown. It's tart and tightly wound on the palate like a ready-to-pluck instrument, combining fresh and bright red-fruit flavors with forest-floor spice.

title: Calera 2015 Mills Vineyard Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)
description: Less than one-third of a ton per acre came off of this nearly 35-year-old vineyard from this drought-addled vintage, but what made it to bottle is quite amazing. Aromas of earthy thyme, sagebrush, wild black cherry and cocoa are layered and elegant. The palate is rich and thoroughly engaging in flavors of roasted tomato, mulberry and purple flower.

title: Lioco 2016 Saveria Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From a vineyard in Aptos just 4.5 miles from the ocean, this bottling begins with a bright fruity nose of alpine strawberry, red currants, dried thyme and lavender. The palate is fascinatingly floral, with rose petal, hibiscus and dried purple-flower flavors, wrapped around elegant cherry tones.

title: Big Basin 2016 Lester Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Bradley Brown goes 100% whole cluster for this single-vineyard expression with stunning results. Aromas of sagebrush, pine needles, damp thyme and wet soil meet with tart raspberry on the distinctive nose. The palate's tangy red fruit is lifted by tea leaves, wild green sage and zesty acidity that vibrates the tongue.

title: Kenzo Estate 2015 Murasaki Estate Bottled Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a peppery, spicy wine that has a leathery, full-bodied feel. Succulent waves of blueberry are velvety smooth on the palate, offering an impressive marriage between richness and balance. The blend is mostly Merlot, with Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot.

title: Lynmar 2016 Susanna's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Creamy stone-fruit and lemon-curd flavors provide an elegant richness to this coastal white. It is a bold, layered example of the variety that is well balanced by honed acidity.

title: Lynmar 2016 Old Wente Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Medium bodied and gritty on the palate, this has a richness of crème brûlée, the fruit a mix of quince and stone fruit. The acidity is emphasized in lingering layers of lime salt that remain vibrant on the finish.

title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Block Q Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: From vines planted in 1973, this excellent bottling is superfresh with aromas of raspberry as well as loads of dark rock minerality, from crushed slate and wet clay to smashed soapstone. That earthy minerality shows on the sip as well, alongside sagebrush, thyme, peppercorns and intense boysenberry flavors.

title: Pennyroyal Farm 2015 Jean Sheep Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Pure focused fruit aromas make this wine instantly appealing and it only gets better on the palate where hints of black tea and sour cherry meet a gorgeous and just-ripe black-cherry core. Vibrant acidity and light tannins give the wine a good nervy mouthfeel while the medium body contains layers of fruits and spices that continue flowing on the finish.

title: Pennyroyal Farm 2015 Monty In Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Floral aromas and concentrated black-cherry flavors mark this medium- to full-bodied wine as something distinctive. It smells of enticing rose petal and light lilac, tastes vivid and fruity but not overripe. Firm tannins and lively acidity lift the texture and while the good concentration leads to a lingering finish.

title: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This bottling relies heavily on dry-farmed bush vines planted in 1880, and their unique impact is on full display. Tightly wound blackberry aromas combine with tobacco leaf, loamy soil and dried meat on the nose. Elderflower and elderberry flavors show on the sip, which is firm with chalky tannins, bright with acid and elegantly layered. Drink now–2025.

title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Mount Eden Clone Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe aromas of Anjou pear and apple are leveled by clean lines of white rock minerality and wet river stones on the nose of this block-designated bottling. Tangy pear and lime flavors are fresh and zesty, with more wet rock touches in the background.
designation: Mount Eden Clone Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard

title: Three 2016 Evangelho Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: An exciting focus helps this wine stand out. It is full bodied, dry and well-concentrated, offering fresh black-cherry and cedar aromas, deep fruit flavors accented by light smoky peppery spices and a nicely firm texture that is moderately tannic. The complexity is partly due to 15% Petite Sirah in the blend, and aging in 35% new American and French oak barrels.

title: Ackerman 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Floral in a heady mix of cherry blossom and lavender, this light-styled red is sanguine in red currant and cassis. Firm tannins provide support without distraction, the oak equally integrated and subtle. Robust and ripe on the midpalate, the wine has a graceful finish.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is intensely flavored in apricot and mango, the aromatics floral and beautiful in jasmine. Fleshy and broad, it lingers in oak and elements of wild vanilla and baking spice.

title: Alta Colina 2016 Claudia Cuvée Marsanne (Adelaida District)
description: Very few producers make a good domestic Marsanne, and Alta Colina is now near the top of that list. Elegant aromas of white-fleshed fruit and lime rinds meet with honey dust on the nose. The palate is very tense with chalky texture and a lemony edge giving nuance to the broad yellow-apple, chamomile and honey-butter flavors.

title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Cougar Rock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy, dusty and mineral-driven, this wine is balanced and fresh on the palate—a study in contrasts between savory and the succulence of plum, dark cherry and just a touch of vanilla. Lush and fleshy, it retains plenty of acidity throughout.

title: Eden Rift 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)
description: The history of this remote property is fascinating, and more will come to love its story thanks to excellent wines such as this. Aromas of black cherry, loamy soils and tarragon lead into a palate redolent with sagebrush, marjoram and minty forest floor flavors. Wild strawberry and red currant touches provide fruity depth.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Hallberg Vineyard-Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny, juicy and lushly layered, this wine impresses in its full-bodied concentration of strawberry jam and biscuit flavors, with soft, approachable tannins. Black tea and a twist of clove give it an understated warmth and spicy persistence.

title: Giornata 2015 Luna Matta Vineyard Nebbiolo (Paso Robles)
description: Rose petals, crushed rocks, rounded red plum and nutmeg show strongly on the compelling nose of this bottling. It's very level on the palate, with tight tannins carrying bright fruit, rosewater and purple-flower flavors. With time, there will be smoother texture and more baking-spice flavors. Drink 2021–2035.

title: Jaffurs 2015 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied boysenberry, white pepper and thyme-crusted roast aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a seminal vineyard in the Los Alamos area. Tightly woven on the palate, the wine is very expressive and floral, with flavors of violet, elderflower and black-plum skins.

title: Ken Brown 2015 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lavish aromas of dried raspberry, black sage, hibiscus and boysenberry make for a generous entry to this bottling from a vineyard in the heart of the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate shows more herbal touches, including thyme, marjoram and tea leaves, giving depth to the boysenberry and white-pepper flavors.

title: La Follette 2016 Sun Chase Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Briny sea salt and lemon open this wine in a bright, acid-driven way—a statement that follows through in an integrated meaty substance. A lingering flavor of just-ripe white peach adds to the complexity and delicious succulence.

title: Lava Cap 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)
description: Both concentrated and luxurious, this wine is a classic that offers a broad range of enticing aromas, plenty of delicious fruit in the middle and a lingering finish. Clove, cedar and cassis fill the aromas, while ripe blueberry and black cherry flood the palate. A great balance of a velvety texture and soft tannins holds it all together.

title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Seven Leagues Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This is the winery's entry-level Pinot Noir, and it's a screaming deal. Aromas of black raspberry, hibiscus and purple flowers make for an elegant and pretty nose that's both high toned and approachable. Alpine strawberry and rose-petal flavors ride a crushed rock minerality and taut texture of fine tannins and bright acidity.

title: Sill Family 2015 Très Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: From the wilds of the appellation and blended with 16% Merlot and 9% Cabernet Franc, this wine is dense, layered and soft—a robust expression of chocolate, caramel and juicy blackberry. The oak is well integrated and supportive of polished powerful tannins.

title: Three 2016 Bigelow Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: This deep and concentrated wine seems to have a story to tell. Hints of rosemary and clove accent dark black-cherry and raspberry flavors that layer through the rich texture and seem to accelerate on the finish. It's an unusually expressive and complex Zinfandel that was aged in 37% new French and American barrels, and contains 14% Petite Sirah plus smaller amounts of Carignan and Alicante.

title: Zotovich 2016 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Loads of white pepper and caraway spice up the backdrop of black-plum paste on the awesome nose of this bottling. There is tons of zippy acidity on the palate, where snappy boysenberry and white-pepper spices deliver immense energy.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An aroma of smoked meat leads to fairly ripe blackberry flavors as this full-bodied wine fills the mouth with firm tannins. It is nicely dry and has a good, appetizing structure.

title: The Crusher 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Dressed up with flashy oak, this medium-bodied wine smells smoky and spicy, tastes oaky, beefy and dark, and has moderate tannins in the texture.

title: Clos LaChance 2016 Proprietary Red (Central Coast)
description: Concentrated and ripe aromas of cherry and blackberry are enhanced by a pinch of dried herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very extracted and ripe, with balsamic- laced red-fruit flavors and a hint of gamy meat.

title: Maddalena 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Lightly candied black-cherry aromas meet with a pinch of herbs, new leather and crushed pepper on the nose of this fairly extracted bottling. The palate is framed by chunky tannins and aggressive acidity, presenting tart blackberry and caramel flavors.

title: Neyers 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine has a metallic bite of salty oak with ample texture and weight to its subtle fruit. Asian pear, fig and melon figure into its moderately structured midpalate and lightly vanilla end.

title: Puma Road 2014 Clone 15 Vigna Monte Nero Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Poached apple, sharp citrus, toasted oak and a hint of popcorn show on the nose of this bottling. There are strong oak flavors on the palate alongside smoked-apple flesh.

title: Skyline Wines 2015 Artisan White (Central Coast)
description: There is a nutty, oxidative quality on the nose of this bottling, with aromas of crushed cashew, olive oil, warm sandstone and baked yogurt. The palate is oily but cut by bright flavors of lemon peel.

title: Killian 2015 Adam and Eve Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Nutty and subdued aromatically, this wine offers tropical fruit and a touch of reduction, the midpalate thick and densely ripe. The oak gives it a big imprint of memorable texture and voluptuousness.

title: emBRAZEN 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a fruity and straightforward profile. It's like peaches and honeydew melons in flavor and adds a hint of citrusy acidity to a mostly soft texture.

title: Hendry 2016 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Lemon, melon and accents of floral honeysuckle invite the palate into this rounded and moderately rich white wine, which has an earthy funkiness on the finish.

title: Josh Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a slightly earthy reductive aroma followed by green-apple and white-pepper flavors. Good acidity gives it a sense of vibrancy.

title: McManis 2017 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Estate Grown Barbera (California)
description: This wine has sweet and spicy aromas, oaky flavors and a firm, lightly tannic texture. Combined with strong acidity, the ample oak treatment makes the wine uneven on the finish.

title: Rombauer 2016 Zinfandel (California)
description: An aroma of smoked meat leads to very ripe, almost-sweet fruit flavors and plenty of oaky cedary cinnamony elements that give it a syrupy impression.

title: Grady Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine shows the softer side of the varietal. It has attractive black-plum and cherry aromas and flavors, a smooth texture and not much tannin.

title: Renwood 2016 Barbera (Amador County)
description: A smoky petrol aroma and a big tannic mouthfeel give a lot of drama to this full-bodied wine. It has flavors like dried cherries and cranberries, and a dry biting texture.

title: Sojourn 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Thick, layered and dense, with a sweetness to the oak, this white tastes of baked apple and caramel.

title: Truth 2016 Dark & Jammy Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has jammy ripe fruit flavors and a vanilla accent accompanied by moderate tannins and oaky undertones.

title: Geyser Peak 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has equally generous doses of ripe fruit and spicy oak in the aroma, and full body incorporating light tannins to provide some good texture.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2016 Whiplash Red (California)
description: This well-balanced, medium-bodied wine has an appealing mix of ripe fruit, baking spices and a touch of black pepper in the flavors. Light tannins and a hint of good acidity help the texture feel appetizing.

title: Solitary Cellars 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very ripe berries and cherries are dusted with vanilla powder on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very extracted with flavors of stewed berries, dried ginger and licorice.

title: Lula 2017 Costa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Alluring cedar, forest-floor and clove aromas lead to generous, jazzy red-cherry and sour cherry flavors in this finely balanced and complex wine. Light oak spices come through with more sipping while fine-grained tannins and delicate acidity lead to a lingering finish.

title: Benziger 2017 de Coelo Quintus Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From biodynamic grapes, this coastal-grown wine is light, tight and high-toned—a study in floral structure and grace. The tart, tangy flavors effuse in red cherry and pomegranate, with savory complements of tea, forest and sea spray. Medium bodied, it has weight and balance.

title: Sangiacomo 2017 Vi Maria Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a barrel selection of Amaral and Roberts Road vineyards, earthy and robustly built in cardamom, blood orange and baked plum. Juicy, fleshy and spicy throughout, it shows integrated oak and acidity with rich rounded layers of flavor and texture that impress in complexity and length. The name honors Vittorio and Maria Sangiacomo, the current generation's grandparents.

title: Merry Edwards 2017 Warrens' Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is named after two good friends of the producer with the first name Warren, Dutton and Arnold, as well as her late son. An inaugural release from a steep site in Green Valley, it explodes in a rich berry flavor and is exuberantly floral and earthy on the nose and palate. It has a stemmy intensity of baked fruit, forest and black tea that dances around firm, structured tannins. Enjoy 2025–2027.

title: Ancien 2016 Haynes Old Block Pinot Noir (Coombsville)
description: Silky and earthy, this lovely, balanced wine is savory in black tea and forest, with exotic nuances of blood orange and strawberry. Integrated in oak and tannin, it offers complexity within a highly appealing package, with a seamless finish.

title: Signorello 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 9% Merlot and 1% Malbec, this is a lush, richly styled red wine that is well made and integrated, with dense concentration and structure. It lingers in dark cherry, dried herb and oak, offering an Old World character amidst the hearty fruit.

title: Friedeman 2017 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Seductive, sultry red fruit is brightly arrayed against a backdrop of Asian spice in this complex, floral and earthy vineyard-designate. Savory more than fruity, it offers texture, tannin and unsuspecting weight within bright, refreshing waves of acidity.

title: MacRostie 2017 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Reductive and luxurious, this wine has plenty of layered texture and grip that gives it a powerful edge. Earthy mushroom, meat and spice accent bold jammy flavors of wild strawberry dipped in mint and tea. The voluptuous lushness is appealing.

title: Schramsberg 2013 Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Rosé Sparkling (Marin County)
description: This medium-bodied, elegant wine blends red-apple and red-cherry aromas with a nervy, brisk texture and flavors tinged with cinnamon. Made with 86% Pinot Noir and the remainder Chardonnay, 39% of the blend was barrel fermented. It feels smooth and brisk at the same time and has great overall balance. Best after 2022.

title: Uphill Vineyards 2014 Jimmy's Dream Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)
description: This seductive wine entices from the first whiff to the lingering finish. A potpourri of baking spices, cedar and mint infuses the aroma, while layered and delicious black cherry, raspberry and cassis flavors coat the palate. A posh and creamy texture is subtly reinforced by fine grained tannins. Best through 2025.

title: Mirabelle NV Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Sparkling (North Coast)
description: This elegant and plush wine is compelling from the first whiff of brioche through creamy, baking-spice flavors to a lingering delicate finish. A luxurious mouthfeel, good balance between crispness and ripeness and a profusion of flavor make it rival the quality of the parent brand, Schramsberg.

title: Epiphany 2016 Revelation Rodney's Vineyard Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dark black-currant and gingerbread spice aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard blend of 56% Grenache and 44% Syrah. It's rich and unctuous on the palate, with cassis and violet flavors. It is attention-grabbing yet also balanced by acidity and a subtle structure.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Black cherry, star anise and light licorice spice show on the nose of this bottling from the region's most historic vineyard. It's rich on the palate with black cherry, cola and vanilla flavors.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Rochioli-Allen Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Crisp acidity underscores bright flavors of lemon peel and tangerine in this complex wine. Textured, balanced and deceptively rich in a measured way, it has length and breadth as well as a touch of reduction, making it an irresistible expression of site.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine sees time in both stainless steel and oak. Flavors of pear, lemon and grapefruit are highlighted by fresh, focused acidity, with a round, smooth midpalate adding layers.

title: Testarossa 2016 Lone Oak Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Cohesive aromas of white peach, yellow-nectarine flesh, hazelnut and lemon rind make for a very complex nose on this bottling. The palate is grippy in texture yet full, with flavors of peach, mango and roasted apricot, served atop buttercream and topped with lemon zest.

title: Testarossa 2017 Tondre Grapefield Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a rich style of Chardonnay, full of buttercream on the nose, but also vibrant, with lime balm aromas. The palate's chalky grip warms up toward toasty, buttery flavors, layered with apple pastry and sea salt elements.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Seared black cherries, red and purple flowers, sage and vanilla make for a very compelling nose on this bottling of a single clone. The palate is fresh with snappy raspberry flavors and then broadens toward baking-spice flavors, proving quite lush and delicious.

title: Hall 2015 Exzellenz Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Complex and high toned, this wine is made from the producer's estate Sacrashe Vineyard in the hills of Rutherford. Bold, full bodied and savory, it shines in toasted oak, sage and currant, with a lasting richness of blackberry and cherry.

title: Walt 2017 The Corners Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This sleek wine shows a seamless melding of ripe, luscious fruit and just-right oak spice. It's instantly enjoyable for the casual consumer and has good balance, depth and length to please a wine geek. Full body, integrated tannins and subtle acidity provide very good structure.

title: Orsi Family 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an earthy, minty wine with deep elements of bay leaf and tea. The fruit is nuanced and light in style, a mix of rhubarb and cranberry.

title: Schug 2014 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is concentrated and viscous, with an herbal imprint and strong notes of oak and cedar. The fruit is tangy and sour in red currant, cherry and a hint of cinnamon.

title: Castle Rock 2018 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Aromas of apple blossom, oak, smoke and cream show on the nose of this bottling. There is a lightly taut texture on the front of the palate before waves of ripe pear and applesauce grow slightly sweet on the finish.

title: Devil's Advocate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a showy wine that exudes strong buttery oaky aromas, medium-intensity cassis and light herb flavors. It is medium to full bodied, smooth and almost soft in texture.

title: Hamilton Creek 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is thick meaty red wine that takes on a baked plum character accented in big tannin and oak.

title: Locke 2014 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)
description: This big and ripe-tasting wine is heavily scented with raisins and dried plums, and shows lots of dark-fruit flavors on a firm and tannic frame.

title: Neyers 2016 Neyers Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is planky in oak and thick in substance, the tannins adding weight and grip. The flavors commingle plum with clove and black pepper.

title: Pacific Redwood NV Organic Red (California)
description: Grapey, jammy and big in structure, this full-bodied wine lays black fruits and raisins over firm tannins. It tastes bold and big and dry, and needs a big protein to pair with. Made with no added sulfites.

title: Pedroncelli 2018 East Side Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Bubbly in acidity, this white sees no time in oak remaining crisp, clean and dry in the glass. Flavors of peach and vanilla provide a richness that contrasts well against the steely frame.

title: Wild Coyote 2017 Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: Extremely lush and extracted aromas of caramel, black plum sauce, kirsch and root beer are very aggressive on the ripe nose of this bottling. The palate is also heavy, with caramelized black cherry, vanilla and leather flavors, finishing with a flash of acid.

title: Calcareous 2016 ZSM Red (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of wood extract and black-cherry juice are quite ripe on the nose of this blend of 54% Zinfandel, 25% Syrah and 21% Merlot. It's rich and nearly sweet on the palate, with strawberry, red-currant and herb flavors.

title: Gnarly Head 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: On the lighter side for Cabernet, this wine shows lively fruit and herb aromas and fresh flavors that are well matched by medium body and very little tannin.

title: Heir Apparent 2016 Cellar Selection Red (Spring Mountain District)
description: Blending 85% Merlot with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc, this is big and bold in flavor, with lots of toasted oak to cradle the blackberry and cherry-jam richness. Hints of sage and pencil accent it well.

title: MooBuzz 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: There's a slightly sour hint of red-plum skins and a touch of gamy leather to the slightly funky nose of this bottling. The Old World character extends to the palate, where macerated plums and dank mushrooms meet with that gamy streak.

title: Sojourn 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an effervescent bottling, made from Pinot grown at several sites sourced for red wines by the producer. Good color gives way to a burst of citrus peel and strawberry dipped in herb, with a touch of sweetness that ultimately goes dry.

title: Sundry 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Boysenberry and red-fruit aromas mix with anise on the fruity nose of this bottling. The palate is very fruity, with flavors of blueberry gum and fennel frond.

title: Cupcake 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: The nose on this popular bottling is a bit muted, with hints of yellow apples, green-apple skins and chilled steel. The palate starts with tighter apple flavors before opening toward very ripe pineapple and pear flesh that grow somewhat sweet into the finish.

title: Pezzi King 2015 Serracino Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from vines over 100 years old, and blended with 15% Petite Sirah, this is peppery and leathery on the palate, with an extreme generosity of tannin that's hard to miss.

title: Saint Tryphon 2016 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a slightly sweet, smoky and seemingly manipulated wine, with a pronounced woodiness to the oak and an herbal quality that gives it limited dimension.

title: Wild Coyote 2017 Malbec (Adelaida District)
description: Very ripe and extracted aromas of black currant and vanilla make for a Port-like nose on this bottling. The palate is also syrupy with black-currant, brown-sugar and coffee flavors.

title: Naggiar 2016 Il Nonno Estate Reserve Red (Nevada County)
description: This medium-bodied wine has lots of fruit, light oak spices and a firm, lightly tannic texture. Raspberries and raisins are the key flavors and though almost sweet, they are balanced by good acidity and grippy tannins.

title: Oak Farm 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Full bodied and firm textured, this wine offers plenty of fruit flavor, light oak shadings from the use of 30% new oak barrels and a good grippy mouthfeel.

title: Precision Wine 2016 Navigator Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This spicy oaky wine is not quite sweet, but is packed full of strawberry jam, maple syrup and Maraschino cherry flavors that give it an exuberant, fruity personality. It has good fruit acidity and light tannins to add some textural counterpoint to the jamminess.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Black Label Nunes Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Barnyardy earth and leather combine around spicy, robust tannin and a wealth of full-bodied fruit. Black cherry and strawberry take on ripe bold richness that persist throughout the rich palate.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Purple Label Silver Pines Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Smoky oak and a hint of citrus combine in complementary ways in this earthy, rich and full-bodied red. Cherry-cola and vanilla flavors provide a burly fruity experience on the boldly built palate.

title: Sculpterra 2015 Maquette Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry and woody cedar aromas show strongly on the nose of this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 25% Merlot. It's quite thick and stiff on the palate, where the wood spice overtakes the dark-cherry fruit.

title: Sola 2015 Meritage (Paso Robles)
description: Inviting aromas of Bing cherries, star anise, mace, tobacco and wood spice show on the nose of this blend. There's a strong herbal kick on the earthy palate, where turned loam and red-cherry flavors arise.

title: Buttonwood Farm 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Earthy aromas of gravelly minerality, clay and damp wood meet with tart red currants on the nose of this lightly bodied Cab from a historic vineyard. There is a lot of herbal tension to the palate, which is fairly green and framed by tannins that still need smoothing out.

title: Castle Rock 2017 Cuvée Pinot Noir (California)
description: This warm, spicy wine has a good combination of ripe red and black-fruit and generous dashes of baking spices. It is full in body, tastes ripe and has a firm but smooth texture.

title: Cinnabar 2015 Mercury Rising Red (California)
description: Concentrated and fruity, this full-flavored wine shows bright berry aromas, deep and ripe blackberry flavors and a texture that has a good little bite of tannin.

title: Folie à Deux 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Robust on the palate, this wine opens in floral aromatics of jasmine and apple blossom. It follows flavorfully in Meyer lemon zest, tangerine and pineapple, combining firm structure with rounded approachability.

title: Inconceivable 2015 The Fog Prince Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Tangy red-cherry aromas are lifted by anise and nutmeg on the nose of this bottling, which features a whimsical but accurate geographic label. Bay leaf and thyme flavors give depth to the sharp pomegranate fruit flavors of the palate.

title: J. McClelland 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 14% Cabernet Franc, this succeeds in its light-bodied palate of red currant, cranberry and plum, with secondary characteristics of pencil shavings and graphite. The midpalate is thick and concentrated, finishing with elegance.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Ripe cherry aromas meet with cinnamon and sagebrush on the rustic yet approachable nose of this bottling. Tart red-fruit and turned earth flavors are framed by a clay-like texture on the palate.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The pine-forest aromas are strong in this bottling, with some blackberry, tobacco and eucalyptus also at play on the nose. Cedary, cigar-box flavors consume the palate, along with touches of blackberry and peppercorn.

title: Midnight 2014 Synnove Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: Candied blackberry, tangy black plum and cedar show on the nose of this single-variety Petit Verdot, which is a slowly growing category. Robust black-currant and violet flavors are juicy if somewhat simple on the palate.

title: Riaza 2014 Diablo Rojo Red (Clements Hills)
description: This is a very good, easy-drinking wine that smells and tastes generously fruity. It has a smooth and lightly tannic texture that will help it pair well with food. Graciano grapes made 74% of the blend, followed by Tempranillo, Grenache and Zinfandel in descending proportions.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Aromas of extracted kirsch and loamy soils show on the nose of this rich bottling. Ripe cherry, oak and nutmeg aromas are evident on the palate.

title: Sean Minor 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a smoky oaky wine with a touch of reduction that opens into a juicy approachable world of soft rich blueberry and plum. It offers good value with a light-bodied approach to ripeness.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Fedrick Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine opens in floral element of rose before unleashing smoky edges and a leathery texture. Inside its full-bodied concentration lies earthy oak and black-cherry vanilla.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Aromas of black raspberry sorbet, tarragon and peppercorn combine on the fresh nose of this bottling. The palate snaps with flavors of raspberry and dark pomegranate that ride zesty acidity and a chalky texture, with wild mint lingering in the background.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Estate Outland Ridge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a rich, complex and attractively layered wine that opens with baking spice and black cherry aromas. The palate brings mouthfilling and concentrated black-fruit flavors with lingering dried fruit and cinnamon characteristics. It's a big but well-mannered wine that will cap any occasion with style.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Zinfandel (San Francisco Bay)
description: Intense, opulent fruit flavors are nicely shaded by sophisticated oak spices in this full-bodied, well-balanced and simply delicious wine. Plump blackberry and cherry mingle with light baking-spice aromas, while the palate impression is rich and soothing. It's an ambitious wine that truly delivers.

title: De Loach 2016 Marin Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: Delicious and exotic fruit flavors light up this elegant, concentrated wine. Rhubarb, black-cherry and spiced plum scents are followed by equally generous fruit flavors and deft touches of spicy oak that add nuances of baking spices and black tea.

title: Fulcrum 2017 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Fleshy and richly layered in cherry and vanilla, this robust vineyard-designate shows a wealth of flavor and texture. Focused acidity and pretty aromatics lighten the power and tightness of the oak, making for a rewarding experience of balance and complexity.

title: Morgan 2017 Highland Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A strongly mineral kick of wet slate meets with apple peels, marmalade, toast and wool on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tense and taut with flavors of lime peel and kiwi, framed by a chalky minerality.

title: Rock Wall 2017 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Reductive in tar and diesel aromas up front, this intensely flavored and textured wine impresses on the palate in flavors of cinnamon, blueberry and blackberry, all laced in dark chocolate. From a field-blended site planted to 22 different varieties, the majority of them a century old, this finishes on accents of earth and leather.

title: Cline 2016 Big Break Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: All about ripeness, this flavorful full-bodied wine fairly oozes strawberry-jam and blackberry-syrup aromas, equally rich but not sweet flavors and a good firm structure of fine-grained tannins. Best through 2024.

title: Herencia 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Light in color, juicy and fleshy, this is a memorable wine, aromatic in cinnamon and cranberry-cherry. Tight chalky tannins give it a structure of integrated ripeness and texture, the fruit dotted in white pepper and clove.

title: Robert John 2016 RJV Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely in a varietal manner, this is a soft, structured and well-integrated wine, bursting in red and blue fruit, its power and weight in balance. Full bodied, it holds its concentration in soft pockets of rich complexity that impress.

title: Saintsbury 2017 Donnelly Creek Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Deep and delicious black-cherry aromas and flavors fill this full-bodied wine to the rim. It has a broad rich moderately tannic texture that nicely supports the big fruit flavors and attractive cinnamon and clove complexity.

title: Sanford 2015 La Entrada Single Block Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of Meyer lemon, wet gravel and buttercream hit all the touch points for an excellent Chardonnay. There is great tension on the palate, where a rounded Key lime flavor meets lemongrass and a touch of crème fraîche toward the finish.
designation: La Entrada Single Block Estate Grown

title: Inglenook 2016 Rubicon Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is an intriguingly feral, herbal and classically styled wine, dripping in sage, toasted oak and wrap-around tannin. Cranberry, clove and cassis form a tangle of nuanced, graceful flavor nestled within a core of impressive structure. This is one to put away for awhile; enjoy best 2026—2036.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2016 La Jumilla Paper Street Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: From the new Paper Street Vineyard, this blend of 80% Monastrell (which is probably Graciano) and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon is crisp and buoyant on the nose with lilac, lavender, acai and blackberry. The palate is framed by chiseled tannins and offers cassis and more acai flavors, with a light cola freshness.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Variations on a Clone, Op. 174 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This study of clone and site by Scott Sampler starts with aromas of boysenberry, turned earth, slate and new leather, along with a touch of fresh lilacs. The palate is dominated by crushed rocks and earth, with touches of savory seasoning salts, dried herbs and a backdrop of elderberry and sandy tannins.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Clone 337 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Francisco Bay)
description: This big but balanced wine has a wonderful black currant aroma, opulent spice and fruit flavors and a firm, moderately tannic texture. Focused on currant and black cherry on the palate, it shows mild oak accents of nutmeg and vanilla. It tastes pure and elegant, and should improve through at least 2025.

title: E16 2015 The West End Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: The generous cherry flavors of this full-bodied wine gain complexity as hints of clove, cedar and black tea mingle on the palate. It is big but very smooth and supple. Well integrated tannins and snappy acidity bring great balance. Best enjoyed through 2024.

title: Flanagan 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Tropically rich and weighty, this is well-made wine in a bold style, that's fresh, textured and integrated with toasted oak. Bright acidity gives it a foundation of lifted vibrancy that helps to tame the richer rounder fruit that finishes in orange peel.

title: Harney Lane 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This wine is big and buttery but also well balanced. It is layered and creamy in flavors of vanilla, pear tart and almond. An especially smooth and clinging mouthfeel helps the intricate fruit and spice notes linger on the finish.

title: Le Casque 2015 Sergent Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: So sweet but so well balanced, this is a gem of a dessert wine that hits all the right flavor notes and is polished to a tee. While luxuriously viscous and as rich as blackberry syrup, it has generous tannins and full body to keep it from being cloying. Black cherry, dark chocolate and baking spices make a wonderful mix.

title: Stonehedge 2015 Grand Reserve Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: Half made of Merlot, the other half a mix of Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a thick wine with mild structure, tasting of leather, tobacco and dark cherry. The finish is diluted and the nose slightly sweet.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2015 Solo Barrique Petit Verdot (South Coast)
description: Wet thyme, peppercorn and plum-skin aromas are a touch odd on the nose of this bottling. Flavors of menthol, pine oil and incense meet with more plum on the palate.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Savory beef-broth aromas and flavors give this otherwise fat and plummy wine a little edge, while full body and mild tannins make the mouthfeel broad and fairly soft.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 ReZerve Primitivo (Amador County)
description: A rather sharp raw-oak character pervades the aromas and flavors of this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. The structure and the grip are positives, but underlying berry flavors have a hard time competing with the oakiness.

title: Castle Rock 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (San Benito County)
description: Hickory smoke, rust and tart cranberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Smoky oak and cherry-wood flavors appear on the sip.

title: Hayes Valley 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This straightforward wine is medium-bodied, moderately fruity and has light earthy buttery accents.

title: Miro 2015 Silverwood Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)
description: This wine is earthy and herbal, with a brushy, dusty grip of tannic power that overwhelms the full-bodied palate.

title: Napa Highlands 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Cola and bark mark a wine of sizable tannins and black-cherry jam in this otherwise mild-mannered red.

title: Sera Fina 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows the rather pungent, herbaceous aspect of the grape variety from the first whiff of wet earth and chives to flavors that are tart and lean.

title: Bookshelf 2015 Vinehill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied wine has a medium-garnet color with a brownish rim, aromas of tamarind and black tea, and mature spicy cola and oak flavors. It's drinkable but out of the mainstream.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Carignane (Contra Costa County)
description: Smoky, charred wood aromas and flavors give this full-bodied wine a heavy oaky character. The smokiness dominates the blackberry flavors underneath and seems to add a touch of astringency to the texture.

title: Draxton 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This full-bodied red offers up-front fruit tones on the nose. It's harsh, bitter and a bit green on the palate.

title: Riaza 2017 Irreverent Garnacha Rosé (Clements Hills)
description: This wine offers a pinkish-copper color and candied-fruit aromas followed by rather sharp, smoked-meat flavors, a full body and an earthy finish.

title: Crush 8 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Grapefruit and herb flavors give this medium-bodied wine a close resemblance to Sauvignon Blanc. A greenish grassy aroma is followed by tangy citrus notes and a sweet-sour sensation.

title: Freelander 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This light-bodied wine offers piney, citrus aromas and lean green-apple flavors that make it an antidote for overly oaky Chardonnay. It is a simple and uncomplicated wine.

title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County)
description: This is earthy, leathery and aromatic in grilled mushroom, with sizable oak and tannin on offer. An herbal component lingers on the finish.

title: Kirkland Signature 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Tropical and brimming in green olive, this is a ripe round white with obtrusive acidity that could use more time to resolve.

title: Happy Camper 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This light-bodied wine has a flinty, matchstick aroma and rather lean flavors of vanilla and lemon custard.

title: Kenwood 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: High-pitched red fruit is met by shrill acidity in this value-minded red, its backbone grippy in tannin and woody oak. There's a taste of dill on the finish.

title: Slow Churn 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Flavors of vanilla and dried fig give a dessert-wine quality to this soft-textured and low-acid wine. It feels fat and tastes very oaky and unctuous.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Statuesque Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and dark aromas of cola, blueberry and fresh black raspberry sorbet show on the nose of this blend of 34% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Syrah and 33% Petite Sirah. There is a good tang of acid to the palate, where cooked red-fruit and dried sagebrush flavors arise.

title: Twisted Paso 2017 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Rose petals, sage, cranberry and cherry show on the nose of this likable wine. It hits the palate with some fat richness, but a sizzle of acid leads into flavors of red apple, melon, red cherry and star anise.

title: Brea 2016 La Estancia Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There is a strong oxidative streak to this wine, possibly due to the low sulfur use, as it shows smoked lemon, almond and cashew aromas on the nose. The palate is also nutty and rich, flavors of walnut and dried apple that ride a creamy mouthfeel.

title: Broken Earth 2016 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Smoke, concentrated blackberry and wet lava rock aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the eastside of Paso Robles. The palate is tightly wound with dried herb and fennel flavors, offering riper dark cassis on the finish.

title: Hahn 2017 SLH Pinot Gris (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Extremely light in the glass, this bottling shows tightly wound aromas of grapefruit blossoms, crushed chalk, tangerine pith, wet river stone and sliced pear. The palate offers rounded pear and Gravenstein apple flavors.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Stagecoach Vineyard Marsanne (Napa Valley)
description: With substantial ripeness and body, this white is blended with 15% Roussanne and was given 18 months in French oak, 30% of it new. Dark in color and viscous on the palate, it's intensely flavored in apricot and wet stone.

title: Martin Ray 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Floral and richly round in golden apple with a touch of nutmeg, this wine has texture and nuance within a light-bodied frame, the palate moderate in structure and complexity.

title: Mirassou 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Leafy aromas and red-fruit flavors dominate this reasonably ripe and rounded wine. It's medium to full in body, and has a smooth texture that's tightened by light tannins and firm acidity.

title: Puma Road 2014 Vigna Monte Nero Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a very rich and straightforward take on Pinot Noir from the Santa Lucia Highlands, starting with aromas of candied cherry and vanilla. The palate offers similar elements, proving ripe and accessible, though the age is starting to show.

title: Sextant 2016 Caverio Red (Paso Robles)
description: Rich and concentrated aromas of black cherry and licorice show quite strongly on the nose of this blend of 75% Grenache, 17% Syrah and 8% Mourvèdre. The palate shows a bit of a tangy side, with blackberry and peppercorn flavors.

title: Verde 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Broad aromas of poached pear, candied white melon, lychee and bubblegum show on the nose of this bottling. It's very clean on the palate with fleshy pineapple and tangerine-rind flavors.

title: High Valley Vineyard 2015 Barbera (High Valley)
description: This deeply colored, concentrated and lightly tannic wine combines tart red-cherry and sour cherry aromas with darker fruit flavors and full body. The texture is smooth but tightened by acidity.

title: Pomelo 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Appealing and refreshing, this medium-bodied wine combines bright and fresh citrus and apple aromas with crisp, fairly ripe fruit flavors and lively acidity for good balance.

title: Kunde 2017 Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Valley)
description: With 6% Chardonnay and 1% Gewürztraminer, this is a well-made white that shows pretty aromas of honeysuckle on the nose. Viscous on the palate, with elements of apricot, lime and stone, it has a creamy lushness within a balanced frame of fresh acidity.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2015 Cuvée Natalie Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Steely and simply structured, with a lemony core of bright flavor and sharp acidity, this is a light bodied and lightly ripe white that will appeal to fans of an understated style.

title: Renwood 2016 Grand Reserve Barbera (Amador County)
description: A rich, plummy aroma is followed by fresh berry flavors and sugarplum accents on a smooth texture. The wine is medium bodied, fresh and fruity.

title: Terra Valentine 2015 Petite Sirah (Spring Mountain District)
description: Made entirely from one variety, this is a showcase for the grape—a soft, robust and undeniably dense layering of full-bodied leather, blueberry and baked plum. Thick and rich, it shows moderate complexity and structure.

title: Avaler 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With nuanced oak and 5% Merlot, this is a value-driven wine, overdelivering for the price in its grasp of earthy, herbal character. Medium-bodied and elegant, it shows a simplicity of plum, cherry and clove spice.

title: Byington 2014 Byington Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Cranberry and raspberry aromas are lifted by savory smoke scents on the nose of this estate bottling. The palate is more concentrated and aggressive with flavors of cherry, plum and light sage, proving quite juicy and ripe.

title: Eberle 2016 Vineyard Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Broad aromas of caramelized red cherry and dried herbs make for a pleasantly savory entry to this bottling from the historic estate. There is a solid amount of herbal expression on the palate, where the dried oregano sets off the tangy black-plum flavors.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Grand Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of grainy oak, buttered toast, sea salt, pan-seared apples and a hint of white flowers show on the nose of this always classic and familiar wine. It's fairly viscous on the palate, where strong flavors of roasted apple, buttered toast and tangerine spray arise.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied wine shows dried fruit aromas, very ripe raisiny flavors, firm tannins and acidity, and a lingering tangy and tannic finish.

title: Fetzer NV Anthony's Hill Dark Bold Red (California)
description: Fascinating anise and clove flavors join stewed cherries in this unusually flavorful wine. It has medium body, soft tannins and an easygoing texture.

title: Freelander 2017 District One Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Earthy and oaky tones vie for attention in this deep-colored, full-bodied and firmly textured wine. It has deep moody flavors like clove, beef and coffee and good aspects of layering and complexity.

title: McManis 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is earthy but still delivers the fruit flavors. The nose has some new leather, barnyard and new oak tones, while the flavors evoke boysenberries and grape jam.

title: Naggiar 2017 Root 49 Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Full bodied and satisfying, this wine has a tasty combination of black-fruit aromas, rich and almost jammy berry flavors and a smooth, lightly tannic texture.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Bright and lively, this wine offers plenty of fruit flavors and refreshing acidity. It has citrus and green-apple flavors, a crisp mouthfeel and clean finish.

title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 Subterfuge Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 40% Merlot, 38% Malbec and 22% Cabernet Franc starts with an intriguing mix of dried cranberry and caramelized red fruits on the nose. The palate is spiced with nutmeg and clove, which lift the tangy red-currant fruits.

title: F2 Wines 2014 Sonetto Red (Los Olivos District)
description: There's a slight balsamic touch to the nose of this blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Merlot, with aromas of tangy strawberry, licorice candy and roasted black plum. The palate is also tangy, combining tart red fruit with dried herbs.

title: Joseph Carr 2015 Revelist Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a big, burly and robustly ripe wine, smoky in oak and leathery tannin. Plum, clove and cola mingle on the palate in dense waves of flavor.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Freshly pressed boysenberry, wet fennel, smoked wood and dried herbs show on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are well polished, allowing the bright red-fruit and cigar-box flavors to shine through.

title: Starmont 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This crisp white is grassy and herbal in pea shoots, with fresh fleshy layers of lemon peel that refresh the palate. Light in style and approach, it's well made and good value.

title: Steele 2017 Viognier (Lake County)
description: This fruity and generous wine shows peach aromas, apricot flavors, good crisp acidity and enough body to balance it. The texture is tangy and edgy and keeps the taste buds alert.

title: The Calling 2017 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is viscous and voluptuous up front with an oaky tannic midpalate of dense intensity. Heavy and unctuous, it has a salty tartness and subtle flavors of apple, pear and melon.

title: Brea 2016 Margarita Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Very shy aromas of dark-red fruits and wet crushed rocks show on the nose of this bottling. There is a fresh black-plum kick to the palate, which then verges into more dried territory of leather and tobacco leaf.

title: F2 Wines 2017 Europeo Great Oaks Vineyard Rosé (Los Olivos District)
description: Clean aromas of wet stone, peach, tangerine oil and light kirsch show on the nose of this pink wine made from Syrah grapes. It's a bit fat on the palate, where watermelon and Meyer lemon pith flavors are wrapped in a chalky structure.

title: Iron Horse 2016 Home Block Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This wine from a three-acre block of the producer's estate is delicately layered and light in body and ripeness, with quiet flavors of dark cherry and plum.

title: Seghesio 2017 Vermentino (Russian River Valley)
description: A longtime white for the Italian-influenced producer, this sings in dried lemon peel and petrol, with a floral aroma of white flower. Fresh and tart with a lightness on the palate in body and ripeness, it finishes in bitter lemon.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Blend 33 White (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of toast, Meyer lemon and pink grapefruit pith show on the well-balanced nose of this blend of 58% Marsanne and 42% Viognier. It's light and tight on the palate with high-toned citrus flavors and ripping acidity.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2014 Zinfandel (Suisun Valley)
description: Dried-fruit aromas and rich sweet-seeming fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine an almost syrupy character, while very soft acidity and low tannins contribute to the wine's unctuous style.

title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Softly textured and full bodied in richness and ripe concentration, this wine is woody and earthy, with a backbone of black currant, clove, black pepper and sizable grip.

title: B Cellars 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark-golden color gives way to a rich, rounded exploration of baked apple, nutmeg and toasted oak in this well-made vineyard-designate. The creamier, concentrated tones are given a lift of freshness from persistent acidity.

title: Bennett Lane 2015 Lynch Family Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Grippy black cherry and blackberry burst out of the entry of this full-bodied, richly concentrated wine, its palate lush, smooth and big-boned. Dried herb and a floral tease of rose round out the fruit-forward experience.

title: Blackbird Vineyards 2017 Dissonance Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Napa Valley)
description: Blending 85% Sauvignon Blanc with 15% Sémillon, this white offers a robust body weight and grip joined by length and breadth. Fig, lemon peel and quince provide fleshy fruit flavors complemented by wet stone and lingering texture.

title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 The Defector Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Light aromas of cranberry, candied strawberry and dried herbs make for a pleasant and interesting nose on this bottling. The palate combines cinnamon and sumac with red plums and more strawberries, going down much with much less drama than the dark espionage-themed label implies.

title: Kunde 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Oaky and a touch reduced, this wine offers a grip of texture and rich, round concentration. Baked apple and pear flavors are seasoned in tones of vanilla and butterscotch.

title: Matchbook 2017 Estate Bottled Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This medium-bodied wine is subtle on the nose, but opens up on the palate to rich fruit and spice flavors that coat the tongue. It is balanced toward the soft side, but with underling acidity to balance the richness.

title: McClean 2015 Simone Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe and candied strawberry aromas meet with nutmeg on the delicious nose of this bottling. There is a strong acidic tang to the palate, where macerated strawberry flavors feel quite fresh and young. It goes down easy.

title: Niner 2015 HH Reserve Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Shy on the nose at first, this bottling, which is cofermented with 10% Cabernet Franc and 6% Petit Verdot, shows dried dill and roasted fennel bulb on the nose, with a strawberry tone slowly emerging. Oregano and black pepper meet with red fruit, star anise and cinnamon on the palate, which is still young and needs more time to come into its own.

title: Oberon 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with nearly 18% Sauvignon Musque, this is fermented in both stainless steel and oak. Dried herb, lemon peel and peach shine along a thread of stony minerality and texture, the body balanced and impressively robust.

title: Olema 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This is wine well worth stockpiling, such a good deal it is for the price. Hearty creamy ripeness is balanced and complemented by bold robust stone fruit, baked apple and a lingering thread of stony mineral.

title: Saxon Brown 2015 Durell Vineyard Hayfield Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoked meat, tobacco and tea make for a robust, edgy experience in this block-designate from the famous site, the wine savory, thick and exotic in nature. Red-currant and cherry notes brighten its mood.

title: Saxon Brown 2015 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made in an earthy, austere style, this wine is intensely savory and spicy, with high-pitched acidity at its core. The fruit follows suit, a mélange of cranberry, pomegranate and blood orange, finishing in a balance of black tea and pepper.

title: Amici 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From a selection of vineyards in Oak Knoll, Yountville and St. Helena, this crisp white is floral and lemony, with moderate weight and breadth. It's made in a steely, straightforward style with an intensity that lingers on the finish.

title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Floral aromas of violet and cherry blossom drop into rich black-cherry and cocoa tones on the nose of this widely available bottling. The palate is juicy in black cherry and blackberry flavors, with accents of oak and cracked pepper, all framed by a chalky texture.

title: Anderson Conn Valley 2017 Sarah's Cuvée White (Napa Valley)
description: Dark gold in color, this wine is showy in oak, with a nutty core of richness and full-bodied flavor. It offers a wealth of green apple, lemon and lime on the lengthy palate.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2014 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: This mostly Pinot Noir-based sparkling wine contains 5% Pinot Meunier. It was given three years en tirage, resulting in a creamy mouthfeel and moderate acidity. It stays fresh and light in the glass, combining flavors of green apple, hazelnut and a squeeze of lemon.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Moses-Hall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a big-boned generously spiced vineyard-designate with sizable tannin weight and textured grit. Toasted oak supports dark cherry, mint and pomegranate flavors that are well-integrated and lengthy.

title: The Calling 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an intensely minty, earthy and clove-spiced wine, soft and velvety in texture. It shows a rounded body that feels ripe and rich, making this a real crowd-pleaser of a pour.

title: Grand Napa 2013 Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir, this has an impressive mousse that's light on its feet with bright acidity and plenty of crispness on the palate. Strawberry, cherry and tangerine mingle along a thread of elegance and balance.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Nun's Canyon Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Herbal and leathery, this impressive wine delights in aromas of white pepper, tar and meat. Robustly textured with full-bodied ripeness, it offers savory exoticism that's hard to resist. It was aged in 25% new French oak.

title: Opolo 2016 Reserve Collection Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Though known more as a Zinfandel house, this estate winery clearly is home to epic Syrah vines, as this bottling rocks the nose with clean nutmeg, roasted black fruit and savory char on the nose. The wine is lush and thick on the palate, with power and elegance, combining thick tannins and bright acid with smoked black-plum flavors.

title: Arrow & Branch 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a classically structured, delicious Bordeaux blend which allows 55% Cabernet Franc to take the lead, with 31% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot in support. Sanguine, herbal and elegant, it shows red currant, clove, cedar and pencil, with a lasting toasty note of dust and oak.

title: Hubba 2016 Carciofi Chardonnay (Santa Cruz County)
description: Fermented in new oak but aged in neutral, this single-vineyard expression from Dusty Road Vineyard offers aromas of honeysuckle, chalk and squeezed tangerine on the delicate and fresh nose. There is tons of grip to the sip, where exuberant citrus and stone-fruit flavors are bright and carried by racy acidity.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 #Pure Yum Syrah-Grenache (Sonoma County)
description: This expertly blends 67% Syrah with 33% Grenache into a blockbuster package of full-bodied flavor and balanced brightness, melding together sanguine meaty tones with an underlying richness of blueberry pie and graham cracker. Velvety smooth, it packs a memorably delicious punch.

title: Siduri 2017 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Strong aromas of black cherry paste and clove are made more elegant with smashed wet slate minerality on the nose of this wine. The palate is complex, with big and bright red fruits, white pepper and tarragon playing off of the earthy structure.

title: Timbre 2015 Supergroup Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This blend of fruit from Bien Nacido and Presqu'ile vineyards starts with aromas of pomegranate, mulberry, tangy plum and Earl Grey tea on the nose. More tea, dried mint and tarragon lift the palate through the background of richer red-plum and rose-petals flavors, all proving very delicate yet complex.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a juicy full-bodied white that is well balanced by crisp apple and orange flavors. Integrated tones of nutmeg and ginger offer support, while a lasting note of wet stone underlines a mineral component.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a fresh, vibrant and all-around high-toned white from the heart of the Olivet Lane District. It is full in weight and concentrated in welcoming teases of citrus pith, lemongrass and ginger.

title: Flambeaux 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with 5% each of Merlot and Malbec, this is an impressive, full-bodied red that displays a clove and cinnamon entry. Blackberry and black currant flavors are seamless on the palate, while a high-toned acidity comes to life on the red-fruit-driven finish.

title: Hahn 2016 SLH Gabrielle Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Aromas of vanilla bean, star anise and cinnamon are sprinkled atop black cherry and sweet woodsmoke on the lush nose of this bottling. The palate is broad and rich yet edged by a graphite minerality, offering flavors of black cherry and mocha.

title: Samuel Louis Smith 2017 Sandstone Terrace Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A beautiful shade of crimson-laced purple in the glass, this fresh bottling is loaded with aromas of wet slate, crushed granite, wet concrete, lavender, wisteria blossom and black plum on the nose. The bright and snappy palate shows rose, black raspberry and plum skin.

title: Samuel Louis Smith 2017 Spear Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tones of wet chalk, lime blossom and citrus pith make for an aromatic entry to this bottling. The palate shows orange skin, light oak and an intensely chalky minerality, clinging to the mouth with tang and structure. It is texturally complex but it goes down easy as well.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is such an impressive appellation-wide blend, combining several vineyard sites into a cohesive whole. Incredibly aromatic in rose and raspberry, the palate brings velvety layers of dark cherry and cinnamon, with integrated acidity keeping the balance.

title: Benom 2016 Les Deux Freres Red (Paso Robles)
description: Clean aromas of ripe red fruits, carnations and wet rocks make for an attention-grabbing entry to this blend of 50% Grenache, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon and 23% Tempranillo. The palate opens very tightly with grippy hints of lanolin and wood before smashed boysenberry flavors lead into a vanilla-kissed finish. Drink 2021–2026.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 St Peter's Church Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a favored site amongst Zin aficionados and for good reason. Earthy forest, tobacco and compost reside within a powerful frame of concentrated richness and complexity. Black pepper, licorice and black cherry come along, buoyant in sparkling acidity that refreshes and intrigues.

title: MCV 2016 Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and concentrated aromas of black currant and elderberry meet with smoke and lava rocks on the nose of this hearty but complex bottling by Matt Villard. The black-rock minerality extends to the palate, but it's more elegant than that, with touches of violet and lilac as well as strong acidity and firm tannins. Light char shows on the finish.

title: Noceto 2013 AX-1 Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: Nicely concentrated and ripe-tasting, this full-bodied wine is a standout. It shows great structure, wrapping good acidity and fine-grained tannins around red-cherry, raspberry, earth and new leather flavors. It's already been aging in the winery cellar, but should keep developing through 2024.

title: Noceto 2016 Dos Oakies Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Don't let the vineyard designation fool you. Rather than being doubly oaky, this nicely balanced wine tastes alive and electric, achieving intense flavors and a snappy, grippy texture at the same time. It blends cranberry, raspberry and red cherry with handsome oak spices and a savory dried mushroom accent. Firm tannins and good acidity create a lively mouthfeel. Best through 2024.

title: Peake Ranch 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This wine offers smooth aromas of red cherry, licorice and dried chaparral. It lands effortlessly on the palate, with an elegant yet expressive array of plush strawberry, red plum, sumac and cinnamon flavors.

title: D'Amante WIne Estate 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (El Pomar District)
description: Creamy and fat black-cherry aromas meet with wet clay and oak on the nose of this bottling. There's a pleasing swath of strawberry and candied cherry on the palate, which is kissed by oak and caramel.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Black-currant, black-plum, pencil shavings, wet clay and charred cedar aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Roasted berries, rose petal and cedar show on the palate, which remains a little young despite being four years old.

title: Korbel NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: This light and slightly sweet wine has effusive fruit-salad aromas, fresh and straightforward apple and citrus flavors and a good frothy texture. Its mix of grapes includes Chenin Blanc and French Colombard plus the classic Chardonnay and Pinot Noir.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe aromas of strawberry and black plum trend toward syrup but are lifted with purple-flower aromas. The violet-like palate is pleasant but really thick and nearly sweet.

title: Chalk Hill 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Nicely priced, this white opens in honeysuckle and orange blossom before evolving to offer dark oak and a rich round experience of tropical ripeness and toffee undertones. Smooth and simple, it's intensely bold.

title: emBRAZEN 2016 Red (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine made mostly from Merlot and Syrah grapes has a salty, meaty character in the aromas and flavors, moderate tannins and a good sense of richness in the texture.

title: Leaping Horse 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: An earthy aroma precedes vivid zingy citrus, and herb and butter flavors in this light to medium-bodied wine that has 10% Viognier blended in. It has good balance due to fresh acidity and will be a versatile wine for food pairing.

title: Simple Life 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A tempting aroma of ripe pears, melted butter and vanilla leads to ripe, almost sweet fruit and baking-spice flavors on a smooth soft texture. The wine is low in acidity and creamy in mouthfeel.

title: Theopolis 2016 Symphony (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Strong floral honeyed aromas and robust grapy flavors give this dry wine a big personality despite its light body. Lively acidity and a hint of tannin make the texture grippy.

title: Worthy 2012 Sophia's Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick, concentrated and highly ripe, this has small amounts of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Compact oak wraps around dark, dense flavors of plum and black currant before a simple finish closes things out.

title: J.R. Storey 2016 Untitled Gaddis Vineyard Old Vine Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)
description: This opens in a reduced note of diesel and tar, the midpalate tart and tangy in red fruit. Thick grippy tannins emphasize the weight and breadth of the experience.

title: Kenwood 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Peachy and robust in flavors of sweet melon, this wine has a moderate body weight and lifted acidity to buoy the integrated oak and lingering layers of vanilla.

title: McManis 2017 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a flinty, earthy aroma, spicy woody flavors and a hint of black pepper. Juicy raspberry and blackberry flavors reside at the core.

title: Campos 2016 Estate Barbera (Contra Costa County)
description: Attractive, mature aromatics and complex flavors make this medium-bodied wine worth trying. Notes of tea, leather and wood in the aromas are followed by dried cherry and raspberry flavors and a smooth texture.

title: Paris Valley Road 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed blackberry, wild herbs and burned chocolate aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a bright blackberry-jam flavor on the palate, along with decent herbal spices and medium acidity.

title: Pull 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Loads of crushed herbs and pencil shavings meet with dark fruit and charred wood on the nose of this bottling. There is an elegance to the woody character of the palate, which also shows touches of caramelized blackberry.

title: Puma Road 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of citrus tang, dried mango and cooked nuts. It's broad and ripe on the palate with apple-juice and lime-zest flavors.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2017 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Slightly off-kilter smoky and flinty aromas meet with toasted pecan on the nose of this bottling. It's much more tightly woven on the palate than expected, with sour lemon and orange flavors.

title: Charles B. Mitchell NV Cote Du Cosumnes Red (Fair Play)
description: Big fruit flavors and a firm structure of tannins and acidity give this full-bodied wine a nice bite. Plump black cherry and blackberry are wrapped in fine-grained tannins and accented with slightly smoky oak notes.

title: Dark Horse 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Medium in body and ripe in flavor, this wine is generous and fruity, offering a good nip of acidity and attractive apple and citrus notes. Small portions of Viognier and Gewürztraminer were blended in.

title: Flat Top Hills 2018 Rosé (California)
description: The roll-out of Flat Top Hills by the Mondavi family of the Charles Krug winery includes this rosé. Rich in color and flavor, this medium-bodied wine has a deep-pink appearance, fruity cherry-jam aroma and a delicious berry flavor.

title: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This buoyant, fresh and substantial wine bursts with concentrated flavors of black currant and black cherry. While full in weight, the texture has light tannins that give a slight, welcome grip on the palate.

title: Balletto 2016 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This balanced wine offers juicy tones of tropical fruit and lemon, with a floral undertone. The palate shows a mild grip, giving it tension and verve.
designation: Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Quite ripe and opulent, this full-bodied wine is mouthfilling, rich in fruit and spices, and shows an attractive, lingering finish. Concentration, layering and a creamy texture all add to its appeal.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Anise, guava and caramelized oak define this rich, densely layered wine, made from Sangiacomo Vineyard grapes. Concentrated in ripe tropical fruit it finds freshness on the long spice-tinged finish.

title: Husch 2017 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This wine tastes lively, nicely fruity and well concentrated without overt oak or too much body. Delicious, pure apple and pear flavors are supported by good acidity for a slightly reserved character that demands more sipping.

title: Rockpile Winery 2016 Rockpile Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rockpile)
description: Blended with smaller amounts of Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot, this mountainous wine is rounded in weight and texture, with a soft fruity approach that is balanced and rewarding. Firm tannins surround a core of brooding black fruit, earth and anise that lingers long on the finish.

title: Prima Materia NV Negroamaro
description: Gorgeous, generous and packed with delicious black-fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine is big and lovable. Blended from the 2016 and 2017 vintages, it shows blackberry, black-cherry and black-pepper flavors that are supported by a firm but not overly tannic texture.

title: Wolff 2017 Old VInes Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Plush aromas of white peach, pan-seared apple, light caramel and toasted hazelnuts show on the nose of this bottling, which delves into the richer style of Chardonnay. The palate is full and creamy, with flavors of roasted apple, peach and buttery toast, all balanced by zesty acid.

title: Cavaletti 2017 The 109 Mile Syrah (Ventura County)
description: The promise of Ventura County vineyards are strong in this bottling, which also includes 2% of both Grenache and Petite Sirah. Dark-blackberry, violet, lavender and white-pepper aromas lead into a palate where dried purple-flower flavors play with both tangy and fruity black-plum elements.

title: Maddalena 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
