description: This widely available wine offers a reliably rich and expressive Cabernet experience. Aromas of blistered red cherry, wet slate, cocoa, pepper and oregano lead into a palate where coffee and black plum dominate.

title: Marimar 2015 Don Miguel Vineyard Bonita's Hill Estate Grown Estate Bottled Unfiltered Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Named for the proprietor's youngest English Springer Spaniel, this wine has inviting aromas of white flower, coconut and toasty oak. The palate is succulent in fresh pear, apple and nutmeg, with integrated oak and lingering earthiness.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Bonita's Hill Estate Grown Estate Bottled Unfiltered

title: Murrieta's Well 2017 The Spur Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Wonderful baking-spice aromas, and ripe, jammy blackberry flavors drench this full-bodied wine from first whiff to the lingering finish. It is light in terms of tannins, but otherwise generous and packed with flavor.

title: Easton 2016 E Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Aromas of menthol and cedar give a nice twist to this full-bodied and firm-textured estate-grown wine while dark cherry and blackberry bring a satisfying richness to the palate.

title: Decroux 2017 Rosemary's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Rich aromas of black cherry meet with tangy purple fruits on the nose of this bottling from a historic vineyard owned by the Talley family. Strong herb flavors of thyme, oregano and marjoram meet with slightly sour berry, lavender and violet on the palate.

title: Imagery 2017 White Burgundy White (North Coast)
description: This big, broad and indulgent wine overflows with honey, nut and butter aromas, and is packed with lush peach, vanilla and honeydew-melon flavors. It drenches the palate with full body and a near-sweetness that lingers on the finish. It is made from Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Meunier.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 Arcadia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Lengthy, textured and robustly concentrated, this is beautiful white wine, juicy and floral in equal measure. Flavors lean into apple, pear and peach, with accents of jasmine and nutmeg that spread across a widely impressive palate.

title: Electra 2018 Moscato Rosé (California)
description: Quite sweet, but also quite tangy and well-balanced, this effusive, low-alcohol wine exudes lychee and floral aromas, offers honey and poached pear flavors and a rich texture buoyed by a touch of spritz and good acidity.

title: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine delivers a robustly rich experience of lengthy appeal. Blended with 12% Petite Sirah, among other varieties, and aged in American oak, the palate shows a wealth of black cherry, cassis and blackberry around toasted oak and a hint of clove.

title: Angeleno 2017 Zanja Madre Alonso Family Vineyard Red (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: This entire Angeleno project is a noble effort to shine a light on Los Angeles winemaking history and, more importantly, its potential. This rustic blend of 50% Tempranillo and 50% Grenache offers sagebrush, red currant and ripe cranberry on the nose, while the lighter-bodied palate shows wild cherry, dried plum, bay leaf and chaparral spice.

title: Villa San Juliette 2014 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Very extracted aromas of cassis and burnt caramel show on the nose of this bottling, which is already revealing its age. Plum-pudding flavors meet with a curiously zippy acidity on the palate.

title: Dutton Estate 2016 Jewell Block Vineyard Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny broad shouldered notions of earthy strawberry, rose petal and Asian baking spice define this medium-bodied wine from an estate-farmed block. It has plenty of tannic power.

title: Husch 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This is a nervy red wine that packs plenty of ripe fruit onto a taut frame of firm tannins and acidity. It has impressive grip on the palate, good cherry and cranberry flavors and a tannic finish.

title: Jigar 2014 Raja Cuvée Red (North Coast)
description: This is an attractive hearty dry wine with tasty blackberry and black-cherry flavors, and a firm layer of tannins to give it grip. Based on 53% Syrah, it should be good to pair with bold meat or pasta dishes.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Merlot (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a very strong woody element to the nose of this bottling, starting with cedar and grainy oak, as well as blackberry. The wood spice shows strong on the palate too, along with berry and caramel flavors.

title: Raymond 2014 Signature Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A soft entry leads a midpalate that's fully ripe and fleshy. Moderate tannins lend support to fruity notes of blueberry and black cherry dipped in dark chocolate.

title: SeaGlass 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Honeysuckle and pear-flesh aromas make for a slightly sweet aromatic entry to this bottling. The palate dries up with chalk and lime-rind flavors before ripe melon touches take over.

title: Sebastiani 2016 Zinfandel (North Coast)
description: This wine is overtly oaky in aroma and flavor and quite tannic to boot. Yet it has a sense of concentration and creaminess on the midpalate that redeems it for those who like their Zins brawny.

title: Sequoia Grove 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Jammy blueberry and cherry contrast against substantial smoky oak and leather in this medium-bodied smoothly rounded red. The tannin weight makes it seem heavier than it is.

title: Shooting Star 2016 Pinot Noir (Lake County)
description: This gentle medium-bodied wine is smooth, almost soft in texture. It offers red-fruit aromas and warm plummy flavors. It is engaging and easy to appreciate.

title: Steele 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Green Acres Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Light-bodied in approach, this is bright in black-cherry and strawberry flavors with a twist of orange helping to lift the acidity. A touch of cola spice softens the substantial tannin and toasted oak.

title: Volunteer 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy, round and lush in strong flavors of vanilla, baked apple and pear, this white is powerfully tannic and grippy as it finishes.

title: Line 39 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This full-bodied wine has an earthy savory slant and good appley flavors as a base. Aromas of mineral water and broth give way to rich-tasting fruit flavors and a rounded texture.

title: Burnside Road 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine has plenty of fruit flavor, light spicy oak accents and an almost silky texture that makes it easy to sip. It's a good choice to please a crowd.

title: Dark Horse 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Floral and citrus aromas get this wine off to a start before crisp grapefruit and herb flavors kick in on the palate. It is light in weight and has a fresh, tangy texture, giving it a good, crisp finish.

title: Domenica Amato 2016 Cherry Camp Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: Sanguine in red currant although accented a light seasoning of black pepper and clove, this wine is on the lighter side of ripeness and imparts a delicacy that appeals, but leaves the fruit subdued.

title: Figge 2014 Vaquero Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Concentrated aromas of black currant, blackberry syrup, licorice and dried herbs show on the nose of this blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. There is a zip to the sip and a flash of minerality, but the extracted and thick dark-fruit flavors and searing acidity dominate the experience.

title: Lewis Grace 2014 Estate Tempranillo (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine is heavy-handed with the oak, showing bold wood char and smoke aromas followed by smoky, black-peppery flavors that dominate the blackberry and cherry notes underneath. Firm tannins give a good tight mouthfeel.

title: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Viognier (California)
description: This is a medium-weight wine that balances subtle floral and orange-zest characters against suggestions of vanilla and butter that build on the palate and add richness on the finish.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 ReZerve Petite Sirah (Amador County)
description: This big, rigidly structured wine is full in body, firm with tannins, and shows blunt-edged blackberry flavors that are tightly wrapped by the texture.

title: Qupé 2017 Bien Nacido Hillside Estate Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Aromas of tar, gravel, baked soil and tightly wound boysenberry show on the nose. The palate is savory in tones of seaweed, squid ink and iodine yet rounded by elderberry and toasted sesame.

title: Byron Blatty 2016 Evenfall Red (Los Angeles County)
description: From what's consistently the most impressive producer using Los Angeles County fruit, this blend of 65% Tempranillo, 25% Petite Sirah and 10% Merlot is dense on the nose with black-currant and strong oak aromas. The palate is framed with dense, firm tannins, which deliver cassis, espresso, vanilla and caramel flavors.

title: Clos de la Tech 2014 Domaine Lois Louise Twisty Ridge Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Broad aromas of black raspberry jam, cola and Dr Pepper show on the nose of this bottling from high atop the appellation between the San Francisco Bay and the Pacific Ocean. Crushed slate, white-pepper and lavender flavors arise on the complex palate, giving depth to the boysenberry and mulberry flavors.

title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Oyster Ridge Red (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Concentrated aromas of blackberry jam, game, charred wood and cocoa show on the dynamic nose of this blend of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot, 9% Petit Verdot, 4% Cabernet Franc and 4% Malbec. The palate is hearty and meaty, offering flavors of blackberry syrup, woody incense and sandalwood, along with roasted beef.

title: Four Lanterns 2016 Fire Light Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Intense aromas of cassis, elderflower, lavender and peppercorn show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is lively and focused, with flavors of elderberry and more purple flowers riding a tense structure of dry tannins and bright acidity.

title: Four Lanterns 2017 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh, bright aromas of red cherries meet with red flowers, vanilla and dried chile pepper on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The palate offers a wide array of cherry, rosewater, cracked pepper and hints of spicy chiles. It goes great with a slight chill.

title: Bellante 2017 Watch Hill Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling manages to be both rich and cool-climate in expression, starting with aromas of boysenberry paste, roasted lamb and cracked pepper. The gamy quality extends throughout the palate, where smoked beef and blackberry jam flavors are lifted by lavender and pepper spice.

title: Bonny Doon 2018 Le Cigare Volant Cuvée Oumuamua Red (Monterey)
description: Randall Grahm's ever-evolving ideology shifted again for the new label and blend of this bottling, which includes 52% Grenache, 35% Cinsault and 13% Syrah. Aromas of plum, cracked pepper, crumpled carnations and dried mint lead into a bright, refreshing palate of hibiscus, anise and a curry-like spice.

title: Camins 2 Dreams 2017 Zotovich Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dense and dark aromas of black plum and black currant are lifted by tremendous florality on the nose of this bottling, which shows lavender and violet. The mouthfeel is tremendously chalky yet smooth, and a fresh acidity delivers those same floral flavors. Drink now through 2032.

title: Chanin 2017 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Subtle aromas of nectarine, lemon and pear flesh are pinpoint in precision and utterly pure on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tense in structure yet more generous in flavor that other Chanin bottlings, offering yellow pear, buttered apple, toasted oak and, on the finish, pale-caramel flavors.

title: Etude 2017 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A richer style, this bottling begins with black cherry, clove, star anise and opulent strawberry aromas on the nose. There's a chalky grip of sandy tannins on the young palate, which is ripe, with cherry sauce and white-pepper flavors yet cut by ample acidity.

title: Foxen 2017 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Roasted cherry and underripe raspberry are paired with ample hickory and oak smoke on the nose of this bottling. The wood is also prominent on the sip, but very well integrated on the whole, giving savory, grilled pork spice to flavors of red cherry and cranberry compote.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 Black Label Bassi Vineyard Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Mike Sinor goes big and powerful on this bottling, starting with aromas of black plum, dark cocoa, dark soil, nori wrap and soy sauce. The flavors are strong on the sip, with leather, black pepper and black fruit, yet the tannins, strong acidity and alcohol should preserve them all. Drink now through 2031.

title: Sangiacomo 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Combining estate grapes from both Roberts Road and Green Acres vineyards, this showcases the coast well in its firmness of structure and high-toned acidity. Starting off somewhat reduced on the nose, it opens slowly to reveal layers of Meyer lemon, melon and green apple, with a richer back note of baked peach.

title: Falcone 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling by John and Helen Falcone offers aromas of black cherry, roasted wood and savory cracked pepper. The palate combines black-cherry sauce with hickory-smoke flavors, wrapped in smooth polished tannins and a silky mouthfeel.

title: Testarossa 2016 Niclaire Pinot Noir (California)
description: This best-barrell bottling begins with baked black cherry, boysenberry pie and hints of caramel on the delicious nose. There is a refreshing tautness to the palate, where the dark-cherry fruits are held in check by a firm structure and nutmeg spice decorates the sip.

title: Denner 2017 Ditch Digger Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Plush aromas of rose water, plum, gingerbread spice and vanilla show on the nose of this blend of 55% Grenache, 20% Mourvèdre, 13% Syrah, 5% Cinsaut, 5% Graciano and 2% Carignan. The palate offers cola, black plum and pepper spice, sitting atop tannins that still require a bit of time to smooth out. Drink 2021–2032.

title: Sojourn 2017 Gap's Crown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Layered and floral with salty lemon flavor, this boldly crafted, medium-bodied white is textured and balanced. Green apple, honeysuckle and stone provide an array of lush, lasting flavor from the famous site.

title: Brecon Estate 2017 Reserve Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Aromas of black plum roasted over a pecan wood fire meet with packed purple flowers and light game on the nose of this bottling. Rich black currant and toasty oak flavors frame the palate, which is lifted by a savory hint of cracked black pepper.

title: Cedarville 2016 The Rules of Fair Play Red (Fair Play)
description: Smooth, layered and easy to like, this full-bodied blend of Zinfandel and Petite Sirah pairs moderate and tempting oak spices with fully ripe plum and raisin flavors. It has good richness and concentration that keep the baking spice and luxurious fruitiness echoing on the finish.

title: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the great Oakville estate is this spicy jammy red brimming in robust tannin and oak. A sweetness of cherry cordial, raspberry cream and vanilla make it richly rewarding on the textured, concentrated palate, with a lasting note of earthy gunpowder at the finish.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2016 Mis Pasos Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dense and dark in color, this blend of 34% Tempranillo, 33% Cabernet Sauvignon and 33% Syrah offers aromas of smoky black currant, loamy earth and oak on the nose. It's thick on the palate, with chunky yet pleasant tannins that will smooth with time, revealing strong flavors of cassis and intense violet.

title: Inman Family 2018 OGV Estate Endless Crush Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the producer's estate, this is an impressive wine, made in a light, crisp style that remains fresh and focused in acidity. Dry, it unfurls lovely layers of cranberry, cherry and orange peel alongside an undeniable mineral component that's a mix of wet stone and gravel. There are teases of rose petal along the way.
designation: OGV Estate Endless Crush Rosé of

title: Iron Horse 2014 Classic Vintage Brut Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: Flavors of apple skin and lemon verbena accent this wine's tart, high-toned acidity and restrained richness. A winery flagship, it presents as dry and textured, with a tight structure of finesse. It finishes on a hazelnut tone.

title: Joseph Phelps 2017 Freestone Vineyards Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Bright and fragrant in aromas of jasmine and lemon rind, this wine impresses in its textured minerality of wet stone and sea spray. Structured and complex, it shines in a light-bodied approach that never holds back in flavors of apple and pear.

title: McKahn 2017 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Enticing spicy oak notes take front and center in this deep and dark wine, and they're so gorgeous and complementary to the rich black-fruit flavors that it's definitely a good thing. Pencil shavings, tobacco, cedar and cocoa meet blueberry and blackberry on the palate while a dense layer of fine-grained tannins makes the mouthfeel big but soothing. Best through 2029.

title: Spear 2017 Block 13 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The block-selection bottlings from this property in the heart of the Sta. Rita Hills are head turners. This begins with light, bright and brilliant aromas of red cherry, lavender, rose and earthy herbs on the nose. There is a sagebrush snap to the palate, where wild thyme meets with sour cherry.

title: The Setting 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is soft and supple, with strong flavors of blueberry and mocha. Lush, rich and creamy on the palate, it has broad appeal and understated complexity.

title: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the Ulysses Vineyard in Oakville, and blended with small amounts of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this wine impresses in earthy sage, clove, cedar and tobacco. Old World in style, it has appealing aspects of crushed rock and structured tannin, with just a hint of dark chocolate and currant. Best 2025–2030.

title: Wayfarer 2017 Wayfarer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Smoky oak lies beneath thick tangy red fruit laced in high-toned acidity that takes on a quality of citrus in this bold and beautiful estate wine. Full bodied, with plenty of power, it displays remarkable grace that contrasts and complements the firm structured tannin.

title: Apriori 2016 Hicks Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Dark boysenberry and elderberry aromas make for a very concentrated nose on this bottling, which also shows a crushed stone and slate minerality. It is a denser style of Pinot Noir, full of dark yet not overripe fruit, offering black plum and more boysenberry as well as loamy soils, forest floor and earthy herbs on the palate, with a baking-spice finish.

title: J. Lohr 2015 Cuvée St. E Red (Paso Robles)
description: This homage Saint-Émilion shows rich aromas of black currant, toast and roasted wood on the nose. It's concentrated on the palate, carrying mouthfilling flavors of cassis, peppercorn, cocoa, espresso and herbs, all wrapped in smooth tannins.

title: Laurel Glen 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This classically styled wine has pretty opening aromas of black currant, cherry and berry, with a slight tease of vanilla and dark chocolate. High toned and supple on the palate, the tannins are well integrated and structured, with a good tension of acidity. Best 2020–2025.

title: Lucie 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has gorgeous aromatics of lavender and rose as it develops on the palate into puffy lush tannins. With a robust powerful backbone of body and oak, it offers strong flavors of cola, cherry and citrus, all seamlessly interwoven into a tapestry of bold intensity.

title: Moraga 2015 Bel Air Red (California)
description: From a vineyard that sits on the slopes of Bel Air, this bottling shows black cherry, roasted coffee and a hint of caramel on the ripe nose. Polished tannins and fresh acidity deliver flavors of blackberry jam, truffle, vanilla and caramel. Drink now–2035.

title: Parrish Family 2016 Silken Red (Paso Robles)
description: Lush aromas of vanilla bean, cola and black cherry are quite delicious on the nose of this blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Syrah and 20% Petite Sirah. The Silken name is right on, as the texture is silky indeed, with dense flavors of cocoa, caramel cream and cherry cola.

title: Samsara 2015 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a great entry-level look at cool climate Syrah. Aromas of seaweed, roasted rosemary and raw lamb flesh are intriguing. The palate is also very gamy, spiced by peppercorns, iodine and dried kelp, finishing on a rosemary lift.

title: Three Sticks 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy and thick, with tart, lively and vibrant red fruit along the lines of pomegranate, strawberry and rhubarb, this is a lovely, complex and delicious wine, with dazzling notes of forest floor, cola and nutmeg. It impresses end to end, with a moderate approach to ripeness that still packs a punch.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2017 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a purity of fruit and herb to Greg Brewer's style that shines through even on this appellation blend. Aromas of candied raspberry and strawberry pair with damp sage, pine oil and green peppercorn on the nose. The pristine palate's crisp pomegranate and fresh raspberry flavors are instantly cut by eucalyptus and green tobacco leaf.

title: Beekeeper Cellars 2016 Hidden Hillside Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 15% Petite Sirah, this is an impressive mingling of two high (1,500-feet in elevation) sites: Montecillo and Madrone Spring. Together, they form a worthy alliance of vanilla, plum and earthy black pepper, the sizable tannins structured and full of grace. Soft, thick and complex, it begs for more time; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Rich Vineyard Grenache (Ventura County)
description: This bottling shows immense promise for vineyard potential in Ventura County, which has struggled with Pierce's disease over the years. Aromas of rose water, red plum, light cherry and cinnamon spice lead into a palate that's fresh with flavors of pomegranate and rose petal, yet grippy with tannins.

title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a serious and sophisticated wine that is full bodied, luxurious in its pear and honey flavors and smooth and mouthcoating in texture. Tasty nuances of vanilla, toasted almonds, and lemon cream emerge on the palate and linger long on the finish.

title: Phillips Hill 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine has plenty of potent fruit and spice flavors but stays a bit restrained in terms of ripeness, which gives it a dry, appetizing appeal. An earthiness adds to the black-cherry and black-tea notes, while vivid acidity and moderate tannins give it a gripping texture.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 One Oak Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: Big and bold, this wine has heady aromas of cedar, toasted oak and cinnamon, followed by ripe and focused black-cherry flavors that have good depth. It is firmly tannic in a good way, has a velvety mouthfeel and sense of density and structure that will help it age. Best through 2023.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 San Andreas Fault Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Strawberry puree, raspberry, mint and sage adorn up-front acidity in this focused, fresh and delicately framed wine named for the infamous earthquake fault. Crisp and light as cucumber, it sizzles in earthy energy.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Freestone Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a coastal site, this shows fruity sandalwood and leathery earth around a grip of firm tannin and integrated oak. Complex and inviting, it offers beguiling flavors of blueberry and pomegranate that linger on the palate dusted in cardamom and nutmeg.

title: Markus Wine Co 2016 Zeitlos Red (Lodi)
description: This warm and full-bodied wine floods the palate with ripe plum, cherry and floral flavors. It has a mouthfilling texture, good sense of depth and a lingering, fruit-and-spice finish.

title: Renwood 2016 Jack Rabbit Flat Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Rich aromas and warm ripe mulled-fruit flavors meet moderate tannins and full body in this big winning wine. It has more structure than usual for the varietal and will pair well with a roast or braise.

title: Amici 2015 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From the great Occidental site comes this fleshy, full bodied and fulsome white, briny in citrus, sea spray and flinty stone. Fresh and meaty on the palate, it holds its weight and oak profile well, allowing plenty of room for green apple, Meyer lemon and banana flavors to shine.

title: Desparada 2017 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Sharp aromas of lime and underripe orange meet guava and wet concrete on the nose of this bottling, which was fermented in large barrels. There is great tension on the palate, where lime peel, lemon juice and chalky flavors reign.

title: Holdredge 2016 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a grainy, gritty and full-bodied wine from the Westside Road site. It is robust in tannin and flavor, offering tones of orange peel, rhubarb and strawberry while savory hints of tea and clove linger in the background.

title: Kukkula 2017 Vaalea White (Adelaida District)
description: Light and clean aromas of melon, tangerine peel, dried pineapple, poached pear and wet cement make for a compelling entry to this blend of 43% Grenache Blanc, 29% Roussanne and 28% Viognier. There is structural grip to the palate, where lemon-skin, white-flower and a subdued tropical-fruit flavors make for a taut and balanced sip.

title: Loubud 2016 Cebada Vineyards Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Just two barrels were made of this lovely sparkler, which shows bright aromas of Key lime, wet slate and a pinch of yeasty sourdough on the nose. The palate is very mineral-drive, with wet concrete flavors giving structure to the honeysuckle and lime blossom touches.

title: Monochrome 2017 Neither Here Nor There White (California)
description: A genre-bucking Santa Barbara County blend of 53% Sauvignon Blanc from McGinley Vineyard and 47% Chenin Blanc from Jurassic Park Vineyard, this bottling shows crisp green pear, bright sliced lime and ripe kiwi on the nose, but with a chalky edge. This palate offers pomelo pith, cucumber, lime and green-fleshed fruits.

title: Ojai 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Clean aromas of apple, pear, peach blossom and crushed white rocks show on the nose of this bottling by Adam Tolmach, whose career started in this vineyard many decades ago. There is strong chalky tension to the palate, where flavors of grapefruit peel and margarita-like lime mesh into green pear and lemon soda.

title: Ramey 2016 Claret (Napa Valley)
description: This blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with 26% Merlot, 12% Malbec, 8% Syrah and 2% Petit Verdot. Together, they interweave into a cohesive whole of clove, black pepper and meaty intensity and integrated oak. Soft and round on the palate, it pleases at an unbelievable price.

title: Rombauer 2017 Proprietor Selection Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Salty pretzel and oaky brine enliven robust spiciness and voluptuous body in this wine made from the best barrels of the producer's vineyard lots. Apple, pear and gingersnap are crafted to reflect a creamy mouthfeel of lush plushness.

title: Three Sticks 2016 Alana Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a new vineyard estate for the producer—a five-acre site near Sebastopol planted in 2010. Made in small amounts, it shows a tease of popcorn on the nose before opening into a world of anise, honey apple and graham cracker on the palate. The textured body is hearty and complex.

title: Tolosa 2017 Apex Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Inviting aromas of boysenberry and Bing cherry meet with a hint of smoke on the juicy yet savory nose of this bottling. The palate shows off lots of California sunshine, with ripe flavors of cherry chiffon and hickory-smoked meats.

title: Bell 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Heady in floral aromatics, this reserve-worthy wine is nutty and brimming in golden apple and pear flavor. Dense and fulsome on the palate, it has a robust body of balanced weight and complexity set within an undeniable beauty.

title: Europa Village 2016 Bolero Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)
description: Candied red-cherry and star anise aromas pop on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also simple but pleasant, with flavors of red cherry, strawberry and a hint of herbs, finishing with vanilla.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2018 Estate Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Sonoma Coast)
description: A taste of flint and stone complements the fruitier notions of apple, lemon and melon in this richly made white. From estate fruit, it takes on a creamy lushness on the palate that balances the lively acidity.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Dewitt Vineyard Petit Verdot (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Deep and dark aromas of blackberry meet with smoky wood aromas on this very extracted and quite ripe bottling. It's thick on the palate, with smooth, polished tannins presenting flavors of black cherry and violets.

title: McKinney 2017 Queen Charlemagne John Sebastiano Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of Asian pear flesh, honeysuckle and guava are soft and pillow-like on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is a tautness to the palate, where honeysuckle, apple blossom and juicy pear flavors linger.

title: Picayune 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa-Sonoma)
description: Floral components of grass and hay are complemented by light crisp flavors of grapefruit in this white, that is fermented and aged in both stainless steel and neutral oak. It's a delightfully enjoyable wine.

title: Smith Devereux 2016 Single Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is 100% varietal and offers classic varietal elements of cedar, sage and dried herb. The quiet fruit is a mix of red currant and plum, with a cool-climate elegance of integrated tannin.

title: Stressed Vines 2017 Indindoli Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light and bright in apple and stone fruit, with a tease of anise, this wine has a rich midpalate that balances out on the finish, the oak subdued and well tamed.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Woody's Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a good, traditional dinner-time wine made mostly from Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet France. It shows an appetizing structure and sound fruit flavors, along with a light touch of oaky complexity.

title: Atrea 2018 Skid Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: This is a restrained, light-bodied, crisp wine that emphasizes mineral and peach-skin flavors braced by good acidity. It's nicely refreshing and will be very versatile in food pairings.

title: Au Contraire 2017 Mighty Mouse Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Lush and expansively rich on the palate, this is a creamy wine defined in bold flavors of apple and pear. Weighty, it offers texture and complexity around a core of toasted oak.

title: Carol Shelton 2017 Monga Zin Lopez Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)
description: Intriguingly gamy aromas kick off the nose of this wine, with rustic touches of wild boar alongside blackberry and earthy herbs. Roasted lamb flavors meet with black-raspberry compote and wild thyme on the palate.
designation: Monga Zin Lopez Vineyard Old Vine

title: Dusty Nabor 2018 The Florist Viognier (Ballard Canyon)
description: Flinty aromas of struck stone and smoke meet with sour lemon peels on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tart, with apple and pear skins and grapefruit-juice flavors, proving pleasantly crisp.

title: Eberle 2017 Steinbeck Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Clean expressions of black currant and elderberry met with dried lilac, tar and game on the nose of this bottling from Gary Eberle, who introduced Syrah to the Central Coast. Bloody and gamy flavors consume the palate, giving intrigue to the black-plum and anise touches.

title: Hahn 2017 SLH Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Light grapefruit and Pink Lady apple aromas meet with a steely minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very subtle, with mellow hints of lemon blossom, lime juice and white peach in the background.

title: Hahn 2018 Rosé (Arroyo Seco)
description: Soft red-plum and riper red-currant aromas meet with a metallic minerality on the nose of this bottling. There is decent tension to the sip, where flavors of lemon rind cut through the broad plum, pluot and cooked melon tones.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Persing Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Roasted red cherries, dried oregano, black olive and smoky wood aromas start off this bottling. The structure is chunky with tannins, even this far into its life, and full of cherry, oak and mint flavors. It could use even more time.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Lighter aromas of purple flowers and boysenberry show on the nose of this bottling. Black-plum and lavender flavors arise on the very dry sip, where a chalky texture providing structure.

title: Liparita 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-made, fairly priced red, dusty in herbal sage and earthy tobacco. Broad tannins give it wide appeal and balanced concentration, finishing in clove and dark-chocolate notes.

title: Portola Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The wild landscape shows strongly on the nose of this bottling, with aromas of bay leaf, sagebrush and even rosemary against the dark-fruit tones. Macerated plum, cinnamon and sumac arise on the sip, with a pinch of white pepper. The wine's age is apparent, so drink up.

title: Quilt 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft, rich and round in dark cherry, brown sugar and vanilla-tinged oak, this is a wine made by Joe Wagner in a popular, likable style, full bodied and deeply concentrated.

title: Ram's Gate 2018 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Carneros)
description: Lushly textured, this is a layered, likable and well-balanced white, with well-constructed flavors of pear, fig, green apple and melon. Moderate acidity lifts the fruit and complex texture while preserving its soft supple nature.

title: William Hill Estate 2016 Winemaker's Series Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: Concentrated tones of dried herb, leather, red currant and cassis combine on the softly tannic palate. Smoky oak, meat and cedar add to the nuance.

title: Blackbird Vineyards 2016 Paramour Red (Napa Valley)
description: With 82% Cabernet Franc, 15% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, this blend is savory and herbal, with a thick sinewy texture. Clove, sage and currant provide a landscape of herbal flavor and complexity that works within the tart cherry fruit.

title: Armida 2017 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Flavors of juicy blackberry, cinnamon and chocolate mark this rich, viscous and concentrated wine, which is voluptuous in style and blended with 10% Petite Sirah. Undercurrents of black pepper and vanilla round out the experience.

title: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Musqué (Oak Knoll District)
description: Made from the Sauvignon Musque clone, this is an intensely viscous, floral and earthy white wine with lasting intensity. Its flavors build around lemon candy, apple and wet stone, finishing crisp and fresh.

title: Jeff Runquist 2017 Z R. Salman Vineyard Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: Big, spicy and almost sweet, this showy and full-bodied wine overflows with chocolate, baking-spice and blackberry syrup flavors. It's tannic, but the richness of the fruit and the sweet-seeming oak component soften it nicely.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Caramel, vanilla and crème brûlée richness rule the day in this lovely wine, which finds balance and grace on the midpalate. Pear, mango and a touch of matchstick and flint complement each other well within a tropical fantasyland of full body and flavor.

title: Starmont 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is fresh and focused, with mineral-laden stoniness and sumptuous stone fruit at its core. Lemon and lemongrass vie for attention on the light-bodied palate.

title: Josh Cellars 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This wine is vivid and dramatic, emphasizing fresh herb and gooseberry aromas. The medium-bodied palate is mouthwatering in grapefruit and lemon flavors.

title: Pellegrini 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers good value, its color light, frame delicate and nose floral in rose and lavender. Its foundation is fresh and lively in orange peel and wild strawberry and complicated in earthy black tea.

title: Tessier Winery 2017 Fenaughty Vineyard Grenache (El Dorado)
description: While relatively light in color and lean in body, this well-balanced wine has charming red- and black-fruit flavors, accents of cardamom and black tea, and a lingering finish.

title: Bellante 2017 Tierra Alta Vineyards Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: There's a solid show of violets and blackberry but also touches of soil, slate and roasted game on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is ripe with wild strawberries but then draws into a savory show of cracked pepper and seared beef.

title: Galante 2014 Ace High Malbec (Carmel Valley)
description: Dark berries, crushed gravel and muddy clay make for a rustic but compelling nose on this bottling from a warm valley. It's tightly wound on the palate, where a chalky mouthfeel delivers bright blackberry and red-currant flavors.

title: Lumen 2017 Sierra Madre Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Asian pear and flint aromas show on the toasty nose of this bottling by winemaking legend Lane Tanner. Tight flavors of lemon and lime balm meet with warmer tones of sea salt and white peach on the finish, which is energetic.

title: Bernardus 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very light in the glass, this appellation blend is shows off aromas of earth, cherry, dark strawberry and a hint of wet wool. Lively acidity on the palate delivers flavors of tangy boysenberry, wet soil, clay, dried herbs and a hint of earthy juniper.

title: Landmark 2016 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of butter, apple, toasted oak and hazelnut show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers flavors of ripe lemon, yellow peach and mango sorbet that are quite ripe but dusted with a touch of sea salt.

title: Miner 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: High toned and full bodied, this is a lengthy, reasonably complex white with a measured approach to oak. It shines in dense green-apple flavor seasoned in baking spice and a subtle suggestion of vanilla.

title: Niner 2018 Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Aromas of tart lime peel and yellow grapefruit rind meet with Anjou pear on the nose of this bottling. There is pleasing brightness and tightness to the palate, where flavors of Meyer lemon and orange flavors meet with a hint of plumeria petals.

title: Sculpterra 2017 Syrah (Central Coast)
description: Blistered plum, tar, cold steel and a hint of game show on the nose of this bottling. There is a cohesion of flavors on the well-rounded palate, where tangy black-plum skins, lilac and meaty elements converge.

title: Zotovich 2017 Zoto Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Asian pear, lime blossom, light pineapple, wet slate and grapefruit aromas make for a complex nose on this entry-level bottling for the estate winery. Candied pear and ripe apple show on the clean, poppy palate.

title: Lexington 2014 Gist Ranch Estate Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The nose on this bottling is shy at first, offering focused aromas of toasted wood, dark blackberry and caramel. A firm structure frames the palate, where juicy blackberry fruit is lifted by thyme and dried purple-flower flavors.

title: Longoria 2016 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark-black plum, cracked pepper and turned earth show on the nose of this bottling from Rick Longoria's estate vineyard. The palate is very tightly wound, offering dark clove spice alongside the dried plum flavors.

title: MCV 2016 Black Red (Paso Robles)
description: Heavy aromas of blueberry, tangy blackberry and baked vanilla pie show on the nose of this blend of 72% Petite Sirah, 19% Tannat and 9% Petit Verdot. There is good herbal spice to the palate, where polished tannins carry deep yet bright flavors of berry and purple flowers.

title: Morgan 2017 Cotes du Crow's Red (Monterey)
description: This mix of 56% Grenache, 37% Syrah and 7% Tempranillo is extra-fresh upon opening the twist-top bottle, showing aromas of raspberry, sagebrush and white pepper. The palate also combines fresh red fruit, pepper and herbs, making for a zesty sip.

title: Ojai 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite light in the glass, this delicate bottling offers aromas of aromatic herbs such as mint and tarragon along with lightly roasted Rainier cherry and red-melon touches. The palate is light and tart with flavors of watermelon, clay and crushed herbs.

title: Sextant 2014 El Pomar Cabernet Sauvignon (El Pomar District)
description: This is a ripe, extracted and powerful red wine, starting with aromas of cassis and coffee candies. The palate is lush and rich in flavors of black plum jelly, licorice and toasted oak.

title: Carol Shelton 2014 Rockpile Vineyard Petite Sirah (Rockpile)
description: Spicy red fruit takes on the tartness of cranberry and orange in this well-made, well-structured wine from the great winemaker. Varietal in its touch of white pepper and clove, it is powerful with firm integrated tannins.

title: Foursight 2016 Paraboll Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Good, rich fruit and baking-spice flavors make this full-bodied wine easy to appreciate. Though aged in 50% new French barrels it doesn't taste heavy or overly baked. It has ripe plum and cherry aromas, tasty and almost jammy flavors, a rounded texture and mild tannins.

title: Grgich Hills 2015 Paris Tasting Commemorative Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is an estate-grown white meant to celebrate founder Mike Grgich's role in making the winning Chardonnay at the Judgement of Paris and it offers plenty to remember. Pineapple, caramel and honeycomb are up front alongside sweet peach aromas. Despite the heady flavors, it is focused and fresh on the midpalate with a steely balanced finish.

title: Phillips Hill 2016 Roma's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells flinty and tastes lean at first, but opens a bit on the palate to show tangy red and black-cherry flavors, mineral and herb accents, moderate tannins and acidity. It will please wine lovers looking for restraint and delicacy.

title: Renwood 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a grand wine, showing very concentrated fruit flavors and a firm structure. Deep blackberry, red cherry, clove and cedar fill the aroma and equally vivid flavors coat the palate.

title: Renwood 2016 Riker Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine tastes meaty and feels grippy, as it goes from black-pepper and black-plum aromas to ripe black-cherry flavors shaded by beefy spicy nuances. Moderate tannins bring a welcome grip to the mouthfeel and call for an equally meaty food pairing.

title: Renwood 2016 Sea of Grapes Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Well balanced and snappy in the mouth, this wine has plenty of fruit flavors offset by grippy tannins and a touch of acidity. It coats the palate nicely buy keeps the taste buds fresh for another bite.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This is an ambitious full-bodied wine, from the deep dark color to the effusive new oak aromas and dense spicy chocolaty flavors. It is saturated with fine-grained tannins that hold the black-cherry flavors tightly. Harmless tartrate crystals may show up in the bottom of the glass.

title: Zinderella 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This sleek but powerful wine offers a nose of black cherries and dark chocolate. The rich palate brings pure berry flavors that linger on the luscious finish. Overall, it has a deep saturated color, fragrant aromas and generous fruit flavors.

title: Grady Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a bold, dry wine that smells like black pepper and turned earth, tastes fruity but not overripe and has a nice firm structure of moderate tannins and fruit acidity. It's great to find a full-bodied Zin with this appealing sense of balance.

title: Nemerever 2015 Complement Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: From the producer's own vineyards, this is a 100% varietal wine aged 18 months in French oak made by the well-respected winemaking consultant Jeff Ames. It opens in a soft, rounded palate of balanced richness and firm tannin as aspects of cedar, pencil shavings and earthy plum settle in.

title: Renwood 2016 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: This wine from a unique little appellation has a wonderful, concentrated fruit character that light oak spices accentuate, while a lightly tannic texture helps the mouthfeel. It has great balance and a long lingering finish.

title: Brea 2017 Chard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There are compelling aromas of chalk and clay on the nose of this appellation blend, along with bright scents of lime zest, grapefruit peel and butter. The palate is bolstered by lemony acidity and the fleshy mouthfeel delivers flavors of nectarine, Asian pear and more clay.

title: Holdredge 2016 Saralee's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Crisply acid-driven, this wine from the famous site does it justice, allowing layers of earthy forest and black tea to mingle within rose petal and white pepper. Substantial on the palate, it lurks in balance, elusive in fruit while being exuberant in clove and cardamom.

title: Cattleya 2017 The Initiation Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There is immense density on the nose of this bottling, with strong pâtes de fruits au cassis and elegant purple-flower aromas coming through in layer after layer. The palate is framed by firm but expansive tannins, coating the flavors of black cherry, roasted espresso cream and loamy soils. This is an extremely deep and unending wine.

title: Lula 2017 Rescue Block Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Haunting, deep, dark fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine an almost irresistible charm. Focused and vivid sour cherry, black-cherry and rhubarb notes meet accents of clove and black tea on a palate livened by firm acidity and light tannins. Delicious already but will improve through at least 2025.

title: Diamond Creek 2016 Volcanic Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This is an intensely powerful Cabernet Sauvignon, with 8% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc blended in. It is robust in firm tannins that prop up flavors of leather, dark chocolate, sage and crushed rock, accented by toasted oak and cedar. It will benefit from aging; enjoy 2026–2031.

title: Ad Vivum 2016 Sleeping Lady Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: A tiny production from winemaker Chris Phelps of Inglenook, this wine is softly round and richly structured, with a backbone of silky tannin and integrated oak. Black cherry and toffee mocha stand out most prominently around savory characteristics of sage, graphite and pencil. This is a lovely, elegant and 100% varietal wine.

title: Stony Hill 2016 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)
description: This mighty white from the historic producer rarely disappoints—a study in nuanced structure and ageability. Crisp, focused acidity boosts a core of delicious green apple, lemon verbena and wet stone. The wood imprint is subtle and quiet, the wine having aged 10 months in neutral French oak. Allow this to age; enjoy 2024–2028.

title: Ramey 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From older vines planted in the early 1970s, this is a knockout, standout wine, juicy and exotic in spicy lemongrass, lime and voluptuous intensity. Richly layered, it has a backbone of fresh acidity that keeps it intriguingly fresh and classically structured. In the end, it's supremely delicious.

title: Larkmead 2016 Firebelle Red (Napa Valley)
description: Spiky dried herb, wood and cedar join an aromatic invitation of lavender in this lovely, powerful blend of 67% Merlot, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petit Verdot, all from the estate. Earthy and fresh in bright underlying acidity, it remains high-toned throughout, expressing currant, clove and cherry cola within well-integrated tannin and oak. Still, there's nothing wrong with cellaring. Enjoy best from 2021–2026.

title: Larkmead 2016 Solari Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Entirely varietal and made from a tiny yielding section of the estate vineyard, a force of nature and mineral. A substantial nose of baked black fruit, coffee bean and chewy, grippy tannin give it a tenacity and weight that finds length enough to smoothen out the sharp edges, dried herb and clove. This is one to let settle; enjoy best from 2026–2036.

title: Drew 2016 Valenti Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Big and bold but also balanced, this medium- to full-bodied wine boasts just-ripe fruit, firm acidity and a sense of delicate layering in the floral, black-cherry and cinnamon flavors. It's “fresh” in the French sense, feeling agile and alive and with potential for aging. Best through 2025.

title: Joseph Jewell 2017 Eel River Valley Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: Great balance and tangy, appetizing black-fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine great focus and intensity. Inviting black-cherry and sour cherry aromas lead to absolutely delicious and lip-smacking cherry, black tea and orange zest on the palate, while light but firm tannins add grip.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Quail Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: An impressive white from start to finish, this offers voluptuous fruit on the generous, expansive palate. Salt, stone and sea spray combine effortlessly within integrated tannin and oak. It is a gorgeous reflection on the vintage and the site, which is blessed with old vines.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2018 Kiler Grove Vineyard Ugni Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This is reliably one of the top white wines to emerge from all of Paso Robles, if not the entire Central Coast, each vintage. Clean lines of chalk, lime pith, gardenia and wet gravel show on the nose, while the sip offers honeysuckle, Asian pear and Key lime pith. A fresh acidity and rocky tension engages the entire palate.

title: Diamond Creek 2016 Red Rock Terrace Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Red Rock is a 7-acre block of the famous vineyard and this vintage is blended with 8% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc. Tobacco, leather and cigar box season a thick, viscous structure of sweet cherry and cassis that is rich and succulently rewarding. Cellar awhile to tame the tannins and enjoy best 2026–2031.

title: Beringer 2016 Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dust and sage color this bold, powerful wine, which is layered and complex in its ripeness and structure. Weighty in oak and tannin, it shows an expanse of rich red fruit, from cassis to current, with seasonings of cocoa dust, espresso and cigar. Enjoy best after cellaring 2026–2031.

title: Domaine Carneros 2012 Le Rêve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)
description: From estate-grown Chardonnay, this is a gorgeously crafted and aged sparkling wine that is persistently crisp in stone, green apple, nectarine and lemon. Firm in lasting acidity, this has beautiful composure and an understated richness of crème brûlée and baked pineapple.

title: Drew 2016 Perli Vineyards Syrah (Mendocino Ridge)
description: This Syrah is massive and steely, wrapping its concentrated black-fruit, sour cherry and black-pepper flavors in firm tannins and acidity. It has the sense of being just underripe, so there's a tension between the nascent fruit flavors and the tangy mouthfeel. Best after 2025.

title: Portfolio 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Winemaker Genevieve Janssens' personal project (with husband Luc), this blends 85% Cabernet Sauvignon from Hendry Ranch with 15% Cabernet Franc from Detert East Vineyard in Oakville—a celebratory bottling of classic complexity. Herbal, it has rich structure and a succulent middle of cassis and coffee bean that pleases in length and breadth. Enjoy it best in due time, from 2025–2030.

title: Ramey 2016 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This producer's blocks were planted in 1991 and 1997 to field selections of both Wente and Robert Young clones. Juicy, tight and tension-filled, it is both complex and high-toned in approach, with looming acidity that freshens in tart lemon-peel, grapefruit and tangerine flavors—a classic and elegant wine.

title: Testarossa 2016 Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This bottling from a coveted vineyard offers a little bit of everything for the Chardonnay lover. The nose begins with aromas of candied lime, tangerine pith, golden butter and cashew cream. The palate continues with toasted hazelnut, fresh lemon and then a crème brûlée finish, yet it's all wrapped in searing acidity and a chalky mouthfeel.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Monastery Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Sharp, focused acidity stars in this barrel-fermented white that dazzles in abundant complexity and structure. Lemon peel, stone and sea air give it an undying freshness in the glass, as lovely flavors of Gravenstein apple, pear and tangerine effortlessly combine.

title: Anaba 2017 Snow Vineyard Picpoul Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: Waxy and mineral, this delightful white has a bright high-acid freshness and a texture of stone. Lemon, quince and apricot factor into the flavor profile with an exotic complexity and undeniable drinkability.

title: Bargetto 2017 Mount Eden Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Intense boysenberry aromas meet with slate, soil and a hint of char on the nose of this expression of the historic clone. It's still very young and shy on the palate, yet the elegant black-raspberry and dried herb flavors emerge with patience and air.

title: Frank Family 2016 Lewis Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Oaky and reduced, this wine has a nose of honey and heady ginger, with lemongrass and nutmeg spice. Bold concentrated flavors of apple and fig follow. The wine is made in a big bold style that's done well and richly ripe.

title: Jaffurs 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rarely is Grenache the best grape to lay down in the cellar, but this bottling has the bones and pedigree to qualify. Plump berry, cherry and red-currant fruits have a floral edge on the nose, while the palate is very grippy with tannins that hold the sumac and tart cherry flavors tightly. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Joullian 2014 Sias Cuvée Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)
description: Though predominantly Zinfandel, this field blend from a vineyard planted in 1984 by Dick Sias also includes Primitivo, Aleatico, Alicante Bouschet, Carignan, Grenache and Petite Sirah, and is a great taste of the past. Blackberry, thyme and dried mint aromas drop into a palate of black plum, loamy soil, dried herbs and cocoa. This is full bodied and well layered.

title: Luna Hart 2017 Fiddlestix Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Young winemaker Gretchen Voelcker got her hands on some rare fruit for this bottling, which shows edgy aromas of crushed rock, flint, smoked apple and citrus peel on the nose. There is an immensely chalky tension to the palate, where yellow-apple and grapefruit-rind flavors wrestle for attention.

title: Margerum 2017 M5 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Doug Margerum is capturing the freshness of Rhône varieties like few others in California, as evidenced in this twist-top blend of 44% Grenache, 37% Syrah, 11% Mourvèdre, 4% Counoise and 4% Cinsaut. Aromas of zesty rosewater, raspberry and a hint of smoke lead into a palate that's zippy with joyous flavors of red fruit, sumac and white pepper.

title: McClain Cellars 2016 Purpose Road Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A smooth black-cherry aroma meets with a touch of red flower on the nose of this Merlot, which is blended with 25% Sangiovese. The broad mouthfeel and tannic tension carry flavors of baking spice and dark fruit.

title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Reserve Rosé Sparkling (Napa County)
description: Bright focused acidity drives the texture and crisp flavors of this wine, a celebration of cherry, orange and strawberry with a touch of vanilla-biscuit richness on the back of the palate. It has texture and length deserving of its reserve title.

title: Peter Paul Wines 2014 Giuliani Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Bright fresh acidity wraps around darker denser flavors of blueberry, black cherry and black currant in this vineyard-designate, which is full bodied in style. It has appealing elements of dried herb and clove.

title: Rowdy Bush 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: A beefy, savory aspect gives this concentrated and full-bodied wine some nice complexity. Its richly layered tannins coat the mouth while deep and persistent blueberry and blackberry flavors taste compelling and delicious. Best after 2023.

title: Saint K 2017 Dial Tone Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: A 100% whole-cluster bottling from Glenrose Vineyard, this whimsically labeled wine combines dark black currant and blackberry on the nose with saddle leather and earthy aromas. The palate is very earthy as well, with stewed black-plum and turned loam flavors.

title: Saucelito Canyon 2016 Backroads Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo)
description: This twist-top blend of various vineyards is an affordable and excellent way to get a taste of what this historic winery is up to. Aromas of black raspberry, turned loam and savory dried meats lead into a tense palate that bursts with berry and is layered with black rock minerality.

title: Sculpterra 2015 Figurine Red (Paso Robles)
description: Woody aromas frame the blackberry-jam and vanilla-cookie scents on the nose of this blend of 43% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Primitivo and 24% Merlot. Concentrated flavors of blackberry and black-plum jam are leveled by pine-needle herbs on the rich palate.

title: Summers 2014 Checkmate Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Inviting in rich layers that taste of cinnamon toast, dusty black fruit and clove, this is a powerfully built and nicely layered wine that has tannic structure to spare.

title: Chimney Rock 2016 Elevage Blanc Estate Grown White (Napa Valley)
description: In this lovely and complex white from estate fruit, winemaker Elizabeth Vianna blends 79% Sauvignon Blanc with 21% Sauvignon Gris to offer an intense, ripe and thick-bodied wine that's lush and layered. The fruit is a mix of green apple and quince.

title: Domaine Carneros 2014 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)
description: This is made from a majority of Pinot Noir alongside Chardonnay and Pinot Gris. Aged three-and-a-half years in bottle, it's complex and approachable in equal measure. Cherry, peach and a twist of lime round out the lush palate, with integrated acidity underlining its freshness.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Winemaker Series Heritage Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Walnut and toasted oak aromas meet with poached and roasted apples on the nose. Flavors of sliced yellow pear and honeysuckle sit atop a rocky mineral note on the palate.

title: Firestone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry, cocoa and turned loam aromas show on the nose. Bright berry and cherry flavors meet with tobacco and ancho chile dust on the palate.

title: Franciscan 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a finely made wine, blended with 10% Merlot and smaller bits of Petit Verdot and Malbec. It offers silky tannins and lovely notes of dried herb, sage, black cherry and blackberry. The finish is dusted in cocoa powder.

title: Starfield NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (El Dorado)
description: This is an exciting wine made from Marsanne, Fiano and Muscat grapes grown in the Sierra Foothills region. Generous pear, butter and vanilla flavors give this smooth and fine-grained wine plenty of substance, while a hint of sweetness and some mellow, spicy notes kick in on the finish.

title: Artesa 2015 Cask Reserva Especial Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The Carneros-based producer ventures into heartier red territory with this lovely, plush and broadly expansive red, blended with 5% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot. Dried cherry, baking spice and plenty of structure define its overall likability and complexity.

title: Ektimo Vineyards 2015 Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)
description: A bold reflection of the grape's inherent heartiness, this imparts softly robust and spicy layers of licorice, lavender and baked fruit compote. It holds its weight and ripeness well, with plenty of plushness on the palate.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2016 Barbera (Amador County)
description: This supple, layered wine has inviting balsam and raspberry aromas, generous berry flavors and a soothing, mild texture. It is medium bodied, easy to enjoy and should pair well with a wide range of foods.

title: Foursight 2016 Charles Vineyard Clone 05 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This lean, light and nervy wine doesn't conform to the norm. It has a sour-cherry character that dominates the flavors and taut acidity that joins with mild tannins for a gripping palate-cleansing texture. The clone 05 (or Pommard clone) grapes were fermented with native yeast.

title: Longboard 2016 Dakine Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: With a touch of Carignan, Grenache, Malbec, Zinfandel and Petite Sirah, this full-bodied red is impressively varietal in its soft seamless tannins and tight embrace of grapy blueberry and cherry flavor. A touch of wild game, coffee and forest floor permeate the fruit well.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 Home Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)
description: This wine is flavorful and well balanced, deftly blending mild oak and spice elements with warm, ripe plum and red cherry flavors on the soft, velvety texture. All the elements are harmonious and well integrated.

title: Vigilance 2015 Cimarron Red (Lake County)
description: Intriguing floral and cedar aromas blend into ripe, juicy and delicious cherry and berry notes on the palate, while a soothing, gentle texture coats the sides of the mouth. This Rhône-style blend is a delight to taste and goes down smoothly.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 Block 8 Estate Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Stemmy, earthy and brimming in black tea, this is a quite savory, dense and meaty red wine, made in an elegant style with understated ripeness. Elements of crushed rock give it a mineral edginess that accentuates the acidity and note of saline around wild strawberry and rhubarb.

title: Gratus 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's Pope Valley estate vineyard, and made in minuscule amounts, this shines in a flair of sauvage earthiness, with thick, juicy and superripe flavors of robust red cherry, currant and plum. Strong and powerfully concentrated, it shows balance and good bones.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This full-bodied wine is packed with aromas of ripe fruit, cedar, cinnamon and flowers on the nose. The juicy palate brings flavors of blackberry and black cherry wrapped in a velvety layer of fine-grained tannins.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2015 La Colina Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fleshy and floral, this medium-bodied white tastes of quince, Gravenstein apple and citrus. Thick in texture and with substantial density on the midpalate, it persists in apple and orange blossom flavors and a thread of nutmeg.

title: Rubus 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This supple medium-bodied offering from an international brand is a terrific value. It supports pure ripe fruit flavors on a velvety texture of light tannins and mild acidity. It tastes focused, feels balanced and leaves you wanting another sip.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Peacock Patch Reserve Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine, containing 15% Merlot, is unapologetically oaky, but the oakiness is well integrated with ripe berry and black-cherry flavors. It starts with aromas of cedar, pencil shavings and toast, segues to spicy, almost floral flavors and an oak-spice accent lingers on the finish.

title: Brea 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe mulberry, pomegranate, sage and wild mint aromas emerge from this appellation blend, which is fairly light in the glass. The flavors are bright and airy, with dried cherry and fennel, wrapped in solid acidity.

title: Clif Family 2017 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: This aromatic wine has a lively perfume of grapefruit and lychees and a tingly, nicely acidic palate that reveals crisp apple and rose petal. It is medium bodied, refreshing and well balanced.

title: Dorothy Jean 2017 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Warm and toasty aromas of buttered sourdough, baked nectarine and sea salt show on the nose of this bottling by winemaker Amy Butler. Roasted pome fruits meet with pecan and more butter on the palate, but in very measured tones.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Warm aromas of grilled white peach and buttercream prove opulent and rich on the nose of this reserve bottling. The palate shows an edge of lemon zest, yet centers on plush flavors of butterscotch, smoked almonds and browned butter.

title: Iron Horse 2016 North Block Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This wine opens thick and tannic in structure before revealing fresh acidity that softens the texture on the palate. Wisps of wild strawberry, pomegranate and orange peel meet a spicy element of cola as aromas of rose petal slide through.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Strata Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an earthy, stemmy and floral wine, with a velvety texture that rides smoothly along the palate. Bold flavors of blueberry and black cherry are framed by firm, substantial tannins and a lingering oak tone.

title: MCV 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Black plum, violet, loamy earthy and a hint of caramel-laced fudge show on the nose of this bottling by Petite Sirah specialist Matt Villard. It's very dry on the palate, with smoothed-out tannins, offering earth-driven flavors of soul, black pepper and licorice, with an undercurrent of cassis.

title: Pech Merle 2017 Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This is an excellent, robust wine that matches delicious berry aromas and flavors with a firm structure of moderate tannins and full body. It has ample fruitiness, a touch of sweet oak and a nice mouthfilling texture.

title: Robert Renzoni 2016 Riserva Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: This long-aging style begins with toasty aromas of oak, boysenberry, black plum and vanilla on the nose. The palate is very rounded with cassis and black-cherry flavors, wrapped in gingerbread and star anise spice: powerful and pleasant all around.

title: Sculpterra 2017 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: This twist-top bottling is always a playful and immediately likable take on Grenache, boosted with 11% Petite Sirah. Rich red-cherry, roasted strawberry and caramel aromas lead into a palate that's loaded with clean red-fruit, nutmeg and gingerbread flavors.

title: Section Wines 2018 Tierra Alta Vineyards Viognier (Ballard Canyon)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling from the northern edge of the small appellation shows plenty of honeydew as well as guava and ripe apple on the nose, all set against a chalky backbone. There's great grip on the sip, where chalky texture and bright acidity frame the baked apple and pear flavors.

title: Solminer 2017 deLanda Vineyard Blaufränkisch (Los Olivos District)
description: A rare planting of this Austrian grape in California, this bottling by Anna and David DeLaski is very fruity on the nose, with crushed pomegranate, candied cranberry, black-plum and orange aromas. The palate is quite tangy, with lively flavors of fruit punch, cherry tomatoes and an intriguing range of sharp spices.

title: Sunstone 2018 Linda's Vineyard Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: From a vineyard named after the winery's late founder Linda Rice, this is a very crisp, clean and light style of Viognier, starting with aromas of lemon-lime soda, guava peel and apple blossoms. The zesty palate offers more guava and golden-apple flesh, all wrapped up in a tight weave.

title: Testarossa 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Toasty oak, Meyer lemon peel and seared citrus flesh show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is solid tension to the sip, where lemon spray and more oak tones arise atop the fairly strong acid profile.

title: The Blending Lab 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling shows intense blackberry-jam aromas alongside a hint of cedar. The flavors and texture fill the mouth, delivering dense blackberry, dried violets and roasted coffee against chalky yet polished tannins. Drink now through 2031.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2016 Family Album Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Aromas of violet, lilac, black plum, tar and wood spice arise on the nose of this dense and powerful wine. The palate shows hints of tar and asphalt at first, but it opens into peppercorn spice and purple fruits, with sticky tannins that rise up on the finish.

title: Balletto 2016 18 Barrel Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is sourced from three of the producer's estate vineyards, all within the Sebastopol Hills. Floral in rose petal and lavender, it shows hearty midpalate weight and a thickness of tannins as layers of wild strawberry, orange peel and rhubarb figure in. Plenty of baking spice and black tea accent the finish.

title: Balletto 2018 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)
description: Tones of jasmine and lemon peel yield to tangerine and peach in this light, bright and refreshing wine. It shows tension and focus on the palate, ending on a light spice note.

title: Bernardus 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: This twist-top county blend is a solid deal, starting with fresh and crisp aromas of lime balm, jasmine and a touch of chalk. Chalky tension grips the palate and then carries through broad gardenia, plump white peach and cherimoya flavors.

title: Bernardus 2018 Rosé (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Quite mellow on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of wet stone and sliced pluot. There is tremendous tightness to the palate, where hints of strawberry, wet gravel, cement and lemon pith converge.

title: Decades5 2013 Stagecoach Vineyard Petit Verdot (Atlas Peak)
description: This is 100% varietal and 100% barrel-fermented—a study in an intense variety from an intense site. Thick, viscous and reductive in style, it shows brawny, thick black fruit, clove, cedar and oak wrapped in grippy, structured tannin.

title: Domaine Eden 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From Mount Eden's more affordable sister property comes this heady bottling, which begins with aromas of dark red fruit and freshly laid asphalt. The palate is immensely earthy, with more tar and a touch of singed boar skin, yet set against a dark raspberry and cranberry profile. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Fallbrook 2016 33 Degrees North Gracie Hill Vineyard Petit Verdot (South Coast)
description: Roasted boysenberry, smoke, caramel and turned soil aromas show on the nose of this rather oaky bottling from near San Diego. The oak-kissed palate offers caramel and butterscotch against fresh blackberry juice, making it easy to like, if not varietally distinct.

title: Felten Cellars 2018 Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: A good example of how Chardonnay can work in Paso Robles, this bottling from a high-elevation site is fresh, bright and tightly woven on the nose, with aromas of ash, mandarin, lemongrass and spring flowers. The palate is quite racy, with acid-driven flavors of lemon and lime rind as well as fresh grapefruit flesh.

title: Lone Madrone 2015 Points West Red (Paso Robles)
description: A bit shy on the nose at first, this blend of 56% Mourvèdre, 23% Syrah, 10% Cinsault, 8% Grenache and 3% Counoise shows underlying hints of black plum, game, minty herbs and turned soil. Tobacco and wild thyme flavors pop on the palate, where the minty herbs play against the rich and exotic plum fruits.

title: McKahn 2017 Grenache (Amador County)
description: Richness, ripeness and a luxurious oakiness make this a big, plush and flavorful wine. It shows wonderfully warm baking-spice aromas, late-picked cherry and currant flavors and a mouthfilling texture. A good structure of moderate tannins and full body nicely balances out the big flavors.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2014 Starscape Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an uneventful red wine, perhaps past its prime, the palate is muted in red fruit and quiet oak.

title: Muscardini 2015 Tesoro Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a blend of 43% Sangiovese, 29% Cabernet Sauvignon and 28% Syrah, the style burly and full bodied, with sizable tannin structure and moderate acidity. The fruit is syrupy black and raisiny, taking on the richness of Christmas cake.

title: Ess-eff 2016 Teldeschi Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Blended with 8% Petite Sirah and made in a tiny amount, this is an earthy wine with a thickness of brawny black fruit, nutmeg and sage.

title: Hook or Crook 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows an unusual pink tinge in the color, aromas that are lightly floral, and flavors that blend fruit salad with heavier butter and toasted oak nuances.

title: Kirkland Signature 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Blended with Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this is oaky and robust in broad black fruit and a powerful midpalate of dried herb. It finishes thin.

title: Maggio 2016 Merlot (California)
description: Oakiness pervades this medium-bodied one-note wine from the spice-rack aromas to oaky mapley flavors and slightly drying tannins.

title: St. Anne's Crossing 2015 Slattery Road Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Hugely grippy, this is a tremendously powerful ripe wine, big and burly with a sweet palate of dark chocolate and tobacco. Blackberry jam is dipped in cinnamon and pepper for the finish.

title: Wellsley Farm 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Damp wood, leather, mushrooms and slightly sour blackberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The fruit flavors of blackberry and plum are quite ripe on the palate, and lifted by cedar touches.

title: Matthes Vineyards 2015 Estate Grown Grenache Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is blended with 32% Marsanne and given seven months in neutral oak. It doesn't show its age well, the acidity tart, marring the waxy apple, stone and white flower.

title: Raymond 2015 Reserve Selection Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This has burly amounts of oak and dry tannins, the ripeness generous in blackberry jam with herbal touches that don't fully integrate.

title: Camp 2016 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This easygoing red offers simple red fruit that's built around a basic core of structure and little oak.

title: Lawer 2016 Betsy's Vineyard Syrah (Knights Valley)
description: Earthy blueberry flavors ride along a thick tannic wall of powerful intensity. The midpalate is slightly dull and leathery.

title: The Blending Lab 2018 Winegeleno Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: This Mourvèdre-based rosé, which includes 3% Tannat, starts with aromas of light nectarine and pluot. The palate is crisp and acid-driven, with slightly sour orange-rind and dried pear flavors.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Herbal and grassy, this has a touch of matchstick that persists and detracts, with a metallic edge to the finish.

title: Wild Coyote 2017 Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Extremely extracted in style, this bottling offers concentrated blackberry and grape seed aromas, along with brown sugar and mint on the treacly nose. The palate is thick, sweet and rich, almost like a Port.

title: Wild Coyote 2017 House of Reds Red (Adelaida District)
description: Extracted aromas of cherry cough syrup are lifted with hints of mint and caramel on the nose of this blend of 36% Zinfandel, 33% Cabernet Sauvignon and 31% Tannat. It's thick on the palate with black-plum and grape seed flavors.

title: Beaucanon 2013 Cuvée Louis Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick tannic red, with huge concentration and coating tannins. It tastes leathery and earthy without much to offer in the way of fruit.

title: Ektimo Vineyards 2015 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Reminiscent of cinnamon toast, this is a tangy light wine, with high-toned cranberry and currant that tastes disjointed in its mix of savory and sweet.

title: Wild Coyote 2016 Syrah (Adelaida District)
