description: Concentrated and extracted on the nose, this shows grape seed, black-currant and cooked Concord grape aromas. Similar flavors arise on the sip, where black-currant and candied grape flavors also arise.

title: St. Anne's Crossing 2015 Shumahi Vineyard Primitivo (Sonoma Valley)
description: Thick, syrupy and green, this has a harshness of tannin atop an abundance of jammy black fruit.

title: Testarossa 2016 La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Hazelnut and roasted apple aromas show on the creamy nose of this single-vineyard expression by the Los Gatos-based winery. The palate is also creamy and generous, with flavors of light butter, marzipan, seared orange and hazelnut paste.

title: Bernardus 2017 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rich aromas of cherry, red currant and pomegranate sauce show on the nose of this bottling. The palate also plays in the lighter red-fruit zone, picking up layers of thyme and oregano as well as a sprinkling of rose petals by the finish.

title: Midnight 2016 Moonbeam Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: A bit more dense than many Grenaches, this bottling offers mocha and cappuccino aromas alongside black cherry on the nose. The palate is rich, with red fruits and a rose-petal lift, cut by penetrating and fresh acidity.

title: The Pinot Project 2018 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Aromas and flavors of ripe plum and sweet cherry make this full-bodied wine taste generous and inviting. While only 20% of the blend is aged in barrels, an impression of sweet oak spices rounds the edges and warms the palate.

title: Zotovich 2017 Z Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pear-flesh and citrus-rind aromas meet with pineapple and slightly tropical fruits on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very tropical and fresh, offering more pineapple but also flavors of grapefruit pith that hold that riper fruits in check.

title: Zotovich 2017 Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A bit more dense on the nose than other Grenaches, this bottling shows black-cherry and smoke aromas as well as more typical touches of rosewater and wet gravel. The palate is loaded with ripe and delicious baked cherries and plum, with texture and acidity that deliver in the midpalate.

title: Beringer 2017 Founder's Estate Pinot Noir (California)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine is one of the best values in Pinot today. It shows classic black and red-cherry aromas, a broad palate of dark fruits and light oak spices. Lifted acidity and moderate tannins complete the nicely composed picture.

title: Hall 2015 Jack's Masterpiece Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky cherry and mocha flavors are accented by dark chocolate and sweet oak in this lush, creamy red that is made in a rich, layered style. Lasting notes of tobacco, dusty sage and brawny tannin round out the impressive experience.

title: Jax 2017 Calesa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Big, burly and earthy, with deft, dense layers of stemmy strawberry and tea, this is a full bodied and richly interwoven wine from the coast. Spicy in cardamon and sage, it finishes balanced and bold.

title: Blue Victorian Winery 2016 Sammy Bacsi Syrah (Suisun Valley)
description: Smooth but powerful, this full-bodied wine exudes ripe and almost sweet black-plum aromas, followed by concentrated black-fruit flavors and accents of black pepper and anise. It is rich and mouthfilling, light in terms of tannin and has a lingering finish.

title: Falkner 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of Granny Smith apple, cut grass and damp pine needles show on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong sizzle of acidity on the palate, where the green apple flavor plays with a richer nectarine tone.

title: Grimm's Bluff 2015 Cliff Hanger Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Earthy aromas of clay and loam lead into black currant, espresso and roasted meats on the nose of this bottling from a biodynamic vineyard. It lands on the palate with a soft presence, delivering flavors of roasted strawberry, cocoa and an earthy, soil-like streak.

title: Groth 2017 Hillview Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Stony, gritty and textured, this is a complex, voluptuously rich wine, with layers of flavor and complexity. Meyer lemon and peach rise to the fore of the palate exposing ripe rounded flavors that veer into an array of tropical nuance.

title: Testarossa 2014 Black Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Dense aromas of black currant are leveled by slate and graphite tones on the nose of this bottling. The palate is all about texture that is firm but friendly, carrying flavors of black olive, violet and blackberry. This one still needs even more time to develop fully.

title: Bernardus 2017 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Plum and cranberry aromas are lifted by mace and cinnamon on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the Carmel Valley-based producer. Mulberry, red-plum and roasted berry flavors meet with orange rind and wild thyme on the palate.

title: Dahlia 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is an extra-nice wine to carry the often lowly California appellation on the label. Delicate, elegant and well balanced, this medium-bodied wine emphasizes slightly tart fruit flavors and subtle but complex accents of baking spices and herbs.

title: DRNK 2017 Catie's Corner Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral, grassy and steely in style, this wine is lightly balanced with a freshness that appeals. The flavors are a mix of apricot and lemon peel unfettered by oak and measured in ripeness.

title: Koehler 2018 Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of Asian pear, Pink Lady apple and green tea on the nose. The palate is quite chalky, carrying flavors of exotic citrus and honeydew though remaining taut into the finish.

title: MCV 2017 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Red-plum skins, turned soil and toasted wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which is fairly light in the glass. Flavorful tones of hibiscus and light red cherry come through on the sip, with is flavorful, lightly bodied and easy to drink.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2018 Glenrose Vineyard Picpoul Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Candied melon, lily, daffodil and a touch of chalk show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression of a grape that's growing in popularity. The palate is very grippy and chalky in texture, offering flavors of exotic honeydew and lemon-lime soda.

title: Roots Run Deep Winery 2014 The Valedictorian Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: With 5% Merlot blended in, this beastly wine boasts bright tones of cassis and currant, with lingering accents of coconut and vanilla. Big, dense and concentrated, it has a ton of structure, grippy tannin and oak.

title: Sanford 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Smoked hazelnut and rich oak aromas are cut by whiffs of lemon rind, citrus spray, chalk and Asian pear on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers both sharp citrus and rounded apple flavors.

title: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Muchacho Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: A rugged blend of 50% Zinfandel, 35% Tempranillo and 15% Petite Sirah, this bottling by the Greenough family shows concentrated aromas of black plum and black currant alongside tobacco and leather on the nose. It's thick and ripe on the palate, but balanced enough, offering powerful black-fruit flavors wit pinches of sage and incense.

title: Sojourn 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This appellation wine is brawny in brambly red and black cherry, tight full-bodied robustness and ripeness. Toasted oak imparts a warmth and seasoning of vanilla cola.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Bateman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A rich and concentrated varietal wine, this is tannic and edgy, with robust layers of rhubarb, cherry cola and dark chocolate. Its oak imprint is strong and seasoned in vanilla.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy cedar gives this wine a savory character that impresses, as well as a well-integrated core of chalky tannin, moderate oak and black-cherry ripeness. It provides substantial mouthfeel and approachability.

title: Wrath 2016 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Baked strawberry and mulberry aromas are lifted by gingersnap elements on the nose of this bottling. Concentrated red-plum and licorice flavors show on the very extracted palate, which gains a slight tartness from the acidity.

title: Benessere 2017 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)
description: Bright, fresh and balanced, this is a fruity white with bold flavors of baked peach and apricot. A nutty undertone adds a touch of richness and texture.

title: Calera 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: A tangy plum aroma meets turned soil on the rustic and rugged nose of this appellation blend by the historic winery, now owned by Duckhorn. The turned earth component shows on the palate as well, with additional flavors of thyme, dried sage, plum and baked sour cherry.

title: Coursey Graves 2016 West Slope Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a thick, rich and unctuously varietal wine, smoky in oak and beautifully wrapped layers of grilled meat and game. A thicket of lavender and licorice gives it complexity and more to ponder.

title: Crosby Roamann 2013 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
description: This wine offers cool-climate characteristics of spice, turned earth and pencil. Its plummy fruit is largely structured around a robust body of power and weight. Aged in both French and American oak, it persists on the finish in a mix of black pepper and sage.

title: Cuvaison 2016 Kite Tail Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Up-front oak gives way to a brightness of Meyer lemon in this ultimately medium-bodied structured white. Briny salty mineral elements pique a lusher midpalate of pineapple, fig and nutmeg, contrasting well to offer memorable complexity.

title: Girard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Floral in musque-like aromatics, this is a well-integrated and fruity white, crisply showing its stainless-steel fermentation. Apple, lime and peach play well with each other to offer bold, memorable flavors.

title: Herencia 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Sweet peach and apricot flavors are given a touch of richness from a jolt of vanilla. Medium bodied and fleshy, it finishes bright and fresh.

title: Iris 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tea, forest floor and rose petal combine forcefully on the nose of this wine, before a torrent of thick, underlying cranberry and cassis take over. The savory complements the fruit well, finishing in a twist of burnt orange peel.

title: La Follette 2016 Lorenzo Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Intensely textured and concentrated in fruit, this is marked by a depth of mango and pineapple with generous oak imparting toffee and caramel. It finds its balance midpalate with supportive acidity that lasts throughout a long finish.

title: Lava Cap 2017 Viognier (El Dorado)
description: This wine has light aromas of figs and crushed stone, followed by a creamy mouthfeel and subtle flavors of almond and white pepper. A couple of years in the cellar will bring out more complexity. Best after 2020.

title: MacRostie 2016 Putnam Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Baked strawberry is enveloped by wraparound oak in this concentrated full-bodied wine. Exotic aromas of rose accompany the fruit as substantial tannins ride along and tighten the texture.

title: Merus 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Blended with 11% Petit Verdot, then aged more than two years in 100% new French oak, this is built for power, exhibiting hugely tannic structure and vanilla oak. Black currant, cedar and dried herb dot the palate before a dense richness of chocolate comes to the fore.

title: Opaque 2013 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Rounded aromas of dark strawberry, black pepper, smoke and vanilla show on the nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. It's smooth and very drinkable on the palate, with flavors of French toast, red plum and dark strawberry jelly.

title: Duckhorn 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is an intensely thick, leathery red from a mountain site, with the addition of 14% Merlot and 1% Petit Verdot in the blend. It offers a powerful grip on the palate, and unleashes deep, jammy flavors of black cherry, berry and cocoa powder.

title: Renwood 2016 Premier Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Intense ripe fruit flavors meet spicy smoky complexity in this full-bodied, concentrated and well-structured wine. It has a deep blueberry and blackberry core surrounded by hints of black pepper, baking spices and wood smoke that keep it interesting from the first whiff to the lingering finish.

title: Renwood 2016 Syrah (Amador County)
description: This wine blends potent fresh grapy flavors with herbaceous notes like green tea and Thai basil. The palate impression is like just-crushed raspberries and blackberries. It is full bodied and firm in texture due to light tannins and good acidity.

title: Blue Farm 2016 Anne Katherina Vineyard Estate Farmed Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This earthy, rustic wine is perfumed in aromas of rose petal and lavender. The palate offers stemmy flavors of fresh plum, cherry and strawberry, with a frame of textured tannins and structured acidity.

title: Guarachi Family 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a spicy, earthy and lively red, bold and full bodied with plenty of length and complexity. Forest floor, black tea and baked strawberry comingle effortlessly in the glass to offer a varietal experience of deep flavor and texture.

title: Hess Collection 2016 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This blend is dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Merlot. Bold black fruit expand on the palate, with a lengthy powder keg of tobacco, gun smoke and cigar box shining through. The tannins are persistent yet soft.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Rockpile Vineyard Haley Syrah (Rockpile)
description: This is a thick, richly layered red with floral earthy undercurrents of exotic complexity. Full bodied with a huge tannic grip, it integrates the fruit and oak well, lasting in flavors of lavender candy.

title: Lexington 2014 Gist Ranch Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Roasted black cherry and a hint of herbs show on the nose of this fairly ripe expression of Cabernet Franc. There is a ton of grip to the palate, where roasted blackberry and dried oregano flavors show potential for long-term growth. Drink 2020–2029.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Clone 6 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is an excellent example of how a classic style of balanced rather than superripe Cabernet Sauvignon can excel in Santa Barbara County. Aromas of sandalwood, dark-red fruit and dried herbs lead into a medium-weight palate of smashed strawberry and red currant. But it's the layers of oregano, dill and tobacco leaf that set it apart.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Bootlegger's Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This lovely, memorable wine has a candied element that's inviting and exotic—a strong element of orange peel that refreshes the palate. Cranberry, forest floor and black tea accent a core of salty, meaty and savory character that's irresistible and balanced.

title: Sanford 2015 La Rinconada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a vineyard planted in 1997, this bottling offers aromas of tart pomegranate, wild rose, crushed carnations and wild sage on the nose. The palate is bright yet hearty and earthy, with flavors of herb, all spice, cranberry and pomegranate.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 Reserve Estate Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Crushed rock and rose petal greet the palate with nuanced complexity in this light-bodied, classically made wine from the great site. Rhubarb, blood orange and a backbone of tannin intermingle with ease around fresh acidity and a lasting tease of black tea.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Barrel 16 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is electric on the palate, dazzling in freshness and vitality. Floral and earthy tones meet lengthy pomegranate and cherry cola flavors on the palate. The oak and tannins are well behaved and integrated.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Vintage 20 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A celebration of the producer's deep history in winemaking, this sources from several of Merry Edwards' well-known estates, including Meredith, Coopersmith and Georganne. Thick and savory in blue fruit and smoky wood, it is a rich, rounded wine with great complexity, the tannins firm and structured. Enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Rasi 2017 Rancho La Vina Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling by Rachel Silkowski DeAscentiis offers aromas of red cherry, peanut brittle, raspberry and menthol on the nose. The palate is plump with Bing cherry and more tart cranberry, and dusted with pinches of tarragon and marjoram.

title: Robert Mondavi 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Steel acidity lifts the oak and fleshy body of this reserve-worthy wine—the core of flavor built around lush, decadent flavors of honey graham cracker, baked apple and lemon meringue. The richness is rewarding and softly beguiling on the palate.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Bentley Ironworks Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is a Cabernet with depth and substance, starting with delicious aromas of vanilla, star anise and black cherry. There is a good black-plum-skin tartness to start the sip, and then come the richer roasted berry and plum flavors, finishing with smoke and cocoa powder.

title: Three Sticks 2016 Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a youthful, tightly wound red that needs time to open in the glass—a study in extreme coastal viticulture. The estate property outside of Gualala imparts firm tannins and a touch of reduction, with big, bold and exotic flavors of cassis, pomegranate and spicy cardamom.

title: Tolosa 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's a compelling chalky aroma to the nose of this bottling, but the citrus zest freshness and nectarine warmth are also inviting. It's very racy and tightly wound on the palate, where flavors of apple blossom, Pink Lady apple, lime and wet clay arise.

title: Renwood 2016 Indian Creek Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This dry wine is fruity, ripe and authentic, as rich strawberry and blackberry flavors flood the palate and peppery, chocolaty accents kick in. It is full bodied but barely tannic, smooth in texture and soft on the finish.

title: WIndstorm 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Poached yellow-pear, lime-peel and lemon aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Full bodied on the sip, this wine is a bit ripe with nectarine and grapefruit-juice flavors.

title: Crosby Roamann 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a big effusive white, intensely full bodied and ripe in floral, earthy matchstick and pineapple. It finishes in a voluptuous embrace of crème brûlée.

title: Mumm Napa 2013 Reserve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is brimming in apple and lemon crispness, with a dryness on the palate that detracts from its time in bottle.

title: Sweet Heart 2015 Courtship Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Interesting aromas of tamarind and cedar get this wine off to a complex start, while spicy savory cooked-fruit flavors give it an unusual but enjoyable character.

title: Wine Spots 2014 Cuvée 38 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick leathery blend of Cabernet Franc and Merlot, with moderate acidity and a depth of chocolate, mocha and black-cherry flavors.

title: Austerity 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Honey-laced red cherries, spice-cake, molasses and cola aromas show on the nose of this widely available bottling. It's a bit sweet and simple on the palate, with cherry-brioche flavors.

title: Bravante 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Tart high-strung acidity meets generous tannins in this plummy full-bodied wine, robustly rich in red currant and cherry.

title: Criss Cross 2016 Old Vine Estate Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine boasts jammy aromas, seemingly sweet flavors of strawberry and red cherry and a rather soft, lazy texture.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2015 After Midnight Malbec (Oak Knoll District)
description: Vanilla oak and cola flavors are given additional richness by way of jammy blueberry fruit and toast. The structure is muddled and fleshy.

title: Medlock Ames 2015 Bell Mountain Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is soft and quietly tannic, with strong flavors of baked plum, tar and black licorice. The texture has a leathery, grainy aspect to it that provides complexity.

title: Quivira 2017 Alder Grove Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine has a nice layering of white peach and pea shoot and retains a light-hearted texture and body weight on the palate. It finishes grainy with a nutty element.

title: Twisted Cedar 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This is a well-made moderately flavorful wine that captures the varietal's apple and butter character along with decent balance and a smooth texture.

title: Black Ink 2016 Red (California)
description: A touch of sweetness softens this fruity and herbaceous medium-bodied wine. It has strawberry aromas, a veggie note in the flavors and very little tannin in the texture.

title: Karah Estate 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky oak and a dip of char dominate the palate of this wine, which offers subtle, crunchy red fruit and a touch of dried herb.

title: Peter Paul Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is brawny and shy in fruit, exhibiting a touch of red cherry in the background. Sticky tannins make themselves felt, dotted in leather and clove.

title: Riaza 2015 Standard Zinfandel (Mokelumne River)
description: An earthy meaty element goes along with very ripe grapey raisiny fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine. It is ripe enough to seem slightly sweet and sugary, and has light tannins for a smooth texture.

title: Spann Vineyards 2014 Mayacamas Range Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: With additions of 12% Malbec, 7% Cabernet Franc and 6% Petit Verdot, this red is spicy and full of heat, with an astringent note of dried herb. The tannins are substantial and fruit dull.

title: Twisted Cedar 2017 Moscato (Clarksburg)
description: This dessert-style wine smells sweet and tastes sweeter. It has abundant floral nutty honeyed flavors, a soft texture and low acidity.

title: Ca' Momi 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Leathery and tobacco dominate in this wine, which is marked by a robust aspect of oak and mild structure.

title: Midnight 2014 Full Moon Red (Paso Robles)
description: Extracted black-currant, grape-seed and licorice aromas show on the nose of this table wine. It's quite thick and nearly sweet on the palate with blackberry-sauce flavors.

title: Sunstone 2017 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Aromas of asphalt lead into roasted coffee, caramel and fresh boysenberry on the layered nose of this bottling. The palate is delicious with flavors of boysenberry pie in vanilla-spiked crust, with pinches of lavender erupting toward the finish.

title: Dawn's Dream 2017 Rachael Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Part of a three-sister series, this bottling offers aromas of subtle raspberry compote with thyme, lavender and white pepper. Snappy flavors of raspberry and cranberry skin pop on the palate, rounded out by sage and pine needle, and framed by a firm texture.

title: Daou 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of black plum, black olive and violet lead into a texturally dynamic palate loaded with ripe but not overdone black currant, baking spice and vanilla flavors. Strong acidity drives the finish.

title: August West 2017 Cortada Alta Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's a slight snap of red fruit on the nose of this bottling, but the stronger impression is of earth, with soil, clay and wet cement aromas arising. The clean and mellow palate packs in plenty of baking spice, red plum and a slight hint of game.

title: Kivelstadt Cellars 2016 Father's Watch Red (North Coast)
description: This dramatic, medium-bodied wine does a great job of emulating its French Rhône forbearers as it offers fruity spicy earthy complexity on a big structure, complemented by a full mouthfeel and firm tannins. While tempting to drink now, it will improve through at least 2025. Blended from Carignane, Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre.

title: Landmark 2016 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A richer style of Pinot Noir, this bottling starts with aromas of cherry juice, roasted berries, earthy minerals and herbs. It's potent on the palate, where black plum and baking spice flavors overcome the underlying earth elements.

title: Margerum 2018 Riviera Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: This Grenache-based pink is always in the running for rosé of the year. It's very light in the glass with aromas of delicate strawberry and crushed white rocks. The palate is a textural masterpiece, grabbing hold with chalky grip and not letting go as flavors of wild strawberry and pinched herbs show brightly.

title: Morgan 2017 Twelve Clones Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Snappy raspberry and sweet hibiscus aromas are layered with dewy herbs on the fresh nose of this bottling. The palate is both high toned and fruity, with fresh flavors of raspberry, dried rose petal and Earl Grey tea riding on zippy acidity.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This is savory style of Cab from a mountainside site, starting with aromas of roast beef, crushed asphalt and dark seared elderberry fruits. Black plum and more elderberry show on the sip, but the focus of the smoothed out tannic profile is showcasing rocky soil-driven flavors, with hints of olive and charred meat toward the finish.

title: Saintsbury 2017 Pratt Vineyard Sexton Road Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: High-toned citrus and rhubarb greet the palate in this impressively well-made wine, that is expansive on the palate in medium-bodied weight and breadth of flavor. Structured and complex, it has teases of baking spice and earth throughout as a succulent finish builds.

title: Bouchaine 2017 Las Brisas Riesling (Carneros)
description: Rare in Carneros, this varietal wine is expressive in melon, honey, petrol and crisp acidity. Balanced and delightfully vibrant, it has a gulpability that's hard to deny, a creaminess to the midpalate that pleases and a graceful lemony finish.

title: Furthermore 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Quite light in color, this bottling from an iconic vineyard offers ripe aromas of red cherry and sumac on the nose. Thyme, lavender and rose petals make for a very floral entry to the sip, where raspberry compote and wild herb flavors complete the picture.

title: Margerum 2017 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Hibiscus, rose petals, light raspberry, crushed stone and a compellingly earthy funk show on the nose of this lighter style of Grenache by Doug Margerum. Red plum, hibiscus and peppery spices arise on the sip, which is a delicious pairing for sunny weather and lighter fare.

title: Paper Street 2016 The Narrator Red (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh aromas of blackberry, lilac and lavender make for a lifted entry to this blend of 64% Mourvèdre, 27% Grenache and 9% Syrah from the region's pioneering Dusi family. Bright acidity delivers flavors of mulberry, plum, roasted meat and dried flowers on the palate.

title: Rudd 2017 Crossroads Sauvignon Blanc (Mount Veeder)
description: This white represents 100% organically grown estate grapes, blending in 11% Sauvignon Gris and 8% Sémillon. Lively in lemon rind, melon, peach and grapefruit, it has a stony minerality that gives it an edge of complexity and intrigue, with a lush body weight and texture.

title: Samsara 2015 Turner Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tart cranberry and earthy herbs of bay leaf meet with a hint of lush black plum on the nose of this bottling. Sagebrush flavors show on the palate against a pomegranate backdrop, offering a fresh and herby style.

title: Armida 2016 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy, tense and tightly woven in textured tannin and integrated oak, this wine shines in strawberry puree and pomegranate—bright, crunchy red fruit, with a touch of richness. Full bodied and densely packed, it offers lasting notes of baking spice and black tea.

title: Bold 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Sommelier-turned-winemaker Chris Miller is acutely aware of value in the Pinot Noir market, and this is a new leader in that category. Bing cherry, roasted pork and pepper show on the nose, while the palate packs tangy pomegranate with bay leaf, juniper and wild sage.

title: Carol Shelton 2016 Cox Vineyard Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This big and bold wine finds a great balance between ripeness and structure, so it's packed full of fruit and oak spices without being sweet and cloying. Blackberry and boysenberry flavors are shaded by hints of vanilla, nutmeg and cinnamon while a creamy texture carries everything along through a lingering finish.

title: Epiphany 2016 Rodney's Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rich red-fruit aromas meet with rose petals and loamy soil on the concentrated nose of this bottling. Flavors of rose petal and lavender consume the palate, giving depth to the crisp pomegranate and red-currant elements on this lively, textural wine.

title: St. Francis 2016 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: Thick, rich and spicy, this wine is robust in tannin structure and powerfully dense black fruit. For fans of a fuller style, it delivers plenty of concentration around accents of leather, clove and cigar.

title: Sevtap 2017 Autumn Claret (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Cherry and berry aromas are lifted by cola, incense and Dr Pepper elements on the nose of this blend of 56% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 19% Petit Verdot. Fennel-bulb and mint flavors meet with backed black currant and elderflower on the palate, where firm tannins hold up the midpalate.

title: The Insider 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dense aromas of black currant, earthy herbs, tobacco and pencil shavings show on the nose of this bottling. Brighter touches of plum and mulberry power the palate, where chopped herbs and graphite flavors add complexity.

title: Las Positas 2016 Estate Coccineous Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Spices and figs in the aroma lead to very rich, ripe and indulgent fruit and fig flavors that coat the palate and linger on the finish. The blend, based on Tempranillo, is full-bodied, complex and concentrated with little obvious oak but a great supply of appealing, mouthfilling flavors.

title: Fallon Place 2017 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)
description: This is a bright, light and high-toned wine from a cool site, densely packed in tart layers of earthy lemon and green apple. It has a floral component of honeysuckle that accents the nose and palate well.

title: DRNK 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light in salmon color, this opens in a floral flourish of rose, lavender and freshly cut hay. Firm in acidity and texture, it shines in deft layers of nuanced strawberry and Meyer lemon, the fruit seasoned in dried herb and a touch of white pepper.

title: Makana 2014 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Robust tannin structure defines an expansive palate of generous red cherry, cassis and toasted oak in this varietal wine, which is blended with small percentages of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. From the mighty mountain appellation, it shows earthy sage and lavender throughout.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tight, tart layers of stone fruit and apple highlight an increasingly soft, appealing midpalate. It shows integrated oak, tannin and weight for a highly appealing result.

title: Purple Dragon 2017 Tres Ninos Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Stony aromas of loam and crushed slate meet with slight hints of red fruit and red spice on the mineral-driven nose of this bottling. The palate is focused on more crushed stone flavors along with hints of boysenberry, all framed by an intense structure.

title: Rhodopsin 2017 Alba Landa Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This tiny-production white undergoes no malolactic fermentation and is aged in neutral French oak, the better to capture its crisp, light-bodied acidity. Wet stone, white flower and crisp apple give it definition beyond the austere texture and lasting earthiness.

title: Timark 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Sanguine and floral on the nose, this wine offers rustic flavors of red and black fruit around a weighty, dense palate. It shows lots of concentration and power, finishing on savory swirls of gunpowder and cigar.

title: Lafond 2016 Lafond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Hearty aromas of kirsch, star anise and licorice show on the nose of this estate bottling. The structure is also hefty on the palate, where black-plum and elderberry flavors are lifted with a touch of elderflower and held up by strong acid and firm tannins.

title: Byron Blatty 2017 Undertake Red (Los Angeles County)
description: Lighter aromas of red cherry, smoke and licorice show on the nose of this blend of 60% Zinfandel, 25% Petite Sirah, 10% Merlot and 5% Syrah. Riper elderberry flavors arise on the palate and lead into more savory tones of smoked beef, pepper and more licorice.

title: Dubost 2017 Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Candied blackberry and boysenberry-jam aromas are enhanced by gingerbread spice on the nose of this slightly sweet-smelling Syrah. Roasted strawberry-jam and licorice-spice flavors show on the flavorful palate.

title: Kunde 2018 Magnolia Lane Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This white offers sharp, tangy flavors of grapefruit, green apple and lemon. Lively acidity keeps it fresh through the midpalate and long, lingering finish.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2016 Jemrose Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine succeeds in its broadly expansive palate of firm tannin and juicy midpalate of fresh cherry and strawberry. Lavender, black pepper, compost and floral elements of anise and earth combine to give it welcome intrigue.

title: Keller Estate 2016 Rotie Syrah-Viognier (Petaluma Gap)
description: This Rhône-inspired wine is thick and densely packed in tannin and meaty garrigue. The elusive fruit is a mix of blackberry and currant, with herbal, earthy undertones of tomato leaf, tobacco and black licorice.

title: Louis M. Martini 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Tones of clove, bay leaf and sage ride over a core of big black fruit in this youthfully tannic wine. An accent of tobacco arises on the midpalate and leads to a robust, lasting peppery finish.

title: Zotovich 2016 Z Heritage Grenache-Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean aromas of violets and lilacs meet with fresh black plums and white pepper on the nose of this bottling. The palate is complex and complete with flavors of tart blackberry, black currant and lavender, with high acid and taut tannins framing it all.

title: Entropy Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine shows quite a bit of attractive oak influence that reveals as cedar, cinnamon and clove in the aromas, while good, concentrated black-cherry and blackberry flavors fill the middle. The wine is big and broad, mouthfilling and moderately tannic.

title: Sojourn 2017 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Brawny yet bright in tangy orange peel, cranberry and strawberry, this well-made wine from a well-known and coveted site is impressive in its breadth and complexity. With thirst-quenching acidity it fills the palate with fruit, spice and oak in equal measure.

title: Spear 2017 Block 19 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Intriguing aromas of thyme, crushed peppercorn, bay leaf and nori show on the nose. The flavor profile is fascinating and unique in flavors of seaweed, tar, boysenberry and green olive. It is a great cool-climate expression for those who seek the savory funk.

title: Stolpman 2016 Ruben's Block Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Candied boysenberry, lilac and lavender aromas make for a very elegant aromatic entry to this bottling from a special block of vines. The palate is deeply layered and complex, combining smooth black-currant flavors with slightly minty herbs and a light dusting of cracked black pepper.

title: Three Sticks 2017 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Nutty, buttery and bright, this is an impressive, memorable and complex wine from the great Petaluma Gap site (situated between 300 and 800 feet in elevation)and one of the coolest-climate of all the producer's wines. Fresh layers of apple, pear, melon and lime meld with ease, supple in tannin and beautifully wrapped in nuanced oak.

title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Clydesdale Estate Vineyard Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A beautiful nose of cassis, caramel, charred pork, bacon fat, white pepper and mocha kick this off. Espresso, teriyaki and grilled meats complete the savory picture of the palate.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Hawkeye Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a tremendously impressive wine from the producer's high-elevation estate situated at 2,400 feet. Rich tones of vanilla bean, cassis and raspberry liqueur open the door to a soft, integrated midpalate that is complex and lengthy.

title: Silenus 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine from the Oak Knoll District is inviting in blackberry and huckleberry fruit, while the dark oak is supportive and complementary. There's a layering of baking spice that lingers on the full-bodied texture and density of the wine, which has intriguing side notes of gunpowder and violet.

title: Three Sticks 2017 One Sky Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This is made from the first vineyard farmed organically by the producer and sitting at 1,400-feet in a cool pocket in the appellation. Citrus-driven brightness rules the palate, following by a creamy pear flavor. The oak and tannins are powerful yet integrated.

title: Amador Cellars 2016 Ottimista Vineyard Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: This is a beautiful wine that's easy to sip, rich in both fruity and savory flavors and shows good depth and length. Ripe red cherries and sour cherries mingle with hints of sage, leather and tobacco, while the texture is velvety. Fine-grained tannins and good acidity frame it well.

title: Chamisal 2016 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Deep dark black-currant and acai fruit meet with violet and other strong floral aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate packs lilac, jasmine and black raspberry into an unending display of purple flavors, even touching on lavender by the finish.

title: Cline 2016 Single Vineyard Series Live Oak Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: Toasty, doughy aromas and gorgeous blackberry and black-cherry flavors make this full-bodied wine hard to resist. Aged in new French oak, the wine has a subdued spiciness that dissolves into the perfectly ripe fruit flavors grown on old-fashioned head-trained vines.
designation: Single Vineyard Series Live Oak Vineyard

title: David Bruce 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This has a lovely array of baking spice and cola on the palate, framed in earthy freshness and energetic red fruit. Structured in firm, supportive tannins, it offers length and plenty of power that tastes fruit forward and complex.

title: Harney Lane 2016 Lizzy James Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This deep, ripe and concentrated wine practically bursts with luscious dark-berry and black-cherry flavors that benefit from subtle oak accents of vanilla, cinnamon and chocolate. It is full bodied, mouthfilling and has just enough tannic grip for good balance.

title: Long Meadow Ranch 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Delicious and exotic fruit flavors light up this elegant, concentrated wine. Rhubarb, black-cherry and spiced plum scents are followed by equally generous fruit flavors and deft touches of spicy oak that add nuances of baking spices and black tea.

title: Mike and Molly Hendry 2016 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)
description: From dry-farmed vines grown on the estate, this wine offers soft layers of juicy plum and cherry flavors. Savory seasonings of black pepper and leather add complementary character and earthiness to the overall well-made offering.

title: Pine Ridge 2015 Fortis Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This robust wine was given 27 months in 100% new French oak and is built for aging. Structured and dense in tannin, and blended with 3% Malbec, it shows a wealth of big juicy black fruit, coconut, toasted oak and elongated tannins. Enjoy best from 2025 through 2030.

title: Sojourn 2017 Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is lovely in aromatics of rose water and rose petal, with a spicy peppercorn element on the opening palate. Leather, forest and dark cherry fruit highlight a moderate amount of weight and richness, boosted by lively persistent acidity.

title: Stephen Ross 2016 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling by veteran Stephen Dooley shows boysenberry cream aromas alongside Dr  Pepper and root beer on the attention-grabbing nose. Very powerful on the sip, the wine combines ripe boysenberry and violet with bright acid and an underlying tannic texture. It's intensely delicious now, but be patient and drink 2020–2036.

title: Tablas Creek 2018 Patelin de Tablas Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Very light pink with a hint of yellow in the glass, this blend of 76% Grenache, 20% Mourvèdre and 4% Counoise from nine vineyards offers aromas of chalky lemon and nectarine on the delicate nose. The texture is grippy with chalk on the palate, offering flavors of strawberry, pluot flesh and a spritz of citrus.

title: Thacher 2016 Solo Concert Coastview Vineyard Syrah (Monterey)
description: Rounded aromas of roasted boysenberry and black plum gain complexity with hints of tar and pepper on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard that sits 2,200 feet above the Salinas Valley. The palate is quite cohesive, expertly melding flavors of blackberry jam, roasting herbs, black pepper and strong acidity.

title: Rideau 2017 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Loads of purple flowers and rose petals meet with pomegranate, cranberry, dried sage and turned earth on the nose of this bottling. There's an earthy core of dried oregano and peppercorns on the palate, which spice up the richer red-fruit backdrop of cherry and pomegranate.

title: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft in texture and accented in smoky, toasted oak, this estate wine blends in 13% Merlot and 3% each of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. It offers lush layers of tangy black fruit, clove, sage and a touch of warmth.

title: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From the producer's own Mount George Vineyard this 100% varietal wine is sumptuous in blackberry, cherry and a forthright nose of clove. Dark and brooding, it offers depth and rounded texture, a richness on the midpalate that leads to earthy notes of dried herb, cedar and crushed rock.
designation: Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard

title: Starr 2016 Rising Starr Cabernet Franc (Nevada County)
description: Powerful and concentrated, this full-bodied wine offers interesting complexity, well-integrated oak and some of the spicy black-peppery nuances of the grape variety. Aromas of cedar, sage and wood smoke lead to a saturated flavor of blackberry and black cherry wrapped in firm but not tight tannins. Best through 2025.

title: Highland Valley 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: This is an impressively dense bottling, with lush aromas of black currant, tar and a hint of smashed black olive. The palate is pleasantly soft in texture, with well-balanced acidity, delivering flavors of blackberry paste and cracked peppercorns.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine offers a complex nose of black pepper, licorice and earthy forest. Blackberry and fig form the core of the palate, with lifted acidity and structured tannins providing the frame.

title: Kenzo Estate 2016 Rindo Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending 48% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot and smaller percents of Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, this is a compelling sum of many parts: woody and powerfully built. Dark cherry, sage, clove and cigar wrap around integrated tannin and robust ripeness that grips.

title: E16 2017 Baby Rattlesnake Vineyard Syrah (El Dorado)
description: Beautiful and concentrated black-fruit flavors on a generous, fine-grained texture make this full-bodied wine hard to resist. Deep black cherry and blueberry meet creamy cappuccino and baking-spice notes on the palate.

title: Michael David 2017 Ancient Vine Cinsault (Lodi)
description: Delicious and almost delicate, this is a soft fruit-laden wine from some of Lodi's oldest vines. Gentle plum and raspberry flavors are surrounded by oak spice accents. A silky texture, with just a touch of tannin tops it off nicely.

title: Miraflores 2016 Estate Malbec (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine is generous, ripe and structured, wrapping firm fine-grained tannins around ripe blueberry, dark chocolate and blackberry flavors that are deep and broad. Best through 2026.

title: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Blended with 5% Sémillon, this wine is lushly aromatic in jasmine, flint and dried herb. A tiny hint of fresh-cut grass nips at the edge of the light-bodied palate, with fresh apricot and peach at the core.

title: Waxwing 2017 Cuvée Bohème Syrah (California)
description: The wild side of Syrah comes through in this complex, earthy and not overtly fruity wine. Hints of wood smoke and sage, dusty earth and singed rosemary combine for an intriguing savory profile that's well supported by moderate tannins.

title: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Made from 100% Merlot from the producer's historic site, this wine saw time in French and Hungarian oak. Flavors of currant, orange and dried herb provide a complex landscape, held together by sinewy tannins.

title: Emeritus 2016 Pinot Hill West Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is the yin to Pinot Hill East's yang, an exploration of east-west sides within one vineyard in the Sebastopol Hills. Winemaker Dave Lattin unearths a wealth of focused, elegant dark cherry, orange and forest floor in this balanced red, which shows integrated oak and a lasting taste of black tea.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Rockaway Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a textured and leathery red that offers spice, earth and robustly ripe fruit. Brick, tar, raspberry and currant flavors are seasoned in dried herb and tobacco, with firm tannins lending support.

title: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the elusive appellation, this impresses in its layering of rich toffee, chocolate and blackberry plum. Sumptuous, soft and voluptuously built, it combines fruit and spice around toasted oak and firm tannin.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2016 Riserva Collection Estate Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Baking spices from nutmeg to vanilla pack this full-bodied and gently textured wine full of enticing aromas and complex flavors. It is rich and concentrated on the palate, has a creamy mouthfeel and lingering finish.

title: Barbieri 2016 Aureum Red (Central Coast)
description: Dense black currant, intense smoke, cocoa and tangy black-plum-skin aromas show on the nose of this blend. Polished tannins on the palate present more dark fruits, from currant to elderberry, with overtones of roasted meat and campfire—impressive weight without being overripe.

title: Wolff 2017 Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: Coming from one of the most coastal appellations in California, it's no wonder than this bottling pushes the extreme cool-climate agenda like crazy. Vivid aromas of eucalyptus, underripe boysenberries, wet campfire and tobacco ash descend upon a sanguine palate of charred pine needle, black peppercorn and fresh meaty beef blood.

title: Fort Ross Vineyard 2016 Stagecoach Road Fort Ross Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Earthy in forest and tea, this well-made, elegantly textured wine is tangy in crisp layers of blood orange and cherry. With a tannic weight on the midpalate, it eases into a lovely finish accented in sea spray and wild mushroom.

title: Neyers 2016 AME Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Robust in spice and oak, this 100% varietal wine is well structured and full of earthy intensity. Black cherry, cassis and an earthy undercurrent of gravel and rock give it complexity. Enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Sandoval Mergenov 2018 Rockets Red Rosé (Edna Valley)
description: The rosé explosion is leading into new styles that are well done, including this darker Grenache-based approach, which begins with ripe cherry, strawberry and wet rock aromas. It then sizzles onto the palate, with flavors of cherry sorbet, proving lively and bright in flavor despite the dark color.

title: Sojourn 2017 Reuling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is light and fresh in style, with a moderate amount of body weight midpalate. Light in oak and well structured, it impresses in dark cherry, blueberry and black tea. The site is a small cool-climate parcel planted to three different clones in Goldridge soils.

title: Thacher 2015 Original Copy Red (Adelaida District)
description: This blend of 66% Cabernet Sauvignon and 34% Cabernet Franc is done in a more savory style, with aromas of black pepper, dried olive, charred oak, boysenberry and a slightly rising floral kick. The black-plum and blackberry flavors are framed by more charred wood on the palate and lifted by pepper-dust spice.

title: Thacher 2016 Oddly Natural Red (Adelaida District)
description: Intense aromas of dark blackberry and cooked black plum meet with earthy herbs and root beer on the nose of this blend of 43% Grenache, 38% Syrah and 19% Counoise. The palate offers flavors of incense, roasted berry and grilled meat, proving to be a heavier blend.

title: Wise Villa 2016 Estate Merlot (Sierra Foothills)
description: Frankly oaky, this swaggering wine shows alluring cedar, nutmeg and vanilla aromas followed by good ripe fruit flavors and more baking-spice nuances. The mouthfeel is broad and rich due to a full body and lots of fine-grained tannins.

title: August West 2017 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Freshly smashed pomegranate and mulberry meet with flashes of licorice and nutmeg on the nose of this bottling. The ripe cherry flavors are rich on the palate but cut by green sage, pine needle and other interesting herbal elements.

title: Blair Estate 2015 Delfina's Vineyard The Reserve Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Earthy aromas of iron and blood give depth to the cranberry, dried red cherry and sour strawberry aromas on the nose of this reserve bottling. The palate's red fruits are leveled by orange-rind and orange-juice flavors, with a bit of mint adding an herbal tone. The acidity is sharp.

title: Buena Vista 2017 Chateau Buena Vista Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Aromas of black tea and cardamom greet the nose, with layers of blueberry and blackberry in the background. Flavors of cranberry, cherry and orange provide freshness on the full-bodied palate and accentuate the underlying acidity.

title: Chappellet 2016 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is made entirely from mountain fruit along the eastern hills of the Napa Valley, including the producer's estate. It is blended with 12% Petit Verdot and 9% Malbec. Smoky oak, clove and tobacco accent red fruit and a savory bottom line of cedar and sage. It's rich but well behaved.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Lovely mint and cedar aromas draw attention, while rich oaky, chocolaty flavors flood the palate with ripeness. Full body, moderate tannins and a sense of completeness and generosity make the wine especially attractive.

title: De Loach 2016 Maboroshi Vineyard Sebastopol Hills Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: White pepper on the nose signals this is an interesting cool-climate wine, with a delicate palate of soft integrated tannin to match. Cherry, pomegranate and rose petal accent the palate, with hints of orange peel and dried herb.

title: Enkidu 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: This thick rich wine benefits from the additions of 15% Carignane, 6% Alicante Bouschet and 4% Petite Sirah, the entirety given a year in neutral oak. Peppery and velvety smooth, it's intense and complex, with strong flavors of black cherry and licorice.

title: Flanagan 2017 Sun Chase Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: There is very little of this wine this vintage, but what exists has substantial presence. Tightly wound tannins give it a structured intensity and power, within floral fruity elements of spice, black tea and clove. The fruit is bright in wild strawberry and raspberry.

title: Inman Family 2018 Endless Crush Pratt Vine Hill Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Crisp, dry and made with intent, this is a meaty, substantive vineyard-designate that shows structure and underlying power beneath its high-toned intensity. Wild strawberry and blood orange rise to the top of the flavor profile, with teases of dried herb.
designation: Endless Crush Pratt Vine Hill Rosé of

title: J. Lohr 2016 Highlands Bench Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Aromas of black cherry, vanilla, cola and loamy minerality lead into a mouthcoating palate of boysenberry, milk chocolate and oaky coconut flavors. This is a no-holds-barred Pinot Noir, with a power that would be suitable for grilled rib eye.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Stature Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Thick tannins wrap around juicy jammy flavors of blueberry and black cherry in this concentrated and savory, earthy wine. Additional aspects of dried herb, tobacco and a touch of vanilla round out the full-bodied experience.

title: Pezzi King 2015 Hales Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This has a peppery entry that seasons a core of thick black fruit, leather and tobacco. There's a hint of flint and black licorice in there as well. The tannins are significantly built and supportive, adding weight and impressive structure.

title: Stolpman 2017 La Cuadrilla Red (Ballard Canyon)
description: Dense aromas of baked black plum, lilac and cherry cola show on the nose of this red blend that is dedicated to and managed by the winery's vineyard crew. Cola, roasted fennel and grilled strawberries and red plums show on the palate, which is framed by tense tannins.

title: Tablas Creek 2017 Patelin de Tablas Red (Paso Robles)
description: There is a great core of black plum and dark berry to the nose of this blend of 48% Syrah, 32% Grenache, 16% Mourvèdre and 4% Counoise, but also a fresh rose-petal component. It's brisk on the palate with crisp damson plum, raspberry and melon flavors, accented by a slight gravel minerality.

title: Relief Wines 2018 Firestorm Chardonnay (California)
description: Okay for casual occasions, this sturdy wine offers herbal savory aromas, apricot and apple-cider flavors and a lively texture. The Waugh family produces it and has pledged all profits to charity.

title: Oak Grove 2018 Family Reserve Viognier (California)
description: A lean core of crisp fruit is wrapped in a buttery layer that weighs it down. The wine is light bodied and spare on the palate.

title: Pezzi King 2016 The Jester Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine has a sweet nose of oak and tobacco, its core thick in black fruit and plenty of heat.

title: The White Knight 2017 Viognier (Clarksburg)
description: Assertive and earthy, this full-bodied wine gives off a petrol aroma, offers strong menthol and fruit flavors and has vivid acidity for a tangy mouthfeel.

title: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Jammy and gushy, this inexpensive, generous and fruity wine tastes grapey like Welch's and has a soft full texture. It's simple and tasty.

title: Wine Cube 2018 Rosé (California)
description: Strong floral aromas and Moscato-like flavors come with a semisweet balance in this soft and medium-bodied wine.

title: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: An intense smoky aroma and equally dramatic charred oak flavors dress up this rich-textured, full-bodied wine. Butter and vanilla accents emerge and linger on the palate.

title: Frey 2016 Biodynamic Merlot (Mendocino)
description: This organic wine was produced from biodynamically grown grapes and it takes a little attitude adjustment to enjoy it. Without the benefit of added sulfites it has an unusually earthy smoky flavor and a quite dry texture.

title: Wilson Creek 2018 Winemaker's Select Riesling (Temecula Valley)
description: Extremely vinous on the nose, this wine smells of sour lime and dried apple. The palate is pleasantly sweet at first before the strong vinous character returns.

title: Cardella 2015 Vineyard 22 Sangiovese (California)
description: Rather earthy aromas give way to good, ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors in this firm-textured and full-bodied wine.

title: Three Stars 2017 Rosé (California)
description: A bright color is the most lively aspect of this otherwise straightforward, subdued and medium-bodied wine-in-a-can.

title: Beringer 2017 Founder's Estate Merlot (California)
description: Medium bodied and apparently semisweet, this wine is very fruity in aroma, and simple and candied in flavor.

title: Frey 2017 Organic Merlot (North Coast)
description: A vegetal, smoky aroma intrudes on the dark-cherry flavors in this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. It has no added sulfites.

title: Layer Cake 2017 Rosé (California)
description: Earthy, murky aromas and flavors rob this wine of the expected freshness and fruitiness. It's definitely on the funky side, maybe reduced.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2017 Estate Reserve Merlot (Fair Play)
description: This wine is extremely tannic in texture, full bodied and shows concentrated and rather tart cranberry and black-cherry flavors.

title: Frey 2016 Organic Viognier (Lodi)
description: This jumbled wine is deep gold in color, offers extremely nutty and cidery aromas followed by flavors that are lean on the one hand and honeyed on the other. It's not easy being organic.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2018 Villa Antico Pétillant Naturel Malvasia Bianca (California)
description: This semisweet wine smells dusty, floral and peppery and tastes like apple cider and honey.

title: Bel Vino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a serviceable, simple wine that's medium bodied, and offers veggie flavors along with prunes and black grapes.

title: Klinker Brick 2018 Vorgänger White (Lodi)
description: Earthy grapey aromas lead to sweet and veggie-like flavors that strike a minor chord.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Hawk Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: An outstanding vineyard-designate that doesn't get made every year, this is the year to find this wine, a deliciously crisp and crunchy expression of red fruit and exotic citrus that showcases the beauty of both the site and appellation in this producer's hands. Forest floor, tea and cardamom ride along a complex thoroughfare of complex length and structure.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2017 Estate Reserve Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Fair Play)
description: This medium-bodied wine tastes straightforward, not too fruity, and emphasizes mineral, almond and light citrus flavors.

title: Folie à Deux 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Sanguine and savory, this bold, brawny ripe wine is robustly built, with concentrated flavors of raspberry and blackberry. Tannic and oaky, it ends in a flourish of wild vanilla.

title: Wilson Creek 2018 Chloe Vineyard Viognier (Temecula Valley)
description: Light on the nose at first, this wine opens toward aromas of honey, nectarine, Asian pear and scratched grapefruit skin. The palate is quite clean but lands with a surprisingly sweet touch, offering ripe pear-syrup flavors.

title: Benessere 2016 John's Promise Estate Red (St. Helena)
description: An unusual blend of 84% Cabernet Sauvignon and 16% Aglianico, this wine has big tannin grip and an intensity of dried cherry, strawberry and mocha. Rose-petal aromas permeate beneath.

title: Campos 2017 Estate Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)
description: This full-bodied wine is light in color for the varietal, and offers warm, plummy, black-cherry-like flavors on a broad, smooth texture that's not too tannic.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2018 Sisters Forever Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Very fruity and floral on the nose, this bottling is redolent with apple blossoms, cut pear and tropical plumeria aromas. A strong citrusy acidity powers the sip, where ripe pear flavors prove very strong.

title: Kuleto Estate 2015 Native Son Red (Napa County)
description: Blending together large portions of Malbec, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Merlot, Petite Sirah and Sangiovese, all cofermented, this is a big burly red, smoky in oak, with a moderate structure. Dusty blackberry, black pepper and meaty tannins make it rugged.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Single Vineyard Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)
description: Black as night in the glass, this is an extremely extracted wine, with layers of vanilla, caramel and black-cherry paste on the nose. The palate shows black-plum-jelly flavors along with powerful baking-spice elements.

title: Section Wines 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Slightly overcooked plums, packed rose petals, baking-spice and fruit-cake aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is spiced with cinnamon and centered on more stewed red plum and baked fruit flavors.

title: Villa San Juliette 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Green peppercorns and pasilla chile aromas make for a very herbal backdrop to this bottling, which also shows a line of blackberry on the nose. The acid is bright on the palate, holding up the bell pepper and strawberry flavors.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2018 Estate Reserve Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Fair Play)
description: This is a smooth but refreshing wine, with soft citrus flavors. It is well balanced, flavorful, and brings a touch of figgy, spicy complexity.

title: Denier-Handal 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Floral, soft and approachable, this wine has touches of vanilla oak, jammy plum and structured tannin. It finishes with a fist of grip.

title: F2 Wines 2016 TBO Great Oaks Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Los Olivos District)
description: Extracted aromas of red berry, purple flowers and peppery spice are very tangy on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very tangy with red currant and pomegranate balsamic flavors, framed by buoyant acidity and background tannins.

title: Opolo 2016 Reserve Collection Merlot (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Very extracted aromas of black cherry, stewed plum, vanilla and caramel show on the nose of this bottling. The very rich and ripe palate packs more caramel with fudge and tangy black plum.

title: Skyside 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Big in structure, this full-bodied wine shows moderate cherry and blackberry flavors and a surprisingly light midpalate before tightening up a bit with tannins on the finish.

title: Cardella 2018 Mia's Vineyard Rosé of Sangiovese (California)
description: This unusually rounded and rich wine is incredibly smooth in texture and fat enough to coat the sides of the mouth. Its watermelon and raspberry flavors are backed by full body.

title: Crosby Roamann 2015 Crosby's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Graphite, pencil and oak accent a concentrated, tannic core of big texture and flavor in this reserve-tier wine, which is blended with 10% Merlot. Tart acidity gives it a powerful counterweight to the dried herb and overall grip.

title: Kunde 2016 Reserve Century Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a meaty, substantial wine from an historic, low-yielding site planted in 1882. Vanilla, cherry and robust tannin combine with sweet tobacco before giving way to a lush, simple finish.

title: Mountain Tides 2018 Rosé of Petite Sirah (Clements Hills)
description: This is a mild, unassuming wine, light in color, light in body and light and fresh in fruit flavors.

title: Roberts & Rogers 2016 Signature Series Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this wine offers smoky oak and dried herb in abundance, with a powerful density of heat and tannin. The producer's estate vineyard is on Ehlers Lane in a warm area of the appellation.

title: Samuel Louis Smith 2017 Albatross Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Few vintners get a crack at this stunning vineyard atop the Carmel Valley, but Samuel Louis Smith does it justice. Rustic red-cherry and hearty nutmeg aromas lead into a palate full of snappy yet dark pomegranate and herbs.

title: Turnbull 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers remarkable value for the quality—a stellar commingling of cranberry, cassis and black cherry. With a robust mouthfeel of plump juicy fruit, gun smoke and firm tannin, it shows integrated oak flavors and plenty of underlying acidity to remain fresh in the glass.

title: Ancien 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a light, bright and fresh red wine, made well and restrained in its use of oak. Candied plum and cherry flavors meld effortlessly with earthy forest characteristics and a lovely jolt of Asian spice. The finish introduces a balance of black tea.

title: La Crema 2015 Bellflower Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy pomegranate and strawberry ride along a road of thick concentration and tannin in this hearty vineyard-designated red. Perfumed aromatics deftly balance the richness with a freshness of sea spray and Asian spice persisting on the long finish.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This ageworthy wine is huge, dense and concentrated, wrapping a thick layer of fine-grained tannins around plump blueberry and blackberry flavors while spicy oak shadings add some complexity and seem to offset the tannic effect. It is showy and delicious now but will drink best after 2023.

title: Renwood 2016 Petite Sirah (Amador County)
description: A wonderful profusion of opulent fruit aromas and flavors give this full-bodied wine a big delicious profile. It oozes blackberry, Concord grape and blueberry notes that fill the mouth with ripeness and stand up nicely to the wine's firm, thick tannin structure. Best through 2024.

title: V. Sattui 2016 Petite Sirah (North Coast)
description: This deeply colored and luxuriously flavored wine is brawny but well behaved. It combines luscious blackberry-jam aromas with dark-chocolate and black-cherry flavors and surrounds them with a thick but soft coat of tannins for a velvety texture. Enjoyable now through 2029.

title: Peake Ranch 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Baked cherry, wet river stone, vanilla and an array of baking spices show on the complex and rich nose of this bottling by the winery that owns this popular vineyard. There is a nice plum-skin tang to the tip of the sip, with clove spice arising atop the refreshing acidity.

title: Williams Selyem 2017 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine from a historic, old-vine site offers tones of candied cherry and ginger that are met by Christmas cake and baking spice. The palate is soft and silky in texture, with plenty of fresh, juicy acidity for balance.

title: 2131 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made to honor baseball player Cal Ripken Jr.'s 2131st consecutive game played, this 100% varietal red is grippy in flavors of coconut and black cherry, with a structured, complex and robust palate. It has richness within balanced tannin and oak, finishing with a wealth of black licorice and earth.

title: Lucienne 2016 Hook Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A ripe red-cherry aroma is cut by hints of bay leaf, rose petal and rooibos tea on nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is a strong herbal quality to the palate in tones of dried sage and Earl Grey tea, but the attention is carried by the strong cherry and red-currant flavors.

title: San Simeon 2015 Stormwatch Estate Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: This powerful, attention-grabbing blend of 46% Cabernet Sauvignon, 27% Merlot, 18% Malbec, 7% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc by the Riboli family starts with aromas of black currant, violet, roasted meat and dark chocolate. The structure is firm on the palate, where roasted coffee, dark berry and smoked meat flavors show, with espresso bean, bittersweet chocolate and tar arising as well. Drink now–2030.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Grenache (Red Hills)
description: This appetizing and full-bodied wine is worth searching out. It combines the varietal's ripe, generous aromas with an almost sinewy, tangy mouthfeel that brings out savory woodsy mineral flavors. It has very good balance, firm tannins and bracing acidity along with ripeness and roundness on the midpalate.

title: Timbre 2015 Lead Vocals Bien Nacido Old Vines Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Light red-cherry, rhubarb, strawberry and light sweet sage aromas show on the nose of this bottling by Joshua Klapper from the historic vineyard's old vines. It's light on the palate but there's a ton going on, with thyme, marjoram, sage and brown spice lifting the red-plum and pomegranate fruit, with the slightest hint of terroir funk.
designation: Lead Vocals Bien Nacido Old Vines

title: Siduri 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Winemaker Adam Lee's first crack at a Santa Barbara County blend is a hit, and he plays in the lighter end of the Pinot Noir spectrum as well. Aromas of crushed slate, red cherry and rose petals lead into a bouncy palate that's tart in flavors of pomegranate and raspberry.

title: Holly's Hill 2016 Patriarche Red (El Dorado)
description: Exotic and compelling, this full-bodied wine exudes arresting aromas of wood smoke, wild sage and black pepper, while the flavors deliver blackberry jam, molasses and beef jus. It has a big broad mouthfeel and moderate tannins for support. Recommended with something primal like a roasted game bird or wild pig ragout.

title: McNab Ridge 2015 Family Reserve Largo Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This is a quietly powerful wine that wraps deep black-cherry and cranberry flavors in a firm but smooth texture of fine-grained tannins and full body. It has a satisfying sense of depth to the ripe fruit and subtle oak-spice accents, and a polished mouthfeel that seals the deal. Best through 2025.

title: Sanguis 2015 The Modern Red (Central Coast)
description: This bottling, which spent 26 months in large-format seasoned oak, shows rich aromas of hickory, cassis and campfire on the nose. The mouthfeel is soft and lush, presenting flavors of smoked wood, rich berries, dried herbs and a savory hint of soy, with all components expertly integrated.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2017 Lester Family Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Clean and crisp aromas of Asian pear, toast with lemony butter, white flowers and white rocks show on the nose of this bottling from a coveted vineyard in the Corralitos area. There is great tension on the sip, where pear, lime peel and lychee flavors grip the palate and don't let go.

title: Seghesio 2016 Cortina Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is juicy in flavors of blackberry and cherry, with an expansive nature to the well-integrated midpalate. It offers a bold depth of fruit and spice flavors that sit well in the full-bodied frame.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2017 3D Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling's nose is delicate yet focused with aromas of lemon blossoms, lemon candy, lemon balm and lemon verbena, as well as a touch of nectarine. The sip snaps with green-citrus flavors of grapefruit before warming up toward brioche with lemon filling, all surrounding lively acidity and compelling texture. Drink now–2032.

title: Cresta Velia Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Juicy black fruit presents as robustly full bodied and layered in this powerful wine, which is both supple and strong, with length and good integration of tannins and oak. A lingering note of smoked meat adds complexity and savory intrigue.

title: Domaine Della 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Golden stony apple opens this full-bodied wine, robust in structure and tannin. Youthful oak gives it a toasty quality that works with the expressive, expansive fruit, finishing with a lasting succulence and touches of nutmeg and Meyer lemon.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's a gamy kick to the nose of this bottling, which is common in wines from this historic vineyard, as well as roasted fennel, dried chaparral and charcuterie aromas alongside the black-plum backdrop. The sip shows sour cherry and cranberry flavors before roasted pork flavors return.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This high-powered wine is saturated with aromatic, spicy and complex oak shadings that integrate nicely with the very ripe berry and dried fruit flavors. It has almost the same mouthcoating density of a Port along with a hint of sweetness on the lingering finish. It's bold, entertaining and satisfying.

title: Samsara 2017 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Toasted almonds, seared lemon peels and toasted brioche show on the inviting and nutty nose of this bottling, one of the winery's first white wines. There is great tension to the sip, where stony qualities lead into nectarine and citrus-spiked lemon-verbena tea flavors, with intriguing herbal tones throughout.

title: Schramsberg 2016 Brut Rosé Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Subtle flavors and a delicately rounded texture help this elegant, medium-bodied wine stand out. Hints of fresh bread and raspberries on the nose lead to slightly tangy flavors of ginger and white cherry on the palate. Gentle effervescence and just-right acidity lend lift.

title: Sutro 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A small-production white out of Alexander Valley, this was tank-fermented and made to capture lovely aromatics of jasmine and stone. Peach and melon flavors accent a juicy core of succulence on the midpalate, which is creamy in texture. It lingers in mineral.

title: Quest 2016 Proprietary Red (Paso Robles)
description: Austin Hope's new red blend sports compelling packaging and tasty insides, starting with rich aromas of caramel, fudge, cassis, coffee and turned loam. The palate follows through with milk-chocolate and black-cherry flavors, framed by chalky tannins and enhanced with a minty lift.

title: Diatom 2018 Santos Road Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of pineapple, pear and fresh plumeria show on the nose of this bottling by Greg Brewer. The palate zips with acidity, delivering flavors of guava, Pink Lady apple, pineapple and more ripe pear.

title: Archium 2016 Dissident G-S-M (Santa Barbara County)
description: There is a lot of herbal enhancement of sage and thyme to the red-cherry backbone of this blend of 40% Grenache, 34% Syrah and 26% Mourvèdre. The palate snaps with flavors of black raspberry and cherry foam, then is lifted by baking spice, a chalky texture and fresh acidity.

title: Blair 2015 Morgantini Vineyard Tasting Room Series Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Jeffrey Blair is exhibiting his region's earthy savory qualities in lightly colored yet tensely structured wines. This begins with aromas of porcini mushroom and dried strawberry on the nose before leading into delicate but lively flavors of pomegranate, dried mushrooms, pine needle, leather and dusty soils.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Saturated and dense, this full-bodied indulgent wine layers dark chocolate over blueberries aromas and pours ripe, almost thick blackberry jam over the palate. Accents of wood smoke and black pepper add a dimension of complexity, while firm tannins support all the fruit. Best through 2025.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2015 Piocho Reserve Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This is a very fresh and pleasantly fruity Bordeaux-style blend of 56% Cabernet Franc, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Merlot, 3% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot, starting with aromas of ripe dark strawberry and cracked pepper. The palate combines that dark-red fruit with green peppercorn and woody spices, making for an elegant yet immediately enjoyable sip.

title: Rancho Victoria 2016 Petite Sirah (Amador County)
description: Spicy and complex, this full-bodied wine has an alluring aroma and generous black-fruit flavors. Scents of cedar, cinnamon and tobacco from aging in 50% new American barrels give it a spicy start, then lip-smacking blackberry and cocoa flavors take over.
