An abundance of fine-grained tannin shapes the mouthfeel and will help it age. Best through 2024.

title: Sandler 2016 Lazare Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: This is a savory and mineral-driven style of Cab, starting with aromas of crushed graphite, roasted pasilla chile, black olive, damp soil and cassis. The palate is layered with oregano and marjoram flavors that give depth to the black-currant and roasted beef flavors.

title: Stringer 2016 Harrison Clark Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Aromas of roasted coffee, blackberry syrup, black pepper and wood ash show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is tart with black-plum skin but made complex with hints of lavender and roasted meats, proving very cohesive and seamless on the sip.

title: Spoto 2016 Special Select Amber Knolls Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This is a firmly textured, concentrated and muscular wine from Beckstoffer's Lake County property that will need time to open. Currently, tightly wound black cherry, cranberry and blueberry notes are reined in by integrated but chewy tannins, while rich, luxurious chocolate and cherry flavors emerge on the palate and grow on the finish. Best from 2023.

title: Diora 2017 La Splendeur du Soleil Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Bright aromas of lemon candy, sea spray and lime balm meets with a touch of pastry on the nose. Richer flavors of white peach and sea salt ride a light and bright texture on the palate, which grows more oaky toward the finish.

title: Dogwood & Thistle 2017 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Elegant and focused, this medium-bodied wine offers great fruit intensity, fine balance and a light touch on the oak. It's made from Pommard clone grapes grown in a noted Mendocino coast vineyard, using 25% whole clusters in the fermentation and neutral barrels. It's not ripe but has tasty, concentrated black-cherry flavors touched with rhubarb and blackberry. Best through 2025.

title: Granite Lion 2017 Grand Oak Red (South Coast)
description: This winery is exploring the terroir east of San Diego near the Mexican border, and this blend of all five Bordeaux varieties shows much promise. Dried blackberry, leather, anise and pencil shavings on the nose lead into a cedar-laced palate of black cherry graphite and dried marjoram.

title: Naggiar 2018 Mamma Mia Estate White (Sierra Foothills)
description: Tasting fresh and fruity, this medium-bodied wine offers fragrant apple and peach aromas, nicely tangy apricot and peach flavors and a hint of sweetness in the otherwise crisp texture.

title: Roblar 2018 Cuvée Blanc White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Nicely rounded aromas of yellow apple, mango, guava and buttered toast show on the nose of this blend of 59% Sauvignon Blanc and 41% Viognier. It's clean and fresh on the palate, where citrus and roasted apple flavors reign.

title: Tantara 2017 Tondre Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's a lemon-peel tang to the nose of this bottling, along with white peach and toast with lemon-jam aromas. The palate is toasty as well, though the tangy lemon-peel flavor is most dominant, leading into a vanilla-laced finish.

title: Twisted Cedar 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Delicious dark-fruit aromas and flavors make this medium-bodied wine instantly appealing while good balance keeps it singing from sip to sip. Fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity support the ripe black-cherry and currant flavors nicely.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Gerry's Vineyard Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Rustic red-cherry aromas meet with toasty oak and touch of tobacco on the nose of this bottling. It lands with a full presence on the palate, showing rich red-cherry, cranberry and baking-spice flavors.

title: Chateau Souverain 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Aromas of mint and flowers lead to rich berry flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It offers well-integrated tannins and a mouthfilling texture that help the flavors linger on the finish.

title: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Chardonnay (California)
description: This affordable wine offers nicely interwoven oak and ripe fruit flavors. It is smooth and rich in feel, with a lingering baking spice finish.

title: Amador Cellars 2018 Estate Field Blend Rosé (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Fruity, clean and light bodied, this wine offers fresh peach and orange-blossom aromas, pleasant peach and raspberry flavors and a lightly tangy texture. It's easy to sip and enjoy.

title: Biltmore Estate 2016 Antler Hill Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: This hearty red wine has an appealing richness: the palate rustic in dried cherry, vanilla and baked plum. Expansively soft and approachable, it goes easy on the oak to allow the bold lushness of the fruit to speak.

title: Block 88 2018 You Had Me at Rose Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Fresh hibiscus, light cranberry, raspberry and wet stone aromas make for a pleasing entry to the nose of this Pinot Noir-based rosé. There is compelling texture to the sip, where ripe red plum, pluot and tangy raspberry flavors prove a bit rich but still refreshing.
designation: You Had Me at Rose Rosé of

title: Breaking Bread 2018 Grenache (Redwood Valley)
description: This wine is quite fruity and spicy in flavor, and fresh and vibrant in texture. It goes for a rather tight, nervy grip and somewhat lean, mouthwatering, fruity, leafy flavors.

title: Charles Woodson's Intercept 2017 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Rich and unctuous on the nose, this wine shows aromas of black cherries, carnation and crushed slate, mellowing out as it breathes. It lands with a black-currant snap and leads into purple fruits, framed by thin yet firm tannins.

title: Ghost Pines 2017 Winemaker's Blend Pinot Noir
description: A good balance between ripe juicy cherry flavors and a supportive structure make this medium-bodied wine easy to appreciate. Generous fruit flavors stop just short of sweet, while a tangy note of acidity keeps them lively.

title: Hungry Hawk 2017 Carmenère (San Diego County)
description: Tart raspberry, crumbled carnations and cedar aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a grape that shows potential in this region. Pomegranate and sour cherry flavors pop on the sip.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 Dolcetto (Lodi)
description: Bold oak spices meet equally bold and ripe berry flavors in this full-bodied, rich and mouthfilling wine. Aromas of freshly sawn oak and vanilla lead to plump blackberry and boysenberry flavors and full body, but not a lot of tannin.

title: Leoness 2015 Meritage (Temecula Valley)
description: Sour aromas of old leather and tart berries mix aspects of the Old and New Worlds on this bottling. The palate blends brighter cherry and raspberry fruit with that earthy leathery kick.

title: Leoness 2016 Signature Selection Syrah (Temecula)
description: There are strong tarry tones to the nose of this bottling as well as dried blackberry and peppercorn aromas. It's lighter to medium bodied on the palate, where dark-red fruit, carnations, pepper-dust and charred wood flavors emerge from a reductive core.

title: Maddalena 2018 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)
description: Key lime pith, crisp rainwater and Pink Lady apple aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a fresh line of lime and green pear down the middle of the sip, which is simple but refreshing.

title: Masia de la Vinya 2015 Orquestra Syrah-Mourvèdre (Temecula Valley)
description: Very earthy and leathery on the nose, this wine surrounds a core of dark-red fruit. There are grippy tannins on the sip, where black-plum and black-pepper flavors meet with more turned earth.

title: Point & Line 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Intense aromas of rich cherry, clove and smashed plum show on the nose of this bottling from a steep hilltop vineyard. The palate is very full and lavish with dark plum and strong baking-spice flavors.

title: Quivira 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: High-toned acidity supports bright, fresh flavors of peach, apricot and green apple in this well-made light-bodied white. Floral aromas of jasmine and apple blossom complement the fruit.

title: Raymond 2015 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Labelled in velvet, the thick dense texture of this wine is equally soft and richly built, with substantial tannin and oak on display. Bright red cherry and cassis are interwoven between the powerful ripeness.

title: Ron Rubin 2015 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is an acid-driven, light-bodied wine that offers elements of black tea and forest floor. Amidst the savory tones are tasty flavors of cranberry, brambly cherry and orange zest.

title: Villa San Juliette 2017 Small Lot Selection Reserve Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: A watermelon aroma meets a sharp lime edge on the nose of this zesty wine. It's tightly woven on the palate, where a chalky mouthfeel and citrus-driven flavors make a good pairing.

title: Waypoint 2014 Tierra Buena Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is a reduced, thick and richly intense wine from the mountain appellation. It is robust in black fruit and grippy tannin. The fruit takes on a baked quality that works within its context of savory tobacco, clove and black pepper.

title: Whitehall Lane 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Hearty red-fruit and graham cracker richness mark this well-made wine, blended with 8% Cabernet Sauvignon. A generous tannin structure provides a framework for the ripe weight as the finish explores aspects of sweet tobacco.

title: Bonterra 2016 Equinox Made with Organic Grapes Red (California)
description: A firm texture and big, earthy black-fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine plenty of presence. It tastes of blackberry, cranberry and dark chocolate while it feels tannic and grippy on the palate. Merlot and Petite Sirah are the two main components in the blend.

title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Cougar Rock Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A reduced oaky entry leads to edgy citrus-driven acidity and a high-strung, stony briny mineral character that beguiles. Green apple, quince and Meyer lemon offer subtle fruit elements that rise up to the overall earthiness.

title: Bruliam 2016 Torrey Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an intensely earthy, soft and stemmy red, savory and exotic in black tea, cardamom and citrus undertones. On top, expect dark cherry compote and wisps of pomegranate within a medium-bodied ripeness of style.

title: Chenoweth 2017 Bootlegger's Hill Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: Made in small amounts, this white worth seeking. It's crunchy in green apple and quince, with a complementary cradling of caramel oak. The rich body weight is buoyed by bright acidity.

title: Clif Family 2015 Cold Springs Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is 100% varietal and from the producer's vineyard, planted to two clones of the variety. Clove, caramel and dusty sage flavors guide a powerful, integrated body of full ripeness, soft texture and lasting richness of graham cracker.

title: Clif Family 2015 Kit's Killer Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is made from two of the producer's properties, Cold Springs and Croquet Estate, both atop the mountain appellation. It shows the power of those sites and a drought-driven vintage. The core is dense and tannic with an intensity of baked plum and dark chocolate.

title: Darioush 2014 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. It delivers plenty of lush layered black-currant and black-cherry flavors around softened tannin and sweet vanilla oak.

title: Domaine Carneros 2013 Estate Brut Sparkling (Carneros)
description: This is a relatively small-production sparkling blend of 51% Pinot Noir and 49% Chardonnay, aged more than three years in bottle. Creamy and lush on the palate, it contrasts that richness with focused acidity and crisp flavors of ginger and lemon.

title: Educated Guess 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This wine shows good concentration in color, flavor and texture. It is deep and dark, with ripe, jammy tones of blackberry and black cherry. Significant baking-spice elements add complexity, while fine-grained tannins add a thick texture.

title: Flanagan 2016 Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a meaty and thick wine, brimming in blueberry, violet and licorice. Full bodied and intensely ripe, it presents as smooth and richly woven on the palate.

title: Frank Family 2016 Beckstoffer Carneros Lake Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is well made and big in style: a full-bodied, soft and round white offering an intensity of baked pineapple and mango. The spice component complements the bolder fruit and substantial oak, finishing in spicy nutmeg.

title: Frank Family 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Reduced, tightly wound and densely packed, this is a big style of the variety, exotically marked by a wealth of citrus, cranberry and pomegranate flavors. Toasted oak supports the fruit.

title: Frisson Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is earthy, dusty and mineral-driven, with a lasting taste of dried herb, cedar and sage. Bright, underlying acidity lifts the midpalate from its full-bodied richness as red currant, cherry and cassis come into the light.

title: Oak Farm 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: A slightly reserved character helps this light-bodied, mineral-driven wine stand out from the pack. Aromas of flint, dried thyme and a wisp of lemon lead to ripe pear and Pippin apple flavors.

title: Olivet Lane 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Richly layered in tropical and stone fruit, this wine is fleshy and bright, flush with high-toned acidity and floral aromatics of apple blossom. The fruit-forward appeal of the wine is joined by secondary flavors of melon and peach that pack the finish.

title: Parvaneh 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Very dense aromas of black currant and elderberry are lifted with a touch of elderflower extract on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are thick and stiff on the palate, giving a serious framing to the blackberry and dark soil flavors.

title: Picayune 2016 Padlock Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from nearly equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this is a lively, balanced expression of the grapes, herbal and floral, with a soft rounded texture. Lithe, it shows a touch of violet on the nose and a dusty, mineral tannin structure.

title: Picayune 2016 Rive Gauche Red (Napa Valley)
description: Seasoned in dried herb, clove, nutmeg and tobacco, this is a well-made richly concentrated blend of 74% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Petit Verdot, 5% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Franc. Drifts of black cherry and currant play around soft structured tannin and spicy oak.

title: Pulchella 2015 Racket Red (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of black plum, cedar, pipe tobacco and clove show on the nose of this rich blend of 64% Mourvèdre and 36% Petite Sirah. The flavors are also very strong and heavy, with aggressive concentration that will please those seeking a powerful experience.

title: Pulchella 2015 Wide Awake 100 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black-currant, blueberry, caramel and milk-chocolate aromas pop on the nose of this blend of 52% Syrah, 27% Tannat and 21% Petite Sirah, which also shows a touch of raisin. The palate is more tart (with black plum) and shows depth thanks to pinched herbs and roasted meats.

title: Sojourn 2017 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Thick and concentrated in rich flavors of pineapple and pear, this is from a section of the famous vineyard that is low yielding and intense. Sizable oak presents as toasted and supportive, leading to a nutty earthy finish.

title: Willowbrook 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Plum, rose petal and black tea combine effortlessly in this well-made, moderately ripe wine, which has sharp, focused acidity at its core. Fresh and savory in baking spice, it finishes in tart tangy flavors of rhubarb and orange peel.

title: Parvaneh 2017 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of charred black cherry, loamy soil and purple flowers show on the dense, thick nose of this wine. The palate is pleasant yet straightforward in flavors of blackberry jam and toast.

title: Barden 2018 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Yellowish pink in the glass, this new bottling by Doug Margerum shows red plum and light cotton-candy aromas on the nose. The palate is quite chalky and tense, offering flavors of lemon rind and grapefruit pith.

title: Dawn's Dream 2017 Alyssa Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Plush aromas of red plum, baked red cherry and star anise mesh on the nose of this lower alcohol bottling from a typically riper region. The palate's crisp pomegranate and cranberry flavors enliven the palate with tart and fresh, if slightly simple, touches.

title: DRNK 2016 Connell Bennett Bench Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Black olive, grilled meat and iron make for an exotic, varietally intriguing experience in this well-made tiny production wine. Medium bodied, it remains in balance with firm, integrated tannin and oak, with a lasting note of lavender.

title: E16 2016 Baby Rattlesnake Vineyard Barbera (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine offers bright, concentrated black-cherry and raspberry flavors. It is built by crisp acidity and mild tannins that don't get in the way of the bold, fruity character.

title: Grassini 2018 Afiora Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Plush watermelon and light strawberry aromas make for a very fruity entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate sizzles with acidity, leading into red-plum, wet cement and chalk flavors.

title: Grey Stack 2017 Four Brothers Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)
description: This wine opens in hearty aromas of hazelnut, vanilla and oak, the palate defined in fleshy full-figured intensity. A tiny-production offering, it dances around flavors of caramel and Gravenstein apple.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: From a low-yield year, this is a spicy, herbal and tension-filled wine has good build and breadth, with brooding elements of black cherry, blackberry and dark chocolate. The tannin and oak are well integrated, with youthful grip and concentration.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Plummy aromas meet with sunbaked soil and lots of earthy herbs on the nose of this bottling. Grippy tannins and buoyant acidity frame the palate, where strawberry, red plum and baking spice flavors lead into an oaky finish.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Persing Vineyard Meritage (Santa Clara Valley)
description: A dried black-cherry aroma meets with cedar and caramel tones on the nose of this bottling. The palate is thick and suave in black cherry and plum flavors, with bright acidity that pushes through the toasty finish.

title: Meeker 2016 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This blends in 8% Syrah, which adds a brooding element of additional power and color to the wine. Cinnamon, black cherry and currant play around integrated oak, tannin and substantial ripeness, finishing in tobacco, black pepper and meat.

title: Goat Bubbles 2016 Solomon Hills Vineyard Rosé Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A yellower shade of pink in the glass, this bottling by regional bubbly pioneer Norm Yost begins with a yeasty nose of wet dough along with citrusy hints of grapefruit peel. The palate enlivens the mouth with flavors of sour lemon and more yeast.

title: Inglenook 2016 Blancaneaux White (Rutherford)
description: The producer's perennial Rhône-style white blend from its estate, this blends 36% Viognier with 32% Roussanne and 32% Marsanne. Together, they harmonize into a cohesive whole of intense floral aromatics and brightly textured fruit. Gardenia, cinnamon and apple all standout on the nose and on the silky, slightly reduced palate.

title: Iskaranu 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light in color and texture, this is a light-bodied wine with underlying elegance and appeal. Textured, it features delicate flavors of dried herb, clove, raspberry and foresty earth.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Fog's Reach Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Rich and deep on the nose, this bottling offers concentrated aromas of black raspberry, black cherry, cappuccino and oak on the inviting nose. The palate is broad in flavors of black cherry and boysenberry wrapped in toasty oak, making for a powerful style of Pinot Noir.

title: Lucie 2016 Dutton Ranch Widdoes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a spicy red, dazzling in baking spice and savory earthiness. Robust tannins provide underlying power that matches the full-bodied concentration and velvety texture.

title: Peltier 2018 Estate Grown Vermentino (Lodi)
description: Zesty aromas and crisp tangy citrus flavors give this light-bodied well-balanced wine a laser focus. It has a vivid, almost electric acidity that gently scours the palate and brings great freshness on the finish.

title: Porterhouse Winery 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A nod to the butchering life of winemaker Adam Comartin's family, this hearty bottling begins with floral aromas of lilac, cassis, violet and Concord grape on the nose. Blackberry jam and more grape flavors meet with pepper dust on the palate, which is not as thick as other Petite Sirahs but powerful nonetheless.

title: Pulchella 2016 Awakening Red (Paso Robles)
description: Freshly smashed violets, white pepper and strong blueberry aromas show on the nose of this blend of 75% Tannat and 25% Petite Sirah from three different vineyards. Those purple-flower and blueberry flavors extend to the palate, which is fresh, clean and loaded with lively character.

title: Rincon Mountain 2016 Estate Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed lilacs, boysenberry, Concord grape and potpourri show on the nose of this bottling, which is grown in Paso Robles but made in a winery that sits above the iconic Rincon Point surf break. The sip is taut in texture, delivering flavors of lavender, violet and more grape, with tannins that dry up in the finish.

title: Rodney Strong 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright in acidity and cradled moderate oak, this wine shows a crunchiness to the tannins and bright bursts of cranberry, pomegranate and orange peel flavors. Elements of baking spice dot the finish, contrasting well against the rich fruit.

title: Stolo 2016 Hillside Reserve Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: The reserve status of this wine must involve heavier oak, as the smoke qualities extend across the nose and palate. Aromas of sour cherry, earthy mushrooms and toasted sandalwood lead into a smoky sip of bright pomegranate, roasted pork, peppercorn and green-sage flavors.

title: Stolo 2018 Rosé (San Luis Obispo County)
description: There is the usual hint of cherry on the nose of this rosé, yet much more unique tones of chalk, steel, wet gravel and crushed stone, making for a very mineral-driven expression. The palate is grippy and offers flavors or sour lemon, nectarine and pear flesh.

title: The Blending Lab 2016 G Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Stewed strawberry, rose water, clove and smoke show on the plummy nose of this bottling. It's fully flavored on the palate, with loads of spice and fresh ripe fruit flavors, all resting on lively acidity.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Lively aromas of boysenberry juice, mint, pine wood and a hint of chocolate make for a very inviting nose on this bottling. There are plenty of minty herbal flavors on the palate, where blackberry jam and pepper spice are backed up by sticky tannins.

title: Bold 2018 Zabala Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Strong grassy aromas meet with a softer hint of white flowers on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate's strong grip delivers Sancerre-like flavors of crisp lime, lime leaf and more cut grass.

title: Bridlewood 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Focused earth aromas of turned forest floor, pine needle and eucalyptus give great depth to the black-cherry backdrop on the nose of this bottling. There's judicious use of oak on the palate, which frames the pomegranate, strawberry, thyme and pepper-dust flavors.

title: Castle Rock 2017 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of cassis, charred beef and wet soil start off this brooding wine. The thick palate is framed by firm tannins and solid acidity.

title: Dogwood & Thistle 2018 Mariah Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Vivid grassy minerally aromas and nicely concentrated flavors give this medium-bodied wine a lot of depth and it shows a great, tangy balance to go with it. Crisp apple, dried thyme and lemon zest wake up the palate, backed by nervy acidity.

title: Lava Cap 2016 Merlot (El Dorado)
description: This robust and flavorful wine is scented with cigar box and dark chocolate. The palate adds in a black cherry flavor for a big and complex array of facets to savor. A full body and firm tannins give it good structure and its concentration is intense enough to deliver a lingering finish.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Hidden Asset Estate Vineyards Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Winemaker Megan McGrath Gates continues to hone this blend of five different grapes. A pureed red-fruit aroma meets with turned earth, leather and wet oak on the nose, while the palate is cohesive in flavors of cinnamon, dried herbs, beef jerky and roasted red fruit.

title: Broadside 2016 Ephemera Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Crisp blackberry, light licorice, lilac and a hint of charred meat show on the nose of this luxury-level bottling from Brian Terrizzi. There are elderberry and elderflower touches on the elegantly woven sip, where dark fruit and flowers compete for attention amidst the dry tannic framing.

title: Cattleya 2017 Call to Adventure Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Pristine and pillowy aromas of white peach, sea salt and creamy white fruits show on the inviting nose of this bottling by Bibiana González Rave. Ripe nectarine and apricot flavors are seasoned with more sea salt on the clean umami-rich palate, which finishes with a hint of ash.

title: Lester 2016 Domingo Lester Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Loads of underripe raspberry, plum, bay leaf and sharp tarragon aromas draw the nose into this estate project by the Lester family. Fresh and lively flavors of eucalyptus and pine needle lift up the underlying pomegranate and sour cranberry elements of the palate.

title: Rowen 2015 600L Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is from the producer's high-elevation Cooley Ranch Vineyard and blended with 20% Petit Verdot. It offers aromas of sage, cedar and oak on the nose. Full in weight and intensely powerful, it has thick, rich layers of cherry, cola and cassis that await further integration. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Samsara 2015 Melville Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Boysenberry, thyme, dust and gamy meat aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the former owner Chad Melville's family estate. Big and powerful flavors pop on the palate, including baked sour cherry, but they are cut by juniper berry and tarragon and lead to a spicy finish.

title: J. Davies 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This wine has a supple succulence of black fruit on the midpalate that's accented by earthy, savory spice. Dark cherry and plum take on bolder, concentrated richness as the wine opens, with expansive, grippy tannins lending support. Enjoy 2026–2031.

title: Calera 2016 Jensen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)
description: Strong aromas of black cherry and Christmas spice are plump on the nose, while the palate is minty and earthy, combining sagebrush, raspberry and cranberry flavors. From a brand that was recently purchased by Duckhorn, this is a complex, layered wine.

title: Liquid Farm 2015 Bien Bien Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: From 40-year-old vines of Bien Nacido Vineyard, this bottling offers ashy Brie rind aromas alongside lemon pith and light guava peel. Compelling tension on the palate frames the tangerine pith and Key lime flavors, which warm toward buttermilk and flint toward the finish.

title: Mindego Ridge 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From a vineyard high atop the mountain ridges over the Peninsula, this is an extremely focused wine, starting with aromas of soil and rocks against the hearty blackberry backdrop. The palate is fuller bodied yet with earth more than fruit, combining loam, forest floor and mushrooms with black plum and wild berry flavors. Drink now through 2036.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The nose on this bottling blends savory depth with floral lightness, combining sandalwood, seared Meyer lemon peels, butterscotch, hot sandstone and flashes of honeysuckle on the nose. Sea salt and nectarine lead toward marshmallow and wood in the finish, wrapped in a structure that's firm but seamless.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Pinot Blanc (Green Valley)
description: Floral, waxy and crisp, this perennially lovely white is generous in stone fruit, lemon, lime and pear, with bristling acidity buzzing beneath the scenes. The crispness mellows in the glass to wide appeal as complex characteristics of white pepper and flint build.

title: Samsara 2015 Cargasacchi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This vineyard is reportedly slipping out of production, which is a shame given bottlings like this. Aromas of cracked green peppercorn, underripe raspberry, bay leaf and singed rosemary are intriguing as can be. The palate is earthy and herbal with thyme and sagebrush, yet awash in tangy red-plum-skin flavors.

title: Storm Wines 2016 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's an immense amount of energy in this bottling by Ernst Storm from a vineyard that's west of the Sta. Rita Hills. The nose offers intense boysenberry, lavender, violet and a touch of game, while the acid-driven palate combines that pure boysenberry fruit with marjoram and dried tarragon flavors.

title: Chappellet 2017 El Novillero Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Mineral driven, this impressive wine is lively and layered in apple, pear and brioche, its oak integrated and lightly toasted. A touch of richness gives it additional weight and breadth across the memorable texture and lasting baking spice.

title: E16 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Heady aromatics of golden apple, pear and brioche are complemented by stony minerality in this lengthy, layered and oak-integrated white wine from the famous site. Fleshy and balanced, it shares a richness tempered in crisp acidity.

title: Folded Hills 2017 Cluster Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: From a whole cluster carbonic maceration, this bottling is immensely fresh in the glass, with light strawberry and hibiscus aromas, yet there are also fascinating hints of peppercorns, dried herbs and cigar leaf. Snappy raspberry flavors meet with layers of herbs and red flowers on the palate.

title: Landmark 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Taut aromas of red plum, pomegranate, crushed gravel, damp riverbed and clay make for a fruity yet mineral-laced nose. Candied raspberry and crisp pomegranate flavors lead into wild thyme and cracked pepper on the palate.

title: Paul Dolan 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This is a huge, muscular but agile wine made from organically grown grapes. Fragrant aromas of French oak spices are followed by concentrated layers of black cherry, cinnamon, black currant and clove. Supported by a big, velvety frame of soft tannins, it is seductive now and will improve through 2026.

title: Samsara 2015 Kessler-Haak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated aromas of dried cherry and red currant meet with a rocky minerality and a wild sagebrush herbal quality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is more impressive, with roasted cherry tomatoes, blistered plums and strawberries, grilled fennel, thyme and tarragon flavors making a magical combo.

title: Stolpman 2017 Estate Grown Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: The Stolpmans play up the cool- climate aspects of Ballard Canyon in this bottling, offering crumbled violets, black-pepper and underripe boysenberry aromas on the nose. The palate sizzles with acidity, delivering fresh berry, pepper spice, thyme and fennel pollen flavors.

title: Flat Top Hills 2018 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine tastes ripe but tangy, balancing vibrant tropical-fruit flavors on an appetizing frame. Pineapple, lime and kiwi burst in the mouth and the crisp texture leaves a clean finish.

title: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Broad aromas of Meyer lemon, lime balm and citrus blossoms show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly wound, with fresh flashes of tangy apple.

title: Bruliam 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black raspberry, dusty sagebrush and a hint of wood show on the nose of this riper single-vineyard expression. Roasted black-plum and cola flavors are evident on the sip, which is quite rich.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Catalyst Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Concentrated aromas of red cherry meet with earthy herbs and soils on the nose of this red blend. Fresh boysenberry and tangy black-plum flavors show on the sip, lifted by a touch of lavender.

title: Tantara 2017 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark layers of black plum and loamy soil meet with eucalyptus and sage oil on the nose of this bottling. Grippy tannins carry the palate, delivering flavors of tangy berry and turned earth.

title: Testarossa 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Muddy clay, dried cherries, marjoram, pine-needle and mushroom aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. There's a smoky and savory kick to the sip, where roasted berry and cherry flavors would work well with weekend barbecues.

title: SeaGlass 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dried black cherry, iron, smoke and dried herbs show on the nose of this bottling. There is lively acidity on the palate, carrying flavors of dried raspberry, rose petals and oregano.

title: Andis 2017 Bill Dillian Vineyard Semillon (Amador County)
description: Balancing good crispness with a supple texture, this nicely dry and medium-bodied wine offers freshness, light herb and Bosc pear aromas and mineral flavors.

title: Chuparosa 2015 Zinfandel (Ramona Valley)
description: This Zinfandel is a strong showing for this slice of Southern California, starting with aromas of luxardo cherry and nutmeg. Vanilla and black cherry meet with a plum-skin tautness on the sip, with tannins rising in to the finish.

title: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: The tangy aspects on the nose of this bottling are quite prominent, with lemon-bar aromas as well as oak quite apparent. The lemony tang of the palate is refreshing if aggressive, accompanied by toasted wood touches.

title: Killer Drop 2016 Red (California)
description: Jammy, concentrated fruit flavors fill this full-bodied wine to the rim, pouring blackberry and blueberry syrup over warm, spicy oak notes. It's big in mouthfeel and moderately tannic and the sense of sweetness smooths it out.

title: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This structured and demure white is juicy in pear and apple, with notes of vanilla and honey that add understated richness. With just a bite of weight, it refreshes in lengthy acidity.

title: Matchbook 2016 The Arsonist Red (California)
description: Aromatic, showing floral and spicy oak notes, this medium-bodied wine offers good balance between ripe fruit and a firm structure. Nuances of tobacco, earth and sage emerge on the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Morgan 2018 Metallico Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Slightly effervescent in the glass, this bottling is loaded with tropical fruit aromas of mango, papaya and tuberose, yet held back by touches of lime pith and chalk. The flavors zip across the palate, from Brie rind and ash to riper streaks of mango and jasmine.

title: Thacher 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Crisp blackberry and black-plum aromas meet with a hint of smoke on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are a bit shy and restrained, with black-plum and rocky earth elements emerging atop the strong acidity.

title: Alara 2018 Mission Ranch Vineyard Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
description: Exotic white- and green-fruit aromas of citrus, lychee and even Rainier cherry show on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is a compelling tightness to the palate, where a sandy grip carries flavors of light pear and broader white fruits.

title: Anglim 2017 Pinot Noir (Adelaida District)
description: Ripe aromas of red cherry and baking spice show on the nose of this bottling of Pinot Noir from a relatively warm area. The flavors are quite extracted on the palate, with blackberry, boysenberry and dried mint.

title: Benovia 2016 Grenache (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This is a thick, rich rendition of the grape: herbal and peppery in subtle ways, with boldly etched flavors of wild strawberry and wild game. It field blends the main variety with Syrah and Alicante Bouchet.

title: Eden Rift 2018 Estate Rosé of Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)
description: Grapefruit-skin and plum aromas meet with wet river stone on the nose of this bottling. Tight lime flavors hit the palate, which is tangy with citrus and plum skin and tightly wound.

title: Granite Lion 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (South Coast)
description: Focused aromas of black cherry, crushed rocks, dried herbs and coffee show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard east of San Diego. Roasted cherry flavors converge with anise, fennel and leather on the palate.

title: Eden Rift 2018 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)
description: There's an alkaline streak across the nose of this bottling, which offers dried honeysuckle and lanolin aromas as well. Dried lemon peel and quinine elements show on the palate, which is likely to blossom into other flavors with time.

title: Justin 2016 Trilateral Red (Paso Robles)
description: The nose of this blend of 64% Syrah, 24% Grenache and 12% Mourvèdre offers aromas of charred beef, teriyaki and black plum sauce. Bright acidity lifts the palate from start to finish, carrying savory flavors of black bean, Asian barbecue spice and toasted peppercorn.

title: Sanguis 2016 Verve Red (Central Coast)
description: Boysenberry, violets and black pepper show on the nose of this blend of Grenache, Petite Sirah and Roussanne, which also flirts with red fruits like raspberry. Chalky tannins frame the sip, which delivers flavors of fennel bulb, black raspberry and white pepper, finishing with elegant length.

title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Rosé Excellence Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Mendocino County)
description: This crisp and classy wine tastes dry, tight but complex from the persimmon and raspberry aromas to the lively white-raspberry and white-peach flavors. It has taut acidity balanced by touches of spicy maturity that keep it interesting through the lingering finish.

title: Dunites 2017 Slide Hill Vineyard Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: Black-cherry, spice-cake, light licorice and earthy mint aromas converge on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the southern Edna Valley. It's very full on the palate, where polished yet still upright tannins carry a hearty range of flavors similar to the aromas.

title: Rideau 2016 Rideau Vineyard Mourvèdre (Los Olivos District)
description: Lighter in the glass, this estate bottling begins with pleasant aromas of caramelized cherry and strawberry, alongside cola spice. The palate is plush with black-plum, dried ginger and spice-cake flavors, and has a range of star anise and clove flavors that linger into the finish.

title: Rideau 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Mulberry, wild plum, thyme and sagebrush converge on the nose of this countywide blend, which offers great depth for a slightly lower price. The palate is dry yet dense with flavor, showing pomegranate and ripe raspberry as well as dried spearmint and more chaparral herbs.

title: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: In a lineup of mostly delicate expressions, this is one of the winery's more oak-forward bottlings, starting with aromas of toasted wood and light caramel. The oak shows on the sip too, but the wine remains clean, pure and soft, with flavors of butterscotch and scorched lemon.

title: Yorba 2013 Barbera (Amador County)
description: Packed with fruit flavor and generously sprinkled with oak, this full-bodied wine feels comfortable on the palate and shows abundant ripe blackberry, fig and plum flavors. It has moderate, well-integrated tannins that support a lush mouthfeel and lingering finish.

title: Chanin 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling explores the earthy side of Pinot Noir, offering exotic aromas of underripe red fruit, sumac spice and plenty of chaparral herbs. Light strawberry and red plum come through on the palate, along with hints of cocoa dust and dried herbs.

title: Krupp Brothers 2016 Synchrony Stagecoach Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is hugely concentrated, powerful wine, a blend of 66% Cabernet Franc with 26% Merlot, 6% Cabernet Sauvignon, 1% Sangiovese and 1% Petit Verdot from the famous site. Dusty earth, crushed rock, dried herb and cassis meet a robust underbelly of leather, black pepper and cedar. This will do well over time; enjoy best from 2026–2032.

title: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Aromas of apple butter, lemon candies, daffodil and buttercream show on the lush nose of this bottling. The palate is full flavored and anything but shy, exhibiting lemon cream and juicy melon, all wrapped in penetrating acidity.

title: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This powerful wine spreads rich butter and vanilla overtones across a foundation of crisp apple and lemon, while riper pear and fig flavors build on the palate and linger on the finish. A complex array of baking spices and a hint of toast add complexity and interest.

title: Bella Grace 2016 Syrah (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine leads with dark chocolate in the aroma, and adds interesting wood-smoke, grilled sage and black-pepper notes on the palate. They add up to great flavors, complexity and concentration that will be satisfying to savor over a relaxed, protein-rich meal.

title: Davies 2017 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Lightly spiced in black pepper and baking spice, this is a blend of several vineyards in the appellation, including Hyde. It opens slowly to reveal densely concentrated layers of flavor—a mix of orange, strawberry and black tea that brighten on the acid-driven finish.

title: Hess Collection 2016 The Lion Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: From the producer's Mount Veeder vineyards, this wine is blended with 14% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot. Thick and concentrated in red fruit and oak, it has a strong presence of oak and sage on the palate. The finish is lengthy in black pepper and integrated tannins.

title: Rockpile Winery 2017 Westphall Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: With tamed tannins, this comes from a steep 1,400-foot-elevation site, the highest of the producer's single sites. Lightly spiced it has a bite of oak, black pepper and clove within a concentrated core of deep rich red and black fruit. It's both pretty and powerful, with a ton of character and soul.

title: E16 2017 Baby Rattlesnake Vineyard Syrah (El Dorado)
description: Beautiful and concentrated black-fruit flavors on a generous, fine-grained texture make this full-bodied wine hard to resist. Deep black cherry and blueberry meet creamy cappuccino and baking-spice notes on the palate.

title: Michael David 2017 Ancient Vine Cinsault (Lodi)
description: Delicious and almost delicate, this is a soft fruit-laden wine from some of Lodi's oldest vines. Gentle plum and raspberry flavors are surrounded by oak spice accents. A silky texture, with just a touch of tannin tops it off nicely.

title: Miraflores 2016 Estate Malbec (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine is generous, ripe and structured, wrapping firm fine-grained tannins around ripe blueberry, dark chocolate and blackberry flavors that are deep and broad. Best through 2026.

title: Dawn's Dream 2016 Escolle Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Smoked white-peach, singed cherry-wood and seared pear-flesh aromas meet with a pinch of herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly woven, with fresh lime and green-pear flavors riding a chalky texture and finishing with kumquat tang.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This clonal study shows focused black-plum and raspberry aromas alongside rose petal. The palate is quite full, with pomegranate, plum and lively mint flavors, proving both tangy and herbal.

title: Grassini 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Light and mellow on the nose at first, this bottling opens toward Asian pear flesh, warm nectarine and clean melon aromas. It lands on the palate with bright flavors of guava, passion fruit and lime, cut by mineral-laden touches of wet cement.

title: McKinney 2015 Napoleon's Secret Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The emperor's apparent secret was that he allowed Syrah to be in Bordeaux blends. This mix of 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Syrah, 13% Merlot, 10% Malbec, 8% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot offers cedar and baked black-plum aromas on the nose. The palate boasts black currant and blueberry flavors, with a slight hoisin spice note.

title: Samsara 2015 Rancho La Vina Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cranberry and pomegranate meet with toasty oak and wet gravel on the nose of this bottling from a winery now based in the suburban lands of Goleta. The palate is bright and tangy with those red fruits, and layered with thyme and wild herbs.

title: Section Wines 2018 Tierra Alta Vineyard Arneis (Ballard Canyon)
description: From a grape traditionally grown in northern Italy, this bottling offers fresh and tightly woven aromas of grapefruit pith, orange flesh, crushed sea shells and honeysuckle. A chalky texture frames the palate, which delivers ripe pear and lime-juice flavors.

title: Spottswoode 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: This wine opens in a nutty flourish of earthiness and floral apple blossom before exposing complex waves of Meyer lemon, green apple and fig. Intensely high toned, it is crisp and dry, with plenty of bite and texture.

title: Bernardus 2017 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe Asian pear, honeysuckle, white peach and sea salt aromas all arise on the nose of this bottling from the heart of the region. The palate blends peachy flavors with elegant white-flower touches of gardenia and plumeria.

title: Bernardus 2018 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Clean and taut on the nose, this bottling shows a blend of passion fruit, lime skin and rainy cement on the pristine and delicate nose. There is a great snap to the palate, where rounded flavors of red pear and passion fruit are quite forward, yet also tightly woven.

title: Chamisal 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Dense aromas of black cherry, vanilla and caramel make for a rich entry to this appellation blend. The palate is full of ripe raspberry and red-plum flavors, with wild sagebrush and forest herbs providing depth.

title: Comartin 2015 Cuvée Cassidy G-S-M (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 57% Grenache, 28% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre is very purple on the nose, showing candied blackberry and grape, with hints of violet. The palate's black-plum flavors meet with tarry earth and charred wood. It needs a bit of time to open.

title: Comartin 2017 R-Bar-R Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Candied raspberry, pomegranate, bay leaf and tarragon aromas consume the nose of this bottling from a single vineyard. The palate is medium bodied yet incredibly spicy, with cinnamon, clove and nutmeg flavors decorating the roasted berry background.

title: Côte West 2018 Mounts Vineyard Rosé of Counoise (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This light, crisp wine has lovely aromatics of cherry blossom and raspberry. Refreshing juiciness is cut by a build up of tightly focused tannins.

title: Davis Family 2016 Soul Patch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has an impressive aromatic entry of rose and lavender buoyed by bright fresh acidity on the palate. The balanced approach allows the tannins to take a backseat to layers of red crunchy fruit and texture, finishing with an earthy flourish of forest and tea.

title: Duckhorn 2016 Atlas Peak Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Much of this wine is sourced from Stagecoach Vineyard and is 100% varietal. Thick and oaky in sage and dusty, concentrated brush, it is full bodied and classically styled. Featuring cocoa powder, cedar, pencil and red currant, it has power and grace in equal measure.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Dutton Ranch Gewürztraminer (Green Valley)
description: Jasmine aromas lead the way to lychee, pear and wet stone in this bright, light and high-toned wine—a whirl of grapefruit and mango on the midpalate. The acidity holds tight throughout, making for a lively experience of balanced fruit and texture.

title: Europa Village 2016 Bolero Garnacha (Temecula Valley)
description: Light aromas of strawberry and tangy pomegranate meet with hints of sumac and cinnamon on the nose of this bottling. Tangy cranberry, thyme and vanilla-cake flavors play on the palate, which is framed by chalky tannins.

title: Folded Hills 2018 Lilly Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Slightly sour lemon aromas meet with broad strawberry strokes, chalky white rocks and pastry aromas on the nose of this Grenache-based bottling. There is a pleasing zip throughout the sip, delivering flavors of peach and strawberry that sizzle into the finish.

title: Foley 2016 T Anchor Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sharp aromas of golden pear, white peach, gardenia and toasty butterscotch show on the rich nose of this bottling, which hits the classic notes but in a judicious style. Oak leads the mouthfilling sip into flavors of baked lemon cake and caramel.

title: Kitá 2018 Camp 4 Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Red-plum, pluot and light berry aromas are cut by tangerine peel on the nose of this bottling by Tara Gomez. Lively acidity and chalky tension thrive on the palate, where crisp nectarine and grapefruit flavors live.

title: Granite Lion 2017 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (South Coast)
description: Black-cherry and oak aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the town of Jamul east of San Diego. Stony flavors of gravel and chalk meet with tart cherry and cocoa on the palate.

title: Graveyard 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Smashed plums, drying lilacs and a hint of soy show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is layered with flavors of sour blackberry, dried violets and lavender, marjoram and other roasting herbs and a more savory soy touches.

title: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: The black-currant and black-cherry flavors in this full-bodied wine are just-ripe and generous, filling out the good structure of fine-grained tannins and showing a touch of tartness and restraint on the finish. Best through 2024.

title: Kunde 2016 Dunfillan Cuvee Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: From the producer's estate, this combines 55% Cabernet Sauvignon with 45% Syrah. Crayon wax, currant and cherry ride along a thickness of power and ripeness, finishing in a touch of wood and heat.

title: Mooney Family 2017 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tangy aromas of black raspberry, sagebrush and wild mint show on the nose of this bottling. There's a flash of sweetness on the tip of the sip before tangier tones of raspberry and dark berry arise.

title: Sean Minor 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The dark red fruits are initially subdued on the nose of this bottling, giving way to the crushed slate and rocky soil aspects of the nose. It's very dry and earthy on the palate as well, where dried herbs, baked loam and crushed stone meet with hints of dark cherry.

title: Silicon Valley Wine Co. 2018 Pixelated Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Bright strawberry and raspberry aromas play with a hint of orange peel on the riper nose of this botting. Sour citrus and chalky texture converge on the sip, with a bit of bubblegum flavor.

title: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Big on fruit and floral flavors, this medium-bodied wine exudes crisp apple and Anjou pear aromas that lead to ripe fruit on the palate and a touch of tanginess on the finish.

title: Albatross Ridge 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Very tangy aromas of squeezed citrus and preserved lemon show on the nose of this bottling. That tang extends to the palate as well, where lemon peel and tart apple flavors dominate.

title: Anaya 2017 Potrero Vineyards Pinot Gris (Clements Hills)
description: Fragrant and floral in aroma and flavor, this medium-bodied wine is packed with dramatic rose-petal, apple and peach-skin nuances. Made with 48 hours of skin contact, the wine's texture is lightly gripping and appetizing which fits the extroverted nature of the wine.

title: Bel Vino NV Butterfly Effect Red (California)
description: Some mature, woody complexity gives this full-bodied Cabernet-based blend extra interest. It offers aromas of ripe fruit, tobacco and earth, and soft tannins for a bit of structure.

title: Foot of the Bed 2016 Roussanne (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From biodynamically farmed grapes, this is a dry, stony and light rendition of the grape, nuanced in weight and body with floral hints of white flower and earthy potato. Apple skin and wet stone complete the picture.

title: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: This bottling, which is bolstered by 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, starts with ripe cherry, dried sagebrush and pencil shavings on the nose. The structure is grippy on the sip, with dried plum, cherry and woody flavors, plus a lingering hint of green herbs carrying into the finish.

title: Laetitia 2018 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Fresh lime, savory sea salt and a touch of crushed nuts show on the nose of this estate bottling for this historic winery, which was just purchased by Vintage Wine Estates. It's crisp on the sip, where warmer flavors of roasted lemon and nectarine arise.

title: Lafond 2016 Lafond Vineyard Syrah-Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rich aromas of stewed black currant, baking spice and licorice are quite ripe and heavy on the nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is quite thick and dense with flavors of prune and fig, proving rather chewy.

title: OVR 2018 Riesling (California)
description: This light-bodied wine offers minty and piney aromas, and crisp and delicate flavors of not-quite-ripe peach and lemon. Its restraint is a good thing; this wine will make a wonderful drink for lunch or pre-dinner.

title: Sebastiani 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Red-fruit-dominant, with light touches of baking spice, dust and tannin, this wine is ripe and robustly built. Dark and brooding in nature, it packs a lasting punch of power and concentration.

title: St. Francis 2016 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a thick, viscous, jammy and rich wine, robustly layered and voluptuously ripe. Spicy blackberry and brown sugar meet toasted oak and vanilla accents, appealing to fans of a big style.

title: Windchaser 2017 The Red Triangle Red (California)
description: This unusual blend of Syrah, Pinot Noir and Grenache is full bodied, flavorful and laced with fine-grained tannins, setting it up to pair well with rich proteins. It shows meaty, plummy, lightly oaked flavors and a smooth broad texture.

title: SeaGlass 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is a pleasantly juicy and easy-to-enjoy bottling that is widely available. Aromas of blackberry jam, cedar and loamy earth lead into a zippy, fresh palate of dark red fruit and wood spice.

title: Houdini 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-made value-driven red, tasting of blueberry cobbler, cinnamon and nutmeg, with a lingering touch of meat and smoke. Brawny and full bodied it benefits from bright underlying acidity.

title: Longoria 2017 Clover Creek Vineyard Albariño (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Tightly woven aromas of chalky mandarin zest and faint nectarine show on the fresh nose of this bottling by Rick Longoria. There is bright lemony flavor and crushed chalk minerality on the palate, and the acid just won't quit, even days after opening the bottle.

title: Red Car 2015 Heaven and Earth Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Lightly built with a persistent succulence, this wine shines in up-front acidity and delicately woven flavors of strawberry, cherry and orange. The tannins are tight and quiet.

title: Thirty-Seven 2015 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This is a tiny production, reserve-tier wine at a fair price, high toned in red plum and savory black olive. Integrated, it offers a sturdy foundation of toasted oak and tannin midway through on the palate before finishing bright.

title: FEL 2017 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: A good sense of concentration and balance in this medium-bodied wine give it an appetizing appeal. Fresh apple and pear aromas are lightly shaded with baking spices, and the flavors follow with plenty of fruit, good acidity and a light tang on the finish.

title: Gratus 2015 Estate Grown Red (Napa Valley)
description: This combines 80% Cabernet Sauvignon with 15% Malbec and 5% Petite Sirah, and the resulting wine is juicy in red currant and cherry. Huge tannins contrast against bright underlying acidity for a satisfying, full-bodied experience in rich ripe fruit.

title: Kunde 2017 Magnolia Lane Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a grassy, herbal and refreshing white, from vines that date back decades in some cases. Lemongrass, lime and Meyer lemon flavors dominate the palate, accentuating a tart, acid-driven proposition of ample texture.

title: Longboard 2016 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers a richness of caramelized oak and toffee that takes on an intensity in the midpalate. It settles into a more balanced presentation of apple, pear and melon with a lushness on the finish.

title: MacPhail 2016 The Flyer Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A top-tier blend from several vineyards, this playful Pinot is full bodied and well built. It's robustly rich, ripe and firm in tannic structure. The oak supports flavors of juicy wild strawberry and raspberry as well as a persistent earthy note, while the finish offers lingering hints of vanilla and cola.

title: Markham 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 12% Sémillon, this white is steel and floral, with a lemony core that's more balanced and elegant than fruit forward. Wet stone and jasmine accent it well.

title: Martellotto 2017 Rosso di Sera Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Ripe and ready aromas of black cherry, wood spice and clove are intense on this blend of 40% Malbec, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Cabernet Franc. The palate is rounded with ripe dark-fruit and baking-spice flavors, framed by mouth-coating soft tannins.

title: Now Presenting... 2016 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of red currant paste, wood spice and crushed red flowers show on the nose of this reliable value wine. It's full and lovely on the palate with rich yet tart red cherries and a hint of lavender oil.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Tre Vini Flood Family Vineyards Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Cherry, crushed slate, wet soil, brick and dried leather make for a compelling nose in this enjoyable blend of 56% Sangiovese, 26% Syrah and 18% Cabernet Sauvignon. There is a tang of red berry fruit on the palate as well as integrated sandalwood spice.

title: San Simeon 2017 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: From the Riboli family's new vineyard named after the patriarch, this bottling offers tuberose and tropical aromas of mango and papaya cream on the nose, but with a chalky edge. The palate is clean and crisp in flavors of lemon curd and apple mousse.

title: Seven Angels 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Candied black-raspberry aromas meet with elegant mace and star anise spice on the nose of this bottling. There's a backbone of black-plum jelly and purple flowers to the sip, which is layered throughout in Christmas spices.

title: Seven Angels 2015 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Black plum, leather, tobacco and a hint of jasmine show on the nose of this bottling of a still rather uncommon grape for the region. There is also a jasmine touch to the palate, where intriguing purple-flower flavors meet with ripe blueberries and licorice spice.

title: Chimney Rock 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Softened with the addition of 25% Merlot, this wine offers a combination of power with grace. Touches of tar, petrol and rocky mineral start this off on the nose. It's shows robust and tightly grained tannins on the palate, with a bold shock of blue fruit and cinnamon.

title: Hess Collection 2016 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: Entirely stainless-steel fermented, this is an impressive estate wine, highly aromatic in honeysuckle. Structured and fleshy on the midpalate, it has full-bodied ripeness and a concentration of rich white-peach and apricot flavor.

title: Jax 2016 3 Barrels Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)
description: This wine offers notes of game, currant, dried cherry and clove. Intense in ripeness and high in acidity, it is a robust, full-bodied and rich red that is sure to be a crowd pleaser.

title: Toybox Wine Cellars 2015 Cadden Family Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: Thick red- and black-cherry fruit punctures more savory earthy elements of dried herb and currant in this tart tangy wine. A strong core of tannin supports the ripeness with violet aromatics leading the way.

title: Portalupi 2016 L. Venturi Vineyard Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: This luxurious, expressive and concentrated wine combines power with finesse. An ebony color with a thin carmine rim leads to extra-deep blueberry, blackberry and unsweetened cocoa aromas and flavors that are layered and complex. The wine is big in structure but not overripe. It is well balanced, built for a long life ahead but also harmonious enough to enjoy before it peaks. Best after 2025.

title: Roederer Estate 2011 L'Ermitage Estate Bottled Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)
description: Complex and mouthfilling, this luxurious, well-aged bubbly offers abundant raspberry, ginger and baking-spice flavors, a soft expansive mousse and touch of sweetness that rounds off the finish. Made from half Chardonnay and half Pinot Noir, a 3.7% portion of reserve wine was blended in.

title: Stone The Crows 2016 Fallen Feather Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: High-toned acidity lifts a thick body of viscosity and power in this vineyard-designated estate wine. Leather, tobacco and baked plum adorn a middle of firm structure and peppery spice, finding powerful elegance and complexity as it goes.

title: Westerhold 2016 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This new small producer tapped Russell Bevan to make its wines—a wise choice in this bottling, which invites immediately with an unctuous nose of golden oak and brioche. The palate becomes complementarily steely and crisp in apple, wet stone and sea spray, finishing in complex balance and grace.

title: Whitcraft 2017 Pence Ranch Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh and nearly effervescent in the glass, this young wine is full of wet soil aromas alongside lively pomegranate and rosebud scents. It's lively and crisp on the palate, where raspberry and pomegranate meet with pinches of oregano, thyme and marjoram.

title: Carlisle 2016 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with 5% Alicante Bouschet, the Zin in this wine comes from a section of the vineyard planted in 1895. Together, they marry a tight tannic framework of graceful structure that will evolve over time with fresh plum, raspberry and black pepper. The finish is laced in savory black olive and herb. Enjoy best from 2021 through 2026.

title: Challen 2016 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tangy black-plum aromas meet with strong herbal spices and a touch of Earl Grey tea on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the southwestern side of the appellation. The palate packs in damp, fresh herbs of thyme, sagebrush, bay leaf and pine needle alongside tangy red fruits.

title: Stolo 2017 Estate Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This bottling starts with aromas of bay leaf, pine needle and tomato leaf, yet with a purity of crushed raspberry fruit that shines through. The palate plays more to underripe raspberry and pomegranate flavors, lifted by tobacco leaf and damp sage.

title: Trombetta 2017 Four Brothers Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Less than 50 cases of this wine were made, but it's worth seeking out. Notes of honey, graham cracker, Gravenstein apple and pear are tossed with anise, while a bright acid-driven backbone delivers structure and freshness.

title: V. Vineyards 2015 Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Aromatically and flavorfully evocative of blackberry pie and coffee, this is a thick, decadent and firmly structured wine, with integrated tannins and oak. Powerful, it retains a forceful elegance around balanced ripeness and restraint.

title: Waits-Mast 2016 Nash Mill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Nuanced and elegant, this medium-bodied wine is almost delicate in its delivery of subtle cherry, tea and underbrush aromas backed by complex black-cherry, cinnamon and allspice flavors. Aging in 30% new barrels helps give it that spicy note.

title: Carlisle 2016 Montafi Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: There is 11% mixed blacks in this wine, which originates from a wonderful site that performs consistently year after year. Leather, sandalwood and cedar provide an earthy, serious and substantial framework on which to hang cherry and raspberry brightness. It ponders mulling spice and sage on the finish.

title: De Loach 2016 Hawk Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: Reduced in matchstick aromas that compel and blow off, this is a well-integrated white from a great site, the fruit and oak combining to great effect. Big flavors of anise and pear build around a concentration of full-bodied lushness and lasting texture.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Iron Hill Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Earthy in turned soil and a thicket of black licorice, this red is robust in style and brimming in ripe brambly black fruit, the concentrated darkness complemented by brighter undertones of strawberry and plum. The richness works and rewards, with 25% new French oak supportive without distraction.

title: Laetitia 2016 La Colline Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of black cherry, vanilla dust, wet soil, charred meat and wood oil show on the nose of this riper bottling. The complex and inviting palate offers ripe but tangy flavors of red fruit as well as white sage, wild thyme and fennel pollen.

title: Paradise Springs 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blend of grapes from John Sebastiano, La Encantada and Sanford & Benedict vineyards makes a very complete wine, starting with aromas of cherry, peppercorn, juniper and cherry wood. The palate is taut and sharp with flavors of red plum, cranberry and garden herbs.

title: Pellegrini 2015 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Textured and layered within a medium-bodied frame of elegant ripeness, and balanced in oak, this is a lovely combination of pear, apple and steely mineral components. The aromatics lean into white flower and anise—strong but not distracting.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2015 Cask 23 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This 100% varietal, estate-grown wine is earthy and brimming in vanilla, anise and cedar. Classic in style and approach, it offers a complex concentration of balanced fruit and savory components that accent substantial tannins.

title: Cobb 2016 Monticue Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a two-acre site near the producer's own Emmaline Ann Vineyard, just five miles from the Pacific Ocean, Monticue shows powerful hits of white pepper, leather and turned earth. Seductive and seamless, with well-integrated acidity and tannin, it lingers beautifully in earthy lavender.

title: De Loach 2015 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Shades of dried fruit rise on the palate of this substantially textured yet well-integrated wine. Sizzling acidity freshens the concentrated full-fruited palate, while the that finish reveals black pepper and cigar accents.

title: WindVane 2015 Reserve Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Tangy and tart in acidity and jolts of forest floor, this wine shows a generosity of body, richness and oak, while remaining reserved in fruit.

title: Des Amis 2017 Rosé (California)
description: Light, refreshing and dry, this wine has subtle fruit and spice aromas and flavors and it leaves a peppery accent on the finish. It's one of those palate-cleansing wines that will pair nicely with rich tapas or seafood.

title: Peter Paul Wines 2016 Live Free or Die Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tightly tannic and youthfully robust, this is full bodied, highly ripe and brimming in red and blue fruit. A velvety texture is accented in black tea and forest notes, leading to a mild finish.

title: Precision Wine 2016 The Xtrovert Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This fresh and jammy-tasting wine shows generous red-cherry and strawberry flavors and a soft, non-tannic texture. It's relatively light in mouthfeel, but technically full bodied considering its ripeness.

title: Unparalleled 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Crushed rock aromas meet with charred wood, vibrant blackberry and black pepper spice on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are rigid on the palate, where dried herbs, more peppercorn and light black-plum flavors arise.

title: Ferguson Crest 2016 Private Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Relatively light in body, this bottling offers pomegranate and asphalt on the fresh but simple nose. Plum and dried herbs make for an almost Pinot Noir-like experience on the sip, which is easy to enjoy.

title: Dutton Estate 2016 Dutton Palms Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a thick full-bodied white with structured tangy acidity that tries to keep up with the oak. A nutty profile defines its flavor. The palate is viscous and lush.

title: Leese-Fitch 2016 Firehouse Red (California)
description: This wine is plenty oaky but backs it up with nice rich and ripe fruit flavors too. A deep color leads to aromas of wood char and baking spices. Blackberry jam and blueberry flavors seem to fill the mouth and light tannins add some good structure.

title: Riaza 2014 Old Soul Carignane (Mokelumne River)
description: This medium-bodied wine has plenty of ripe fruit character, and moderate tannins in the texture. Light smoky earthy accents follow good raspberry and blackberry flavors.

title: The Federalist 2016 Honest Red (North Coast)
description: Spicy and smooth, this full-bodied blend based around Merlot and Zinfandel shows ample oak influence and good ripe raspberry and cherry flavors. Notes of brown sugar and maple provide a hint of bourbon in the aroma and lead to nice fruit on the palate.

title: Via Romano 2014 Tuscan Style Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is mild and mellow, on the light side in terms of body, and shows warm plum and sandalwood flavors that offer some maturity and complexity. It's very smooth and has just a touch of light tannins.

title: Axios 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Big black fruit and cedar wrap around a stock of toasted oak and tannin in this integrated wine that is in decline.

title: Domenica Amato 2017 Salomon Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is an oily viscous white, nutty with floral elements of jasmine and rose. A dense dry texture rides below lemon verbena and stone-fruit flavors.

title: Dutton Estate 2016 Warren's Collection Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Honey and graham cracker are the richer elements of this otherwise bold, ripe and concentrated white, which has a hearty helping of oak and Gravenstein apple.

title: Golden 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Cranberry and grape-seed aromas meet with wet wood and anise on the nose of this bottling. The acidity is extremely aggressive on the palate, where cranberry-orange juice flavors arise.

title: Havens 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine holds back on its aromatics, but not on its generous grip of oak and tannin. The flavors lean into dried cherry, cassis and mint.

title: Kreck 2016 Del Barba Old Vine Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: Very ripe, vaguely plummy and full bodied, this wine tastes rich and feels soft, almost syrupy, on the tongue. It has light tannins and elevated alcohol, which combine for a fat mouthfeel and finish.

title: Owl Ridge 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Sanguine in red currant and tangy acidity, this wine is robust in tannin with a finish of mint.

title: Peter Paul Wines 2016 Mille Frere Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a thick densely concentrated red, ripely driven by tannin and oak, with an elusive underbelly of red fruit.

title: Reata 2016 Three County Pinot Noir (Monterey-Sonoma-San Benito)
description: Ripe and baked red-fruit aromas meet with rust and baking spice on the very extracted nose of this bottling. The palate is very ripe with baked red fruit and nutmeg spice.

title: J. Lohr 2015 Cuvée Pau Red (Paso Robles)
description: A rich black-cherry aroma meets with hints of slate and marjoram on the nose of this Californian ode to Pauillac. The palate offers flavors of black cherry foam, milk chocolate and dark fudge, all wrapped in chalky, polished tannins.

title: Keller Estate 2016 Precioso Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: There's an alluring stemmy, earthy component to this tiny production wine that intrigues and invites. A selection of the best barrels, it shows soft black cherries and strawberries that have been dipped in black tea, orange peel and baking spice. It is fleshy and lush on the palate with strong acidity.

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2017 Cortada Alta Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black cherry, iodine, leather and a hint of game show on the nose of this bottling, one of the rare Syrahs from this appellation. There are hints of iodine, kelp and green peppercorns on the palate, but also richer touches of black plum and acai.

title: Montemar 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lighter in the glass, this bottling from a mountaintop vineyard shows pomegranate, sour cherry, sandalwood and roasted fennel on the nose, along with a strong mineral kick. There's a sense of crushed sandstone on the palate along with red cherries, red currants, star anise and a touch of nutmeg. It is still very fresh.

title: Navarro 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Though floral and fruity, this wine tastes absolutely dry and refreshing from the first whiff of crisp green apple to the generous white-peach and apricot flavors and through the lingering vibrant finish. Great acidity gives wonderful balance to this elegant wine.

title: Pine Ridge 2015 Alta Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Smooth red fruit is girded by powerful tension in this mountain wine, integrated in tannin despite its mountain heritage. Black raspberry and black currant are complemented by dustings of mocha and lavender. The wine is complex and hearty, with 5% Petit Verdot.

title: Sanford 2015 Vista Al Rincon La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Buttercream, honeysuckle, pear flesh and a hint of toast show on the cohesive nose of this bottling. It's a down-the-middle and familiar Chardonnay on the palate, with flavors of lemon, lime, roasted apple and nut butter, finishing on a touch of butterscotch.
designation: Vista Al Rincon La Rinconada Vineyard

title: Shane Wines 2016 La Reine Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Very ripe and concentrated, this full-bodied wine exudes black-cherry and blackberry aromas, rich fruit flavors and well-integrated oak spices. A broad mouthfilling texture benefits from fine-grained tannins that add an appetizing grip.

title: Ann Albert 2016 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light and bright aromas of lemon peel, yellow apple, orange peels and red-pear flesh arise on the nose of this bottling by Eric Johnson. There's a great grip to the sip, where lemon and nectarine flavors show in the midpalate that leads into a more creamy yet still chalky finish.

title: Aperture 2016 Sugarloaf Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine, earthy and meaty, this wine shows hints of dried herb, petrol and ash between dark brooding hits of plum and black cherry. Made mostly from Merlot, it has 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Cabernet Franc blended in, adding to its soft, layered finish hinting of mocha and sage.
