title: Cabana Wines 2008 Harbour Red (Lodi)
description: This luxurious, dark and brooding dessert wine has the complexity of a well-aged Port and the opulent, concentrated fruit content of a blackberry sauce. It is full bodied, quite sweet, rich in texture and very long on the finish.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Super Cali Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Bay leaf and tarragon aromas give herbal depth to the brighter red-fruit and dried earth aromas on this bottling by Scott Sampler, who macerates his wine for many months. There are savory qualities to the sip, which is reminiscent of a pizza sauce, with oregano, cherry, red plums and dried mushroom flavors.

title: Navarro 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Lovely, light fruit and flower aromas give a great entry to this well-balanced medium-bodied wine from a remarkably consistent producer. Raspberry and red cherry follow on, lifted by great acidity and tasting absolutely fresh and appetizing.

title: Sojourn 2017 Wohler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Beautifully perfumed, this is a well-integrated wine, gritty in texture and moderate in weight. Blue and red fruit form around a tension of focused acidity and tannic balance, finishing with a spiciness of cardamom, cola and orange peel.

title: Tablas Creek 2018 Vermentino (Adelaida District)
description: This is an extremely fresh and delightful bottling from a grape that continues to impress. Aromas of honeysuckle and fresh lemon seem slightly sweet but very subtle, and then the palate grips with a flashy tautness, carrying flavors of chalk and Key lime pith. It's as refreshing as wine gets.

title: Benom 2018 Contrast Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: This unique Santa Barbara-Paso Robles blend of the Solomon Hill and Parrish Family vineyards makes for a compelling sip, with aromas of guava bubblegum, jasmine and wisteria on the nose. The palate is crisp with guava skin and plumeria candy flavors, cut by an underlying acidity.

title: Bruliam 2016 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the great site now within the Petaluma Gap is this stewy, meaty and concentrated wine from a great vintage, is ebullient in strawberry, plum and mint. The backbone of the red's medium-bodied richness is concentrated in savory spice and herb, with a lacing of acid-driven minerality.

title: Davis Bynum 2017 River West Vineyard Dijon Clone 809 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a vineyard on Westside Road this is a rich and complex white wine meant to highlight a strong, stony element of mineral-laden acidity. Juicy, with length and breadth, it has flavors of baked lemon and hazelnut spiced in nutmeg—a successful contrast between citrus and tropical character.

title: Eclectic 2017 Tanner Vineyards Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)
description: This complex and well-balanced wine manages to be a bit edgy but generous at the same time. Mineral chalky aromas segue to palate-coating white-peach and almond flavors while the full body is braced by a good twist of acidity that adds nice tension in the middle and finish.

title: Locke 2016 Viognier (Calaveras County)
description: This full-bodied, fabulous wine captures both the rich, nutty quality that Viognier can show and a leaner, more tangy aspect. Mineral and hazelnut aromas set the stage for vibrant peach and apricot flavors that swirl into a savory mineral finish.

title: Iron Horse 2014 Wedding Cuvée Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: A blend of 72% Pinot Noir and 28% Chardonnay, this is a stunning vintage of the perennially impressive sparkler. Nutty and earthy, it sings in strawberry, wet stone and rose petal. The palate offers a lively mousse and persistent acidity, making it vibrant and easy to enjoy.

title: Stewart 2016 Nomad Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The producer's new Nomad collection includes bottlings from every marquee Beckstoffer Cabernet Sauvignon vineyard in the Napa Valley. This is an herbal, dusty, old-world offering, deep in grippy tannins and the youthful vigor of firm acidity. Pencil shavings, red currant and a streak of cocoa play on the palate with bright abandon. Enjoy best from 2026–2030.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Toyon Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This lovely vineyard-designate is expertly put together, showing honeyed concentration and evolved flavors of baked apple and apricot. Floral in honeysuckle and apple blossom, it has substantive layers of bold texture and body, with a steely undertow of fresh acidity.

title: Bien Nacido Estate 2015 The XO Reserve Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: From a block planted in 1987, this bottling offers an extremely fresh, bright and snappy black raspberry aroma, with deeper tones of tar, char and coffee in the background. The palate is all about grippy tannins, roasted berries and white pepper spice. Drink now–2035.

title: Black Kite 2016 Gap's Crown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This has gorgeous aromas of ginger and crushed rock, a stony mineral component that's irresistible and memorable. Balanced in richness, it sings in baked pear and honeysuckle, finding a touch of restraint within a medium-bodied frame of welcome decadence.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Great ripeness comes with great balance in this fruity, expressive and firm-textured wine. It is full in body but not flabby due to sinewy tannins and persistent acidity. Aromas and flavors run from cinnamon to black cherry to rhubarb, as hints of nutmeg and vanilla show a deft touch of oak. Best from 2022.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of 71% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Cabernet Franc, 11% Petit Verdot and 5% Merlot. Together, they present a powerful grip of tar, black cherry, blackberry, framed by supportive acidity and integrated oak. Let this one lie; enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Leitmotif 2016 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a phenomenal start for the small-batch side project by Stephen Searle, whose main job is running Jaffurs Winery. Intense aromas of Bing cherry jelly, crushed rocks and dried sage show on the nose, while the palate combines wild berry and minty flavors with a strong chalky grip, proving both luxurious and refreshing.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Benito County)
description: Beautifully plump aromas of black plum, violet, rose and baked fennel show on the nose of this bottling. Soft and full on the palate, it offers plenty of fruit surrounding the earthy core, with flavors of wild cherry, cherry pit, Alpine strawberry, loam and herb.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is pretty, floral and compact in red fruit, the texture soft and billowy on the palate. Rich and full bodied, it has additional complexity from small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Integrated beautifully, it shows balance and power in equal measure.

title: Thirty-Seven 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)
description: This remarkable wine impresses in quality and price, made in tiny amounts but well worth seeking. A bright, earthy entry of wild strawberry and raspberry fill the full-bodied palate that's grippy in tension and powerful in weight.

title: Daou 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Inky in the glass, this rich and structured bottling offers a plump black-currant aroma, along with pinches of pepper and tightly woven oak. The palate lands softly and then the tannins rise up, offering savory flavors of charred beef, dark chocolate and black cherry. Drink 2020–2036.

title: Friedeman 2016 UV Lancel Creek Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft and nicely integrated, this full-bodied wine is robustly built yet sublime in its grasp of firm tannin and fresh acidity. Flavors of raspberry, cherry, mint and an earthy forest floor component complement each other well.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Dutton Ranch Walker Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: This white has an expert level of intensity and concentration, and plenty of length within its balanced frame. Flavors of lemon meringue, brioche and apricot are complemented by wet stone.

title: Jaffurs 2015 Upslope Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Bright and snappy violet aromas lead into black peppers and charred blackberry on the elegant nose of this bottling, created from the winery's best-barrels released each vintage. The palate is taut and grippy with firm tannins and perfectly primed acid, which will carry the dried herb and pepper flavors into the deep future. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a grainy, structured and textured white, lifted by bright acidity and crisp flavors of apple, peach and pear. It has concentration of flavor as well as tension, offering length and balance within an elegant framework.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smoky, toasty oak plays a stellar background role to this wine's succulence of black cherry, raspberry and blood orange. Acid-driven on the palate, it presents plenty of secondary characteristics that lean into savory tones of black tea and cardamom.

title: Mt. Brave 2015 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)
description: This is 100% varietal and remarkably impressive, true to form in earthy aromas of violet and sage. The mountainous appellation contributes girth and breadth, as well as densely layered texture and grip. Around the fullness are beautiful flavors of chocolate, graham cracker and blueberry. This will cellar well; enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Aperture 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a barrel-fermented white that impresses from start to finish, with 4% Sémillon added to the mix. A sublime white-peach flavor is layered and well-integrated within a stony texture. Offering length and breadth, this is defined by an exotic spice note that lingers.

title: Dragonette 2016 Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright citrus aromas meet with clay-like minerality and richer nutty aromas on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from atop the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate combines edgy tang with richness, pairing lemon cream with white peach, citrus peel with custard, making for a fascinating sip that will please many.

title: Anglim 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Dense aromas of black cherry are enhanced by strong baking spices on the nose of this bottling. The palate's dark-red fruits and gingerbread flavors are held up by chalky tannins, proving quite full and lavish.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Barrel 16 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a richly layered, approachable wine that offers soft, succulent tones of pear, pineapple and vanilla. The oak is measured and supportive, with a creamy lushness balanced by bright, lasting acidity.

title: Tinto Rey 2015 Tempranillo (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This generous wine is full in body and packed with ripe black fruits wrapped in dark chocolate. Fine-grained tannins give support on the palate and balance the opulent fruitiness.

title: DRNK 2016 Hallberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dense red fruit is supported by a weight of grippy tannin in this seductive silky smooth wine marked by cardamom and nutmeg. Aromatic in roses, it shows lovely structure and an elegance that lingers through a long finish.

title: Graveyard 2016 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of black currant, violet, lilac and oak arise on the nose of this bottling. The palate is rich, plush and ripe in a black cherry flavor, yet also cut by pleasing acidity and firm tannins.

title: MacRostie 2016 Clockwise Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: Smoky oak, meat and garrigue accent a juicy, integrated core of blueberry, blackberry and currant in this approachable wine that is both lush and fruity. The tannins are well integrated and softly wrapped around the richness.

title: Parallel 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick and savory red wine from a picture-perfect vintage, moderate in ripeness and power. Graphite, lavender and dried herb combine around dense layers of cassis and red currant, finishing with length and grace.

title: Pianetta 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Geneseo District)
description: Focused aromas of boysenberrry and elderberry meet with earthy floral tones on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the eastside of Paso Robles. The palate is powerful but not overly ripe, offering flavors of boysenberry and strawberry alongside star anise and more baking spices.

title: Boekenoogen 2017 Bell Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Monterey)
description: A compellingly stony minerality starts the nose on this bottling from a vineyard planted in 2005 in southwestern Carmel Valley, which also offers crisp honeydew rind aromas. The palate is also taut with chiseled stone qualities, showing white melon and Key lime as well.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Estate Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)
description: Quite light in the glass, this estate bottling starts with aromas of raspberry and dried tarragon. The palate is enveloped in wild thyme and other dried herbs, which decorate the base flavors of pomegranate and raspberry, with a zippy acidity throughout.

title: Renwood 2016 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Delicious, ripe plum and vanilla flavors light up this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine. Light accents of black pepper and dried herb add some complexity while the concentrated fruit flavors drive the palate and finish.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a lively, tasty wine that is persistent in fresh acidity. Flavors of orange peel, pomegranate and strawberry meld with light touches of baking spice and rose petal.

title: Hess Collection 2016 Small Block Series Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine with impressive concentration and full-bodied weight, this wine is soft and richly layered in blue and black fruit, with memorable elements of mocha and vanilla. Classically structured, it offers insight into a great vintage in the right hands.

title: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Strong aromas of coffee, cocoa, toffee and black cherry show on the very rich nose of this blend of Syrah, Mourvèdre, Petite Sirah, Touriga Nacional, Cabernet Sauvignon and Souzao. There's a tang of cherry peel to the sip, where caramelized flavors are lush and expressive.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Strata Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This mineral-driven white has a steely frame, punctuated by inviting aromas of white flower and apple blossom. Creamy on the palate, it stays bright and fresh in the glass, with appealing flavors of lemon zest, Gravenstein apple and wet stone.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Cinsault (Red Hills)
description: Very ripe, almost roasted black-fruit flavors and full body are the primary impressions of this bold, saturated wine. Black plums and dried plums are subtly spiced with cinnamon and tamarind for interesting complexity on the palate and finish.

title: Abbot's Passage 2018 Sightline White (Clarksburg)
description: This full-bodied wine shows a more serious side of Chenin Blanc, wrapping a rich texture around baked apple, vanilla and mineral flavors. It is nice and dry, mouthfilling and adds a touch of grippy tannin to cleanse the palate. An addition of 20% Verdejo was blended in.

title: Markus Wine Co 2018 Nimmo White (Lodi)
description: This attractive, spicy and complex blend balances ripe fruit with crisp acidity on a smooth and expansive texture. The wine is full bodied and rich enough for a lingering finish.

title: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: Clean and grassy aromas meet with rainy cement and a hint of peach blossom on the nose of this blend of 53% Sauvignon Blanc from McGinley Vineyard and 47% Chardonnay from Donnachadh Vineyard. There is a great sizzle to the sip, which is crisp with dried apple and bright Meyer lemon flavors and wrapped in chalky tannins.

title: Ordaz Family Wines 2016 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Crayon wax, plum and dark cherry mingle against a medium-bodied, moderately oaked and well-made mountain wine from the famous site in this new appellation. Sinewy texture is boosted by high-toned acidity and earthy freshness that allows room for white and black pepper to linger.

title: Zaca Mesa 2015 Estrella Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dark blackberry juice, wood spice, charred beef and tar aromas show on the nose of this clonal expression, which remains quite young and tight. Stiff tannins and sharp acidity carry flavors of roasted meat in elderberry reduction sauce.

title: Bravante 2013 Estate Reserve Red (Howell Mountain)
description: Soft and thick, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot has a wealth of raspberry, chocolate and clove flavor. The secondary characteristics dip into cedar, tobacco and black pepper, the finish starting to fade.

title: Ca' Momi 2016 Heartcraft Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Bright blueberry, plum and cherry aromas open this affordable red, which is soft and supple in approachability. Clove and a touch of mocha round out the light-bodied experience.

title: Castle Rock 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Ripe orchard fruit, apple blossoms and warm melon flesh show on the nose of this widely available bottling. Rounded flavors of lemon cream and salted cashew show on the palate, where acidity is prime.

title: Domenica Amato 2017 Gusto Bianco White (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a 50-50 blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier, made in a lighthearted light-bodied style. A floral earthy nose of jasmine opens the wine, before fleshy aspects of nectarine and dried apricot figure onto the palate, boosted by uplifted acidity.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Fleur de Edna Winemaker Series Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Very floral aromas of honeysuckle, apple cream and tuberose show on the nose of this bottling from the Gallo-owned winery. There is also intense florality on the sip, where honeysuckle cream flavors meet with a chalky mouthfeel.

title: Encanto 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Thick and syrupy, this wine offers a wealth of tannic density and ripeness. Black cherry and cola dominate around a support of toasted oak.

title: Hendry 2016 Hendry Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced and meaty, this is a richly built, robust and earthy wine, with grabby tannins that grip the palate with force.

title: Left Bend 2015 Raines Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Dark red currant and concentrated rose elements meet with crushed slate and a pinch of herbs on the nose in this bottling from the eastern slope of the appellation. Flavors of pencil shavings, tomato leaf and dried oregano are prominent on the palate, where tart berries and persistent acid round out the experience.

title: McClain Cellars 2016 Summer Breeze Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This bottling is quite ripe on the nose with yellow-peach and melon aromas, but they are cut by a sharp lemon-spray element. Yellow-pear and poached apple flavors show on the palate, finishing on a touch of marshmallow.

title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Napa County)
description: Made from both Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this value-driven, larger production offering is light and lean, with understated acidity. It delivers flavor and texture within a rich rounded palate of approachable pear and vanilla-biscuit flavor.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Blue Label Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Weighty tannins and broad flavors of strawberry that take on a jammy quality dominate in this wine, brimming in sweet cherry.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Yellow Label Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is rich and round in blue fruit, cola and root-beer flavors, the body weight thick and concentrated in full-bodied ripeness. It finishes in toasty oak.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)
description: Vanilla, sweet cherries and intense red currants make for an approachably ripe nose on this bottling. The palate is also quite ripe with boysenberry and extracted cranberry-sauce flavors.

title: Carol Shelton 2014 Rockpile Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rockpile)
description: This wine is minty and intense in tannin, which contributes to a grippy texture around its full-bodied weight. A brightness of red currant and cranberry give it a lasting tartness on the finish.

title: Dutton Estate 2016 Kyndall's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a mild-mannered white, lemony in apple and pear. It has an intensity that finishes dry and oaky with a strong finish of tropical richness.

title: High Valley Vineyard 2016 Zinfandel (High Valley)
description: A slight earthy, dusty accent accompanies ripe, raisiny, plummy flavors in this soft-textured and full-bodied wine. It's big, smooth and mouth filling.

title: Jockey Club 2015 Red (Amador County)
description: This dry wine is medium bodied, seems Rhône-like in its combo of ripe berry and spice flavors but it's made from 75% Zinfandel and 25% Barbera. A broad mouthfilling texture adds to its appeal.

title: Murphy-Goode 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a value red made in a big full-bodied style that's thick, rich and chocolatey. Substantial heat and oak push the fruit forward with no hesitation.

title: The Federalist 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This wine has classic aromas of apple and butter, then good and ripe fruit flavors accented by vanilla and caramel and surrounded by a rich soft texture.

title: Cannonball 2016 Eleven Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Thick and rich in cherry, raspberry and oak, this is a full-bodied, entirely enjoyable wine. The layers of flavor are soft and well integrated, with touches of leather and baking spice.

title: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a substantially fleshy, rounded white wine, offering concentrated flavors of almond paste, white peach and crème brûlée. The oak is integrated and supportive, with nuanced wisps of nutmeg and vanilla.

title: Albatross Ridge 2017 Cuvée Vivienne Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Black plum and black-pepper spice are framed by oaky, caramel-laced aromas on the nose of this bottling. There's a strong tang of boysenberry on the sip, which is made more complex with herbal flavors.

title: Albatross Ridge 2017 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Fairly reserved at first on the nose, this bottling eventually reveals red plum and dank herbs on the tangy nose. The palate is fairly concentrated and thick in mouthfeel, with pleasing flavors of roasted black plum and more dark fruits.

title: Michael David 2016 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)
description: Rich aromas of fresh pastries and berry pie meet jammy, ripe and almost thick blackberry and boysenberry flavors. This is a full-bodied, bombastic and delicious wine.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine is easygoing, broad in texture and full bodied. It's generously oaked, having been aged for 20 months in 41% new barrels, but not overworked, offering a rich mélange of baking spices, currants, cherries and cedar.

title: Hans Fahden 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This is an herbal, tannic 100% varietal wine that is thickly full bodied in black cherry, blackberry and currant, with nice accents of sage and clove. The oak is supportive and unobtrusive, allowing the savory and fruity elements to come together.

title: Charles Woodson's Intercept 2018 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Tight aromas of lime blossom, Key lime sorbet, white melon and a touch of spearmint show on the nose of this bottling by football star Charles Woodson. The palate starts with stony flavors before tropical touches of guava and lychee arise.

title: Jarvis 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has barrel-informed creaminess and rich flavors of caramel and crème brûlée. Thick and layered, it imparts golden elements of apple and pear with an underlying hint of brine and oyster shell that complement and freshen.

title: Peju 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with Petit Verdot, Malbec and a dab of Zinfandel, this wine is thick and concentrated in red fruit and firm generous tannin. Heavy in texture and weight, it should appeal to fans of a hearty style: it's well made, with dashes of leather and dried herb.

title: Tower 15 2017 Chapel Vineyards Dornfelder (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dornfelder is almost unheard of outside of Germany, yet this planting, from a vineyard once owned by a German couple, makes one wonder why. Extremely dark and unctuous in the glass, the wine reveals aromas of boysenberry pie while the palate's grainy tannins carry elderberry and minty herb flavors.

title: Bella Grace 2016 Primitivo (Amador County)
description: This is a serious, dry wine fashioned to pair with a grilled steak or chop, and nicely packed with ripe blackberry and cherry flavors that are framed by firm tannins and good acidity.

title: Hawley 2017 Treborce Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Earthy compost, black tea and turned earth highlight a structured offering of bold ripe flavor and robust power in this wine. Jammy black fruit is seasoned in baking spice and leather, with 5% Petite Sirah adding extra weight and concentration.

title: Square Peg 2017 Estate Dry Farmed Unfiltered and Unfined Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers bold, brawny earthiness and dense black fruit that is laced in cardamom and black pepper. Exotic, well crafted and full bodied, it has silky but strong tannins and integrated oak, with a jolt of freshness enlivening the finish.
designation: Estate Dry Farmed Unfiltered and Unfined

title: Heintz 2016 Rachael Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This exuberant white is lengthy in stony minerality and a touch of sea spray, its closeness to the coast in full display. Integrated and balanced in acidity, it shares juicy layers of apple and lemon with nuanced oak and subtle tannin.

title: Imagery 2016 Gee eS eM Red (North Coast)
description: This deep-colored and full-bodied wine is packed with flavors of blackberry jam, blueberries and oak spice and wrapped in moderate tannins that balance out the ripe character.

title: Peachy Canyon 2017 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: There's a clean streak of down-the-middle purple aromas on this bottling, including acai and elderberry, as well as a slight hint of tar. The palate is quite crisp with strong acid and sandy tannins framing flavors of black currant and dank earth.

title: Prima Materia 2016 Sangiovese
description: Effusive floral and black-fruit aromas lead to rich, ripe and concentrated flavors as this full-bodied wine stays focused and powerful. It shows moderate tannins and good balance too. Five different clones of Sangiovese are included, and 15% whole clusters were used in the fermentation.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Aglianico (Amador County)
description: A lively angular texture and bold well-delineated fruit, herb and smoke flavors make this full-boded wine arresting. It piles wood char on black pepper on ripe blackberries for a unique combination that's fun to explore.

title: Thacher 2016 El Alvaro La Vista Vineyard Red (Adelaida District)
description: Lighter in the glass, this blend of 52% Grenache, 24% Syrah and 24% Mourvèdre is pleasantly spicy on the nose, with dark-red-fruit, coffee and smoke aromas. The palate combines light-red fruits with hickory-smoke flavors.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salty, briny and grippy in baked apple, oak and tannin, this wine has lengthy concentration and complexity to offer. Its waves of structure and oak are buoyed by fresh, persistent acidity. The brightness pierces through a lengthy finish of baking spice.

title: Gainey 2017 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Juicy and ripe boysenberry fruit is lifted by pinches of baking spice on the intense and rewarding nose of this bottling. The strong fruit character continues on the sip with ripe berries and gingerbread spices, but it's cut by a potent acidity that drives into the finish.

title: Liquid Farm 2017 La Hermana Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This roughly 50-50 blend of sister vineyards Solomon Hills and Bien Nacido starts with aromas of lemon oil, clean tangerine pith and damp oak. There is great tension on the sip, where bright lemon and dried chamomile flavors meet with sandalwood.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Densely packed in rich layers of concentration, this is an expansive and rewarding appellation wine, worthy of exploration. Cherry, strawberry and baking spice combine effortlessly for a seamless expression of savory fruit that lingers on the palate in balanced complexity.

title: Davis Family 2016 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an impressive and lovely wine, thick, spicy and exotic with integrated oak. Lively and fresh with a powerful undercurrent of understated power, it shines in orange, rhubarb and blueberry dipped in cardamom and cola.

title: Drew 2016 The Fog-Eater Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Delicate but flavorful, this nervy wine walks a tightrope between ripeness and tartness that gives it an extra zing on the palate. Bright red cherry and raspberry meet light herb and cedar flavors, while firm tannins tingle on the finish. Best after 2023.

title: Anaba 2016 Turbine Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: This outstanding blend brings together 45% Syrah, 41% Grenache, 9% Mourvèdre and 5% Petite Sirah, the grapes from the Landa Vineyard and Teldeschi Home Ranch. Soft, structured and juicy on the midpalate, it has strong, forceful layers of meaty, peppery exoticism, complemented in dried herb and blackberry compote.

title: Auteur Wines 2017 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Hearty in cardamom, sage and orange, this robust, powerfully built vineyard-designate shows a density in tannin and depth of earth. Billowing layers of blood orange, dark cherry and lavender boost an underlying vibrancy of high-toned acidity and balance.

title: Kitá 2016 Camp 4 Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a great amount of energy on the nose of this bottling, showing fresh berries alongside damp wood and chunky soil aromas. The palate is cohesive in offering all the elements of Cab, from dark berries at the core to touches of marjoram, oregano and cracked pepper. Tannins are apparent, but not obtrusive.

title: Longoria 2017 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Richard Longoria's Pinot Noirs can last decades, and this one is a good bet for cellaring. Aromas of wild lavender, dark cranberry, lilac and dark rocks lead into an earthy palate of ripe berry, game and chaparral, all framed by promising tannins. Drink 2020–2037.

title: Grassini 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Intense aromas of red currant and black plum meet with an elegant floral display on the fresh nose of this bottling. There's great energy to the palate, where exotic red-cherry and elderberry flavors meet with cola, more flowers and tannins that will quickly smooth out.

title: Miner 2017 Wild Yeast Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Intensely fruity on the nose in pear and anise, this white is creamy and lush in style, while simultaneously balanced in ripeness. It shows an exotic mineral component of stone and crushed rock before unveiling a smooth, lengthy finish.

title: Villa Creek 2017 Garnacha (Adelaida District)
description: This wine is still quite young, but with patience, it blossoms from delicate and shy into a more lush and delicious experience. Aromas of red cherry, rose petal and light sumac lead into a palate thick with sticky tannins. As they smooth out, precise candied strawberry flavors steal the show. Drink 2021–2031.

title: Zotovich 2018 Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's immense freshness to the nose of this estate bottling, with freshly cut pluot and white-melon aromas. The palate sizzles with strong acidity and grabs hold with a tense structure, tucking the flavors of peach and melon behind a chalky frame.

title: Domaine Chandon NV Étoile Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: A prestige cuvée made from Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier, this impressive wine has a beautiful salmon hue. Floral and salty, it presents as dry, with a lingering flavors of lemon peel, oyster shell and unripe strawberry.

title: Grounded Wine Co. 2016 Steady State Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This impressive red overdelivers on its price point, combining the main variety with Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Merlot, aging the whole in French oak for 18 months (40% of it new). Truffled earth, compost, bark and gunpowder give it a savory edge that leads to a juicy, balanced midpalate of black fruit, cocoa powder and dust.

title: Saracina 2018 Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This is a substantial, engaging wine that shows focused fruit flavors backed by lively, mouthwatering acidity. Ripe pear, peach and apple notes ride a full body that makes it mouthfilling. Subtle hints of vanilla and ginger add complexity and seem to expand with each sip.

title: Laetitia NV Brut Cuvée Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: There's a yeasty kick to the nose of this bottling, which begins with aromas of sourdough as well as Mandarin orange peel and lemon-lime soda. The palate is complex with flavors of corn, dough and orange zest.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 SHR Field Blend Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a generous, full-bodied but also complex and nuanced wine that contains 13% Petite Sirah and 7% Barbera. It packs in nicely ripe and concentrated blackberry and black-cherry flavors and dusts them with light herb, mineral and toast accents. Moderate tannins help liven the palate and extend to the lingering finish.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Soft yet dark aromas of black raspberry sorbet are lifted by star anise and wild mint aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a rich boysenberry depth to the palate, alongside fennel pollen, rounded baking spice and a plum-skin tang.

title: Comartin 2018 Zabala Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Aromas of cut grass, kelp and lemon rinds show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with sour citrus flavors, and slightly more complex hints of oregano and nori wrap.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Purgatorio Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This 50-50 blend of Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon is huge in flavors and giant in structure, boasting dense, concentrated blackberry and blueberry notes on a tight texture of firm tannins and full body. It needs a few years aging or a juicy steak to tame it down. Best after 2024.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Choreography Red (San Francisco Bay)
description: This generous and smoothly textured wine is full bodied but feels deceptively light, while splashing the palate with fresh blueberry and blackberry flavors. It was made with a majority Merlot along with Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc.

title: DeLorimier 2015 River Lane Reserve Primitivo (Alexander Valley)
description: Smoky in oak and firm in tannin, this is a surprisingly high-toned wine, with a core of crisp red fruit. It belies the overall power and generosity of the wine, which is richly concentrated.

title: DeLorimier 2015 The Station Reserve Primitivo (Alexander Valley)
description: Brambly in jammy black fruit, mocha and cinnamon, this is a soft, rounded and rich wine that pushes the envelope on ripeness and concentration, but will please fans of the style.

title: Delta 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Light, nuanced and floral, this value-driven wine is also made to benefit environmental causes. Sourced from cool-climate sites, winemaker Matthew Iaconis of Brick & Mortar gives it low oak and moderate acidity, letting it become creamy in crème brûlée and bright in orange and lime.

title: Deovlet 2017 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dried pear peels, freshly cut pomelo and very pithy citrus aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers dried orange peel, light apple flesh, a steely minerality and zippy acidity.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2018 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)
description: Fragrantly fruity in peach, apricot and a sweetness of vanilla, this is a cheery, approachable and richly styled white, which refreshes within a full-bodied middle.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2014 Fogline Neighbors Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is thick and tart, with sizable tannins. The fruit is firmly intertwined with the bigger elements of oak and power, showing a brightness of cherry and strawberry.

title: Fossil Point 2017 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Fruity aromas of papaya, mango and pineapple kick off the nose on this affordable bottling by the Center of Effort team. The tropical tones show on the palate as well, where flavors of Starburst candy dominate, yet there is a tension to hold everything in check.

title: Fossil Point 2018 Rosé (San Luis Obispo County)
description: A yellowish shade of pink in the glass, this bottling offers tangy lemon peel and just a tiny bit of red fruit on the nose. It's very tightly wound on the palate, with slight peach and more lemon-rind flavors.

title: Hahn 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Light and mellow aromas of lemon blossom and yellow pear show on the nose of this bottling from the Hahn family, which features a new label. The palate is tense and full of citrus flavors, from lime peel to lemon peel, leading into a slightly sour finish.

title: Jax 2018 Y3 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Opening in jalapeño, dried herb and grass, this light-bodied white comes together in the glass to refresh in crisp acidity and lasting steely texture. It was fermented in both concrete and neutral oak.

title: Kaena 2017 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: Tropical aromas of tuberose, ripe papaya, mango and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling. There is a stony grip to the sip, where ripe flavors of peach and guava show strongly.

title: Kokomo 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This provides good value and a velvety smooth expression of the variety that should satisfy fans of a bigger style. Big-boned in tannin and oak, it settles into itself to show dense jammy flavors of black cherry, currant and chocolate.

title: LangeTwins 2018 Estate Grown Moscato (Clarksburg)
description: Fragrant with roses and gardenias, this sweet and deliciously fruity wine is low in alcohol, soft in texture and sugary on the finish. It's something nice to drink with cheese, biscotti or a fruity dessert.

title: Marimar 2015 Mas Cavalls Dona Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy in mushroom and forest floor, this wine has a thick tannin structure and plenty of intensity. The fruit is savory in cranberry, pomegranate and rhubarb, tartly accentuating the high-toned acidity that is its foundation.

title: Orsi Family 2014 Aglianico (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Mint and bay leaf open the door to a thick midpalate brimming in wild gamy notes, leather and black pepper. Underlying acidity keeps it fresh in the glass, finishing soft and succulently.

title: Pulchella 2018 Rogue Rosé (Adelaida District)
description: This Tannat-based rosé from Bella Collina Vineyard starts with red-plum and red-apple aromas that are tangy and earthy. The palate's tang is delivered by grapefruit skins and then rounded by bubblegum and sour orange, but the texture is much thicker than expected.

title: River Road 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a gamy, brooding and darkly colored wine, offered at a nice price. Juicy, rounded and rich, it shows balance and complementary flavors of toasted oak, sage and blackberry.

title: Lady of the Sunshine 2017 Coquelicot Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Wet stone, crushed rocks and a touch of funky grass aromas show on the nose of this bottling, the first for young vintner Gina Hildebrand. The palate is all about minerality, reminiscent of wet sidewalks on a rainy day, along with touches of lime skin, grapefruit pith and ash.

title: Noceto NV Rosso Tuscan Style Red (Amador County)
description: This wine has the grip and good acidity of a Sangiovese along with ample red- and black-cherry flavors that fill out the palate very well. It has a medium-dark color, light salt and pepper aromas that accent the cherries, and then a satisfying richness on the palate that is well supported by fine-grained tannins.

title: Portalupi 2017 Graziano Vineyard Arneis (Mendocino)
description: This unoaked wine is positively charged with crisp apple and grapefruit flavors, has tangy acidity and medium body. Refreshment is in the forefront from the apple-skin aromas to citrus flavors to a mouthwatering finish.

title: Red Car 2015 Zephyr Farms Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This has a carbonic freshness and high-strung acidity. The fruit is nuanced, fresh and powerful in strawberry and orange.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: From portions of the Burning Creek and Lafond Vineyards, this fruit-forward wine is a solid deal, starting with strong aromas of black cherry, licorice and nutmeg. It's a full-flavored Pinot Noir that currently shows a rather tense structure, carrying flavors of black raspberry, boysenberry and black pepper.

title: St. Supéry 2014 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Rutherford)
description: Sanguine notes of red currant and plum meet a light dusting of baking spice and clove in this well-made, well-integrated wine. It shows a heartiness of full-bodied richness and toasted oak.

title: Stephanie 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: Toasty black-cherry jam meets smoky oak in this robust, rich varietal wine, blended with a small amount of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Abundantly ripe, it finishes soft and round.

title: Wilson Creek 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)
description: Concentrated red-cherry aromas meet with caramel, baking spice and vanilla brioche on the nose of this bottling. Ripe red-fruit flavors are lifted by red licorice and more caramel on the palate, which rides through chunky tannins and finishes on vanilla.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Big Wood Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied elevated-alcohol wine offers an enticing salt and pepper aroma followed by meaty wood-smoke accents that complement the underlying blackberry flavors. It matches the grapey fruitiness of the wine with oak accents and a just-firm enough texture.

title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Toyon Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This kitchen sink blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and more offers aromas of boysenberry, alpine strawberry and peppercorn on the fresh nose. The earthy palate combines violet and black cherry with a pinch of pepper.

title: Au Bon Climat 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Sharp pomegranate aromas and concentrated strawberry tones meet with star anise, clove and crushed rocks on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's taut on the palate with tightly woven raspberry and a touch of thyme, proving rather light and easy.

title: Balletto 2015 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Made in an austere style, this has a backbone of tannin and power that builds on the midpalate, with the oak prominent and supportive. Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors are seasoned in touches of nutmeg and ginger, making for a balanced experience of fruit and spice.
designation: Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Balletto 2017 Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Thirst quenching in lemon, anise and wet stone, this is a steely, focused white that will appeal to fans of the unoaked style. It finishes on a lingering baked-bread tone.
designation: Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A great value from the great producer, this includes 5% Touriga, 4% Petite Sirah and 1% of mixed other grapes. Together, they offer juicy cherry notes and a big imprint of toasted tannin, the backbone of oak substantial yet soft and approachable. The finish is all mocha.

title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Brawny char and dark chocolate create a stage for jammy black cherry and blackberry to star in this big-boned full-bodied wine. Generous use of oak and substantial tannin give it an oomph of power that persists through a soft rounded finish.

title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Petite Sirah (Yolo County)
description: This is one of the lightest-tasting and most charming examples of a notoriously blunt and tannic varietal. Cherries and violets accent the aromas, bright black-cherry flavors brighten the palate and a moderately tannic texture gives a snap to the mouthfeel.

title: Blue Rock 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This has lithe bright red fruit with a touch of blueberry—flavors that are integrated and elegantly interwoven. Polished tannins give it grip and weight within this medium-bodied approach. This wine enjoyable and approachable in its understated complexity.

title: Bonterra 2017 Dry Muscat (Lake County)
description: This is an aromatic, bone-dry wine that shows off the grape's floral side. It smells of jasmine, rose and lychee, tastes crisp and refreshing and finishes with an appetizing nip of astringency.

title: Cannonball 2017 Eleven Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a fruity white that is balanced by buoyant acidity. Fermented mostly in stainless steel, it offers defined flavors of lemon, melon and lime.

title: CULT 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Flavorful, well-structured and well-balanced, this is a wine for all seasons. With a medium to full body, generous black cherry and raspberry aromas, and a nicely dry mouthfeel, it is ready to pair with almost any meat, fowl or cheesy dish.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: Velvety and concentrated, this full-styled wine is awash in dark fruit and relatively tamed tannin, offering plenty of power within a rich round approachability.

title: Victor Vineyards 2015 Roadside Red (Lodi)
description: Jam-packed with opulent fruit and decadent chocolate flavors, this full-bodied wine is concentrated and mouth coating. Moderate tannins lend some grip on the palate and there's enough depth for a lingering finish.

title: Ampelos 2017 Phi Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is from certified-organic fruit that has been fermented in stainless steel, showing a fresh lively profile of textured peach, melon and coconut flavors. Steely and demure, it persists in jasmine aromas and a hint of honey.

title: Desparada 2017 Arclight Rosé (California)
description: It's not common to find a rosé based on a blend, but this pink mix of 60% Barbera, 27% Sangiovese and 13% Nebbiolo is quite a stunner, starting with aromas of tangy red plum, plush strawberry and orange peel. The palate is sharp and tangy with tangerine pith on the entry, then opens toward rounded red plum, watermelon and mandarin orange flesh flavors, bolstered by a chalky grip and strong acidity.

title: Morgan 2017 Double L Vineyard Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: From a certified organic vineyard, this ever-so-slightly-sweet Riesling shows strong aromas of orange sorbet, Key lime, citrus pith and pleasant petrol on the nose. There is strong acidity and firm grip on the sip, where Pink Lady apple, coconut and creamy tropical flavors arise.

title: Passaggio 2016 Fieldsa Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Rosemary and sage enliven a leathery earthy core of moderate ripeness and integrated tannin here, the fruit a mix of baked plum and blackberry. A spicy finish of white pepper and nutmeg leaves a memorable impression.

title: The Withers Winery 2017 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Lemony on the palate, this wine is intriguing in Good & Plenty licorice, with a medium build that's balanced and complex. Bright in acidity, it has a density to the apple and pear fruit at its core.

title: Thirty-Seven 2015 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine offers so much value for the price and quality it comes highly recommended. With an exotic floral quality on the nose, it delivers dense flavors of baked plum, blackberry and grilled mushroom around a thick velvety mouthfeel that's spicy in cinnamon cola.

title: Thirty-Seven 2016 Albariño (Sonoma Coast)
description: Steely in acidity, this white has a fleshy midpalate of apricot with floral underpinnings of jasmine and rose. A moderate body of texture is layered and refreshingly crisp.

title: Carlisle 2016 Palisades Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal and supremely earthy, a mix of turned earth, grilled mushroom and lavender. Made in a big bold style, the tannins are robust yet polished, with a sultry smoothness on the palate. Baked blueberry and blackberry mingle effortlessly.

title: Guarachi Family 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Shy on the nose at first, this well-made full-bodied red opens slowly to unfurl brawny layers of tannin and smoky oak. The power is met by densely packed flavors of black cherry and currant, with a hint of sage and dried herb.

title: Pelletiere 2016 Estate Lagrein (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling of a grape from northern Italy shows aromas of black cherry, blackberry, loamy soil and roasted coffee. The mouthfeel is chalky and nearly sticky, with dark-fruit flavors lifted by wild thyme and sagebrush. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Silver Ghost 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth and approachable, this wine offers a tangy red-fruit flavor and bright acidity, with integrated oak and tannin. It is delightfully quaffable and finishes in layers of cedar and pencil shavings, remaining varietal and delicious through a steady finish.

title: Talley 2016 Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Light in the glass and reserved on the nose, this appellation blend shows red fruit, red flowers and a touch of oak on the nose. The palate is easy to like with light raspberry and ripe cranberry flavors, leading into rose petals and lavender toward the finish.

title: Markus Wine Co 2016 Sol Red (Lodi)
description: This wine is sturdy in structure, medium to full in body, nicely balanced and has a very good combination of ripe fruit, light oak and savory flavors. The texture is smooth, lightly tannic but with enough grip to be great with food.

title: Sobon Estate 2017 Barbera (Amador County)
description: This medium-bodied wine is fresh and lively in red cherry and raspberry aromas. The palate brings tart fruit flavors and good balance. It is a vibrant and appetizing expression of the grape.

title: Steven Kent 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: An oaky, toasty perfume leads to layered and spicy flavors in this full-bodied wine. It has a generous amount of ripe black-cherry and black-currant flavors. Nutmeg, vanilla and other oak nuances are tasty on the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2015 Las Flores Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's organically farmed estate in Chiles Valley, this is 100% varietal and classic in approach. Baked aromas of plum and blackberry lead to a soft midpalate of plum and cola, with a finish of black pepper and leather. This is a beautiful wine at a fair price.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2017 Benevolent Catie's Corner Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine was aged in both neutral oak and stainless steel, the grapes from a famous corner of Saralee Kunde's sought-after vineyard. Peach and anise show on the nose and palate. It is velvety in texture, with notes of jasmine and crushed rock that offer brightness.

title: Chronic Cellars 2017 Dead Nuts Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 74% Zinfandel, 16% Petite Sirah, 8% Tempranillo and 2% Alicante Bouschet is driven by a cigar-box aroma on the nose, with thyme, peppercorn, dark plum and strawberry in the background. It's tightly wound on the palate, with bright acidity that rises into the finish of black currant and clove.

title: Franciscan 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County-Napa County)
description: From a majority of Monterey-grown grapes, this showcases floral honeysuckle and a sweetness of vanilla oak within light-bodied ripeness and approachability.

title: Francis Ford Coppola 2015 Director's Cut Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Smoky oak takes on a char flavor in this simply constructed and structured red. A juiciness of cherry comes to life on the midpalate, that's soft, ripe and without fanfare.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 Brickmason Red (Lodi)
description: A strong element of new oak dominates this full-bodied and tannic wine that was made from Zinfandel and three other grape varieties . It smells like cedar, tobacco and clove, and tastes rather tight and astringent.

title: Scaredy Cat Ranch 2015 Tempranillo (Ramona Valley)
description: Sour aromas of black plum, cola and grape seed are dominated by a damp coffee-grind scent on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a tad funky and gritty with black-fruit flavors.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2014 Herman Vineyard Sid's Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a soft, simple and somewhat heated block-designate, tasting robustly ripe on the tongue. Plum and cinnamon flavors help to offset the ripeness and intensity, but the fruit is beginning to fade.

title: MacRostie 2017 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine opens in a strong grasp of honey, apple and stone fruit, with a mix of high acidity and viscosity. Approachable, the oak is buttery but thick and out of tune with the high-toned fruit.

title: River Road 2017 Double Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: Very fruity, soft and on the sweet side, this thick and medium-bodied wine tastes simple and straightforward. It shows ripe, lush Bartlett pear and Fuji apple aromas and flavors, and very low acidity.

title: Bushong 2016 Fire Spirt Bourbon Barrel Aged Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Charred grape seed, prune, raisin and caramel-fudge aromas show on the very extracted nose of this bottling, which was aged in Bourbon barrels. The palate offers stewed fruits against a vanilla and caramel backdrop.

title: Carlisle 2016 Rossi Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a tightly wound but still- developing wine that might come around to greater things. Black olive, dried cherry and an earthy herbaceous quality distract. The wine is concentrated and full bodied.

title: Gehricke 2016 Petite Sirah (Sonoma Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine aged in French and Hungarian oak, this is earthy in truffle and thick layers of black pepper and currant. The texture is rough and gritty, the tannins still developing in unapologetic power.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2014 Dijon Clone Selection Reserve Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This red is full bodied and hugely tannic, with strong flavors of eucalyptus and bay leaf. Burly red fruit adds to the undeniable intensity.

title: Houdini 2017 Dean Block Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: With a perfume of fresh melon and baked pear, this full-bodied, concentrated wine has a metallic edge that distracts.

title: V. Sattui 2017 Collina d'Oro Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark in color and possessed of prominent oak, this is a hearty white with bold layers of vanilla and melon.

title: Hawley 2018 Rosé of Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: Orange-copper in color, this is a sizable, meaty and big-boned wine, tasting of blackberry jam, leather and oak.

title: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Winemaker's Red (California)
description: This fruity jammy-tasting wine has exuberant maple aromas, and rich, lightly sweet blackberry and strawberry flavors. It's soft in acidity and very smooth in texture.

title: One Leaf 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This straightforward wine is medium bodied, medium flavored and rather simple in structure. Bolstered with 2% of Moscato, it has light fruit-cocktail aromas and mild hints of vanilla.

title: OZV 2016 Old Vine Red (California)
description: Aromas of strawberry syrup and flavors like raspberry jam give this slightly sweet and soft-textured wine a friendly exuberant personality.

title: Carlisle 2016 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine has hard drying tannins that detract from its fuller expression. It is unclear whether it's a sign of youth or weighty intensity.

title: La Fleur's 2017 Three-Fifteen Estate Zinfandel (South Coast)
description: Sweet tobacco leaves meet with black-cherry syrup and damp forest undergrowth on the nose of this bottling. Tangy boysenberries and plums meet with more tobacco tones on the palate.

title: Wise Villa 2017 Wisdom of Wise Red (California)
description: This wine's combination of candied and cooked fruit flavors give it an unusual and very fruity slant. It is medium bodied, almost syrupy in texture and has a sweet tinge on the finish.

title: Auteur Wines 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is impressive wine at every level—a crisp, complex exploration of minerality and cool-climate aromatics. Grapefruit, Meyer lemon and stone provide a backdrop of elegant flavor within structured elegance and appealingly well-integrated acidity. This is a delicious wine.

title: Larkmead 2016 Dr. Olmo Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tawny in taut leather with layers of coffee bean, dried herb, plum and cherry, this wine is structured and 100% varietal, from older vines. Lengthy in power and grip, it has dusty tannin weight and breadth alongside fistfuls of Asian spice and clove and lasting acidity. Enjoy now or wait and enjoy 2026–2036.

title: Gondak Cellars 2016 Collective Efforts Syrah (Knights Valley)
description: Cofermented with 7% Viognier from the same site, this red is earthy, concentrated and thick in baked plum, warm spices and cracked white pepper. Lavender, fig and game enliven the dense richness that pervades on the palate, with integrated tannins and oak. This is an impressive full-bodied wine, with an age-worthy structure. Enjoy 2022–2026.

title: Laetitia 2016 Brut Rosé Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: A vibrant shade of orange-pink and full of tiny bubbles in the glass, this sparkling rosé is delicious and approachable from start to finish. Aromas of rose petal, strawberry and chalk lead into a palate with a persistent mousse that delivers bright flavors of watermelon, tangerine spray and lemon.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Old Vines Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From the oldest vines planted on the estate Quail Hill Vineyard, this wine has been barrel fermented and aged in 50% new French oak for 14 months. High-toned buzzy acidity boosts floral, earthy layers of vibrant, refreshing flavor and nuanced texture, with an undeniable complexity and soul.

title: Beringer 2016 Steinhauer Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Weighty, substantive and grippy in tannin, this is a bold, powerful wine that is unflinchingly ripe and richly layered. Black cherry and smoky oak compete for affection on the lengthy palate, asking for more time to develop in bottle. Enjoy best from 2026–2031.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Westside Farms Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral, lively and undeniably vibrant in acidity and freshness, this wine dazzles in tones of guava, tangerine and fig. Crisp, balanced and complex, it delivers flavor and texture in waves alongside a stony minerality without ever letting oak get the last say.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Adam's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salty oak dots the palate of this lively, vibrant and fresh take on the variety, 100% barrel-fermented and aged in new French oak for 14 months. Brioche richness underlies brighter notions of green apple and pear, with a touch of stone minerality that persists on the savory finish.

title: Sangiacomo 2017 Home Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: From the vineyard first established by the producers' grandparents in 1927, this white is creamy in feel while also lifted by bright acidity. Apple, lemon zest and tangerine appease the palate, with accents vanilla and nutmeg in the background. The finish is refreshing and vibrant.

title: Benovia 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This delightfully impressive wine is barrel fermented and aged in neutral French oak and stainless steel. Beautifully fragrant and fruity, it has a substantial palate of rich watermelon, strawberry and blood orange boosted by fresh acidity.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Cherry Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine shows a touch of reduction on the entry, tightly wound as it is in tannin and oak. The midpalate picks up succulence and freshness as well as a flirtation with tropical flavor, its profile robust and rich with plenty of complexity, honey and oak. Let it open slowly or cellar; enjoy best from 2022 through 2027.

title: Law 2016 Beyond Category Red (Adelaida District)
description: This atypical blend of 56% Tempranillo, 24% Grenache and 20% Graciano begins with impressive density to the nose, where aromas of concentrated violet and blackberry paste converge. The palate's immense yet balanced concentration carries cassis and black-cherry flavors into waves of lavender and singed oak. The tannins will uphold these flavors for years. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Merry Edwards 2017 Georganne Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a bench land site on a western slope of Westside Road, this wine is gorgeously aromatic in rose, lavender and cherry blossom. Bright acidity enlivens exotic spice notes of cardamom, anise and dark chocolate on the palate, alongside a grippy texture and rich red-cherry fruit. The oak is well integrated and in the background. This will do well in the cellar; best 2025–2027.

title: Sangiacomo 2017 Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: Winemaker James MacPhail works with estate-grown fruit to make this stellar showcase for the appellation that is light in color and silky in tannins. Fleshy orange peel and cherry contribute fruity richness, complemented by black tea, clove and lasting acidity.

title: Ad Vivum 2015 Sleeping Lady Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: This is a beautiful, classically made solo-project wine from the veteran winemaker Chris Phelps, now at Inglenook. Dusty sage, plum and cocoa dust highlight a layered, balanced and complex midpalate that's structured and velvety lush, with a lasting taste of sweet tobacco.

title: Beringer 2016 Bancroft Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a grippy, powerful and densely built wine, robustly oaky and substantial in dark, brooding black fruit. The blackberry and cherry have a succulence that gives the wine a juicy core and soft midpalate, as a build up of black pepper, graphite and smoke surround.

title: Charles Heintz 2012 Melissa Danielle Chardonnay Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from 100% estate-grown Chardonnay, this wine is crisp in apple and pear flavors while balanced by a rich crème brûlée tone. Well integrated and high in acidity, it shines in persistent freshness and delicious wet-stone complexity.

title: Inman Family 2016 Pratt Vine Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a tremendously delicious and impressive wine from a fantastic vineyard site, integrated and earthy with an unexpected robustness. Plum, sour cherry, orange, cranberry and Asian spice combine around firm, supple tannin structure and a lengthy finish.

title: Laetitia 2016 Cuvée M Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Crisp and bright aromas of lemon peel, grapefruit zest and cantaloupe rind are precise on the nose of this bottling. Sharpy acidity frames pear and sour lemon flavors on the approachable palate.

title: Noceto 2015 Original Grandpère Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This huge, heavy bottle contains a hugely flavorful but not heavy wine. Complex oak, spice and bramble aromas lead to vivid sour cherry and raspberry flavors that are firmly framed by moderate tannins and a slight acidic bite. It's a special occasion wine from old, old vines that will pair especially well with Italian food and grilled meats.

title: Meikle 2015 Estate Grown Black Dog Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)
description: Both oaky and tannic, this boisterous full-bodied wine has vivid aromas and flavors of sawn oak, dill, red cherry and bay leaf. It is quite tannic in texture, which is not unusual for a Cabernet, but fun to taste.

title: Puma Road 2014 Apex Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very extracted aromas of cherry syrup are dusted with layers of chaparral herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite thick with boysenberry, licorice and seared vanilla-extract flavors.

title: St Huberts 2016 The Stag Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This complex and savory wine is backed by mild plum and cherry flavors but mineral, earth and herb aspects come to the fore. It shows little new oak, and has a smooth, relaxed texture that makes it easy to sip.

title: Twisted Paso 2016 Main Squeeze Red (Paso Robles)
description: Licorice paste, black-plum jelly, smoked pork and anise show on the nose of this blend of 48% Syrah, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Zinfandel. Against a backdrop of black fruits, dusty flavors of thyme and sagebrush make for a compelling sip.

title: Carol Shelton 2015 Oat Valley Vineyard Old Vine Carignane (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a thick, juicy and concentrated expression of the oft-rustic grape, blended with small amounts of Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet. Jammy in strawberry flavors, it lingers in a tease of earthy rose petal and tar.

title: Campovida 2016 Campo di Rossa Red (Mendocino County)
description: Ripe, concentrated and fruity, this full-bodied wine shows ample blackberry and black-cherry flavors and moderate tannins to firm up the texture. This is a blend of five Rhône grapes and aged in neutral barrels.

title: Campovida 2017 Oppenlander Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This light-bodied wine is lean and restrained in style, from its very pale-yellow color to green-apple and cucumber aromas to subtle, crisp flavors like jicama and white peach. It was aged in neutral oak barrels, so no obvious oak flavors come through, just steely refreshment.

title: Heritance 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With up-front oak and firm tannin, this is an easy-pleasing red offered at a remarkably fair price that's effusive in black fruit, clove and cinnamon. The ripeness is expansive and succulent.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Grand Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)
description: Baked cherry, wet slate and warm baking spices make for a very likable if not overly complex nose on this bottling. The palate is thick with flavors of cranberry, dried herbs and clove—a great show of varietal typicity and a reliable midweek sipper.

title: Kokomo 2017 Cuveé Red (North Coast)
description: This oaky, showy wine exudes toast and butter aromas, vanilla and strawberry-jam flavors and a medium body. It is soft in terms of acidity but does have a light structure of tannins that help the balance.

title: Maryetta 2016 Nash Mill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is charming, light bodied and lean, offering tempting red-cherry and forest-floor aromas and delicate sour-cherry flavors. It is relatively low in alcohol and brings a tangy mouthwatering texture.

title: Noceto 2016 Misto Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Fresh in flavor and light to medium in body, this wine will make a great lunch or dinner pairing with anything from dried meats to pizza to a mushroom risotto. It has a smooth, lightly gripping texture, and light but complex cherry and dried herb flavors.

title: Smashberry 2017 Red (Paso Robles)
description: This widely available twist-top blend of 40% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Syrah, 5% Cabernet Franc and 5% Grenache starts with a touch of reduction, but it blows off with patience and emerges into a fresh wine. Aromas of crushed rocks and dark fruit lead into a palate of rich plum, berry and a hint of baking spice.

title: Thomas Allen 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a well-made, no-nonsense and full-bodied wine that smells like ripe plums and dried thyme, tastes moderately rich and cherrylike and has a smooth, lightly tannic texture.

title: ZO Wines 2017 Carignane (Alexander Valley)
description: This is blended with 9% Zinfandel, the two combining for a relatively tamed experience of cherry, strawberry and dried plum. Light on its feet and moderate in body, it finishes with a swath of earth, cedar and tobacco.

title: Foursight 2017 Charles Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine blends generous apple flavors with touches of mineral and fig for a fruity but substantial style. Good acidity balances an impression of slight sweetness.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Reserve Claret (Sonoma County-Napa County)
description: The producer's annual nod to the classic Bordeaux blend, this combines 60% Merlot with 39% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot. Graham cracker, cherry and cassis flavors are pronounced and richly smooth as oak makes itself known.

title: M-80 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A new offering from the producer, this is a classically tropical, honeyed white wine, viscous, thick and oaky, with a touch of butter teasing the palate as it opens in the glass. For fans of full-bodied flavor, this is creamy and buttery in spades.

title: Bandit NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is a soft and creamy-textured wine, with a mix of light fig, mineral and apple flavors. It's not a fruit bomb, but more of a textural wine that is soothing and easy to enjoy.

title: Avaler 2016 R Own Cuvée Red (Sonoma County)
description: A value-driven blend of 40% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 20% Viognier, this offers a balanced, moderately styled expression of strawberry, maple and white flowers—the acidity measured and the tannins thick.

title: De Loach 2016 Van Der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Earthy and robust in ripeness and tannin, this is a powerfully concentrated and structured wine, true to its mountain roots. Spice, tea and rhubarb mark its midpalate and complement the bigness of its profile.

title: Gainey 2018 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of honeysuckle, lemon, peach and fresh lime are clean and inviting on the nose of this bottling. The sip combines a tense texture with ripe peach flavors that are held back by lemongrass and sour lime-skin touches.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2018 Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Carneros)
description: This wine opens in racy high-toned acidity and evolves to show a creamier lusher texture and style. Peach, lime and green-apple flavors develop around a moderate structure that refreshes and finishes dry.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Swing Carmenère (Santa Clara Valley)
description: From a grape rarely seen in California, this bottling shows cranberry, crushed carnation, peppercorn and roasted pasilla chile on the nose. The palate is also loaded with peppery spices and dried chile flavors, which gives a unique twist to the clean cranberry core.

title: Judge Palmer 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dust and gravel components provide a mineral aspect to this mountain-grown wine, a study in classic elements of cedar and dried herb. The midpalate is richer and denser in chocolate-covered red cherry and strawberry, with an underlying lushness. It's undoubtedly decadent in style.

title: Keller Estate 2015 Rotie Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: A nod to the northern Rhône, this is a cofermentation of 93% Syrah and 7% Viognier. Soft in supple texture and brimming in balanced richness, it tastes of raspberry liqueur and plum, with a dash of nutmeg and cardamom.

title: Kokomo 2018 Rosé of Grenache (North Coast)
description: High toned and delicious, this has tension and freshness built around flavors of strawberry puree, herb, grass and wet stone. Tart, dry and palate cleansing, it ends with a lasting hit of citrus.

title: Kokomo 2018 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Grassy fresh and bubbling in acidity, this light-bodied, lightly ripe white is dazzling in lime and grapefruit, with a tease of peach skin. It's an enjoyable varietal wine that shows restraint and grace.

title: Le Casque 2016 Espion Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This flavorful and well-polished blend of Syrah and Petite Syrah balances lively concentrated fruit flavors against moderate tannins. Black cherry, black currant and hints of dark chocolate make it delicious, while the firm texture should help it improve with age. Best from 2023.

title: Le Mistral 2018 Single Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Very light and crisp on the nose, this bottling offers very stony aromas of chalk and nectarine. It's also bright on the palate with flavors of Key lime, Gravenstein apple and a touch of bubblegum.

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2017 Cortada Alta Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Elegant aromas of dried purple flowers, cola and dark cherries show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from Monterey County. The palate offers rich black-plum flavors that are lifted by gingerbread spice and dried sagebrush.

title: McClain Cellars 2016 Promise Keeper Reserve Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Floral aromas of lavender, lilac and wisteria meet with dark-purple fruits like açai on the clean nose of this blend. Snappy black-raspberry flavors lead into a chalky midpalate, making for a compelling sip of this heavier bodied wine.

title: Merriam 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Fresh flavors of watermelon and cherry expand on the palate in this light red. The oak is subtle and the acidity is supportive, both letting the bright fruit shine.

title: One Hope 2016 Vintner Collection Pinot Noir (California)
description: This juicy, delicious and well-balanced wine is one of the better offerings under the broad California appellation. It's medium bodied, well balanced and complex enough to keep sipping through an evening.

title: Orsi Family 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an Old World wine in style—classic and muted in cedar and herb. Dry tannins form a foundation for deft flavors of currant, tomato leaf and a bright streak of acidity. The finish has a lasting strength of grippy tannin.

title: Paradise Springs 2016 The Roshi Red (California)
description: Intense blackberry-syrup, woody cedar and dried herb aromas show on the nose of this blend of 47% Petit Verdot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Cabernet Franc and 14% Merlot. The tannins are grippy and firm, carrying more berry and damp wood flavors and a solid hit of acid.

title: Picayune 2018 Hay Penny Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: Stainless-steel fermented, this blends 75% Syrah and 25% Grenache into a fresh package of fruity flavor and floral aromatics. Melon, peach and dried herb highlight a high-toned expression of stony mineral.

title: Pulchella 2017 Deadbeat Pinot Noir (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Mellow spice aromas of mace and cedar meet with light plum and soft raspberry on the nose of this Pinot Noir from Mendoza Farms. The palate shows a thicker streak of fruit, with tangy red-plum and mulberry flavors alongside dried herbs.

title: Riley's Rows 2018 Rosé of Syrah (North Coast)
description: Dark in color, this opens like an orange Creamsicle—rich yet high toned. Strawberry, herb, grass and lemon peel combine around the lightly ripe body full of tension and freshness.

title: Rodney Strong 2018 Charlotte's Home Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This crisp white is steely and bright in acidity. A core of pear, fig and mint shows a creaminess on the midpalate that remains balanced and fruit forward through the finish.

title: Fulcrum 2018 Dry Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: Classic aromas of rose petal and lychee fruit give this medium-bodied wine a great first impression. On the palate, it's rather light and delicate as more subtle peachy, floral flavors come through. Added benefits are a lively texture and good balance.

title: Lafond 2016 Clone 777 Lafond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Juicy red fruits meet with touches of cinnamon toast on the nose of this clonal expression from a single vineyard. The palate's fruit grows darker, with boysenberry jam and tart black plum flavors that are enhanced by lavender. The acid is quite aggressive.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 Whole Cluster Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Deep blackberry and black-currant aromas meet with intense hints of cracked pepper and roasted game on the nose of this bottling, which is still quite young and structured. Violet and lavender flavors float across chunky tannins and strong acidity on the palate.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2018 Estate Franci Verdelho (Suisun Valley)
description: Showing mineral and oak complexity rather than overt fruitiness, this full-bodied wine is well balanced and subtle at first sip and then unlocks tasty flavors of pear tart and cream. It builds texture on the palate that helps extend the baking-spice finish.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Vintage Reserve Red (Sonoma Valley)
