description: This robust, well-aged wine combines 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Cabernet Franc, 6% Malbec and 6% Petit Verdot. Cherry, vanilla and smoke complement an underbelly of dried herb, char and spice. The body is full, soft and richly rounded in flavor.

title: Neyers 2017 Left Bank Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot that is firmly structured yet ripe. Gripping tannins and bright acidity lift dense plum and spice flavors.

title: Robert John 2016 Bold Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending 65% Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this is indeed a bold, full-bodied wine, made to appeal to fans of a soft approachable style. Spicy with herbal elements of sage, the tannins are silky and the fruit bright in blue and red berries as well as chocolate, likable and rich.

title: Akash 2016 Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)
description: Elegant aromas of exotic strawberry, charred oak and loamy earth show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is clean and quite textural, with strong acid carrying red-fruit and cinnamon-spice flavors.

title: Sosie 2016 Stagecoach Vineyard Block K5 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: Deeply textured and robustly ripe, this is a brooding and lengthy 100% varietal wine—a seductive combining of tar, clove and cedar. The black fruit is smoky and concentrated, seasoned generously in dried herb.

title: Torial 2017 Red (Sonoma County)
description: A hearty blend of old-vine Zinfandel, Grenache and Carignane, this wine is perfumed and plummy, with high-toned acid behind a powerful density and concentration. Meaty garrigue and earth meet a fistful of lasting black pepper that keeps going and going.

title: Westgate 2017 Curtis Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Snappy raspberry aromas meet with slate, pinched herbs and a touch of smoke on the nose of this bottling. A chalky tannic frame grabs hold of the palate with strength, allowing herb-laced dark-fruit flavors to emerge atop the zippy, almost searing acidity.

title: Covenant 2017 Landsman Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: Fruity in strawberry jam and rhubarb, this thick, structured wine is also powerfully robust in savory undertones of garrigue and black pepper. With a leathery texture, it provides full flavor and weight across the palate.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Cabernet Franc (Paicines)
description: Strong aromas of soil and crushed gravel meet with a fresh and buoyant streak of red fruit and peppercorn on the nose of this bottling. The structure is firm and taut but not chunky, with flavors of boysenberry, elderberry liqueur and more rocky earth.

title: Pinot Society 2017 The Tumult Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Violet, lilac and lavender aromas meet with boysenberry and sandalwood on the nose of this bottling. It's well structured on the palate, blending fresh pomegranate, rose petal and strong wood flavors into a snappy expression.

title: H.L.R. Cellars 2016 Estate Merlot (Fountaingrove District)
description: Perfumed in gardenia and lavender, this is from a site hovering at 1,300-feet-elevation. Red cherry, plum, dark chocolate and graphite play around dense, concentrated layers of soft, integrated smoothness and a hit of fresh acidity.

title: Longboard 2016 Dakine Vineyard Merlot (Russian River Valley)
description: With 13% Malbec in the mix, this is a densely packed and robust red wine, herbal and earthy in cedar and anise. Dark cherry and smoky oak round out a fleshy midpalate that finishes in a lengthy swirl of dark chocolate.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2016 Alegria Vineyards Rita's Block Red (Russian River Valley)
description: Slighty reduced and opening in an earthy hit of tar, this 18-varietal field blend is thick and richly rewarding, made in an appealingly robust style. Blackberry, vanilla, smoke and oak combine across a full-bodied palate of lasting freshness and weight.

title: Kukkula 2016 Pas de Deux Red (Adelaida District)
description: Deep aromas of black plum, violet, black sage and smoke show on the nose of this blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah. Candied blackberry is at the core of the sip, yet there is plenty of black-pepper and purple-flower flavors as well.

title: Shannon 2016 Home Ranch Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: Richness and ripeness give this very full-bodied wine a mouthfilling presence as black-cherry and blackberry flavors coat the palate and linger on the finish. Subtle oak spices add complexity too.

title: Stressed Vines 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fresh and lively in cranberry, red cherry and cinnamon, this well-made wine has integrated oak and acidity. Made in a light, balanced style, it shows a weight of tannin and robust earthiness as it builds to a lengthy finish.

title: Rutherford Ranch 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy and rich in peach and nectarine, this well-made white shows light-bodied ripeness and buzzy acidity. The midpalate has a pleasing lushness and hint of grit.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Joughin Vineyard Primitivo (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Extracted aromas of black cherry, cigar box, star anise and gingerbread show on the nose of this rich bottling. The baking-spice and spice-cake flavors come through on the sip as well, where baked plum, strawberry and cherry flavors are quite strong.

title: Scattered Peaks 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A straightforward wine that overdelivers on its price point, this is blended with 7% Merlot and made by longtime Napa Valley winemaker Joel Aiken. Tight in oak and tannin, it offers a generous expanse of black cherry, currant and sage, finishing in a thicket of dark chocolate and vanilla.

title: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is blended with 10% Cabernet Franc, 10% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot. A sweetness of cherry and vanilla dominant along a smooth corridor of smoky oak and grippy tannin. It lingers in heat and density as black-pepper spiciness takes hold.

title: Schug 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a trio of vineyards, this white is grassy and fruity in equal measure, with flavors of pineapple, maraschino cherry and kiwi. Lively acidity keeps it fresh in the glass, leading to a mineral-laden finish.

title: Sevtap 2016 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Extracted aromas of black plum and pepper spices show on the nose of this bottling. Dark red cherries, oak smoke, baking spice and cracked pepper show on the cohesive palate.

title: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a likable, well-made wine, blended with 12% Merlot and appropriately soft, succulent and moderately rich. Tangy red fruit is lifted by good acidity and nuanced oak, the tannins are well behaved.

title: F2 Wines 2016 Falconiere Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)
description: Roasted berries, vanilla extract and damp wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Rich blackberry-jam flavors meet with the tang of balsamic on the palate, which offers flashes of acid against an extracted core.

title: Three Pears 2018 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (California)
description: Light fruit and herb flavors like crisp apple and fresh thyme give this medium-light wine a sense of delicacy and reserve. It's a wine that doesn't need to be the star of the show, and will be good for a crowd.

title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is dry, well-balanced and offers a good, velvety texture to support generous cherry and raspberry flavors. It's difficult to find this kind of drinkability at this low price.

title: Grayson 2018 Chardonnay (California)
description: This very ripe and oaky wine shows abundant pear, butter and baking spices, and has a mouthfilling, soft texture. It's tasty, feels a bit sweet and is easy to sip.

title: Tortoise Creek 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells buttery, tastes like vanilla and cream and feels soft and generous on the palate. Fans of an unctuous, ripe style will love it.

title: McManis 2018 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Pinot Grigio (River Junction)
description: Tangy and crisp in character, this light-bodied wine shows touches of mineral and white pepper in the aromas, and lean citrus and green-apple flavors on the palate. It's refreshing and reserved.

title: Bodkin 2018 Oakliss Chardonnay (Suisun Valley)
description: In a lighter, leaner vein than many Chardonnays, this non-oaked wine offers crisp lemon and green-apple notes, light body and a tangy mouthfeel.

title: Jalama 2016 Refugio Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Strong aromas of black cherry and blackberry are quite tangy with balsamic touches on the nose of this blend. The mouthfeel is soft and thick, carrying very energetic but tangy black-plum-skin flavors.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Brutus Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Very dark in the glass, this wine begins with extracted aromas of prune, raisin and gingerbread cake. The palate also offers fruit-cake and spice-cake elements, surrounding a candied black-plum core that's lifted by pinches of vanilla and nutmeg. Sticky tannins frame it all.

title: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Malibu Coast)
description: The nose on this bottling, which includes 8% Malbec, 5% Petit Verdot and 2% Merlot, is extremely potpourri-like, with dried purple-flower aromas mixing with purple fruit. The strong violet kick plays into the palate as well, with is also extremely purple in flavor.

title: Oakstone 2016 Estate Meritage (Fair Play)
description: Very fruity, firm and well-structured, this wine offers bright cherry and berry flavors, a crisp texture and noticeable tannins.

title: Ravel & Stitch 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: Wet gravel, damp grass and danky herbs show on the nose of this appellation blend. Dried green-apple flavors dominate the palate alongside hints of lime spray.

title: D & L Carinalli 2018 Estate Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)
description: Light and crisp, this wine offers peach, melon and stone. It remains bright and approachable from start to finish.

title: Mettler Family Vineyards 2018 Estate Grown Albariño (Lodi)
description: This wine is fresh and fruity in aroma but also has a more buttery, concentrated aspect that develops on the palate despite being unoaked. Apricot and apple notes are tempered by light vanilla accents, and the texture is quite smooth.

title: Monochrome 2018 Barrel Distortion Albariño (California)
description: Clean aromas of pan-seared apples, light caramel and salty brine show on the nose of this bottling from the Plum Lane Orchard Vineyard in Paso Robles. The palate is tangy with lemon, leveled by pear flesh and framed by chalky tannins, trending a bit sour into the finish.

title: Monte Volpe 2015 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)
description: Good concentration, focused fruit flavors and a silky texture make this full-bodied wine a pleasure to taste. Red and black cherries blend with hints of tamarind and roses while fine-grained tannins bolster the mouthfeel.

title: Phinch 2018 Rosé (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: There's a minty aroma to the nose of this saignée of Grenache, along with a light touch of raspberry. The palate is fresh and stony with wet rock minerality, mixing a light wash of red-fruit flesh, with earthy lanolin flavors.

title: Rodrigue Molyneaux 2016 Estate Grown Barbera (Livermore Valley)
description: Rustic flavors and a velvety texture make a good combination in this full-bodied wine. Leather and farmyard aromas are followed by concentrated blackberry and raspberry flavors and a smooth but lively mouthfeel.

title: Tie-Dye 2016 Red (North Coast)
description: Earthy complexity, full body and ample black-fruit flavors make a fine combination in this bold but nicely polished wine. Aromas of wet earth and tobacco lead to generous plum and black-currant notes.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Promenance Vineyard Family Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula)
description: Rusty red cherry, ripe strawberry, wood spice and vanilla converge on the nose of this bottling, which is rustic yet expressive. Flavors of brick and ripe red berry are framed by a firm tannic texture and plenty of acid, with cola and nutmeg spice providing depth.

title: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This firm-textured and full-bodied wine layers spicy, earthy, meaty oak tones over concentrated, effusive berry and plum flavors. Grippy tannins thicken the mouthfeel while layers of oak spice and jammy fruit roll over the palate.

title: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Not too showy at first but quietly rich in flavor, this full-bodied wine drizzles subtle spices of nutmeg and vanilla over a core of baked apple and ripe pear. Toasted oak, butterscotch and pineapple emerge on the lingering finish.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2018 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Aromas of citrus and green apple meet ripe juicy flavors in this full-bodied and well-balanced wine. It tastes fresh and natural, and has an appetizing mix of brisk acidity rounded out by ripe fruitiness. Barra grew the organic grapes on its own property.

title: Bellacosa 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Appetizingly smoky in aroma and flavor, this beefy and full-bodied wine emphasizes savory spicy notes like black pepper, toasted oak and beef jus layered over red and black cherries.

title: Byron Blatty 2017 Tremor Red (Los Angeles County)
description: Red-cherry and strawberry-paste aromas are coated in hickory smoke on the nose of this blend of 65% Grenahche, 30% Merlot and 5% Syrah. That smoky quality envelops the sip as well, which also shows red-currant jam, cranberry and licorice flavors.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 Mourvèdre (Lodi)
description: Suave, sculpted and handsomely oaky, this full-bodied wine shows plenty of baking spices and toasted oak nuances, along with a texture that's almost thick due to an abundance of fine-grained tannins.

title: Landmark 2017 Overlook Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Steely and floral, this wine is medium bodied and measured in acidity, with pleasing layers of apple, pear and wet stone. A hint of butterscotch tugs at its edges, suggesting additional richness and caramel flavor, as a tease of white pepper lingers on.

title: Minus Tide 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Malbec (Mendocino)
description: Tempting, perfumed oak and cedar notes light up the aroma of this full-bodied wine, and meld with bold, ripe and powerful black-fruit flavors on the palate. Firm tannins and a touch of lively acidity give it good structure. Best from 2022.

title: Rideau 2017 The Englishmen Rideau Vineyard Sangiovese (Los Olivos District)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling with a whimsical label that touches on the history of the estate starts with aromas of cranberry, fennel and dusty earth. The tannins grab hold of the palate right away, delivering flavors of strawberry and toasted wood.

title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Excellence Sparkling (Mendocino County)
description: Dry and crisp, this light-bodied wine offers tangy lemon and green-apple flavors, subtle baking-spice accents, refreshing acidity and an appetizing stream of fine bubbles.

title: Block Nine 2018 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Hints of spicy oak and black tea dress up this nicely balanced and medium-bodied wine, complementing the fresh red cherry and raspberry flavors. The wine is lively and flavorful and will be versatile at lunch, cocktail hour or dinner.

title: Girasole 2018 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: This mouthwatering wine has bright apple and citrus aromas, a tangy feel on the palate and fresh, just-ripe fruit flavors. It's right on the money in terms of balance and will be a great apéritif wine.

title: Adelaida 2018 Rosé (Adelaida District)
description: There are crisp touches of rose, strawberry, red plum and lemon zest on the nose of this pink blend of 58% Grenache, 12% Mourvèdre, 9% Carignane, 8% Cinsaut, 7% Counoise and 6% Syrah. It lands with riper flavors of peach and nectarine that are cut by pink lemonade acidity.

title: Sean Minor 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a nutty, somewhat reduced white, steely and light in ripeness. The flavors lean into Meyer lemon mousse and anise.

title: Ironstone 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)
description: This extremely smoky oaky wine is full bodied but not too tannic and has a touch of sweetness in the flavors. Charred wood and maple-syrup aromas lead to maraschino cherry flavors and more smoky oaky accents on the palate.

title: Geyser Peak 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is very fruity, tastes sugary and thick and has low acidity for a soft mouthfeel. It's simple and uncomplicated.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Barbara Anne Barbera (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe and tangy at once on the nose, this bottling shows berry and overextracted cherry on the nose. Roasted tomato, cherry and licorice spice show on the sip.

title: Educated Guess 2016 Educated Guess Merlot (Napa County)
description: Chalky bulky tannins round out a bold big-flavored hit of smoky oak and green herb in this red, blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petite Sirah.

title: Ironstone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a fruity, soft-textured and rounded wine that has raspberry and cherry-extract flavors, very low tannin content and a syrupy, almost-sweet character.

title: Reynoso 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: This white is disjointed, a bit dull on the palate with dizzying flavors of green apple and olive.

title: Brotherhood 2014 Honker Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a quirky wine that's drinkable but past its prime already. It has stewed fruit flavors, pronounced oak accents and a baked, aged taste on the finish.

title: Days of Youth NV The Diver Brut Rosé (California)
description: A deep pink color and vivid candied-fruit flavors make this wine taste like a still rosé with added bubbles. It starts with a metallic aroma, and continues with lightly sweet cherry flavors.

title: Muscardini 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyards Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: Tart tangy acidity veers into a disjointed quality that's sour on the palate in this hearty wine that veers on overripe. Bulky oak masks flavors of cherry, plum and dried herb.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2012 Everything in Its Right Place Red (Paso Robles)
description: Sour and tart berries smell like balsamic vinegar on the nose. The palate is also very sour with almost painful acidity.

title: J. Davies 2014 Jamie Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Named for the late matriarch of the property, this is a blend of 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot, all of it grown on hillside estate vineyards. It dances around cherry, cassis and rose petal, the core of the wine soft in integrated tannins and oak. Balanced in weight, it is undeniably lovely, complex and beautiful. It will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2024–2034.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Thomas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a gorgeous, memorable and classically styled wine, grippy in tannin and a leathery texture that's complex and complicated. Black pepper, black cherry and toasted oak give it definition that evolves stunningly in the glass.

title: Lynmar Estate 2016 Monastery Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salty, briny and beautifully spicy, this wine offers full-bodied richness that's completely in balance and remarkably memorable on the palate. Everything is well integrated, from the entry to the long, lingering finish.

title: Lynmar 2016 Sweeney Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Stone fruit, nutmeg and mineral notes open this lovely wine, which dazzles in high-toned acidity and a persistence of mineral and stony texture. The oak is nuanced and integrated, offering a hint of toasted nut and vanilla within a lasting cradling of baked apple and pear.

title: Lynmar 2016 La Sereinité Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is aged in neutral oak, allowing plenty of room for the fruit and spice to breathe. Complex, bright and structured, it imparts lovely tones of dried herb, ginger, wet stone and lemon zest. The palate is medium bodied and subtle, finishing elegant and full of grace.

title: Lynmar 2016 Old Vines Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This white is so good, sumptuous in pear, peach and honey flavors dipped in anise. Lush and creamy, the texture is particularly memorable and beautiful. It has fully integrated the richer elements of fruit with supportive acidity and lingering twists of nutmeg and ginger.

title: Kenzo Estate 2015 Ai Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dried herb, cedar and pencil shavings mark this rich, full-bodied wine that offers earth and plum flavors. Robust and concentrated, it holds its density well, allowing room for the fruit to breathe, all while seasoned in clove and black pepper.

title: Round Pond 2015 Proprietary Red (Rutherford)
description: This blends 60% Cabernet Sauvignon with 25% Petit Verdot, 9% Malbec and 6% Merlot. The combination is electrifying, beautifully layered, dusty and flavorful in cassis and plum. With a backbone of structure, it lingers in a memorable jolt of nutmeg oak. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 ERA Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Brightly woven in cassis and black raspberry, this is a blockbuster wine, sumptuous and seductive in enviable structure and complexity. Polished tannins wrap around a rich, balanced core of rounded fruit, with a bite of cedar and oak vying for attention.

title: Longboard 2015 Duke's 42 Red (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an unusual blend of 39% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Syrah and 28% Malbec. Fragrant in red fruit and vanilla, it has a grippy, broad expansive quality on the palate, the tannins firm and supportive with well-integrated oak.

title: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Oaky vanilla, caramel and lemon curd highlight the full-bodied concentration of rich flavor in this wine, aged in both new and neutral oak. Well made, integrated and structured, it shows grace within a powerful package of intensity.

title: Robert Mondavi 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is well-made varietal wine, blended with 24% Cabernet Sauvignon. Chocolate, blackberry and plum highlight a soft, approachable palate of fruit dusted in lasting hints of clove and cinnamon.

title: Cherry Bomb 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a full-bodied and broadly structured wine, lush and plush with plenty of wide-ranging appeal. Baking spice, cherry and plum combine around earthy tannin and smoky oak—the fruit always front and center.

title: E & J Gallo 2015 Signature Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Meaty and smoky in barbecue char, this wine has a big grip of tension and a robust amount of red jammy fruit. The oak takes on a sweetness of tobacco and vanilla.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This combines grapes from Hallberg, Starscape and Bucher vineyards—all vineyard-designates for the producer. Together, they form big firm tannins accented in oak, forest floor and grilled meat. Underlying acidity boosts the flavors of bright black fruit.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Thick and leathery, this red is robust in flavors of dark cherry and strawberry, with a powerful texture of gripping tannins. Its considerable breadth is felt throughout the midpalate and lingers on the robust finish.

title: Sleeping Giant 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Full bodied and rich, this 100% varietal wine showcases the exciting appellation just outside of Napa in its soft texture and deft embrace of savory characteristics. Cedar, clove and red currant grace a backdrop of integrated oak and lasting taste of graham cracker.

title: Bliss 2017 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: What a treat to find an unassuming but satisfying, estate-bottled wine in this price range. This medium-bodied, well-balanced wine offers mild pear, butter and vanilla aromas, lively fruit flavors backed by good acidity, and a silky mouthfeel that's not too fat and not too lean.

title: Brassfield 2016 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Mourvèdre (High Valley)
description: This wine tastes powerful and has a robust mouthfeel. A dark-ruby color leads to slightly smoky, peppery aromas and concentrated tight flavors like cranberry and smoked cherries. The texture is firmed up by fine-grained tannins that may need time to mellow. Best after 2021.

title: Cordant 2016 Kessler-Haak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's an interesting magic to some of these wines, in that they begin extremely ripe and extracted but then come into their own as the fruit and spices converge. Aromas of black plum and licorice spice lead into a palate that's rich with black plum jelly as well as savory marjoram, oregano and thyme herbs.

title: Jax 2017 Y3 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a bright red that offers savory elements of black tea and forest floor, along with plenty of black fruit to keep it interesting. The palate is lifted by refreshing acidity, giving it a light, elegant feel overall.

title: La Crema 2016 Kelli Ann Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Full and rich, this has a sizable concentration of guava, pineapple and lime, the latter offering a hint of underlying freshness. The finish is big, yet tangled in acidity.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Valley View Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There is a strong mineral kick to the nose of this bottling, with aromas of wet slate and loam that lead into purple flowers and blackberry juice. The palate is lively with energy, dusted by dried herbs and lifted with fresh blackberries, all clinging to tense tannins and strong acidity.

title: Mabera 2017 Estate Collection Zinfandel Rosé (Amador County)
description: Don't call it white Zinfandel because this concentrated rosé made from 40-year-old vines is more elegant and complex. A light copper color, crisp texture and nicely concentrated cherry and red-plum flavors give this medium-bodied wine a lot to like. It combines the bracing acidity that's good in a rosé with a solid backing of fruit that carries through the finish.

title: Parducci 2016 True Grit Reserve Red (Mendocino County)
description: Aromas of oak and smoke are well integrated in this full-bodied and broad-textured wine. It offers a bit of swagger as it wraps flavors of blackberry jam and grilled meat in a fairly thick coating of tannins on the palate. It's big but balanced and has plenty of flavor to chew on.

title: Passaggio 2016 Albini Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)
description: Floral in lavender and lilac, this is a highly likable and varietally respectful wine that's elegant and balanced. The oak and tannin present as soft and well integrated, allowing the fruit and herbal components to speak.

title: Rincon Mountain 2015 Barbera (Paso Robles)
description: From a winery that sits on the mountaintop atop the famed Rincon Point surfing break, this wine, which comes from an estate vineyard in Paso Robles, shows coffee, baked black cherries, black currant and peppercorns on the nose. The palate is loaded with plum paste, crushed slate and elderberry, wrapped in elegant tannins.

title: St Huberts 2016 The Stag Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Touches of nutmeg and vanilla fill the nose of this full-bodied and full-flavored wine. The texture is smooth and creamy, while a touch of acidity helps balance all that richness.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2016 Versada Limited Production Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a soft, juicy and layered wine that offers approachability in its integration of oak and tannin. Cherry, plum and cassis flavors give it a brightness that persists long on the finish.

title: Martian Ranch 2016 Absolute Magnitude Gamay Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: The slow rise of Gamay Noir on the Central Coast shows immense promise for lovers of mineral inflected, lighter styles of wine. This bottling offers wet slate and gravel on the nose along with sagebrush and light berries. The palate's tart cranberry fruit takes a backseat to wet rocks, tobacco leaf and mossy forest floor.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Allen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High toned and perfumed, this wine has ample texture and structure. Rose, lavender and blood orange effuse from the glass, before powerful waves of strawberry compote and rhubarb shoot through hoops of savory minerality.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site the heart of the appellation, and a block-designate at that, this is an exuberant and intensely flavored wine, with tones of black cherry, smoke and forest floor. It builds power as it sits in the glass, finishing on a lush, seductive texture.

title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a structured and remarkable wine, bursting in tension and complexity. High toned, it dances lightly on the palate in bolts of tangerine, Meyer lemon and green apple, with a jasmine note providing a pleasing complement.
designation: Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard

title: Saxon Brown 2014 Fighting Brothers Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A very earthy, spicy wine, this delights in red cherry, pomegranate and black tea, the body complex and full bodied with impressive density. Crisp, fresh acidity lies beneath the richness, complementing and refreshing.

title: Falcone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling by industry veterans John and Helen Falcone always packs in Paso Robles' lushness without breaking the bank. Creamy aromas of black-cherry chiffon, lush roses and violets and vanilla-speckled French toast lead into a ripe palate of black cherry, cassis, mocha and caramel. Soft but structural tannins and a proper acidity hold it together.

title: MacPhail 2016 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This red is floral and brimming in stony minerality. Tight-grained tannins wrap around spicy red fruit and savory notions of forest floor and black tea as full-bodied ripeness is balanced by walls of structure and fresh, juicy acidity.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Foss Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright, crunchy red fruit effuses ripeness in this lushly layered wine. Black tea, forest and cedar pierce through, making for a complementary experience that intrigues with complexity.

title: Dragonette 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Though this winery's single-vineyard expressions are awesome, this appellation blend is also a strong choice. Intense aromas of tart pomegranate, cinnamon, sumac and turned soil lead into a smooth, fresh and high-toned palate of rhubarb and French toast flavors.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Fox Den Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This wine is beautifully fruity in tones of cranberry, strawberry and raspberry, with perfumed wafts of rose and lavender on the nose. It's light in body, driven by bright acidity that keeps it fresh and inviting. A silky display of Asian spice rings on the finish.

title: Goldeneye 2015 Confluence Vineyard Lower Bench Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Intensely expressive fruit flavors carry this full-boded wine from first whiff through lingering finish. Bright black-cherry tones meet violets in the aroma, while black cherry, blackberry and rhubarb fill out the palate. The flavors are unusually pure and well delineated and the balance is spot-on, as moderate tannins and good fruit acidity bolster the mouthfeel.

title: Gratus 2015 Estate Grown Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: From an estate site in Pope Valley that rises to an elevation of 1,000-feet, this impresses in high-toned raspberry and cassis fruitiness, accompanied by an aromatic note of violet. Well structured and full bodied, it has secondary characteristics of cedar and dried herb, the oak supportive and not in the way. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy best from 2025–2030.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 West Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Gritty in texture and supremely complex, this estate red is powerful in concentration and acidity. Floral rose and earth ride along its midpalate of forest floor, black tea and tangy pomegranate, finishing with an emphasis on the persistent Asian spice.

title: Fort Ross Vineyard 2016 Fort Ross Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: From a field selection planted to old Hyde and Wente clones, this white has soft rounded corners of caramel, oak and vanilla bean. The complex, balanced richness is defined in tropical fruit accented by a brightness of tangerine and white peach.

title: Jax 2017 Dutton Ranch 7 Barrels Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Tart, tangy and inviting, this medium-bodied wine shows deft layers of succulent fruit over a smooth texture. Flavors of lemongrass, anise and Meyer lemon are carried by a flowing river of acidity.

title: Saxon Brown 2016 Etre Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Low in oak and high in acidity, this is an earthy herbal white that's stony and salty, capturing full-on the spirit of the ocean. Light and lemony, it has complexity and elegance in spades.

title: Alta Colina 2015 Old 900 Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Very dark in the glass and a tad wound up even three years in, this bottling graciously opens into aromas of lamb roast, charcoal and cassis. It has commanding presence on the palate, with a rich heavy luxurious mouthfeel that delivers flavors of lavender, rosemary, espresso and more cassis.

title: Bolt To Wines 2016 Sidekick By Karin Langer Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Rich and roasty on the nose, this bottling offers charred blackberry, peppercorns, tar, coffee and grape seed on the nose. The palate is rounded and smoky as well, with grilled black-plum and fig flavors lifted by pepper dust and well integrate purple flowers. This feels lavish but high-toned due strong acid.

title: Dragonette 2016 Duvarita Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Delicate at first on the nose, this bottling from a vineyard that's northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills offers honeysuckle, light pineapple, candied orange rind and a hint of pecan on the nose. The palate is rounded with yellow-melon, orange-cream and walnut flavors, proving unique and complex.

title: Le P'tit Paysan 2016 Le P'tit Pape Red (Central Coast)
description: Ian Brand's flagship bottling just keeps getting better, yet stays reasonably priced. Light in the glass, this blend of 65% Grenache, 26% Syrah, 7% Mourvèdre and 2% Counoise offers lovely aromas of strawberry, red plum, white pepper, wild tomato and forest floor. It's taut in texture on the sip, holding cranberry and strawberry flavors in check, as dried sagebrush carries through the finish.

title: Furthermore 2015 Gioia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Perfumed and floral, this wine's provenance from a coastal site gives it a swagger of crunchy red fruit and tangy citrus, the acid pronounced and quenching. An edgy earthiness beckons from its medium-bodied structure and rocky minerality.

title: Joullian 2016 Argyle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (San Antonio Valley)
description: Though from a hot part of Monterey County, this bottling retains great freshness, starting with aromas of wild strawberry and violet. The palate combines plump strawberry with hints of white pepper, showing the varietal elegance of the grape.

title: Maryetta 2017 Roma's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine has personality, good balance and a subtle but memorable mélange of fruit, spice and savory flavors. The aroma catches sour cherries, stems and earth while the flavors bring black cherry, cranberry and a hint of rhubarb. Good acidity and mild tannins help form an appetizing mouthfeel.

title: Noceto 2016 Hillside Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: A wonderful tamarind aroma and flavor give this nervy, well-balanced wine a unique personality. It has spicy aromas, cherry-like flavors, medium to full body and light tannins for extra mouthfeel.

title: ONX 2016 Level 22 Red (Templeton Gap District)
description: Aromas of black plum and purple flowers meet with white pepper and char on the nose of this blend of 49% Syrah, 35% Mourvèdre and 16% Petite Sirah. Dark plum and Morello cherry flavors arise on the palate, where bright acid cuts through the stiff tannins, finishing on hints of tar and black spice.

title: Opolo 2016 Maestro Red (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of cassis, caramel, black rock minerality and charred wood show on the nose of this very likable blend. Strong black-plum, coffee, caramel and chocolate flavors are cut by lavender and graphite flavors on the dynamic palate.

title: Starfield 2016 Jacks Are Wild Red (El Dorado)
description: This deep and gutsy wine was blended from Petite Sirah, Tempranillo and Aglianico grapes. It is tightly packed with ripe fruit, oak spices and firm tannins. Its deep color is black nearly to the rim, the aromas resemble cooked blueberries and cherries, while the palate is rich, dry and concentrated. It's tannic and firmly structured, and will need either rich food or time in the bottle to mellow it. Best after 2022.

title: The Withers Winery 2016 Ruben G-S-M (El Dorado)
description: Floral, spicy aromas and bold well-articulated flavors accompany a firm, moderately tannic texture in this oaky but well-balanced Mourvèdre-based wine. It has a tangy nervy mouthfeel, plenty of baking-spice and cedar nuances and a good core of red and black cherry.

title: The Withers Winery 2017 Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Bold black-cherry and strawberry layers adorn this balanced, light-bodied wine that's deceptively big in flavor and intensity. With integrated oak and tannin, it allows room for savory characteristics of forest and clove to speak.

title: Timbre 2014 A Cote Mission Ranch Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Light aromas of sage, wild strawberry, cranberry and wet river stone are subtle but expressive on the nose of this bottling. The palate is well integrated with flavors of tart cranberry, wild mint and earthy soil.

title: De Loach 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy and stemmy, this affordable wine is both fresh and robust. It shows good balance in its black cherry, tea and forest floor flavors, which make it appealing to many Pinot lovers.

title: Austin Hope 2015 Syrah (Templeton Gap District)
description: Extremely rich on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of coffee candy, black cherry paste and roasted fig. Very much adhering to Austin Hope's house style, the palate is also thick and creamy in flavors of caramel, espresso and syrupy black fruits, all bolstered by flashes of acidity.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2015 Heritage Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This is a savory style of Cabernet Sauvignon, with structure that's built to last. Aromas of crushed black rock, dark chocolate, blackberry, charred wood and herb-crusted beef lead into the dry palate, where a sticky structure carries flavors of black currant, violet and cola. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Campovida 2017 Trails End Vineyard Rosé di Grenache (Mendocino County)
description: This appealing and well-balanced wine checks all the boxes for rosé. It is crisp, lively and lightly fruity. The color is light salmon, the aromas are full of peaches and tangerines and the flavors are dry, tangy and just fruity enough.

title: Cass 2015 Rockin' One Red (Paso Robles)
description: Very ripe and boisterous aromas of red cherry, berry jam, nutmeg, star anise and cinnamon show on the spicy nose of this blend of 39% Mourvèdre, 31% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 10% Petite Sirah. The palate is cohesive and compelling, wrapping those baking-spice notes around a black-cherry core, framed by solid acidity and tannins.

title: Hayes Valley 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Extremely well balanced and appetizing, this screw capped wine combines absolutely fresh black-cherry flavors with mild oak accents and energizes them with good fruit acidity and moderate tannins. It is medium to full bodied, and will make a lively pairing with a wide variety of dishes.

title: Killer Drop 2015 Red (California)
description: Excellent breadth and depth make this Grenache-based wine feel luxurious on the palate while also bringing concentrated black-fruit and spice flavors that are focused and lingering. It has moderate, well- integrated tannins that coat the rich blackberry and baking-spice core.

title: La Voix 2015 Reflektor John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tangy strawberry aromas are lifted by white pepper on this bottling by Steve Clifton from a vineyard that sits toward the eastern edge of the appellation. There is a snappy freshness to the palate, where tart red fruits mix with dewy thyme and, on the finish, a lavender lift.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lightly toasted coconut and lemon peel make for a soft, delicate nose on this bottling. There is plenty of ripe fruit on the palate, from pear and apple cream to exotic citrus with just enough oak background, proving to be a very flavorful wine.

title: Lucienne 2016 Smith Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Soft and creamy aromas of poached pear and buttered toast are cut by the slightest edge of lemon peel on the voluptuous yet not overdone nose of this bottling. More lemon and baked nectarine show on the palate, which is plush and creamy, with flavors of marshmallow and meringue.

title: Qupé 2016 Bien Nacido Block Eleven Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Exotic aromas of lemongrass, chive, Vidalia onion skin and toasted nut make for a fascinating entry to this bottling. The palate carries hints of vanilla and light caramel that surround the baked apple flavors, all framed by zippy acidity.

title: Westwood 2016 Annadel Gap Vineyard Calera Clone Pinot Noir (Sonoma Valley)
description: Juicy, savory and earthy, this is a gorgeously complex and expressive wine from one clone, brimming in dried herb, sage and firm tannin. Structured and offering breadth across the balanced palate, it finishes in bright tangy acidity.

title: Pride Mountain 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy, savory, spicy and well integrated, this bold beauty offers so much of what the variety is while combining 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot. With a backbone of tannin and oak, it shines in lasting accents of clove, chocolate and red and black currant, rich and smooth.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Alexander's Crown Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Bright in acidity and offering firm tannic structure, this lush wine is gracefully lengthy and powerful in weight. Red fruit, anise, fennel and sage provide a richness of flavor across the palate, with a depth of chocolate and blackberry jam that lingers on the finish.

title: Sanguis 2016 1-1 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Matthias Pippig's wines need plenty of time and air to reach their full potential, but they sing once there. This one-barrel bottling begins with aromas of black plum, black currant, sagebrush and thyme and then drops into a palate loaded with boysenberry, pie crust and cracked pepper. Every component is amplified the longer the bottle remains open.

title: Monochrome 2018 Wall of Sound White (California)
description: This blend of 68% Roussanne from Zaca Mesa Vineyard and 32% Viognier from Shokrian Vineyard starts with a very compelling set of brisk aromas, including crushed sea shells, light apple and a whiff of daffodil. The grippy palate grabs hold and never ceases, sizzling through with flavors of melon, baked quince and salt.

title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2016 Georges De Latour Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick, concentrated and hugely structured, this wine from the famous site is robust in tannin and oak, with a core of tangy red fruit, both currant and cassis. It builds succulence on the palate as it opens, allowing for a generosity of spirit and fruit. Still, cellaring will benefit the wine; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

title: Cami 2015 Estate Grown Red (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is made from nearly equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Robustly savory and earthy, it shines in graphite, licorice, red fruit and brown sugar, with complexity, length and considerable power at its core. This impressive red will do well in the cellar. Best 2025–2030.

title: Benovia 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Sourced from two great sites, Martaella Estate and Zio Tony Ranch, this is an acid-driven wine, demure and elegant in wet stone and a touch of lanolin. The midpalate develops more weight and richness in the form of baked apple and pear, finishing with focus and lasting complexity.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 Black Label Bassi Ranch Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo)
description: Lightly herbal tones decorate the ripe red cherry, exotic strawberry and soil- and slate-laced nose of this powerful yet complex wine by Mike Sinor. The palate booms with flavors of black cherry and tarragon, backed by strong acidity and firm tannins.

title: I. Brand & Family 2017 Escolle Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very light and bright, this bottling from one of the appellation's northernmost and coolest sites shows honeysuckle and more white flowers on the subtle, delicate and yet inviting nose. There's a vibrant tension on the sip, where chalky white-rock flavors dance with lemon zest for a laser-sharp expression.

title: Sangiacomo 2017 Roberts Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)
description: From the producer's estate site in the heart of the new appellation, this sings in rich, juicy waves of fresh pear and anise. With depths of flavor and body, it retains crushed rock-like minerality and lemony acidity throughout its lush, layered texture.

title: Foxen 2017 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The tang of pomegranate cuts through the layers of fresh thyme, dewy sage, Earl Grey tea and singed tobacco on the nose of this bottling. Similar flavors consume the palate, where bright acidity cuts into the dried sage and crisp red fruits.

title: MacRostie 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: An expert display of subtlety and restraint on the nose, this elegant bottling offers light aromas of pomegranate and dried rose petals. Light raspberry, thyme and sagebrush flavors arise on the crisp sip, where the tannin level and acidity is refreshingly balanced.

title: Private Property 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine comes from the cellar of Scott Caraccioli from Escolle Vineyard, meaning that it's a lower-priced take on one of the premiere Pinot Noir properties in California. Fresh and vibrant aromas of rose petal, strawberry and potpourri are precise, while the palate's dry expression of pomegranate, chalk and ash are compelling.

title: Sanguis 2016 1/1 Grenache (Central Coast)
description: Layers of cherry, star anise, plum fruit leather and nutmeg cookies show on the nose of this one-barrel bottling from Alisos Canyon Vineyard. The palate is loaded with gingerbread spices that liven up the rustic red-plum and dried cherry flavors, all wrapped in well integrated tannins.

title: Dunites 2017 Spanish Springs Vineyard Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This bottling amplifies the coastal setting of these vines, showing aromas of damp campfire, violets, wet slate, roasted plums and violet. The palate is also incredibly unique, mixing acai, lilac and violet flavors with an ashy smudged cigarette flavor.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Adam's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed in rose and lavender, this is a bright, well-integrated wine rich in red cherry and strawberry that hides its powerful underlying weight and breadth well. It impresses in structured tannin and well-behaved oak that supports the fruit with a hint of spice.

title: Patz & Hall 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a memorable wine, meaty and earthy with plenty of fresh, persistent acidity. Grapefruit, strawberry and dried herb mingle around a tart and tangy texture of sublime nuance and elegance.

title: Foxen 2017 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Polished aromas of red cherry and hibiscus meet with wild sage and light wood on the fresh nose of this bottling. There's an herbal array on the palate, from pine needle-laced forest floor to tea leaf and eucalyptus, giving depth to the light red-cherry and mulberry flavors.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Hudson Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Salty, smooth and exotic in rocky brine, this white has robust power and concentration within intensely flavored richness—a mix of pineapple and pear. Medium bodied, it retains a backbone of acidity that complements the boldness; enjoy best from 2022 through 2027.

title: Baldassari Family Wines 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Barrel fermented, this impressively balanced, expressive wine shows lovely flavors of pear compote, ginger snap, lemon meringue and vanilla. Smooth and creamy, it has a lushness to the texture that doesn't overwhelm, offering a bite of welcome acidity as it finishes.

title: Sangiacomo 2017 Green Acres Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the producer's estate site, first planted in 1969, this is an intensely concentrated and powerfully built wine, made by winemaker James MacPhail. Viscous, it has a hearty mouthfeel of lush power dotted in green apple, peach, spicy nutmeg and a hint of toast.

title: Testarossa 2016 Diana's Chardonnay (California)
description: Ripe white-peach and honeysuckle aromas are leveled by oak, sea salt, toasted almond and seared lemon on the rich nose of this statewide blend. The palate is hefty and rich, with lemon, white peach and roasted nut flavors, balanced by a powerful acid and a lime zest touch that carries through the long finish.

title: Testarossa 2016 Rosemary's Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Nuanced aromas of Meyer lemon and tangerine rind meet with hazelnut, toast and a hint of ashy Brie cheese on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard that only a few producers are able to use. A chalky mouthfeel frames fresh but toasty flavors of lemon peel and oak.

title: Villa Creek 2016 Bone White (Adelaida District)
description: There are many layers to this bottling, starting with aromas of lemon juice, dried mango, melon rind and yellow rose on the nose. The palate lands with a touch of honey and then opens toward light plumeria and tropical fruits, leaning toward canned pear and maraschino cherry, yet the tight texture and citrusy lime-blossom flavors hold it together.

title: Timbre 2016 Lead Vocals Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: From Bien Nacido Vineyard's older vines, this bottling, which saw 40% new oak, starts with aromas of plum, pepper, wild thyme and sagebrush on the nose. Exotic plum and mulberry flavors arise on the sip, which is loaded with marjoram and even dill flavors, as the old vine fruit turns the oak spice into layers of intrigue.

title: Beringer 2016 Pauli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a tight-grained, grippy and complex red wine, savory in leather, tobacco and current. The midpalate softens into a rich, luxurious explosion of black cherry, cocoa powder and currant. It stands to develop more substantially over time; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

title: Calluna 2018 Estate Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Chalk Hill)
description: Light and creamy, this is an impressive, small-production wine made from 67% Sauvignon Blanc and 33% Sémillon grown high up on the producer's estate. Fruity and flinty, it excels in interwoven flavors of peach, melon and lemon, finishing crisp and complex.

title: Cattleya 2017 Belly of the Whale Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Rounded aromas of roasted cherry, star anise and violet make for a rich yet detailed nose on this bottling by Bibiana González Rave. The bright cherry-compote flavor of the palate is enhanced with eucalyptus, cracked pepper and earthy tones, making for a deliciously complete experience.

title: Zotovich 2017 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Precise aromas of boysenberry and dark cherry are lifted by sharp mace on the focused and intense nose of this bottling. The palate explodes with fresh violet and boysenberry jam flavors, proving lively and hedonistic, yet made more complex by licorice dust and pepper spice.

title: Oakstone 2017 Estate Geoff & Katy Reserve Petite Sirah (Fair Play)
description: This gentle giant of a wine is seductive, concentrated and full bodied. It has a cocoa and grape-skin aroma and deep blackberry and blueberry flavors wrapped in a rich blanket of fine-grained tannins. Can't wait to see how well it develops; best after 2025.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2018 Days Between Glenrose Vineyard Counoise (Adelaida District)
description: Here's a strong new player in the fresh, chillable red game. Snappy red fruits meet with wet gravel on the bright and buoyant nose, while the palate is crisp and a bit more complex. Flavors of red plum and pomegranate encounter sumac and cinnamon, riding with high acid from tip of the sip to finish.

title: Niner 2017 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Plush aromas of strawberry and cherry meet with subtle accents of clove, gingerbread, cinnamon and flowers on the nose of this bottling from Jespersen Ranch. A strawberry flavor dominates the palate, with touches of pepper and tobacco leaf, all framed by full tannins that hold firm into the finish. Drink through 2032.

title: J. Cage Cellars 2017 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a crisp, focused and floral white from a small new producer that shows a backbone of structure and well-integrated oak. From the heart of the Petaluma Gap, it has a length of stone and baking spice within a cradling of Meyer lemon and pear.

title: Domaine Carneros 2015 Estate Grown Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: This sparkling blend of 58% Pinot Noir and 42% Chardonnay is gorgeous in salmon color, with lithe bright flavors of sea spray, lemon peel and wet stone. Structured and gracefully high toned, it develops richer elements of peach and brioche on the cohesive, complex and lengthy finish.

title: Matchbook 2015 Estate Bottled Syrah (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This generous, expansive wine tastes rich and concentrated from the first whiff of ripe plums, baking spices and cedar to the lingering, spiced plum finish. It is full bodied, layered and mouthcoating.

title: Mathew Gibson 2014 Estate Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Subtle oak spices and black cherries fill the generous aromas and flavors of this medium- to full-bodied and smooth wine. It tastes rich and feels warm and mouthfilling, making it easy to sip and enjoy.

title: Square Peg 2018 Estate Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: From the producer's dry-farmed Pinot Noir vineyard, this beautifully crafted wine is a joyful expression of citrus and strawberry that bristles in acidity. With depth and complex flavors, it's more than just light and bright.

title: Windchaser 2017 Syrah (Mendocino County)
description: Aromas of wet rocks and iron start this medium- to full-bodied wine off with a jolt before dramatic flavors of sour cherry, black cherry and bitter chocolate kick in. Firm tannins and bracing acidity give it plenty of structure and the balance to age. Best after 2024.

title: Riaza 2014 Prospector Monastrell (Calaveras County)
description: Gorgeous fruit flavors meet darker clove notes in this exuberant but also well-structured and moderately tannic wine, made from a Rhône grape variety better known as Mourvèdre. Good acidity lifts the mouthfeel and keeps it tasting lively through the finish.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Gobs of fruit flavor and a rich, rounded texture make this wine fun to taste and easy to enjoy. It practically oozes blackberry and black cherry flavors, and is supported by mild tannins and a velvety mouthfeel.

title: Dutton Estate 2016 Manzana Vineyard Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A soft velvety middle of muddled dark cherry, strawberry and black tea combines fruit and earth well in this medium-bodied estate wine. A touch of reduction persists from the beginning.

title: Jaffurs 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Clean aromas of pomelo and lychee meet with peach and dried sour pear on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Tangy citrus and grapefruit flavors ride an energetic mouthfeel, with a long-lasting acid that takes a sour stretch into the finish.

title: Masút 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Eagle Peak)
description: This attractive medium- to full-bodied wine lays out tasty pear and vanilla aromas and adds a touch of butter wrapped in a soft low-acidity texture. It was aged in neutral barrels on the lees for nine months so it goes easy on the oakiness.

title: Tablas Creek 2017 Patelin de Tablas Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: Rounded aromas of lemon cream and banana meet with a touch of chalk and a crushed rock minerality on the nose of this blend of 44% Grenache Blanc, 29% Viognier, 12% Marsanne, 12% Roussanne and 3% Clairette Blanche. There is a compelling tension to the palate, giving structure to the tropical guava and lime-spray flavors.

title: Tailor Made 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine shows light aromas of plum and cinnamon before rich and mouthfilling plum and strawberry flavors coat the palate. It is medium to full in body, is not overly oaky and has good concentration and light tannins to keep it feeling snappy on the finish.

title: Collier Creek 2016 Big Rooster Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Very rich and ripe, this lip-smacking wine has abundant grapey jammy blackberry-like aromas and flavors, and a broad, mouthfilling texture. It's well-backed by moderate tannins to balance out all that fruit.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Signature Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: This wine looks deep and dark, smells like black fruits and tastes concentrated, ripe and nicely dry. It has firm tannins and good acidity to boost the texture and enough depth in the fruit flavors to last on the finish.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: Aromas of hay and lawn clippings meet with wet river stone on the nose of this fresh and vibrant bottling. It's zippy on the palate, with flavors of lemon, lime and grapefruit rind.

title: Europa Village 2014 Vienza Private Reserve Sangiovese (Temecula)
description: Candied cherries, hibiscus, sumac and light clove aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Southern California. Dried strawberry flavors meet with mint and garden herbs on the aromatic palate.

title: Margerum 2017 Margerum Estate Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)
description: This wine begins with ripe bubblegum, peach, pear-syrup and Stargazer lily aromas, although those start to fade into more mineral tones as it sits open. The sip is quite tight, with lemony acidity and a chalky frame constraining the peachy flavors.

title: Portalupi 2016 Dolinsek Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny and rich, this is a stemmy and juicy wine, fruity in dark blueberry and blackberry fruit. Asian spice and cinnamon cola round out the full-bodied ripe experience.

title: Tablas Creek 2017 Cotes de Tablas Blanc White (Adelaida District)
description: Wet cement, almond cream, nectarine and tuberose aromas show on the nose of this blend of 44% Viognier, 24% Marsanne, 20% Grenache Blanc and 12% Roussanne. There is a strong acidity to the sip, which is crisp and clean with sliced pear and a hint of guava flavors.

title: Vino Noceto 2014 OGP Original Grandpere Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine features plummy raisiny aromas and fresh grapey flavors on a smooth, almost soft texture. It's easy to sip and enjoy on its own due to low tannins.

title: Balderdash 2014 Brakelight Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: Dark-black-plum aromas are fresh but dense on the nose of this bottling, which also offers tarragon, tobacco and bay leaf scents. The eucalyptus streak is strong on the tip of the sip but then warms up into baked blackberry and black-cherry flavors.

title: Bishop's Peak 2015 Elevation Red (Paso Robles)
description: Juicy in style, this blend of 45% Petit Verdot, 25% Merlot, 23% Malbec and 7% Cabernet Franc offers aromas of fresh-pressed blackberry and a hint of caramel. Charred oak, red-cherry and cranberry flavors arise on the palate alongside dried sage.

title: Black Ridge 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Seared lemon rinds, toasted almonds and broad apple aromas arise on the nose of this bottling. It's smooth and waxy on the palate with crème brûlée and Marcona almond flavors.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Petite Sirah (Amador County)
description: This big wine strikes a good balance between ripe delicious fruit flavors and the notorious tannic bite of the varietal. Black cherry and blackberry fill the aroma and flavors, while a very firm texture gives them plenty of support.

title: Figge 2016 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dark red-cherry, boysenberry and rosebud aromas make for a deep and expressive style of Grenache on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong herbal touch to the palate, where thyme, sagebrush and cinnamon meet with snappy black-raspberry flavors.

title: Chappellet 2018 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Waxy peach, green apple and lemon zest make for an enticing entry into this signature wine, which is lively and complex in crisp acidity. It builds body and weight on the midpalate, offering a creamy texture of viscous tropical richness.

title: Foley 2016 Bar Lazy S Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Full aromas of marshmallow, white peach and buttercream are billowing on the nose of this bottling. Creamy, ripe and rich flavors of white peach, cherimoya and oak consume the palate.

title: Grey Stack 2016 Four Brothers Vineyard Grenache (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a tiny-production field blend based around the main variety, with small amounts of Syrah, Carignane and Alicante Bouschet. It invites in pungent earthiness and velvety thick strawberry fruit, its core seasoned in black pepper, nutmeg and toasted oak.

title: Lone Madrone 2018 Dry Farmed Rosé (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: From a dry-farmed vineyard of Mourvèdre, this bottling is one of the better rosés in the region this year, starting with subtle aromas of wet cement, watermelon rind and plaster of Paris. The texture is incredibly chalky and taut, delivering brisk flavors of lemon juice and slight nectarine, with just enough of a sour kick on the finish.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2017 Dijon Clone 76 Estate Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: This wine offers delicate aromas of roasted pear, oak and butterscotch. The palate is round and plush, with white peach, sea salt and pastry flavors, cut by a stony minerality.

title: Mindego Ridge 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This bottling from a property atop the Santa Cruz Mountains shows complex aromas of warmed cream and toasted hazelnuts, with a strong lemon twist. The palate picks up a firm tension and offers flavors of crisp lemon wedge and broader nectarine in the midpalate.

title: Pulchella 2016 Henchman Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Rich and gooey cassis, black-plum-jelly and lilac aromas show on the nose of this Tannat blend from the Bella Collina and Glenrose vineyards. The purple fruits and flowers come through on the sip as well but there are also layered of roasted coffee, anise, peppercorn and smoke, making for a complete flavor profile.

title: Ram's Gate 2018 Estate Pinot Blanc (Carneros)
description: Crisp, floral and textured, this is a varietal white rare to Carneros and in new hands, with winemaker Joe Nielsen. Aged partially in stainless steel, partially in neutral oak, it has focused acidity, with refreshing tones of lemon, lime, peach and grapefruit.

title: Rincon Mountain 2016 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: From a six-acre vineyard that the owners planted by hand, this is an impressive early showing for this winery. Dark in the glass, the wine shows aromas of boysenberry, blackberry, violet, jasmine and vanilla. The palate continues that fruit-forward expression but wraps it in sticky tannins and persistent acidity. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Westerly 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: The slightest bit cloudy in the glass, this bottling shows a wondrous combination of grassy aromas and fruity tones of passion fruit and guava on the full nose. The palate is flavorful in ripe tropical fruits as well as strong grass and wet stone accents.

title: Margerum 2018 Sybarite Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Crisp pear flesh, lemon rind and white-flowers show on the nose of this always zesty, refreshing bottling by Doug Margerum. There's a stony grip to the sip, where citrus and Asian pear flavors compete for attention against the tremendously chalky texture.

title: Hahn 2017 G-S-M (Central Coast)
description: Freshly crushed blackberry, leafy herbs, charred meat and a hint of oak show on the nose of this value blend of 65% Grenache, 33% Syrah and 2% Mourvèdre. It's fresh on the palate in a black currant flavor yet savory in smoked meat, all framed by bright acidity and layered tannins.

title: Calera 2016 De Villiers Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)
description: There is impressive density to the bottling, starting with aromas of roasted black cherry and blackberry as well as cocoa and wood spice. It's heavy on the palate with full flavors of blackberry, bay leaf and more dark chocolate.

title: Comartin 2016 Tierra Alta Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Clean and broad aromas of purple flowers and blueberry fruit meet with toasty oak and roasted meats on the nose of this single vineyard expression. The palate is concentrated with black cherry and vanilla flavors, lifted by layers of bay leaf and more herbal elegance.

title: Domaine Eden 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The more affordable little sister of Mount Eden, this wine, which is bolstered by 15% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc, 4% Petit Verdot and 1% Malbec, offers black plum, wet river stones, dusty herbs and wood spice on the nose. The palate focuses on minerality, structure and savory flavors, including subtle lavender and black plum. The structure will last for ages. Drink 2020–2036.

title: Emeritus 2016 Hallberg Ranch Wesley's Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is made to honor founder Brice Jones' father and this vintage is the inaugural release. Demure in cherry and strawberry it becomes bolder and richer as it builds power on the midpalate, with a spicy undercurrent of clove and forest floor. The tannins are grippy and thick, the finish surprisingly elegant and balanced.

title: Grassini 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Warm aromas of black cherry, caramel and cola promise a comforting sip on this rich and ripe wine from one of the region's more beautiful estates. Rich cassis and blackberry flavors meet with spicy touches of sarsaparilla and mocha on the sip, which is framed by chalky yet slender tannins.

title: Grimm's Bluff 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This bottling from a newer biodynamic property, now made by winemaker Ernst Storm, combines racy and riper tones on the dynamic nose, offering aromas of dried lemon, red pear, wet stone and parsley. The palate is stony and tingling with acidity, delivering ripe pear and nectarine flavors.

title: Lone Madrone 2015 Points West White (Paso Robles)
description: There's a fascinating smoke element to this blend of 49% Picpoul, 34% Roussanne and 17% Viognier, starting with aromas of seared Meyer lemon rinds, roasted chicken, flint and yellow peach on the nose. The palate is also smoky but layered with melon, mango and white-peach flavors, finishing on butterscotch. It's a viable Chardonnay alternative.

title: McKinney 2016 The Baron Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of black plum, roasted berries and baking spice are rich and ripe on the nose of this blend of 52% Syrah, 26% Grenache, 13% Mourvèdre and 9% Viognier. There is a chalky tension to the palate, where a rich black-plum flavor is met with elegant touches of lavender and other herbs.

title: Foxen 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Dried cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry meet with dried thyme and peppercorns on the nose of this appellation blend. There is good acidic zip on the sip, where cranberry flavors meet with dusty herbs.

title: Hungry Hawk 2018 Elliot Ranch Reserve Albariño (San Diego County)
description: Clean aromas of chalk, Asian pear and melon are crisp and pure on the nose, which ends on a slight hint of almond. Sliced green pear, tight nectarine and a tiny touch of toast flavors show on the pleasantly crisp palate.

title: LangeTwins 2018 Prince Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)
description: Fresh apple and orange-blossom aromas lead to crisp and satisfying fruit flavors in this light-bodied, fresh and appetizing wine. It feels well balanced on the palate and turns a bit soft or sweet on the finish.

title: Las Positas 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Oodles of oak meet gobs of fruit in this ripe, mature and ready-to-drink wine. Toast, nutmeg, vanilla and cedar wrap around rich plum and a touch of raspberry, while full body adds to a generous mouthfeel.

title: Terra d'Oro 2018 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)
description: This wine smells gorgeously fruity, tastes ripe and pure like freshly cut apples and Bosc pears, and has a good crisp texture balanced by medium body. A touch of sweetness emerges on the finish.

title: Brecon Estate 2018 Albariño (Central Coast)
description: Melon rind, chopped mint and wet gravel show on the nose of this appellation blend from a winery that's doubling down on Albarino. It's very zippy on the palate, with tart flavors of finger lime that slice across the palate and can be enjoyed on the hottest of days.

title: Buck Shack 2017 Small Batch Red (Lake County)
description: This wine is large in flavor, very ripe and rich, but also dry and well balanced, which can't be said for a lot of red blends. Moderate tannins and a lively fruit base keep it appetizing through the finish.

title: Fleury Estate 2014 Lauren Bryce Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, aged two years in new French oak. Leather, cigar and black currant highlight a smoothly structured, richly full-bodied wine that shows warmth and depth.

title: Grassini 2016 Articondo Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Lilac and violet aromas meet with purple fruit on the slightly tangy nose of this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. There is a tart black-plum element to the sip, where more purple-flower flavors meet with Dr Pepper spice.

title: Markus Wine Co 2017 Toura Red (Lodi)
description: This sturdy and well-made wine is dry, well-balanced and medium to full bodied. Made from an unusual combination of equal parts Touriga, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah, its strong blackberry and black-cherry flavors blanket the palate while light tannins add some welcome grip to the mouthfeel.

title: Navarro 2018 Estate Bottled Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: This dry (or nearly dry) wine is lively and well-balanced, fresh and appetizing. Rose petal and peach aromas lead to citrus and peach flavors that are charming and nicely concentrated.

title: Flat Top Hills 2016 Red (California)
description: A smooth texture and mouthfilling presence make this full-bodied wine from the C. Mondavi family easy and satisfying to sip and enjoy. It blends ripe plum with a milk chocolate flavor for a generous, relaxed character.

title: Diamond Hitch 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Very full aromas of black cherry, smoke and crushed stone make for a pleasing nose on this bottling. The flavors are approachable if simplistic, with more black cherry and oak, backed by forgiving tannins and substantive acidity.

title: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2017 Sparkling Rosé (Malibu Coast)
description: This first-ever vintage blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Grenache starts with clean aromas of peach, strawberry, chalk and wet stone on the nose. The mousse is intense on the sip, with flavors of tangy raspberry and wet slate, proving very high-toned.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Olivet Lane Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Apple-cinnamon crisp first comes to mind in this rounded white wine, which is aromatic in white flowers and a touch of butter. Creamy on the palate, it has balance within a lightly oaked arena of crème brûlée richness finished in Asian spice.

title: Navarro 2018 Riesling (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine is always a good choice. It balances a nice ripe fruit character against a tangy texture that keeps the plump peach and apricot flavors lively on the palate and lingering on the finish.

title: Peachy Canyon 2017 Especial Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Exotic plum and mulberry aromas meet with lots of fennel-bulb touches on the nose of this bottling. The fennel element is also strong on the palate, giving spicy depth to the plummy flavors at the core.

title: Republic of Pink 2018 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Freshly snapped bubblegum sticks, light strawberry, rose petal and jasmine aromas invite the nose into this fun bottling. The sip is bright and plush, with flavors of strawberry sorbet and more bubblegum that are quite prominent.

title: Testarossa 2016 Cuvée Los Gatos Rob's Red (Central Coast)
description: Earthy aromas of red plum, black-plum skins and mushroom show on the nose of this bottling. There's an earthy, rocky core to the sip, and then come waves of red fruit, including red plum and sour cherry, as well as a fennel-frond spice.

title: Twisted Cedar 2018 Moscato (Clarksburg)
description: This dessert-style wine exudes bright, floral-fruit flavors with wild abandon and backs them with concentrated, sweet and ripe flavors. It has richness and layers and enough sweetness to pair with almost any dessert, but could be fabulous with aged cheeses too.

title: Zotovich 2016 Heritage Red (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This 50% Syrah and 50% Grenache shows many cool-climate hallmarks that come from this region, with blackberry, purple flower and a hint of charcoal on the nose. The layers are slowly revealed on the palate, with dark strawberry and plum skipping into lavish tones of baking spice. Acid drives deep into the finish.

title: Entrepreneur 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Creamy and lushly full bodied, this wine is complemented by a gritty texture of mineral and crushed rock, the whole integrated and well structured. Bold ripe flavors of pear are met by baking spice and toasted oak that linger with abandon on the finish.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Indian Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine from a Zin specialist has soul and spices, combining ripe and rich berry flavors with attractive hints of sage and black pepper. It is full bodied, smooth and lush in texture and offers just a touch of tannin for good structure.

title: Gambal + Work 2016 Francesca Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is the brand new project from Alex Gambal and Peter Work of Ampelos Cellars in the Sta. Rita Hills, where Gambal is hoping to replicate his Burgundian style. This wine's rounded aromas of white peach, sea salt caramel and nectarine syrup lead into an energetic palate that's sharply citrus at first before the chalky minerality takes hold.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Toboni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an intensely built, dense red that is sultry and full bodied yet totally in balance. Tangy dark cherry, pomegranate and black tea are accented by rose petal and orange zest, finishing on a lush expanse of vanilla.

title: Kenzo Estate 2017 Asatsuyu Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a hearty, acid-driven white, with a white peach flavor and a lush, creamy palate. Hints of jasmine and apple blossom meld with a touch of lemon zest on the lingering finish.

title: Le P'tit Paysan 2017 Jacks Hill Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: This bottling by Ian Brand always packs bang for the buck, but he really nailed it in the 2017 vintage. Clean and delicate aromas of Asian pear, lemon rind and edgy chalk lead into a racy, crisp and tightly wound palate. Flavors of grapefruit, nectarine, blanched almond and sea salt are delicious.

title: Roblar 2016 Estate Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A richer style of Syrah, this bottling offer baked black cherry, blueberry sorbet, lilac and baking spice on the nose. The palate is lavish and loaded with black fruits and jasmine flavors, framed by buoyant acidity.

title: RouteStock 2017 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is such a lovely white wine, priced attractively, which delivers a heady entry of honey and caramelized oak. Juicy acidity lifts bold flavors of lemon meringue, green apple and tangerine, finishing with a balanced weight and intrigue of nutmeg.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Besson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Blackberry, black cherry, vanilla and baking spice converge for a very hedonistic and delicious aromatic entry to this bottling from an old vineyard near Gilroy. Roasted red-fruit flavors show on the sip along with star anise and cherry-wood smoke.

title: Zaca Mesa 2015 Eight Barrel Syrah Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Quite gamy and savory on the nose, this select bottling offers aromas of cracked black pepper, roast beef, crushed violet and elderberry. The palate falls in line with meaty, peppery flavors as well as a black currant and black-plum sauce, with hints of cardamom and chai tea.

title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Eloge Red (Napa Valley)
