description: This blends 66% Cabernet Sauvignon with 28% Cabernet Franc, 4% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot. Together, they combine for a soft rounded palate of smoky cherry, currant, clove and cinnamon. A light grip of tannin gives it additional power and statement, with a finish of black pepper. Enjoy 2026–2031.

title: Au Bon Climat 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: From Jim Clendenen's historic vineyard collection of wines, this bottling (from the vineyard that surrounds his winery) is light in the glass with aromas of red cherry, bay leaf, juniper and vanilla. The herbal attack is powerful on the palate, where oregano, sage and chamomile lift up the cranberry and pomegranate fruit.

title: Au Bon Climat 2015 La Bauge Au-dessus Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rusty and gamy aromas of blood meet with light cranberry and charred wood on the nose of this bottling by Jim Clendenen and team. The body is light yet carries immense waves of flavors, including sarsaparilla, pomegranate and smoke.

title: Bargetto 2017 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Rounded cherry aromas are lifted by light licorice spice and sweet herbs on the nose of this clonal study. The lightweight mouthfeel is tense with pinpoint tannins, offering flavors of black raspberry, orange rind and spicy fruit punch.

title: Bonny Doon 2013 Le Cigare Volant Reserve Red (Central Coast)
description: This reserve blend of 55% Grenache, 25% Syrah, 16% Mourvèdre and 4% Cinsaut takes a good amount of patience to open, but is quite compelling when it does. Candied cherry and hibiscus aromas meet with rusty sanguine aromas on the nose, while the palate combines red fruit with raw meat and feral flavors. A baking-spice warmth evolves with time.

title: Chenoweth 2015 Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This blends grapes from three tremendous sites: Chenoweth Ranch, Treehouse and Bootlegger's Hill, all sites farmed by Charlie Chenoweth himself. It melds and marries aspects of fruit and spice effortlessly around a tightly packed bit of power and ongoing freshness, with a perspective of Asian spice and black cherry.

title: Chimney Rock 2015 Tomahawk Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a thick, richly layered red from the producer's site—one of the cooler sides of the vineyard. Lush on the palate, it has tender elements of black currant, smoked meat, black pepper, licorice and lavender, a complex array of elements that shows room for further evolution. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Concannon 2016 Captain Joe's Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine is bold and straightforward, with just a little oak spiciness and a generous supply of black-fruit flavors and fine-grained tannins. It has a sense of layering and creaminess that keeps it drinkable despite the tannic grip. Best after 2023.

title: Au Bon Climat 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is winemaker Jim Clendenen's take on the region's most important vineyard. It is light in the glass yet with savory aromas of chalk, butter, hazelnut and sandalwood. Rounded flavors of lemon, honeydew and orange cream lead into a caramelized finish.

title: Kuleto Estate 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky in charred oak with thick walls of tannin, this is blended with 10% Merlot, 7% Malbec and 6% Cabernet Franc. Together they offer dense flavors of dried herb, baked blackberry and tar.

title: St. Francis 2016 Claret (Sonoma County)
description: Combining half Merlot with 30% Malbec and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this red is herbal and earthy with a bold tannic structure. Touches of clove, tobacco and oak mark the finish.

title: Masia de la Vinya 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Extracted on the nose, this bottling shows dried sour cherry aromas and a hint of herbs. Sticky tannins frame the palate, where blackberry and garden herb flavors meet with a hint of bitter earth.

title: Technique 2016 Proprietary Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: Juicy and oaky with a bite of char, this is a simple, ripely robust red wine that blends Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Dark cherry, currant and a touch of reduction round it out.

title: Formation 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows extracted aromas of strawberry, Bing cherry, oregano and potpourri. The palate is rustic with earthy flavors of rosemary, pine needle and light raspberry.

title: Paraduxx 2016 Rector Creek Block 5 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending nearly equal parts Cabernet Franc and Zinfandel, this is a woody, tannic wine with diluted black- and red-cherry fruit that struggles to find definition in either variety. Harsh back notes of dried sage and oak mark the finish.

title: AVA Grace 2018 Citrus Pear Vibrant Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This light-bodied wine has a touch of wood smoke in the aroma and vague, modestly fruity flavors.

title: Esser 2018 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Sour apples and dried limes converge on the nose of this bottling, which is almost a slight shade of pink in the glass. Dried apple flavors show on the slightly sour palate.

title: Lapis Luna 2016 Red (North Coast)
description: A touch of sweetness softens the vibrant cherry and raspberry flavors in this medium-bodied wine.

title: Muscatine Vineyard 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick in black, leathery fruit, dried herb and toasted oak, this is an intensely ripe, concentrated wine that has a sour quality to the finish.

title: Akash 2016 Three's Company Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Primary aromas of smashed plum, Concord grape and acai fruit are fresh if simple on the nose of this blend. The palate is also juicy and fresh while very primary in flavor, offering grape juice and fennel elements.

title: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Very tart aromas of green apple and sour grapefruit meet with grassy, green-pepper aromas on the nose of this bottling. Flavors of rainy cement and dusty, dried apples show on the sip.

title: Felten Cellars 2016 Old Casteel Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Dried mulberry, baked cherries and strong nutmeg show on the nose of this thicker wine. The palate is noticeably sweet, with loads of gingerbread and extracted fruit flavors that slide from sugary to sour by the finish.

title: Kunde 2015 Drummond Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Herbal, intensely tannic and brimming in peppercorn, this is a full-bodied, concentrated and richly rounded wine that finishes tart.

title: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Merlot (California)
description: An aroma of cherry syrup meets fresh and seemingly sweet cherry and strawberry flavors in this light- to medium-bodied wine. It is smooth and easy in texture, and soft in balance.

title: Ballentine 2016 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is a robustly ripe, thick and vicious wine. It shows flavors of baked plum that veer into the sweet prune territory.

title: The Atom 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A heavy, sweet-oak component obscures most of the fruit flavor in this medium-bodied wine. It tastes like wood smoke, cedar and mint all the way through.

title: AVA Grace 2016 Fruity Silky Soft Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is soft and fruity, almost syrupy in texture, and has simple cherry and berry flavors.

title: J. Cage Cellars 2018 Tzabaco Rancho Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is made partially from the Musque clone, the wine fermented in half neutral oak and half stainless-steel. Herbal and tart, it has an intensity of flavor and ripeness.

title: Fortress 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 11% Merlot and 4% Malbec, this is a hearty red wine that's brimming in chalky tannin and oak. Powerfully dense, with a touch of heat, it features peppercorn and dried herb as well as a touch of cigar.

title: Goldeneye 2015 Confluence Vineyard Hillside Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This densely packed, superripe wine is a winner for folks who love an all-out fruit and oak combination. From aromas like cloves, black cherries and lilac it goes to jammy rich berry flavors and a plush mouth-filling texture, followed by a lingering, baking-spice finish.

title: Jaffurs 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Tar, charred beef, purple flowers, crushed slate and elderberry jam make an attention-grabbing aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite tart and taut, with peppery spice, rustic elderberry and new leather flavors.

title: Justin 2015 Savant Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this blend of 80% Syrah and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon starts with boysenberry, caramel, cocoa and fresh purple-flower aromas. The palate is framed by lush tannins, carrying a black cherry flavor that leads into a coffee and crème brûlée finish.

title: Niner 2016 JR Reserve Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Fresh and lively on the nose, this bottling by Molly Bohlman offers aromas of baked boysenberry, savory caramelized pork and purple flowers. Grippy and chalky tannins are fairly rigid on the palate, offering flavors of dark cherry, plum and thyme. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Sheldon 2016 The Red Hat Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tiny production field blend of 90% Petite Sirah and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. It surprises and delights in aromas of floral lavender sachet and white pepper, the red fruit is high-toned and tangy, with buoyant acidity and freshness shining from start to finish.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Allen Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an integrated, well-made white, with juicy acidity and a robust ripeness. Grainy apple, pear and lemon flavors provide texture as additional accents of nutmeg, lemongrass and tea intrigue.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Coastlands Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A spicy white-pepper note opens this wine. Root beer, black cherry and firm tannins combine for a beefy midpalate of freshness and power.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewurztraminer (San Benito County)
description: As one of the more expressive dessert wines from the region, this bottling offers aromas of candied honeysuckle, tuberose, plumeria and lime balm on the nose. The unctuous and thick palate is balanced by a slick acidity, allowing honey, flowers and citrus flavors to make for an ambrosial experience.

title: B Cellars 2017 Blend 23 White (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: This is made from 60% Sauvignon Blanc, 35% Chardonnay and 5% Viognier, some of the wine stainless-steel fermented, some barrel or concrete-egg fermented. Together, they offer a lively hit of bright grapefruit, apricot and Meyer lemon squeeze. The texture is velvety smooth with a twist of grip.

title: Benovia 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This is a classic version of the variety, the grapes grown at the Four Brothers Vineyard (winemaker Mike Sullivan is among the brothers). Smoky tar, oak and tannin grip a softly layered, structured mingling of lavender, white pepper, strawberry and leather.

title: La Crema 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a well-structured, subtly flavored wine that should improve and become even more complex with a few years aging. It has bold black-cherry aromas, enticing black-fruit flavors that are more tangy than rich, and mild oak spices wending through from aroma to finish. Best after 2023.

title: Les Belles Collines 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a juicy wine that's richly woven in flavors of dark cherry, plum, cola and nutmeg. Big and bold, it remains in balance through a burly midpalate and lengthy finish.

title: Longoria 2016 Cuvée Diana Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling needs some time to breathe, but once it opens, there are aromas of oak, Meyer lemon and grapefruit pith on the nose. The palate combines flavors of salty crushed nuts and savory broth with lemony acidity. It walks the line between a racy and rich feel.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2016 Landmark Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a dry table wine but so rich it could almost be served as dessert. It pull out all the stops, starting with a deep gold color and aromas like marzipan and poached pears to mouth-coating butterscotch, pineapple and honey flavors. Full body and a creamy, viscous texture help to create an extra long finish.

title: Saxon Brown 2015 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Golden apple and pear flavors shine brightly in this beautifully made white, with its golden oaky quality of integrated wood. Gritty and grippy, it has texture and weight in good measure and balance, with a stony mineral quality and lingering succulence of white peach.

title: Tamber Bey 2015 Merlot (Yountville)
description: Black olive tapenade dominates the flavor profile of this well-made 100% varietal wine, concentrated in black-licorice and black-cherry flavors. With a spicy thread of nutmeg throughout, it has tremendous grip. This is one worth setting aside; enjoy best from 2020–2025.

title: De Loach 2016 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: This coastal-influenced wine is rich in tones of vanilla and pear. It's thick, complex and full bodied, yet appropriately balanced, with a lingering note of savory nutmeg.

title: Hess Collection 2016 The Lioness Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This has balanced richness in spades, offering a full-bodied, soft embrace of caramel and crème brûlée flavors. Bold and beautiful, it will appeal to fans of a fleshy style.

title: Alpha Omega 2015 Drew Vineyard Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: A barrel-fermented white, this features an unexpectedly steely entry of bright integrated acidity that keeps it fresh and focused. It evolves to offer layers of texture and bold clear flavors of green apple and Meyer lemon.

title: Big Basin 2015 Odeon Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah
description: Soothing and elegant aromas of blackberry meet with cedar, dill and oregano on the nose of this blend of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon from Santa Cruz County and 48% Syrah (plus 1% Viognier) from Monterey County. Woody flavors are woven throughout the dense blackberry and peppery spice of the palate.

title: Sentivo 2013 Estate Syrah (El Dorado County)
description: This late-release wine is a powerful and delicious fruit and chocolate bomb. It starts with an inky dark color and spicy, approachable aromas before flooding the palate with dark chocolate and blackberry jam, with a side of black pepper. While full bodied and moderately tannic, there's no need to age it.

title: Benziger 2017 de Coelo Arbore Sacra Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light, bright, tart and savory, this is a complex expression from one section of the coastal vineyard, with firm, present tannins that grip on the back of the palate. The finish brightens and moderates in forest and black tea.

title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: This sparkling wine is a majority of Pinot Noir, with Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier. It is aromatic in strawberry and cream tones that follow through to the palate. Rose petal, wet stone and lemon peel provide complementary brightness.

title: Marietta Cellars 2016 Game Trail Cabernet Sauvignon (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This well-made and well-polished wine is bold in flavor and full bodied, but achieves good balance via fruit acidity and moderate tannins that buoy the ripe blackberry, plum and black-cherry flavors. Light oak spices add welcome complexity.

title: Inman Family 2016 OGV Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the producer's 10-acre estate, this is a tight-grained, firmly structured red with a core of cherry, strawberry, orange and rhubarb that's fresh and lively on the palate. Rose petal aromas accent the fruit and baking spice, leading to a seamlessly soft finish.

title: Kitá 2016 Spe'y Camp 4 Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Sandalwood and incense aromas meet with red fruit on the nose of this blend of 70% Grenache, 24% Carignane and 6% Syrah. Seared cherries and roasted strawberries rise to the fore of the palate, backed up by vibrant acidity and grippy tannins.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2018 Ancestrale Pet Nat Bassi Vineyard Sparkling Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Mike Sinor continues to hone his pétillant naturel talents, and this is his best bubbly bottling yet. The cloudy wine gives off sharp aromas of frozen pluot, lime blossom and grapefruit juice before delivering a similar palate of grapefruit rind and fresh citrus. It puckers the mouth, but pleasantly.
designation: Ancestrale Pet Nat Bassi Vineyard Sparkling

title: Bernardus 2017 Gary's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Fat black-cherry aromas meet with smoke and crushed slate on the nose of this bottling from a famed vineyard. There is a great sizzle of acidity to the sip, where well integrated flavors of mulberry, star anise and cracked pepper converge.

title: Seghesio 2018 Arneis (Russian River Valley)
description: A lovely representation of the Piedmontese grape and made 100% varietal, this is a crisp, refreshing and lively white which sparkles in acidity. Apricot and waxy lemon contribute muted fruity flavor, the grapes fermented in stainless steel and concrete egg.

title: Hall 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a substantially dense, hearty wine, rich and round in style, with structured tannins. Sweet oak envelopes packed layers of blueberry, mocha and vanilla, showing a hint of the mountain in cocoa powder and dust.

title: Walt 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a crisp, dry and delightful wine with ample body weight and complexity, enjoyably earthy and herbal. Layered flavors of peach and lemon give it a balanced, fruity core of personality that resonates with the variety.

title: Holly's Hill 2018 Estate Grenache Rosé (El Dorado)
description: One of the gutsiest rosés available, this full-bodied wine shows a deep copper color, vivid berry, black cherry and sour-cherry flavors and a tangy mouthwatering texture. It will hold its own against a wide variety of spicy and savory dishes.

title: Baldassari Family Wines 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a crisp, dry and easy to love wine, complex and restrained, with energetic elegance. Cherry, strawberry edginess gives in to earthy flint and stone that appeals on the long finish.

title: MacRostie 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from a block of the producer's Thale's Vineyard, a vineyard-designate, this wine has pretty color and savory earthiness. High toned, it delights in crisp layers of lemon peel, red cherry and tangerine offering elegant structure along the way.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2018 Reserve Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Fair Play)
description: Concentrated and rather full in body, this wine has ripe fig and complex mineral flavors that coat the palate and linger on the finish. Richness and depth are its hallmarks, and it's weighty enough to serve alongside big proteins.

title: Pali 2017 Huntington Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This wine combines grapes from the Riverbench Vineyard in Santa Maria Valley and the winery's estate property in the Sta. Rita Hills. Aromas of black raspberry, wild thyme and roasted fennel lead into a palate full of boysenberry, charred game and hints of marjoram and thyme.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Reserve Mohr-Fry Ranch Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Great balance and subtle complexity give this full-bodied wine an extra level of enjoyment. Vivid black cherry and blackberry mingle with light earth and oak nuances while moderate tannins and mild acidity support the texture. More than just a gulper, this wine has many attributes to savor.

title: Testarossa 2015 Mountain Select Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Hearty reds from the Santa Cruz Mountains are often rigid, but this is a hedonistic version, with ample black cherry, caramel, cracked pepper and herbs on the nose. It remains fresh and vibrant on the palate with candied cherry and vanilla flavors framed by bright acid and polished tannins.

title: Testarossa 2016 Tondredre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Roasted cherries and plums meet with a gamy kick of sage-stuffed pork roast and hickory on the nose of this bottling. There is a snappy pomegranate flash to the palate, where wild thyme and rusty earth flavors dust the cranberry core.

title: Kitá 2018 Taya Camp 4 Vineyard White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Broad pear and peach aromas are clean and fresh on the nose of this blend of 56% Marsanne, 40% Roussanne and 4% Grenache Blanc, which is also full of white-rock minerality. The palate is zesty with yellow apple and honeydew rinds, and the chalky mouthfeel extends deep into the finish.

title: Old Soul 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Marshmallow aromas and butter flavors give this wine a candied, confectionery character. It shows very obvious oak influences and has a soft, almost cloying texture.

title: Uptick Vineyards 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark in color, this wine offers a sharp taste of apple and lemon, remaining high toned within a generous ripeness. There's a metallic twinge to the finish.

title: Blazon 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Smoke and maple-syrup elements give a flamboyant edge to this rich-tasting oaky wine. It's candied in flavor and almost cloying in mouthfeel.

title: Bushong NV Sweet Illusions Red (California)
description: Aromas of sweet cigar wrapper, wet tobacco and prunes are very Port-like on the nose of this dessert wine. The palate is sweet in flavors of raisins and prunes, with more tobacco in the mix.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2018 M Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Temecula)
description: A very beautiful shade of pink, this bottling is a bit funky throughout, starting with aromas of caked earth and cold metal. The palate shows a decent tension, yet the flavors of dried fruit and damp herbs aren't typical for a rosé.

title: J. McClelland 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 11% Malbec and 3% Merlot this medium-bodied wine is bland in structure and slightly herbal in approach, with a baked element to the dark fruit.

title: Renwood 2016 Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied oaky wine shows strong aromas and flavors of oak sawdust and cedar over rather tart and tight blackberry notes.

title: Sand Point 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: So rich that it tastes sugary, this wine smells and tastes like lemon meringue pie. The texture is smooth and syrupy, the flavors are mostly sweet and the acidity is very soft.

title: Draxton 2018 Nelson Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is somewhat spritzy and thick, with a drying taste of lemon candy and strong vegetative essence. Pea shoot and gooseberry figure into the mix.

title: Vie Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: This full-bodied wine tastes a bit over-wrought. The aromas resemble balsamic and the flavors are beefy and peppery.

title: Lawer 2015 Betsy's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Knights Valley)
description: This wine is thick in impenetrable tannins and reduced oak, taking on a distinct earthiness that is hard to enjoy.

title: Ron Rubin 2017 Pam's Un-Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: A mostly neutral aroma is followed by generic, semisweet fruit flavors in this soft low-alcohol wine. It has little varietal character and tastes clean and syrupy.

title: Coast 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has a rather light-garnet color, mature herbal aromas and unusual spicy, floral, almost-sweet flavors.

title: Mabera 2017 Estate Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Veggie aromas and oily, doughy flavors make this wine a bit extreme but it does have a smooth texture and some nice baking-spice elements that develop on the palate.

title: Windy Trail 2016 Windy Trail Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is both steely and spritzy, with an earthy mushroom component that persists and detracts from the fruit. There's a metallic edge to the finish.

title: Lapis Luna 2015 Red (North Coast)
description: Aromas like turned earth and barnyard meet earthy, meaty flavors in this rustic wine. It has a lively, spritzy mouthfeel and full body.

title: Victor Vineyards 2017 Lawson Ranch Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Milky, earthy flavors put a funky spin on this medium-bodied soft-textured wine. Its aromas of chicken stock and turned earth are unusual for the varietal.

title: Beaucanon 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Made from organic grapes, this wine is ultimately bland and uneventful, with a slight taste of hazelnut.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2015 Herman Vineyard Sid's Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a green, herbaceous and distractingly earthy wine that doesn't taste good.

title: A&D Wines 2017 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: This unusually dark-colored and potent-smelling wine pumps out overripe pruney Port-style aromas and apparently sweet, jammy boysenberry flavors that are not at all typical for the varietal. Think of it as a dessert wine and it's acceptable.

title: Spann Vineyards 2015 Lake Family Tempranillo (Clarksburg)
description: This broad rich wine shows plenty of spicy mellow fruit and oak character and a melt-in-your-mouth texture. It spent an extra-long 34 months in older barrels and tastes like warm cherry pie with a touch of brown sugar, yet without the sweetness.

title: Square Peg 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a dry-farmed estate vineyard in Occidental, with ocean fog and winds affecting the fruit, this is a lovely, full-bodied and concentrated wine true to its origins and vintage. Big cherry fruit highlights substantial tannin and oak with an earthy mint element lingering on the finish.

title: Thomas Allen 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: This wine is not too full bodied, but is big in terms of zesty, vivid flavors of grapefruit, lemon peel and green apple. It has mouthwatering acidity and great palate-cleansing characteristics. Bring on the oysters or cold cracked crab.

title: Toad Hollow 2018 Eye of the Toad Dry Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This perennial favorite of a light, dry style at an unbelievably fair price overdelivers once again, showing a dry, acid-driven body of tart grapefruit, strawberry and candied cherry. Made entirely from the variety, it's one to enjoy all day long.
designation: Eye of the Toad Dry Rosé of

title: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (California)
description: Ripe fruit flavors and a generous helping of oak spices make this full-bodied wine flavorful and easy to sip. It brings cinnamon and red cherry to the nose, and black cherry, cranberry and baking spices to the palate.

title: B Cellars 2016 Calesa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Perfumed in rose and oak, this is a big bold version of the variety, balanced in structure and ripeness yet robust in baked strawberry, mint and coffee.

title: Bevela 2012 Matela Le Bon Climat Vineyard Teroldego (Santa Barbara County)
description: Deep and dense aromas of loamy soil, packed violets, black-currant jellies and a touch of prune show on the nose of this bottling of an obscure Italian grape. The palate is thick with stewed black-fruit flavors, framed by tense tannins, buoyant acidity, licorice spice and plenty of earthy grip.

title: Boeger 2017 Pinot Gris (El Dorado)
description: This medium-bodied wine wraps crisp apple and lemon flavors in a buttery texture that brings in vanilla and nutmeg on the palate and finish. It's a relatively lightweight wine with big flavors that leave a lingering impression.

title: Dunstan 2016 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fruity, smoky and full of earthy forest-floor notes and black tea, this is a full-bodied, concentrated and rich wine of great intensity and moderate acidity. Juicy on the midpalate, it reveals twisted, tangy flavors of rhubarb, strawberry and cardamom as it opens in the glass.

title: Écluse 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Dusty black cherry, baked earth and chaparral spices show on the nose of this bottling. There is decent tension to the palate, where black-cherry flavors compete for attention with dried thyme and savory sagebrush tones.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2016 Silver Spur Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Hearty in honey, peach and mango, this white is made in a fuller, more approachable style sure to please, with well-integrated oak and a succulent midpalate. It finishes with as much graceful richness as it starts, ending with a note of crème brûlée and ginger.

title: Kivelstadt Cellars 2018 The Family Secret Indian Springs Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is fermented and aged in barrel for six months, and it shows a moderate midpalate of structure of supportive oak. In taste, it's a tart tangy expression of green apple, lemon and grapefruit pith, the acidity up front and persistently fresh and forgiving.
designation: The Family Secret Indian Springs Ranch

title: Las Positas 2016 Estate Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: A light dusty toasty aroma leads to much deeper darker fruit aromas and flavors in this big robust tannic, yet polished wine. It has a full body, a firm, gripping mouthfeel and enough generous ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors to fill out the big frame.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dark aromas of boysenberry and black-plum skins are lifted by clove and oak spice on the nose of this bottling. It's a down-the-middle Pinot Noir on the palate, combining dark-red-fruit flavors with chai spice.

title: MacRostie 2017 Wohler Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This has a floral opening of apple blossom that delves into stone fruit and a touch of tropical flavor on the palate. Lemon, lime and apple mingle along a linear expression of full-bodied intensity that presents as voluptuously lush and fleshy.

title: Peloton 2016 Criterium Red (Paso Robles)
description: Rounded blackberry and black-currant aromas are lifted by wisteria and violet aromas on the nose of this blend of 50% Merlot, 38% Cabernet Sauvignon and 12% Petite Sirah. It's quite dry on the palate, offering more violet and lilac flavors along with Concord grape and a savory streak of dried herbs, kelp and wood.

title: Rodney Strong 2016 Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)
description: This is a relatively large production and a well-priced wine that shows creamy, lush layers of baked apple and pear. Voluptuous in style, it provides a backbone of balanced acidity.

title: Sculpterra 2014 Estate Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling, (whose beautiful butterfly-woman label features one of the winery's newer sculptures), offers black-currant, milk-chocolate and coffee-syrup aromas on the nose. It's rich, thick and pleasant on the palate with chalky tension that delivers flavors of caramelized black fruits.

title: Sketchbook 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Big in structure and chocolaty in flavor, this rich, full-bodied wine is impressive and smooth. While firm in tannins, it balances that grip with flavors of ripe black cherry, mint and dark chocolate in a seamless, delicious way.

title: Temecula Hills 2014 Estate Syrah (California)
description: A plump cooked-blackberry aroma meets with baking spice, smoke, hot asphalt and crushed rocks on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard located 2,900-feet above Temecula. Roasted fennel, blackberry paste and peppercorns show on the palate.

title: Testarossa 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Seared marshmallow and butterscotch aromas are cut by sea salt and sour orange peel on the nose of this bottling. There is a caramel tone to the palate but a strong line of lemon-juice acidity cuts through it all, finishing on white-peach flavors.

title: Villa Creek 2018 Grenache Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Very shy at first, this bottling opens up with lemon-blossom and light honeysuckle aromas on the nose. There's a sharp sizzle of acidity on the palate, which is tightly wound and refreshing, offering hints of white melon, light bubblegum and a touch of toast.

title: Chappellet 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine opens in thick, burly tannin, black fruit, dust and sage, showing its additions of 16% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot. Tar, smoky oak, grilled meat and coffee round out the experience, while a softness builds on the finish.

title: Giornata 2018 Barbera (Paso Robles)
description: There's a bursting amount of bright berries and red currants but also underlying clay and earth elements on the fascinating nose of this fresh bottling. The sip is electric, with zesty carbonic-like flavors of red berries. Drink up now while it's fresh.

title: Testarossa 2016 Fogstone Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Singed lemon and white-peach aromas are cut by a flinty minerality on the nose of this bottling. Bright, refreshing acidity frames the lemon-candy flavors of the palate, which are enhanced by a pinch of cinnamon.

title: Montagne Russe 2017 Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy rose petal and black tea make for an exotic, fleshy and lightly ripe experience in this vineyard-designate, which delivers plenty of freshness and complexity. Flavors of tangerine and wild strawberry are nuanced and bright.

title: Round Pond 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: A 100% varietal, estate wine given nearly two years in French oak, much of it new, this wine is powerful, sultry and smooth, with succulent red fruit and fig at its fore. Tobacco, forest and cedar give it a savory, complementary complexity that works well to make it a cohesive wine. This will benefit from time in the bottle; enjoy best 2021–2026.

title: Corison 2016 Helios Sunbasket Vineyard Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)
description: Herbal and brimming in violet aromas, this is a 100% varietal wine that shows old-world classicism, its tannins structured and behaved. Pencil shavings, red currant, cassis and smoky oak combine effortlessly along a high-toned palate of underlying freshness.

title: Eighty Four 2017 Gamay Noir (Carneros)
description: This is the inaugural release by Doug Shafer and Winemaker Elias Fernandez. Fruity with a lightness of spice and oak, it offers smooth, rounded tannins and fresh acidity, which underscore the pomegranate and strawberry flavors.

title: Fulcrum 2017 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: Fragrant in rose petal and orange peel, this wine is light on its feet and high in acidity, able to preserve a current of freshness throughout a balanced core of cherry and pomegranate. Black tea and forest complement the vibrant tones.

title: Camins 2 Dreams 2018 Spear Vineyards Grüner Veltliner (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tightly woven aromas of lime skin, chalk and honeydew rind show on the nose of this rare Grüner Veltliner from Santa Barbara County, made by married couple Tara Gomez and Mireia Taribó. There is tremendous tension to the sip, offering lime skin and intriguing white-pepper flavors.

title: Grimm's Bluff 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Rich but subtle aromas of red fruit are lifted by ample baking spice and a rocky minerality on the nose of this bottling. There is solid grip to the sip, where more lush purple and red-fruit flavors meet with touches of crushed graphite, roasted coffee bean and fine oak. Chalky tannins carry into the finish.

title: Longoria 2017 Cuvée Diana Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tightly wound and a touch reductive at first, this bottling opens up to reveal aromas of sea salt, mango and Meyer lemon rind on the nose. The tight palate also opens with patience into flavors of lime cream, ashy Brie rind and riper pome fruits.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2018 Paper Street Vineyard Clairette Blanche (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Creamy aromas of pear custard and papaya are cut by lime spray on the nose of this bottling of a rarely planted grape. There is great tension to the palate, whose grippy frame opens to reveal flavors of apple and pear flesh.

title: Testarossa 2016 Brosseau Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)
description: Meyer lemon and tangerine pith meet with a more reductive touch of Brie cheese rind and ash on the nose of this bottling. That ashy component carries to the sip as well, where pink lemonade flavors play against the yogurt-like components.

title: Zotovich 2017 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Subtle at first on the nose, this bottling shyly offers white lily and lime rind on the clean and fresh nose. The palate is also light and restrained, moving from chalky structure to richer white peach before a vibrant acidity cleans up the finish.

title: Thompson 31fifty Wine 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High toned and floral, this wine is also exotically earthy, a mix of stems and savory forest floor. Full bodied and powerfully concentrated, it shares strong, lasting flavors of dark cherry and cola that meet a finish of toasted oak.

title: Bernardus 2017 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This single-vineyard bottling is earthy on the nose with damp wood and forest-floor aromas, yet there is also a strong red-fruit component with hints of tarragon and dust. There's a pleasant mushroomy funk to the palate, where thicker fruit flavors provide the backdrop.

title: Fesstivity 2016 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sour orange, sourdough and a touch of tart apple show on the nose of this bottling from the Fess Parker family. The palate offers a persistent mousse as well as flavors of lemon rind and an earthy complexity.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 La Sereinite Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: High toned and well integrated, this is a peaceful, serene wine that lives up to its name. Barrel fermented and given 14 months in French oak, none of it new, it unwinds into layers of lemon pith, orange blossom and silty earth, suggesting crushed rock and stone.

title: Peltier 2018 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: Bright, tangy and well balanced, this low-alcohol, pale-pink wine is light bodied and refreshing, offering subtle strawberry and raspberry flavors.

title: Broadside 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of dark strawberry and red plum meet with mint and turned loam on the nose. Savory herbs provide a counterpoint to the rich flavors of pomegranate syrup and mulberry on the palate, with chalky tannins framing it all.

title: McManis 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: A pale pink color and intriguing strawberry-leaf aromas help this charming, low-alcohol wine stand out from the pack. It feels crisp, and tastes very clean and refreshing.

title: Pacific Redwood 2018 Organic Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a firm, tannic and flavorful wine, showing again that dense, red varietals tend to hold up better without added sulfites than others. Earthy, spicy, meaty aromas lead to ample black-cherry and cranberry flavors, while the tight tannins leave an astringent finish.

title: Parducci 2017 Small Lot Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Equally massive fruit and oak-barrel flavors compete for supremacy in this bold and firmly tannic wine. It shows ripe black-cherry and blackberry flavors that mingle with smoke, toast, cedar and vanilla notes.

title: Section Wines 2018 Il Bianco White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Lime pith, wet gravel and a hint of guava show on the nose of this blend of 75% Grenache Blanc and 25% Arneis, featuring a painting by renowned regional artist Wallace Piatt on the label. The sip grabs hold with fresh pink lemonade, grapefruit and lemongrass, proving to be an intriguing sour-sweet mix.

title: B.R. Cohn 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Thick and tannic in full-bodied concentration, this wine overdelivers on its price point, offering well-defined and richly rewarding flavors of dark cherry and cassis. Oak, clove and pencil shavings provide complex counterparts to the fruit.

title: Balletto 2017 Winery Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Quite savory in forest, bark and tea, this wine is softly layered with moderate structure and brooding flavors of orange and rhubarb. Light bodied, it shows balance and elegant style.

title: Cline 2016 Ancient Vines Carignane (Contra Costa County)
description: Bold aromas of chocolate and leather meet flavors of licorice and blackberry jam in this ultraripe and saturated wine. It has a Porty ripeness, very full body and rather firm tannins.

title: Derange 2016 Red (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Merlot, Syrah and Zinfandel, this is a gargantuan wine, expansive in its intensity of smoky oak and huge tannin power. Weighty black fruit, tobacco and meat accent a velvety lush texture of grip.

title: Double Black 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh boysenberry fruit aromas meet with a stony, earthy edge on the nose of this bottling. The wine lands with a slightly sweet mix of ripe and tart berries, with acidity that rises across the sip into an earthy finish.

title: Fleur 2017 Select Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Bright and brawny, this wine offers dense layers of tart red fruit surrounded by powerful tannin and a gritty texture of earthy minerality.

title: Folded Hills 2017 Estate White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Plumeria and honeysuckle meet with tropical notes of mango and ripe papaya on the nose of this estate bottling, one of the first crops from this promising new vineyard. The palate starts a bit tangy with exotic apple flavors and then shows more mango before the tart finish.

title: Gibbs 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Fleshy and rounded in a sweetness of peach and vanilla, this wine is appealing and ultimately bright in underlying acidity, finishing in flavors of green olive and honey.

title: McKinney 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Light aromas of Meyer lemon peel, crushed rocks and nectarine show on the nose of this Pinot Noir-based rosé. There is crispness to the palate, where light red-fruit flavors meet with a touch of earth.

title: OZV 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Jammy in flavor and soft in texture, this full-bodied wine seems to melt in the mouth. The strawberry and chocolate notes taste rich and ripe, with light tannins framing it all.

title: Pulchella 2016 City Slicker Red (Paso Robles)
description: Very rich and concentrated aromas of prune, raisin, gingerbread and fruitcake show on the nose of this blend of 72% Zinfandel and 28% Petite Sirah. The palate is more fresh and lively with black-plum-skin and blackberry flavors riding a long-simmering acidity.

title: Rabble 2018 Murmur Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Barbara County)
description: Broad, nearly sweet aromas of lime juice and canned pear show on the nose of this fresh bottling. Those elements also show as flavors on the palate, which is bright with acid and just tense enough.

title: Rose & Thistle 2018 Rose & Thistle Rosé (California)
description: Very crisp and refreshing, this light-bodied wine made mostly from Tempranillo and Mourvèdre grapes offers citrus aromas, subtle ruby-grapefruit flavors and a tangy mouthfeel.

title: Sbragia 2014 Neal Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a broad, brawny red wine with 4% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. Full bodied, ripe and rich in baked plum, cinnamon and vanilla, it finishes in leathery black pepper.

title: Curran 2018 Grenache Gris Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: Always one of the best rosés of the year (although really a separate grape that the government doesn't yet recognize), Kris Curran's latest vintage is a Goldilocks shade of pink and shows aromas of bubblegum, peach and crystallized watermelon. These epic aromas of summer lead into a palate that's taut, bright and loaded with acid-driven light red-fruit flavors.

title: En Garde 2015 Le Bijou du Roi Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This is a reserve-level wine, aged in 80% new French oak for 27 months. Intense on the nose in coconut and nutmeg, it offers robust chalky tannins and a strong powerful core of concentrated cassis, sage and cocoa powder. It should do well in the cellar for a time; enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Grey Stack 2016 Four Brothers Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a refreshingly cool-climate, delicately crafted wine with an enduring freshness of red cherry and tangy background citrus. The palate is integrated and cohesive, with elegance and long-lasting structure.

title: Petrified Forest Vineyards 2015 Totem Ridge Merlot (Knights Valley)
description: Brawny and brooding in black and red berry, this is a well-integrated, cohesive and harmonious wine, aged 18 months in French oak. The tannins are soft and supple and the acidity high toned, allowing room for herbal elements to shine within the fruit.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2016 Riserva Collection Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This enticing wine has a spicy sexy swirl of oak in the aroma and broad saturated fruit and dark-chocolate flavors that flood the palate with ripeness and linger on the finish. It's very full bodied but stays smooth in texture.

title: Sanford 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Mellow aromas of Asian pear, butter-fried apple and a bit of canned pear show on the nose of this appellation blend. The compelling aspect is the grippy palate, which is taut in a chalky tension that presents flavors of sea salt, Pink Lady apple and red pear.

title: Solminer 2016 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: From a vineyard that's west of the Sta. Rita Hills, Bing cherry aromas are quickly consumed by the herbal side of this wine, from green peppercorns to forest floor. The palate falls in line, laying down a base of raspberry, cranberry and orange rind but focusing more on the energetic eucalyptus and pine-needle flavors.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from the producer's Chiles Valley estate, organically farmed, and blended with 25% Merlot. A bright, perfumed nose of rose and sage leads to a soft, cohesive and well-integrated midpalate of dark cherry, raspberry and hints of vanilla and herb. It shows great length and breadth.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Especial Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: While it was aged in 60% new oak barrels, it's the pure and concentrated black-cherry flavors that give this full-bodied wine a practically irresistible allure from the first aromatic whiff to the fruit-soaked palate impression. Firmly tannic, it's not too stiff and will make a great pairing with any number of meaty, cheesy dishes.

title: Cellars 33 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tightly compressed with fresh, focused flavor, this wine opens in floral aromas of rose and lavender, sourced from a two vineyards within the appellation, including Hummingbird Hill, a single-vineyard designate for the producer. Light delicately woven citrus notes are boosted by well-preserved acidity that lends a spicy element to the finish.

title: Daou 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: The first vintage of Sauvignon Blanc from this producer is a complex and lively white wine to balance their rich red portfolio. Aromas of jalapeño, green herbs and wet cement meet with nectarine on the nose, while the zesty palate combines bell pepper, lime peel, peach and tropical fruit.

title: Diora 2016 Three Crowns Estate Grown Red (San Bernabe)
description: This red blend is boisterous on the nose in aromas of boysenberry, peppercorn, licorice, cola and caramel. The palate is framed by chalky tannins and supportive acidity, showing flavors of cocoa and rich blackberry jam.

title: Gainey 2017 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rounded, soft and pretty aromas of strawberry and pomegranate meet with pleasing touches of mace, star anise and hibiscus on the nose of this bottling, which always offers good bang for the buck. The palate is rounded with pomegranate juice, peppercorn, thyme and coriander flavors, pairing spice with soft red fruits.

title: Ghost Block 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Blended with 3% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot, this opens on a perfumed nose of sage, lavender and rose petal. Persistent tones of clove and baking spice complement the brooding blackberry and sanguine notes.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2008 Carneros Cuvée Late Disgorged Brut Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Disgorged in November 2018, this shows the beauty of time in the bottle—a well-developed core of flavor and texture that's evolved and complex. Supple richness and softness last and linger on the palate, with pronounced elements of apple, peach, cherry and wet stone.

title: Goldeneye 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is full bodied, dark and brooding—in a good way. It has concentrated flavors of black fruit and ripe red berry as well as attractive oak accents of cinnamon and clove. Fine-grained tannins lend ample support and structure.

title: Jayson 2017 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Thick red fruit becomes approachable on the palate in this stylish, focused and full-bodied wine from the coast. Big powerful waves of tannin and pomegranate, cherry and cola are met by nuanced aspects of spice and earth, the finish explosive.

title: Joseph Phelps 2017 Pastorale Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Estate-grown, Pastorale is brimming in apple, white flower and toasted oak, with a tease of richness in the form of crème brûlée. Stony mineral persists beneath the surface, boosting a strong, complex structure of fresh, nuanced acidity that finishes in a lingering taste of lemon rind.

title: Kessler-Haak 2016 Brut Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A lighter shade of pink in the glass, this is a lovely sparkling wine with aromas of grapefruit, light plum and toasty yeast, making for a mellow but intriguing nose. The palate's pink-lemonade and lemongrass flavors ride a soft mousse, providing a very pleasant and easygoing experience.

title: Meeker 2016 Hoskins Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal and aged in fairly neutral oak, a fruit-forward expression of the grape that opens in a fantastic nose of white pepper, violet and lavender. Full bodied and fleshy, it is well integrated and robustly complex.

title: Novy 2016 G-S-M (Central Coast)
description: Adam Lee's recent fascination with Châteauneuf-du-Pape translates to this bottling, which offers aromas of black plum, black currant, clove, cinnamon and star anise. It's rich and ripe on the plush palate with wild strawberry, more baking spice and firm tannins holding it altogether.

title: Peake Ranch 2016 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Generous aromas of oak and pecan meet with seared lemon peel, caramelized white peach and sea salt on the lavish and delicious nose of this bottling. The palate is oaky and toasty yet made dynamic by ripe lemon, pan-seared apple and clove-dust flavors, all cut by strong acidity.

title: Pey-Marin 2016 The Shell Mound Riesling (Marin County)
description: This is an aromatic, delicate wine that's light in body but has a distinctive and complex personality reminiscent of German Rieslings. Piney, petrol, resin aromas waft up from the glass, then white peach, green pear and subtle apple flavors warm the palate.

title: San Simeon 2015 Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Broad aromas of blackberry and soy sauce meet with lilacs and violets on the nose of this bottling. The smooth palate offers flavors of black currant and purple flowers that evolve into white pepper, all cleaned up by refreshing acidity.

title: Thacher 2015 Controlled Chaos Red (Paso Robles)
description: Snappy black raspberry and rich cherry-syrup aromas are lifted by an herbal array of thyme and sagebrush on the nose of this blend of 37% Mourvèdre, 25% Zinfandel, 19% Grenache and 19% Counoise. Red-plum and red-cherry flavors are enhanced by oregano and peppercorns on the easy-to-drink palate.

title: Timbre 2015 Opening Act Mission Ranch Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Swollen red cherries, thyme, dried mint and tangy pomegranate arise on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard that's across the street from the Santa Lucia Highlands. The palate is complex with flavors of red cherry compote, mulberry, sagebrush and mint-chocolate cookies.

title: Amici 2015 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Black and inky, with a touch of reduction, soy and tobacco leaf on the entry, this effuses earthy intensity and soft lushness, combining both within one bottle. Touches of cherry and vanilla nip at the midpalate cradled in toasted oak and firm tannin structure.

title: Carpe Diem 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: Vivid oaky, earthy aromas lead to ripe firm flavors of apple and citrus in this assertive and well-structured wine. The char and wood-smoke nuances carry over to the palate, along with a nice nip of tannin and firm acidity that help to offset the richness.

title: Dracaena 2016 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling shows a lot of oak influence, but it works well, starting with aromas of toasty vanilla, pecan and caramelized red fruits. The palate is lively with black raspberry as well as dried thyme and cracked pepper, leading into a tightly wound finish.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2015 Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Dry in layered flavors of green apple, melon and tart lemon, this is a well-made and impressively structured sparkling wine, the mousse thick and lush on the palate. Ginger and brioche flavors highlight the finish.

title: In Hand 2016 Red (El Dorado)
description: This well-balanced wine blends disparate, precise flavors for a harmonious and complex end product. Black-cherry, plum and rhubarb aromas lead to ripe and generous flavors while a lightly tannic texture gives good support. This wine from The Withers Winery was fermented with 30% whole clusters, and the blend was 69% Mourvèdre along with 31% Syrah.

title: La Crema 2016 Fog Veil Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy and grippy character define this full-bodied wine, a full explosion of big flavor at its core. Cola, cherry and black currant complement in waves of sweet and savory flavor, with a lasting taste of forest floor and tea.

title: La Voix 2015 So What Rancho San Ysidro Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Tart black-plum aromas are cut by cinnamon stick and mace on the nose of this bottling from a Syrah-focused appellation. There is zip to the sip, where green and Sichuan peppercorn flavors meet with tangy black-plum skins and a hint of lilac.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Kessler Haak Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sandalwood, struck match, poached pear and smoked apple show on the savory nose of this bottling. There is a smoky quality to the sip as well, with flavors of roasted chicken in lemon sauce, nectarine and poached citrus leading into a caramel-laced finish.

title: Meikle 2016 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine is dry, well-balanced and supported by firm tannins that make it ready to pair with hefty protein. The blackberry and pomegranate flavors run deep, persisting and growing on the palate and lingering on the finish. The grapes grew at an elevation of 3,000-feet, which helps to explain the wine's concentration.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate La Bohème Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This beautiful and focused blend is fruity and well concentrated, showing snappy cranberry aromas, vivid red-cherry and black-cherry flavors and a smooth, slightly crisp texture. It shows little obvious oak but plenty of flavor and charm.

title: Peake Ranch 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rich aromas of brioche and sweet butter are cut by chalky lemon pith and candied citrus rind on the nose of this blend of fruit from John Sebastiano and Sierra Madre vineyards. The chalky mouthfeel presents flavors of grapefruit, toasted croissant and a drawn-butter element toward the finish.

title: Pelletiere 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Robust aromas of blackberry jam, licorice, coffee syrup, tarragon and wet rocks make for a very complex entry to this bottling. The palate is full flavored, with black cherry and strong dark spices, proving very rich and ripe.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2016 Zinfandel (Santa Clara County)
description: Winemaker John Benedetti opts for a new grape in this bottling, and delivers with style, using 20% new American oak. The nose offers aromas of black and red cherry, tobacco, wood spice and campfire, while the palate packs in dried herbs, red-plum and dark strawberry flavors.

title: Starfield 2016 Marsanne (El Dorado)
description: Ripe and fruity, this full-bodied wine brims with melon and tangerine aromas and almost-sweet peach and melon flavors. It wraps them in a soothing, rich texture that encourages a long finish.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Clean aromas of Asian pear rind, lime and chalk make for a very tightly woven nose on this bottling. Apple and pear-juice flavors dominate the broad palate.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2017 Hoot Owl Creek Vineyard Viognier (Alexander Valley)
description: Aged 10 months in neutral American oak, this wine has a thick gritty texture and a sweetness of peach, green apple and honey. The structure and acidity are moderate; the ripeness full bodied and intense.

title: Quivira 2017 Fig Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a meaty white, layered in dried herb and white peach. The texture is youthful and still evolving.

title: Sean Minor 2017 4B Pinot Noir (California)
description: A touch of seeming-sweetness from generous oak treatment spices up the aromas and flavors of this ripe and generous-tasting wine. It has lots of plums and cherries in addition to a mapley baking-spice component.

title: Waypoint 2014 Oakville Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This is a reduced, tight and robustly ripe wine, grippy in structure and a lasting taste of black pepper and gunpowder. Black-licorice, black-cherry and blackberry flavors round out the experience.

title: Wrath 2016 Fermata Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Strong aromas of Anjou pear, honeysuckle and almond make for an aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling, which halts malolactic fermentation halfway through to preserve freshness. The palate is indeed fresh, with flavors of apple and white flowers.

title: Etude 2016 Grace Benoist Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is estate-grown wine, crisp and sharply tense in acidity, the flavors marked by a distinction of green apple, pear and pineapple. The oak is measured and unobtrusive.

title: J. McClelland 2015 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: This full-bodied white has an intensity of oak and baked fruit, which is a combination of apple and pear. Aromas of nutmeg accentuate the richness and warmth of the overall experience.

title: Mumm Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa County)
description: Sweet notions of peach and nectarine mark this fleshy, creamy rich and round sparkler, textured with an undeniable lushness. Both Chardonnay and Pinot Noir go into the blend.

title: Peter Paul Wines 2016 Gravenstein Highway Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tart, tangy acidity is persistent through this wine's full-bodied character of robust dark-red fruit, black tea and dried herb. It offers richness and ripeness.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2017 Sylvaner (Santa Barbara County)
description: White peach, banana, lemon wedge and tropical fruits show on the nose of this bottling of a grape rarely seen in California. There is a flash of sweetness at the tip of the sip, followed by tingly acidity and pome-fruit flavors.

title: Riaza 2015 Unorthodox Syrah (Mokelumne River)
description: This bold and full-bodied wine has ripe jammy Port-like aromas, plump blackberry flavors and a rich, almost-sweet, palate impression. It's certainly mouth coating and tooth staining.

title: Rodney Strong 2014 Symmetry Meritage (Alexander Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend includes smaller amounts of Malbec, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, in that order. Together, they offer a robust, oaky and soft expression of mild blue and black fruit, dusted in toasted oak and tobacco.

title: Rutherford Ranch 2016 Reserve Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: Spicy clove and black pepper adorn a burly build of subdued black fruit in this reserve-level wine. The finish is soft and moderate.

title: Sculpterra 2015 Statuesque Red (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed rocks, black currant, caramel and toasty oak make for a bright, minerally entry to this blend of 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 38% Syrah and 24% Petite Sirah. Sour black-plum flavors meet with lilac on the palate.

title: Urgency 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has a good range of fruit, spice and wood flavors along with appealing balance and a smooth, lightly tannic texture. Hints of cedar, black cherry and raspberry light up the palate.

title: Wolff 2015 Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: Very shy aromas of black raspberry show on the nose of this bottling. Tart black-plum and elderberry flavors meet with dried herbs on the palate, but the overall expression is very mellow and reserved.

title: Wrath 2016 Tondré Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Bay leaf, tarragon, black-plum sauce and Asian spices show on the sharp nose of this bottling. There's a rich streak of boysenberry to the palate as well as juniper and pine needle touches. Still needs time to evolve.

title: Y Rousseau 2016 Son of a Butcher Red (California)
description: It's easy to like this generous, fruity and plush-textured wine based on French grape varieties, led by 45% Tannat and followed by Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Raspberry and blackberry aromas and flavors are lightly shaded by spicy oak notes and there is a moderate dose of tannin to balance the jammy fruit character.

title: Ballard Lane 2017 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Broad aromas of fruit punch, pomegranate, sumac, mace and rust show on the nose of this fairly priced bottling from the Miller family of Bien Nacido Vineyard. It's bright, snappy and tangy with red-plum skin, strawberry and raspberry flavors on the palate, plus herbs and pepper spice.

title: Rutherford Ranch 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is sweetly confectionery and fuzzy in texture, with a dullness that begins to feel harsh on the palate.

title: Willowbrook 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Minty eucalyptus provides a one-dimensional experience in this thin, simple white. It is a straightforward wine that should be enjoyed soon.

title: Blue Fox Cellars 2013 Old Vine Bartolomei Brothers Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This mature-tasting, high-alcohol wine has a relatively light color with a brownish rim, aromas that are earthy and dusty, and woody earthy flavors without much fruit coming through.

title: Beaucanon 2013 Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: Mushroomy earth and notes of coffee are marred by a distinction of leather that veers into a hot take of undue barnyard in this confusing wine.

title: Scotto Family Cellars NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: This wine has a straw color and straw-like aromas, followed by herbal flavors like dried grass and scallions. It is dry, medium bodied and has a sharp edge to the texture.

title: 5th and Bowie 2016 Bourbon Barrel Aged Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The Bourbon-barrel-aged red wine trend is not good. This wine starts with overcooked blackberries, strong clove and burnt caramel on the nose. That caramel and butterscotch kick, thanks to the Bourbon, dominates the palate.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Starscape Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens in a burst of anise and fennel but becomes extreme in its austerity and embrace of sharp acidity.

title: Crown Point 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This winery is focused on setting a new benchmark for what Cabernet Sauvignon from Santa Barbara can be, and this bottling is its best yet. Beautifully layered aromas of black cherry, baking spice, star anise and crushed slate lead into a roasted palate of black plum and chai spices, with acid that carries into the finish.

title: Patrimony 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: The Daou brothers are intent on making this brand the most expensive and luxurious in Paso Robles. This vintage begins with intense aromas of roasted blackberry, tangy black-plum skin and crushed peppercorn. The palate is expertly layered in flavors of cassis, caramel, gravel, loam, cocoa and a hint of licorice. The tannins are firm but already approachable.

title: Crown Point 2015 Estate Selection Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Dark and thick in appearance, this estate blend from winemaker Adam Henkel and proprietor Roger Bower shows a tremendous cassis aroma, with splashes of smoke, dried purple flowers and baking spice. The palate begins with a lavish entry of polished tannins that still have some teeth, providing tension that carries the dark fruit flavors deep into the finish.

title: Joseph Phelps 2015 Insignia Estate Grown Red (Napa Valley)
description: This vintage of the perennial knockout is exceptional—a concentrated blend of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Petit Verdot, 2% Cabernet Franc and 1% Malbec. Pencil shavings, red currant and red plum are complemented by hints of crushed rock and cocoa, with persistent acidity maintaining balance. Like so many of its forebears, this is a wine well worth cellaring; enjoy 2025–2035.

title: Spottswoode 2015 Family Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Fresh on the palate and floral on the nose in a bouquet of rose, lavender and crushed herb, this perennially beautiful, delicate wine benefits from the addition of 7% Cabernet Franc and 3% Petit Verdot, also from the organically farmed estate. Pencil shavings, coffee and a touch of tobacco add to its savory, earthy nature, contributing to its overall structure and elegance. Enjoy best from 2025 through 2030 if you're able to wait.

title: Bien Nacido Estate 2015 LXXIII Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Intense cranberry aromas meet with smoked pork roast, crushed slate and pinches of sage, thyme and white pepper on the nose of this luxury-level bottling. The palate is florally flush in touches of rose and tarragon, set against snappy red-plum fruit and racy acidity.

title: Lail 2016 Blueprint Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a stunningly beautiful wine that is ageworthy, complex and will stay with you long after it's gone. Tones of cedar, clove and cinnamon start it off, followed by a dusting of cocoa powder and toasted oak. Lingering threads of crushed rock, violet and currant carry the finish. It finishes soft and silky.

title: Bien Nacido Estate 2015 The Captain Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Part of the historic winery's new reserve line, this intense wine delivers a roasted pork aroma against black cherry, dried rose petals and charred wood. There is a compelling sharpness of cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry flavors on the palate, with hints of green peppercorn, moss and tea leaves.

title: Center of Effort 2015 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Dark raspberry, packed lilacs, crushed lavender and a hint of game make for a powerful yet elegant nose. The palate is framed by strong, silty and grippy tannins, with zippy acidity that delivers flavors of black raspberry, pepper spice and roasted boar.

title: Daou 2015 Mayote Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Always one of the most immediately delicious and powerful wines in the Daou brothers' portfolio, this blend of 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Syrah and 16% Petit Verdot shows intense black fruit, roasted coffee and charred meat on the nose. It's luxuriously soft yet firmly framed by polished tannins on the palate, where black plum, espresso and caramel flavors dominate.

title: Daou 2015 Soul of a Lion Red (Adelaida District)
description: Intense aromas of smoke, black currant and crushed purple flowers make for an impressive entry to this blend of 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Cabernet Franc and 11% Petit Verdot. The palate combines the tang of plum skin and dimpled berries with flavors of peppercorn, violet and gravelly minerality.

title: Corison 2015 Kronos Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is among winemaker Cathy Corison's finest offerings, made from decades-old vines planted on St. George rootstock. Cassis, red currant and floral elements make for an inviting entry of aromatics that is followed by substantial structure and classic herbal undertones. A pillowy body of balanced elegance is met by an earthy, leathery finish of complex beauty.

title: Sanford 2014 Founders' Vines Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This single-block expression is extremely earthy on the nose with aromas of loamy soil, wet gravel, sumac, cinnamon and wild berries. It's light in the glass, with rounded flavors of raspberry, cherry and underripe strawberry as well as a clay-like minerality. A chalky mouthfeel leads into a clean and taut finish.

title: Wild Coyote 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Concentrated and thick aromas of black currant are very tangy and cut by damp woody cedar tones. The palate is very tangy and thick with grape seed, blackberry and oaky vanilla flavors.

title: Pezzi King 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is earthy and quite green, with a dullness to the fruit and an unclean barrel imprint.

title: Realm Cellars 2016 Falstaff Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is the producer's Cabernet Franc-based blend (64%), the remainder Cabernet Sauvignon. The Franc comes from the heart of the valley's sweet Oakville-based spot for the variety, near Rudd and Dalla Valle. It's tense, focused and brawny in black fruit, violet, tobacco and sweet oak, is laced in peppercorn, cedar and dried herb, an has an Old world sensibility riding over its complexity and structure.

title: Realm Cellars 2016 Moonracer Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is the producer's signature estate wine from Stags Leap District fruit, blending Cabernet Sauvignon with Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. From volcanic soils, it shows an earthy sensibility that's tough to shake, a lingering thread of black cherry and berry that's met halfway by sweet tobacco, crème brûlée richness and a soft undercurrent of tamed tannins.

title: Realm Cellars 2016 Houyi Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon is deeply red-fruited in rich flavors of currant and cherry that are complemented by accents of pencil shavings, dried herb and turned earth. The wine evolves constantly in the glass, and is confounding in its grippy, wide tannins and firm structure. Enjoy 2026–2036.

title: Realm Cellars 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From this historic Coombsville site comes this earthy, graphite-ridden red, which is herbal within a core of baked red fruit dripping in grippy structure. It has a breadth of expansive full-bodied richness that holds its fruit in check within an herbal, Old World embrace of tight-grained tannin and expansive power. Enjoy this concentrated wine best from 2026 through 2036.

title: Joseph Phelps 2017 Freestone Vineyards Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This expressive wine impresses in its expanse of savory tension and complexity, with accents of clove and cardamom. It is lightly styled on the palate and shows good integration of oak and polished tannins, filled out by the berry fruit core that offers length and breadth.

title: Realm Cellars 2016 The Tempest Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is the producer's Merlot-based blend, sourced from Calistoga, Oak Knoll and Stags Leap District. The minority is made up of Cabernet Sauvignon from a stellar source in Oakville. It buzzes in soft layers of creamy texture and beautiful red fruit—a mix of plum, apple skin, maple and exotic Asian spice. The tannins are expansive yet tamed, easily enjoyed in the moment or over time.

title: Realm Cellars 2016 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Red (Napa Valley)
description: This has concentrated richness and a mix of baked plum, mocha and thick cherry compote. From the famous site, it twitches in minerality, from crushed rock to tree bark and cedar. The full-bodied intensity is met by a balance of racy acidity that sizzles around accents of black pepper and leather.

title: Vineyard 7&8 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Made by consulting winemaker Martha McClellan, this is a dark, brooding mountain wine, brawny in leather, baked cherry and raspberry. Secondary components of meat and oak are embraced in soft expansive tannins that contribute lush creamy texture and cohesion. It has an enduring element of spicy savory pepper, baking spice and tobacco that endure on the palate. Enjoy 2025–2035.

title: Inglenook 2015 Rubicon Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: From the esteemed producer's gorgeous estate, including 3% Merlot, this is impressive and structured—a leathery, viscous and concentrated expression of a great site in an intense vintage. Gunpowder, oak and black-cherry compote form around brightly captured acidity and a lasting fistful of baking spice that lingers and softens the finish.

title: Realm Cellars 2016 Beckstoffer To Kalon Red (Napa Valley)
description: From the famous site, this is a warm, concentrated, impressive wine brimming in tension and fresh acidity. Caramel, baked cherry, cedar and tight-grained tannins are just the beginning of a complex, layered and complicated journey of intense balance and savory character.

title: Seghesio 2016 Todd Brothers Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: An incredibly impressive wine, this beguiles in baking spice and white pepper from the get-go, following the heady aromas with soft floral layers of rich red fruit, leather and integrated oak. Aged in both French and American oak, it's a complex, structured and seductive package of beauty and power.

title: Pali 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is an attention-grabbing bottling from the eastern side of the appellation, starting with aromas of black cherry, boysenberry, vanilla and baking spice. The palate snaps with black-raspberry flavors, ranging from bright to dark and lifted with elements of mint, tarragon and baking spice.

title: Yao Family Wines 2015 Yao Ming Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 3% Petit Verdot, this dark-garnet wine bursts with aromas of herb, clove, tobacco and cedar. Aged entirely in new French oak for two years, it shows a decadent, sumptuous texture built by soft, integrated tannins around a core of dark chocolate and cassis.

title: Seghesio 2016 Pagani Heritage Grower Series Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: From a historic site comes this well-made wine, which includes 22% Alicante Bouschet in the mix. Barrel-aged for 16 months in French and American oak, it is lively, vibrant and fresh in acidity. Flavors of rich red fruit, tobacco, clove, rose and pepper are lush and lingering.

title: Crux 2016 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: The majority of the grapes for this lovely wine come from the producer's Crazy Run Ranch estate as well as the respected Ponzo Vineyard that was first planted in the 1950s. Beautifully perfumed, it dazzles in tones of white pepper and lavender, with a rich dark-cherry flavor. The tannins and oak are well integrated and offer ample framing for the lush fruit.

title: Stolpman 2017 Angeli Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Very dark in the glass, this top-level bottling from Stolpman shows dark currant, cinnamon, mint, cocoa and tarragon on the fresh and beautiful nose. The intense boysenberry and lilac flavors of the palate are delicious, framed by polished tannins and lifted by minty herbs.

title: Mayacamas 2017 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: Winemakers Braiden Albrecht and Andy Erickson crafted magic out of a difficult vintage, picking the grapes for this beautiful white well before the October 2017 fires. It's gorgeously racy and light, bright and effusive, offering fleshy flavors of peach and lemon. Licorice and fennel finish out the expressive wine, which persists in wet stone.

title: Parallel 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers a lovely use of oak, which contributes to its salty, stony mineral profile that pleases from the start. Lemon, apple and ginger notes combine around nice, lifted acidity and a textured, layered and complex midpalate that lasts on the finish, balanced in weight and breadth.

title: Site 2016 Larner Vineyard Red (Ballard Canyon)
description: Intensely dark and rich in the glass, this blend starts with aromas of bacon fat, brown sugar, maple, cassis and dark earth. The palate is plush, enveloping the mouth with impressive weight, and delivering flavors of black plum, coffee and toffee.

title: Lula 2017 Founder's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Classic and concentrated, this full-bodied and well-balanced wine offers inspired fruit flavors, subtle oak spices, nice depth and length. It's ripe but not overripe, rich in black-cherry, raspberry and pine-forest notes that flood the palate and linger on the finish. Best through 2027.

title: Lula 2017 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: This concentrated and tangy wine shows the nervy side of Pinot Noir with absolutely delicious red- and black-cherry flavors backed by good acidity. It's moderately tannic, well structured and reveals more nuances with each sip. Best through 2027.

title: Jayson 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
