description: A thick oak-influenced white wine. with weight and breadth across the palate, this is undeniably delicious and in full possession of its richness and concentration. The layered flavors of stone fruit, pear and nutmeg are lifted by focused acidity that cannot be denied.

title: Lumen 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of wild raspberry, crushed slate, clay and hibiscus make for a deep and wondrous nose in this countywide blend by Lane Tanner. The palate is earthy and alive in flavors of raspberry, gravel and wool, proving bright, fresh, complex and delicious.

title: Piedrasassi 2017 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dense aromas of boysenberry, cherry-wood smoke, peppercorn and pine needle converge on the dynamic nose of this blend of two vineyards. Sticky tannins frame a wildly flavored sip that gathers yakitori lamb, rosemary flowers, blackberry and eucalyptus tea into one unique package.

title: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: With a spicy, vibrant entry of clove and cinnamon, this wine expands into a melded texture and bold flavors of cassis, currant and a bite of watermelon hard candy. Well made, integrated and firm in tannin and oak, it impresses from start to lengthy, spicy finish.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Syrah (Red Hills)
description: This gutsy smoky peppery wine grown in rocky volcanic soil truly captures the uniqueness of Syrah, with its mix of earthy gamy savory nuances backed by just-ripe blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors. Full body, a firm texture, fine-grained tannins and a lingering finish all bode well for further aging. Best through 2023.

title: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 6% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Malbec, this vintage is superb and exuberant in flavors of chocolate-covered plum, baking spice and dried herb. Structured, robust and mineral-driven, it is powerful yet balanced. Enjoy 2026–2036.

title: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tremendous deal for the quality: a highly aromatic, structured wine, with a juicy backbone of black currant and dusty texture. Crushed rock and firm tannin provide a mineral-suggestive midpalate of tone and tension, with balanced acidity and brightness throughout.

title: Chanin 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Strong aromas of earth and herb kick off the nose of this bottling, but there are also richer red-fruit elements of red cherry, blistered red plums, exotic carnations and sandalwood. Earthy spices dominate the sip, where red-plum-skin flavors are pushed back in favor of gray sagebrush.

title: Kenzo Estate 2016 Murasaki Estate Bottled Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This powerful blend is dominated by Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, with smaller amounts of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. The firm yet graceful palate displays accents of forest floor, mushroom, clove and sage that ride on a dense core of dried herb and dark cherry. Enjoy 2026–2032.

title: Mauritson 2016 Loam Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is sourced from gravelly loam, a soil type the producer believes to be capable of achieving greatness in Cabernet Sauvignon. It is powerfully built in concentrated layers of sage, crushed rock, cedar and black fruit. The oak is integrated, leaving a trace of vanilla.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Soft, rounded red fruit marks the juicy midpalate of this beautifully made wine that is appealing in its robust weight and power. With tamed tannins, it offers a mix of black cherry, dried herb, graphite and crushed rock around a length of supportive oak.

title: Stringer 2016 Alder Springs Vineyard Syrah (Mendocino County)
description: This full-bodied wine goes all out for concentration, ripeness and bold fruit impact. From the deep dark color to the blackberry-jam, dark-chocolate and wood-char flavors the wine is assertive and powerful. Best after 2022.

title: Denner 2017 Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Extremely aromatic in the glass, this bottling offers enticing aromas of fennel pollen, licorice spice, plum and ripe fig. The palate is rich in flavors of black plum, fennel bulb and more black licorice framed by sticky tannins.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Gorgeous in aroma and satisfying in flavor, this full-bodied wine shows great fruit concentration. Layers of dark berries and spice fill out the firm structure and give it depth.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This bold, oaky wine is full bodied, very flavorful and nicely rich in texture. Aromas of toasted and buttered baguette lead to ripe pear accented by caramel and vanilla.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This brawny wine carries floral and oak imprints on the nose that carry through to the full-bodied palate. Red fruit, citrus and grippy, full tannins accent the powerful weight that could benefit from time in the cellar. Enjoy 2027–2037.

title: Talisman 2015 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Intriguing dried herb and baked earth aromas give way to savory stony flavors and dried plum, black tea and tart cherry in this full-bodied wine. It shows how different the Yorkville terroir is from nearby Anderson Valley.

title: McNab Ridge 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This stylish, attractively oaky wine tastes warm, spicy and firm in texture. It dresses up ripe cherry flavors with baking spices and fresh cedar accents, for a thoroughly showy and delicious personality.

title: Ottimino Vineyards 2015 Ottimino Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick, rich and leathery, this hails from a dry-farmed historic site in the heart of Pinot Noir country, showing its rightful place within a cool climate. Dust and crushed rock give it a mineral-driven edge around black currant and cocoa powder, a fistful of black and white pepper lingering along.

title: Peake Ranch 2016 Bellis Noir Syrah-Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of strawberry jam, rose petals and toasted coconut show on the nose of this blend of 50% Syrah and 50% Grenache from proprietor John Wagner. Rich plum-jam, nutmeg and vanilla-paste flavors arise on the palate.

title: Pelletiere 2015 Riserva Sangiovese (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Deep black-plum, baking-spice, licorice, black-pepper and wet loamy earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is ample acidic zip to the sip and lots of earthy, wet soil-like grip, with a tight structure revealing black-plum and licorice flavors. Drink now through 2025.

title: Pelletiere 2016 Montepulciano (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Thick on the nose, this impressive bottling starts with aromas of robust cherry, freshly cut pine wood and wild chaparral herbs. It's quite lavish on the palate, with soft, creamy tannins presenting flavors of Morello cherry and fennel bulb.

title: Windrun 2016 Vintage Selection No. 14 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Baked boysenberry, sandalwood and vanilla show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is dry and tight, with a firm structure and strong acidity, carrying flavors of red fruit and cedar.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine is a good choice in the savory style. Vivid cut-grass and shallot aromas lead to a lively palate impression and citrus flavors tinged with mineral. It has great acidity, is not overripe and nicely shows the character of the grape variety.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Showing good character and substance, this medium-bodied wine stands out from the pack of bland Pinot Grigios thanks to its light, earthy aroma. The palate brings full-fledged flavors of white cherry and peach, with hints of flowers that add interest. The texture is firm enough, but also rich and mouthfilling.

title: Muscardini 2015 Pauli Ranch Sangiovese (Redwood Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine offers ripe fruit flavors that soften the varietal's usual nervy texture. Aromas of black plums and dried cherries lead to a rich and extracted flavor that incorporates abundant cherries, berries and hints of sandalwood and new leather.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Candlestick Blend Syrah-Grenache (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose at first and hugely tannic, this wine settles into robust, fruity and bright layers of blueberry and dark cherry, with secondary characteristics of leather, chocolate and cinnamon that season the fruit well.

title: Red Car 2015 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This is robustly earthy in forest, tart acidity and black tea, an exotic and well-structured expression of the grape from an extreme, coastal site. Cranberry, pomegranate and wild strawberry mingle within the strands of firm tannin and integrated oak.

title: Sleeping Giant 2015 Inglewood Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Broadly integrated in bold flavors of blackberry and black cherry, this is a well-made, 100% varietal wine aged in well-integrated oak. A juicy midpalate informs an overall deliciousness of tamed tannins and elegant finish.

title: Beringer 2016 Beringer Bros. Bourbon Barrel Aged Chardonnay (California)
description: Richness, almost unctuousness, is the hallmark of this full-bodied, creamy textured and complex wine. Subtle baking spices, butter and ginger fill the aroma, while perfectly ripe, abundant flavors of pear tart and toasted almond flood the palate. It's balanced on the plump side.

title: Fringe Collective 2016 Seafall Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a new, high-end project from winemaker Sebastian Donoso at Fetzer, sourcing from several spectacular vineyard sites, including Heintz and Morelli. Tart, structured and nervy, it offers integrated flavors of tangerine, guava and apple laced in nutmeg.

title: Iron Hub 2015 Resolute Red (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied blend has the Italian grape variety Aglianico at its core. The wine shows complex, mature aromas like balsam and cola, ripe and rich spiced-fruit flavors and a broad, lightly tannic texture. It's enjoyable and interesting, almost like picking a 10-year-aged Cabernet off the shelf.

title: La Crema 2016 Shell Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A big bold red, this is lush and expansive on the considerably concentrated palate, imparting developed flavors of baked strawberry, rhubarb, baking spice and black tea. The oak is integrated yet present.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Clos Pepe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Smooth aromas of vanilla and nutmeg meet with boysenberry sorbet and pie crust on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is quite ripe and rich with baked black cherry, lavender and lilac flavors.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Hints of vanilla paste decorate the rich black-cherry and nutmeg spice qualities on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is rich with boysenberry and dark cherry flavors, but balanced by joyous acidity and fresh flashes of mace.

title: MCV 2016 Gemeny Vineyards Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Black pepper, tar and elderberry flavors show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, which needs a touch of time to blow off its reductive qualities right now. Once it does, flavors of elderberry jam, black currant and pleasing leather emerge alongside firm structure and decent acidity.

title: The Withers Winery 2017 English Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This lightly ripe wine shows sizzling acidity that bolsters notes of forest floor, black tea, orange and lemon peel. With fantastic floral aromas, it shot puts acidity against an underbelly of tannin and quiet oak.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2014 Special Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Suisun Valley)
description: This is a rich, ripe and seemingly sweet wine that oozes black cherry and milk chocolate aromas and has blackberry-jam flavors wrapped in a soft pillowy texture of light tannins and soft acidity.

title: Reichwage 2016 Mancini Ranch Carignane (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a stemmy, carbonic-like red wine, rustic in its grasp of tart cranberry and orange flavor. Medium bodied, its acidity is tightly wound and does a good job of integrating with the oak.

title: Geyser Peak 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is nicely fruity, uncomplicated and easy to sip. It has green-apple aromas, light citrus flavors and a good balance between fresh acidity and ripeness.

title: Telios 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Vivid gold in color, this medium- to full-bodied wine boasts ripe, almost syrupy, fruit aromas and flavors, and has a mouthcoating soft texture. It tastes clean and rich, verging on sweet.

title: Boneshaker 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)
description: Meaty, peppery aromas and spicy smoky flavors show a pretty heavy oak influence in this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine.

title: De Loach 2016 OFS Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is meaty and full bodied in style, with pretty aromatics up front—a mix of jasmine and apple blossom. The palate takes on bountiful oak elements of vanilla and honey, with a lush texture front and center.

title: Hungry Hawk 2016 Queue Rouge Red (San Diego County)
description: Light in the glass, this blend of 35% Malbec, 29% Cabernet Sauvignon, 27% Cabernet Franc and 9% Merlot offers juicy aromas of red currant and a hint of crushed rock. The bright red fruits also show on the palate along with a more tart red-plum-skin twist.

title: Tortoise Creek 2017 Mission Grove Pinot Noir (California)
description: Smoke and black-pepper notes compete with good, ripe fruit flavors in this medium-bodied wine. The first whiff is a bit rubbery and charred, while in the mouth the flavors get smoother and more berry-like.

title: McManis 2017 Petite Sirah (California)
description: Aromas of smoke and rubber dominate on the nose of this rich and full-bodied wine. It has an earthy streak on the palate, too, but it has a fruit core that makes it enjoyable nonetheless.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2012 Two Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There is a strong oaky aroma that coats the red-currant fruit on the nose of this bottling, which is now seven years old. The palate is tangy with plum fruit and a tad simple at this point of its life.

title: Thomas Allen 2016 Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Strong oak aromas and flavors give this wine a jazzy array of spices like tamarind, clove and cardamom that nearly overwhelm the varietal fruit character. But if you love oak spices, you'll like this full-bodied, lightly tannic wine.

title: Carnivor 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This full-bodied wine is theatrically dark and rich, showing a color deeper than wines three times as expensive. It also has late-harvest plum, raisin and chocolate flavors, and a soft, thick texture.

title: Calavera 2014 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)
description: This wine tastes mature and mellow, exhibiting aromas of tamarind, vanilla and vermouth, and oaky dried-fruit flavors. It's full bodied and well aged.

title: Iron Hub 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)
description: This a lush fruity wine that is easy on the taste buds. Pineapple and citrus aromas lead to ripe, lightly sweet pineapple and banana flavors and a soft low-acid texture.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2017 Reata Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Soft, supple and moderate in oak, this medium-bodied white delivers layers of texture and vanilla with apple and pear fruit melded well within.

title: Old Woodhouse 2017 Bourbon Barrel Aged Red (California)
description: This full-bodied wine shows spicy, oaky aromas, semisweet oak and boysenberry-jam flavors and a broad, moderately tannic and low-acid texture.

title: Plow and Stars Cellars 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Honey graham cracker and vanilla flavors help declare this wine big, ripe and lush in style, the body robust and the acidity moderate. Baked peach, caramel and toasted oak round things out.

title: Highway 12 2016 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This is a soft, simple red wine, trafficking in rich layers of chocolate and coffee. The tannins are persistent and firm.

title: Acumen 2015 Mountainside Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This combines 8% Cabernet Franc, 7% Merlot, 5% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot with the Cab. A leathery, herbal expression of these grapes, it takes on a thick structure and persistence of turned earth, dark chocolate and coffee within a restrained package.

title: LangeTwins 2017 Chardonnay (Clarksburg)
description: Lots of butter, toast and fresh fruit make this medium-bodied wine taste rich, oaky and a bit heavy. The wine feels soft, round and low in acidity.

title: McManis 2018 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: Aromas of maple and brown sugar lead to jammy mulled fruit flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It is soft and round in texture and low in acidity.

title: Old Soul 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Leading with a lot of smoky oak, this medium-bodied wine shows cedar, clove and char aromas, and then some snappy black-cherry flavor along with more toasted oak.

title: California Roots 2018 Rosé (California)
description: This pale-colored wine has very light flavors and body and shows a sugary note on the finish.

title: Foot of the Bed 2018 White (California)
description: This unusual, dry but rich and nutty-tasting wine has a vivid gold color, aromas like toasted nuts and popcorn, and a savory salty palate.

title: Renwood 2017 The Cleaver Red (Amador County)
description: This semisweet wine smells jammy, tastes rich and ripe and raisiny, and has an almost syrupy texture.

title: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is an extravagantly buttery Chardonnay, with a soft smooth texture. An aroma of toasted baguette is followed by flavors of vanilla, poached pear and butterscotch while the mouthfeel and body are full.

title: Boeger 2017 Pinot Grande White Pinot Noir (El Dorado)
description: This unusual white wine made from Pinot Noir grapes shows a lot of spices and butter in the aromas and the flavors, and has a seemingly woody, slightly tannic character.

title: Dark Horse NV Brut Rosé (California)
description: Very dry and light bodied, this canned wine brings basic refreshment qualities and low-level fruitiness.

title: Peirano 2015 Heritage Collection Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine tastes ripe like dried plums and raisins and feels soft, thick and a bit sweet.
designation: Heritage Collection Estate Grown Old Vine

title: Aquinas 2017 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: A buttery, spicy layer of oak coats the jammy cherry and berry flavors in this stylized, ripe and almost-sweet wine.

title: Ghostrunner 2018 Ungrafted Red (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine shows a big whack of oak in the smoky aromas and charred fruit flavors, along with moderate tannins and a nip of astringency in the texture.

title: Louis M. Martini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Lemon peel and pea shoots combine in this earthy, thick white wine with moderate appeal.

title: MooBuzz 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Pungent, tarry aromas kick off the nose of this bottling, which also shows extracted blackberry and toasted oak on the nose. The palate offers sour blackberry, dried mushroom and dank herb flavors.

title: Head High 2018 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This youthful red wine has a minty, eucalyptus-like edge to both the aroma and flavor, an herbal element that's hard to shake amidst forceful red fruit that takes on a candied-like density and concentration.

title: Meadow View 2016 Lamorinda Isabelle's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Contra Costa County)
description: The strawberry, veggie and white-pepper flavors of this full-bodied wine are certainly unusual. It's something to try when shaking up the usual wine lineup.

title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: Fruity, straightforward and ripe, this wine is light and refreshing. It will be nice for a picnic or pre-meal cheese tasting.

title: Las Positas 2015 Meritage (Livermore Valley)
description: A complex funky aroma offers cedar, leather and farmyard notes, while the flavors run to earthy, pruney, cherry-cider accents.

title: Risk 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This wine is both brawny and thin, with lush layers of cola and dried herb around a full-bodied midpalate.

title: Bliss 2018 Estate Bottled Rosé (Mendocino)
description: Light bodied and fruity, this wine offers a very light color, faint peach aromas and a slightly earthy flinty side to the flavors.

title: Frey 2016 Organic Dolcetto (Mendocino)
description: Serve this organic red wine chilled to damp down the earthy aromas that cover what are actually quite lively and fruity flavors underneath.

title: Longoria 2016 Evidence Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Intense and dark berry fruit meet with black pepper, roasted beef and firm oak spice on the nose of this blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Candied blackberry flavors and wood spice are held together by firm, elegant tannins. Drink 2020–2031.

title: MacPhail 2016 Mardikian Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This estate-grown wine is made in small amounts and is bursting with complexity. Tightly structured, it's peppery, intense and tannic, with concentrated fruit flavors of pomegranate and cassis. A lingering note of black tea marks the finish. Enjoy from 2021–2026.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a great vineyard sourced by this producer for some time, this wine impresses in its sublime texture and integrated oak, the fruit profile of Gravenstein apple and pear is fleshy and lush. Bright acidity keeps the palate fresh and ready for more.

title: Saxon Brown 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Salty, briny oak gives a lift to the bolder richer flavors of baked pear in this lovely vineyard-designate, made in small amounts. Caramel and vanilla accent a nicely lush, yet balanced palate of full flavor and grace.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Fresh Meyer lemon peel and lime are drizzled atop pear brioche, nut cream and oak on the nose of this expressive, fresh bottling from an Ojai-based winery. It's tightly wound on the palate with fresh honeysuckle and light white peach flavors, finishing with a chalky grip.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light, plush and dancing in dark cherry and strawberry tones, this estate wine is soft and pillowy on the palate. A tangy citrus undertone rides along a backdrop of black tea, nutmeg and turned earth.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a new wine from the producer's Westside Road property. Soft and approachable, it has crisp, steely acidity that carries flavors of wet stone and lemon peel. It takes on a broader sense of lushness as it opens on the midpalate, presenting bold flavors of peach and apricot.

title: Beckmen 2016 Purisima Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Lovely aromas of candied boysenberry, dark red cherry, crushed lavender, cracked white pepper and dried sage sticks show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard located high above the Ballard Canyon appellation. There is a great freshness on the palate, where flavors of lavender and violet meet with peppery spice, berry fruit and a tarry edge.

title: Bennett Lane 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is juicy, structured and high toned, with elegant flavors of red cherry and cassis. High powered, it has contrasting notions of dried herb, clove and black pepper that play well against the fruit and a gritty oaky texture.

title: Black Kite 2016 Redwoods' Edge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine has wonderful ripeness without sweetness, a tangy mouthfeel and great structure. It shows bright cherry and apple-skin aromas, fresh and crisp cherry, cranberry and rhubarb flavors and medium to full body.

title: Alta Colina 2015 Estate G-S-M (Adelaida District)
description: There's considerable heft, weight and heady-ness to this vintage from Alta Colina, and it requires patience to fully explore. This blend of 52% Grenache, 41% Syrah and 7% Mourvèdre offers soft aromas of blackberry, black plum and crushed slate on the focused nose. The palate is full with black-plum and caramel touches, wrapped in tight, young tannins. Drink now through 2030.

title: JCB 2015 N0 11 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a big-boned, robustly flavored red that offers concentrated tones of dark cherry and raspberry, with bolts of Asian spice. Sizable tannins support the richness of the fruit, coating the palate with aplomb and complexity.

title: MacPhail 2016 Toulouse Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Full bodied and very plush in texture, this supersmooth wine starts with aromas of cooked cherries and plums, moves to richer, sweet-seeming strawberries and red cherries on the palate while it coats the tongue and sides of the mouth with an appealing, creamy texture.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a thick, intense and boldly concentrated wine, balanced in its richness by supportive acidity. Gravenstein apple flavors are nearly baked in flavor, with bolts of nutmeg and cinnamon adding intrigue and complexity.

title: Robert Hall 2015 Cavern Select Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Joyous aromas of black currant are spiced by pepper and charred meat on the nose. There's a violet aspect to the palate that floats above a backdrop of game, singed sage and coffee flavors.

title: Saarloos & Sons 2015 Broer Windmill Ranch Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Fairly light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression offers aromas of candied cherry, caramel and hickory smoke on the nose. It's light in body but with immense amounts of tannic tension, showing flavors of smoked cherry, savory roasted pork and cranberry sauce on the palate.

title: Stature 2013 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a brawny, meaty and thick wine made from Cabernet Sauvignon grapes grown on mountains, hillsides and ridges of Alexander Valley and Knights Valley. The tannins grip as smoky oak gives it additional weight and power around huge layers of peppery clove and black currant.

title: Bolt To Wines 2016 Sidekick by Karin Langer Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Cola and Dr. Pepper aromas meet with dark plum and black cherry on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The intense Dr. Pepper flavors also show on the palate, where tense tannins also deliver floral flavors of lilac and rosewater. It's quite an intriguing and full sip.

title: Heritance 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: With lasting tension and a good build-up of fresh acidity, this is a well-made white that offers fruity notes of white peach and apple. It has enough creaminess to be pleasurable on the palate, but ultimately is well built and balanced.

title: Sheldon 2017 Luc's Vineyard Grenache (Fountaingrove District)
description: This is the first vintage of this wine, and it was made in minuscule amounts. It opens awash in fresh strawberry, white pepper, citrus and flowers, aromatically inviting and fruity. A touch of grit and oak provides backbone amidst a textured, balanced palate of great beauty.

title: Brick Barn 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There is a compelling and unique freshness to this bottling, one of the first for this new estate. Very light in the glass, this shows aromas of lime blossom, green mango, citrus candy and crushed white rocks on the nose. The palate is very expressive and yet laser sharp, offering flavors of Asian pear and key lime pie.

title: Carlisle 2016 Rossi Ranch Grenache (Sonoma Valley)
description: Having had to skip a vintage in 2015, this wine is back with a pleasing vengeance, and is cofermented with 15% Mourvèdre. Strawberry, cherry and earth give it a bold, fresh flavorful complexity with depth and surprising freshness. It lingers in cherry cordial and cedar.

title: Clementine Carter 2017 Graciano (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is one of the early bottlings labeled Graciano, from grapes that were thought to be the Monastrell clone of Mourvèdre, and the future looks promising. A beautifully deep but not thick color in the glass, the wine offers aromas of fresh boysenberry, wet gravel, violet and tea on the nose. The palate is fresh with acidity and deep with blackberry flavors.

title: Écluse 2016 Ensemble Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and sultry aromas of black plum meet with cedar on the nose of this blend of 29% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Cabernet Franc, 15% Petit Verdot, 14% Merlot, 14% Malbec and 7% Carignan. There is chalky structure to the sip, which presents flavors of smoke and black fruits.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2015 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Exotic plum and mulberry compote aromas are lifted by curry leaf and other Indian spice-rack flavors on this single-vineyard expression. There is ample cola spice on the palate, where tangy red fruits meet with wild herbs.

title: Goat Bubbles 2015 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Santa Barbara County)
description: Sparkling wine is still relatively new in this part of the world, and it will be fascinating to see how these bubbles age. Right now, this bottling offers aromas of toast, dried lemon peel, wet dough and a touch of tangerine, while the palate shows sourdough with lemon-marmalade flavors. It will grow more yeasty and rich with time. Drink now through 2035.

title: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This Cabernet is blended with 6% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot and 3% Cabernet Franc. Fresh tones of brioche and currant meld with crushed rock, pencil and sweet tobacco. Youthful tannins offer a structured frame to this undeniably elegant wine.

title: Maritana 2017 Le Russe Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Vintner Donald Patz crafts this blend from several vineyard sites across the appellation. It captures the perfume of baked strawberry, cola, nutmeg and cardamom, followed by a lush, plush and velvety midpalate that boasts a toasted oak tone.

title: Heitz 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Representing one of the finest values in Napa Cabernet, this 100% varietal wine is bright and plush, layered in anise and cassis liqueur. A fresh high-toned midpalate evolves to show a softly round ending as a classic style of structure and elegance play out.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 The Mariness Meritage White (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A blend of 88% Sauvignon Blanc and 12% Sémillon marks the inaugural vintage of this Bordeaux-inspired white. White peach, apricot and pear flavors mingle with seamless acidity to give it a long-lasting sense of lushness.

title: Casa Dumetz 2017 Hayes Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very floral on the nose, this bottling from a vineyard off of Sweeney Canyon Road offers aromas of lavender, lilac and rose petal as well as a freeze-dried strawberry component. The palate booms with fresh strawberry and raspberry as well as hibiscus flavors, proving very likable and fruity.

title: Écluse 2016 Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Dark and brooding in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of smoke, black cherry and caramel on the rich nose. It's a very rich expression of Syrah on the sip, offering oak, vanilla and caramel set against rich mouthfilling flavors of black-cherry foam and mocha. It is great for a barbecue.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Sandalwood, sea salt, singed lemon and creamy poached pome fruits show on the nose of this bottling. There is a great sizzle of acidity to the sip, where flavors of lemon juice and kumquat are framed in a chalky tension.

title: Laetitia 2016 Reserve du Domaine Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Rich black-cherry, creamy vanilla and a tart red-plum kick make for a dynamic, soft and alluring nose. The palate is also rich, yet balanced, with a black cherry flavor that's lifted by clove and star anise.

title: Pellegrini 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This beautifully crafted wine has sizzling acidity and resulting freshness, with a bite of texture and grit. Peach, fig and melon flavors ride alongside crisper elements of lemon pith and grapefruit, finding a cohesive whole that is balanced and forever bright.

title: Robert Mondavi 2017 Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Impressive at the price point and production levels, this shows a nice nose of strawberry, rose and lavender, following through on the palate with seamless texture and balanced earthiness. It remains light bodied and enjoyable in the glass.

title: Two Sisters 2016 Reserve Courtney's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Hazelnut, yeasty dough, lemon juice and honeysuckle aromas make for a very expansive nose on this reserve bottling from the Foley family. There's a hint of butter on the front of the palate, which widens to flavors of citrus, almond, toast and oak.

title: Zaca Mesa 2015 Z Cuvée Estate Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 48% Mourvèdre, 36% Grenache, 13% Syrah and 3% Cinsault starts with aromas of wet stone, black plum and purple flowers. The texture is taut on the palate, where flavors of candied grape, lilac and violet make for a refreshing and refined package.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2017 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This is a broad, rich and relaxed wine made from organic grapes. It shows generous black-plum and blackberry flavors, full body and grippy, moderate tannins. It does a great job of filling a big frame with opulent, delicious and ripe fruit, while adding subtle spice and wood-smoke nuances that enhance each sip.

title: Axr 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a classically elegant, structured wine, subdued in tannin and oak. It sings a song of savory intrigue, from tobacco, cedar and clove to currant and cassis. It offers flavor and texture within quiet interludes of integrated ripeness.

title: Heath Vineyards 2015 Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Thick aromas of black plum, licorice and toasted wood show on the nose of this bottling produced by a Texas-based winery. Savory flavors of pepper-crusted roast beef make for a full palate, which rides a persistent tannic texture and decent acidity.

title: Herencia 2014 Merlot (Chiles Valley)
description: Sanguine in red and black currant, this is an expansive, succulent and broadly fleshy red wine, full bodied but still elegant. Grippy tannins provide additional power as elements of cedar and clove season the fruit and oak.

title: La Voix 2015 Satisfaction Kessler-Haak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Candied pomegranate, alpine strawberry and tarragon aromas show on the nose of this bottling by Steve Clifton. The palate is tangy with tart red-fruit and dried mint flavors, enlivening the mouth with each tart sip.

title: Ledson 2015 Estate Ti Amo Red (Alexander Valley)
description: A blend of 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Merlot from the producer's estate vineyard, this is smoky in blackberry with a grip of tannin and oak. It has a soft underbelly of texture and rounded richness, with a lasting candied, dusty note of clove.

title: Noceto 2016 Marmellata Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Good, mellow flavors are supported by a lithe structure of light tannins and acidity in this medium-bodied, almost gentle-tasting wine. Mild flavors of cranberry, black tea and red cherries fill out the palate.

title: Oak Mountain 2015 Estate Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: Rounded red fruit aromas meet with pie crust, baking spice, vanilla cookie and toast on the nose of this bottling. There's a taut cran-raspberry flavor on the palate, with flavors of wet rocks and white pepper providing complexity.

title: Pine Ridge 2016 Collines Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a smooth, floral white crisp in white flowers and a bite of grapefruit. The midpalate settles into more substantial elements of fresh pear and nutmeg, finishing in a hint of reduction.

title: St. Francis 2015 Wild Oak Cabernet Franc (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with just 2% Cabernet Sauvignon, the main variety is allowed to truly speak. This wine shows a melding of tobacco, crayon wax and dried sage—the herbal component compelling and complex. Coffee aromas wield power around smooth integrated tannin and plenty of rich oak.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Dark in color, this bottling shows dark red-cherry and licorice aromas on the nose. The palate is well rounded with firm tannins, solid acidity and flavors of berry, tobacco, fennel and freshly picked herbs.

title: Guarachi Family 2016 G Estate Grown Red (Napa Valley)
description: Offering tremendous value, this blends 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Syrah and 10% Merlot from the producer's Atlas Peak estate. Leather, reduced oak, meaty black pepper and currant combine around an approachable structure cradled in considerable oak.

title: La Crema 2015 Saralee's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy, big and bold, this speaks well to fans of a full-bodied, fruit-forward style. Boysenberry, black cherry and cola are complemented by savory teases of coffee and black licorice.

title: Sleeping Giant 2016 Dearden Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Big and bold in flavor and style, this wine is firmly structured in tannin and oak, with layers of sarsaparilla, cola and black cherry at its full-bodied core.

title: Brophy Clark 2015 G-S-M (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Candied and plump boysenberry aromas meet with wet slate, white pepper and tobacco leaf on the nose of this blend of 48% Grenache, 32% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre. There's a singe of acidity at the tip of the sip, leading into flavors of black raspberry, cigar wrapper and thyme.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This is a thick, chewy and full-bodied red that will appeal to a wide range of palates and budgets. Bright underlying red fruit enlivens the firm tannic structure and integrated oak, finishing soft and smooth on the palate.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2017 Vintner's Reserve Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine interlaces a light buttery-oak nuance with vibrant, appealing fruit flavors. It's medium weight yet fresh, with a smooth, well-balanced palate that displays a harmonized mix of savory oak and citrus nuances.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Valley)
description: Spicy and fresh, with a savory underbelly, this full-bodied red sings in tones of forest floor, sage, cranberry and orange. The tannins are firm and well integrated, with an accompanying bolt of woody oak.

title: Amici 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This full-bodied red has earthy sage on the nose and palate, an herbal expression within a rich, concentrated grasp of cedar and black licorice. Along the way red currant and cassis come into the picture, adding succulence to the dusty cocoa and mineral.

title: Cass 2015 Backbone Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: From the Geneseo District in the eastern hills of Paso Robles, this bottling begins with aromas of savory smoke and ripe black currant on the nose. The palate is very cohesive with a decent tannic tension that unleashes an explosion of tangy boysenberry flavors.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Lytton Springs Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Aged in French and Hungarian oak, this is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Merlot, 14% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Spicy cinnamon, clove and cedar mix with black fruit and tobacco on the palate. This is firm and bold in style, built by structured tannins.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Well-integrated aromas of mace, exotic red cherry, hibiscus and peppercorns make for a very fresh entry to the nose of this bottling. Soft flavors of alpine strawberry and star anise pop on the sip, which is very pleasant and easy to drink.

title: Center of Effort 2015 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Aromas of toasted marshmallow, nuts and ripe apple meet with a steely, racy seam on the nose of this bottling. There's an orange-rind edge to the bright palate, providing freshness to balance the richer cashew and almond flavors.

title: Crū 2017 Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Clean and tight on the nose, this bottling offers lemon juice, chalk, wet river stone and sharp, grassy aromas. There is great acidity and strong tension to the palate that grabs the tongue and won't let go, weaving through flavors of lemon-lime and Anjou pear.

title: Crū 2017 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This light-hued bottling offers candied strawberry, fresh berry, wild thyme and sage on the nose. There's a slightly green, almost cannabis element to the palate, which gives intriguing depth to the bright red fruit.

title: J. Wilkes 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lime peel, green pear, lemongrass and wet river stone combine for an inviting and complex nose. There is strong chalky tension to the palate, where a flavor of Key lime pie is wrapped in bright acid.

title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This is a tremendous value for the quality, a full embrace of crème brûlée and baked pear that's grainy in texture and bright in acidity. Minimal oak allows for a succulent experience on the balanced palate, finishing in a burst of lemon zest and key lime.

title: Martellotto 2017 Melodeon Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Golden-apple, lemon-extract and toasted marshmallow aromas immediately reveal that this is a California Chardonnay, but one held in balance. The palate is clean and crisp with lemon and Asian pear flesh flavors, woven by a firm grip and strong acidity.

title: Williams Selyem 2012 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)
description: Dark and hearty aromas of blackberry syrup, clove, allspice and prune show on the intense nose of this cigar-perfect Port. A black plum flavor grips the palate as espresso and raisin tones emerge, proving the overall package sweet yet spicy.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Precious Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a dry-farmed coastal site, this is a grippy, concentrated wine full of powerful tannins. Dried herb, tea, blood orange and pomegranate combine for a force of flavor as the wine broods and develops.

title: Fernwood 2016 Vanumanutagi Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a compelling dairy component to the nose of this bottling, but more toward yogurt rather than butter, and then the aromas evolve into white peach and crushed nuts. A salty edge leads the palate, where lemon zest, roasted apple and oak smoke ride a racy acid-driven sip.

title: Goldeneye 2015 Brut Rosé (Anderson Valley)
description: Rich and full of flavor, this wine offers fruit, spice and some attractive aged complexity in equal measures. It has an earthy toasty gingery aroma, mellow cherry and raspberry flavors and a mouth-filling mousse.

title: Grassini 2014 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Roasted black cherries, toasted wood, a pinch of pepper and the slightest hint of green herbs show on the nose of this bottling. The entry to the palate is very smooth with dark fruits, but there's also a hint of Cab Franc's herbal side, with a bit of mint. The finish is oak dominant.

title: Martellotto 2016 La Bomba Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Charred meat, smoked boysenberries, crushed gravel and charcoal make for a savory nose on this bottling by Greg Martellotto, whose Italian family has made wine for generations. Dried herbs, tangy cranberries and roasted meats show on the palate, which offers a hefty weight and should age well.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Malbec (Santa Barbara County)
description: Freshly smashed red-currant and blackberry aromas provide a bright and accessible nose. The palate is layered with tobacco, mint and plum flavors, and there is good acidic zip to the lively feel.

title: Red Car 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tangy oranges and tangerines accent sculpted acidity in this textured, gritty white from the always impressive vineyard site. With just a touch of reduction, it has understated elegance and a light-bodied style.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Fumé Blanc (Oakville)
description: This has 14% Sémillon. Together, the white grapes form a fleshy, floral core of bold full-bodied flavor and lemony oak, the structure impressively complex and lasting in texture.

title: Saarloos & Sons 2014 O.G. Windmill Ranch Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: This carbonically fermented bottling shows plenty of herbal kick to the nose (from sagebrush to wild thyme), which is set against the light, tart red-fruit aromas. The palate is framed by a cranberry and cherry backdrop that allows the herbaceous side to shine, from potpourri to tea leaves. This is a great food wine.

title: Three Thieves 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Baking spice aromas and ripe, juicy fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine easy to appreciate. It follows on the palate with toasty oak nuances and satisfying notes of red and black cherries. A good structure of fruit, acidity and moderate tannins keeps it well balanced.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Burnside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a lovely, earthy vineyard-designate, brimming in thick, viscous and youthful layers of black tea and cardamom. Structured tannins support a core of velvety baked strawberry and cola.

title: Saxon Brown 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dark gold in color, this is a meaty, substantial white, tremendously flavorful in tropical and stone-fruit notes and an intensity of savory spice.

title: Coursey Graves 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a small-production offering from a small producer. It opens in a beautifully floral display of rose and sage, following through with a substantial weight and breadth of cassis and black cherry. The oak is rich and rewarding while allowing the wine to remain balanced and elegant.

title: Immortal Estate 2014 Slope Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: From the former site of Hidden Ridge Vineyard, Slope is indeed from a 55-degree slope, the site near the Spring Mountain border. A sweetness of vanilla and cinnamon give it a richness met by viscous, smoothly jammy red and black cherry, finishing with a touch of texture.

title: Dennen NV Charismatic Fool Sparkling Rosé (California)
description: This rich and impressive wine emphasizes complexity rather than simple fruit flavors. The aroma is earthy, spicy and mineral-like, while the flavors bring dried cherries, ginger and raspberries in layers that unfold on the palate.

title: Frostwatch 2017 Semillon (Bennett Valley)
description: Made 100% from Semillon from the producer's estate vineyard, this is a floral, viscous and lemony white, concentrated and full flavored, with underlying acidity and complex structure. Made in tiny amounts, it shows the variety's weight and texture.

title: Marimar 2018 Rosaleda Doña Margarita Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is floral, bright and creamy in layers of wild strawberry and watermelon. It shows delicate accents of earth and herbs, with a balanced, appealing weight.
designation: Rosaleda Doña Margarita Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of

title: Artevino 2017 Maple Creek Estate Chardonnay (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Tempting butter and butterscotch aromas lead to poached pear and caramel flavors in this full-bodied, full-blown and yet well-balanced wine. Subtle oak spices weave throughout and linger nicely on the finish, in tandem with generous fruitiness.

title: Prothro 2018 Rosé (Clarksburg)
description: Bright peach flavors and crisp acidity make this a truly refreshing, mouthwatering and food-friendly wine. Light to medium in body, the wine is based on Tempranillo grapes and offers persistent fresh peach from the aroma through the tangy finish.

title: Yao Family Wines 2018 Napa Crest Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy on the palate, with a balanced approach to acidity, this wine offers breadth and length, nicely combining a small amount of Sémillon within. Pear, peach and Key lime make for an expressive midpalate of fruit seasoned in a touch of lemongrass.

title: MCV 2017 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling by Matt Villard pops on the nose with blackberry sorbet, wet slate, seared oak and a hint of mint. Earth and fruit converge on the palate, offering berries, sagebrush and a touch of smoke. It's a hearty yet balanced glass of wine.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This delicious take on the grape is ripe yet bright. Exotic flavors of peach, pineapple and lemon zest lead to a creamy midpalate, with just a hint of oak shining through.

title: Chuparosa 2015 Malbec (Ramona Valley)
description: A strong and balanced showing from a vineyard near San Diego, this bottling blends accessible red-fruit aromas with rugged earth tones of dust and pencil shavings on the nose. The palate is rustic and pleasing, with blackberry, oregano and more dried earth flavors—a worthy competitor to more established regions to the north.

title: Lapis Luna 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Breadth and depth are the hallmarks of this full-bodied mouthfilling wine. It offers ripe citrus, dried fig and mineral aromas followed by rich and palate-coating flavors that combine subtle spices and ripe melon flavors.

title: Sinor-LaVallee 2016 White Label Bassi Vineyard Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Complex aromas of flint, toast, seared lime and damp forest wood show on the nose of this bottling by Mike Sinor. There is a compelling chalky tension to the palate, where lemon skin and grapefruit flavors mesh into a tight, flinty minerality.

title: Testarossa 2016 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's a generous amount of oak on the nose of this bottling, which also offers creamy yellow lemon and lime on the nose. The palate is tense with citrus-juice acidity, which cuts through the creamy, toasty wood spice flavors.

title: Fallon Place 2018 Estines Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a four-acre site in the heart of the appellation, this small-production saignée is earthy in rose petal and citrus. The lithe, bright flavors follow suit, offering an array of watermelon, grapefruit, lime and flint that persists with a light ripeness.

title: Dubost 2017 Grenache (Adelaida District)
description: Layers of fresh strawberries, oak, rose petals and gingerbread show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard deep in the appellation. The gingerbread touch comes through strongly on the sip, along with dark red plums and a crushed slate minerality.

title: Testarossa 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Caramelized cherry aromas meet with loamy soils and slightly forest floor funk on the nose of this bottling, which is light in color in the glass. The palate snap with cranberry and pomegranate flavors that ride a slate-like minerality. The acidity is buoyant, ensuring long life. Drink 2020–2031.

title: La Crema NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: A new offering from the producer, this blends together Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, it offers sleek flavors of strawberry puree and brioche that benefit from crisp acidity and stony texture. Balanced and fresh, it finishes in lemon peel and flowers.

title: Bodkin 2018 The Victor's Spoils Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a delightfully bright, light and refreshing wine, grassy and herbal within a context of textured grapefruit and lime. It's lovely and complex with a persistence of acidity.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2018 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine was given no time in oak and made entirely from grapes grown in Dry Creek and Russian River Valleys. It is lively, tart and fresh. Balanced flavors of lemon peel, lime and peach mingle around an earthy tease of fresh-cut grass.

title: Pride Mountain 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 22% Cabernet Sauvignon from the estate, this wine is thick in sandalwood, red currant and dried herb, structured and balanced in ripeness. The tannins are well integrated and supportive, allowing room for fresh acidity to brighten its lushness.

title: Roblar 2017 Block One Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Wet earth, dried yellow-apple peels and damp herbs show on the nose of this bottling. There is a petrol character to the sip as well as flavors of sour apple and dried grass.

title: Jamieson Ranch 2016 Reata El Diablo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed and broadly fruit-forward, this wine has a pronounced grasp of oak and tannin within a nervy hit of acidity. Black cherry, blackberry and cola commingle with approachable aplomb.

title: Eponymous 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced, with a strong element of char to the oak, this 100% varietal wine is inky and dark, with a thick, tannic character that holds tenaciously on to the palate. A sweetness of cherry, vanilla and cocoa powder clings to the dense, concentrated palate.

title: Kunde 2014 202 Estate Grown Meritage (Sonoma Valley)
description: Combining 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Malbec, 19% Merlot, 12% Petit Verdot and 6% Cabernet Franc, this is a true Bordeaux-style red blend of pungent earth, tobacco and dried herb. Simple in approach and robust in body, it has moderate richness and structure.

title: Metzker Family Estates 2018 Morningsong Vineyard Rosé of Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Reddish-copper in color, this is a meaty, substantially thick and concentrated wine, with a touch of spritzy acidity that keeps it fresh and in check.

title: Oak Mountain 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of damp campfire, hickory smoke and red-cherry pie show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is slightly thin with angular tannins, showing dried black fruit and dried fennel flavors.

title: Old Soul 2016 Pure Red (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has plenty of oak spices in the aromas and flavors, good cherry and berry notes underneath and an agreeably smooth, drinkable texture.

title: Beringer 2016 Beringer Bros. Bourbon Barrel Aged Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The rich flavors of this ripe and jammy-tasting wine are rounded by a touch of sweetness as in many California red blends. It starts out in the aroma and first sip as big and full bodied and finishes as soft and candied.

title: Bogle 2016 Merlot (California)
description: Cedar and sawdust aromas lead to earthy, meaty, oaky flavors in this moderately built, well-aged and woody wine. It's a good choice when you're on a budget and enjoy wines that aren't overly fruity.

title: Grindstone 2014 Cortina Red (California)
description: Very fruity in flavor and velvety smooth in texture, this medium-bodied wine shows concentrated ripe berries and cherries in the aroma that continue in the flavors, wrapped in a melting texture of soft acidity and soft tannins.

title: Rippey 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a stainless-steel fermented and aged white that takes some time to reveal its aromatics—a subtle combination of peach and wet stone that follows through on the lean up-front acidity. Touches of jalapeño add spice as a contrasting hit of vanilla takes hold on the finish.

title: Buena Vista 2016 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Caramelized oak and concentrated, tropically sweet fruit dominate in this full-bodied, lushly crafted wine, textured and layered in bold flavors of baked pear and pineapple.

title: Myka 2017 Mitzi's Chardonnay (California)
description: Plenty of butter and butterscotch aromas start this wine off with a bang, while equally effusive pear and ripe apple flavors join in on the palate. There's a touch of earthiness, but the pastry character really carries this medium-bodied wine.

title: Petrified Forest Vineyards 2017 Totem Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)
description: Thick, herbal and buttery, the midpalate of this white is grassy and awash in pea shoot. Medium bodied, it has a simplicity of approach.

title: Bushong NV Institutionalized Red (Paso Robles)
description: Strong aromas of purple flowers and fruits are quite extracted and lifted by a touch of baking spice on the nose of this bottling. Ripe and cooked blackberry and black-plum flavors meet with tart purple flowers and a chunky texture on the palate.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2013 Test Pilot F-86 Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Extracted black-plum and blackberry aromas meet with pepper dust on the nose of this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Franc. The age is showing on the palate, where black-plum skins and violet-extract flavors meet with a touch of smoke.

title: Cuvaison 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This white has a hot spicy opening from the oak that tastes of peppercorn. The palate is moderate in ripeness with drying tannins and a shortness of fruit.

title: De Loach 2015 Riebli Valley Vineyard Mayacamas Range Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This site lives within the relatively new Fountaingrove District appellation, beneath the Mayacamas. Spice, clove and tobacco highlight a bold full-bodied expression of easy and soft approachability that finishes without fanfare.

title: Lobo 2016 Wulff Vineyards Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Heady in oak and a forceful taste of caramel, this continues in bold baked flavors of pineapple, vanilla and matchstick. It is intensely flavorful and ripe.

title: Swingset 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A partnership between Brett Zimmerman and winemaker Ed Killian, this shows thick, concentrated flavors of sweetly baked tropical fruit and crème brûlée. The oak is prominent and adds touches of vanilla along the way.

title: Rock Wall 2017 Mama's Reserve White (California)
description: Luxuriously flavorful and mouthfilling, this full-bodied wine offers flower and pear aromas on the nose. The palate brings flavors of hazelnut and cream. Aged on the lees in new French oak barrels, it is layered, complex and concentrated, with a long, lingering finish.

title: Schramsberg 2015 Cremant Demi-Sec Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: This impressive bottling relies on Flora grapes for its core (67%), blended with 19% Chardonnay and 14% Pinot Noir. There's an intentional sweetness to the wine that makes it off dry in peach, pineapple and honey. Lively acidity keeps it balanced with a lift and energy in between the welcome richness.

title: Sense of Place 2014 Braff Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of chalk and oak meet with lime pith and a hint of cinnamon on the dynamic nose of this bottling from a vineyard that sits 1,100 feet in elevation. Baking spices show on the palate, alongside flavors of preserved lemon, sandalwood and vanilla.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Deaver Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Handsome oak aromas and intense old-vine fruitiness combine to give this full-bodied wine extra dimension. Cedar, vanilla and new leather tones crowd the nose, while ripe and soothing berry and cherry flavors coat the palate.

title: Thacher 2017 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)
description: Light touches of wet concrete, yellow grapefruit and chalk make for a very subtle and mineral-driven nose on this bottling. There is a great chalky grip to the palate, whose tense structure allows flavors of lime in and jasmine to slowly emerge.

title: Ann Albert 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Hazelnut, preserved lemon, warm toast and a touch of daffodil show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling by Eric Johnson. There is a toasty quality to the tip of the sip before the fresh waves of lemon and creamy cherimoya set in, leading into a lush, rounded finish.

title: Benom 2018 L'Essor Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Very pale pink in color, this rosé blend of 74% Grenache and 26% Cabernet Sauvignon from two vineyards is exciting and delicious, starting with faint yet precise aromas of peach, white flower and rainy cement. There is extreme tension to the palate, where hints of citrus and pluot flesh are framed by a brilliantly taut structure.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2016 E Squared Kimsey Vineyard Syrah-Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Purple flowers of lavender and lilac meet with boysenberry hams and savory hints of white pepper on the nose of this bottling by Edgar Torres. It lands on the palate with big and bruising but balanced flavors of blackberry, charred meats, cola and minty bay leaf.

title: Falcone 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Green pear skins and flesh lead toward aromas of nectarine and lime preserves on brioche on the nose of this wine from a historic vineyard. There is a zesty brightness to the sip as well as riper flavors of roasted apple, yellow peach and pineapple, framed by a chalky structure.

title: Fulcrum 2017 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: The scent of gorgeous dark cherries blended with exotic French oak spices gives this full-bodied wine an inspired start before it spreads equally spicy, smoky, almost-sweet flavors and ripe black-cherry and boysenberry notes across the palate. Full body and moderate tannins give it great structure and grip in the mouth.

title: Michaud 2015 Syrah (Chalone)
description: This is a very unique wine by the Chalone appellation veteran Michael Michaud, starting with aromas of mushrooms, roasted plum and elderberry. The palate is packed with intense purple flavors and leathery tannins as well as a strong sense of umami, with peppercorns, hoisin and hints of barbecued meats.

title: Montemar 2014 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of roasted plums, grilled pork, cranberry and white pepper on the dynamic nose. Mace, sumac, rooibos tea and savory pepper flavors give nuance to the light red-plum and smashed cranberry core of the palate.

title: Sol Rouge 2016 Viognier (Lake County)
description: Poised and balanced, this medium- to full-bodied wine boasts apricot and peach-skin aromas, lively fruit flavors backed by good acidity, and a mouthfilling texture that is soothing on the finish, where it releases extended nutty and vanillin impressions. Expect it to gain more complexity through 2023.

title: Stephen Ross 2016 Bee Sweet Vineyard Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: An elegant take on Grenache, this single-vineyard expression begins with floral aromas of lavender and black-raspberry sorbet. The purple flower sense carries into the sip, where boysenberry flavors mix with softer red fruits and rosewater.

title: Stephen Ross 2016 Escolle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Fresh and ripe aromas of black raspberry, alpine strawberry, dark chocolate and dried mint show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the appellation's northern edge. The palate is loaded with bowlfuls of cherries, raspberries and ripe plums, with a minty character keeping it lively.

title: Stolpman 2018 GDG Gamay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Another exciting Gamay coming out of the Central Coast, this version by the Stolpman family starts with aromas of dark red cherry and boysenberry as well as the grape's telltale wet stone and pulverized rock. The sip is extremely fresh, lively and nearly effervescent, offering red fruit and bay leaf flavors as well as an intriguing texture.

title: Tessier Winery 2017 Filigreen Farm Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Great balance, moderate fruit flavors and mild spices add up to a nervy, appetizing wine. Made from old vines farmed biodynamically, it shows cranberry and red-cherry aromas, slightly lean cherry and rhubarb flavors and a good structure of moderate tannins and taut acidity. Best now through 2025.

title: Westwood 2017 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is fleshy on the palate and bright in aromas of citrus and stone. Notes of pear, flint and lime provide an unctuous nature on the palate, with refreshing acidity making for a nicely balanced and memorable experience.

title: Bridlewood 2016 Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Roasted aromas of smoked black plum, hoisin sauce, violets and cracked pepper make for a very compelling nose on this bottling. Rich flavors of cocoa nibs and roasted coffee pair with dark plum and violet for a delicious sip.

title: Ektimo Vineyards 2016 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This clone-specific red is rich in juicy red fruit and grippy in texture, with integrated waves of full-bodied power. Made in a big style, it succeeds in its grasp of brawny earth and seductive spiciness of clove and cardamom.

title: Steele 2017 Parmelee Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine has an earthy entry of peach, fig and vanilla the work well within a steely texture. But an intensity of edgy oak distracts from the fruit.

title: Uptick Vineyards 2014 Estate Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is dull and overripe in black fruit with a moderate grip of structure and tannin.

title: Starfield 2016 Barbera (El Dorado)
description: This wine goes for concentration and power but battles an acidic streak. It has a deep color, potent aromas of dried cherries and balsamic, palate-saturating fruit flavors and full body.

title: Twisted Paso 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Very ripe and extracted aromas of cassis and blackberry syrup meet with a pinch of dried oregano. It's both ripe and tangy on the palate, with balsamic notes.

title: Simple Life 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has strong wood and baking-spice aspects in the aromas and flavors that give it a smoky-sweet effect. Candied cherries and vanilla notes stand out from the soft texture.

title: I Mille 2015 Petite Sirah (Rockpile)
description: Reduced, thick and grippy, this red is unduly robust and difficult to decipher, the fruit 100% varietal. The oak is pronounced, a majority of it new.

title: Ironstone 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: Onion and garlic aromas mostly blow off after a few minutes and let this medium-bodied wine turn more fruity and concentrated on the palate.

title: Kate Arnold 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine emphasizes earthy and lightly herbal flavors and has a moderately rich mouthfeel to go with them. Subtle flint and mineral notes outweigh any fruitiness.

title: Kobler 2017 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: There is something overwhelmingly rich and forced about this white, made from a great site. The fruit is a touch dull and sweetly overripe with a caramelized aspect to the finish.

title: Obsession 2016 Red (California)
description: A strong peppery meaty aroma is followed by oaky spicy smoky flavors in this medium-bodied wine. Ripe, almost sweet blackberry notes and a soft texture help to balance out the oakiness.

title: Heath Vineyards 2016 Captivating Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Sour lime and sour guava aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent grip to the palate, although the flavors are a bit muddled, with apple and lemon most prominent.

title: Aviary 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is tremendously oaky, showing aromas like sawdust and toasted bread, flavors like butterscotch and vanilla and a buttery texture. It's an extreme example of the varietal.

title: Ironstone 2017 Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: An overtly smoky, ashy aroma comes with heavy, oaky and almost sweet flavors in this medium-bodied wine.

title: Sojourn 2017 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine presents as both sweet and sour in a disjointed offering that may suggest it needs more time in the bottle to develop.

title: Spann Vineyards 2014 Cross Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This wine is simple in approach, with a tart, tannic texture that is a little rough on the palate.

title: Kobler 2017 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: There's a wealth of viscous sweetness to this white, that presents as reduced and matchsticky on the nose. Salt, pineapple and butterscotch are burdened by too much oak.

title: Leaping Horse 2016 Red (California)
description: This is an enjoyable wine that nevertheless emphasizes obvious oaky aromas and flavors that don't integrate well with the blackberry-fruit component. It is medium bodied and appears sweet, possibly due to the woody character.

title: Aviary 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Extremely obvious oak aromas and flavors knock this wine off balance and don't allow much flavor from the grapes to show through. It smells and tastes like pungent cedar, cloves and charred wood.

title: Hanna 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy and sweet, this wine is reduced and tastes manipulated, with a flavor of burnt vanilla, tropical fruit and matchstick flintiness.

title: Ironstone 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Earthy aromas and a rough texture give this wine a rustic character. It has pronounced herb and grapefruit flavors, lean texture and tart acidity.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Strata Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Caramelized apple and crème brûlée flavors make for a heady richness in this wine. It finds its balance on the midpalate, where concentrated, silky waves of flavor move to a settling mineral intensity on the finish.

title: Landmark 2016 Damaris Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dark gold in color, this wine takes on a heady bouquet of honey, graham cracker, vanilla and crème brûlée. Hearty, full bodied and fleshy, its fruit-forward character is defined by flavors of pineapple and mango.

title: On Point 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This blends grapes from the Gap's Crown and Wildcat Mountain vineyards, aging the whole in a small percentage of new French oak for 11 months. Heady in spice and baked dark cherry, it offers moderate body structure and ripeness with a touch of orange peel and toasted oak.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Vintner Select Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This is 100% varietal and made from the best vineyard blocks. Brawny and bright, it has substantial weight and tannin, accented in red and black cherry, plum, coconut and leather. Seasonings of dried herb linger on the long finish.

title: Robert Hall 2016 Cavern Select Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Clean aromas of toast, oak, butter and nectarine cream make for a strong showing of a Paso Robles Chardonnay. There is great grip to the palate right away, with flavors of lime and apple skin leading into a toasted oak finish.

title: Sojourn 2016 Reuling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Big and spicy, this wine is tannic on entry, intensely full bodied and supremely earthy. Exotic waves of citrus, rhubarb and cranberry provide crunch and tartness that complement the forest and black tea.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Tangy black-plum aromas meet with savory meats, lilac and burnt brown sugar on the nose of this reserve bottling. It's soft and chalky on the full and ripe palate with a thick layer of blackberry foam as well as a hint of lighter flowers toward the finish.

title: Works & Days 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is memorable in its firm grasp of earthy savory forest floor, sage and cardamom. The acidity is tart and well integrated as well as delicately built, finishing in a burst of pomegranate and orange peel.

title: Flint & Steel 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aged entirely in stainless steel, this pretty, appropriately named white is floral and herbal, tasting strongly of grapefruit pith and lemon peel. The flavors lead to accompanying textures of light-bodied weight and refreshment.

title: Kennedy Family 2014 Vite Centanni Vineyard Estate Grown Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a brawny, lushly made wine, rich in dark cherry and blackberry fruit. Lengthy and structured in nature, it takes on broader notes of milk chocolate, vanilla and nutmeg as it evolves on the finish.

title: McClean 2017 Clemence Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Packaged in one of the more impressive labels on the market, this very young wine is quite ready now, starting with fresh aromas of blackberry sauce, crushed slate and dried herbs. Chalky tannins frame the sip, where ripe red-fruit flavors lead into herbs, smoked meat and cocoa.

title: Robert Hall 2015 Cavern Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dark aromas of blackberry, baked earth, licorice and chaparral scrub show on the nose of this rich and extracted bottling. The palate is also lush and juicy with black-currant and caramel flavors, yet held in check by chalky tannins.

title: Seven Angels 2015 Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Elegantly woven aromas of purple flowers, blackberry syrup and charred meats make for a rich aromatic entry to this bottling. The flavors are more reserved, showing dark fruit and baking spice, all wrapped in strong acidity with potential to be even more delicious.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This white offers tremendous value, being bright, floral and fruity with a touch of restraint. Integrated ripeness and oak are etched in apple, pear and nutmeg, with just enough acidity to keep a level of freshness through the finish.

title: Westerly 2014 Cote Blonde Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Blackberry-sorbet, teriyaki, candied-purple-flower and dark-chocolate-syrup aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which is starting to show a touch of age already. Framed by chalky tannins, the palate combines tangy black-plum fruit with roasted coffee, caramel and peppery spice.

title: Hess Collection 2016 Panthera Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a new offering from the producer—a lush expression that offers bold flavors and texture. With complementary oak, it offers rich layers of crème brûlée, caramel and apple, all dusted in nutmeg.

title: Bennett Lane 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a big bold wine, layered in concentrated flavors of cassis and red currant that present as sanguine and woody. Gritty, sizable tannins add intensity and boldness to the hugely ripe style of the wine.

title: Buena Vista 2016 Jovita's Selection Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a well-made, full-bodied white that delivers honeyed flavors of salted pretzel and toasted oak. The bolder richer elements are complemented by bright bursts of orange blossom, grapefruit and lemon pith.

title: Corley 2014 Tietjen Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This wine has a classic herbal element of sage, sous-bois and mint, tucked within soft layers of integrated tannin and oak. Medium bodied, it shines in rich blue fruit and a lasting note of clove.

title: Coursey Graves 2016 Bennett Mountain Estate Red (Bennett Valley)
description: From an estate vineyard this combines 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon. Together, they offer a broad, succulent experience of strawberry and cassis that's bright and full bodied, with an underlying density that finishes dipped in leather and black pepper.

title: Montagne Russe 2017 Spring Hill Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stemmy in earthy bark, cola and tea, this wine has spicy acidity and a soft, textured midpalate of moderate weight. The finish is nutty and subdued.

title: St. Francis 2016 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This is an appealing red wine, juicy and soft in layers of baked plum with an oaky backbone. Accents of cedar and dried herb round out its full-figured profile of concentrated density.

title: St. Supéry 2018 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Strong in dried herb, lemongrass and pea shoots, this is a robust, rounded and richly composed white from the estate vineyard, showy in oak, peach and green apple.

title: Abbot's Passage 2015 Steel Plow Vineyard Points Unknown Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: This combines 41% Grenache, 36% Mourvèdre and 23% Syrah into a dense, rustic and tannic undertaking of meat, black pepper and leather. Around the edges you find lavender and compost providing an earthy contrast to the weight and breadth of flavor.

title: Bear Flag 2017 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Spicy with bright red fruit, this is a rich, succulent and rounded wine with a jammy core of fruit and vanilla. Accents of leather, black pepper and cinnamon complement the concentrated fruit.

title: Bear Flag NV Eureka Red (California)
description: This full-bodied blend of eight varieties is serious, despite being a nonvintage offering. It is concentrated in flavor and firm in texture, wrapped in grippy tannins that frame blackberry and black-cherry flavors.

title: Brecon Estate 2018 Last Sandwich White (Central Coast)
description: Green-pear and apple-rind aromas show on this unique blend of Viognier and Albariño. There is solid acidity on the sip, where lime and green-apple flavors compete for attention.

title: Cannonball 2016 Eleven Merlot (Sonoma County)
