description: Herbal and savory in pencil shavings, cedar and crayon wax, this is a powerfully built and quite tannic rendition of the variety, blended with 6% Petite Sirah. The fruit is jammy and densely packed.

title: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry jam, loamy earth, cocoa and a hint of lilac show on the nose of this bottling. The palate lands with density, carrying flavors of dried berry, dried herbs and mint.

title: Dante Robere 2016 Claude's Cuvée Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a showy, chocolaty, oaky blend of Syrah and Touriga grapes that's rich in texture and packed with dark fruit and smoky spice flavors. It's dramatic and almost sweet, having been aged for 18 months in 60% new French oak barrels.

title: Danza del Sol 2014 Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)
description: New leather, dried red cherry and red-plum aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is decent tension to the sip, where leathery flavors of tobacco and earth meet with dried cherry fruit.

title: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of wet gravel, lemon peel, citrus pith and green pear show on the nose of this bottling. There is a pleasant stony quality to the sip, where red-apple, light nectarine and peach-blossom flavors converge.

title: Dubost 2016 Siletto Vineyard Cabernet Pfeffer (San Benito County)
description: This rarely found grape is fascinating to taste, although this version is so ripe that much of the varietal nuance is shadowed by style. Strawberry-jam, hickory-smoke and cinnamon-stick aromas lead into a rich palate of cracked peppercorn and jammy fruits.

title: Felten Cellars 2015 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Soil, slate, cracked peppercorn and old leather aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines those elements with tobacco leaf and hearty blue fruit, which grows a tad sour toward the finish.

title: Granite Lion 2016 Chardonnay (South Coast)
description: Ripe apple and orange aromas meet with a touch of walnut on the nose of this bottling from near the Mexican border. A full palate is flavored with touches of hazelnut, lemon butter and yellow peach, framed by a waxy texture. Drink soon and oxidation seems forthcoming.

title: Jalama 2016 La Presa Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Ripe aromas of cassis and blackberry juice make for a slightly tangy nose on this bottling. There's a touch of blackberry balsamic sauce to the sip, which is dusted with black pepper and framed with strong acidity and a firm tannic texture.

title: Kivelstadt Cellars 2018 Wayward Son Orange Bonfiglio White (Mendocino County)
description: This amber-colored wine offers wonderful, fresh peach and melon aromas, then tightens up on the palate as grape-skin tannins and nervy acidity take hold. It's a bit stiff as a pre-meal drink but it can be paired with rich fish, fowl or meat dishes where its gripping texture will be a good asset.

title: Louis M. Martini 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Cedar, spice and dried herb hit the nose of this robust, densely concentrated red wine that is full bodied and unabashedly ripe in style. Black currant and blackberry take on a jammy quality that will appeal to fans of rich roundedness.

title: OVR NV Old Vine Red (California)
description: Very fruity—almost jammy—aromas and flavors make this medium-bodied Zinfandel-based blend plush and soft to sip. Blackberry and blueberry nuances ride a rich texture and dark chocolate emerges on the finish.

title: Peachy Canyon 2017 Westside Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Canned cherries and red plums cast a red fruit net across the pleasant nose of this widely available, fairly priced bottling. Spicy tones of nutmeg and dried ginger give depth to the cherry-sauce flavors.

title: Longoria 2017 Lovely Rita Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Crisp blackberry aromas meet with a strong earthy streak of muddy soil on the nose of this bottling. Rounded flavors of mulberry, blistered red plum and dried flower petals arise on the sip, where a fine-tuned acidity is ever-present but not overdone.

title: Cartograph 2013 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a scintillatingly focused, dry and razor-sharp sparkling wine, made predominantly from Chardonnay, with just a splash of Pinot. Peach, strawberry and oyster shell combine on a bright, pleasing palate. Disgorged in 2018.

title: Schramsberg 2015 Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Bold in texture and flavor, this wine offers toasty, lightly smoky aromas that segue to vanilla, toasted almond and baked apple flavors. The pinpoint bubbles tighten the texture just a bit for good balance before a creamy midpalate and finish take over.
designation: Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Blanc de Noirs

title: Beringer 2016 Bancroft Ranch Merlot (Howell Mountain)
description: Sanguine with fruity flavors of currant and cassis, this is a hearty, full-bodied and substantially ripe red, lush on the palate with a succulent texture. It has aspects of forest sage, dusty rock, cocoa powder that highlight mountain tannin structure and bold oak.

title: Hendry 2016 Blocks 7&22 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of white pepper and lavender lead to a robust, meaty palate. Blackberry, graphite and oak round out the balanced, powerful foundation that's supported by firm tannins.

title: Laetitia 2016 Brut de Blancs Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Linear and alkaline aromas of crushed white rock meet with lemon-pith brightness on the nose of the bottling. It's laser-sharp on the palate, with lemon and lime juice as well as Asian pear flavors making for a tart expression.

title: Monlieff 2018 Rosé of Grenache (Central Coast)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling is shy on the delicate nose with touches of melon rind and peach that slowly emerge. There is tremendous tension to the sip, with enlivening flavors of underripe nectarine, white-melon rind and pithy lime.

title: Testarossa 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Roasted red cherry, turned earth, dark mint and sage show on the vibrant nose of this bottling from one of the more coveted vineyards in California. There's ample sagebrush flavors on the palate, followed by bright and snappy red-fruit flavors that ride a vibrant acidity into the finish.

title: Furthermore 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of pomegranate, crushed slate and dried oregano on the nose. Potpourri and dried strawberry flavors pop on the elegantly woven palate, which finishes on hibiscus and rooibos tea.

title: Hahn 2017 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: This wine delivers pleasing aromas of blackberry jam, smoke and turned soil, leading to a palate loaded with black cherry, cocoa spice and light mint flavors. Solid tannins and fresh acidity complete the picture.

title: Ordaz Family Wines 2018 Maus Vineyard Rosé (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This vineyard-designate is made from 70% Mourvèdre and 30% Grenache, the grapes having gone direct to press and then stainless-steel fermented. It works in its complex marriage of dry, crisp acidity and meaty undertones true to the varieties. Exotic lemon peel, strawberry and sage also figure in.

title: Buck Shack 2017 Small Batch Sustainably Farmed Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: This full-bodied wine has plenty of dark berry and cherry notes, a touch of black olive and a big structure of firm, fine-grained tannins. Deft oak accents spice up the palate and linger on the finish. Best through 2025.

title: Thompson 31fifty Wine 2017 Ponzo Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is intensely fragrant in wild, brambly blackberry and cinnamon, the palate richly round and soft. Smooth tannins provide a subtle structure and grace to the whole, which is balanced, elegant and well integrated.

title: Mirabelle NV Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)
description: This wine is delicious but subtle as it weaves tempting notes of raspberry and cream with toasted nut and baked bread nuances that provide complexity and layering. It has both a vivid crispness and a subtle smoothness that coats the mouth and helps the finish linger.

title: DRNK 2018 Wildwood Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This stainless-steel white offers tones of jasmine and peach, with lingering flecks of lime and grapefruit. The acidity is fresh, lively and well balanced.

title: Gibbs 2015 Three Clones Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with a sizable percentage of Merlot, this soft, beguiling and likable red is flinty and dusty, with brooding, earthy sanguine notes. Amidst the flint and dust is a bright undercurrent of acidity that keeps if fresh and lively.

title: Auteur Wines 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This light-bodied, elegantly crafted white is composed, structured and floral, with an exotic hint of bay leaf on the nose that persists on the palate. Green apple, olive and brine combine effortlessly across the quiet, integrated oak.

title: Emerald Hare 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: Good structure and plenty of black-fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine a good choice. It shows judicious balancing of blackberry and black cherry with seductive oak accents and supported by a moderate layer of fine-grained tannins for a mouthwatering texture.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Hawk Creek Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This big, bold and concentrated wine packs in opulent berry, cherry and tobacco flavors that go deep and wide. Attractive and well-integrated oak spices add an extra dimension while the mouthwatering flavors spread across the palate.

title: Merry Edwards 2017 Bucher Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a full-flavored, full-bodied wine that shows upfront power and intensity in aromas of black tea, forest floor and wild strawberry. The palate brings black cherry and blackberry richness, with enough juicy acidity to cut through the grippy tannins.

title: Mathew Bruno 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Aged entirely in new French and American barrels, this 100% varietal wine is juicy, broad and expansive on the palate, as well as firm and grippy in tannin. Blue fruit and dark cherry meet integrated vanilla and nutmeg seasoning from the oak.

title: Red Car 2015 Platt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tangy and tart in acidity, this coastal-grown wine is thick in developed tannins, enveloping the delicate red and citrus fruit within. Black tea and a spiciness of oak linger on the light-bodied finish.

title: Theorize 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an earthy wine, elegant in structure and style, with moderate ripeness and body weight. Cinnamon, plum and black licorice highlight integrated oak and firm tannin.

title: Bella Grace 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This silky but full-bodied wine was made from a non-irrigated, 50-year-old vineyard. It tastes ripe and generous, offering ample berry aromas and grapey plummy flavors. It's big and mouthcoating but not very tannic, keeping the texture smooth and soft.

title: Brassfield 2017 Pinot Gris (High Valley)
description: Fresh herbs and fragrant pine aromas lead to a crisp, vivid citrus flavor in this medium-bodied, well-balanced wine. Bright acidity keeps the mouthfeel vibrant while the satisfying fruit and herb flavors linger on the palate.

title: Chronic Cellars 2017 Sofa King Bueno Red (Paso Robles)
description: There's a fascinating amount of sharp cinnamon on the fresh-smelling nose of this blend of 52% Syrah, 21% Grenache, 12% Petite Sirah, 8% Tannat and 7% Mourvèdre. The palate also offers that red spice but with energetic black-plum flavors as well, all clinging to a sticky texture.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2016 Two Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Rich aromas of nutmeg and vanilla spice up the dark red-currant and cranberry aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with black-plum, sharp cedar and gingerbread flavors.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Eastern Bench Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a well-made, estate-driven combination of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Malbec, 15% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. Flavors of plum, dark cherry, cola and clove cover the smooth, seductive palate, with the oak and tannins that are fully integrated to provide an approachable outcome.

title: Falkner 2015 Vintner's Reserve Estate Grown Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)
description: A concentrated kirsch aroma meets with baked soil and a hint of rose petal on the nose of this bottling by Duncan Williams. There is a tarry grip to the palate, which offers flavors of tangy Morello cherry and a light char.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 Cassata Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Robust aromas of blackberry and baking spice rise from an oaky, juicy wine, thick and velvety in texture. Rich, full-bodied style benefits from cola and a fresh pinch of acidity.

title: Loring Wine Company 2017 River Quinn Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: This whimsically labeled wine by Brian Loring offers great quality at a more affordable price. Aromas of hazelnut, cashew, seared marshmallow and light flint lead into a bold palate of poached apple, lemon curd and sweet oak.

title: Opolo 2016 Reserve Collection Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This bottling starts off somewhat mellow on the nose, with blackberry jam, oak and licorice aromas. The palate, however, is bombastic, sure to please lovers of big Zins but scare away those seeking subtlety. Ripe flavors of black cherry and vanilla ice cream are most prominent.

title: Sottomarino 2014 Primitivo (Lake County)
description: Ripe and concentrated black-fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine a good sense of depth, while firm tannins make it grippy on the palate. It's big and bold, ready to pair with rich indulgent dishes.

title: Thirty-Seven 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine offers tremendous value and is impressively made, brimming with balanced layers of black cherry, cola and black tea. With a forest earthiness nipping at the fruit, it's fleshy and integrated, with a smooth mouthfeel and spicy finish.

title: Toybox Wine Cellars 2015 Cadden Family Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dark fruit and chocolaty richness are at the heart of this robust wine. Cedar and oak complement the flavors of baked black cherry and blackberry on the palate, giving a rich feel to this enjoyable wine.

title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Z Cuvée Blanc White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Nectarine, honey, peach syrup and a light caramel touch shows on the nose of this blend of 54% Roussanne, 35% Grenache Blanc and 11% Viognier. It's quite dry and sharp on the sip, starting with tense, rocky flavors that lead into white peach, lime peel and a hint of pineapple.

title: Brophy Clark 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of baked apples, cinnamon, French toast and singed sandalwood show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a strongly aggressive sizzle of acidity on the sip, followed by squeezed lemon and grapefruit-peel flavors.

title: Acumen 2015 Peak Edcora Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Jammy blackberry and dark chocolate mark the midpalate richness of this wine, which is blended with 6% Petit Verdot and 4% Cabernet Franc, all of the grapes estate-grown. Dusty dried herb makes a statement on the nose as the lean, elegant style comes to the fore.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate GiGi's Red (Contra Costa County)
description: This smooth, lush wine made from mostly Barbera and Zinfandel has a distinctive fruit character in the aroma and flavor that's reminiscent of wild blackberries. Hints of dried herbs and fresh earth add complexity. Relatively full bodied, it is light in tannins and rich in mouthfeel.

title: Dancing Crow 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: This wine tastes old school in a good way, revealing the traditional black-olive and herb nuances of California Cabernet grown in cool climates. It has good depth, a nicely firm texture and lingering fruit and herb notes on the finish.

title: Thomas George 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy and funky, this wine comes from the producer's four estate vineyards. Pear and Gravenstein apple give it flavor before an uninspired finish of simple length.

title: Contour 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a workman-like weekday wine that is medium bodied and has an appetizing balance. A flinty matchstick aroma leads to good lean red-cherry and cranberry flavors and a touch of grippy tannin.

title: Korbel NV Sweet Cuveé Sparkling (California)
description: This smooth and bubbly wine has a brassy color, baking-spice aromas and semisweet, nutty baking-spice flavors. It will be good to pair with a fruity dessert or biscotti.

title: Girard 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy and tannic, this robust expression of baked blueberry and blackberry has an underlying softness that's hard to resist and makes it rounded and approachable.

title: Greystone 2015 Merlot (California)
description: A sweet-seeming, spicy oak character carries this medium-bodied wine from a smoky aroma to meaty, fruity flavors and a touch of strawberry jam. It's rather soft in texture and low in tannins and acidity.

title: Twisted 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Smoke and flint meet with sour lemons on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows similar qualities, proving both nutty and tangy at once.

title: Archimedes 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec, this red is dull on the nose with a touch of astringency. The red fruit is a mix of currant and black cherry, with a full-bodied ripeness front and center.

title: Bonterra 2017 Young Red (Mendocino County)
description: This fresh-tasting wine has bright, candy-like fruit aromas, jammy but not sweet red-cherry flavors along with touches of vanilla and butter. It is light to medium in body and has just a nip of tannin for texture.

title: City Winery Chicago 2016 Elevated Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Anise, lemon and apple combine for a tart entry of sharp linear freshness and focus in this light-bodied white. Moderate texture complements the high tones.

title: Highway 12 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Moderate in flavor and body weight, this wine has a medium build and integrated use of oak. The flavors roundly present as a mix of apple, pear and nutmeg.

title: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This wine has a touch of matchstick on first whiff, and brings a combo of fruit, spice and flint aromas followed by straightforward fruit and light oak notes. Medium body and light tannins complete the picture.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2016 Grapeful Red (California)
description: This is a smooth, rich, fruity and chocolaty wine with a hint of sweetness. Plum-jam, blackberry-syrup and vanilla flavors flood the palate while a soft, almost tannin-free texture makes it seem like a dessert.

title: Steele 2017 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Floral in apple and orange blossom, this is an oaky, thick and earthy white wine. Barrel-fermented, it has a rich tropical character that's approachable and pleasing.

title: Puma Road 2014 Pedregal Vineyard Chardonnay (Paicines)
description: Sour aromas of pear cider meet with toast and roasted nuts on the nose of this bottling. It's quite tart on the palate, where lime zest and grapefruit flavors converge.

title: Blatty 2015 Tannat (California)
description: Roasted red-plum, charred wood and grape-seed aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tangy with plum-skin flavors and a bit of dried sagebrush.

title: Campos NV Estate Grown Sparkling Rosé (Contra Costa County)
description: This rosé has quite a bit of red-wine character in the aromas and flavors, and a noticeable sweet streak on the palate that further softens its already pillowy texture.

title: Paris Valley Road 2016 Zinfandel (California)
description: Fairly ripe and extracted aromas of blackberry jam, caramel sauce and coffee syrup show on the nose of this bottling. It is superripe and jammy and cooked on the palate, which is thick, extracted and fairly tannic.

title: The Drop NV Red (California)
description: This soft and lightly sweet wine has aromas like raspberry and cherry jam, ripe berry flavors and a medium body. It is simple and approachable, especially for people who don't like dry wines.

title: Happy Camper 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Grapy and straightforward, this medium-bodied wine has plenty of fresh and simple fruit aromas, jammy flavors and a soft texture.

title: Tipp Rambler NV Pinot Noir Sparkling Rosé (California)
description: This wine has a bright coral color, vivid aromas of red cherries, and bittersweet flavors of vanilla, butter and sour cherries. The bubbles are frothy and mouth filling.

title: Sola 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Lemon peels and apple rinds meet with steely, almost ashy aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a good sizzle at first to the palate, which moves into apple-blossom, sour lime and toasted nuts flavors.

title: Vigilance 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This ripe and expressive wine exudes an earthy, black-fig aroma, then rich and concentrated black-cherry and dried date flavors are accented by spicy, wet earth and oak notes and a mouthfeel shaped by velvety tannins.

title: Castle Rock 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: There's a touch of fizz to the glass of this twist-top bottling, which indicates a freshness that shows in the snappy berry aromas on the nose. The palate offers herbal touches of tobacco against tangy dark-red fruits. The body is somewhat thin but the overall experience is pleasurable.

title: Kenwood 2015 Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a tannic, oaky entry that persists on the midpalate to reveal full-bodied concentration. Crunchy red-fruit takes on a cherry-cola character that's lush and round.

title: Kunde 2017 Block 4SB20 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is from an estate-grown block at 300-feet in elevation. It is an intense take on the variety that's crisp and refreshing in flinty petrol, lemon and melon.

title: Olelo 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Fresh aromas of yellow pear, sharp lime and a hint of crushed white rocks show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with lime flavors reminiscent of a margarita, along with toasted oak.

title: Seven Angels 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Caramel, chocolate and violet paste make for a very ripe aroma set on the nose of this bottling. It's thick on the palate, with heavy blackberry and fudge flavors, framed by firm tannins.

title: Silverpoint Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)
description: The grapes for this wine come from the Rodgers Creek Vineyard in the new appellation. This is a hearty barrel-fermented white that's lush and luxurious, moderate in oak with big flavors of marshmallow, peach and vanilla.

title: Gratus 2017 Estate Grown White (Napa Valley)
description: Thick, robust and full bodied, this white is intensely flavored in sweet peach, with a gritty texture that lingers in steely acidity.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Brutus Private Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Slightly sour boysenberry aromas meet with caramel, fudge and oak on the nose of this blend of Petite Sirah, Syrah and Zinfandel. Oaky flavors dominate the palate, where cooked berries and caramel lean a little bit sweet yet remain pleasurable.

title: Olelo 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe cranberry sorbet, orange peel and a pinch of tarragon show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit tangy with strawberry-balsamic flavors and a pinch of herbs.

title: Clos La Chance 2017 Murphy's Choice Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Broad aromas of poached pear, clotted cream, cashew and a hint of toasted brioche show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is clean although very light in flavor, offering green-pear and key lime pie touches.

title: Dark Horse NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: Light, dry and very crisp, this wine has aromas and flavors like Pippin apples and a lean appetizing texture. It shows plenty of good, bracing acidity, rather low alcohol and a bone-dry finish.

title: K Squared Cellars 2016 Merlot (Russian River Valley)
description: Smoky in oak, this soft, round and medium-bodied red is a mix of blackberry and black cherry, with tart acidity lurking in the background. Smooth integrated tannins support without distraction.

title: Lobo 2016 Howl Wulff Vineyards Custom Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 65% Syrah, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this tastes of caramel toffee and red cherry, and is sizable in weight and ripeness. The structure is moderate and the wine softly approachable.

title: Ravel & Stitch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Concentrated black-currant aromas lead into charred oak and wood-ash aromas on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 12% Petite Sirah, 4% Merlot, 4% Petit Verdot and 3% Malbec. The palate is a bit tart and sour with black-plum skin flavors at first, but then a black-cherry richness shines through alongside singed tobacco.

title: Bell 2015 Merlot (Yountville)
description: Dusty tobacco and dark chocolate are buoyed by big expansive tannins in this full-bodied, bulky and brawny wine. Smoky oak and dried herb with cedar round out the profile.

title: Dark Horse NV Brut Rosé (California)
description: This wine is nicely balanced, delicate and appealing, with light body, subtle cherry flavors and tiny bubbles that give a seamless texture. It was made with 55% Pinot Noir, 37% Chardonnay and the remainder other grape varieties.

title: Longwood 2016 Family Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is woody and herbal on the nose, thick and grippy on the palate, a study in black fruit intensity and sizable tannin.

title: Grady Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine has an aroma like new leather and balsam that leads to warm maple, brown sugar and stewed plum flavors. It's tasty and enjoyable in an offbeat way.

title: Three Sticks 2017 Origin Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is aged in a majority of concrete egg (71%), as well as stainless steel. Bright and floral in lemony texture, it has great wraparound acidity that gives it a persistence of freshness and a bite of stony mineral that lingers for considerable length on the impressive palate. This vintage marks the 20th year of owning the Durell Vineyard for Three Sticks owner Bill Price.

title: Aperture 2016 Del Rio Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine offers juicy red fruit on the nose, with background layers of mocha and vanilla. The palate offers a velvety concentration of berry fruits that are supported by a rich, strucutred profile.

title: Aperture 2016 Oliver Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Aromas of pencil shavings, cedar and violet show brightly in this vineyard-designate wine. The palate is robustly concentrated and fleshy, its tannins firm and well integrated. Mocha, plum and blueberry define the fruit components that shine alongside plenty of underlying acidity.

title: Orfila 2016 Sequestered Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Deep and dark aromas of black cherry, mint chocolate chip and oak are extremely intense and pleasurable on the nose. There is depth of flavor to the palate, where ripe raspberries and mulberries meet with tart red currants, tangy pine needles and forest floor.

title: Silenus 2017 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: This impressive white is sourced from grapes grown at the coveted Red Hen Vineyard. Full bodied and well balanced, it integrates its oak and power well, allowing room for vibrant acidity to boost the fleshy layers of red apple, Meyer lemon and toasted vanilla.

title: Caliza 2016 Azimuth Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Impressive aromas of roasted cocoa, cappuccino charred beef and cassis rise to the fore on the nose of this blend of 40% Grenache, 36% Mourvèdre and 24% Syrah. The palate pops with bright blackberry and black-cherry flavors, framed by a gravelly tannic tension and seasoned with hints of fennel and beef jerky. The finish is quite long.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Names Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black plum, violets and oak aromas come in wave after wave on the nose of this bottling, which features the names of the people who have helped Scott Sampler along the way. There are layers of dried purple flowers and tea leaves on the palate along with elderflowers, jasmine and more black plum.

title: Parrish Family 2016 Four Chords Red (Adelaida District)
description: Focused aromas of black currant, turned soil, toasty oak and dried herbs show on the nose of this blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Cabernet Franc, 10% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot. There is tremendous intensity on the palate, where the black-cherry flavors are cut by pencil shavings and peppercorns, with a penetrating acid that carries into the cocoa-powder finish.

title: Robert John 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a reserve wine worthy of its designation, blended with small amounts of Malbec and Petit Verdot. Soft layers of red currant and cassis highlight a full-bodied palate of integrated tannin and oak, offering plenty of length and expanse as dots of clove and cedar form.

title: The Calling 2016 Sunny View Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This gorgeous wine has a crisp entry of sumptuous cherry and strawberry laced in orange. It's lively and vibrant with just a layering of lightly spiced cardamom and cola. Not shy, it nonetheless retains a graceful sensibility within its powerful frame of bold brawny extroversion.

title: Ancien 2016 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine has a beautiful bouquet of smoky cherry, forest floor and tea aromas that follow through to the medium-bodied palate. A jolt of orange peel helps to highlight the lifted, integrated acidity that wraps around the robust body.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Estrella Rivers Behind the Purple Door Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Extremely complex aromas of smashed menthol in muddy earth mix with blackberry paste and soy sauce make for a wild nose on this bottling by extended maceration wizard Scott Sampler. Violet and black-currant flavors run into mint on the creamy, unique and ultimately delicious palate.
designation: Estrella Rivers Behind the Purple Door

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Variations on a Clone Op. 1 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This examination of the clone 1 of Syrah starts with aromas of cassis, acai and black plum on the nose. There is a compelling mix of lilac, crushed slate and rounded black plum to the palate as well as a touch of dark-chocolate sauce, proving quite layered and yet precise in flavors.

title: Falcone 2017 Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Beautiful aromas of black cherry, caramel, sea salt and roasted pork make for a very delicious and immediately accessible nose on this bottling. The roasted and smoked meat flavors show on the palate as well, with black-currant and acai fruit aspects driving into the lush finish.

title: Flanagan 2017 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is great Ritchie Vineyard wine, gorgeously profiled in caramelized oak and a nutty lushness that's hard to resist. Full bodied with waves of fresh acidity, it delivers nuance amidst a fleshy, tropical power of fruit and layering.

title: Joseph Phelps 2016 Quarter Moon Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Structured and lively in fresh acidity, this is an impressive wine from an impressive vintage, made from grapes grown in the foggy wilds of Freestone. Broad, baked fruit flavors of pomegranate, strawberry and orange peel give it additional brightness and length, complex within a soft-balanced frame of underlying delicacy.

title: Kokomo 2017 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is vibrant and layered with accents of spicy oak. Salt, wet stone and pretzel flavors are complemented by more traditional notions of green apple and pear, with flourishes of hazelnut and vanilla on the close.

title: Fringe Collective 2016 Rockbound Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Bold aromas of cherry, smoked wood and dried sage make for a fully fleshed-out nose. The palate shows a great array of flavors, from dark strawberry and boysenberry to sagebrush, bay leaf and peppercorns.

title: Lynmar 2018 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers pure strawberry and watermelon flavors, with a smidgen of dried herb. It's gorgeously inviting and irresistibly enjoyable. It persists in fresh, vibrant acidity and a well-honed structure.

title: Realm Cellars 2016 The Bard Red (Napa Valley)
description: The Bard is 85% Cabernet Sauvignon this vintage, and the producer's largest production wine, which still is small and devoted to detail. Sweet red-cherry-liqueur flavor meets a grippy herbal undertone of forceful weight and power, the structure balanced and complex, yet immediately enjoyable.

title: Davis Bynum 2016 Jane's VIneyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy in blue and black fruit, this is a thick, tangy and savory wine. Clove, forest floor and black tea play supporting roles on the palate. It's rich and will satisfy fans of a richer style of Pinot.

title: Altvs 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a grippy, dense and powerful red, blended with 5% Petit Verdot. Approachable in its youth, it shows strong flavors of red currant, cherry and coconut, with a lushness that lingers on the finish.

title: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Aromatically, vanilla oak supports a medium-bodied ripeness of baked pineapple and lemon curd—viscous richness that works in the context of its balanced acidity.

title: Big Basin 2015 Coastview Vineyard Terraces Syrah (Monterey County)
description: Intense waves of black currant, elderberry, lavender and tar show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high above the eastern flanks of the Salinas Valley. The palate is framed by solid tannins and acid, offering very ripe black-currant flavors that are ready to drink now.

title: Binz 2017 White Grenache (Fiddletown)
description: A dance between tangy acidity and a creamy texture plays out wonderfully in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It offers fresh citrus aromas and generous apple and honeydew melon flavors while the mouthfeel is broad and smooth.

title: Christophe 2015 Explorer's Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: This wine opens in cedar and dried herb earthiness and swiftly expands into a world of broad, exuberant red cherry and cassis. It balances its full-bodied power with grace and dusty oak, the tannins relatively tamed.

title: Concannon 2017 Reserve Assemblage Blanc White (Livermore Valley)
description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon is a savory feast of mineral, herb and consommé flavors on a firm structure of good acidity and medium to full body. It's hearty, mouthfilling, a bit boisterous and quite satisfying to sip.

title: Criss Cross 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: Oak spiciness lights up the bouquet and flavors of this full-bodied firmly tannic wine. It's not as heavy in alcohol as some, but is very rich in flavors of black plums and blackberries, black pepper and light oak char, and has a good, grippy texture.

title: Dutton Estate 2017 Kylie's Cuvée Dutton Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Fresh, focused and herbal, this robustly ripe white has strong flavors of apricot, green apple and pineapple. The fruit is sourced from the family's Shop Block Vineyard, planted to the Mosque clone, as well as from the Mrs. George Vineyard near its Home Ranch. It develops fleshy elements of tropical splendor as it opens in the glass.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Winemaker Series Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)
description: Aromas of candied lemon rind, lime leaf, Granny Smith apple and crushed granite show on the nose of this bottling by the Gallo family. The palate is smooth in feel, with flavors of apple skin, grapefruit and squeezed lime.

title: Experience 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This might be the best value in the appellation: a beautifully structured wine that's brimming in blackberry and plum flavors with a medium-bodied elegant approach. Soft velvety texture gives it additional appeal as it finishes in baking spice and clove.

title: Faust 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tremendous value for the quality—a youthful tightly wound wine that's still thick and tannic, with a heavy thread of leather, gunpowder and oak. Savory and substantial, it has secondary seasonings of sage and cedar that contrast well against black currant and cherry.

title: Frank Family 2015 Owner's Red (Rutherford)
description: This is a big bottle made to mark the winery's 25th anniversary. Integrated, rich and well-structured, it merits its purpose, offering dusty mineral notes around a softness of oak, clove, cedar and chocolate toffee.

title: Kokomo 2015 Ruth's Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a brawny and broad reserve-level wine that's grippy and dusty in tannins. Powerful red fruit matches the rich concentration, the acidity textured and well-integrated to offer complementary brightness in contrast to the big flavor.

title: Louis M. Martini 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is lighthearted and approachable yet structured, with earthy elements of turned earth and dried herb. The palate is grippy in tannin and dark in blackberry and chocolate flavors.

title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa County)
description: This is made from 80% Pinot Noir, the remainder Chardonnay. It offers inviting aromas of strawberry and orange around a tightly structured layering of flavor and bright acidity.

title: Neyers 2015 AME Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a Conn Valley vineyard estate and 100% varietal, this wine is tightly wound and full bodied, reflective of the vintage and the warmer climes. It is intensely flavored and dense, grippy in leathery tannin and oak power, with a dusting of dried herb and graphite.

title: Paratus 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Juicy with just a slight touch of reduction, this wine is thick and well-integrated—a small-production offering that reflects well on the appellation. Plum, black cherry and hints of black licorice toy with the nose and palate, finishing in balance and grace.

title: Red Car 2015 Vivio Vineyard Roussanne (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a well-made version of the rare variety—oily and floral with a gritty underbelly of texture. Apple, rose water and lemon provide an exotic framework of balanced acidity and crispness.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Green Label Sangiacomo Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This has both lush tannin and tangy acidity, the two complementing each other well along a full-bodied offering of strawberry, forest floor and black tea. Savory on the nose, it remains tart on the palate in a finish of rhubarb.

title: Tenshen 2018 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A pale shade of pink, this rosé offers soft bubblegum aromas along with freshly peeled lemon skins. The texture is very chalky at first, then opens up to reveal sour grapefruit and red-plum-skin flavors.

title: Bridlewood 2016 Block 7 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crumpled lilacs, damp wood and blackberry aromas show on the nose of this block designate from the Gallo brand. Light sandalwood flavors meet with blackberry, dried purple flowers and charred oak on the palate.

title: Calcareous 2016 Lloyd of Calcareous Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep aromas of black currant and violet buds show on the nose of this blend of 46% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Merlot, 14% Cabernet Franc, 10% Malbec and 6% Petit Verdot. The palate is very full with flavors of blackberry, Concord grape, cedar and smoke, with a slightly tangy edge.

title: Deovlet 2015 Sonny Boy Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This blend of 78% Merlot and 22% Cabernet Sauvignon is subtle on the nose at first, where aromas of boysenberry compote meet with oregano, marjoram and pencil shavings. Black plum arises on the palate alongside minty herbs, earthy mushroom and savory peppercorn flavors.

title: Gnarly Head 2017 1924 Double Black Limited Edition Red (Lodi)
description: This smooth, almost silky, wine shows a beautiful black-fruit tone, with a full-bodied frame and a light touch of tannins. It has plenty of black cherry and blackberry flavors accented by baking spices.

title: Kings Carey 2018 Spear Vineyards Rosé of Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A deeper shade of pink in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of orange rind and sour cherry compote on the nose. The palate is more earthy and complex than a typical rosé, with muddled sour cherry, damp herbs and dried red fruit flavors.

title: LangeTwins 2018 Woods 01 Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Jahant)
description: This is a traditional style of Sauvignon made from the Musque clone and emphasizing unabashed grassy, herbaceous aromas and crisp citrus-like flavors on a nicely acidic texture. It tastes refreshing and food friendly.

title: Skinner 2016 Dry Diggings Red (El Dorado)
description: Touches of vanilla and toasted baguette in the aroma give way to crisp but ripe cherry and raspberry flavors and a lively firm texture in this full-bodied wine.

title: Thomas Allen 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: A hint of pink shows in the straw color of this bold and dry wine. It offers oaky toasted nut aromas, a broad palate of Bosc pear, walnut and dried fig flavors on a full body and weighty texture. While on the reserved side now, this should be best after 2022.

title: Two Roads 2015 Crossroad Red (Amador County)
description: This big and balanced wine blends an enticing oak perfume with ample black-fruit flavors and a firm structure of moderate tannins and good acidity. It is medium to full bodied and has generous, ripe flavors that don't go over the top.

title: Alara 2017 Chardonnay (San Benito)
description: Creamy aromas of crème brûlée meet with crisp nectarine, citrus and hazelnut on the nose of this rich bottling. The palate shows a lot of oak influence, with more hazelnut and pecan as well as smoky butter flavors.

title: District 7 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: This wine starts with aromas of roasted red cherry, wild tarragon and dried spearmint on the nose. The earthy flavors extend onto the palate, where flavors of ripe black plum and wild berry meet with more herbs.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Candied red-cherry, mace and oregano aromas show on the fruit and likable nose of this bottling. Smoke and candied cherry flavors appear on the palate, which is full of roasted and dark-fruit flavors.

title: Fesstivity 2016 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling, which is two-thirds Pinot Noir and one-third Chardonnay, shows very toasty aromas on the nose, with a zesty kick of preserved lemon. The mousse is fairly mellow on the sip, where tangy lemon and yellow-apple flavors dominate.

title: Maggio 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: While hardly a weakling, this fresh and flavorful wine is lighter than usual for the variety and ready to enjoy. It has a tempting blackberry aroma, ripe and concentrated black-fruit flavors and a soothing texture full of soft tannins.

title: Morgan 2018 Double L Vineyard Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's a slight fizz in the glass at first on this fresh bottling, which shows chalky, slight petrol aromas on the nose along with Meyer lemon pith and fresh apple sauce. It's very lively on the palate with Key lime pie, ripe red pear flesh and a slight chive-like spice.

title: Noble Vines 2017 667 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Fresh aromas of strawberry, hibiscus and pomegranate are made more complex by hints of hickory and chaparral scrub on the nose of this clonal study. The palate combines berry paste with earthy sagebrush flavors, framed by a grippy texture.

title: Sanan Redmond 2015 Gold Reserve Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Reserved on the nose at first, the blend of all five Bordeaux varieties opens up toward cooked black cherries and mint on the elegant nose. The palate combines dried blackberry with roasted cedar and dried herb flavors.

title: Porch Pounder 2018 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This is a very compelling can of wine, starting with fresh and vibrantly tropical aromas of guava and pineapple chunks. It tightens up a tad on the sip, where lemon-skin flavors take hold. It's great for the beach or lake.

title: Brick & Mortar 2018 Rouge Red (California)
description: This can brings together Cabernet Franc, Pinot Noir and Syrah from Clarksburg, Napa Valley and the Sonoma Coast. With a Gamay-like nose of bright gamy spice, it is both perfumed and tannic, developing over time to show darker denser notes of blackberry.

title: Midnight 2018 Chardonnay (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Lime pith and sharp white-flower aromas kick off this twist-top bottling. The palate is focused and fresh, with very tropical flavors of passion fruit and Key lime pie.

title: Orsi Family 2018 D'Ischia Filomena's Block Biancolella (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Steely structure gives in to fruity layers of apricot, guava and anise in this unusual white. Thick, concentrated body weight is dappled in hazelnut and a lasting hit of heat.

title: Ramona Ranch 2013 Tannat (Ramona Valley)
description: From a region northeast of San Diego comes this wine with deep-black plum, violet and a hint of raisin on the nose. The palate is a bit rustic with rougher tannins yet bright purple fruit and violet flavors, showing interesting potential and promise for the future.

title: Wilson Creek 2018 Winemaker's Select Riesling (Temecula Valley)
description: Sour lime flesh, dried lemon peels and chiseled stone aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate grows a tad sweet, with hints of orange, apple and fruit salad.

title: Worthy 2014 Sophia's Cuvée Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending 64% Cabernet Sauvignon with 20% Merlot and 16% Cabernet Franc, this features tight-grained tannin around soft, plummy and lush black fruit. Moderate structure and length lead to an abbreviated, simple and approachable finish.

title: Bold 2017 Riesling (Arroyo Seco)
description: Strong aromas of orange peel and tangy juice meet with a strong toasty element on the nose of this bottling. Those orange elements stumble a smidgen into the palate, where tangy flavors round out a bit, with broader golden-apple touches.

title: Cobble Creek 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: There's a mix of bright red cherry, smoke, herbs and gravel on the nose of this bottling from organic grapes. The palate is pleasant if simple, with baked cherry, vanilla and plenty of baking spice.

title: Europa Village 2017 Vienza Arneis (Temecula Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling of a rarely planted grape is a bit reductive at first but then opens toward dried lime peels, petrol and dried nectarine. The palate offers honeydew, orange rind and a touch of wild herbs.

title: Joel Gott 2018 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Very light pink in the glass, this bottling starts with fairly aggressive pink-lemonade and strawberry aromas on the fruity nose. The palate is also loaded with fruit, from strawberry to ripe plum and watermelon, set against a gravelly minerality.

title: Joel Gott 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This full-bodied wine is bigger than usual for the varietal, offering very ripe melon aromas, rich flavors and a mouthfilling texture.

title: Love Noir 2017 Satin Red (California)
description: Clean, fruity and dry, this medium-bodied wine will be versatile for different occasions. It's good and well balanced enough for meal-time and has a broadly appealing, plummy flavor that should please a crowd.

title: Petrified Forest Vineyards 2015 Totem Ridge Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: Black cherry, cassis and a thread of sanguine earthiness mark this full-bodied wine, leathery in tannin and texture. It has a rounded approachability and simplicity to the finish.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2016 Merlot (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Candied Bing cherry syrup and other focused red fruits meet with a touch of mint on the nose of this bottling from south of Paso Robles. That cherry concentration meets with menthol and cough-drop flavors on the palate, which is framed by just enough tannins.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2018 Pink Pearl Rosé of Grenache (Livermore Valley)
description: Spicy sandalwood aromas and flavors give this brassy-colored and rather full-bodied wine a more assertive character than many rosés. It tastes plummy, peachy and softly rich in texture.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2018 Family Album Grenache Blanc (San Benito)
description: Dense aromas of lemon-lime soda, apple syrup and kiwi show on the nose of this bottling, whose label features a painting of Princess, the owners' Cavalier King Charles Spaniel. The palate combines broad honeydew with sour lime flavors.

title: Campos 2017 Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: This wine is full bodied, shows good berry flavors and has a rich smooth texture without a lot of tannin.

title: Hahn 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Soft violet and boysenberry aromas consume the nose of this affordably priced bottling. There is decent tension to the palate, where blackberry-pie and vanilla flavors lean toward sweetness.

title: Hierogram 2016 Vineyard 8 Block N Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Full bodied and quite ripe in flavor, this wine has a smoky, grilled veggie aroma followed by a mix of savory and jammy notes.

title: Jeff Runquist 2017 Massoni Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: A sweet raspberry aroma and lavish oak and strawberry-jam flavors make this wine taste like something to pour over ice cream. It's very fruity, medium bodied, smooth in texture and tastes sweet on the finish.

title: Stateland 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County)
description: Grassy and richly rounded in pea shoot and fig, this wine is mild in acidity with an intense, steely finish.

title: 1850 2016 G-S-M (Sierra Foothills)
description: Powerful aromas of beef jerky and hickory smoke lead to equally strong flavors in this extreme-style wine. It's difficult to taste any fruitiness, as the smoky element persist on the palate and finish.

title: mietz 2015 Sodini Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is stinky and earthy in distracting ways, disjointed in acidity and oak, with baked flavors that present as harsh on the palate.

title: Lucia 2017 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rich, clean and powerfully mineral-driven on the nose, this single-vineyard expression shows black cherry, tangy raspberry, crushed slated and damp gravel on the nose. There is tremendous depth of flavor to the intensely elegant palate, where strong but perfectly ripe dark fruits are balanced by tightly woven tannins, fresh acidity and more rock and soil flavors.

title: Laetitia 2016 La Coupelle Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Polished and ripe aromas of black cherry, cardamom, chai spice and wet slate make for a very compelling nose on this top-shelf bottling from the longtime producer in southern San Luis Obispo County. The palate is tense in structure yet widely expressive in flavors, offering black cherry, dark strawberry, slate-driven minerality and more delicious chai spice, all cut by bountiful acidity.

title: Lucia 2017 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Deep, intense aromas of black cherry, loamy soil, bay leaf and the slightest hint of smoke show on the nose of this excellent bottling from the Pisoni family. There are plenty of earthy qualities to the tense palate, from sagebrush to slate-driven minerality, but also inviting tones of Bing cherry and ripe cranberry.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Rochioli-Allen Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers elements of forest floor and nutmeg atop a stony texture. Grapefruit, lime and raspberry flavors offer further intrigue on the palate, providing deliciously inviting fruit components around a core of fresh, lively acidity.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Lancel Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a boldly layered red, savory in earth tones of forest and cardamom. Boysenberry and strawberry flavors combine with a nervy edge for a lush yet fresh package that works on every level. A thirst-quenching thread of acidity persists from start to finish.

title: Laetitia 2016 Les Galets Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of black raspberry and boysenberry are very fresh, ripe and inviting on the nose, and only made more accessible by joyous hints of vanilla. It's bright, energetic and quite ripe on the palate as well, where vibrant acidity and firm tannins carry Bing cherry and mint flavors into a deliciously long finish.

title: Carlisle 2016 Piner-Olivet Ranches Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a first-time blending together of three still-also-separate vineyard-designates (Papera, Carlisle, Montafi) into one cohesive harmonious wine. Hugely aromatic in fresh strawberry, cherry cola and tart fresh slices of citrus, it's a lovely cuveé of tremendous balance and beauty.

title: Cobb 2016 Diane Cobb Coastlands Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Named for the winemaker's late mother, this particular bottling is always a standout. It offers entangled layers of tangerine, strawberry and earthy leather. This is a fine wine to consider cellaring; enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Freeman 2016 Yu-Ki Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A powerful, layered fruit character gives this medium- to full-bodied wine great focus, depth and length. Its core of black berry, currant and cherry is lightly accented by black tea and clove for an almost mysterious mix that is compelling to sip. A brisk texture of fine-grained tannins and nervy acidity completes this superbly balanced and well structured wine. Best from 2023.

title: Wallis Family Estate 2016 Seraphim Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: A 100% varietal wine made by Thomas Rivers Brown, this is abundant in baked plum, cassis and dark currant. Firm tannins wrap around the integrated oak and secondary seasonings of black pepper, licorice and pepper, leaving a fresh, floral finish to ponder. Enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Mueller Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: From a 1,110-foot-high elevation site, this is chalky and waxy in plum, cinnamon, leather and tobacco. It has an underlying richness of chocolate-covered espresso beans and dark cherry that are sustained in balanced complexity and structure. Dusty rock and mineral linger.

title: The Debate 2015 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy baked plum, raisin cake and anise mark the extended entry of this bold big-boned red from the great Oakville site. Softly integrated in tannin and oak, it shows deft layers of cassis, cedar and cigar box, a persistence of woody herbaceousness intriguing and contributing ongoing complexity. Best 2025–2035.

title: Whitcraft 2017 Shokrian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling is redolent with aromas of ripe raspberries, dark sage, peppercorns and the citrusy spice of Japanese sansho pepper. It's very snappy and fresh on the sip with pomegranate and dark -raspberry flavors that are wrapped in a chalky structure and dusted with light herbs.

title: Anaba 2016 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: This is a gorgeous wine, perfumed in rose and candied strawberry and cherry. A touch of vanilla gives a quiet, understated richness beneath a structure of thirst-quenching blood orange, tangerine and black tea, with a seductive cardamom tone. The texture is silky smooth.

title: Cobb 2016 Rice-Spivak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a beautifully made wine, fully able to capture the beauty of coastal influence in a great vintage. Spicy and floral, with a delicate entry, this has nuanced and entangled elements of wild raspberry, lavender, Asian spice and foraged mushroom. A stemmy earthy undercurrent adds energy and continued freshness on the long-lasting finish of forest.

title: Heitz 2013 Trailside Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a certified-organic site in Rutherford and 100% varietal, this wine has benefitted from time in the bottle, dazzling in soft silky red fruit and jolts of nutmeg and dust. Beautifully layered, structured and brightly vibrant, it has impressive coaxings of cigar, cedar and a rich hint of wild vanilla.

title: Stolo 2017 Estate Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This bottling from a vineyard just three miles from the Cambria coast is unique, fascinating and reminiscent of Côte-Rôtie. Aromas of cracked pepper, espresso grinds and smoked berries lead into a palate that's marked with acidity and loaded with spice. Flavors of pepper-roasted coffee-crusted pork meet with black-currant-cream sauce and a pinch of purple flowers.

title: Stone The Crows 2016 Three Twins Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With a mineral-laden opening of iron, earth and crushed rock, this expands on the palate to showcase thick, rich layers of cassis, nutmeg and clove, in addition to classic touches of pencil shaving and cigar box. With a firm tannin structure that's youthful and still evolving, this should be cellared for best enjoyment. Drink 2021–2026.

title: Koehler 2016 Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dense blackberry aromas meet with dark, loamy earth tones on the nose of this estate bottling. There is a vibrant richness to the well-balanced, texturally compelling palate, which is loaded with black-cherry and cigar-box flavors.

title: Koehler 2016 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Nose-filling aromas of plush blackberry and red fruits combine with oak and caramel on the rich nose of this bottling. The palate's texture grabs hold quickly, pushing flavors of roasted strawberry and plum along with peppery spice.

title: Marco Lucchesi 2016 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Fresh and fruity on the nose at first, with red plum and ripe strawberries, this bottling grows more elegant with time, showing dried flowers and minty herbs. The palate combines black plum with tarragon and dried violets.

title: Miner 2014 Stagecoach Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Sinewy in leather and dusty tannin, this is a well-integrated, full-bodied and earthy wine with forceful flavors of baked plum and dark cherry. It broods with secondary elements of sage, clove and tobacco.

title: Solminer 2017 Coquelicot Vineyard Riesling (Los Olivos District)
description: Very fresh and tight on the nose, this bottling from a vineyard near the town of Los Olivos offers lime skin, lily and freshly plucked parsley aromas. The palate is tightly wound, offering flavors of tangerine pith and lime peel, all wrapped in a chalky grip.

title: Timbre 2016 Lead Vocals Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: From Bien Nacido Vineyard, this bottling begins with aromas of kumquat and sliced lime as well as hints of toast, cashew and tightly grained oak. The palate is taut at first, then opens toward light Meyer lemon and soft butter flavors, with a touch of nuts toward the finish.

title: Timbre 2016 Opening Act Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Salty peach and freshly zested lemon meet with a handful of roasted nuts on the nose of this bottling from Bien Nacido Vineyard. The palate is tightly wound and briskly clean yet also expressive with white-flower flavors of honeysuckle and gardenia.

title: Timbre 2016 The Headliner Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Light raspberry, wet rocks and turned earth aromas show on this bottling from Presqu'ile Vineyard, which is planted on sandy soils. The palate is loaded with earth flavors, from gravel to damp soil, with red-plum-skin and orange-rind flavors rounding out the experience.

title: William Harrison 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: A fruity nose is complemented in clove spice and tobacco in this full-bodied wine, which has a soft rounded richness that's complex and in balance.

title: Bernardus 2017 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Plumeria and jasmine aromas make for a very floral entry to this bottling, yet there are also bright touches of Key lime pith and richer butterscotch. It's broad and creamy on the palate with poached pear and soft apple flavors.

title: Bold 2018 Mission Ranch Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
description: Crisp grapefruit, lime balm and passion fruit aromas meet with a touch of wet wool on the nose of this bottling. There is tightness to the palate, with grassy, lime leaf and more passion fruit flavors.

title: Conduit 2017 Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is aged entirely in neutral French oak, with a majority of the grapes fermented whole-cluster. It shows a quirky liveliness and an earthy undertone alongside flavors of strawberry pie, pepper, lavender and orange peel.

title: Cuvaison 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: This wine is earthy in rock and forest elements, with lifted tones of velvety red fruit and rose petal. The tannin and oak are expansive and sturdy on the palate, providing structure around richer aspects of cola and tea.

title: Fallbrook 2016 33 Degrees North Gracie Hill Vineyard Sangiovese (South Coast)
description: Polished aromas of red cherry, oak, wet gravel and rocky earth show on the compelling nose of this bottling from a vineyard planted in 1995 near San Diego. Clean flavors of red cherry, roasted strawberry, thyme and dust combine on the medium-bodied palate.

title: Foley 2016 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Strong aromas of jasmine and honeysuckle meet with creamy white-peach and sweet sandalwood aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is classic California Chardonnay: oak, lemon and pineapple flavors riding solid acidity.

title: Galante 2018 Wagon Wheel Sauvignon Blanc (Carmel Valley)
description: Very light aromas of lemon peel, pear flesh and apple syrup seem a touch sweet at first but remain refreshing. There is buoyant acidity on the palate, where green-apple and lime peel flavors ride a grainy chalky texture.

title: Grounded Wine Co. 2018 Space Age Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Very pleasant aromas of strawberry and watermelon reflect the beautiful shade of pink that this Grenache-based rosé shows in the glass. The acid-driven palate is refreshing, with flavors of lemon peel, light peach and, on the finish, a bit of bubblegum.

title: Jason-Stephens 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling is quite inviting, with creamy aromas of butterscotch, caramel, nectarine and golden apple. The palate is lush and broad in flavors of buttered apple, cotton candy and sea-salt caramel, finishing on a touch of buttercream.

title: Klinker Brick 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This wine puts bold, spicy, flashy oak at center stage, and introduces a good supporting cast of gorgeous blackberry and black-plum flavors. Firm tannins lend support and balance out the performance nicely.

title: Midnight 2018 Andromeda Grenache Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling starts with aromas of crisp Asian pear, jicama and light Key lime spray on the pleasantly mellow nose. It's tightly woven on the palate, with fresh citrus and freshly cut honeydew flavors that ride into a grippy finish.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2016 John John Zinfandel (Suisun Valley)
description: This is an overtly oaky, obvious style of Zin that shows sweet spices and a soft entry followed by some alcoholic heat that builds on the palate and finish.

title: Wine Cube NV Bubbles Rosé (California)
description: This wine is fruity, clean and sweet, offering strawberry and raspberry along with buttercream flavors that verge on cloying. It's soft and sugary in mouthfeel. It is sold in a four pack of 250 ml cans.

title: Wine Cube NV Bubbles Sparkling (California)
description: This wine is light and semisweet, showing appealing vanilla and cream aromas, sugary pear flavors and a soft texture. It is sold in a four pack of 250 ml cans.

title: Bianchi 2017 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Strong aromas of loamy soil and slate meet with smoke and lingering cassis on the nose of this bottling. Zippy acidity starts off the sip and runs powerfully into the finish, where blackberry-juice flavors reign.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Davis Vineyards Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine tastes mature, mellow and saturated with dried berry and dried cherry flavors. While turning the corner on age and sweetness, it has a soft, lightly tannic texture and broad mouthfeel.

title: Miner 2018 Rosato (Mendocino)
description: Like a nouveau Beaujolais, this full-bodied Sangiovese rosé brims with candied aromas and butterscotch flavors that are rich, almost sweet on the palate.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 ZSM Red (California)
description: Boysenberry extract, fennel, mint and dried purple flowers show on the nose of this blend of 40% Zinfandel, 30% Sangiovese and 30% Malbec. There are lavender-like flavors on the lightly bodied palate alongside berry juice and fennel pollen.

title: Delta 2018 Cabernet Franc (California)
description: From cool-climate sites, this has an herbal personality true to the variety, with light, bright layers of plum, raspberry and sage. The tannins are well tamed and integrated, the oak neutral.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Strong aromas of potpourri, wood spice, clove and cedar make for a very strong aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate reflects the wood spice but adds tangy red- and black-plum flavors.

title: Mud Pie 2018 Grenache Grenache (Mendocino County)
description: This is a mild, unassuming wine, light in color, light in body and light and fresh in fruit flavors.

title: Broadside 2017 Margarita Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling packs together bright red-cranberry fruit with strong and dark herbs of oregano and marjoram. It's a bit sweet with red currant and raspberry on the palate, all set against that herbaceous backdrop.

title: Akash 2018 Parlez-Vous Rosé (Temecula Valley)
description: Raspberry, dried cherry and dank herbs show on the nose of this pink wine. There is compelling texture to the palate, where sour cherry and slightly earthy herb flavors arise.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Claret (Paicines)
description: Pencil shavings and gamy aromas meet with very light red-fruit tones on the nose of this blend of all five primary Bordeaux varieties. Leathery flavors show on the palate as do dark berries.

title: Muscardini 2018 Santa Giordano Vineyards Rosato di Sangiovese (Sonoma Valley)
description: Grapefruit pith, lemon and high-toned acidity mark this Italian-style wine, dry on the midpalate in leathery texture and a lasting note of dried cherry.

title: Apothic 2018 Rosé (California)
description: Enticing and complex mint, thyme and raspberry aromas paint an intricate picture at first, before candied and jammy flavors kick in along with a soft sugary texture.

title: Acacia 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Soft and simple in dark red fruit, this wine is easygoing in its approach and style: full bodied, floral and mild in oak.

title: Cline 2018 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Offering great value, this white contains 2% Pinot Gris. Intense in oak-influenced flavors of caramel and vanilla, it has a simple structure and plenty of richness in the form of baked pineapple and pear.

title: Dubost NV Homestead White (Central Coast)
description: Quite yellow in the glass, this atypical blend of 40% Viognier, 30% Chardonnay, 20% Roussanne and 10% Grenache Blanc begins with aromas of boiled lemons, dried mango and butterscotch. The flavors blend riper mango with sour orange, proving both rich and tart.

title: Porch Pounder NV Brut Rose Sparkling (Paso Robles)
description: A dark shade of salmon-pink, this canned wine shows large bubbles in the glass and begins with aromas of cherry, cranberry and candied watermelon on the nose. The palate is both sour and sweet, reminiscent of sour cherry syrup on soda water.

title: Midnight 2016 Merlot (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Very floral aromas of rose and strawberry framboise show on the excited nose of this bottling. The palate offers simple and somewhat sweet flavors of fruit punch.

title: Windchaser 2017 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a rich rip- mouthcoating wine that feels sweet, and offers abundant baking spice, peach and pear-nectar aromas and flavors. Full body and a smooth texture give it a big mouthfeel and the delicious leesy-spicy character is unusual for the varietal.

title: Las Positas 2015 Estate Barbera (Livermore Valley)
description: Intense berry aromas and loads of fresh ripe berry flavors flood this full-bodied wine. It offers a smooth rich texture, great concentration and a touch of tannin that adds nicely to the mouthfeel.

title: Las Positas 2018 Estate Albariño (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine smells fresh and appley, and tastes fruity, crisp and mouthwatering. It's light to medium in body and offers great balance and vitality.

title: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Floral, herbaceous aromas join ripe plum and dried cherry flavors in this full-bodied, broad and generous wine. Subtle spicy notes come from 30% new Hungarian barrels.

title: Rodrigue Molyneaux 2018 Pinot Blanc (Livermore Valley)
description: A smooth, rich mouthfeel carries vivid and bright green-apple and lemon flavors in this medium-bodied wine. Good depth and concentration are complemented by bracing acidity for good balance.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Winemaker's Select G-S-M (Temecula Valley)
description: This blend of 45% Grenache, 30% Mourvèdre and 25% Syrah shows promising direction for this winery, starting with well-integrated aromas of barrel smoke, cola, black cherry and fennel pollen. It's lighter bodied on the palate, offering wild herbs, fresh berry and more oak-derived flavors.

title: Terre Rouge 2018 Vin Gris d'Amador Rosé (Sierra Foothills)
description: A deep-raspberry color and concentrated fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine more character than most rosés. It's made from red and white Rhône varieties. Cherry and berry aromas meet ripe berry and plum flavors on a smooth, fairly rich texture.

title: Cline 2017 Ancient Vines Mourvèdre (Contra Costa County)
description: Very fruity, generous and mouthfilling, this full-bodied wine drenches the taste buds with berry flavors so ripe the berries would be falling off the vine. It offers great concentration, wonderful focus and good length on the finish.

title: Oakstone 2017 Estate de Cascabel Vineyard Mourvèdre (Fair Play)
description: This fruity, generous, smooth-textured wine offers loads of black cherry and boysenberry in the aroma, rich and almost jammy blackberry and cherry flavors on the palate. It's full bodied, low in tannins and very approachable.

title: Jalama 2016 El Capitan Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is an intense blend that sports strong aromas of violet, lilac, acai, black currant and charred wood on the nose. The palate is also intense, with cassis and kirsch flavors proving rich and dense but just balanced enough.

title: Pellegrini 2016 Toboni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy in forest and tea, this wine also shows plenty of full-bodied, concentrated fruit flavor, ranging from dark cherry to orange and rhubarb. Savory spice gives the fruit a complement of balance against a rich texture of rounded tannin.

title: Rideau 2016 Siempre Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: From Happy Canyon Vineyards, this bottling starts with soft aroma of ripe dark cherry as well as lavender and black-pepper dust. The palate shows roasted cherry, red flower petals and stewed plum flavors.

title: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: From a high-elevation site in the Mayacamas Mountains, this is an affordable, small-production, 100% varietal wine, with bright notes of raspberry and cherry. The tannins are soft and well integrated, with a light layering of earth, clove and baking spice playing around the midpalate.

title: Siduri 2017 Barbieri Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Crunchy in texture and high-toned acidity, this wine evolves to show richness and girth on the palate, undertones of grip and tension never far behind. Plum, baked cherry and earthy black tea highlight the varietal classicism and structure.

title: Prager 2015 Royal Escort Paladini Vineyard Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely from Petite Sirah grapes, then fortified into a Port-like wine and aged for 2.5 years, this is salty in blackberry and dark chocolate, with a thickness of resolved tannin and oak. It delights the senses with just enough acidity to refresh the palate.

title: Adelaida 2018 Anna's Vineyard Picpoul Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Broad nectarine and ripe melon aromas are cut by crisp Meyer lemon and a hint of white rocks on the nose of this bottling of a grape that's increasing in popularity. It's quite tart on the sip with citrusy freshness, but there are also warmer stone-fruit flavors to round it out.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2016 Hope Red (California)
description: This is a truly hefty, bold and tannic wine. It shows a deep dark color, aromas of wood smoke and cloves, and flavors of black cherry and licorice accented by vanilla and cinnamon.

title: Chandon NV Reserve Late Disgorged Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)
description: This wine is dry, fresh and clean, offering crisp apple and Bosc pear flavors accented by toasted almonds, tangy acidity and vivid bubbles.
designation: Reserve Late Disgorged Blanc de Noirs

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Thompson Vineyards Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)
description: Great balance and an appropriately firm texture complement the ripe but dry character of this fruity and savory wine. It is moderately tannic and will be best paired with something meaty. Best through 2024.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Valliant Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Named after the family who owned the property in the 1930s and 1940s, this slightly cloudy bottling starts with carbonic-like aromas of red fruit and cinnamon. The palate picks up pomegranate and earthy herbs, proving somewhat simple yet easy to quaff.

title: Apothic 2016 Dark Red (California)
description: Dark, rich, smoky and meaty, this full-bodied wine is layered with black fruits and toasted oak flavors, along with soft mouthfilling tannins.

title: AVA Grace NV Rosé (California)
description: This light-bodied wine shows nice fresh watermelon and raspberry aromas, mild flavors and a fairly soft texture.

title: Kunde 2016 Estate Grown Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: Sanguine in red currant, this is a high-toned herbal wine, with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Petite Sirah. Green olive and herb highlight the lush midpalate of dark cherry and soft tannin.

title: Markus Wine Co 2018 Crealto White (Mendocino)
description: This is a sweet, floral and effusively fruity wine whose tutti–frutti aromas and sugary, appley flavors need the right audience or occasion.

title: Martin Ranch 2016 J.D. Hurley Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Smashed graphite aromas meet with light, dried red-cherry aromas on the nose of this bottling. Charred cedar and wet campfire flavors encounter richer blackberry and oregano on the palate.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Mohr-Fry Reserve Sangiovese (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine captures the savory salty side of Sangiovese, shading red cherry and red plum with earthy, cedary, leathery accents. It feels smooth on the palate and soft on the finish.

title: Terra Robles 2017 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted almond and dried lemon aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It hits the palate with very ripe pear and apple flavors, finishing very quickly.

title: William Hill Estate 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Powerful oak flavors and saturated tannins make this full-bodied wine taste firm and a bit tight. The aromas overflow with cedar, charcoal, wood smoke and toasted coconut while the flavor is a lot like blackberry jam.

title: Dark Horse 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is plush and soft, giving way to flavors of melted butter and vanilla. The ripe palate is low in acidity and rich in feel.

title: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Nice and rich in blackberry and black-cherry flavors, this full-bodied and jammy wine is velvety and mouthcoating in texture.

title: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Fresh lemon-lime aromas and tangy, green-apple flavors give this light-bodied wine an appealing fruity character. The smooth texture has a touch of crisp acidity for balance.

title: Danza del Sol 2015 Madrona Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Slightly sour aromas of dried game and old leather meet with a dried blueberry character on the nose of this blend of 80% Tempranillo and 20% Grenache. The palate is very leathery and earthy, with dried beef, berry and strong mint flavors that rise into the finish.

title: Dark Horse NV Canned Pinot Noir (California)
