description: This canned wine is big on flavor, pairing very ripe blackberry and black-cherry notes with robust oak spices. It is medium to full bodied, and has a touch of tannin for grip in the texture.

title: Mirassou 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A deep dark color and ample fruit flavors make this medium-bodied and lightly sweet wine appealing. Chocolate and blueberry aromas last on the finish while the smooth texture is light on tannins.

title: People's Wine Revolution 2017 Mangels Vineyard Grenache (Suisun Valley)
description: This is a well-behaved, medium-bodied wine whose aromas and flavors are a bit subdued. It is moderately fruity, smooth in texture and easy to sip.

title: Rancho Costero 2017 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Stewed red cherries, black-plum skin, sweet tarragon and crushed grape-seed aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It lands quite sweet on the palate, with candied strawberry and berry-jam flavors.

title: Rock & Vine 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is a butter and spice bomb, showing lots of oak influence, full body and a soft texture. Nutmeg, vanilla and coconut aromas precede butter, vanilla and pear flavors.

title: Rubus 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a flashy, candied, buttery aroma, good fresh red- and black-cherry flavors and light tannins that don't get in the way of a smooth texture.

title: Sevtap 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Cut grass, wet sandstone and earthy river-water aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is not much texture or zip to the sip, where apple and peach flavors arise.

title: Stephen Vincent 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows good red- and black-cherry flavors under a veneer of maple and vanilla-scented oak. It's well made in a popular style that many people like.

title: Binz 2015 BinZin Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This full-bodied wine has an oaky, sweet-pickle aroma, woody flavors that come off as sweet and spicy, and very full body. Underneath all that oak are good black-cherry and blackberry flavors that some will enjoy.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2017 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Fair Play)
description: This light and crisp wine has a snap-pea aroma, tangy herb and citrus flavors and a touch of veggies on the finish.

title: Fricks Cellar Select 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County)
description: This raisiny on the nose, with a palate that is thick and somewhat bland.

title: Grayson 2017 Lot 11 Chardonnay (California)
description: This thick-textured wine has apple, petrol and citrus aromas, seemingly sweet pear flavors and a very full mouthfeel.

title: Tailor Made 2016 Creamy Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine has very obvious vanilla and butter aromas and similar flavors that seem sweet, especially since they're wrapped in a soft, almost thick mouthfeel.

title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Smoky oak permeates this wine in abundance, the aroma reduced and palate tightly wound in tannin. Black cherry peeks through.

title: Manifesto! 2015 100% Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Strong oaky aromas and flavors practically smother the fruit component in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It smells like cedar and fresh-sawn oak, tastes smoky and peppery and has a firm, drying texture.

title: mietz 2012 Merlot (Russian River Valley)
description: Here, harsh acidity underscores a disjointed experience of high-toned red currant with coconut and leathery tannin.

title: Sweet Heart 2012 Voluptuous Red (California)
description: This full-bodied wine smells and tastes very mellow and well aged, if not over aged. It has a balsamic aroma and almost-sweet plum and sandalwood flavors.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Moscato (California)
description: Sweet and very fruity, this light-bodied low-alcohol wine tastes sugary and simple. It's basic refreshment for people who don't like dry wines.

title: AuburnJames 2015 1001 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is harsh and green in nature, with obtrusive tannins that present a reobust, chewy palate.

title: Joseph Phelps 2018 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: This is outstanding white wine, entirely varietal and estate, aged in both new and old puncheons. Matchstick, flint and rounded acidity boost a midpalate of structure and complexity highlighted in white flower, lemon zest and Asian pear.

title: Justin 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: There's a compelling density of aromas in the way of blackberry, dark cocoa and savory charred meat on the nose of this bottling. The palate is deep and ripe yet balanced by a dry structure, offering flavors of black cherry, black currant, cocoa and espresso bean.

title: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: The three graces in question here are 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 45% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. The wine offers aromas of bay leaf, peppercorn and pencil shavings that carry through to the structured, savory palate. Length and complexity rule above all, adding to the rich core of spicy blackberry and currant. This will mature well; best 2025–2030.

title: Testarossa 2016 Fogstone Vineyard Single Vineyard Series Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is one of the winery's monopole properties, and Winemaker Bill Brosseau handles the fruit with extra care. Aromas of black cherry, boysenberry, vanilla and roasted game are ripe yet precise, while the palate's dark-cherry tone is lifted by minty herbs and more savory qualities.

title: Obsidian Ridge 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: A deep, dark color and generous black-fruit aromas lead to well-extracted flavors of blackberry, blueberry and black currant on the palate, while a thick blanket of fine-grained tannins wraps it all in. It is huge in structure but matched by luxurious, layered fruit and spice flavors. Best 2023–2033.

title: Lynmar Estate 2017 Susanna's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From one of the producer's coastal properties, this is firm in structure and robust in earthiness. A juicy strawberry flavor is complemented by accents of cardamom, black tea, forest and sea spray, with focused acidity lending firm support.

title: Law 2016 Audacious Red (Adelaida District)
description: Dark and tangy aromas of black plum and boysenberry meet with hints of licorice, fennel pollen and wet loam on the nose of this blend of 32% Grenache, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Carignan and 18% Syrah. The palate is dense with flavors of cassis, cocoa bean and coffee and made more complex by sagebrush and pencil shavings. Young tannins coat the finish.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Graphite, flint and toasted oak accent a core of brawny, concentrated black fruit in this estate red. Clove, black currant, cigar box and firm, structured tannins contribute to the classic nature of this well-made wine. Enjoy 2026–2031.

title: Merry Edwards 2017 Coopersmith Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed aromas of rose and lavender lead the nose of this wine. It shows ample power, density and structure, with flavors of chocolate-covered strawberry and cherry that are cradled with toasted oak.

title: E16 2015 Upper Bench Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This bottling is very rich on the nose, with wild strawberry, blackberry and black-cherry aromas that are cut by loamy soil and rocky minerality. The full-flavored palate packs roasted cherry with tarragon and wild mint flavors, making for a very heady and attention-grabbing expression.

title: Testarossa 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Brioche, pineapple and ripe melon aromas make for a creamy nose on this bottling from the vineyard's historic old vines that were planted in 1971. The palate zips with acidity, carrying flavors of lemon sorbet and sea salt. It's very taut and tense throughout.

title: Sanguis 2016 The Modern Red (Central Coast)
description: Boysenberry paste and lavender aromas converge on the nose in this blend of Syrah, Viognier, Petit Verdot and Marsanne. The palate is quite savory, showing flavors of roasted lamb with rosemary oil in a black-plum sauce as well as nori wrap, soy and green peppercorns.

title: Chenoweth 2016 Home Ranch Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Earthy forest floor, black tea and clove meet an acid-driven core in this impressively memorable wine. It builds flavor and texture as it opens and rides to a fresh, lifted finish.

title: Limerick Lane 2018 Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: This rosé is a blend of Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache that is fermented in stainless steel. It's a lovely expression of fresh fruit and acidity. Tangy, light and complex, it unfurls flavors of cherry, lime and grapefruit alongside a stony texture.

title: Etude 2016 North Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Potent aromas of boysenberry, black raspberry, wet slate, smoke and truffle show on the layered and dynamic nose of this bottling. It's thicker and textural on the palate, where blackberry flavors play with mint, loam, dark chocolate and sarsaparilla.

title: Justin 2015 Focus Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Hearty, rich and deep on the nose, this Syrah begins with aromas of blackberry jam, cocoa dust, damp oak and a touch of vanilla. The palate is cohesive and rich with roasted black currant, vanilla cream, cappuccino and, on the finish, pepper dust. The structure is luxuriously soft and balanced.

title: Rusack 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Aromas of peach compote on toast, honeysuckle and lemongrass make for a very fresh and floral nose on this bottling from the historic vineyard. A chalky mouthfeel frames flavors of seared lemon and roasted peach.

title: Merry Edwards 2017 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is tangy and fresh, with lively acidity carrying flavors of red cherry, cranberry and blueberry. Lifted tones of rose and white pepper counteract a full-bodied richness and complements the lushness of the fruit.

title: Chenoweth 2016 Bootlegger's Hill Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is a softly textured, balanced and weighty wine. It offers flavors of baked rhubarb, strawberry and plum, with strong secondary characteristics of forest and dried herb.

title: Patz & Hall 2017 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy in exotic waves of tangerine, grapefruit and Gravenstein apple, this is a textured and complex white, with justified weight and breadth across the palate. Tart acidity lifts the richness and rounded edges from becoming overly lush, bringing it all back to a lasting hit of freshness on the spicy, vanilla-oaked finish.

title: Dubost 2017 Illumination Red (Adelaida District)
description: Roasted black plum, cedar planks, nutmeg and more Christmas spices show on the nose of this blend of 40% Syrah, 28% Grenache, 28% Mourvèdre and 4% Viognier. It's dense and extracted on the palate, with plum, fig and raisin flavors that get lifted by baking spice.

title: Foppiano 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Structured and peppery, with earthy leather and savory spice, this robust, full-bodied wine offers an abundance of blackberry and boysenberry fruitiness and rich, jammy texture.

title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Blending together 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay, this sparkling wine is made in a rich, lush style, with a sweetness of peach and strawberry offering weight and breadth against the palate. Balanced acidity provides lasting freshness.

title: J. Lohr 2018 Flume Crossing Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Rounded aromas of wet hay, grass clippings, struck stone, apple and pear make for a wide entry to this bottling. There is a good zip to the sip, where flavors of damp pine and crisp green apple arise.

title: Ladera 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From a vineyard on Oak Knoll and made from 65% Sauvignon Blanc and 35% Sauvignon Musque, this is an earthy, robust and exotic white with a taste of pea shoots, citrus and tangerine. Medium bodied, it has grip on the palate.

title: Peachy Canyon 2018 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Light peach, ripe melon and earthy berry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is decent tension on the palate, where plummy flavors meet with watermelon rind and lemon peel.

title: Seawolf 2016 Love Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Red fruited and light in baking spice, this is a well-made wine that's full bodied and richly layered. Black licorice, vanilla and a taste of white chocolate contribute additional nuance and flavor.

title: Tribute 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Golden pear, ripe peach and light cement aromas show on the nose. There is a kiss of sweet oak on the palate, where roasted apple and yellow-peach flavors also arise.

title: Trujillo 2016 Madelyn Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is blended with 9% Petite Sirah and smaller amounts of Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot, packing a punch of concentrated red fruit that's plenty rich and ripe. Woody tannins surround sweet oak that finishes in a taste of vanilla.

title: Walt 2016 Bob's Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This estate wine is thick and weighty in oak and tannin, with a powerful ripeness of black fruit. Earthy in tea and forest floor, the fruit and earth lead to a heat-filled finish.

title: Walt 2017 La Brisa Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rich and thickly concentrated, this is a big wine in style and ripeness, concentrated in spicy pomegranate and caramel. Tight-grained oak and tannin broaden and lengthen the palate.

title: Zotovich 2017 Zoto Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dense aromas of boysenberry syrup, light mint and cola show on the nose of this bottling, which is a great deal for the price and perfect for midweek enjoyment. Black-plum and tea-spice flavors converge on the palate.

title: Beringer 2017 Founder's Estate Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a good, reliable, middle-of-the road wine that puts fruit flavors first. It has nice, ripe apple and pear notes, a rather rich texture and softish balance.

title: Krupp Brothers 2018 The Damsel Stagecoach Vineyard Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: This is hearty red wine in a lightly colored package, a mix of 42% Syrah, 35% Tempranillo and 23% Cabernet Sauvignon from the famous site. Meaty and full bodied, it has rich strawberry and leather notes compounded by a bite of lasting heat.

title: Mountain Tides 2018 Partial Carbonic Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)
description: This light-bodied wine offers a dramatic mix of black pepper, singed herb and sour cherry flavors that are unusual but tasty. Firm tannins and firm acidity give it a grippy texture.

title: Sentivo 2014 Estate Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine shows oodles of oak and black-fruit flavors and a balsamic edge that's a little rough. It's big and robust from the deep dark color to a mouthcoating, tannic texture.

title: Hoopla 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Medium bodied and easy to enjoy, this wine offers light maple and baking-spice aromas, fresh red-cherry and blackberry flavors and light tannins for a bit of grip.

title: Mason Cellars 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy and lushly rich, this has strong flavors of peach and vanilla. Made in an appealing style, it finishes in a sneaky twist of jalapeño that gives it a touch of earthiness and heat.

title: Miro 2017 Hemar Ranch Old Vines Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine opens in substantial tannin and powerfully weighty ripeness, appealing in its style with welcome acidity and a freshness of red berry.

title: Captûre 2018 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County-Lake County)
description: This is stainless-steel fermented, opening with a fresh lively nose of legume and pea shoot. Robust in mouthfeel, it has additional flavors of anise, apple and pear, finishing bright and earthy.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 Especial Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Flavorful and harmonious, this full-bodied wine deftly balances rich black-fruit flavors with subtle oak spices on a firm, appetizing frame of light tannins. It brings generosity of flavor along with interesting complexity.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2017 Benevolent Catie's Corner Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine was aged in both neutral oak and stainless steel, the grapes from a famous corner of Saralee Kunde's sought-after vineyard. Peach and anise show on the nose and palate. It is velvety in texture, with notes of jasmine and crushed rock that offer brightness.

title: Chronic Cellars 2017 Dead Nuts Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 74% Zinfandel, 16% Petite Sirah, 8% Tempranillo and 2% Alicante Bouschet is driven by a cigar-box aroma on the nose, with thyme, peppercorn, dark plum and strawberry in the background. It's tightly wound on the palate, with bright acidity that rises into the finish of black currant and clove.

title: Falkner 2015 Amante Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Concentrated aromas of licorice, black cherry and cocoa show on the nose of this blend of 52% Sangiovese, 27% Merlot, 16% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc. There is good energy on the palate, where flavors of black cherry, roasted strawberry, licorice and fennel bulb converge.

title: Iron Horse 2016 Deer Gate Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is a meaty and savory wine from the Green Valley producer, textured in a delicate midpalate that picks up force as it goes. A substantial concentration of Asian spice seasons baked plum and dark cherry, with a smoky twinge to the oak.

title: Morgan 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: A classic Sauvignon Blanc at a fair price, this bottling starts with fresh and inviting aromas of apple blossom and red apple on the nose. Crisp and clean on the palate, it's tightly woven structure reveals lemon wedge and sliced Granny Smith apple flavors.

title: Primal Oaks 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Estrella District)
description: Deep and dark aromas of black cherry and graphite are inviting on the nose. It is soft and elegant in texture, with a powerful blackberry flavor that's edged by decent acidity and a touch of violet.

title: Scratch 2014 Ventana Vineyards Grenache (Arroyo Seco)
description: Exotic aromas of cranberry, Luxardo cherry, star anise and white sage are fairly rich on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with smoke and tannins, offering flavors of tangy red plum and tart raspberry that ride a sizzling acidity.

title: Thacher 2017 Shell Creek Vineyards Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles Highlands District)
description: Clean and mellow aromas of green-pear rind, Pink Lady apple flesh and a hint of grapefruit peel show on the nose of this bottling from an own-rooted vineyard planted in 1972. It's tightly woven on the palate, where lime-spray, baked-apple and crushed chalk flavors show.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2015 Blessings Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Peppercorn and black fruits gain some violet aromatics on the floral but intense nose of this bottling. It's thick and a bit stiff on the palate, where concentrated black-plum flavors and cracked pepper converge.

title: Campovida 2016 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This wine tastes tangy and mouthwatering, as its good fruit acidity and moderate tannins frame red and black-cherry flavors that are not fully ripe. It has great structure and will pair nicely with different foods.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Goldridge Selection Noir Collection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed in blue fruit and rose petal, this is a substantially weighty and full-bodied red, tannic and hugely concentrated. The acidity is intense and helps to balance the considerable power.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2016 La Terra Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Strong aromas of extracted cherry juice, thyme and dried herbs show on the nose of this blend by Don Lorenzi. The palate offers balsamic- laced strawberry flavors that are lifted by white pepper.

title: ONX 2016 Praetorian Red (Templeton Gap District)
description: Roasted coffee, toasted graham cracker and smoky berry aromas show on the nose of this blend of 58% Tempranillo, 29% Mourvèdre and 13% Malbec. Black plum, thyme and marjoram show on the sip, which finishes with a watered-down coffee twist.

title: Ultima Tulie 2015 Syrah-Grenache (Central Coast)
description: Candied aromas of black cherry meet with vanilla on the tangy nose of this blend of 50% Syrah and 50% Grenache. There is a good snap to the front of the palate, which then leads into cooked berry flavors with hints of earth and herb.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2017 Grenache Blanc (Edna Valley)
description: While a bit reductive a first, this wine opens up into a show of nectarine and peach blossom, remaining quite pithy throughout the nose. The palate offers great zing, with flashy flavors of bright green fruit.

title: Graziano 2014 Grenache (Mendocino)
description: This wine is lively, well-balanced and complex in flavor, showing fresh raspberry and cranberry notes backed by light spicy oak nuances and framed by firm tannins.

title: Renwood 2016 Zinfandel (California)
description: This is a fun, fruity wine with all the exuberant qualities of the varietal. Fresh raspberry and red-cherry aromas lead to ripe, almost jammy raspberry and blackberry flavors while full body and a just-slightly grippy texture add to the mouthfeel.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Saluté Red (California)
description: This wine is big and bold, showing powerful fruit and wood-smoke aromas, penetrating and focused blackberry flavors and a very firm structure. Spicy oak nuances like toasted baguette, cinnamon and nutmeg emerge on the midpalate and continue on the finish.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Proprietary Red (California)
description: Spicy perfumed oak aromas and flavors blend well into the rich berry component of this lavish, tempting and full-bodied wine. Concentrated blackberry and black-fig flavors ride a rather thick but soft texture with integrated tannins.

title: Hungry Hawk 2017 Recon Red (San Diego County)
description: Cherry-syrup, cedar and anise aromas show on the nose of this estate blend of 40% Grenache, 26% Syrah, 20% Mourvèdre and 14% Petite Sirah. Snappy red-fruit flavors meet with fennel pollen and sandalwood flavors.

title: Maddalena 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Toasty aromas of peach brioche, lemon juice and melted butter show on the nose of this bottling. Bright flavors of nectarine and white peach are cut by lemon zest before growing richer into honeysuckle and guava.

title: Martin Ranch 2016 Therese Vineyards Victoria Denise Vineyard Private Reserve Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This winery features a house aroma and flavor of cedar and pine that is apparent in most of the red wines, and it works well in this blend of Mourvèdre, Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. Those woody aromas meet with black cherry, cinnamon and cardamom on the nose, leading to a palate of sandalwood and incense, as well as dark berries.
designation: Therese Vineyards Victoria Denise Vineyard Private Reserve

title: Mud Pie 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This dry and bracing wine offers concentrated cherry and berry flavors, a firm structure, polished but tannic texture and lingering finish. It tastes natural, balanced and focused. Best from 2025.

title: Pianetta 2017 Barbera (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very dark in the glass, this is a powerful bottling loaded with cassis, black plum and wood spice on the nose. The palate is fully loaded with more black-plum, blackberry and baking-spice flavors, proving quite intense.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2016 Cielo Viola Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied and firmly tannic wine is densely packed with black-fruit flavors and generously accented by oak spices like cinnamon, vanilla and toast.

title: Talbott 2017 Kali Hart Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Lime balm, seared wood and an intriguing line of dank forest floor all rise on the nose of this bottling. There is great grip to the sip, where tangy lime flavors meet with that slight pine-needle kick, showing solid depth.

title: Tantara 2017 Tondre Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe and tangy black-plum aromas kick of the nose of this bottling. There is a solid cracked rainbow peppercorn kick on the palate, which is otherwise consumed by tangy berry flavors.

title: William Hill Estate 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This ripe-tasting and full-bodied wine fills the mouth with a rich texture and shows buttery, toasty, almond-like nuances over pear nectar flavors. The oak effect is subtle at first but but builds and echoes vanilla and cream on the finish.

title: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Flinty in stone, green apple and pear, this white has a thick backbone of structure and acidity, presenting as fleshy, full-bodied and fulsome on the lengthy palate.

title: Dueling Pistols 2016 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Smashed blackberry, licorice and black plum show very strongly on the ripe nose of this blend of 50% Petite Sirah and 50% Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate hits with the tang of blackberry and crumbled herbs, with hints of a black-rock minerality. The label is stunning, if you like guns.

title: Ladera 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From estate vineyards at high-elevation, this is a robust red, generously ripe and weighty with the density of both the vintage and mountain provenance. High-toned rhubarb, currant and herb meet leathery spice and firm tannin with length to the finish.

title: Luna 2016 Lunatic Red (California)
description: Very concentrated and focused, this full-bodied wine brims over with ripe blackberry, fresh black-cherry and baking-spice flavors. A touch of tannin helps firm up the texture and everything seems well balanced.

title: Markus Wine Co 2018 Nativo White (Lodi)
description: Fresh melon and apple flavors fill up this medium-bodied, fruity wine made mostly from the German varietal Kerner, giving it an easy appeal. The tangy texture is appetizing and nicely counters the ripe fruit character.

title: Murrieta's Well 2018 Dry Rosé (Livermore Valley)
description: This delicious wine made from red Rhône varieties has more depth than most rosés, offering peach and raspberry aromas, tangy but ripe flavors and a good sense of concentration.

title: Siduri 2017 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Mild and quite fruity, this medium-bodied wine smells like fresh strawberries, tastes like raspberries and has a smooth easy texture.

title: Westgate 2017 Mateo Vineyard Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Black currant and elderberry aromas met with loamy soil and graphite on the nose of this bottling. The palate is heavy with dark-blackberry-jam, toasted oak, purple-flower and roasted coffee flavors that end on a quick finish.

title: Aerena 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: Robust in flavor and structure, this full-bodied wine offers ample ripe black-cherry and black-plum notes, moderate to full tannins and a healthy dose of oak that shows up as cedar, wood smoke and tobacco. Grippy on the palate, it needs equally robust food to pair with.

title: Barrel Burner 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Savory aromas of dried herbs and turned earth meet with a bright blackberry tone on the nose of this bottling. Flavors of blackberry paste, roast beef, purple flowers and spice show on the dry palate.

title: Kunde 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: With 2% Sauvignon Blanc, this white is fleshy in apple and cinnamon, the oak pronounced and toasty. Heavy and weighty across the palate, it has richness within a straightforward context of soft, dry approachability.

title: Iron Hub 2015 Barbera (Amador County)
description: This is a rich, warm wine that blends fruit and oak elements seamlessly for a mouthfilling flavorful character. It shows light baking spices and ripe fruit in the aromas, deep cherry and berry flavors and a soothing, velvety texture backed by fine-grained tannins.

title: McKahn 2016 Syrah (Spring Mountain District)
description: Aged 18 months in French barrels, half of them new, this is a nicely made and memorable red, varietal in its grasp of tar, oak and meaty lavender. With a hint of petrol, it opens into velvety thick and concentrated layers of blackberry cobbler and cola.

title: FEL 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Tempting and delicious, this full-bodied wine is quite ripe and yummy, showing plump red and black cherries, black plums and a hint of strawberry jam in the flavor. It has a mouthfilling texture, rounded tannins and lingering fruity finish.

title: Jarvis 2012 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: Silky, earthy and intense, this softly textured red made entirely from one variety is well integrated and given ample time in bottle. Flavors of baked plum and blueberry are complemented by vanilla, coffee and cedar, with toasty oak factoring in on the finish.

title: Markus Wine Co 2016 Domo Red (Lodi)
description: This is an aromatic, floral and intriguing blend of 90% Carignan and 10% Petite Sirah that is medium to full bodied, has plenty of complex fruit, earth and spice flavors, good balance and a sense of elegance. Moderate tannins and good acidity will make it versatile in food pairings.

title: Naggiar 2017 Root 49 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: This concentrated, layered wine shows ample fruit and tasty spices from the first whiff through the lingering finish. Full body and ripe (but not sweet) black-currant, rosemary and black-cherry notes coat the tongue, while firm but polished tannins give a full and satisfying mouthfeel.

title: Herencia 2015 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: Perfumed in Musqué-like jasmine, apple and orange blossom, this wine offers a meatier concentration of ripeness on the midpalate than the perfume initially suggests, leading to a richness of crème brûlée and fig. Together the flavors and ripeness work and find balance via complexity and integration.

title: Morgan 2017 Metallico Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: The unoaked character of this wine does push it toward a Sauvignon Blanc style, but it works well in this vintage. Aromas of wet stone, grass, lemon blossom and honeysuckle lead into a chalky palate of lime balm, lanolin and a hint of sour cream.

title: Ojai 2017 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light on the nose at first, the refreshing bottling offers subtle aromas of springtime flowers and delicate grass, proving quite appealing and even sexy. The subtleties continue on the palate, where rounded Asian pear flesh meets with a honeysuckle sweetness.

title: Starmont 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine starts off with a salty, stony flavor of oyster shell and rock. Integrated and firmly textured on the palate, it has strong Gravenstein apple and pear flavors that are seasoned nicely by hints of nutmeg and lemongrass.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 Block 8 Estate Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Stemmy, earthy and brimming in black tea, this is a quite savory, dense and meaty red wine, made in an elegant style with understated ripeness. Elements of crushed rock give it a mineral edginess that accentuates the acidity and note of saline around wild strawberry and rhubarb.

title: Ampelos 2015 Ampelos Vineyard Rho Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From the producer's estate certified organic and biodynamic vineyard, this red is light in color and texture, with subdued, supportive acidity that packs a punch of tartness. Cranberry and rhubarb flavors highlight the fresh focused character.

title: Broken Earth 2016 Limited Release Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe aromas of caramel-soaked cherry, vanilla candy and toasty oak show on the nose of this bottling. Those vanilla and caramel elements pop on the palate, which then leads into rounded red-fruit flavors on the midpalate, with hints of wild thyme and pepper on the finish.

title: Desparada 2016 Soothsayer Red (California)
description: Vailia Esh isn't afraid to mess with tradition, often to stellar results, and this blend of 59% Cabernet Sauvignon and 41% Barbera is an interesting example. Aromas of blackberry Popsicle, rosemary and dried lavender lead into a palate of violets and ripe blueberry. It's unique, but not quite as successful as her other blends.

title: F2 Wines 2015 Il Falconieri Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)
description: There is a crunchy freshness to the nose of this bottling, which shows concentrated blackberry sauce and wild mint aromas. That dried mint and green herb quality extends to the palate, playing against the richer black-currant and espresso flavors.

title: Glenwood Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a pretty, tropical and stone-fruit-infused wine, well-priced for the quality and depth of experience. Textured, it's bright and admirably made, with a lingering flavor of peach.

title: Holdredge 2016 Upper Elevations Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a memorably earthy and robust red, tasting of crushed rock and tea as well as rhubarb. Soft, it has a touch of reduction on the midpalate that evolves to show tight-grained oak and tannin wrapped around the burly fruit.

title: Jeff Cohn 2016 2 Guys 2 Barrels Stagecoach Vineyard Viognier (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely from one variety in collaboration with winemaker Yves Gangloff, this imparts a subtle floral nose of jasmine and a fresh spritzy midpalate of juicy acidity. Well made and complex, it melds together bold layered flavors of lemon peel, melon and apricot into a cohesive, full-bodied and concentrated whole.

title: Monochrome 2017 Plum Orchard Lane Vineyard Albariño (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe aromas of honeydew, mango and slight banana show on the nose of this bottling, which retains its freshness deep into the sipping experience. There is a strong chalky grip to the sip, where ripe tropical flavors of papaya and coconut flake are cut by clean lines of citrus peel.

title: Outlot 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Floral on the nose, this white is lively in acidity and stony in texture—a nice combination that gives it breadth and depth. Peach, apricot and Key lime flavors define the palate, with a lingering taste of melon. There is 5% Gewürztraminer blended in.

title: Merryvale 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Expansive tones of tangerine and green apple are balanced by bright acidity and stone-like minerality on the palate. The tannins are well integrated and supportive, as is the integrated oak, making this a well-balanced offering.

title: Neyers 2017 Roberts Road Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stemmy and earthy, this wine offers intense cranberry and tea tones. The midpalate has a velvety lining of soft tannins that lengthens the finish.

title: Samsara 2015 Las Hermanas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Black-raspberry aromas are lifted by lavender, peppercorns and eucalyptus on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Bay leaf flavors are strong on the palate, giving herbal energy to the tangy, underripe red-fruit base.

title: Skinner 2017 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Attractive but subtle spices brighten the red cherry and black plum notes in this full-bodied and firmly structured wine. Hints of cinnamon, allspice and nutmeg emerge in the aromas and stay buzzing through the concentrated palate and on to the finish.

title: Solminer 2018 Rubellite Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: File this blend of 72% Syrah, 27% Grenache and 1% Riesling in the fresh, bright and chillable category. Named after the wine's beautiful color, this begins with aromas of boysenberry compote, lilac and charred wood. The palate zings with black-raspberry, wild thyme and dried mint flavors.

title: Solminer 2018 Spear Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Intriguing aromas of Meyer lemon rind, Marcona almond, lily and daffodil make for a fascinating and rich nose on this bottling. Stone and cement-like qualities grip the palate on the sip, delivering tangerine, plumeria and roasted nut flavors. It is both delicious and unique.

title: Storm 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pleasant and plush aromas of red cherry, rosewater and a slight kiss of oak show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression by Ernst Storm. It lands cleanly on the palate with a bit of heft, offering savory sea salt and pepper-dust spices against the red-plum backdrop, with a hint of caramel on the finish.

title: Sunstone 2017 Mourvèdre (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Full aromas of black plum, violet and earthy hints of beet juice show on the nose of this bottling, the first-ever single-variety Mourvèdre for this longtime winery. The palate is cohesive and clean with purple-flower flavors that are earthy and elegant at once.

title: Carol Shelton 2017 Coquille Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of Grenache Blanc, Marsanne, Roussanne and Viognier is extremely smooth on the nose, with aromas of lemon cream, seared white peach and a light brush of honey. It's clean, pure and suave on the palate as well, with honey, smoked chicken flesh, lemon peel and herb flavors.

title: Cline 2016 Ancient Vines Mourvèdre (Contra Costa County)
description: This full-bodied wine reveals a bit of the feral, earthy, meaty character of Mourvèdre and backs it with palate-pleasing, ripe berry and plum flavors that anyone can enjoy. Moderate tannins are nicely interlaced in the mouthfilling texture.

title: Comartin 2016 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Brooding aromas of dark red cherry, star anise and clove make for a heavier style of Grenache in this bottling. The baking spice powers the palate, where mouthfilling flavors of ripe cherry and plum meet with vanilla on a smooth, creamy texture.

title: Dawn's Dream 2017 Nicole Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Part of a series named for three sisters, this bottling aims to accentuate the soil side of the appellation, offering aromas of sandalwood, hibiscus, pomegranate and star anise. Crisp red fruits and riper cherry tones meet with vanilla on the fresh lively palate.

title: Domaine Eden 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This little sister to the Mount Eden wines needs a bit of time to breathe through its reductive phase upon opening, allowing the flinty oak-kissed aromas of yogurt and dried lemon peel to emerge. There is tremendous tension to the palate, with lime pith and walnut flavors riding a damp oak element into the finish.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2015 Barrack X Ten-Goal Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very focused on the nose, this Bordeaux blend offers crushed slate, cigar box, black currant and dried herbs on the nose. There are Concord grape and blueberry tones to the palate alongside violet and cola flavors, framed by a delicate yet persistent structure.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2016 Piocho Patron Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This new blend of all five Bordeaux grapes starts with a fresh nose of strawberry, hibiscus and anise. The palate offers macerated plums and berries as well as baking spices such as nutmeg and a slight hint of roasted game.

title: Landmark 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine shows roasted herb, packed purple flowers and a hint of caramel on the rich nose. The palate is dense in hearty flavors of baked boysenberry, bay leaf and juniper, yet finishes with oak-driven power.

title: McKinney 2016 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Strong aromas of pomegranate syrup, anise and oak show on the nose of this bottling. There is a compelling texture to the sip, where chalky tannins present mouthfilling flavors of cranberry, raspberry and turned earth.

title: MCV 2017 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Smashed violets, asphalt and roasted blackberry make for a classic nose on this Petite Sirah from varietal expert Matt Villard. Black-currant flavors slide across the palate, making for a refreshing, not-so-heavy style of this grape.

title: Shafer 2017 Red Shoulder Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A perennial powerhouse white, this delivers gorgeously constructed layers of rich pineapple, guava and mango, complemented by vanilla and baking spice from the oak. A steely midpalate shows bright acidity that lifts the concentration.

title: Timbre 2016 Opening Act Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: This bottling from Mission Ranch, which is adjacent to the Santa Lucia Highlands, begins with strong pomegranate aromas alongside light pepper dust on the cohesive nose. Black-plum flavors fill the sip, which is layered with a touch of tart black pepper and singed pine needle.

title: Timbre 2016 Supergroup Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This blend of fruit from Bien Nacido and Presqu'ile vineyards, treated to nearly one-third new oak, starts with fat aromas of black cherries along with loamy earth and dried tarragon. A full flavored palate of red fruit, vanilla and baking spice are wrapped in brilliant acidity and stony texture.

title: Daou 2017 Pessimist Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of primarily Petite Sirah, Syrah and Zinfandel starts with rich, lush aromas of black cherry, vanilla cream and caramel, with a hint of earth. Framed by solid tannins and bright acidity, the palate runs through similar fruit and spice flavors with plenty of power.

title: Balletto 2017 BCD Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral, earthy and red-fruited, this wine is savory in accents of tea, earth and rose. There's a brightness to the midpalate that lengthens the experience, leading to a supple, succulent finish.
designation: BCD Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Bold 2018 Vista Verde Chenin Blanc (Paicines)
description: Crisp and pleasant aromas of nectarine, white flower and guava make for a sort of tropical sorbet on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp, with flavors of Asian pear and rounded nectarine wrapped in a stiff chalky texture and racy acidity.

title: La Lieff 2018 Alamo Creek Ranch Rosé of Grenache (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Very light and floral aromas of rose petal and nectarine meet with clay and damp stone on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in a remote area of southern San Luis Obispo County. The palate is delicate with light peach, tangerine and red-apple flavors, framed by a very chalky texture.

title: Law 2016 Beguiling Grenache (Adelaida District)
description: Deep and rich red-fruit aromas meet with star anise spice and darker black-plum touches on the nose of this bottling, which is boosted with 14% Syrah. Mouthcoating tannins leap onto the palate, where the rich but not overripe red-fruit flavors are lifted by fennel pollen and strong acidity.

title: Seabold Cellars 2017 Four Sisters Terraces Grenache (San Miguel District)
description: The nose on this bottling is quite layered and complex, starting with loamy soil and dusty earth before sultry alpine strawberry, exotic plum and clove aromas shine through. The palate is more about earth and herbs than fresh fruit, and there is a cinnamon spice that shows into the finish.

title: Skinner 2016 Eighteen Sixty-One Red (El Dorado)
description: Intricately woven, complex flavors are braced by firm tannins and bright acidity in this Rhône-style red blend. It is full in body without being fat, blending earthy, meaty flavors with black pepper, blackberry and roasted plum for a subtle but compelling outcome.

title: The Prisoner 2017 Red (Napa Valley)
description: The famous blend combines Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Charbono from throughout the Napa Valley, combining the grapes into a robust, flavorful explosion of soft, richly rounded fruit and body. It's undeniably appealing.

title: The Withers Winery 2016 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: This wine has some of the alluring complexity and earthiness of a Pinot Noir, but with Grenache's bear hug texture. It's full bodied, full flavored and moderately fruity, giving room for enticing woodsy, spicy, mushroomy accents to emerge on the palate. The winemaker used 30% whole clusters and blended in small amounts of Mourvèdre and Syrah.

title: Timbre 2016 Guest Star Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rusty cherry, muddled mulberry and dragon's blood incense scents power the aromas on this bottling from Turner Vineyard. The plummy flavors of the palate meet with roasted strawberry, star anise and mace flavors in a very mouthfilling and flavorful sip.

title: Diora 2017 La Petite Grace Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: A deep, nearly candied aroma of boysenberry meets with baking spice on the nose of this powerful bottling. The palate is loaded with rich flavors of black cherry and vanilla, framed by sandy tannins.

title: Duckhorn 2016 Rector Creek Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Estate-grown and blended with 4% Cabernet Sauvignon from a site near Yountville, this wine offers a mix of velvety, plush texture, toasted oak and bold blueberry and strawberry flavor. Full bodied and richly round, it has powerful tannin and a lasting taste of coffee that gives it a savory finish.

title: Foley 2016 JA Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of white peach, Meyer lemon preserves, oak and toast arise on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tense with texture and acid, showing flavors of marmalade on toast, lemon zest, oak and peach.

title: Giornata 2018 Fiano (Paso Robles)
description: Warm and clean aromas of yellow peach and daffodil make for a creamy entry to this bottling of a grape from southern Italy that's uncommon in the region. The wine lands on the palate with a great sizzle of acidity, then moves into peach, lemon cream and Meyer lemon zest flavors.

title: Guarachi Family 2016 Meadow Rock Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From estate-grown fruit, 100% varietal, this is a bold, concentrated and well-structured wine, big in grippy tannin and robust oak. The dark brooding berry fruit is contrasted in tobacco and tar, with a lasting flinty quality.

title: Kori 2014 KW Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Earthy aromas of bay leaf, forest floor, roasted nutmeg and dried cherry show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are dense, with grilled cherry fruit that is balanced by eucalyptus and sagebrush spices.

title: Liquid Farm 2018 Vogelzang Vineyard Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This Mourvèdre-based pink wine begins with rounded aromas of strawberry, pluot and damp earth on the nose. There is tremendous tension to the sip, where snappy red-plum flavors meet with a compelling element of earthy funk.

title: Lone Madrone 2014 The Dodd Red (Adelaida District)
description: This is a unique chance to taste an old-school style of head-pruned and dry-farmed field blend of 41% Tannat, 26% Petit Verdot, 21% Cabernet Sauvignon and 12% Zinfandel from Klau Mine Vineyards. Gamy and herbal aromas on the nose lead into mouthfilling flavors of black plum, peppercorn and vanilla on the interesting palate.

title: McKahn 2017 Mourvèdre (Livermore Valley)
description: This luxurious, deeply colored wine offers tons of late-picked berry flavors, a full body and a mouthfilling texture, along with subtle spicy nuances that add complexity. Aged for 18 months in French and Hungarian barrels, it's big and warm and easy to appreciate.

title: Bogle NV 50 Years Quick Ranch Reserve Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: This is a beautifully polished but massive wine from a winery known for decades for its excellent Petite Sirah. It is packed with blackberry and blueberry flavors and lavishly spiced with new oak. Dark chocolate and maple nuances emerge on the palate as dense but soft tannins thicken the mouthfeel. Best now through 2029.

title: Halter Ranch 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This bottling, which includes 16% Malbec and 6% Petit Verdot, is a complete and cohesive wine that will satisfy many palates. Aromas of black cherry, dark plum and spice cake lead into a palate that's rich in a blackberry flavor. Polished tannins and fresh acidity frame it all.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2012 Brut Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: Dry and tart, this tastes of oyster shell, wet stone and grapefruit, with hints of lime and lemon. High-toned acidity underlines the delightful structure and elegance of this sparkling wine.

title: Lafond 2016 SRH Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Intriguing aromas of red cherry, mulberry, turned earth and rainy gravel show on the nose of this bottling by one of the region's earliest producers. The palate is dark and earthy with flavors of boysenberry, star anise, rhubarb and cardamom pods, all wrapped in fresh acidity.

title: Ojai 2015 Roll Ranch Vineyard Syrah (Ventura County)
description: Adam Tolmach continues to explore the potential of the Ojai Valley viticulture, and this richer but balanced Syrah is strong evidence of the region's suitability for wine grapes. Aromas of violet, lilac, cola, Dr Pepper and savory smoked meats lead into a very aromatic palate of lavender and black-currant jelly.

title: Peake Ranch 2016 Peake Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Earthy aromas of moss and forest floor meet with tarragon and wild strawberries on the exotic nose of this appellation blend. There is a very elegant display on the palate of tart cranberry, sage, bay leaf and plum-skin tang, making for a complete sipping experience.

title: Heritance 2015 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Flavors of tart cherry, red currant and clove combine to highlight a palate of measured ripeness and grace in this firmly tannic wine from a great site. It shows breadth to the body and is succulent in nature, finishing on lingering spice notes.

title: Iron Hub 2015 Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: This is a big but velvety wine with lots of well-integrated tannins, attractive wood-spice and raspberry flavors and a full body. A delicious light toasty-oak thread runs through the aromas and onto the palate where tangy berry notes and wisps of dried herbs complete the fabric.

title: Kukkula 2015 Pas de Deux Red (Adelaida District)
description: Candied roses, bright cherries, white pepper and dried thyme show on the nose of this blend of 66% Grenache and 34% Syrah. Sour-cherry tones kick off the lively palate, which grows more dynamic, with hibiscus, oregano and marjoram flavors that intensify with time.

title: MCV 2016 Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Black currant, black pepper, elderberry and roasted meats make for very familiar and welcome aromas on the nose of this bottling. There's a savory entry to the palate, with roasted beef in blackberry sauce and black-pepper flavors, finishing with dark clove and lingering acid.

title: Bear Flag 2016 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Flavors of crayon wax, vanilla bean and dark cherry appear on the palate along a continuum of tight, firm tannins. This is a thick, powerful wine that is given extra lift by a fresh citrus tug on the midpalate, providing a breath of refreshment.

title: Daou 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Creamy aromas of lemon meringue, butterscotch and toasted marshmallow are cut by zesty lemon peels and flesh on the nose of this bottling. It's a very full expression of Chardonnay on the palate, where toast and almond tones are leveled by lemon-lime acidity and white-flower flavors, all finishing on a caramel candy tone.

title: Desparada 2016 Dione.8.Nh4 Nebbiolo (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling from Luna Matta Vineyard was fermented in amphora and remains very young, with structure and acidity needing much more patience. Aromas of wet river stone, lilacs and bright red fruit lead into an herbal-laced palate of bright raspberry. Drink 2021–2036.

title: Hahn 2016 SLH G-S-M (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rich aromas of baked strawberry and black cherry meet with star anise on the inviting nose of this blend of 57% Grenache, 39% Syrah and 4% Mourvèdre. It's ripe and juicy on the palate as well, showing cherry, black plum, cinnamon and vanilla touches.

title: Martinelli 2016 Vigneto di Evo Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This robust, generous and ripe red offers a mix of candied plum, blackberry and black olive, with a lavender tone to brighten the concentrated fruit. A sweet oak note complements the richness of the palate.

title: McNab Ridge 2016 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This full-bodied wine leads with a savory spicy aroma that sets it apart from the simply fruity versions, and follows with blackberry, black-pepper and rosemary flavors on a slightly firm texture. Aged for 19 months in French and American oak barrels, it's distinctive, well balanced and delicious.

title: Ojai 2011 Apricots Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Though almost eight years old, this blend of Grenache and Sangiovese by Adam Tolmach is only starting to emerge. Aromas of black-plum paste and slight tar lead into a concentrated palate of elderberry jam and dark sage, with brighter touches of red fruit emerging with time. This will be fascinating to watch, so drink 2020–2036.

title: Robert Renzoni 2015 Riserva Barbera (Temecula Valley)
description: Smoked berries, plum and vanilla cookies show on the nose of this bottling, which is an estate-grown project packaged in a royal-themed bottling with a metallic crest. The palate blends milk chocolate with tangy red-plum and strawberry fruit, gingerbread and graham cracker touches, and evolves dynamically as it breathes.

title: Solitary Cellars 2016 East Block Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Pepper and clove aromas dress up this dry, full-bodied and berry-rich wine from an almost 60-year-old vineyard. It shows how a slightly less-ripe Zinfandel can stand out. The wine has ample fruit flavors but spicy complexity, too, and a firm enough structure to keep the palate tingling.

title: Liparita 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a lovely full-bodied white, with 1% Sauvignon Blanc in the mix. It is native-yeast barrel-fermented and aged further in French oak, 70% of it new. Lively, fresh and citrus-driven, its bolder style and use of oak doesn't detract from a high-toned personality and firm structure.

title: Heron 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This wine is marked by very ripe pear and honeydew melon aromas, plus flavors as thick and fruity as pear nectar, as well as a medium body and a texture so soft that the wine seems sweet.

title: Ironstone 2016 Merlot (Lodi)
description: Starting with meaty, smoky, herbal aromas, this medium-bodied wine follows with good plum and cherry notes, a relatively lean body and moderate smoky, spicy accents.

title: Little Vineyards 2016 Band Blend Live Red (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has ample fruit flavors and a solid, firm texture. Aromas of raspberry and dried plums lead to ripe but not jammy flavors.

title: Miro 2016 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Thin layers of blueberry are seasoned with a touch of baking spice in this soft, simply structured and 100% varietal wine. With teases of grilled meat, lavender and black pepper, it finishes in an intensity of grippy tannin.

title: Renwood 2016 BBQ Zinfandel (California)
description: This is a good grippy wine that's moderate in fruit flavor, medium to full bodied and has a lightly tannic mouthfeel. With plum, raspberry and sweet-oak aromas and flavors it's nicely rich on the palate.

title: Renwood 2016 The Cleaver Red (Amador County)
description: This blend of Petite Sirah, Zinfandel, Syrah and Barbera is flavorful and firmly structured, from the berry and oak aromas to the moderately tannic palate where cranberry and blackberry flavors give it some richness.

title: Summit Lake 2013 Sophia Lynn Estate Petite Sirah (Howell Mountain)
description: A tiny production from estate fruit, this is big-boned and grippy in blackberry, plum and cocoa powder, the tannins firm and undeniable in their presence. The wine finishes soft in texture and lightly spiced.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Rich aromas of black cherry, clove, star anise and sagebrush show on the nose of this widely available and generally pleasing bottling. It's very ripe on the palate, where boysenberry, ripe melon and cherry flavors are lifted by baking spice.

title: F2 Wines 2016 Ghibellini Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)
description: There's an intriguing and atypical streak of sour grass and earthy herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate displays a compelling grip, carrying flavors of chive, kaffir lime, lemongrass and fresh spring herbs.

title: Hahn 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: The nose on this bottling is a little bit sour, showing tangerine, lime pith and the slightest hint of riper nectarine. The palate combines tangy lime zest with wet chalk and a touch of bubblegum.

title: Négociant 2013 Lenamon-Pepi Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a sturdy, structural and somewhat lean-tasting wine that will make a good foil for beef or birds. While the fruit flavors are underripe, this helps the moderate tannins and good acidity to give the wine a tangy quality that's appetizing.

title: Toybox Wine Cellars 2017 Cadden Family Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Full bodied in thickness and concentration, this is a heavy grippy white. Floral on the nose, it offers well-defined flavors of lemon and melon that linger on the finish.

title: Twisted Paso 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry and roasted aromas of hickory and cherry wood show on the nose of this bottling. It's quite juicy and ripe on the jammy palate, but there is strong spice to level the fruit.

title: Cline 2017 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A strong oak perfume leads to intensely floral, oaky flavors and a core of fruit-concentrate in this full-bodied wine. It is flashy, extroverted and spicy.

title: Pride Mountain 2017 Viognier (Sonoma County)
description: Fermented and aged in neutral French oak, this has an opening earthiness and jasmine profile that leads to structured, moderate acidity and plush viscous layers of baked apricot. It's hearty and full bodied.

title: Grayson 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Oak flavors take a central role in this medium-bodied, spicy and buttery wine. A candied-fruit edge and cherry-strawberry core are layered with vanilla and toast accents.

title: Happy Camper 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This soft and jammy wine has an effusive cherry-berry aroma, with a good sense of extraction and ripeness on the palate. Plenty of ripe fruit notes are mixed with vanilla and nutmeg.

title: Ironstone 2016 Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This ripe and oaky wine starts with plummy, sweet and spicy aromas, then floods the palate with ripe flavors of dried plums and sweet cherries. It is full bodied but soft in texture.

title: Jeremy Wine Co 2016 Noma Vineyard Barbera (Lodi)
description: This is a hearty, ripe and full-bodied wine with plenty of black-cherry and balsamic aromas, rich berry and cherry flavors and a hefty texture of moderate tannins and good acidity

title: Precision Wine 2016 Astrid Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a good, well-made wine with the firm structure, tight fruit flavors and length for which the varietal is known. It has tasty red and black-cherry notes, subtle hints of oak and full body.
